description: Behind the building of gaz station, quiet and with an amazing view. Wifi and it's for free. Children can play in the nature ! Maybe possible to have energy if you ask.

name: Bomberos Lajas
description: In the street, next to the "bomberos" ! They are friendly and looks safe... Almost quiet as it's not a big street.

name: Loja Gas
description: Apparently no longer able to refill US valved bottles. No adaptor on site

name: Macara Next To Old Airport
description: Looks safe without anything special ! Noisy till 10pm and from 5:30am !

name: Finca Orgánica San Antonio
description:
Outstanding and Beautiful location in the middle of the subtropical forest of Intag. The campsite is surrounded by forests, rivers, waterfalls and walks. There is an area for grilling, toilets,  hot showers and a kitchen/dining building. Marisol speaks spanish and english and she will welcome you with a smile and lemonade. She is very helpful if you need to organize adventures around Intag and the Santa Rosa Community since she is part of the Local Guides Association and The Women´s Santa Rosa Collective. 
Camping $8/person. Camper van or RVs $10 per person. 
Meals are also available upon request, $10 dinner, $7 breakfast.  Finca Orgánica San Antonio is an ecotourism entrepreneurship and works with the local women to create sustainable alternatives in the Santa Rosa Community and to protect the cloudforest. 
In the months of dec-jan-feb-march and april access can be challenging if you don´t have 4x4. 
Call or text via whatsapp only +593 9597 63722, ahead of your visit and she will happily receive you and make a reservation for you.

name: parking 10 dollar
description:
-10 dollar for the night for the car (2/2017)
-It's quiet and close to the tourist attractions
-One toilet with shower
-The 2 other parkings we found in ioverlander, it was not allowed to sleep there

Recent checkin said "We left our vehicle 11 days to go to the Galapagos for $ 40"

name: Eni Gas
description:
NOTE, recent reports show a willingness to attempt to fill almost any bottle including US, Chilean and European bottles. 10/2018

Gas filling plant at the end of the side road. They filled our 10kg tank for 10$. No problems with the universal valve. They could fill my Swiss bottle (image) with the adapter!

See recent check-in advising they can fill US-style fixed tanks with the 1 3/4" ACME connector. They may fit your vehicle with a spark arrestor on the exhaust and give you a hard hat so you can enter the restricted area

name: Hostal Arena Guadua
description: An absolute cracker! The best place we stayed on the coast! This place right on the beach rents out cabañas and Teresa 'Tere' is happy to let you set up camp in the sandy parking lot. We paid 5$/p/n and added a little to use the amenities in a cabaña nearby.  Toilets and open surf shower provider for campers.

name: Taxi Station In Vilcabamba
description: You need to ask for the Señor del gas (a taxi driver). The tank will be loaded on the regular gas truck to be filled in the gas filling plant in Catamayo. The truck leaves at 10am and returns around 5pm with the full bottle.

name: Petrolecuador
description: we filled up our tank and parked here over night for free.

name: Roadside Jungle Camp at Rio Yananas
description: Big open bitumen/gravel area with direct road entrance, suitable also for the biggest rigs. At the backside of the lot you park out of sight behind the loading ramp. Quiet. Enjoy the jungle feeling with the river floating down below. End August had nice cool evening and night temperatures. Alt 840 meters.

name: Hostal Alternative
description: Nice, bright and clean hostal about a 10-15 minute walk from the main plaza and across the street from the free Banco Museum.  A private room for $10 USD per person per night. Includes towels, soap, shampoo. The hostel has a gated secure parking area attached, only big enough for one small rig (it was a bit of a tight squeeze for us). Friendly owner. Lots of natural light and looks better than the photos show.

name: cheap parking
description: It's a small parking run by a family who is very helpful. From this place it's only 10 min to the centre of the town. We paid 10 $ for 24 h. Miguel, the owner, is a mechanic so he can help in case of trouble. The place is very good for leaving the car to walk around in town. Even bigger and higher rigs can enter. You can stay overnight in your camper, but be aware that the ground is closed from 6 pm to 7 am. You can get out of the parqueadero only with the help of the owner's father who lives around the corner. (telephone) On Sunday this place is closed all day long. There is a toilet and you can fill your tank with water (potable).

name: Pucapamba
description: We arrived very late in the night and parked on the basketball court, but there is also a plain grassy area next to it. A man came out of his house to check on the noise of the car and said we wouldn't have problems camping there. There is also a public toilet with shower and sinks outside, next to the volleyball court, some meters away from there. In the morning, people didn't seem concerned with our presence. Very nice and friendly place. Free.

name: Army Control
description: Control for passports. Just a little look in the van out of curiosity.

name: Immigration / Customs Ecuador
description:
i assume these comments are regarding ENTERING  ecuador (exit is very simple):

Took 2 hours to go through the procedures with the car in the customs because they couldn't connect with the system. They said it happens frequently, so come early and have patience. Exiting Peru, one copy of the driver's passport, license an car document was required. Entering Ecuador, three copies of the same documents.

Ecuador border opens at around 8am.

name: Free walking tour
description:
Here starts the walking tour (Hostel Community) from monday to saturday always at 10:30. Or 14:30 Around 3 hours.
You walk with a group through the old time and get some informations.
You can give a tip to the guide at the end.

name: La Bicok Ecolodge - Camping
description:
La Bicok is a new place in Mindo, owned by a french overlander family who after traveling around the world, decided to settle in Mindo.
They have a very nice place close to the river, 400 mts from town, surrounded by nature, butterflies and birds.
There's place for 5 trucks, each of them with power (110 and 220), potable water and dump station.
They are finishing at the moment the bar/restaurant, and the cabins (September 2015) but for trucks is perfect!
Highly recommended. USD$9 p/person (first night), $7 if staying longer (Oct 2016)
Pool and lounge area finished.(Oct 2015)
NB No signs up at intersections but GPS coordinates are spot-on. Road is narrow but no overhead clearance problems at all. Rigs longer than 8 metres will not fit in all bays.

name: Hotel Quinta Galindo
description: Hostel overlooking Ona Ecuador. A little tricky to find, up a hill overlooking the village. Clean rooms, hot showers, fast wifi and one of the owners speaks English. Paid $15.00 foe one night.

name: Hosteria Camare
description: Very nice hosteria direct on the beach. Flush toilets and hot shower (both very clean). Big covered area with hammocks and pool table and lots of electric plugs. 2 fishermen camps 50m walk on the beach, rough ocean. Room for a few rigs in flat secured spot in property. Access from main road at km 72 or 71. Access ok for big rigs except for a low hanging cable when you leave main road. 5 usd/pers (2020 NOTE : 7.50USD),very quiet, even when the fisherman camps are active, still very ok. Good wifi.

name: Cielo Del Pacifico
description: A hotel/hosteria right on a very chill and beautiful part of the beach.  They have a great beach front parking lot where we camped and they gave us access to bathrooms and outdoor shower.  Surfing out front too.  This is a much chiller option than canoa, which is a zoo.  We paid $15 for the night.  Restaurant available too, but closes at 5pm.  Better to show up before 5pm or you might not find anyone here

name: River Campsite Outside Tena
description: Great location, turn left at roundabout on to dirt road before bridge ( when heading north), go to end of road, open space in gravel lot beside river, covered area with tables and chairs, toilet; can swim in river, check with locals before camping, the owner charged us $2Usd per vehicle per night, stayed 2 nights, loved it.

name: Mariscal Inn And Suites
description: Really nice and new hotel north side of town a block from mercado. We were able to negotiate a huge family room for $50 with breakfast. Parking is included close by, max height ~2.5m. Great deal and quality for Cuenca. Laundry $5 a load.

name: Mechanic Vilcabamba
description: This mechanic totally and utterly wasted my time. He was aware that u was in an enormous rush and I sat in his shop for an entire day waiting for him to return from collecting parts  while he was uncontactable on his phone. No respect for time, but happy to take pre payment and lock you in while he wastes your day. Avoid.

name: Restaurante Wijao
description: Great place to taste Amazonic dishes, they even have the palm three worms, breakfast was plenty full tasty and they were extremely friendly. We strongly recommended it

name: Rapi Frenos
description:
Great Mechanic in Quito! specially fast, it is probably the fastest workshop we've been to so far in our journey. We needed to calibrate our differential, and the whole thing was ready in about four hours. 
And we've done the brakes of our Volkswagen Vanagon Syncro - just great. Adjusted and nenewed the old pads.
The owner Mr Walter Yugsi is very professional and since he is a good friend from the owner of La Bicok , a campground in Mindo, he is very friendly to overlanders. His contacts are: www.rapi-frenos.com.ec / walter.yugsi@hotmail.com / 2491833 / 2497547

name: On the beach
description:
The spot would be amazing if it was clean.
We decided to stay and clean around our truck and enjoyed the beautiful quiet beach in front of us.
It's garbage that the ocean brought, it doesn´t look like people go the to leave their trash.
If more people visit the place and clean their own square meter (or more) it will be a great great spot for others. Enjoy!

name: Shantí Lodge Parking Lot
description:
We came to the lodge for another reason and met Mauricio, it's owner and manager and he let us stay on the parking lot for 2 nights.
He is very helpful and a great person.
It is not meant to be a Campground at all, but we liked it so much that asked Mauricio to put it here on ioverlander and he agreed.
The parking lot is small, has space for 6 vehicles and is not leveled, BUT on the other side has very good wifi, a lovely restaurant with hammocks with a great view of the ocean and is very quiet. It's out of town, about 20 minutes walk which we think is another plus.
A great place to relax for a couple of days.
Also, if someone is interested to stay longer and participate as a volunteer (building a greenhouse, helping on the kitchen, helping with the website -translating to other language, for example-, or teaching your skills) you are very welcome.
Price is USD$3 p/p.

name: Quinta Restaurant Forestal
description: Lots of room to camp. Gated, toilets, hot showers, clean, nice owner. We ate dinner and camped for free. Only open on weekends.wifi!

name: El Angel Soccer Field Camp
description: Enough grassy space around the sporting field. Alt 2978 m. Quiet.

name: Free Area de Camping, fogota-parilla
description: Nice free camping managed by the Ministerio del Ambiente. Fire pits, barbecue grills, cold water. Internet available at the nearby Pululuhua hostel.

name: Campo Alegre
description: We crossed from Pto. Cayo via Jipijapa, Daule, Babahoyo, and Guaranda to Riobamba. In between we did not see many places to park overnight. We happened to notice this one leaving Juan Montalvo toward Balsapampa. It's a quiet and safe place away from the road. It also is a rehab center for drug and alcohol addicts, but this was no problem for us; the staff was nice. While it looks and is a bit run down, it also serves as "balneario" for locals. There are some nice natural water pools, which you are welcome to use. We spent only one night, and the toilet we were told to use worked. We paid $5 per person for the one night. Probably few overlanders travel this route, but if you do, this is one place you can stop over for the night. Note: GPS coordinates are approximate. As you drive eastward out of town up the hill, the place is on the left. There is a sign.

name: Killa Wasi Hostel
description:
Nice property in Alausi. Place for big rigs. Electricity, hot shower, bathroom communal kitchen to wash your dishes or for cooking.
Access by a cobblestone road. $5 per/night per/person.  Talk to Víctor. Super Friendly people. Fast internet even inside closed camper.   Directions: ask for "La quinta de la familia Rivadeneira" en el barrio Mullenquiz. Once in the barrio Mullinquiz you'll start seeing painted signs with arrows pointing to "Killa Wasi"

name: Pahuma Orchid Reserve
description:
An utter mistake! Waste of time and money. The "botanical garden", which was supposed to host 300 species of orichid, looked neglected, disease-ridden and overgrown with parasites. We failed to notice even a single orchid flower, apart from a one next to the highway.

An old man, who said he was the owner, was unfriendly and didn't allow us to enter with a dog as he was afraid he might pee inside the rundown "garden".

Do yourself a favour and spend your $5 (per person) somewhere else.

name: Next to police station
description: flat parking space next to the police station. free. no amenities. In the town centre.

name: Hosteria Paraiso
description: This place is located at the north entrance of Vilcabamba near the mechanic Pilacar. The owner, Jacqueline, is exceptionally friendly and helpful and accommodating. Just for that, this place is highly recommendable. Smaller pickup campers or VW-type vans will fit. Bathrooms and showers are next to the pool. $5 pp. See updated info.

name: Tobauto
description: Very good mechanics though not lightening fast. We had disc brakes replaced on a heavy van, they ordered parts from Quito so it took a few days. Try to think of everything you will need and insist they order it all so that you don't wait an extra day for the other other part you can't get in Ibarra!

name: Hosteria Candamo
description: Very good place to park and camp near the border in Mandala, 6 km north of Macara. There are signs on the Panamericana. Very quiet, and the host Alberto is very friendly and helpful. It's also bug free. Plenty of level space on concrete for at least six big rigs. Tents are welcome, but you camp on concrete. Very highly recommended! We gladly paid the $5pp Alberto asked for. Cold water showers by the pool, hot only in the rooms. Very easy to get up for an early start in the morning, the roosters take care of that... : )

name: Kinde House
description:
The best hostel we've stayed at in Latin America. Modern hotel-like rooms with carpet floors, comfortable beds, hot showers and excellent Wifi. Towels, tea and drinking water included. Free parking for vehicles under 2.2m (our 4runner with roof tent fit). There is also laundry and a rooftop with a great view.

We paid $25/night for a private room in the low season.

name: Molleturo Village
description: This small village has a flat parking area around the square. It has restaurants and shops. Better option to spend overnight than near the main road. Coming from Guayaquil, take the third road on the left which is the only one with tarmac.

name: Hosteria Nantu
description: pool with open air shower

name: Hotel Bambu
description:
Bambu has cabañas, rooms to rent. You can also sleep in your rig in the secure carpark out back with access to bathrooms, wifi etc for around $6
pp per night (depending on season). Large area out back so most big rigs should be fine if it’s empty, but often lots of cars parked.

Beautiful leafy grounds. Restaurant/bar onsite. Really friendly staff. Hammocks, pool table and ping pong table to use. Waves right out front by river mouth.

Showers for overlanders are outdoors, so not much privacy.

name: Roadside
description: Parking on the roadside near the Rio in front of the Faculty of médecine. Not far from town centre. Quiet at night. Toilets in the faculty.

name: Mecanica Electrica Vasquez
description: Had some unknown issue with the ignition, and had this place recommended.

name: Hotel Tampa Bay
description:
Nice and clean single rooms for $25, double for $35. With wifi (slow) and A/C. 

No parking, but one block further away there is a secure overnight parking for $1.5.

Can stay with a pet, bit bigger dogs should be kept for the night in a designated area. We didn't know that and kept Django in the room.

Street noise can be a problem. It dies around 9 pmand resumes around 7 am. No rooms immune to that problem.

name: Hosteria Cabanas del Valle
description: $5 pp in the car on the parking, $25 in single room, $35 double room. Pool, wifi, restaurant. Dog only outside/in the car. $3 for breakfast.

name: Hotel Joshed Imperial
description:
Clean and quiet mid-range hotel. $25 for a single, $45 for a double room including breakfast. Possible to stay with pets in the room
(after a bit of convincing). Has a private, gated parking.

name: Techni Centro Cortez
description:
Workshop which Pedro Villota uses. He`s the best mechanic we`ve encountered so far. Really knows his jobs and has numerous years of experience as a mechanic on racing teams (e.g. on Daytona), but sometimes might be too attached to his vision of your car's problem, so don't hesitate to stress your opinion if you have one - he'll work with you.

Last, but not least: his rates might be high. We paid $180 for having valve cover taken off to check position of timing chain, installed new alternator, greased idler pulley bearing and distributor aligned and set properly. Pricey, but then we didn't want a cheap half-wit to mess with our engine.

name: Central square in the village
description:
A piece of ground around the village square with lots of street light. Access to clean toilets and showers. Ask for senor Tigre to arrange camping. $1 pp.

Access to nearby waterfalls is another $5 pp.

There are a lot of dogs around, so if you also have one better go somewhere else as they will be barking all night long (after the villagers went to sleep there will be no one to make them quiet). Other than that it is calm.

The name of the village is 23 de Noviembre and/or Siete Cascadas.

name: hostal Lita
description: We were allowed to park and use the facilities in a room for $10 since we frequently prefer sleeping in the van. but a double room is $15 if you want to stay in the hostal. rooms are very clean. cold showers, and WiFi. no air conditioning or fan but it was cool enough at night.

name: Hotel Villonaco
description: Used to be called Hotel Acapulco. Nicely remodeled. Indoor parking for motorcycles. I paid $15 a night for a single room with private bath, very good wifi, and TV.

name: Balcon en el cielo
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this post was added by the owner. Has not been Overlander verified.

Wood cabin hot water .gas stove.heater.two bedrooms.kitchen.bathroom.living room. The most important anout this place that the view is breathtaking am in top of the clouds.the perfect place to be in contact with the nature and is stress free guaranty. The weater up in the montain it changes in matters of minutes.we have spring water o contamination. The only place in cuenca that offers this.

name: Paseo de los Monos
description: Monkey rescue centre. Camp in pflat parking lot opposite entrance ($1). Stayed 48 hours and gave our time volunteering with the monkeys. Cooked our own food. No charge for us. Can volunteer and stay in house with meals, $15 per day. Check www.losmonos.org.

name: Rancho Hnos Prado
description: A farm with a rather rustic restaurant & sport-fishing in small lakes. Happy to have guests for the night & they really enjoy the company. Lovely place with fireplace lit every night in sheltered eating area. Toilets available & hot shower on request. Camping in exchange for meal from the restaurant or a tip. Trout is $4-$6 depending on size of fish (that you can catch yourself) with rice & mote pillo....delicious!!! Other food & hot drinks available. Lovely owners, Roque speaks Spanish & his son Fabian speaks some English. There is nice hiking to some lakes & waterfalls. They offer excellent fly fishing for a fee as well. All in all a wonderful stay & much better value & experience than the parking lot of the national park for $4pp!!!!

name: Jardin Las orquideas
description:
Parking of the forest Las Orquideas.
Recovery project of the native forest, as well as orchids and medicinal plants. Owner Omar is very friendly and a lover of his project, which takes more than 30 years.
He let us sleep in the parking lot and accompanied us to see frogs and nocturnal animals.
We did not ask about the possibility of baths or water, but it has a park adapted for wheelchairs, very nice.

Parking del bosque Las Orquideas.
proyecto de recuperación del bosque nativo, así como orquídeas y plantas medicinales. Su dueño Omar es muy amable y un amante de su proyecto, que lleva más de 30 años.
Nos dejó dormir en el parking y nos acompañó a ver ranas y animales nocturnos.
No le preguntamos por posibilidad de baños ni agua, pero tiene un parque adaptado para sillas de ruedas, muy bonito.

name: Suites MAR
description: very clean hotel. Hot shower, wifi and a small kitchen availebal with fridge. 30$ for a dobleroom maybe get a discount if you stay more days. close to the habor.

name: Ecuador Aduana Control
description:
This is an Ecuador Aduana control primarily for traffic going north.  All northbound traffic is detoured but not all are checked. 
Going from Peru -> Ecuador after their offices are closed at the main site you may have to come here to check in your vehicle afterwards.
Going from Ecuador -> Peru you may need to stop here if you are after hours and drop off your TIP. The main Aduana should be open from 08:00-19:00 weekdays and 08:00-13:00 Saturday. If passing within this time you should not need to stop here.  But may be worth stopping.

Update Ecuador -> Peru: you do NOT need to come here, they will not take your tip. Go directly to CEBAF.

name: Near to the river
description: Next to the river, behind the walled fortress of the church retreat. There is a dirt road that goes along the river. Accessed from the central square, just drive down towards the river and turn left before you go over the bridge. No amenities but our Claro was good. You have to drive thru the stream for a bit but it’s somewhat smooth going, a little clearance is needed. Walk back to the square, and French bakery is about 10 minutes.

name: Trailhead For Cerro Cubilche
description: This is one of the trailheads for the hike to cerro cubilche. You can make a A to B or and A to A hike. Park your Car just at the trailhead, after 500m there is an electric pole. Pass it, don't take a left turn. The path goes through a pine Forest. After the forest You basically go straight up the hill. It takes 1 Hour up the summit. There you have a spectacular view over the valley, ibarra, cayambe and even See the cotopaxi if the clouds allow. To get here from ibarra drive to la esperanza. After the bridge Take a right turn and follow the sign to Cubilche. It's a 7km cobblestone road. One the Way up here there are several beautiful Wild Camping spots if you don't Need any facilities and want to have a wonderful view over the valley. Well worth it!!!

name: Mechanic
description: Good Mechanic. Speak a little english. We got our windshiled fixed here. Just off the panamerican.

name: Gravel Pit Near Cotopaxi
description: Gravel Pit near cotopaxi. Park was closed when we were here but we still wanted to get a good view of the volcano. Nice, hidden, quiet, free. 3149m altitude. In the Morning a Security guard passed by but didn't stay anything, so it seemed to be okay.

name: Pull Off Next To River
description: Big parking next to the river. We stay here 4 nights really nice. On the weekend, the people come here to swim and enjoy. This is the way to the route: Las 7 cascadas. 5 minuts walk to the supermarket and restaurants. There is and hotel with restaurant.

name: Boondock City
description: One of many access roads in area that lead to beach this one looks over grown and has lowish hanging brush but its fine it comes to a nice area at the beach

name: Puente Lucarqui, Pull Out
description: On the Way to the border we ran out of daylight and were really tired of the serpentines. This is a good and quiet stop on the left side of the road just before the bridge (going South). The road leads to a Gate ( to an elementary School) so there is no through traffic. 30 m before the Gate is a Little pull out which is leveled. Only 100m away from the panam. You can hear the traffic but there is hardly any during the Night. Quite warm because it's only 682m altitude. Some bugs. On this Highway there weren't so many options for Wild Camping so we found this was a good Spot. Before The Little town of lucarqui.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Military Checkpoint, checking passport and Registration for.....? Anyhow, friendly guys.

name: Marilyn's Restaurant
description: Stayed in parking lot had power wifi and toilet and shower. Owner Walther is very nice. Good cheap meal and was free !

name: Near Bomberos
description: A safe place in "plaza" in front of bomberos. There is a supermarket and the bathroom can be used, open until 8pm.

name: El Rio Mall
description: A giant mall full of stuff, including huge fast food court, supermarket, Yamaha moto store, cinema, outdoors store and various electronic and clothing stores.

name: Moto Servicio
description: Good shop for moto stuff. Mechanic was really sound and charged a fair price for soldering a circuit board on my starter switch. Store sells oil, tires, spares etc too (but I felt it was expensive.)

name: Cafe de la Vaca
description: Follow the cow signs from the main road for delicious fresh cheese and milk and a restaurant menu based around this. We were here for lunch which was delicious and offered plenty of Ecuadorian specialities but also had burgers, etc. available. Highly recommend the Bandeja Criolla if you're hungry, or sharing one as a main if two people are hungry. Not inexpensive but a very worthy splurge. Mains are between $7 and $14 on average. Breakfast is supposedly amazing but you may have to wait or book ahead.

name: Hotel Tavarua
description: Very nice place yo camp near the sea. Very kind owners

name: Hosteria Eterna Primavera
description: Restaurant international food, internet, electricity and other service. Perfect place to relax, the view from the Hosteria is amazing. Great Service. The rooms are very comfortables.

name: Termas de Nangulvi
description: Termas with 4 hot pools. Cost US$3 for access or $8 to camp and have access. Hot showers inside the termas.

name: Parque San Sebastian
description:
Parking free. $ 10 cents to toilets that are opened until 7 p.m. Security and quiet. Police 24 hours arround the place. There are bakery and mini market near place. 
Water free.

name: Riverside North Macas
description:
Large flat area on western bank of river accessed by track about 200 metres west of bridge. Locals swimming and picnic spot.

No facilities 
Weekend WILL be noisy unless you go as far away from the bridge end as possible

name: Templo de la Amazonia only with permission
description:
Parking lot.  Complex seems abandoned. 
  Toilets are open but not maintained. Car park is ok for overnighter

name: Hostal Tambo Cocha
description: This is a really nice hotel by Ecuadorian standards. At the time of writing I paid $10 for a spacious room including wifi.

name: Hostel Alondra
description: nice hostel with showers, toilet and swimming pool outside. We stayed with new years ave in an room with airco for 35 dollar

name: Bambu Casa
description: Hostel with rooms from 10 USD in low season. Kitchen, good communal area, lovely views from rooftop area. Has wifi and hot communal showers. Various rooms available. Suitable for Moto budget bikers only as garage is tiny, possibly only fit for three or so motorcycles. Probably better options out there but this isn't bad for a couple of nights.

name: Mr. Motorcycle
description: Great shop to stock up on oil, chain lube, etc. Also a variety of gear and there is also a mechanic here.

name: Larama Village
description: This is an absolute gem to find especially as a touring cyclist. This spot offers shelter (important as it was raining heavily during the night) running water, power points, lights, toilets are near buy. I did see a shower, didn't test to see if it worked however. Ordinarily I would be reluctant to camp so close to the highway, but this a sleepy little town with minimal traffic during the evening. A few of the locals said I wouldn't have any trouble during the night. Lots of insects that are mainly just attracted to the lights (no Mosquitos to worry about). Very luck to find this spot, if you have a vehicle you can park it adjacent to where you camp right on the street, ample space.

name: Gated Parking Lot
description: Good place! It's 4$ to let your car in this secured parking lot. You can sleep in your RV for the same price, it's quiet by night. No facilities but you can go the hostel tiana, just next to the parking to take a shower (2$) or use the wifi (1$/3hours). The gate is high enough for a big rig and there is plenty of space in the parking but the street is a bit tight so turning into the parking can be tricky . Our car is 5,5 meters long and it was ok, I don't know how about if you are much longer than that.

name: Aduana Ecuador
description: Cold shower. Bathroom. Free internet. Safe place. Electricity inside offices. Police right in the corner. Parking lot.

name: Nariz del diabolo
description: Viewpoint of the Nariz del Diablo with restaurant, you can stay in the parking lot or just in front of the restaurant when you eat there. Very friendly staff. You can also do some nice walks. Super quiet by night

name: Spot Next To The Hanging Bridge In Misahualli
description: Cross the bridge to the other side of the town and is a good space in front of Jungle hostel. Just next to the end of the bridge. No facilities, but is quiet and safe. Wifi from the hotel: user: JUNGLE pass: WELCOME1  //// Cruzando el puente al otro lado del pueblo hay un buen espacio para estacionar, justo donde termina el puente frente al hostal JUNGLE. Sin servicios, pero seguro y tranquilo para alguna noche. Wifi del hotel! User: JUNGLE pass: WELCOME1

name: Parque Acuático Araque
comedor Susanita
description: large parking area next to restaurant with access to bathrooms and cold water shower. the waterfall that is accesses from here for $1 is beautiful. there is some traffic noise. we paid a few dollars to stay. Very friendly family after you get to know them. They also have cabins with private bathrooms and hot water for $20 per person. try the plantano Verde at the restaurant, yum!

name: Austrogas
description:
Here you may be able to fill US fixed tanks with the 1 3/4" ACME thread from one of their delivery tankers. May require a wait until a tanker is available.
Suggest to call +593982659414 before arriving.
No children are allowed inside the industrial area including Austrogas.
Closes at 3 pm

name: Hotel Valle Sagrado
description:
Closest camping to the Centre of Vilcabamba.  
They let you stay in the garden of the hotel. Toilet, shower, electricity and fast Wifi. There is room for approx. 4 vans.
Just one block from main plaza - perfect for visiting Villcabamba!
$ 6/pppn

name: Hostal Maria
description: Owners have been gone for two days. They left there dog and are gone.  Van is locked in, we are not. Dog poops wherever it wants. Somehow today a chicken showed up. We are out of here as soon as possible.

name: PetroEcuador
description: Gas station,  open 24/7 we had a peaceful night!

name: Road By Beach
description: Roadside parking next to beach, with public toilets and showers. Quiet at night,

name: Just Outside Cotopaxi NP
description: This free site is just outside the park boundary on the north side. Amazing view of summit and surrounding area. In a slight depression to offer a little wind protection. We arrived at park entrance and were informed that camping is not allowed within the park. Not sure what to make of that since others have camped within and have mentioned an established campground.

name: Gran Hotel JS Latacunga
description: Nice and clean double room with wooden floor, hot shower, wifi and tv. Safe parking in the back of the hotel, entry gate approx. 3m high. Paid usd 30.- for a double room.

name: Hotel Doña Esther
description: Cosy small hotel with an excellent restaurant. 54 USD for room with two beds and private washroom. Best hot shower I've had in months. Google maps location is wrong, but this location is correct. No parking on site but many parqueos nearby. Recommended.

name: La Casa Cuencana
description: Nice clean rooms with charm. Refinished hardwood floors and stairs. Bright rooms with comfortable beds. Fast wifi. The downside is parking. We had secure parking for our motorcycles and many bikes would fit. Unfortunately other vehicles would need to park on the street.

name: Grutas de La Paz
description:
Cave with river flowing from its mouth. Church sanctuary here, "medicinal" waters. People were collecting the drippings from the stalactites and there are also baths here. Smaller scale than the Santuario de las Lajas on the other side of the border in Ipiales, but similar vibe. We were told to give it a visit from some Colombian travelers when we were at the Santuario in Ipiales. worth the detour! There's a "good" road from the main highway but if you go into La Paz and follow signs, there's a more adventurous road through the valley.

Dog friendly!

name: Complejo Turistico Mojanda
description: perfect  place, cheap and good 5$ Camping  by tente. 15$  Cabanas by personne. 20$ Cabanas by couple.

name: Kamala Hostel
description: Nice place on beach close to town, nice big pool. Bar restaurant etc you can camp or park for 5 dollars a night if your car is big it will not fit in driveway our vw camper was fine

name: Free Beach Camp
description: On the beach left side of the restaurant in front of The beach, quiet, kind and friendly

name: Talleres Faconza (LR)
description: Best Land Rover mechanics in town. They work also on 4x4s from Mercedes, Toyota and VW. Owner speaks English and has a lot of experience with Land Rovers. They let you camp in the workshop if fixing your car takes more then a day.

name: Restaurant La Abuela María
description:
Restaurant en route, menu for 3 $. Very clean and well laid out. With WiFi and parking at the door 

restaurante en ruta, menú por 3$. muy limpio y bien puesto. con WiFi y estacionamiento en la puerta

name: Fernando Arias
description:
Mechanic called Fernando Arias. Very good with travelers, will help instantly with good will and consideration. Is located in the city of Pasaje, prov del parrot. The address is Juan pablo second and cesar naranjo, in the citadel La Francisca. Your cell phone 0985218084 

Mecanico llamado Fernando Arias. Muy bueno con los viajeros, ayudara al instante con buena voluntad y consideracion. se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de Pasaje, prov del loro.
la direccion es Juan pablo segundo y cesar naranjo, en la ciudadela La Francisca. su celular  0985218084

name: mecanico Fernando Arias
description:
In the city of Pasaje, prov of the parrot, its direction is Juan pablo second and cesar orange. His cell phone 0985218084. He is an excellent mechanic and very considerate with the travelers 

en la ciudad de Pasaje, prov del loro, su direccion es 
Juan pablo segundo y cesar naranjo. Su celular 0985218084. Es un excelente mecanico y muy considerado con los viajeros

name: cima ruta R2! vistas de las lagunas
description:
beautiful!! Good walking !! 

precioso!! buena caminada!!

name: restaurant El Caja
description:
Parking lot of the restaurant
free for the night if you eat at the restaurant
you can fish your own "trucha"
5$ per person
very friendly people
no amenities except toilet

name: Laguna Colta parque
description:
inside the park of the laguna
ask at the desk if possible to camp inside
gate closes at 6 pm. Have to wait outside before
price : $2pp + $1/vehicle
bathrooms 24 hours
guard at night
very quiet
level & paved parking

name: Cemetery Tulcan
description: A very interesting cemetery with its bush-figures. El jardin de dios.

name: Diving At Darwin N Wolf/ Equator
description: Absolutely phenomenal diving.. Highly recommend taking a 7 night tour. We did with Galapoges master- deep blue. Last minute booking at half price and just had an amazing time below and above water. Staff is amazing. As for diving yes it's tough at time with current and all. Having some experience in current will be a must. We had about 90 dives beforehand and has dived with strong currents but don't worry too much. You don't need many many dives just advance certificate and mixed experience with tough situations, calm under water as panic is only big concern

name: Tango Reef Hostal
description: 52usd per night two people. Clean and we had a room with sea view . No breakfast but then good bakery was just around the corner.

name: bushcamp
description: Nothing fancy. A Level spot well hidden from the road. Quiet at night

name: International Airport: Flight To Galapagos (avianca)
description: Return flights for two usd 976. Agents will scare you book with them etc etc and were almost charging two hundred more. Best is book yourself a day earlier if really needed...

name: Canopy Doble
description:
the longest (1000m) and fastest canopy in Ecuador
very friendly
15Usd per person

name: Market Place Parking Lot
description: Got late at night as clouds rolled in. Roads are extremely narrow and steep for our RV 2.4m wide, 20ft and 3.4m high finding a hotel turned very hard. This was a reasonably safe place as other local families of farmers stayed to put market in morning. We asked police man nearby and he said no problem. Of course somewhat noisy with dogs n cars it's an emergency stop.

name: Leoni Pizzeria
description: Nice little restaurant on a side street of the market. they serve excellent pizzas! biggest size. margeritha $ 13.00. friendly people. Wifi available.

name: Cuna del Sol Completo Turistico
description:
We are in the south of Ecuador, in the Coordillera de los Andes, 500 m from El Tambo, Cañar province, via Panamericana Sur, next to the municipal stadium, at a height of 2956 masl, and at an average temperature of 12º, latitude 2º31º16.039 "south, length of 78º55'47.05" west, we are located just 60 minutes from the city of Cuenca.

SERVICES OFFERED
We have ample green spaces for recreation and camping, ample and safe private parking, convention hall, restaurant, swimming pool, Turkish, discotheque, lodging.

We have fast wifi, cable TV and many more services.

name: hotel karina
description: Good location in center. Nothing special but cleanish small rooms with hot showers, air con, wifi, breakfast 13USD. Small garage great for big bikes or small cars.

name: Equator Museum And Line
description: You can take cute pictures here and also the guide shares some interesting information about equator worth listening. All in 15 minutes but can also last more if you question the guide. Costs 2usd per adult, 0,50 per kid. Open 8.30 am-5.30 pm / every day

name: Ñañas hostel
description: Very nice place to stay, very modern and comfortable. Excellent attention, very friendly. 10 dollars en dormitory or 20 for one people in a big room with private bathroom. Un lugar muy hermoso para quedarse. Muy tranquilo y gente muy simpatica. Possibilidad de gardar la bicicleta en la habitacion. Un très bel endroit pour séjourner, hôtel de charme et employés très sympathiques. Cuisine privée, wifi, etc ..

name: Hotel Rio Guayas
description: Wow. no sign out front but the place is amazing. 18 bucks per night for two person, private double, immaculately clean in the centre. wifi quick and very welcome aircon (currently 35 degrees). guy at reception speaks english and originally from cuba. not much in guayaquil unless you need parts or work done except jumping off point for galapogos or the lizard park in the centre which is free and amazing. beatles museum exhibition was cool. 3 dollars to securely park 2 bikes. cars bikes and 4x4s only

name: hotel opposite bus station
description:
securish car park for our bikes. 20bucks private room 
not much in town but had to stop

name: Cabañas Victoria
description: Basic cabins with private bathrooms, You can camp in the big garden, we camp under the roof of the restaurant because was raining season Victoria let us to use the kitchen and shower from the room. We paid 3 dolars per person for the tent, free parking, no Internet, Restaurant, she cooks for us a delicious chicken soup for free!!!!

name: Hostal Junin
description:
It is clean, the cost is 8 dollars per person, we were able to park the Motorbikes and bicycles inside, bathroom. 
....
Es limpio, el costo es 8 dolares/persona, pudimos parquear las motos adentro, tiene baño

name: hostal el maple
description: comfy and decent price b&b. super friendly. no parking. stayed here while breaks were getting fixed

name: ConAuto TireCity Michelin
description: We found a BFGoodrich AllTerrain tire here. Since 5000 kms we were looking (chile, peru, ecuador). If you need Bf Goodrich tires, this place might be helpful. If they dont have it, they have other ConAuto places all over Ecuador so they can ship the tires in 24 hours here.

name: Toyoservicio
description: Toyota centric mechanic but worked on our Ford van no problem. Clean, fairly fast, knowledgeable, and fair price. We did have to run around all over to get parts for ourselves. We stayed the night, clean restrooms, good Wi-Fi, no showers.

name: American Truck
description: Not a mechanic but a parts place for heavy vehicles. Good source for parts for old American diesel engines and heavier vehicles. They have International, Cummins parts, etc. We were able to get a fuel pump for a 96 7.3 Powerstroke here, which we were afraid was going to have to come from the US! However the crush washers to put the banjo bolt back on took a couple hours wandering around before we found something that would work. Cheaper to pay cash.

name: Taller Avila
description: Automatic transmission shop. A bit grubby but two good mechanics working there, they fixed our E40D transmission in three days and did a pretty good job. $350 flat rate labor + parts. They do not have all the possible bench test gear and diagnostic equipment but I'm not sure anyone in Ecuador does, so they take it apart, look for damage, replace anything that shows damage, and put it back together. For us, had to drop it a second time and re-clean the pump to resolve slow shifts but it was solved correctly and we are back on the road. Warrants keeping an eye on everything while they are working, as always. Can call the owner, Andres Avila, at 099 975 7461.

name: Lucero Princess
description: $16 for double room, hot water, WiFi, small parking.

name: hosteria mi huasipungo
description: beautiful hotel with amazing grounds. $50 for a room but everything was lovely. they may allow camping but didnt ask.

name: Kiwi Hostel
description:
Double rooms from 15 $ (shared bathroom) up to 30 $ with air conditioning and private bathroom (in low season at least). There is common kitchen and kitchen in the rooms for $ 30. Clean. friendly owners. Also has restaurant and eats well (menu $ 3.50). With parking and wifi 
habitaciones dobles desde 15$ (baño compartido) hasta 30$ con aire acondicionado y baño privado (en temporada baja por lo menos). hay cocina común y cocina en las habitaciones de 30$.
limpio y dueños simpáticos. también tiene restaurante y se come bien (menú 3,50$). Con aparcamiento y wifi

name: control policial/militar
description:
Military control (second on this road) 

control militar (segundo en esta carretera)

name: Fuji Film - camera repair
description:
José Loor is a genius in regards to repairing all  kinds of cameras. We got sand in our new lumix so the zoom would not work anymore and he fixed it within a half day. He said he also repairs bigger cameras. He likes to work with foreigners so he will always give you a special price. 
We also bought an underwater camera there. Very nice guy, highly recommended.
The GPS data might not be totally correct but it's the fuji film store in front of the place.

name: Hostal Suites Madrid
description:
Nice Hostal with secured parking. We stayed two nights in a private room with private bathroom and AC for 30$\night, that's why we don't know about the conditions if you want to sleep in the car. Close to bars and the street so not totally quiet night. 
Kitchen fully equipped (stove, plates, pots, fridge),nice roof terrace. 
Fastest WiFi we have had so far in South America. 
10min walk into the Center. 
Laundry service down the road. 
The manager Christopher also arranges last minute Galapagos Tours, see different post. 

You could also leave your car there if you leave for Galapagos but we don't know about the price. Maybe the Livingston hotel is a better option for that. 

 Has gated parking but does not allow you to sleep in your vehicle. Can barter rooms for $25-30 and parking from $6-4 per day while you are in the Galápagos Islands

name: Galapagos last minute deals
description: Christopher, a young and sympatique manager of the Hostal Suites Madrid can arrange you good Galapagos deals. We chose to book here, because in comparison to other agencies we have checked (Galasam, Dreamkapture Hostal/agency, enchanted tours) he offered us the (in our point of view) best itinerary (route), for the lowest price. He also really takes his time to explain you everything what you want to know and what you are going to see.

name: Iguanas Park
description: A nice Park where a lot of iguanaa just run around freely. Nice for a stroll. Free entry.

name: La Casa Se Los Pescados
description:
It is a place where you can camp for free, there is a roof in case it is raining, the family is very friendly. You can rent a cabin for $ 10 dollars for 2 people 

Es un lugar donde puedes acampar gratis, hay un techo por si esta lloviendo, la familia es muy amable. Puedes alquilar una cabina por $10 dolares por 2 personas

name: VW Garage "Motor Studio”
description: Very good VW Vanagon, T3 Mechanic, the boss is Don Diego, they fixed our axle arm after other quit. Don Diego is specialized in VW Beetle, Combis, Vanagon. Nice guy, nearly no english

name: El Tablon
description: I arrived in the dark and could easily stay in the village, which has only few houses. There exist a basketball field with a flat area for camping. No facilities. Free. The people are friendly, there is one small shop right on the road.

name: Base camp at Antisana
description: Here you can come if you climb Antisana or follow people who climb. You need permit and it's done easier with local guides who take care of papers. Need 4x4. No facilities, completely wild.

name: Casa del Arbol
description:
Parking lot just under the famous Swing at the end of the World. $1 during the day. Nice views, restaurant nearby with limited choice, a lot of snacks. There are a couple parking lots here. The swing you can see is not Casa del Arbol, you have to walk up the hill and to your right, impossible to park directly there. 

You can park-up there for the night but it's around 1000m higher than down in the town.

Road starts just before Ulba when coming from Baños. Clear signs from then on. Be early!!

name: Bolivar 3 Hospedaje
description:
Nice and clean rooms.Very Quiet place. Friendly people.Safe parkinglot inside.We
payed 35 lsoles for room with one big bed.

name: Hotel la Estación
description: Really nice place in Urbina in front of train station, next to Chimborazo volcano. Lovely owner. $15 per person. $5 for breakfast. Very recommended!

name: Hostal Puerto Engabao "El Surf Shelter"
description: An international surf hostel with wifi, outdoor kitchen, common area with hammocks and netflix, bbq, laundry, bathroom with cold shower. $5 per person camping, and starting at $8 per person in a dorm room. Friendly atmosphere and loads of info on surfing the surrounding areas.

name: David's Cars
description: Buen Mecanico elèctrico !! Great Mechanic - electrical. And speaks English!

name: VW Repair Shop
description: On the corner. They help us with our T2 VW bus and did a good job.

name: Cabaña Mi Grande
description:
Very good restaurant to have breakfast. Very nice and friendly owner. Prices are good and so is the food. Highly recommended! 

Note: coordinates are a bit off, it's in Av. José de Villamil opposit of Marys cafe & cake on the first floor!

name: Hotel Splendit
description:
Nice enough place to stay. Clean, hot water. Secure parking lot and could easily fit the largest vehicles. $12 USD for a night in a pretty spacious double room.

Update 01-2024 WiFi is terribly slow.

name: Free parking lot, guarded at night
description:
Free parking lot next to a public building. There are guards all night long.
Calm. 
Sometimes free WiFi from "Asadero"

name: Local House Cabana
description: That's the house in the big curve. We asked to this nice family if we can park the car here and sleep for the night and they offer is to sleep in this small cabane for the night. A 1,5 single bed, a table and electricity, nothing else :) for the bathroom you can ask them. Free

name: jungle tour nicky lodge
description:
we did a 4 days jungle tour in the cuyabeno reservat organised from nicky lodge. Very great guide - very informative and funny, nice staff, nice nature and the lodge is in a different place than the other tour operaters, so you are on your own and don't stick together with hundreds of other tourists. 
We booked it over the website from nicky lodge. They work together with ecuatraveling and have a office in quito. Our guide was Andres and he was just really great!
Really nice and highly recommand!!

name: Patas vet
description: Very helpful and friendly vet. Our dog had a cold and we didn't have to wait at all when we arrived. Very professional people work here.

name: The Lost Lobster
description: Pleasantly surprised by the value of the 5 dollar set lunch menu. Big potions of either chicken or beef. Great stater soups to boot.

name: Cabañas El Roclo
description: it is a very nice, cosy, clean place. a bit pricey $20 per night for double room, but if you like us find yourself driving by in a rain and at night it is a great place to stop by. owners are two lovely Ladies.

name: right by the beach outside Montanita
description: Open terrain right by the beach, next to some kind of shrimp plant which makes a bit of a surrrrrring noise during the day. About 10min walk into Montanita. 180° view of nothing but fine beach. Stayed for 10 days, had no problems.

name: commercial parking lot
description: Commercial parking lot, small vehicles only (vans are no problem), 10 USD/night, shower/toilet, safe, noisy, central, bad neighbourhood. Manager Marco is a nice guy, speaks a little English.

name: Levelled terrain in low valley near river
description: Huge levelled terrain next to the river. Warm climate. Lots of sand flies during the day. Quiet, free.

name: flat terrain near San Rafel waterfall
description: Small level terrain used as bus parking for San Rafael waterfalls, quiet, free, 2min walk to San Rafael waterfalls entrance

name: Tero Real Cabanas
description: 20 USD Per person. 5 bungalows. Sleep up to 5 in each.  Probably can bargain down in low season to 15 pp per night. 2 minute walk to beach. Nice hammock chill out area and decent wifi. Best budget option on the island. 5 dollar breakfast optional. 3 dollar snorkel gear rental. Free advice on all things cheap on the island.

name: Old gaz station near San Isidro
description:
Policeman from the town shows us this area, 'where some bus drivers sleep here sometimes'. We probably prefer sleeping somewhere in the town, wich looks pretty but policeman want to help us and we follow him ... 
Very quiet, the only noise we heard was cow and rooster :-)
Two kids came to play with ours in the morning.

name: Gas Station PS
description: Great stop next to Highway. Tall building shields you from traffic noise if you park behind it. Ask at the station. Free. Restroom 24h.

name: Mitad del Mundo
description:
DAY USE ONLY! 

It's not possible to stay on the parking.
Must pay the parking ticket (3$ for the day) at the cashier before.
Entrance on the site is 5 $ per adult. Half price for kids from 6 to 12.
Fun to see the equator line. Littles museums (french pavillion free), monument and lots of souvenir's shops (not expensives opposite to food shops) : certificate, stamps on passport, etc.

name: escuela superior de policia
description: Dark and rainy night ... We ask to the police of Pomasqui and they show us this dead end just in front of police school. They said : "very safe here !". Close to the road but sometimes, you just want to stop and sleep !

name: parking 24/7
description:
Car park close to airport for vehicles under 2.6 m high promotional rate at 3.5 dollars for 24 hours (which may increase slightly) Totally fenced and very well kept free shuttles to airport water, electricity, toilet and free wifi We left our camping car 9 nights without any nasty surprises to recommend 

parking gardé proche aéroport pour véhicules de moins de 2.6 m de haut 
tarif promotionnel à 3.5 dollars les 24 heures  (qui risque d'augmenter un peu)
Totalement clôturé et très bien gardé 
navettes gratuites pour aéroport
eau, électricité,  toilettes et wifi gratuites 

nous y avons laissé notre camping car 9 nuits sans aucune mauvaise surprise 

à recommander

name: Parking at Balneario Santa Clara
description: Quiet and safe place to take a sleep. In the morning it gets busy. Its right at the door of a thermal pool, great to take a warm swimm.

name: Bocana Hotel
description: Expensive but was one of a very few options after the earthquake. 20-25 $ per person.

name: PS Gas station
description: It's a gas station and it's open all night. Of course there is some noise, but when you need a place to park for the night is this a good option. Friendly people.

name: Native Jungle
description:
Patricio Garces from Native Jungle is one of the 4 tours operators in Puyo.
9 de octubre 1268 / Atahualpa, 2nd piso

He speak spanish and english... and others natives dialects

We have done a one day trip for all the family (with children 13y, 9y, 6y). It was perfect. We do a walk in the jungle to see waterfall. Learn a lot of things about plants, see native people, 3km with canoe etc...
35$/adult, half price for child

With Patricio, when you want, there are some other options between 1 to 10 days in the deep forest for next level called 'indiana jones' too... :-)

name: CEREVEN (centro de eventos)
description: 2 bedroom townhouse/cabina with kitchen. paid $20 per head during week. large enclosed parking lot (may have guard at night). includes breakfast. saunas next door. thermal baths around here somewhere.

name: On the beach
description:
Quiet place on the beach. There is 2 sheds (palm leaves roof) that are usually unoccupied by night. You can put a tent under it and be double sheltered in case of rain. Otherwise the beach is quite big so you can camp farther away. 
Careful, there can be turtle nests on the beach. Better put your camp reasonably away from the marked spots so the guardians won't bother you. 
You're not supposed to make fire on this beach but probably if you go at the north end, near the cliff you would be ok. 

All the streets I saw that goes to the beach are blocked at the end by wooden posts so you can't pass by car. Still you can let your car just at the end of one of those streets (20 meters from those sheds). No problem for motorbikes or bicycles. 

There is no electricity, water or whatsoever but in the village you'll find basics commerces.

name: Aita Hostel Montanita
description: Nice place with hostel and camping. Room with fan and breakfast for two -  $16. With AC - $20. Room upstairs is more fresh and doesn't have a smell like the ones down stairs. There are mattresses outside to put the tents on too and some place for true van.

name: Paramo
description: Camping with tent just in the paramo landscape. With nice view on Cotopaxi. Just 50m next to the street. Not a good place for cars - access is possible but will be seen from the street

name: Morejon Motos Motorcycle Mechanic
description: Best Mechanic in south Ecuador. By far! Christobal knows averything about motorcycle and can handle each model. Brand does not matters.

name: Bar restaurant
description:
Forget the restaurant if you can, it was expensive (3,5 to 5$ one course).
But big free area to overnight (with buses and truck...)
There is natural source to refill your tank
Restroom and cold shower 24h but without light...

Just an helpful area when the night comes

name: Homero & Ortega panama hat
description: Free visit of a small but interesting museum, in the heart of the fabric of the well know Panama Hat. Visit of the factory too. Possible to have a complete tour in english or spanish.

name: Saraguro football pitch
description: Flat area close to the football pitch, at 50m from E35. We asked at the little shop in front of the street : owner said " no problem, very safe and quiet place !"

name: Closed gaz station
description:
We found nothing for big rig since at least 100km from the north...
This gaz station seems definitly closed and there are ropes along the streets. But there is a way without rope, closed to the building. There are still people living on the 1rst ground of this building. They were ok when we asked to stay here.

name: Gavalin Tours
description: Horse riding. Kiwi horse guide that has his own land and refugio bordering the NP. Back into nature trip. Very basic refugio: not reachable by car, no electricity etc. He offered us help with parking and camping in Vilcabamba.

name: Lavanderia BLANQUITA
description: Laundry service near Quito approx. 1.8 US/kg

name: Hotel el Refugio
description: Located in Salinas Bolivar, a mountain town. We paid $20 per person, including awesome breakfast. Secure parking for bikes. Friendly staff. Hot shower. Cold room but really warm, comfortable bed. Restaurants in easy walking distance. Adorable, tiny town.

name: Henrrys Hostel
description: Clean, cheap and very friendly hostel. You can use the kitchen as well, 10usd or less/person/night.

name: Hosteria Candamo
description: We create this point in order travelers easily see that this hostel is also a fantastic campground. We stayed 3 nights and it Was a Perfect place for our kids, there is a soccer ground. I used their washing machine for 3 dollars per machine. Beautiful with pool friendly people good food and cheap with laundry service

name: Rapi-frenos
description:
Here is a garage specialized on breaks problems . We had to check some mechanicals issues . They worked straight on it . Very professional and helpful they fixed everything in 3 ours . Big and super clean place you also have bathroom and free wifi . There is a restaurant at the corner  and a big grassy park with playground if you want to breeze up yourself . Super friendly team highly recommend
But check the price before agreeing to work

name: entrada reserva el angel 'el salado'
description: this is the entry for the western part of the el angel reserve, camping here is free, on the street or in a gated area if you are lower then 2 meters. we preffered the eastern part at laguna voladero

name: polylepis lodge
description: this is a nice lodge. day use is 10$ p.p for guided hikes. you could camp here for 25$ p.p including hot showers and maybe a jacuzzi. incl. food its 40$. didn't try any option because of its price

name: near estacion biologica guandera
description:
closest you can drive to the estacion, which is 15 min by foot. there are two hikes from the estacion. they rent cabanas too. tent camping possible too, 7 USD. to enter you have to pay 6usd/P. beginning of hikes extremely muddy
Hike 1 Nariz del Diablo: 15km and 750m elevation gain.
Hike 2 Waterfall loop: 7 km and 390 elevation gain.

name: Lavanderia / Laundryservice
description:
Laundry service near Quito
0.80.- $/libro

name: Trailhead Imbabura
description: this is the parking for the trail up to Imbabura, road very steep. to find the trail: walk to the end of the cobblestones, you will see the trail going up on the left. after the reservoir follow the trail to the right and approx midway to the small white house, go uphill. you will find a signpost, from there it's easy. 11km, 1400m elevation gain, 6 - 8 hours

name: Mojando Lake
description:
Update Aug 2022: Sometime between when this pin was created and now, the level of the lake has increased by at least 3 meters. flooding a small section of road and I assume the lake trail. there is no longer a trail around this lake and if there was it would be at least 12km now. 
.....
Beautiful spot right at the lake. several opportunities. lots of fireplaces but only few woody areas. Hikes around the laguna(4km) and up to Fuya, 3.6 km roundtrip 520 elevation gain.  Road sealed all the way to the lake.

name: Portachuelo
description: In front of "Seguro Social Campesino". 50 m from Panamericana. Very quiet in the night .

name: Hotel d'Mario
description:
Very friendly staff.
Double room is about 30$/night

They let you park your campervan at the secuered parking (max. high 2.8m) behibd the hotel.

name: Hostal Casa Aida
description: Cute little hostel managed by the most charming granny ever. parking spots for cars, hôtel rooms, camping spots. Great breakfast. Tour possibilities with Aida's sons to climb surrounding mountains.

name: Horsebackriding - Jose and 2 dogs
description:
If you are interested in horsebackriding, that is the place to go! Others offices offer horseriding but they are far behind in terms of quality. Jose the owner of the horses will take you more than 2 hours for 20 dollars with real good horses with which you will have the possibility to run. Best horseriding experience I had in south america so far! Jose will also share his knowledges about the volcanos and medicinal plants.
Canyoning, rafting, mountain biking and canopi also possible here.

name: Veredita Tropical Camping
description: Complejo turistico with swimming pool and a big place down at the river. Beautiful surrounding. A bit run down. Showers didn't work when we were there and toilet without flush (bucket). Owners are very friendly. US$ 10 pP (might be negociable)

name: Parador
description:
Free parking next to the parador and flat camping area in the sports field. 
Little parador sells food and drinks. Closes when everyone is gone. 
Free camping with great views on volcano.

name: Mariposario Butterfly House
description: Great spot to see butterflies emerge from cocoons in the morning. 9-5 $8,50.-They also have a hotel.

name: Trip in Amazonia from Coca
description: If you are looking for real adventure, highly suggest the park Yasuni, where you will sleep along the river into tents. If you prefer a more confortable experience but much more touristic too, go to Cuyabeno and its lodges. But I think this guide only offers excursions into Yasuni.

name: Fadicart
description: Nice and tidy place. General mechanic. We had an issue with our turbo but couldn't help and recommended us a place in Quito. But they took time to find the problem. Serious, friendly and professional staff

name: General Air
description: Paperwork for your dog is donne here if you arrive by plane ) $28.50 fee

name: Agrocalidad
description: Obtain  import certificate for the dog here. In the airport building. Another $26 payment.

name: NucaPacha Hostel
description: Dog friendly accomodation in private room with own bathroom. $35/night.

name: Galardi Motors
description: Motorcycle shop and mechanics. High quality place.

name: Los Balcones
description: Very nice hotel with secure parking at the rear. Parking has height restriction but not too low. We paid $65 including taxes and parking fees. Near to (but far enough away from) the lively pubs. Restaurants, markets and shops surround the hotel.

name: Transoceanica
description: Pick up paperwork for NYK RoRo- B/L here and pay some fees $136.00, before going to port.

name: Contecon
description: Get access permit to port here. The wait game starts here.

name: Aduana
description: Before All come here with the temporary DJT numbet.

name: Techniservicio Frevel
description: Take care of you very quickly and prices are very honest.

name: Hostal Eddys
description: There is camping and budget rooms available here, Eddy speaks English an can recommend places to eat nearby. Its about 1 block away from a great beach. No Wifi in rooms, you have to go to the Balcony

name: Hostal Eddys
description: There is camping and budget rooms available here, Eddy speaks English an can recommend places to eat nearby. There is no Wifi in the rooms, you have to sit on the Balcony

name: Casa KoKopelli
description:
La casa kokopelli is a beautiful house in the direct proximity of an almost private beach where you can admire the beauty of nature. Breathtaking sunsets and good waves for surfer. The room offers all comfort, queen bed, private bathroom,air conditional, and private terrace. Hot water and wifi access. 45 dollars for 2 people breakfast include
other option:
small room with private bathroom 25$ for 2 person breakfast include (no hot water)
8$ for camping or a bed in "la casita"

name: Parking at Centro Recreacional Yamburara
description:
Some locals advised us about this place really close to the city in front of the Centro Recreacional Yamburara, where you can find toilets, shower, pools, even babarcue!!!
The parking at riverside is level, big rig frienly and FREE.
For the park and the pools there is a small fee.
To get there better follow "Camino de servidumbre", because the bridge on "Via Viveros" has a low and narrow roof.

name: Cabañas Yunkuam
description: Probably the best option for parking an RV or staying in the cabanas.  About $25-$30 per person per night including breakfast which was very good.  Dinner $10 a person.  Other lunch and dinner options in Las Orquideas about 10 min (30 min walk). Nice "jungle" experience for night walks.   Good for visiting nearby waterfalls Cascada de Vino, Cascada de Dioses and the Coca-Cola swimming pool.  All easy walks.  It also offers good tours of Rio Nangaritza.  Facilities are a little dated but good.  Recommended.

name: La Casona Del Mario
description: Nice private place to stay in Quito. Mario is a really nice guy, the rooms are tidy and there are several bathrooms to share. We paid like 20$ a night for our double room.

name: Sangay NP - huge gravel turnout
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

ADMIN NOTE: Users report"we parked at this place, and at night, two local and drunk men came, and asked us money for parking here. They were agressives, so we paid them 10$ and went on the next village Cebadas. This parking is under the Park responsability, but not guarded and free, it was the information given by the Office of the Sangay Park in Macas. Following this attack,we filed a complaint with the Park Office in Riobamba. Georges and Claude Schaller"

" Be careful, much traffic at night, and some local people stop on the parking and ask money. At 11.30 pm, 2 drunken local people asked us our authorization of the park to stay here. (For your information, we went to the Ministerio de l'Ambiante in Macas, but they said us "It is free, without permit, and under the responsibility of the Parc). People were very aggressive men, and we paid 10$ for our safety, and we moved at night quickly to the village of Cebada. Georges and Claude Amsud "

big and level gravel lot just by the Lagunas. spectacular surrounding. beside the street but no traffic. hiking trails and beautiful nature around.

name: Parque Condor
description:
Great park with awesome eagles and hawks, entry fee of $4.50 including bird of prey demonstration, worth the visit! Highly recommended!

Aug 2022: Fee is now$ 6pp

No pets

name: Mother Fanny
description: Perfect stay. Very clean and wonderful hot shower. Fridge and clim in the bedroom. Little kitchen available too. The lovely old lady asked first for 60 dollars but we got a 3 beds room for 50 dollars/night.

name: Free: In front of Coast Guard Property
description: Okay place to spend the night. No facilities, but there are lots of restaurants with toilets and lots of showers (for a small fee, i.e. 50 cents) around. We just asked the coast guards if it's safe to camp at the malecon and they said we could park in front of their property. They were very nice. Quiet night.

name: Free: Parking lot close to the beach
description: Nice plastered parking lot, close to a hotel and the beach. Very level. Pretty quiet at night. Until now no facilities, but there is a TIA (supermarket) closeby which has a toilet and there are also toilets at the pier. Furthermore they are builing facilities all over the beach!! Oh and there is a wifi without password if you walk towards the pier.

name: Quinta san miguel
description: Hotel good parking for large vehicle great view

name: Laundry
description: Laundry $3.75 w&d for a fairly large load in professional machines.

name: Heliconias Campestre
description: Safe parking in pass border. 24 hour garage.

name: Piscina Neptun
description:
Piscina with free hot showers
Update: very cold, no pressure and no doors!

name: Restaurante Y Pizzeria
description: Restaurante y pizzeria el descando de Nahomy. We had dinner here and were allowed to stay overnight at their parking lot in front of the restaurant. Very nice people and reasonable priced food and drinks. We had breakfast the next day, 4$ for eggs, fruit, crossiant, cheese, fresh juice and coffee. For 1$ more you get rice and chicken added. Free wifi, also works at the parking lot.

name: Cascada Rio Malo
description:
Nice waterfall with big parking lot. From the main road you take the dirt road next to the building with the life jackets and tubes by the river and follow it for a few minutes till the parking lot. From here it's a 5 min walk to the waterfall. Enough space for big rigs and nice place to camp next to the river. No toilets. 

Scam at the entrance, avoid.

name: Big space to park next to police station
description:
Free area next to an old football field which is located next to the 24h police station. The police station is 50m down the hill next to the coliseo municipal. Ok to just spend a night.

Small calm village which seems to be a safe place.

name: cavernas de la ceremonia
description:
this is a cool place to see and explore the jungle...to learn about the plants and the culture. you can go to a cave in the middle of the jungle it's so funny and interesting....the guide is cool and friendly.
we do the Ayawasca ceremonies :) and if you ask you can stay here overnight..pitch the tent or sleep in hamac....and is secure for parking
the tour is 3,5 USD

name: Caiman Lodge - Cuyabeno Reserve
description: Eco-lodge in the Amazon rainforest of Ecuador's Cuyabeno Reserve. Park in Lago Agrio take a shuttle for 2hrs to the reserve entrance and then take 2 hour river boat ride to this pristine ecosystem. Highlights include black & white caiman, anacondas, pink Dolphins, and tons of birds and frogs. Paid $540 for 2 people for three days in a private room.  We also saw 2 large scorpions fighting, incredible.

name: Spot by the river
description: Quiet place down by the river. Nothing fancy, but if you just need a place to stay somewhere overnight in town here is lots of space.

name: Piscina - Hot Showers
description:
1,25 US for a hot shower
Piscina
Baño turco
Sauna
Hidromasaje

name: El Castillo
description: Bar and restaurant. Dinner for 5$ which was very good and filling.

name: Reserva Ecológica Santa Rita
description:
A beautiful place in the forest near to a river. The coordinates are at the Campground. But you must register first at the reception. It is easy to find, because there are enough signs.
The very friendly lady Monika first wanted 28$/night. We offered 10 and it was alright.
There is a Barbecue and a chimney. Wooden Logs were at the site for free use!
E-Mail: reservasantarita@hotmail.com
At the site there is no Internet, but you can use it at the reception.

name: Hostal San Martin Inn
description:
It is a hostel that has private and shared rooms, wi fi, parking, kitchen. The price is u $ d 5. 

Es un hostal que cuenta con habitaciones privadas y compartidas, wi fi, estacionamiento, cocina. El precio es u$d 5.

name: Bellavista Reserva
description: There is room for a few vehicles here at $9pnpp. The place is a great retreat up in the cloud forest and is somewhere you can see a different set of hummingbirds and a toucan that you won't see in Mindo. They also have a rare olingo (known as the olinguito here), that is endemic to the Ecuadorian and southern Colombian Andes, which visits regularly. The water is very hot on the shower and there is free potable water available. You can do a set of three birding tours on a day for $18. The owner Richard is very friendly and helpful, as are all his staff. They have a separate campsite for tents. The food in the restaurant is good but not cheap (price reduction for ioverlanders - Richard)

name: Auto Parts Area
description: In this area are numerous auto part stores

name: Parking
description: Right behind the basilica. 0.75/hr security on site

name: Estacion El Chorrillo
description:
we wanted to get our US-bottle (20lb) filled. the security guard sent us away saying it was only possible for contracted companies. later someone else told us, that we arrived there just to late in the day (5 pm) and the guy, who could`ve helped us allready left. so maybe you`re lucky if you get there early....
(we were succesful then at agipgas, 3km east of isidro ayora)

name: Agipgas
description:
got our US-propane-tank (20lb) filled there for 7$.
i think they don´t fill single tanks very often, since it´s a big distribution plant.
but they were very helpful anyway...
opening hours (mon-fr, 7am-5pm; sat 7am-3pm)

name: ER25 Moto Racing
description: Retailer and mechanic working on large displacement bikes in clean professional shop. had fork oil replaced for A KLR 650 here

name: Llullu llama
description:
Old renovated farm with private bedrooms, dorms and cabañas. also space for some tents and a parking with place for vans. the common livingroom is amazing, with woodstove, free coffee and tea. price per night includes 3 course dinner and breakfast. Nice terrace outside with amazing views over the valley. there is also a jacuzzi and sauna... highly recommended!!!!
Very nice Hostal in the Village of Isinlivi. Great Acommodations and nice Parking lot. Only 12 USDollars if you gonna Camp. Big Rig friendly and Tent Camping also possible. Breakfast and Dinner is included, family style all at three big tables. They have a nice Spa-Area too! The St.Bernhards dog is harmless but huuge ;) Perfect Location on the Quilotoa Loop with lots of great hikes possible. Visiting a local Farm and cheese Factory is possible, too. Absolutely recommended! Wi-Fi available down the road if needed.

name: Hotel Central
description: Very friendly staff and good prices made this hotel a good choice in downtown Latacunga. There is a 24 hour reception (just ring the bell) and you can leave your luggage for free when hiking the Quilotoa loop. We paid 20 dollars for a large ensuite room.

name: Hotel Presidente
description:
LOCATION now correct
You will see signes on the road for the hotel. you will see signs for "Hotel Presidente Km 1.5 Via A Valencia, Cdla.jardines Del Este, San Cristobal"  It is a hotel but they have a safe parking lot. They charged us 6 dollars for the car. There is a clean shower and bathroom in the parking lot. They also let us use wifi in the hotel's common area. Ask for Wellington (this is the owner's name!).

name: Mesón Del Tren
description:
Very good restaurant.  Menus are $5.  

They would like to receive overlanders for 10 per vehicle per night or have a meal at restaurant. lovely couple run the place. we stayed there night hand out with them ( and the kitchen). they have a parking lote were you can get water abs electricity. gate doesn't have a height restriction. Big rigs friendly. Washer and dryer machine available for 3 extra dollars.

name: Rumi Wilco Ecolodge
description: It is a private reserve,  you can park close to the entrance.  Kitchen very complete,  hot water. The trails inside of the reserve are fantastic. $5 per Person.

name: Top of the mountain
description:
We drove about 25minutes from the main road to the top of the mountain. The view on the valley, the other moutains and the volcano is amazing. There is no houses etc. therefore very quite. 
It is an unpaved road and a 4x4 is definitely necessary. 
Really nice spot to enjoy the nature and be alone.

name: Huasi Suites de calidad
description: We came here cause other places in the town were full and it was a great choice! Clean, cosy rooms in modern style with bathroom, small patio with hammocks, well equipped kitchen, safe parking place at the property, good wifi and extremely nice people. We felt like home here! 30$ per double room with private bathroom. It's just a bit far from the center (too far for a walk) and I'm afraid that very high cars won't feet in a gate.

name: Casa 1881
description: We came here cause Oasis was full. It's a luxury place in a really reasonable price. We've paid 40$ for a room with living room, bedroom with king size bed and bathroom. Everything just perfect and the people who are running this place are extremely nice.

name: Sabor y aroma de Mercedes
description:
Some of the best empanadas in South America. Just above the car park. If coming from Baños, she is the last restaurant on the left on the old road through Rio Verde. She also has a restaurant in Baños.

It is just before the Rio Verde Cafe Restaurant entry ...west of the restaurant.

name: Mechanic - Recommended
description: After the other mechanic mentioned in IOverlander didn't fix our problem (made it even worse) we got this indication from the 4X4 club in Cuenca. Victor and his sons started immediately to fix our problem. We can highly recommend this mechanic especially for 4x4 which is his specialization. Also the prize was accurate for the work which has been done.

name: Nice Camping behind The Church next to the lake
description:
Quiet and very nice camping spot with nice view to Chimborazo... Free and no facilities.

You may be harassed by locals for money.

name: Museo de Sitio Inti-Ñan (Mitad del Mundo REAL)
description:
This is the place defined by the Incas and seriously we preferred this one! It is named museo Inti Ñan In Situ. It cost 4usd per person including guide and experiences.
