Eso es el lugar definido por los Incas y en serio hemos preferido este! Se llama el museo Inti Ñan In Situ. Cuesta 4usd por persona incluyendo guía y experiencias.

name: Animal Market
description: Every Thursday morning there is a big market with native animals (e.g. cows, pigs, sheep, lamas, etc.). The native people are traditionally dressed. The market starts early in the morning and finishes around 11am. So don't be late.

name: Tierra del Volcán / Hacienda el Porvenir
description:
Hotel & Hostel: the prices vary from 20$ to 170$ depending on the bed/room/suites including breakfast.
Campground: it is FREE for iOverlanders sleeping on their car but please take in mind that you will have to consume something at the restaurant. For campers sleeping in their tents the price is 5$/pers including wood for the fireplace.
The place is just fantastic: great views on volcanoes and very nice hikes to observe the beautiful Cotopaxi. Possibility to horse-ride.

Hotel & Hostel : los precios varían de 20$ a 170$ dependiendo de la cama/ habitación/suites incluyendo desayuno.
Camping : es GRATUITO para iOverlanders durmiendo en su coche pero toma en cuenta que es necesario consumir algo en el restaurante. Por las personnas acampeando en su tienda de campaña el precio es de 5$/pers incluyendo laña por una fogata..
El lugar es simplemente fantástico: grandes vistas sobre volcanes y caminatas muy agradables para observar el hermoso Cotopaxi. Posibilidad de paseo a caballo.

name: Lubricentro LM
description: Lubricentro close to mitad del mundo. Good and fast service & price.

name: Termas comunidad Shuar
description: The termal complex is very nice and so clean. We pay 3,5usd pp for the day. A lot of pools and restaurants. We past the nigth in the big parking area free. Is excelent for big Rv. The people of the indian comunity is very nice.

name: Safe camping at beach
description: right next to some sort of billard cafe. The owner, Pepe, was very nice and let us park next to his place for some voluntary donation. We could use his toilet and get some water as well. He also watched our car while we walked to Frailys beach (ca. 1 h on the beach, accesible before 12 o'clock, when the tide comes. Walkway through the hills available). We gave him 3 dollars per night.

name: Casa Blanca turist complex
description:
Pools cabins camps wifi security... Excelent choice if you travel Manta-Quito or Quito-Manta. 1,5 usd pp + 5 for a Rv. 
Excelnte opcion para pasar un dia y dormir. Piletas, toboganes, baños, duchas, cocina, Wifi, buenos dueños... excelente atencion.

name: Aguas blanca community
description:
coorcinate are from the museo
enrance is 5km from the main road, there is sign and need to pay at the start of the road

This is a native community offering tourism services. Archeological excavation, museum, guided tour, beautiful natural swimming pool. Entrance 5$ p/p. Beautiful and extremely nice people. They are happy to receive overlanders. Bathroom, cold shower, free wifi. I am not sure about power. Quiet, no traffic no through road.

name: Veterinario Cesar Gonzalez
description:
veterinary clinic open also on sundays (9 or 10am). nice and friendly doctor and staff. 
tel 0988727810

name: veterinary
description: in some shop which Wells plastic botels. yellow door. next to blue haus

name: Luis Romero Mecanico Vw
description: Experto Mecanico de Vw

name: paruqe central
description:
We stopped at the main square, stayed two nights, the place is super quiet.


Paramos en la plaza principal, estuvimos dos noches, el lugar es super tranquilo.

name: Automotor VW - Patto Sigcha Mecanico VW
description:
Si tienes cualquier VW Patto Sicha el mejor mecanico de VW de todo Ecuador. Super tecnico, muy profesional, con un muy buen equipo tecnico y sobre todo muy buena persona. Altamente recomendable. Cel +593999901132.

If you have any problem in your VW  Patto Sicha is the better mechanical VW in all Ecuador. Very profesional, very technic, good team and good persons. High recomend.

name: MotorsDealers 4x4
description: Excelent mechanic. Very profesional. The team is excelente and very calificate. The better option in all Ecuador. High recomend for 4x4 and any cars. All service. We repair the exsus "escape".

name: Rio Malo Camping
description: Great spot to camp! This is the parking area for the Rio Malo waterfall. Right next to the river, large and flat with easy access for large or small vehicles. Very quiet at night. We came on a Sunday and were asked at the restaurant/tube rental place on the way in to pay $1pp to park, which seemed legit as other locals paid as well. Waterfall is just a few minutes walk and it is beautiful, plus if you get close, it doubles as a shower :)

name: Administration Park Manglares
description:
Camping in front of Administration. They let us in at night. Nice people.

Bathrooms - incl cold shower in small bathroom block behind admin building.

Very noisy as it's right next to the busy highway (trucks all night).

Park closes at 4.30pm, and gate is locked at around 6pm.

name: Entrance Park Maglares
description: Start of hikes and entrance. Beware an insane amount of mosquitos around

name: Hostal el recreo
description: Nice and cheap hostel great owners. Posibility to camp in a save parking. Storage should also be possible. Big indoor swimmingpool and whirlpool. Doubleroom 10$, Camping 5$. Maria can prepare you a great breakfast if you like. 3$ p/P. 10min walk into town. There are nice restaurants. There are some dogs around here. Not sure if it will be good to bring dogs...

name: petro ecuador
description:
We spent a quiet night. Is open 24 hours and has bathrooms and showers.


pasamos una noche tranquila. esta abierto las 24 horas y tiene baños y ducha.

name: rio muchacho organic farm
description: location isn t quite right but keep going down the road and you will see it

name: Cascada del Amor
description: very nice swim.  We stayed for 2 nights.

name: Ayni Guest House
description: Ayni Guest House is a place in the Amazon Jungle from Ecuador, 1 hour near from Baños. We have a bedroom to share with 4 more people, a camp area and another area to park 5 cars. Our location is 7 minutes from the center of Puyo city, we have an excellent view of Sangay vulcano and one road to the river, clean river. Our service offer you the bathroom,wifi and a kitchento share with the others guests.

name: Pato/Patricio Flores
description: Pato or Patricio Flores is a great mechanic for clutches transmissions “ manual”, and other drive train matters! We had a front bearing go out and were towed here. He and his staff did a great job! Reasonably priced and able to run to get parts. We had to order parts from the US and he knew a guy that had a courier service from the US at the Nissan dealer . We got parts in 10 days. We were able to camp with electric, water, and bathrooms at his garage. Not very clean , but it was great in our situation. We also had some cuts in the sidewalls of our tires repaired. Pato knows a guy with an autoclave. This is a machine that uses heat and pressure to vulcanize “ melt” rubber through the tire. Cost was 50$ each tire. A bargain considering these Michelin’s cost over 1000$ here in Ecuador. Secure safe parking and dog friendly! He has some sweet doggos too.

name: Ayni Napo Guest House
description:
EN - Ayni Napo Guest House is a place in the Amazon Jungle from Ecuador, located 4 hours from Quito and 2 hours from Puyo by car. We have a bedroom to share with 4 persons, a camp area and another area to park 4 cars. Our location is 15 minutes from the center of Tena city, or 10 minutes from the center of Archidona; we also offer tourist information and guides to the river or beautifull places in the jungle. Our service includes a shared bathroom,wifi and a kitchen to share with the others guests.
***************************************
ES- Ayni Napo Guest House es un lugar en la selva amazónica de Ecuador, ubicado a 4 horas de Quito y 2 horas de Puyo en coche. Tenemos una habitación para compartir con 4 personas, una zona de campamento y otra zona para aparcar 4 coches. Nuestra ubicación está a 15 minutos del centro de la ciudad de Tena, o 10 minutos del centro de Archidona; también ofrecemos información turística y guías para el río o lugares bellos en la selva. Nuestro servicio incluye un baño compartido, wifi y una cocina para compartir con los otros huéspedes.

name: Motel - without name :)
description: We found this place after we got stuck here because the people from Hibiscus Sanctuary were on holiday. Very nice motel with clean rooms for 17 USD per night. He would have let us camp at the truck parking lot (for free?) but as we needed a bathroom he said we would have to get a room. So you can either sleep in the room or in your car in the parking in front of the room (height restricted, we just fit with 2.6 m). Friendly owner, fast internet, electricity from the room, fan, cable TV. And a very nice view!!

name: Hostal Canela
description:
It is a hostel with a large parking space, Eduardo his owner is very friendly and helpful. A few blocks from the center of Puyo.


Es un hostal con un gran espacio para parquear, Eduardo su propietario es muy amigable y colaborador. A pocas cuadras del centro de Puyo.

name: Hostal
description: Room is clean. Hot shower, kitchen, wifi. I parked my motorcycle at barcony, here is safety town and there were no problems. Single room without bathroom is 8$.

name: gringo's laundry
description:
very nice laundry and opens on Sunday
Fast service, our clothes were clean and dry in 3hours 4$ for two bags.

name: terma de agua fuente termal y spa
description: Beautiful thermal springs with spa. On Wednesday from 5pm to 11pm there is a 2x1 special for the spa circuit (there are other promotions, look at there website). A bit pricey with 35 dollars but totally worth it. As well there is a 2x1 cocktail happy hour ;-)

name: La Ronda - High clearance parking
description: Parking Garage (multiple levels) 2.50m clearance. Highest we could find.

name: Gardner Hostal
description: Private room with hot shower, cleaned well every day. Upstairs outdoor kitchen/chill out area. Has wifi in common areas. Usually 15pp, we got 27 per night for 2 ppl inc local tax.

name: Mirador Camping
description: Nice place to spend the night away from the road, not completely out of sight as on a natural viewing platform. A bit exposed if windy but fabulous views. A little road leads up towards a hill. You pass a house and we asked the lady for permission to camp. No problem she said. We had two cars coming up in the evening but they were only curious...

name: Petro Ecuador
description:
Very quiet place with lots of space. We requested permission to park and there was no problem. Has free shower.


Lugar muy tranquilo con mucho espacio. Pedimos permiso para estacionar y no hubo problema. tiene ducha gratis.

name: Lavanderia
description: Reliable lavanderia. Clothes ready in three hours. $1/kg. East side of Vilcabamba's plaza.

name: Mi Casa
description: Hot shower, wifi, kitchen, secure parking for moto and small car. Staff are friendly, everywhere are clean. Dormitory is 8$.

name: Mirador Y Parque Al Costado De La Ruta
description:
There is free parking, tables and plugs. It is a park taken care of by the neighbors of opposite of the route but of free access. There is good quality wifi. We stayed one night, there is a stall to eat something if desired and the view is spectacular.


Hay estacionamiento, mesas y enchufes gratuitos. Es un parque cuidado por los vecinos de enfrente de la ruta pero de libre acceso. Hay wifi de buena calidad. Nosotros nos quedamos una noche, hay un puesto para comer algo si se desee y la vista es espectacular.

name: Hostal Oro Verde
description: Clean hostel with restaurant. Room is clean, sraff are friendly. Hot shower, wifi, TV. Parking is opposite empty place, here is countryside and there were no problem on my motorcycle. Single room without bathroom with good breakfast is 15$. Breakfast is hot milk, fruit juce, egg, chicken, bread, rice.

name: Gualaceo
description: along the river, many spot to choose. very friendly locals. safe and free

name: other parking lot on kids park
description: A bunch of spaces on this side of the park, slow free wifi, good restaurants within walking distance, and free! we saw guards walking around as well.

name: San Luis Hotel
description: I arrived to Zumba late and in the rain this place was recommended to me by a guy in Vilcabamba. Large Private rooms with shared bathroom $8, parking a half block away behind a gate with a roof for bikes ($1). Internet is slow but strong signal as they have 3 routers. Hot showers shampoo and soap included, boom.

name: Cruce Fronterizo Lalamor
description:
Fastest way to go to Puru, Ecuador road is almost perfect, not many people.

Comment: At that aduana they stole my tank bag. They was no one there, mr saavedra (the officer here ) was very unfriendly, very annoying, and slow. I left my bag 5mn because he insisted to show me some pictures about his job (dugs, traffic etc... but no pictures of corruption :-)). So be careful, and a bit suspicious and everything will be fine.

name: cascada condor machay
description: we arrived at 4pm. nobody around. we spent peaceful night here. toilets were open when we woke up. nice walks to waterfalls. high recommended. first go to bottom of cascada condor machay. took us 2.5h return with little picnic by waterfall. easy, few bridges to cross, beutifull cascade. another trail took us less then two hours. again some bridges, little leader. in one part there is missing bridge so need to take your shoes off but its not s issue. !!!!!very important: there is a sign after last bridge saying end of trail. but its partly damaged so dont worry and continou for another 300-400m and you will end up on the top of the cliff with waterfall rio pito. amazing view of the whole valley . definitly worth it. $2 to park vehicle. Free to camp.

name: los alpes
description: good hotel for one night, you can negociate the simple room, private bathroom, tv, etc... for 10$ for one person.

name: Rio Upano wild camp
description: Quiet camp off the main road. A roughish track (2WD) leads down to the river from the main road. You can park right beside the very little travelled track or if you have a small, slim 4x4 you can even drive down into the sandy and bouldery riverbed (experinced driver rec.). Nice large river, cooling down in river possible. /// with very small car / bike you can drive over suspension bridge to the other side of river where tent camping is possible.

name: Bush Camp At Dead End Track
description: Gravel spot at end of gravel track. Hidden from road. Level ground for 2 cars. River close by. Secondary jungle vegetation all around. Nothing romantic but quiet, away from traffic. Pitching tents difficult as gravel ground is very hard. /// alternatively there is a good camping possibility 22kms west at a river crossing (old unused road, almost hidden from main road) -2.20142 -78.31728 /// or 35kms west at a lookout tower (close to and visible from road) -2.199695 -78.370953

name: Roaring River Wild Camp
description: Little gassy camp beside roaring river. Visible from road but there is almost no traffic (we saw 3 cars passing within 9hrs.) Foot track from here to some very distant farmhouse, but nobody around. Only camping possibility in this very steep valley.

name: Hidden camp within trees
description: Level sandy spot, shade, hidden from road, view on Cotopaxi, tranquil, access ok with cars but no big rigs (too steep and bumpy), 13kms from Saquisili (thursday market)

name: Car parts & spares shops - great choice
description: Area of town for car spares & parts. if you need something in Quito, you should find it around here!

name: Hidden House Hostel Montañita
description: Really nice hostel on the river with dorms from US$5 or option to camp for US$3. Secure parking area (would fit approx 3 cars and more motorcycles). Has 2 kitchens & the bar sells cheap beer. Great place for chilling during the day in the many hammocks under the trees, and during the night it has a great social and fun atmosphere. Only 3 minute walk from the Center of town. We preferring to stay here as the Center of town can get pretty wild and noisy during the night.

name: cascada de latas
description:
Nice place with waterfalls and balneario natural. 
2$/adult and 0.50$/child. We didn't stay but i suppose it's possible to sleep in the parking.

name: Casa Helbling
description: Excellent hostel near all amenities in central Quito. Parking for one car only. Nicest place in Quito

name: PAE Protecteccion Animal Ecuador
description: Nice and helpful vets. Helps you with your dog passport and other stuff. $16 for consult and deparasitico

name: latencia carrocería
description: Nice guys, quick and honest, did good job

name: A Lavar La Ropa - laundry!
description: Great place FrEE wifi $4.50 for 45lbs of clothes! they have smaller machines for $2.25 dryer is 25 cents per 8 minutes. The lady will activate the machines for you so you just have to pay her.  The instructions on how they would like you to use the machines are in nice drawings on the walls. :)

name: Dog park
description: Our friends have a special place in Parque Carolina too :)

name: Restaurant Rancho Edith
description:
A restaurant along the road with clean toilets and shower. Friendly, some English spoken by Augustin and his wife.
We bought cold juices and a big bag of chifles. The stay was free. Augustin says overlanders are welcome.
Electricity available with about 10 m extension chord. Wifi is good and reaches the parking area.
Close to the road, so some road noise.

name: hostel transilvania
description: Very nice and centrally place, managed by an Israeli man and his wife. Rooms are nice and very clean excellent breakfast. Parking for motorcycles and vehicles in Close and secure place

name: Secohi - MB, Iveco, Man trucks
description: Was sent here by Mercedes office that only sell parts and don't offer mechanic service. Big shop specializing in professional trucks, mostly Mercedes but also Man, Iveco etc. They did a decent job of small smart work on the door locks, ventilation but couldn't help me with everything and as always in Latin America you have to watch them and keep asking the boss to keep things moving. That said, if you have a big MB, Man or Iveco rig, this is probably the most professional place.

name: Water
description: Planta procesadora

name: Baños
description: A hotel. We slept in the parking and at first they did not allow, but we tried and the woman said ok, 10 usd for two people

name: Lago Agrio Parking lot
description: Free parking lot. There are access to many wifi signals but couldn't get any . Maybe if you walk towards the park.

name: G-TWO publicidad
description:
Need any stickers printed or any cool prints for your vehicle ? Javier is your guy! He loves Overlanders even had us parked in front of his house and fed us and let us use his wifi, Internet and shower while we fixed some technical issues 
---
Algúnas calcomanías que le quieras sacar a tu camioneta? Algunas etiquetas que imprimir vengan con Javier que les dará súper buen precio y la mejor atención!

name: Hostal Chasqui
description: Clean room, hot shower, TV, wifi, secure parking, kitchen. Owner Roberto is very kind and friendly. You can use laundry macine. 12$ for single room with bathroom.

name: Quiet spot by playpark
description: ok for a quick night stop on the edge of town. one space on the top of the parking area is flat, otherwise there are some level areas in the nearby streets. free toilets in the playground. Free wifi in the town but very slow. no charge for parking-up

name: Puente Cuyabeno Visitor Center
description:
At this point you can leave your vehicle and take a boat to the river . If you are lucky and get more tourist the boat is $160 and can split the cost with the others. We did this because we have a dog and dogs are not allowed inside the reserve so this would allow for a one day trip through the river to see the pink Dolphins 

We talked to Mr Modesto personally. Unfortunately he is not allowed to do daytrips right now, because the Lodges in the jungle are not fully booked yet and Mr Modesto does not have a license to do official tours. He is hoping though that postCovid times will bring back the business and once the lodges are fully booked again, nobody will say anything against an extra income for the locals. We were lucky, that the rangers managed to phone up an agency in Quito to book us in for an overnight trip to one of the lodges.
It's best to book ahead before you get here as there is neither a WiFi  nor a cellphone connection. Don't know how the rangers managed it. There is a list of all lodges and agencies on the information board at the ranger station. We'll post it here under the photos. We can highly recommend the Tucan  Lodge. Great guides, great food, basic but very clean rooms, ensuite with hot showers. Bring your own pillows though, there's are super high and hard. A 3 nights/4 days trip currently runs between 270 and 300$ per Person. 4 nights/5 days in the Tucan Lodge is 320$ pp including transport from and to Quito by bus.

name: Puente Cuyabeno reserve
description: Very friendly people at the park entrance at a safety place. You can contract a local guide here, I recommend sr. Modesto, very good and friendly guide. We did a one day tour for 120 dollars for two people. Very  good. Also possible to park the car while in the jungle for some days.

name: San lorenzo beach
description:
Lot of space in front of the beach. 
Clean beach

name: Santa Rosa Sports Complex
description: Flat, big rig friendly, FREE WI-FI signal but didn't work while we were there, and the occasional futbol/volleyball pickup game if you are into that. Fairly quiet.

name: Cascales: Kuri Allpa
description:
Acommodation with Cabins, 2 Pools and a huge secured parkground.
We were allowed to camp here in our car, there are several places. We avoided the grassy field because of the tiny black flies during dawn. On the graveled spot behind the pools it was ok for us.
Very friendly!! Marie-Sol, the owner is lovely and a good cook. Simple but savoury food.
We parked our car here while beeing on an tour in the Amazon! 
A new Overlander meeting point!!


Not free camping anymore; $2/pp
we only paid 2$pPpD to use the pools
Guarding the car during our Amazontrip: 2$pD

Facebook:
Complejo Turistico Kuri Allpa

name: Laguna Ozogoche
description:
Parking Lot 400 m from Laguna Ozogoche. It's possible to ride further on but only on motorcycle or bicycle - there are posts on the gravel road and it's impossible to pass them by car. There is a free camping area next to the laguna.
It's part of Sangay Nacional Park.
This spot is only 300 metres from a small community, but people are friendly and nobody bothered us during the night.

name: El Paraiso de Betania
description:
Really nice hotel close to the city centre. Huge parking lot, rooms wih private entrances and garden view. Newly built so everything is superclean. Tasty breakfast included in the price (coffee, fresh juice, fried eggs, fruit salad and pastry with cheese). Free coffee/tea/water all the time. 
We paid $28.50 - 31 and booked it through booking.com Really good quality for this price. The best hotel in SA we've been so far.

name: At the foot of NP
description:
This coordinates lead to the beginning of the gravel road along the river.  We arrived at night and camped here, but we checked what's further up in the morning and we found 3 nice spots by the river. Not really levelled but you'll find a lot of rocks to cope with that. 
There is no traffic as it's a dead-end.
Remember Ecuadorians are early birds and they we're walking on the main road at 6 o'clock. :) on this smaller road no one's there but you...

name: Deep canyon
description: Worth to stop and take a picture! :) There is also a gravel road along the river with nice views and wild camping possibilities.

name: Hola Vida Waterfall
description:
Car park for Hola Vida waterfall which is 1 km away. Free toilets, free cold shower and free overnight stay. Nice and safe!!
Older couple who run the restaurant and take care of toilets are really, really nice. They didn't want any money for using toilet and shower, but we left a  small tip. Highly recommended!!!
We've also seen cabanas by the restaurant, but didn't check the price.

If you want to take a shower in the waterfall go there in the morning -  you'll have swimming pool for yourself.

01-2024: Camping 3 dollars
03-2024: Camping 5 dollars per vehicle

name: Reserva nacional limoncocha
description:
Inside the park, free. It's not official, but they allowed us, with we don't drink and eat inside the park. 
There is a bathroom with a cold shower.

You can contract a local guide there (I think it's a good and cheaper idea), but be careful, we payed one to a two people night tour to see cayman but we did a tour with a lot o people and we didn't see caymans

name: North entrance of Cotopaxi
description: We arrived at 5:30pm and as opening hours of the park are 8-15 we were not allowed to go further. The ranger, Giovanni let us stay behind the gate and was very friendly. Spoke English as well. Night was quiet and toilets are available.

name: Cark Park at 4580 m
description: Here is the highest point you can drive to in Cotopaxi NP. Nice views!

name: Museo San Rafael
description:
Archimedes is an incredible human. The "museum piece" is actually himself! knowledgeable and wise.You can also camp at his house. it has 2-3 beds and there s a wonderful sight from his house/museum. 
Worth the visit.

name: Multiple Wild Camping Options
description: A few check-ins nearby, but this entire area has remote dirt roads throughout. Most lead to either tree farms or a rock quarry. Plenty of options to park either on, or off, the dirt roads. Maps.ME has most labeled as trails. Good view of Cotopaxi and plenty of firewood to be found. Stayed sunday night into Monday morning and saw no one. Be respectful and I'm sure all will be fine. Not recommended for large rigs without strong 4x4 if you go off trail. surrounding grounds are loose dirt and sand.

name: supermarket and cafeteria
description: A decent sized supermarket to stock up on supplies. There are three levels and the top floor is a nice cheap cafe with good coffee and nice food overlooking the harbour.

name: Museo del Sombrero (panama hat)
description:
Awesome place to discover how they fabric the famous Panama hat and buy it. They have a lot of choice (more than the other shop Omero Ortega). You can even ask to custom your hat. Need two days for a customise request.
They also have a nice coffee place with a viewpoint on the city. They offer you a coffee/tea if you buy a hat. Wifi too. At the entrance there is a small museum. 
Monday-friday: 9am-6pm
Saturday: 9h30am-5pm
Sunday: 9h30am-1h30pm

name: Hotel Galo Carillo
description:
The name is wrong but the hotel is down the street. there is an other one 30m up, seems you can park the bikes in the restaurant next door but we didnt try.
this hotel has a garage that put you bike out of sight (it's closed) but it's not lockable.
10$/pers

name: River Dam camping
description: Large, flat, and quiet. There is a large space next to the river for wild camping. A small access point down to the river in which small cars can park next to, but it's safer up top. to access this area, take the road on the right, just before the single lane bridge (driving towards the Peru border). you will pass one small side road to the river, but keep going another few minutes or so for a better spot. small street lamp at night. spoke to the family closest and they said it's safe here and the water is clean. driftwood available for a fire. **WARNING** everyday around 8am the dam is closed to create a small lake up stream. DO NOT camp past the dam.

name: Mercado municipal
description: Awesome And fresh market near Ambato.  Shopping mall across the way and a gas station down the street.

name: Figurin Garden
description: If you missed Tulcan's cementry with its famous shaped trees , this might be another place to take cool pics. Many nice hedge shapes and flowers.

name: Mercado mayorista
description: Public market that is súper cheap near Ambato

name: Opposite community policing
description:
Opposite community policing. Safe area and very quiet at night


frente a la policía comunitaria. zona segura y muy tranquila de noche

name: Il tramonto
description:
This place is not for big Rigs. Altitude max. Ca.2.8m 7,50$ pp. No height limit as of Oct 2020

$3,5pp with shower , toilets , wifi, electricity. Access to communal kitchen and 1 block from the beach. Mosquitos are criminals at night ! Owner Miguel is very nice , this town is recovering from the earthquake

name: Complejo Deportivo el Arenal
description: Very nice place before crossing the border. Very friendly owner. Very quiet. Big pool. 5$pppn. Clean shower and toilets. Also ostrich at the end of the big garden. the front door is closed at Night. Highly recommended.

name: Lavanderia MI MORENA
description:
Laundry.very economical.1.60 dollars the kilo.and with possibilities of other washes.


lavandería al peso.
muy económica.
1.60 dolares el kilo.
y con posibilidades d otros lavados.

name: Beach area
description: We parked behind/in front of the house by the skate park. We asked if it was ok and it was fine. Safe and quiet at night. Great surf.

name: Iglesia del Rocio
description:
Very interesting church cut into the rock- face. Really worth a short stop (and climbing the steps to see inside) if you are passing. Free. 

Not for big rigs!  If other cars here, cannot turn around!

name: Hotel Majestic
description: A simple and clean hotel run by a really nice family. We had a room towards the back as it was quieter. A great location next to the local market and a few blocks away from the centre square. We paid the asking price ($20) which included WIFI, air-con, TV and hot water - the price is more than fair. Secure parking out the back (not big rig friendly). If this hotel doesn't suit you there are plenty more within a few blocks to chose from.

name: Grand Hotel La Mana
description:
A simple and clean hotel run by a really nice family. We had a room towards the back as it was quieter. A great location next to the local market and a few blocks away from the centre square. Asking price was $40 and we paid $25 which was fair. Included WIFI, air-con, TV and hot water. The hotel had secure parking across the street and is big rig friendly.

Note comment that access for bigrigs may not be easy because it is in the centre of town

name: Humberto Vega Mechanico
description: The workshop isn't much to look at but a really good and reasonably priced mechanic recommended by Arie (owner of Arie's Cabins - great place to stay). We had our brake pads changed, back drums cleaned, a full service and spark plugs changed. He also took me to a tyre shop to get a wheel alignment two steering bushes changed. Highly recommended - call 0992705337

name: Professional Tyre Shop
description: Big clean workshop and very professional staff. I had a wheel alignment and two steering bushes changed out. The price was fair and the work was good. They explained everything before doing the work and hoisted the car up and showed me the new bushes once done. Thoroughly recommend.

name: playa garrapatero
description: pretty beach, no facilities apart from  toilets. you can camp here if you get permission from the park range 2 days in advance, worth a visit, lots of wildlife and great scenery.  we had the campsite to ourselves

name: hostal Brattle
description: Cheapest place we could find in town - $25 for 2 people without private bathroom, $30 with. fully equipped kitchen.

name: Puerto Hermano Miguel
description:
Not far off the road. People are not used to seeing tourists here so look very interested in us as we drive past, which was a little off putting firstly. 

It is a ferry port across the river to what I could make out (my spanish is a little rough) was a small town for petroleos. The ferry guys very friendly. A private house acoss the way with younger workers. All friendly and have no problem with us staying here.

There is a small toilet block. Looks unused for a while and we didn't use it. 
Rio Napo is beautiful as the sun sets and the guys on the feery invited us over to conversar. Great spot. We parked on the grass. Perfect fallen tree fork for hammocks.

name: Coca Zoo - free entry
description:
A muncipalidad zoo that doesnt charge an entry fee. Well set up with a variety of different animals that are well looked after. 
There are many different monkeys, ocelots, tapir, many different species of birds, boa snakes and more.
Clean toilets and cold water shower, could possibly camp in the parking area overnight. 
Definitely reccomend to visit!

name: hostel Cordillera de los andes
description: nice hostel, very nice owner, for 7$/night for simple room for one person,  great shower, you can pack motobikes or car in the parking 100metres from the hostel for 2$(motobike ).

name: Electrotito- electricidad Automotriz
description: Ask for Tito, he's the man. he'll fix you right up, super knowledgeable on all electronics but specializing in VWs. he has his own german 78 kombi and brasilia. Funny guy, speaks a little English but you'll figure it out. also friends with pato sigcha, so you can ask him as well.

name: E35 Gravelpit Free Camp
description: Looks like a gravelpit though. Not complete invisible from the mainroad, but far enough to experience a bit of privacy.  Easy access for all rigs. Quiet at night. Some children brought us mango's, happy to have us there.

name: Nuevo Paraiso Free Camp
description: Large flat gravel area to park your rig near the little settlement. We tried to find a river spot, but went for the jungle-feel. We stayed one day and two nights. Quiet and peacefull. You will be welcomed by the local schoolteacher Moises and his wife Fanny. They love to have you there. Moises is also the owner of the area. The last 15 km. of the road is gravel, a bit narrow at some places for two cars, condition is good. No problem when it's wett. Easy access for al rigs.

name: Carachupa Pakcha Free Camp
description: Just near the entrance to the little waterfall under the shady tree (when you are not too high). Quiet night. At night the gate is closed with a big iron door. 2,5 km to the waterfall (not that interesting) parking by easy gravelroad. From parking 5 minute walk to the fall. There you pay the fee. $ 2 per person.

name: cascadas las conchas
description:
Nice waterfall and area for swimming. $1 entry pp. 
Has a camping area. We were allowed to camp in our truck overnight in the shaded parking area.
Very tranquillo no other visitors on a weekday.

name: entrance to cascadas los conchas
description: This is the point where the road starts to the waterfalls. Dirt track easy to drive, possible in 2wd. Follow the signs from here on to the waterfall.

name: Killa Wasi Campspot
description:
Added another entry to show this is a great camp-ground/park-up spot & not just a hostel. We loved it here & parked-up for a few days. Beautiful location, friendly owner; bilingual folks (English/Spanish). Very strong wifi.

The place has excellent  facilities (well equipped kitchen including a real wood-fired pizza oven) great hot shower. A short walk into town. Rooms for a reasonable price, big-rig in the garden, but if you are really big there is a nice space to park-up just outside the gate. Route down from the road is a bit narrow but most big-rigs should get through with a bit of care, follow the signs. $5pppn.

Electricity is 110V only.

name: montañita surf camp
description:
Is a hostel facing the sea with good services for the guest we have rooms with private bathroom and hot water and air conditioning WiFi Tv area and kitchen 24 hour security laundry service and all the tourist information and all the good vibes for you to enjoy our Place and we are located 3 blocks from the center of town 7 minutes walking


es un hostel frente al mar con buenos servicios para el huésped tenemos habitaciones con baño privado y agua caliente y aire acondicionado WiFi area de Tv y cocina seguridad 24 horas servicio de lavandería y toda la información turística y toda la buena vibra para que disfrutes de nuestro lugar y estamos ubicados a 3 cuadras del centro del pueblo 7 minutos caminando

name: Montañita Surf Camp
description:
Excellent, very quiet, Charley the owner very friendly and always ready to solve everything VERY RECOMMENDABLE !!! 
.....
excelente muy tranquilo a pasos de montañita Charly el dueño muy amable y siempre dispuesto a solucionar todo MUY RECOMENDABLE!!!

name: Balneario Archidona
description: safe and cute quiet place by the river to sleep

name: Tecnimoto
description: motorcycle mechanic for big bikes. head mechanic is Carlos, who has ridden to Alaska himself on a BMW R80/7. Was incredibly helpful and friendly. An excellent resource for any moto overlander!

name: PRIMAX
description:
Just a gas station where they allowed us to sleep. 

Toilets available.

name: Sarita
description: great place, 3 mins from the town centre close to beaches and the port. really friendly owner. small kitchenette in room to cook basic foods. low season we paid $25 for 2 people as we stayed several nights, it's $30 if you only stay 1 or 2 nights

name: Rondador Cotopaxi
description:
Nice little hostel on side of the road, with great views of Cotopaxi. Price is $3 per person to camp in our van (no hookups). Shower $1 pp.
We were able to take hot showers, use bathrooms, fast internet and sit at the fire place. Very friendly family. They offer food in the restaurant. If you ask nicely, they might let you cook if it's not busy.

name: Balneário in Loreto
description: The best place to spend some time in the amazon, friendly people! Infrastructure near the river! Safe, quiet at night, beautiful!

name: La Esquina (Cuenca)
description:
A nice place "chic and cozy", pricey but tasty.
We order Argentinian meat : 2 bifes de chorizo for 36$. We didn't try "disco de arado" but it looks like very good; it is like a paella dish with many kind of food inside and cost about 35 to 50$ for two.

name: Estacionamiento en Cancha de Fútbol.
description:
Huge parking area, it's a football pitch transformed into parking area. Next door is the police. Safe and quiet. Only CNT signal.

Enorme aparcamiento, es un campo de fútbol transformado en parking.Justo al lado esta la policía. Seguro y tranquilo. Solo hay señal CNT.

name: otra entrada al pailon del diablo
description:
This is another entrance to the devil's pylon, but for me the other entrance is much more interesting, because it can not reach the bottom of the waterfall.


esta es otra entrada al pilón del diablo, pero para mi la otra entrada es mucho mas interesante, por esta no se puede llegar al fondo d la cascada.

name: entrada pailon
description:
Quiet and great place to spend the night and fish for trout! Shops and bathrooms nearby


Lugar tranquilo y grande para pasar la noche y pescar truchas! tiendas y baños cerca

name: Mercado 9 de Octubre
description: Very nice covered market where you can eat for cheap.

name: Quarry River Camp
description:
Beautiful spot, far from view of the road. No road noise. Has a spot for a camp fire. No mosquitos and lots of birds.
There is a small dirt road. Follow 20m to a cleared section of quarry. As you enter, turn left to the river.

name: Playa Rio Soloya
description:
Nice little village. There is a big soccer field with a spot to park by the river. Perfect clear water swimming hole and walking tracks around. 
Unfortunately we didnt get to stay as we had to keep moving but would be nice. Locals walking cows or riding donkeys. Friendly waves as we passed. Kids playing by the river.

name: Posada Ingapirca
description:
We asked, in this nice posada, if they accept that we camp with our car in their garden : they agree with a charge of 15$, using toilets and saloons. It is pricey but this place is so pleasant...
Not sure that they will accept in high season. 
The ground is slightly slope, so maybe it wouldn't be useful for big rigs. 
Breakfast : 5$ for each of us
Restaurant : about 10$ per dish
If you like to use hotel :
Double room : 40$ because low season; 100$ on high season. 
Enjoy.

name: Colibri Aeropuerto
description:
Contact us Whatsapp : +593960616606

Parking area, accommodation, laundry service, tours around Quito, transfer service 24/7 , food, and bilingual staff. Pool and warm jacuzzi, nice view. 
Nice garden, shower and kitchen, wifi. $1 per night If you leave the camper in the property, or $5 each people per night If you stay here with your camper. Possibility storage campers. Owners speak Spanish and English. Come and enjoy with us the Family Colibrí ! You will feel at home!

name: Rock Face Bluff
description: Follow the service road past the light house down a short rough dirt road to 3 different sized level landing pads. 4x4 recommended. Some fishermen came at dusk to walk the beach with nets. There was some garbage but we cleaned it up, hope it's still clean for the next camper! Beautiful beach, possible surf with the right swell.

name: Power Lines Access Road
description: Dirt access road off the highway. Unlocked gate up 50m. Shut it when you cross through. The local farmer has animals he doesn't want on the highway. Drive another 75m to a hidden level area. Little road traffic noise at night. Great view!

name: Taller Mecanico de Camiones "Edgar"
description: This is a mechanic for trucks and big rigs. Owner "Edgar" maintaines and fixes all the local buses and trucks. The place doesn't look very clean and organized, but Edgar is very knowledgeable. We had a brake problem with our 25k pound truck and Edgar fixed it for just 10 USD and 3 hours of work.

name: La Compania pub/bar
description:
Really great beers and 6 different kind of beers
•extra golden
• amber ale
• red ale
• stout negra (my favorite)
• brown ale
• stout nitro

5.5$ L
2.75$ 1/2L

Many traditional cocktails and special cocktail with beer.

Food is quite expensive! Didn’t try. Better to eat somewhere else if you’re on a budget but this place is excellent if you like cervezas

name: Car Awnings (Toldos)
description:
Anthony and his cousin Santiago custom make car awnings (toldos) in Quito, Ecuador.  They don't have a storefront as they make them at home and sell on MercadoLibre.  

We paid $160USD for a 2m x 2m awning custom made.  Takes around 3 days to make.  We paid a 50% deposit initially and once completed paid the remaining amount.  You can choose your colour and also get 2m x 1.5m if you'd prefer.

Anthony's number is +593 98758 7911, give him a call or message him on whatsapp.

name: Iveco truck Comreivic
description:
The employees are friendly, but incompetent and the management is mafia. Run away
Fuyez a tout prix

name: Hostal La Posada Colonial
description:
In the heart of the historical center, this hostel is cheap, clean and with a really friendly and helpful staff. 
We choose a double room with shared bathroom for 20$; breakfast is  correct (coffee, milk, french croissant, butter, jam, fruit and eggs) for 2,5$); no breakfast on sunday. 
There is a small parking lot for 2 cars but clearance lower than 2,20 m. 
Our room (Nbr 5) was very quiet but it was necessary to go out of the room to get wi-fi, a nice saloon is close to the room. 
The owner accepted to keep our car in the parking lot during our stay in Galapagos (2$ per day). 
Family of owners offers also to drive you by car to the airport for 25$ to go and 30$ to pick you back (from Quito airport to the hostal).

name: Bus station
description:
Here you catch the bus to Puerto Ayora when coming from Baltra airport : 2$/pers. 
1. Bus from airport to the boat : free (8 minutes)
2. Boat to cross the canal of Itabaca : 1$/pers (5 minutes)
3. Bus to Pto Ayora : 2$/pers (40 km) 45 minutes. 
4. Taxi from bus station to waterfront: $1.50 per car. 5 minutes.

name: Recinto Pueble Nuevo - Riverside
description: Beautiful place to spend one day, with the river, calm and safe, we spend one day and take shower in river, very good!! Free

name: Beach
description: Calm place, without noise, really nice to spend one night or the day!

name: Next the beach
description:
1 mtr from the beach on a flat parking
restaurants nearby

name: TODOTERRENO
description:
True specialist of 4x4. Very efficient mechanic service at affordable price. can provide any type of required additional equipment. 
participate the dakar rally. the team knows very well toyota 4x4 but we went there with a mitsubishi and everything was ok.
has a trailer and can RESCUE in case of breakdown.
TODOTERRENO leads a "club" of mecanical owning and practicing 4x4: this club of amigos can rescue in any place of Ecuador. 
Tel 593 2 510 11 76
pericareno@gmail.com

name: Tsatsayaku, fabrica de chocolate
description:
Factory of natural chocolate without sugar. Chocolate Amazon.you can do a tour to know the manufacture of the same.Also at harvest time(feb-jul) you can help them and know the process and stay in different communities.


Fábrica de chocolate natural sin azúcar.
Chocolate amazónico.
puedes hacer un tour para conocer la fabricación del mismo.
También en época de cosecha puedes ayudarlos y conocer el proceso y quedarte en las diferentes comunidades.

name: Galapagos Native
description:
We spent the first night in Brattle Hostel for 40$ by Booking : it was a mistake. 
The day after we found this hotel (a real one) much more comfortable with breakfast, free bananas all days, filtered water...a brand new room with 30 m2; just a few dollars more. 
In French : "Pas photo, nous avons déménagé à l'instant même..."
Probably we could enjoy the price of low season.
Via Booking low season doesn't exist ?...

name: Floreana Island, Galapagos
description:
A nice island without too much tourists;  you can see free sea lions, sea turtles and earth turtles. 
Two hours by boat from Puerto Ayora. 
We paid 100$ per person for an excursion but we should have come by ourselves, just paying the boat transfers. It is possible to sleep in the island (there are also restaurants) and go back the next day to Santa Cruz.

name: Street restaurants with lobsters
description:
A good fresh grilled lobster for $15-25. 
A big red fish for $15-25. 
An interesting place to eat, cheaper than restaurants around. Lobsters and grilled big fish From 6:00 pm
During the day you can have a complete lunch for 4$ (soup, meat or fish with rice, juice); a bottle of beer (500 ml) : 4$....

name: Tortuga Bay
description:
A nice beach in a pretty creek. 50 minutes walking from Puerto Ayora. 
Arriving in the Brava Beach you can see iguanas in the sand and in the middle of mangroves. 
After Brava Beach (dangerous to swimm) there is Mansa Beach a good place for swimming and snorkling with possibility to rent kayak.

name: Mr. Otero Radiadores
description:
Specialist in repair and replacement of radiators. They work well and fast. recommended


Especialista en reparacion y cambio de radiadores. trabajan bien y rapido. recomendado

name: Marcos Sarmiento Diesel
description:
Specialist in diesel. We were failing to light up and regulated very poorly. Regulate the injection pump and improve the sound of the engine. And I get better in cold. Fair price.


Especialista en diesel. nos estaba fallando para encender en altura y regulaba muy mal. regulo la bomba de inyeccion y mejoro el sonido del motor. y arranco mejor en frio. precio justo.

name: Termas El Salado
description: Average thermals.  $3pp. Open until 8pm. Swimming cap is compulsory - buy one for $1 there.

name: Parking lot next to the police station
description: After a long day (crossing the border took us 6 hours) we parked next to the police station.

name: Sol y Mar Hosteria
description:
Really quiet and lovely place, 17 rooms, with AC or not, clean, bathroom with cold shower, wifi. Bar, swimming pool, hammock, outside table, garage. We paid 20$ (starting price at 30$) for a room without AC, with 3 beds. 

The owner have a big space behind the hotel where Overland can park. But we don't know the price... There is one tap water. 

email: solymarsanjacinto@gmail.com

name: El Muro de las Lagrimas
description:
A nice hike from Puerto Villamil to here : about 2,5 hours taking your time and seeing iguanas, turtles, birds, beaches and mangrove. 5km each way.  There are toilets at the start of the trail but nothing else. 

Take a heap of water (we drank a full 2l each, and froze our bottles before we left so it kept nice and cool). It can be very exposed on the trail.

name: Hotel Marquez
description: $25 private room with two beds for two people. Clean and friendly staff. Secure parking for motorcycles and bigger vehicles. Blazing fast wifi. Close to town center.

name: Hostal Neptuno
description:
We booked 3 nights in this hostal by Booking for 40$ but when we arrived the owner charged us 14% more for "IVA"...
So definitive price for a double is 46$ without breakfast, slow wi-cfi and with a mandatory check out at 08:30 am !...
Hotel is not bad but for the same price we could have find some better accommodation in the island. 
That's what we did in Puerto Ayora (45$ for a brand new 30m2 double room, with breakfast, bananas free, TV...)
Don't book by Booking; search by yourselves when you arrive in the island. There are dozens of empty hotels in Puerto Villamil just waiting for clients.....at least on the season we stay here : Christmas.

name: Hotel Northia
description:
Got a double with bathroom, AC, balcony, common kitchen... for 30$ including taxes. 
Near airport and near harbour. 
Inconvenients : no hot water and the street is noisy.

name: Complejo Turistico El Progr
description:
It's called: El progresso
1$ the entrance, for 3 swimming pool, 2 waterslide, hammock, children playground, etc. The establishment is quite old and not really well maintained, but the manager (the husband) is such a nice guy!! It's maybe our best memories of Ecuador, the kindness of this family. 
He understands what is it to welcome foreigners! 
We pitch our tent near the hammock, under the roof. We gave him 5$. I'm sure Overland can come here to park, there is enough space, even for big rigs.
You can buy beer or even ask for a meal.
The complex is open all the week. Close around 7-8pm. Busy during the weekend and holidays.

name: Arupos  Hotel
description: Nice hotel just off the town square. Inside secure parking and decent internet. Seems to be only two hotels in town. $12 a night per person.

name: Supermarket Mega Bodega
description: An average supermarket with all you need! Good prices.

name: Tijeretas
description:
A magnificient point of view and "tijeretas" birds. 
Just 30 minutes walking from downtown. 
We also got a sea tour of the bay with a taxi-boat for 10$/person (40 minutes).

name: Restaurante El Cheff in Mindo
description:
Good meat in this place. 
Try "lomo a la piedra" for 9.50$ : a big piece of beef cooking on a hot stone, served with fried potatoes and vegetables. 
Natural fruit juices for 1,50$

name: Hotel El Descanso
description:
This hotel is the paradise of colibris. 
The whole day birds are coming on the watering troughs hanging in the trees and you can see dozen of species of colibris flying at one meter of you. 
We spent two nights in a room with view towards this magnificent exotic garden : 40$ for a double with private bathroom and complete breakfast. Normal price is 45$. 
Our car was parked in the garden. WiFi was good; we could upload photos and videos on our website. 
If you don't want to sleep in the hotel you can visit the garden and see the birds for 4$ per person. 
An unforgettable experience.

name: Hostal Santa Fe
description:
There are 2 hostals Santa Fe in the city. This one offers a parking lot for our car, but access is very narrow. 
We paid 30$ for a double with breakfast and garage (but they wanted 35$). 
Very clean place. 
Highly recommended. 
-------
For French travelers : le Guide du Routard annonce 16$ pour une chambre double, c'est une grossière erreur qui mérite d'être corrigée. Le prix de 35$ demandé est largement justifié.

name: Mishqui Quinde
description: Vegan/Vegetarian restaurant. Has amazing dishes, e.g. quinoa burgers and Chop Suey. Has a nice little terrace. Variety of artesenal beer available (awesome!)

name: Bosch Baterías
description: Bosch batteries shop

name: Tu parada en Cuenca
description:
Nice place with a family with a huge private secure parking lot. You can see the sign easily above the gate. They normally rent out with airbnb.

Own private room on the first floor and own bathroom downstairs. Good wifi and you can use the kitchen.

CAMPING IN THE GARAGE, $6 per person you can use the kitchen, the shower, wifi. You give bath towel is excellent and safe

We initially wanted to stay at Mi Casa but found this place. Very warm and lovely family. Great with helping you out in the city and good to practice your Spanish.

$12 per person including breakfast
+593999551028 whatsapp

the entry gate is:
hight 3.45m
width 5m

name: Canopy Adventure
description: Always wanted to go ziplining, but not sure if it is for you? For $20 you can enjoy 10 very tame zip lines in the jungle here.  Safety is impeccable (they have a two-line system) and the guides are a lot of fun.  If you are 'adventurous' you can hang upside down on the lines and do other fun things.  We liked it.  Take about an hour. Try to buy the tickets online, as it is cheaper for Ecuadorians ($14 pp) and you might be able to score a cheaper ticket this way?

name: Casa Hotel Campanario
description: Informal hostel. Owners are slowly renovating their house to include a hostel.  $3.50 per person with hot shower and a spot to park motorcycles or cars. We got a room with matress, sheets, and blankets. No bed. Clean environment. *room is now $5 but the mattress is on a frame!* phone number to call if no one is home: 0995689407

name: Prosmile Dentist
description:
Wonderful, sanity-saving dentist in Ecuador.   I had not one but two (yes two!) root canals here.   Dra. Maria Flores speaks impeccable English, and was a comforting force during a stressful time for us.  The practice is popular with medical tourists from the USA and Canada, and their equipment is someone the best in the world.  They have specialists for almost everything (Dr Mora did my root canals, Dr Flores did my reconstruction).  Best of all, it's cheap - way cheaper then most places.  My root canals were $380us each, and this practice charges higher then most.  I was quoted $200 at another dentist, but wanted someone who spoke English (and it turns out they had diagnosed the wrong tooth!). A root canal in Australia will set you back $2500usd, minimum! Ouch.   

Located in Torre 3,level 5. On the right as you exit the elevator.  There is parking 2.5m high under Torre 2,or other open lots scattered around.

name: Indichuris Mirador
description: View Point across the Jungle. Comedor and Cabañas. Large gravel parking lot. Overnight stay for free. Quite and safe. Free parrots and other animals. Trees and flowers are beautiful. Worth to visit. Road to the mirador is all paved. Easy going also for big rigs.

name: clinica de motos
description: motorcycle workshop that works on big and small bikes, friendly and helpful staff, no English, fitted my tyres and welded pannier frame on my Vstrom. recommended by euromoto where I bought the tyres from (K60 scouts) which is was about 20mins away in traffic.

name: Zayapa Son Bar
description:
Cozy place with a nice view and cool decoration.
They have good offers - ex. lunch for $5 + taxes, and dinner for S12+takes. It´s possible to ask for different menus ie. vegetarian, vegan, gluten free etc.
They also have a nice bar. 

It´s very near the fish market and the Tortuga monument.

name: Hernancor
description: Big and clean rooms. $30 for two people. A/C, WiFI, hot shower, Parking (motorcycles), and breakfasts.

name: hotel malecon inn
description: good hotel with parking in the same multi level building, the 4th floor is reserved for the hotel parking, $30 per night with breakfast for one person

name: Auto Centro - Land Rover Parts
description: Land Rover Parts Shop. They have almost everything! Coming from North America and being used to ordering every single part we felt like we just landed in Land Rover paradise with this shop!

name: Service Road. Cangahua
description: End of a service road.  Take the road marked with two wooden poles.  It isn't far down to the river, and there is an open flat spot.  Super private.

name: Teleferico Parking Lot
description: This is the parking lot of the teleferico cable car. We paid $ 2,50 parking fee and were allowed to stay overnight. We spoke to the security and the place is safe.

name: Petroecuador
description: Gasstation, quiet, safe......................

name: Museo Pumapungo
description: Great free ethnological museum and ruins of old city + beautiful park. Recreations of how previous generations lived, old currency etc

name: El Refgio Hotel Turismo
description: Cheap hostel. Single room with bathroom is 10$. Motorcycle can put inside.

name: Museo catedral vieja
description: The best $2 spent. Fascinating church interior with life sized "Last supper" at the altar and many side rooms. Beautiful wall paintings

name: Carolina bookstore
description: English & other 2nd hand books bought and sold

description: We stop here and ask the owner Rolando and he said it's ok to sleep here!! Also he Offers  the showers they have mini market and is a restaurant across the street!!

name: Great Mechanic! Trunkin'Car
description:
Best mechanic we have found in South America (Peru, Bolivia, Chile)! After having been to several well know mechanics on our trip, Mauro an his team were the first ones who were able to make our car running under South American conditions. They found several grave problems which well known mecanics as e.g. Fire Wheels Lima did not find during one week of work! While they were working they explained everything they did, so that we now know a lot more about our car and we were able to understand the problems our car had. 
After over 30 years working as an international mechanic, Mauro has a lot of experience. And if he doesn't have a part or needs the help of another specialist he doesn't hesitat to do his best!
When we left the garage we had a competely new car!!!
Prices were very fair. And Mauro offered us to stay in his garage (electricity, baños, shower, wifi) while they were working on our car. Or you can stay on the campground directly besides his garage.
Heres the mobile phone number: +593 99-967-4518 (spanish or you write an english text message/whatsapp)
Calle Canton Gualaceo, Cuenca

name: Sucré Salé Café
description: a nice little french themed café in the heart of Cuenca. awesome deserts and inexpensive menú del día ($3.50) they also serve a microbrewery beer called latitude cero and for those Germans who are looking for a little bit of home you can also buy Paulaner in a few varieties.

Puesto de gasolina grande, se puede dormir, hay ducha electricidad y la gente es muuuyyy agradable.

name: Parking place to do paperwork for crossing from Ecuador to Colombia
description:
Park here or just across the road. Go to building on left of road. At counter on left (outside) (Aduana) get vehicle document sorted. Join queue for migration just beyond. Eventually get allowed to join queue inside.  Hand over passports & bit of paper received on entry to Ecuador. Get passports stamped. Proceed just down the road to Colombian side. Go into migration building straight ahead, up steps. Queue to get passport stamped, (only one person allowed at counter at a time) get guard to unlock gate to let you through to Dian (vehicle import). Ensure have vehicle with you beside Dian office, copy of passport photo page & copy of page with stamps for entry into Colombia. Also copy of international driving licence & copy of vehicle registration document (can get copies across the road for 50 cents a page).  Process from start to finish took 2 hrs aprox

DO NOT BUY SOAT here in the limit !! Buy it in the city IPIALES in Supermercado Exito o beside by Julio Andrew Lopez Revel

If you ask nicely, possibility to camp next door

If you're like us and didn't want to pay the $$ to summit the glacier, you can follow a sendero to the base of it to get a little hiking in. Refuge is at 15,100ft so it's COLD.

name: Immigration and Customs Ecuador and Colombia
description:
Ecuador to Colombia.
1) Exit Ecuador was straightforward, 10 min. 
2) Colombia immigration went smoothly, 5 min. but you need your CheckMig. Do this online before getting to the border. There is no/poor internet at the border.
3) Customs took 45 min. Apart from copies of passports, vehicle ownership documents etc. The VIN was recorded by putting carbon on the plate with the number and using tape to get an imprint.
4) An insurance was not sold at the border. We had no problem entering Colombia without a valid SOAT. As recommended by the Colombian Customs officer we bought one in Hormiga (took 3.5 hours). COP 188,000 for 2 months.

Colombia to Ecuador.

0) Contact Hans a week before to get on the tourist list if you want to be sure to stay the maximum of 90 days during the state of emergency: +593 93 937 1170
1) Cancel TIP at DIAN, done in 5 minutes.
2) Get Exit stamp for Colombia, no Checkmig needed.
3) Go to Ecuadorian health check with covid test or proof of vaccination. You can fill out a form online, google 'formulario salud viajero ecuador', but they didn't ask.
4) Get entry stamps for Ecuador.
5) Go to Ecuadorian aduana to get new TIP. This can take a while depending on traffic.
6) No Insurance required and or sold for Ecuador.

Some money can be changed at the little print and snack shop in the building, but most money changers are waiting for you on the bridge (the actual border, 3km from the customs building).

Colombian aduana works 8-12 and 13-17.
Ecuador aduana works 8-18 not sure on the lunch break.

DOGS/Pets
Colombia -> Ecuador. I would highly advice AGAINST following the rules for pets. The problem is to exit Colombia, you need an official ICA SISPAP registration. Nobody cares on the Ecuadorian side. The Ecuadorian aduana saw our dog and didn't say anything. Even the Colombian ICA lady said it's better to just drive instead of going through the process. I put the offical process in the comments below on 15/02/2023.

Please update for Ecuador -> Colombia. As far as we know, you need ICA paperwork if you want to exit Colombia by flight.

name: Le Bistro

They allowed us to camp on their parking lot - not sure if it was an exception or if they would welcome more overlanders - just ask!

Each cabana has a bano privado, a kitchenette with utensils, hotplate and microwave (no refrig though), tv and A/C. All for $20/night as a solo motorcylist. No restaurant on site but they do sell soft drinks and beer. Patio with view, swimming pool and wading pool with slide for kids. Gated parking for motos and smaller rv's. Height limit for larger overlanders.

Owner is Pedro, concierge 'go-to-guy' who does everything is Eduardo.

Simple and clean hotel.
Garage in the basement.

name: Crater Rimp

name: Parque Samanes
description: Enormous park where tou can camp for free. Best free spot in Guayaquil assuming there isn't a big event going on at the park. Wifi is hit or miss. You must register in the office with your passport to get permission to sleep here or you will have to leave when they close.

name: Sobre Ruedas - Tyres, brakes, etc
description:
Last thing ioverlander needs in Quito is another mechanic (lol!) but we found few listings for tyres and breaks.  This place will work on most models, and we were able to do our brake pads on our 4runner for a really reasonable price ($70 for front pads - best quality we could get, $40 for the back, $30 to machine the rotors and $25 for some pins to replace the ones we'd shaken out of our calipers on the rough roads).   This shop didn't mind if we wanted to bring our own parts, and there are a heap of shops nearby if you prefer to do so.   Best part is that several guys speak great English, so you can understand exactly what's going on and watch whilst they work.  

They also have WiFi while you wait.

name: Dentist - Odonto Advanced
description: Free Teeth Cleaning!  Stop by any of the Super Maxi supermercados first and get one of their free membership cards.  Super Maxi has partnerships with some dental offices for free services.  Our two cleanings (prophylaxis) were completely free after we presented our Super Maxi cards.  Other discounts on attached picture.

name: Casa de Luis
description: Smaller hotel with private rooms for small groups or couples. You pay per person, so even though we had three beds in our room we only paid $30 ($15 each).  This place has a kitchen for guests (stove, microwave and basic cutlery/crockery), WiFi, air con, and a cheap restaurant downstairs serving local Ecuadorian-style meals.  Showers have the potential to be hot (electric heads) but were turned off when we were here because of the hot weather. Breakfast not included, but they put out some free bread and drinking water in the kitchen each day.

name: Isla Espanola
description:
It's possible to daytrip here from San Cristobal, three times per week.  We paid $180pp, and this included a brilliant snorkel in themal waters (30±m visibility. Very clear), and a few hours on the island. 

Three types of boobies can be seen, and they call it the 'albatross airport' as up to 25,000 mate and nest here (April is when they arrive). It's the entire population of this species of Albatross. 

Many say Espanola is their favourite island on the galapagos and its not hard to see why.  

Each boat gets an alloted 'timeslot' on the island, so whether you are on a multi-day cruise or a daytrip, your experience will be the same - only one group can be on the island at a time (for us this meant just 8 people... Amazing!). It's exceptionally well preserved.

name: Diving Seymour Norte and Mosquera
description:
Not a qualified diver? This is the place for you! A wonderful dive location off Santa Cruz.  In April we had warm clear water, with 20m visibility. Easy currents. 

This is one of the few places you can do 'discovery diving' (untrained) in the galapagos.  You don't get exactly the same experience, as you are more restricted in moving around, and you have to do a training dive first so you only get one good go on the water (professionals get two full dives).  That said, Discovery divers on our boat saw hammerhead sharks - so you really don't miss out. 

We are trained divers, so we got 2 amazing dives at 20m depth, and saw lots of hammerhead sharks (wow!), white tip sharks, schools of mantas and a million fish.  

We went with 'galapagos people' (several agents in town book them) and they were OK. Nothing extraordinary, but we dived, felt safe and were fed.  We paid $160 each. Bring a usb drive and you get all photos from the day for free. 

It's amazing! Do it!

name: La Loberia (free to visit)
description:
Sea lion beach. Free to visit. We came in the morning and didn't have many sea lions (they go out to eat), but we had at least 5 giant sea turtles swimming in the shallows with us for an hour. 

Bring your own snorkel gear. It's a 30 minute walk from town (free) or $2 each way in a taxi.

name: Hostal Flamencos
description:
Not much to look at from the outside, but this little place on the corner (directly adjacent to the flamingo pond) had everything you need in a room. Air con, WiFi (slow), cold showers, and a fridge in the room (I got an electric shock off it, so be careful!).  $30 per night for two people. A well-stocked supermarket is a few doors up,but this place doesn't offer a kitchen so you need your own cooking equipment. 

A Tip for those looking for a place to stay on arrival (like us): we were told by a local that this street, 16 de marzo, offers cheaper accommodation once you get a few blocks off the beach.  Although we only saw Las flamencos. Most of the places we checked out on the main street (parallel to the beach) were about $60 per night for a couple.   This street also seemed to have cheaper food at night ($8 for a menu del dia).

name: Tortoise Breeding Centre
description:
$10pp including mandatory guide. Lots of different species of tortoises, and of course lots of babies.  Easy to reach on bike or on foot. Another 250m along the road will take you to another flamingo pond as well.  Toilets and a little store is on site. Plus free water to fill your bottles. 

You can take either the road or the boardwalk from the iguana crossing to get here.

name: Concha de Perla
description: A free snorkelling site. Wildlife seems to change depending on the tides, but people have seen mantas, sharks, sea lions and even penguins here.   The white sandy beach adjacent to the pier is also an excellent spot for swimming with sea lions.

name: lighthouse parking lot
description: Big and flat parking lot of the lighthouse and lifeguards overlooking the ocean and the village. Very quiet at night. Super nice to look at all the fishermen coming back at night on the beach below. Miguel, the owner of the nearby Comida (Cabaña Miguelito) is very friendly and serves very nice Almuercos and ceviche. Shower and Baños for 50 cts.

name: Terminal AC
description: They repaired our AC and did't a great job

name: Aduana Del Ecuador SENAE
description: To extend TIP (vehicle permit extension).

name: Hostel Casa Del Lago
description: Very nice eco friendly hostel only 3 blocks away from the pier and main streets in town. Quiet and comfortable. Elena the owner is super nice and accommodating. Check the website for the room rates. We had a lovely stay for 3 days. Good tasty breakfast included.

name: Pitstop Racing
description: Johnathan has great English and used to work/live in the UK. No getting gringo'd here, he charges around $5-10 an hour and knows his stuff! Also has DIAGNOSTICS to plug into any bmw, Harley, triumph, Kawasaki, Ktm, maybe more. Was a wonder on a persistent electrical gremlin on my g650x, and very friendly. Can't recommend enough! Tyres also available nearby but better prices in Colombia.

name: Charles Darwin Centre
description:
Tortoise breeding Centre. Free to visit. Personally we thought the tortoise viewing areas were better at the breeding centre on Isla Isabela, but this Centre provides more information about the conservation of not just tortoises, but all wildlife in the galapagos.  It was the only place that we got to see the yellow land iguana.  They also have Lonesome George - the world's last Pinta tortoise - on display (he died in 2012, so it's just his embalmed body now). 

If you want to camp out at Garrapatero beach this is also the place to ask permission from the national parks service (unfortunately we couldn't, due to wild weather that had wiped out the camping area). 

Bring your snorkel - we took a dip at the Playa Estacion over here and swam with baby galapagos sharks, spotted Eagle rays, a swarm of golden rays, marine iguanas and plenty of stingrays digging in the sandy bottom... Go to your far left as you enter the water (for rays) and then go straight out to the mouth of the bay (for sharks).  We went twice in the afternoon. Really lovely, and free!

name: Las Grietas
description:
A free snorkelling site. Take a water taxi to the hotel finch dock ($.80c) and walk along the path to the end. It can get busy, but the water is crystal clear. 

We also went for a snorkel off the beach you pass by on the way to the Grietas and spotted baby sharks and big schools of fish. It's a lovely calm, shallow beach suitable for everyone.

name: Zarza Brewing Company
description: Craft brewery with restaurant. We didn't try the food but it looked good. Beer was ok. Dog friendly and wifi. Open 4pm-?, closed Sunday.

name: Pizzeria Buona
description: Typical South American pizza. We had a family big vegetarian. The deck is only cheeses killing any other flavour - but maybe the other ingredients had no flavor as nearly everything was out of tins.

name: Lavandería Limpio y fragante
description: Cheap, fast laundry service. Workers everyday of the week.

name: End of canoa beach
description:
NOT a beautiful beach spot, but as we arrived late in Canoa and didn't like it there at all we were here around 7pm.
200 meters from the street, only 3 small houses near by and the sound of the surf in the night made us stay. Super quiet, nice breeze but rubbish at this place.
In the morning we realized that it would be pretty easy to drive at the beach. Maybe a nicer option.

name: Tecnicentro Pits Car
description: Full service mechanic and tire shop. Owned and run by Washington, a very friendly and honest man! Very well stocked and equipped shop, would highly recommend it to anyone on the coast of Ecuador!

name: Autorad
description: Radiator experts. Flushed and cleaned our radiator for $40. Very friendly and quick.

name: Casa Hostal Geranios
description: Nice clean hotel. Close to amenities. 15US for a double room, wifi and shared bath. Hot showers and parking.

name: Lookout Entrace to San Lorenzo
description: From the main Spodylus route there's a pave road to that takes you into town. Just as you get on that road look for the big colorful letters that read "SAN LORENZO" to your left there's a hill with a short dirt driveway. Drive up and camp at the flat dirt lot. Good views with a cool breeze. Free, dafe but close to the main highway.

name: Hostal Canoamar
description: Nice, clean hostal right on main street. ~30 meters from the beach. Good location nice breeze. Leveled parking lot with room for 2 or 3 small to mid size campers not higher than 2.5 meters. Friendly staff. Clean restrooms and shower. WiFi. Shared kitchen. We negotiated price down to $10 per night for the two of us to camp in our truck. Shared rooms also available for $8pp or double rooms for $25 for two people. Rooms include private restrooms and fans. Nice place overall. If hostel is busy staff may not be able to accommodate overlanders.

name: Servicio Automotriz Inga
description: A really good, teasonably priced do-it all mechanic outside of Cuenca. Has airtools, does weldinng and knows all the places to get spare parts in the city. He has a much better "feeling" for cars the most mechanics that i had been to before and after a short testdrive diagnosed all the problems I had suspected while other mechanics didn't see them even though i told them to have a closer look!

name: Parque Ciudad Blanca - old airport park
description: roadside, open park, no shade, busy road, but tranquillo otherwise. bathrooms 9-9..no showers.

name: Angel, excellent mechanic
description: We had some carburetor problems while going uphill, and we were helped by this " Angel". He repairs everything, any brand... also great option for oil changing or whatever you need for your car... great person, honest, and not pricey... if you are somewhere in between Guayaquil and  Cuenca, Angel is the one!

name: Planeta Azul
description:
Start place for a lot of tours to the Cuyabeno Reserve. Possibility to get a room there as well. 
Has parking lot where all kinds of rigs can fit, not sure if they would allow you to sleep in the vehicle but there's a good chance I'd guess... our car stayed there during our jungle trip for free. Although not totally hidden from the street, felt quite alright and all was good when we got back.
We paid 20USD per night and were allowed to use the kitchen. They have a very nice pool and bar also.
Wifi is good, and in the trees behind the building we spotted monkeys on three different moments :)

All in all a nice spot and super gentle people!

name: Free field camp
description: Lots of option ! Boom dock anywhere. Nicest native ecuadorian around here.

name: Refugio #1
description: $15/pp for a bed. 4800m. Was planning to camp, but oh my dear it is ever cold here!

name: Reserva Puntilla de Santa Elena
description:
Open from 6am to 7pm.
Most western point of Ecuador with 3 sites. The hill El Morro with a 360° view. The lighthouse and a beautiful beach (surfing is allowed) with sea liones. 2 trails connect the sites and 3 short walks at the locations. Beautiful and definitely worth a visit. Only drawback you can't camp there as it is at a military area.

name: Camping Chucuri
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Description provided by owner:

At Camping Chucuri you can make camps with family, friends and pets! We are located in El Valle del Tambo, one hour from Quito in Papallacta. We have security, bathroom, clean water, tents area, fire area, grill for roasts, parking! 

To know about our promotions and discounts contact campingfincachucuri@gmail.com on Facebook as @CampingChucuri Or our website Camping Chucuri -wixsite.com 
Nature that inspires! 

  We offer a comfortable space to make camping, surrounded by nature native to the area! If you want more information 0999247454 

Ofrecemos un espacio cómodo para realizar camping, rodeados de naturaleza nativa de la zona! Si quieres más información 0999247454

name: Hostería La Loma
description:
Club with pool, room for tents, private rooms. Good wifi. Pet friendly. Hot water in showers. Nice place, if a little crowded on weekends. 2 km of uphill dirt road from the main road but it's good and 4x4 isn't needed. Friendly owners.
This place is great only the road there is not so good but only 2 km

name: TeleferiQo de Quito
description: It is an teleferic at 3.900 meters above sea level where is possible have an amazing view of Quito and its  around places. It also possible to come close to a volcan and doing a litle tour on the moutains. At the up there are some smal stores and restorants. The teleferic cost USD 8.50 per person. To come there from Quito downtow you have to take a bus to Comuna (USD 0.25) and take a free bus to TeleferiQo Station. Its possible to come by driving, there is a parking lot.

name: Treehouse El Eden
description:
A good place to see birds. Enter for free only voluntary support. The place is on the road The tarabita. There are also little cabins, a treehouse or campground for $8pp adult, 5$ child. Bathrooms clean. Very friendly people!

Showers are normally not included, but if there is a free room/cabin, they might let you use one.

name: Multiservicio Automotriz Chino's Cars
description: General mechanic for cars. Chino did a great job on my broken ride

name: Guacamayo Hostel
description: Nice place to rest. Camping also available. We paid 5 dollars per person for camping with our tent. Very clean. Just on the beach. Wifi average but enough.

name: Romeria Hostal
description: Nice Hostel on the main square. Friendly owner, asked for 10.- pp for a private double room with bathroom, he agreed to 8.- Hot showers good wifi. Gated parking across the square. The town is beautiful and the mining history is very interesting. Ask the locals about what's currently happening under the city and why the town did not get the UNESCO status! It is crazy!

name: El Diablo es Puerco
