description: Amazing place to sleep/eat and refuel! This place has great food, and it has a parking lot to park and sleep in! Fernando is the owner! Tell him Gringasho sent you

name: Graham Kersey's garden centre
description:
this is the access road to Graham (Australian) and Amalia's (Colombian) house, where they welcome overlanders and give them full use of an apartment with double room, bathroom and kitchen - for free. They have a lovely view out over Ibarra and are extremely welcoming! it was a great stop for us and our kids who enjoyed playing with their 4-yr old daughter. other details: WiFi, laundry, 100v, 200v, hot showers, water all available for free.
I added this IO entry on the access road as otherwise his campsite is hidden by an icon for a mechanic (which is in the wrong location anyway). just keep heading up this road and his brick coloured house is at the top on the right (check other IO entry for exact coordinates).

name: Hostel molina
description: Ok place was on my way to Macas when I picked up a screw, changed the tube up the road, 10USD good internet next to rooms 1&4 (molina11) restaurant next door is owned by same person parked my bike inside restaurant for the night. No toilet seat but hottest water I have had in quite awhile!

name: Casa Sakiwa
description: $38/night for a couple, with BUFFET breakfast included. Secure parking on the premises. Somewhat upscale place, friendly staff, fast internet, restaurant on-site.

name: Cocoa Inn
description:
Very beautiful the hotel and its rooms, but they opened my car and robbed me, cameras, radio, money in the hotel parking lot and the hotel was not responsible .. I do not recommend it as they promised to give me back the money and they did not And if you go here you must be very careful 

muy hermoso el hotel y sus habitaciones,  pero me abrieron mi kombi y me robaron,  cámaras,  radio,  dinero en el estacionamiento del hotel y el hotel no se hizo responsable.. no lo recomiendo pues ellos me prometieron devolverme el dinero y no lo hicieron y si van deben tener mucho cuidado

name: Hostal Saraguro
description:
Great hotel with parking inside for motorbikes, really nice rooms, fast wifi.  Private bathroom and two people cost 20 dollars.  Very close to town square.
10 dollars per person

name: Ironman 4x4 Accessories
description: Cesar and his team at IronMan Ecuador will help you with any issues you have with your overlanding rig. They have a full mechanic and build shop in addition to a large catalog of accessories and auto parts. 100% recommended.

name: Casa Mabell
description:
Nice, very clean small hotel/hostel.
30/40 US for a double without/with air conditioning. Kitchen and slow wifi available. Very hot and powerful shower! Free drinking water.

name: San Rafael Waterfalls Parking Lot
description: Ask nicely if you can camp next to the Information center and they'll be happy to accommodate you on the tiled lot. They, leave a restroom door open for you during the night. Might need to level out a little bit. Julie was the park ranger when we were there she live right behind the parks office. Super nice. Free.

name: Hotel Restaurante Rincón Manabita
description: Simple but clean hotel with a tasty restaurant. Super friendly owner with tons of tips about activities to do in the area. Rafting, Kayaking, hikes waterfalls, natural, river slides and swimable sink holes. Thank

name: Cottages by the sea
description: Beautiful pool, beautiful apartments, right on the beach. Kim the owner is super nice, generous, and helpful. I don't know how much it normally costs since I knew Kim, and I don't know if camping is allowed. Expats around the town gather here in the morning for coffees and socialize and will give you the inside scoop on the town. Parking available for 1-2 rigs. Dog friendly.

name: Galfishing.com.ec tour agent
description:
Seemed to be the cheapest place for tours we found.  kicker rock $90 (snorkel), and espanola $180 pp.  this compared to $120 and $200 in other places.  we went with another agent for kicker because days conflicted with espanola at this place.  turned out that we got put on the same boat for espanola as what we would have if we had booked it with the other agent for $200.  the snorkeling equipment was a bit better at the more expensive agent though.

Also no one would negociate for price.  it seems like prices on the island are cheaper because they dont give a receipt and therefore dont pay any tax.  everyone would only take cash.

Probablly a good idea to see if u can pickup your gear the day before so you can use the equipment to snorkle the beaches around town.

name: Erhmagawd beachcamp
description:
A great little flat patch of sheltered dirt parking next to the beach.  On the coast of Chile places like this are commonplace - but here in el norte its been much more rare.  

noone around, except for a local who confirmed this is public land and we are welcome for a night. Its well off the main road (track is a bit sketchy, but passable) and the only noise comes from the crashing waves.  Sunsets are magic. 

Big rigs might struggle to squeeze in (i dont have one, so i dont really know) but small and medium rigs will be right at home. 

Enjoy!

name: hotel Princess mar
description:
An option to stay in tonsupa, clean, safe vehicle, hot and cold water, WiFi (with certain flaws) but it works, the owner Mauricio, can guide you to eat, mechanics. $ 30 a night per couple .. Atacames and Emerald is not recommended for sleeping, maybe just for lunch .. 

una opción para quedarse en tonsupa, limpio,  vehículo seguro,  agua caliente y fría,  WiFi (con ciertas fallas)pero funciona,  el dueño Mauricio,  puede guiarte para comer,  mecánicos. 30 $ la noche por pareja..  Atacames y Esmeralda no es recomendable para dormir, quizás solo para comer..

name: Concrete soccer field
description:
Across the street from the hospital.
Flat quiet spot for late night arrival 
Early morning departure
Well lit
Just a place to lay your head safely for 10 hours

name: turnoff la casa del arbol
description: this is were you turnoff to la casa del arbol, now you drive 8.5 km up into the mountains

name: El Pahuma reserve
description: Few meters in the CloudForest is a basic cabin, with showers, bano and light where you can sleep for 5$! There is a nice trail to waterfalls and to another cabin where you can sleep as well! On the road is also parking and restaurant where you might can stay with your camper!

name: Playa Magica Hostel
description: It is one the chipest place to stay in Puerto Lopez. USD 7.0/ Person, the average in the city is USD 10 by person. There is private bedroom, kitchen, parking and It is close to comercial area and two blocks far away from the beach. It is possible to contract a tour to Isla La Plata (USD 35.00 / person). There is a litle bakery next to hostel with delicious hot breads in the morning  USD 0.10 each one.

name: Fuel Station
description: It is a very big petrol station with lot of places to spend a night. It is quite busy and noicy but apart of that good place with a toilet and shower.

name: Isla La Plata
description: It is a amazing island 46 km by boat from far Puerto Lopez, about 1.15h by navegating. There are several kinds of birds in specific season. In may is time of Fragatas and Piqueros patas azules. Snorkel is wonderfull experience, with a lot of species of fishes and other sea animals like turtle and others. The tour is USD 35.00 per peraon. Unmissable.

name: Laguna Santo Domingo
description: Small Lake on the North East side of Cotopaxi. Incredible views of the Volcano if you have a clear day. This area is much less visited and you are lucky can see spectacle bears, white tale deer and rabbits. From the park's North entrance check-in with the ranger take the road immediately to your right and follow it for 13km (approx). The road may be a little difficult to follow at times. Stay to your right (for the most part)  following the most used road. The road splits a few times. Follow your GPS or Maps.Me. There are sections with piroplastic rock you have to drive through and some muddy section during the rainy season. Need high clearance and 4x4 is recommended. Camping here is not allowed but some people do illegally at their own risk. Really odd worldly landscapes. This is the quiets place we've been ever.

name: Cascada Angel Pachala
description:
large flat parking along nice river
1 min walk to the waterfall
not exceptional but very nice and super quiet place to spent night
there's a small signboard "waterfall" on the main roard  from Caluma to Catarama. So turn right on this good road, and 2,5km after, you have to turn right again to a dirt road in the middle of banana trees (little sign board of the left, easy to miss). follow this dirt road for another 2km, condition in ok even with rain, just a bit more step at the end. A few hundred meter after the bridge, it separates in 2, just take right and 100m after you are in the parking

name: Crazy food
description: Great hotel with clean rooms, fast wifi and heaps of parking for all vehicles. USD20.00 for two people per night.

name: Bomberos Loreto
description: Very nice! They offer me water when arrived. U can camp in the terrace at the 3rd floor and it's roof cover. Toilet present with shower.i didn't ask for internet but there is wifi line. Bup in front of bomberos have music loud but nice.

name: Hostería Flor de Canela
description: I ask and they allowed me to camp for free..but I was alone for one night may be they will charge in future..I camp under the auditorium roof and there were light for the night but no charge socket. toilet with no shower.. internet at the receptions, I used the swimming pool.

name: Polic paladio
description:
I ask to the pollice and they let me camp behinde the pollice station. Under a bambù construcción..
I used the pollice toilet with colf shower over day. Over night they lock the entrance to the toilet. I charge the phone in the station.
The place is close to a volleyball camp. After 10.00 pm was quite.

name: Hotel El Dorado
description: Decent hotel right in the heart of town. $20/night for a couple (they charge per person) for a room with private bath. Okay internet connection, they also have a private parking area around the backside. Would recommend if looking to stay in town.

name: Apart Humboldt
description: Great hotel for 25 town bucks a night for two people.  Fastest internet we had in Ecuador, super clean and big rooms with kitchen.  Breakfast and laundry available.  Parking for bikes and cars.

name: la terraza de máximo
description:
Arriving at parking lot lot with incredible view. Bathrooms clean and free ... a tip is welcome. Is a large natural balcony by the side of the road. Quiet and safe. Maximo took very good care of us. 

llegando a loja parking lot con increíble vista. baños limpios y gratis... una propina es bienvenida. es un gran balcon natural al lado del camino. tranquilo y seguro. maximo nos atendió muy bien.

name: Estadio municipal
description: Free big parking slot at a football station. Quiet. Not nice but good for a night.

name: River parking
description:
This is a place where really all kinds of trucks can park. Right next to the river, very flat but in sight of the bridge. But the river drowns out the little traffic.
Very nice, free and safe.

We could access the other spot, but would block the narrow gravel road entirely with our 8 ton truck. No chance for us to turn around. Good for smaller cars.

name: Hostal El Pinzon
description: Nice Hostal in Puerto Ayora. Double room with AC and private bathroom for $35. Basic kitchen to use, small pool and free(!) bikes. Perfect to explore Puerto Ayora and Santa Cruz Island. Short walk or bikeride to the towncenter. Laundry next door.

name: Hostal San Pedro
description: On the corner of 9 Octubre and 5 Junio (the main Street through town). Clean rooms. Good wifi. Parking for motos, probably for vans too (I didn't ask). $17/night for a single.

name: Grand Selva Lodge Tours
description: Amazing lodge  10 dollars per person with private bath.  Great food, massive pool and surrounded by rain forest.  Parking for bikes, cars and big rigs.  Camping available.

name: Mercado Municipial
description: It is the local shopping market for fruits, vegetables and other food. Near to the market you find the big supermarket 'El favorito' where you find "cheap" food if you compare with the other minimarkets.

name: Quimi.CORP. (alcohol/methanol)
description:
Industrial alcohol (1,64$/l) and methanol (1,37$/l) for cooking.
Open from Monday to Friday, from 8.45am to 1pm and from 2pm to 5.45pm.
Accessible with big rigs.

name: hotel lemon
description: petit hotel a 7s, avec la salle de bain sur le palier. malgré tout c'set très calme et l'accueil agréable

name: Isa Mar Hotel
description: We arrived to stay in Casa de Soleil, but it was full. On the side of Casa de Soleil stays Isa Mar and it is an excellent hotel, big rooms, air conditioning, beachfront, but we were afraid it was far too expensive.  We decided to ask and were lucky to find a last minute promotion. We had our best days in Isabella's island.  The hotel is amazing, the owner is friendly and the location is privileged.

name: Safe parking
description: Parking in a small street close to the nightlife heart. Has security guards from hostels and police patrolling every hour. Can park from 18 to 8 for free, and 0,40$/h during the day (3,20$ a day). Can connect to plenty of wifi from hostels and restaurants. Not much bathroom options besides hostels, which are very friendly.

name: Refugio Ecologico Molinuco
description:
Nice place to spend couple of days and explore around the gorgeous waterfalls and hikes. Place was USD 7 per person including "breakfast" (a very sad sandwich. Restrooms next to the camping area were not well maintained. Cold showers. No Internet unless you ask the owner. The complex is nice and quiet at least during the week. Kids will enjoy the place.

Correction: road to get there is pretty bad!

name: Divecenter Los Mantas
description:
Very good PADI centre. Were the only ones who cared about previous experience etc. There are a lot of shady shops around!!

160$/2 dives including a very good lunch and a waterproof camera for you to use. 

Speak very good english. Very small group (2-3/instructor)

name: Hostal Miraflores
description: Cheap hotel with secure parking for 1-2 regular vehicles -- no height restriction but, limited width to enter. Simple room with private bathroom for $16 for a couple. WiFi signal was weak from our room, but decent connection. We got permission to cook in the parking area.

name: Full Motos
description: Lots of parts and tires here for dual sports and smaller bikes, with a busy moto mechanics right beside. Got a good deal on a tire with a little bargaining.

name: hostal anita
description:
Residencial not terrible. Room cost 6s without tv nor banos, 8s with tv and banos 

residencial pas terrible. chambre à 6s sans tv ni banos, 8s avec tv et banos

name: Arepas to-go
description: Venezuelan food! Can't miss this place. Good artesanal beer. Service is extremely slow though, just a Mom and Pop running this place.

name: Hostel Voluntad de Dios
description: Right next to Mope Beach hostel. They asked $15 for a single-occupancy fan private, countered with $10 and they accepted. Wifi, veranda, parking.

name: Nass Bed & Breakfast
description:
The best and probably cheapest way to stay in Cuenca. Nice rooms, incl. breakfast, hot shower, gated parking, wifi and kitchen. Supermaxi is close by (just two blocks away) also the center and a nice Park. Everything is in walking distance. The neighborhood is safe and quiet. We had a room with two double beds and payed 15$ per room (3 people stayed in the room, so 5$ each) - we booked on booking.com. They have different rooms for 2, 4 or 5 people.
The best way to book is directly on info@nasshotels.com or +593998656897 or www.booking.com

name: Eco turismo Agoyán
description:
Good place to spend the weekend. Its owner Manuel Barriga, is very receptive to travelers, nice view over the Agoyán waterfall .

Canopyn,  tarabita,  columpio,  un buen lugar para vender los finés de semana,  su dueño Manuel Barriga,  es muy receptivo con los viajeros,  linda vista hacia la cascada Agoyán.

name: Mecánica Monchito
description:
Maintenance and repair of all kinds of vehicles. When I got to the bathroom, a kombinauta recommended it; works well, and charges reasonably too.

Mantenimiento y reparación de toda clase de vehículos,  cuando llegue a baños,  un kombinauta me lo recomendó,  trabaja buo, y cobra bien también.

name: Los Tunneles Tour Agency Caprcornio
description:
Tour Los Tunnels
I can highly recommend this tour. It's a must on Isabella.
100 $ for adults and we asked for children discount - 90 $ for 5 h and and a family with 3 kids (12,12,13) is much but every $ worth.
1 little land hike on the amazing lava streams and the lava tunnels with Blue foot bobbies. The NP guide was well educated in the geography and the biology of this landscape. 
2 Snorkel spots (only the early boats go to 2 Snorkel spots) with seahorses, white tip sharkes, lobster, huge of turtles and schools of coloured fishes. 3 snorkel guides looked for the good places and tunnels with the fishes and showed them to us. The maritim  landscape was unique and we got the feeling that the guides were very proud of this.
We got the pictures from the gopro of the guide afterwards for free.
This agency often is fully booked so ask early.

name: Hostal Atardecer
description: Rooms upstairs with a shared balcony overlooking the nice white beach. Good wifi. $8 a night; other places I asked at were at least $15. Space inside for motorbikes.

name: Nothing between you and Chimborazo...
description:
...except some vicuñas.
100 to 150 meters from the road on a stone (lava) field. Bit windy but not too bad. With a starlit night the temperature dropped down to 4°C.
Clear view in the late afternoon and in the morning, amazing!
Depends on the spot you choose you might see the summit of Carihuairazo as well. If not walk uphill and you'll see the entire volcano (if clouds allow).

name: Parking lot between Restaurants
description: Empty place between restaurants just in the side of the road.  We parked and stayed there just for the night.  Asked the restaurant and said it was ok, a truck joined us during the night.  It's not official, during the night one of the bathrooms was open and we where able to use it, even to have a shower

name: Estación de Servicio La Maná
description: Parking spot at gas station.  Only a few places. Bathroom and cold showers.

name: KTM del Ecuador, Cuenca
description: KTM dealership and workshop in Cuenca. We went there to look for new Boots and a front tire. When we saw the professional workshop and talked to the mechanics we felt this place is very competent and decided to let them service our suspension. The whole team worked great and did an excellent job on our bikes. They went far beyond a normal garage job. Thank You! We totally recommend this place.

name: Optimum Centro Técnico Automotriz
description: Fernando Montaño, the owner of the shop is super helpful and friendly. You can do your oil change, brakes, tune-up and miscellaneous. We did our oil change in 20 min. Recommended.

name: Gabrielita Hostal
description: Paying $26 for a double en-suite including breakfast. Clean and comfortable. Secure parking in a garage big enough for a couple of cars or lots of motorbikes!

name: Entre Rios Villa
description: Nice hostel with super friendly owners, Jorge and Irma. Prices vary depending on room breakfast included. Quiet part of town small. No height limit but still small parking lot. May not fit oversize rigs.

name: Casa Lloret
description: Super nice hostel $30 a room plus taxes. Nice, fresh breakfast included. Private bathroom. Secure parking but only 2.3 meter clearance street parking available in quiet park of town or you can park next door at no cost at neighbors parking lot. 7-10 min drive from city center. $2 taxi ride to center. Really pleasant stay. Recommended!!!

name: Tallers Quintuña
description:
We were sent here from Mister Mauro (other Overlander entry). We had a problem with our gearbox and they are fixing all trucks from the bomberos and other companies. We were there 2 hours and they fixed the problem. With some new liquid for the gearing we paid $45 US.
The boss and his mechanics are very experienced. Knew our old German engine as well! Happens not often at all ;)

They are closed between 12:30-2:00 for lunch.

name: Blue Door housing
description:
Hostel in a quiet and safe area of ​​the city, parking for small vehicle available in the vicinity. You can contact the owner Alejandro Hinojosa, through www.housingecuador.com, telephone +593 99 998 8424 . Cute old house overlooking Quito.

Hostal en zona tranquila y segura de la ciudad,  disponible un parqueadero para vehículo pequeño, en la cercanía,  previo hablar con el dueño Alejandro hinojosa, en Internet están como www.housingecuador.com, teléfono +593 99 998 8424.. linda casona antigua con vista a Quito.

name: mauca pedregal
description: basic hotel with restaurant. $15 pppn. great warm fireplace, friendly people and very cosy. beautyful place with view on the Mountain. the first signs on the road are obvious, but the entrance to the property (on the right hand side) is easily missed.

name: Yambo gas station
description: Tried boondocking close by but some locals got frightened and called police. Police was super friendly, explained the situation and escorted us to this gas station. Said it was safe. Not super nice and quite loud as it is right next to Panamanian highway. Ok for a transit night.

name: Hotel Silva Real Internacional
description: Great hotel to stay if you have been riding all day and crossed into Ecuador. Private room. Fast wifi, tv, fridge, secure parking included. $19.00 us. Cheap and next to everything you need to have a break.

name: La Casa Del Ciclista
description: Lots of motorcycle parts. Bought a quality chain here at a good price.

name: Front of church
description: On street in front of church,quiet

name: La Punta - Boat to Amazon ca rescue station
description: La Punt - Boat to Amazonica  rescue station

name: Hostal Mercy
description: Well maintained hotel. $15 for a single-occupancy room with bath. Fast wifi, lots of secure parking. Not the nicest city but close to the border.

name: mirador indichuris
description: good spot 4 sleep, 3dolar pero nigth, great view and whith the entrace you can use a climb to the sky!!

name: parking place
description: the parking lot of the park, is big and less noisy than the other. there is some plugs near but not near enougth to plug our van. just in front of police/emergency place. bathrooms 0,20 dollars near.  free to overnigth

name: Lindo apartamento amoblado en Salinas
description: An Airbnb house ran by Gian (owner of the Pizzeria Casa Nostra on the main square. Great option if got no cash as can pay on card! 20 dollars for the whole house. 2 bedrooms can sleep 6. Shower is amazing with side jets and all! Try Gians pizza restaurant, he may give u a discount on the food if you stay with him :)

name: Motos Principal
description: Simply put, do not go here for motorcycle work. Drastically overpriced and even worse about timeliness. We were insistent on our schedule and they agreed they could meet it, but failed to deliver by an 8 hours for a 3 hour job, costing us a critical day on the road.

name: Cuenca Suites
description: All suite hotel near Plaza San Sebastian. They have secure parking at the rear of the property for Motorbikes or Cars. High enough entry for almost any overlander vehicle. Owned by a very lovely couple Simon(Danish) and Rebecca (Ecuadorian) who can't do enough to help you. I would say this is the perfect base to visit Cuenca. The suites feel like they are brand new and come with induction hobs and things necessary to be sell suffient for your visit to the city. Close to Laundry, Cafes, main centre and stones throw from a Belgian brew pub.

name: street parking
description:
We parked in a parking lot and talked to the guards at the naval base, they said that there was no problem and we were taken care of all night. Very quiet because it is not high season. A very kind gentleman who takes care of a house in the block before this one offered us shower and bath for 2 us, also he offered us to park in front of his house.

Parqueamos en zona de estacionamiento permitido y hablamos con los guardias de la base naval, dijeron que no habia problema y nos cuidaban toda la noche. muy tranquilo porque no es temporada alta. un señor muy amable que cuida una casa en la cuadra antes de esta nos ofrecio ducha y baño por 2 us ,tambien nos ofrecio parquear enfrente de su casa.

name: casa de medardo  #4.011 puerta cafe
description:
Mr. Merardo takes care of a house and let us park in front of the house and allowed use of shower and bathroom for USD 2. Very friendly. We spent the night here and very quiet. Clearly it is off season.

El señor Merardo cuida una casa y nos dejo estacionar en frente de la casa y nos presta la ducha y baño por 2 us. muy amables. pasamos la noche aca y muy tranquilo.claro que es temporada baja.

name: La Cleta
description: La cleta is a chilled cafe/bar in the La Florista district. I came here for their menu del dia at lunch time. Bruschetta, pizza or pasta, a salad and a drink for 5 dollars from 12-3pm on weekdays. Everything was delicious and a nice place to hang out on their breezy Terrasse for a moment. All furniture is made out of bicycle parts and customers that come by bike even get a 10% discount.

name: Al Instante - Restaurant
description:
Very nice guy and delicious trout (best so far), we fished the trout, so fresher impossible. For 7 USD.
Plus, it is a parking (1$) for the Pailon del Diablo waterfall and he lets you park overnight for a voluntary tip.
He also told us he has a double room for the night, don't know the price.

name: The wooden house lodge, isabela, galapagos
description:
It is more than a hotel, it is your home during your stay in Isabela. It is located very close to the percha concha snorkeling site. The team is really adorable and goes out of their way to make your stay perfect. The breakfast is excellent and varied. The other meals, optional, are all very good. The team welcomes you in Spanish, English or French. The rooms are clean ... a paradise 

C'est plus qu'un hotel, c'est votre maison le temps de votre séjour à Isabela. Il est situé tout près du site de snorkeling de concha de la perla. L.equipe est vraiment adorable et se met en quatre pour que votre séjour se déroule de façon parfaite. Les petits déjeuner sont excellents et variés. Les autres repas, en option, sont tous très bon. L'équipe vous accueille en espagnol, anglais ou français. Les chambres sont propres...un paradis

name: LAS HELICONIAS
description:
Fantastic place Fully build with bamboo, in the middle of the jungle. We also could see monkeys Around in the trees. 
The manager, David is a great person, so nice and very good cooker also !!
I recommend without any dought !!

name: Rosa Mistica
description: it's tight back in here but the location is great and I got my big rig in. $5pppn and you get to use the kitchen and bathroom. no shower though. everyone is super nice and this is the closest spot to the good point break.

name: Un Dia
description:
Wonderful spot on a secluded beach. Only a few structures. totally safe with a nice left hand beach break a short walk away. Zero other surfers. 
The description for this site has been updated in conjunction with the owner

the current setup is 3 individual Cabana's which are fully self contained. We stayed for one night and the room was excellent, clean, bed was great and shower hot. Marcel has some great plans for the whole area and these are slowly coming together..... it is still early days for here. We paid $50 for a night and the Cevesa was $3 per bottle; they have a bar area and food available .

name: busstation, militarry checkpoint
description: We were running really late, and as it was the Dia del padre everywhere were people partying and cars parked into the street. we did Not find the visitor Center nor a quiet secure street side parking as our truck Camper is quite big. we asked the soldier where a safe Spot would be, an he said right here (coming out of the petrified forest street, turning right towards the bridge pretty much in the street but in front of the busstation Hut) He told us to let one light on, and we will make an early Start to be surely out of the way. Not really quiet but really secure :)

name: Termas de la Virgen
description:
natural volcanic thermal water . up to 47 degrees Celsius.
$2 daytime.
$3 from 6 pm to 9:30 pm.

name: Pilalo
description: We slept in the street near the school and the police. Very quiet and safe. WC near the church. We stopped here before to go to Laguna Quilotoa from the ocean to acclimate us. Altitude is 2500 m. Free facilities are at the church.

name: Cabañas Del Mar.
description:
Cabañas del mar is a hosteria that is located in a paradisiacal place of Mompiche. We have 6km of private beach. Here you can enjoy nature in its pure state. You can fish in the river. We offer lodgings in comfortable cabins facing the sea with private bathroom, balcony and hammocks. We have restaurant, and we make excursions to different islands, cabalagtas in the beach, sport fishing, snorkel.

Great place to stay, very peaceful !! Bungalows just in front of the sea, with so good restaurant of typical food. Wifi and shower available !

name: Hotel Navarra
description: Decent hotel for $24/night for a couple. Good internet, tv, secure parking garage below (but a tight fit -- would fit cars, bikes, trucks with canopies, SUVs).

name: Sendero de Volcanes
description: Great hostel with private rooms for $10 per person, shared kitchen, large social area, good internet, private parking area for 4 normal sized vehicles. Friendly staff who also arrange trekking tours. Short walk to Aki Supermarket and restaurants and stores.

name: Hostal Montanita Weekend
description: Nice hostel, $10 per person for private room with A/C. Share kitchen, good wifi. Parking isn't secure, but it's in a quiet corner, supposedly with cameras -- felt secure. About a 10 minute walk to the beach.

name: Lalo Beach
description: $10 per person for private room with A/C, secure parking nearby included in the price, shared kitchen upstairs and decent WiFi. Cheapest we could find in Canoa. One block from the beach.

name: Hostal El Obraje
description: Great hotel near the airport for $20 for a couple or $15 for a single. Fast wifi, nice rooms, ample, secure parking, short walk to a mini market, pizza place, and panaderia. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

name: Sun Beach Hotel
description: Okay hotel for $30 for a couple. Rooms a bit run down and overpriced but we got into town after dark. The hotel has a green pool, secure parking in a spacious garage, and a short walk to a few restaurants.

name: The Ecuator
description: A fantastic slow traffic dirt road to enjoy the Ecuator. Farm owners were happy to see us (they speak great English) and we had just a single motorcycle pass in the hour we spent hanging out.

name: Hostal Yurag Wasi
description:
Clean twin room with private bathroom and fan for 16usd. Toilet paper, towel and shampoo provided. They also have rooms with A/C but don't know the price. 
Bikes can park inside but without panniers to fit through the gate. Probably safe enough to park in the street

name: Nuevo Rocafuerte
description:
In this town you arrive when coming from Pantoja/Coca. Few places to stay and one restaurant. Village is ok but we prefered Pantoja. 
Not possible to get here with a car but doable with a motorcycle. Not recommended if you don't want any damage on your bike. Getting your bike in a canoe, is not easy without getting a few scratches...
No fixed prices, we paid 70USD for two people and a motorcycle. 

You can take a guide into Parque Nacional Yasuni from NR. It should be much cheaper than going to a lodge - take the boat from Coca and ask around town for a guide. You can go into the park for one day or overnight, you can also take a trip to another river to see pink river dolphins up close - even feed and swim with them 💕🐬

name: Hotel Safari
description: We paid 15usd for a matrimonial with private bathroom and a/c (room 111). All clean enough. Parking for motorcycles and a few cars but there's a height restriction.

name: deserted bilding
description: parking infront of a deserted bilding. no faselities. just a quiet place to spent the night.

name: Hospedaje Las Chimeneas
description: Friendly and clean hospedaje with many room options ranging from 8 USD  for dormitory 10 to 20 US$ per room. Some have private bathroom some shared, most are pretty small. Use of kitchen for an additional 2$. Lots of plants everywhere, big backyard and two really friendly wiener dogs!

name: underneath antennas with gorgeous views
description:
probably the most amazing and free views of the devil of nariz valley. just watched the train doing it's thing along the zig zags.

a short dirt road off the main highway towards the antennas. little level area for one or two cars. probably not for big rigs. super quiet and (almost) hidden from street. beautiful views into Alausi direction as well.

name: Rapi-Frenos
description: we came to fix our braiks in the van, profetionals, good people.did it in 3 houers.

name: petro Ecuador
description: they said it was not possible to sell to foreigners. But after a short conversation the said OK

name: hostal oasis
description:
nex to la mision and the pier that takes you to the napo river.
$5 for parking  and $15 for a room with hot shower (Not using the beds)

name: Cabana Nuto Cabo
description: A this village lives a friendly family that creates a "traditional live" show for tourists if some arrive. For the show the whole family dress like a jungle tribe. Our show includes a small basic dance, trying to use a spear and a blowpipe as well as presenting a souvenir shop with handmade stuff. Then they want to sell us a 1 hour jungle walk for 20$ per person. We gave them 10$ for the show and they looked disappointed and lost interest. The rest of the day we played with their kids while bathing in the river. All in all we had a nice day.

name: Hotel Espiga de Oro
description: Cheap digs. $6 for no bathroom, $8 with a private bathroom. Rooms are clean and pretty comfy. Except for the swarms of locust throughout the town. I put a towel under my door to keep them out. There is a garage but not for big rigs.

name: Farmers' fair ground, San Juan del Bosco
description: Quiet place by the river. Asphalt parking lot, slightly sloping, too many street lights. We don't know if this place gets much use over weekends...

name: Salinas - Chipipe Beach, in front of Base Naval
description: We stayed one night here. Quiet and secure. We ask the militaries if could stay here, he says "of course". There are camera in the building beside. Near option for shower (cold) - $ 1 pp. Coordinates GPS -2.197656, -80.983699

name: River wild camp
description: The parking lot furher up the road didn't allow camping so they sent us here. Free and safe. It's a nice flat area next to the river. Might be busy on weekends with locals coming for a swim but very quiet at night.

name: free wood camping on top of cojitambo climbing rock
description: free and level parking options for about 5-7 cars on top of cojitambo climbing rock. beautiful views to all directions. haven't tried the climbing here as I am traveling solo right now. some visitors during the day, quiet at night. close to cojitambo ruins.

name: parking
description:
There is a public parking at the end of the waterfront. We talked to the guards and they told us that there was no problem. We gave them a tip. The sector is very nice, there are public restrooms for 15 cents, shower on the beach and restaurants in the surrounding area.there is free wifi and even music. You can recommend to spend the night and get to know this beautiful place.

Hay un parqueadero publico al final de la costanera. hablamos con los vigilantes y nos dejeron que no habia problema. les dimos una propina. el sector es muy bonito, hay baños publicos por 15 centavos, ducha en la playa y restaurantes a los alrededores.hay wifi gratis y hasta musica. se puede recomendar para pasar la noche y conocer este lugar tan bonito.

name: By the river in Sigsig
description:
Several grassy areas by the river.  Some picnic tables, playground, further down BBQs and toilets. 
 Sigsig has an interesting Sunday market; this is where the Panama hats are really made!

name: Isinlivi village FREE
description: No amenities. Steep hill to make it. Bikes & 4x4s will make it easy. Vans will need some high clearance. Breathtaking awesome views. FREE. Check Llullu Llama Hostel for drinks, food, spa & shower!

name: UPC - Unidade de Policía Comunitaria
description: We arrived in Guayaquil ay 9:30pm, in the Hotel Livingston and Parking Hostel Macal was full. Stay here after permission of the policeman's, in front of UPC. We can use water of him. No other facilities. Quiet and secure.

name: Hosteria San Lorenzo
description: This is a very nice and beautiful hosteria in front of the beach. Its clean and has lots of chair and hammocks. There is a big pool and restaurant. Rooms are big and clean. They are building more rooms on the second and third floors but had no issue with noises or anything else. 15usd for a night in a room and allowed my dogs to get in. Very friendly staff and owners. I just didnt like a lunch I ordered to take away. Other than that totally recommended.

name: Hostal Chosita
description: We paid 12$ per person for a private room with 3 double beds (one double bed was in a separate room) and private bathroom. Price includes also breakfast and dinner. Hot water on request, wood-heated. Basic but nice.

name: La Plata Tour
description:
It's a tourist operator that takes you to La Plata island for $35. Rosita Tour. We stay in front of the office and we have a fast wifi and possible to use shower and toilet because we bought there our tour. 

It is a very nice tour, they are profesional and honest. The whale season is from June - September and we saw like 10 whales around the boat. The island is really worth it, many species of birds, snakes, turtles, etc. Snorkeling with many fishes.

name: Hostal el Charapano
description: 15 usd for matrimonial room with shared bathroom. Very clean. The electrical showers did not work for us. So, a bit expensive considering that you have to cold shower. Street parking. People said it's ok to leave the car on the street, but locals always say so. Looks safe since there's an army facility up the street

name: Casa De Darwin
description:
Casa de Darwin, nice, quiet, clean place to stay in Mompiche. I camped there for 8 nights at 5$ each. Place to park a motorcycle under a roofed area, secure and out of sight. Camp spot on the sand behind the house or under the roofed area. Place to park rig in front of the house, can probably workout a price to use water and power. There is also an appartement/hostel up stairs that can be rented per night per person or for the week or month. It can accomodate up to 4-6 persons with kitchen and bathroom. The owners are super friendly and honest, I felt at home the whole time I stayed here!
Situated at the end of calle Iguana in front of Bernabeth hotel right by the river bed access. 

Check for availabilities by calling first : 0988264051 and 0980462695

name: Honey, Coffee and Tea
description: Hands down, one of the best coffees in Ecuador I've had.

name: Hotel Barnard
description:
Great staff. Helped us track down some prescription medications, called taxis for us numerous times, helped set up dental appointment and kept room spotless. Big and quiet room, hot showers and good and fast wifi. 

Both garage parking and small open lot parking with wide gate and no height restrictions so all except BIG rigs should fit. Garage Door on back side of hotel on another street with green door. But pull up to main hotel entrance, enough room to pull off busy street, and they will direct you to correct door. 
Internet deal got us a room for $49/night which included a good breakfast buffet which had staples and other assorted offerings. 

Walking distance to Ejido Park and all major bus lines within 10 minutes. Taxi to old town approx. $3.

name: Vilca Agro Veterinaria
description: Vet urgency service. Doctor Diego Leon was of great help as one of my dogs had been sick for weeks. He was very through in the examination and prescribed everything necessary. Not expensive.

name: Lavendaria H2O
description: This is a great place to get your laundry done. You can pay extra for all sorts of things including HOT WATER! Reasonable rates.  You can park our front.  24 hour service.

name: El Jardin - Restaurant
description:
Safe,  very nice and quiet place beside river on little hill, owners are going to set up some cabins, very good food in restaurant with reasonable prices. 
They accept staying in their parking lot ( for free) after having food in the restaurant. Gate will be locked after closing the restaurant in the evening. Good also for big rigs.

name: Lubricadora Express
description: We make the oil change in the evening and stay forfor the night here. Very frendly family. Bathroom, Wifi, and water. Safe and quiet

name: River Valley
description: several places,  quiet, beside trail, only some locals sometimes,  in national park. high clearance + 4×4 !

name: Hostal international
description: I came here because it was the first place near the bus station (50m away). It says it's a hostel but is more like a hotel as every room is private (I think). I got myself a private double for $15 a night. Everything is really clean and shower is warm. Worth $15 after spending 2 weeks on the road.

name: Casita Torre del Agua Entrance
description: This is the GPS point to entrance into the Casita Torre del Agua.

name: Cuenca Rooms
description:
Beautiful hotel, super clean and really lovely guy who owns it! 
We were able to fit our 18foot long car in the secure parking, may have some height restrictions (there are three parking spots and each one is a different height). $40USD a night including breakfast and amazing hot showers!

name: Pachamama lodge hostel
description: Quiet hostel with mainly Spanish speakers. Big kitchen for cooking, backyard and next door to a cheap bakery (25cents for a chocolate croissant). The rooms are shared with 3-5 beds in each room. $6 per night and is quite comfortable. They let me bring my bicycle in to store inside

name: Rincón del Cajas
description: Nice camping ground in the middle of the valley. The owner is very nice and helpfull. Theresa is a Restaurant with toilets, but no shower. Pets are allowed. We paid 5 $ for two person and a tent. Option to fish in a little pond or river. Very recomended

name: Lavado Express
description: Carwash, we paid 5$ for the car inside and outside

name: Cascadas del Milagro
description:
Nice waterfall, 1$ pp. You can take a bath, there are bathrooms and showers and a small restaurant. Camping for a night is great and no problem. Very quiet at night.
Hight restriction 3,45 m!

name: Travel Agency
description:
Here you can buy tickets for the ferry to San Cristobal and Santa Isabel for 25 USD. Everywhere else you will pay 30 USD as this is the official price. 
Don't know the name, but there are two travel kiosks next to the supermarket. It's the left one

name: Casa de Simon
description: It's a big wooden house without any sign. They also have rooms for 15$ pp. We camped here for 5$ per tent on a huge grassy area. They have a parking area with a big entrance. Maybe place for two big rigs. Stuff really friendly and quite place. Little field for soccer & beach volleyball.

name: Pension Buenos Aires
description: Very basic Pension. Super friendly owners. Room with dopple bed & privat bathroom 10$. Really authentic village. Good Panaderia, Restaurant & Minimercado.

name: Casita Mahalo
description: Very nice and quiet place in the valley but still close to the beach and Montañita. Fully equipped little house (kitchen, fridge, stove, hot water, fast wifi, split A/C). Super clean, newly built and very friendly and helpful owners.

name: Stadium Spot
description: After we have been at Lecka Bistro Aleman (good german Restaurant 2 Blocks away) we decided to sleep here overnight. It's a leveled parking lot behind the Stadium. Very quiet at night. No facilities. From 7 till 8 am there is aerobic/dancing with loud Music. But you could join it for free ;-) There are also trainingstations. We stayed here with two small vans during the week. Good spot!

name: Hostal Rosita
description: Nice, very quiet little hostal owned by locals close to the trail between Guayana San Pedro and Quilotoa. We paid 25$ for  2  for one night dinner and breakfast included. Warm showers, no wifi.

name: Hostal El Danzante
description: Private dopple room with bathroom and hot shower: 20$. Nice ecuadorian owners. Also wifi & TV. They have a private garage too, but we don't know if it's for big rigs. We used their private kitchen.

name: Tambo Inti
description:
Old colonial style Hosteria set in large gardens. Large flat carpark and grassed areas suitable for tents or large overland vehicles. Expat American owner Joe and manager Anna are very welcoming. 
A real hot shower with great water pressure and clean toilet area available for Overlanders in laundry area.
Restaurant meals available if required which saves drive into Otavalo if you dont want to cook.
At time of writing $5pp. Local dogs take a while to settle as they do all through Ecuador!
Only a short drive to the market in Otovalo and the directions to the place are clearly signposted from the turnoff when driving from the town. It should be mentioned that the Hosteria location is incorrect on mapsme and google maps.

name: Paradero Restaurante Los Saskines
description: Road side restaurant. Great lunch, had soup and trout for $US 3 pp. They also have a tiny, very basic hut across the road  with 3 bunk beds where you can stay for $US 5 pp. Big parking lot with bathrooms where camping might be possible.

name: El Ranchito Restaurante and Hosteria
description: Basic restaurant. They also rent out a tiny room with three beds across the road for $US 10 a night. It is the opposite of nice but if you are like us a couple of wet and cold cyclists not wanting to camp in the rainstorm then it is probably ok for a night. There is electricity in the room and bathrooms down on the road. Also you don't have to set an alarm for the next morning as the rooster, dogs, chickens and ducks living on your doorstep will take care of this!

name: Hostal Los Ceibos
description: Sometimes you get what you pay for. And sometimes you get a little more. This place had it all, clean rooms, friendly people, super hot shower with great pressure, fan and they even let us use their kitchen! All for US $ 15 for a double room (2 ppl). Our room was in the back and super quiet and on the ground floor so we could roll our bicycles right in. Not sure about parking.

name: Blue and Yellow Church
description:
Tiny town called Progreso. No hotels or accommodation, but guys at the store said I could camp at the church, which has a large concrete lot next to it. Doesn't seem to be anyone around, but everyone from the town has been super nice and friendly. Entrance to the lot is off a dirt road that pops off the main road. Pretty large dirt entrance ramp which could probably accommodate any civilian sized vehicle, but no big rigs.

I'm assuming this is free.

name: Wildcamp at the lake
description: Beautiful and safe place at a public beach. Some people at the weekend, but not too much. We liked it much more then parque aquatico.

name: Hostal San Juan Bosco
description: Nice, clean and friendly hotel. And most importantly: quiet. The rooms are in the back above an inner courtyard - where we also made dinner on our stove in peace and locked our bicycles. The inner courtyard provides secure parking (locked at night) for smaller rigs, bikes etc. Rooms are spacious, fastest WiFi we had in quite a while and okay electric showers. Good value for $US 20 for a double room (2ppl).

name: Central Park
description: Tranquil space to stay for a night before or after crossing the order. Lots of police cars around. Public bathroom on the plaza (closed during the night). Mild temperatures and calm night

name: la bella italia
description: You will find a menu to us3 very different from the usual offers. Served by Nick-cheff Italian- offers organic and fresh products. Pasta, lasagna, etc ... dessert ... enjoy it

name: Montano Camping & Hostel
description: Beautiful place to camp with a grassy backyard and view of the volcano. All amenities including communal fully-equipped kitchen, steaming hot showers and internet. It's $5 per person. Parking in concrete driveway - space for one vehicle, multiple motorcycles, covered area for tents. Very good atmosphere. There are also rooms with private bathroom. BBq and firepit.

name: Restaurant near San Rafael Waterfall
description: We moved back down here after staff at San Rafael would only let us park in an area on a steep incline although only 1 other car in parking lot.

name: Rio Malo Cascada Restaurant
description: This restaurant ( which serves excellent trout) allowed us to boon to use their parking lot to camp overnight. 100m from trail leading up to Rio Malo Cascada. It's the restaurant furthered the up the hill. The closer Restaurant didn't serve any meals.

name: UFO ----  United-falafel.org
description: Good coffee and cakes and other organic food!

name: Hostal Kasud
description: small hostal , very basic, clean, fan, WiFi, single occupancy room with shared bathroom. US  $ 6.00

name: Out of Bilován
description:
A level place big enough for a few tents or one car, might be to small for big rigs. Just a few meters above the road, you can hear but not see it. 
There are a houses a few hundret meters away, but we diden't see anybody.

name: Hotel La Colina
description: Secure parking. No height limitation and gate and lot was wide enough to fit our truck camper - 2.5m wide and 6.5m long. Fast wifi. Clean and spacious room. Hot water. Friendly staff. Do laundry. $50/night.

name: El Paraiso Cacao Farm
description: Visit and degustation. Friendly people. 2 $pp. Parking in front.

name: Isla escondida
description: tipical food. soup and complete plate for 3,5 $. friendly people.

name: Tour de selva
description:
here you can have a tour in the selva,  to a mirador and cascada. more than 2 Hours. very nice guide.
2,5$ pp. Enjoy !

name: Finca Castillo de Altura
description: Very kind Ecuadorian owners, Juan y Juanito Elias. They're living in Riobamba but you can easily contact them via whatsapp: +593984784330. It's a nice quiet farm with cows, horses and 3 dogs. There is a flat green area for camping but also 3 double rooms for rent (in- and outside hot showers & toilet). They also have a huge secure area for camping and big campers in 5 min walking distance (bathroom planned). Juanito also can organize hiking and horse riding to different places like, for example, "El Altar".

name: Hostel Bella Vista
description:
Kichen available
Dorms 6s and private rooms from 12s
Familiar environtment
Can keep bikes in and garage right next door
Beautiful house
Nice bakery and minimarket around

name: Montecristi, by the stadium
description: Montecristi, the origin of real Panama Hats. Lots of hat shops in town... If you want to spend the night this dusty parking lot isn't bad. Hardly any noise, a little hidden from the road, some cool breeze.

name: El Cumpa 2
description: Road side restaurant with large tasty meals ranging between $2.5 - 5, bringing juice, soup and main. Seems popular with locals

name: Train Station front & Main Street
description:
We parked in the block between train station and bombero's station for two nights. There is a public bathroom one block away in market behind bomberos. Easy access to numerous restaurants and train ticket office. 
We did put up windshield covers but left pop-up camper up. Had no security problems. Plenty of foot traffic walking by. Quieted down around 10pm Started up again around 6am.

name: Mamacucha hostel
description:
Very Nice hostel next to the beach, private ans shared rooms. Not very expensive... 6USD/ shared room.
They have Space for 2 motorbikes inside the property.

name: La Casa de la Abuela
description: Good restaurant option in the town. The cheaper plate is the "almuerzo" - U$ 3 (sopa, chicken, rice, vegetables and a juice or cola). The meat, chicken or fishes are prepared on grilled. Clean and friendly staff. There is other options of plates.

name: Residencial El Refugio
description: We paid USD $8 for a matrimonial with shared bathroom. All very clean. Check-out is a bit early, at 9 am.

name: Tecnocentro
description:
Very good place for alignment, tire balance etc. 
Nice guy recommended by friend mechanic

name: Servilab
description: Repares Heating refri y A-C system. The inkt Guy in town i could find! Probably best in town regarding locals!

name: Estación de Policía
description: In front of the police. Dead end street so it is quiet, ideal to spend the night.

name: Cabañas los Volcanes
description: Lovely place with a few little cabanas. $12/person, single, double, multi-person rooms. Secure parking (not for huge cars, high gate but a little bit narrow, Montero fit perfectly fine), quiet, comfortable. On a clear day there would be an awesome view of Cotopaxi. Owners are extremely friendly, and the food is awesome! The man organizes some tours and can give you a lift to Quilotoa loop or wherever you want (although a taxi was much cheaper). They let us leave our car there for free for a couple of nights when we went for a hike. Hot water was a bit unreliable but it was a super cute place with really lovely owners. Optional breakfast for $3 and dinner $5 (super good!).

name: Hospedaje Girasol
description: Nice owner and nice simple rooms. Matrimonial with a/c $23 without $18. Rooms have hot shower and tv. Place has a garage for bikes, motorbikes and normal passenger cars.

name: Outside the sports ground.
description: Little spot very quiet. Just outside the gates to the sports ground.  Toilets inside do not know when gates close 7 pm when writing this.  No showers, or any other services but in town and close to shops etc.  good place to stay one or two nights.

name: Inta-Rambra Restaurant
description: Secondo (speaks good English) and his wife Lyna let us park our caravan and Land Rover behind the restaurant on a nice level piece of land. Beware access is step and the width probably only suitable for rigs less than 2.1m wide. We paid $10/night.

name: La Mapara
description: Its also a official Campingplace. 5 Dollar per Person, incl. Swimmingpool.

name: Hotel Bracamoras
description: Nice hotel in this little village. We paid 15$ for a double room with shared bathroom. Clean room and bathroom. Cold shower (Electric system for hot water). The owner, Luis, is very friendly. We could park our motobikes in the foyer under the stairs. Maybe a little bit noisy at night but not annoying.

name: Hotel San Antonio
description: Nice hotel in front of the sea with very friendly owners. I was allowed to stay with my 2 dogs after not being able to go to Cabañas del Mar due to high tide. Rooms are nice with huge windows that allow lots of light and breeze in, some are facing the sea. Was charged 20usd for a private room with bathroom. Food is also very good. What I liked the most is how friendly the owners are even with a full hotel, they were very helpful about helping me change a flat tire.

name: Plateau with amazing Views
description: Big plateau gravel lot, probably an old road works site. A 4x4 might make it up the little bank from the road, easy access with bicycle or motorbike. Further back is a nice bay surrounded by trees on three sides for shelter if the wind blows and it is well hidden from the road the further back you go. Amazing 360 degree view!

name: Cochasqui-Mojanda road
description: Good place, wind covered, no much traffic, flat no facilities

name: Hostal Terito
description:
It's a lovely place to stay with a wonderful elderly couple who are taking care of you all time! They are well situated to either the center or the way to the beautiful Playa Man and Playa Carola. They have a kitchen for everbody's use as well as a nice garden. The rooms are spacious, single, double or triple with Wifi all over and hot water showers. Prices are 20$, you might get it cheaper if you stay longer.
you get free drinking water here!!! Highly recommended!!
www.hostalterito.com.ec
cell +593 993083066. It's possible to contact them by whatsapp also.

name: Very nice beach
description: Clean, beautiful colour, calm water, very chilled, hardly anyone around. One mile from a small town. Probably could camp along the beach. Just in front of the beautiful beach, there is a dirt parking area aside a clean quiet friendly expats neighborhood. They welcome clean quiet friendly campers. The only facility is a trash bin.

name: Taboo Adventure Store
description: Large outdoor store with a good collection of (yes!!) Asolo trekking shoes. Also clothing, camping gear, backpacks. Much better than the other one mentioned in the mall. And screw on gas canisters!

name: Road works on the road to Cuenca
description: they are renewing the road. only open from 7-9am and 4-6 pm. partly paved and partly ripio.

name: velacruz church
description: a quiet and big place, next to the church, near the route with space for caravans. there are a few shops nearby

name: Claro shop and Supermarket
description:
Ok supermarket if you need to re-stock-up after spending too much time in north Peru at Swiss Wasi :-)  There are bigger ones in Machala if you can wait.
Next door is a Claro shop - first opportunity in Ecuador to buy a SIM.
Everything is more expensive in Ecuador!!  SIM $7 + $20 for 1GB data.

name: Camp Mirador
description: From the main road you have a dirt road to the right up the hill. On the top is a little shelter and you have an amazing view over the ocean. Here is place for a tent or a car. 50 metres further is the paraglide start point. People there leave when it's getting dark so it's very quiet at night.

name: Capuccino - Italian Restaurant
description: A very good italian restaurant. Pizzas, Pastas and deserts are very good. The owner is from South Tirol and very friendly. It's a little bit more expensive than other ecuadorian restaurants but definitivly worth it.

name: Delicious salty bread, foccacia & calzone
description:
Gus from Argentina and his wife Sol from Peru are backing delicious salty bread, foccacia and calzone. The bread they sell in Canoa on the street on monday-/wednesday-/friday- morning, foccacia on tuesday and calzone on saturday. Just ask vor "Gustavo", a lot of hostels know him. It's also possible to do orders: +593 99 678 2382
Facebook: briceñodeli

name: History of money museum
description: Free museum about the history of money in Ecuador. Nicely displayed, has a lot of coins and old money counting machines, and a play area for kids.

name: Escape 23 Escape Room Game
description: Great afternoon activity in the city if you have a group of at least 3. We were 5 overlanders and we didn't manage to escape but this turned out to be a lot of fun anyhow. At the time we were there it was $11 per person but price depends on the group size. You can book a spot online https://www.escape-23.com

name: Hostal Alvano's
description: Private rooms with own bathrooms or shared bathroom. 18$ for a double room with shared bathroom. You can use the kitchen. They have also breakfast (eggs, fresh juice, bread, marmelade, tea, coffee,..). Quite relaxed place with nice & helpful owners. All you need and the center in walking distance. Private garage, but not sure if it's for big rigs. You also have secured parking across the street.

name: Wild camp next to river
description:
Update: Maybe no more for big rigs/ tent, because of some land slide. Better you check it first.
Stealth camp: when leaving Oña the second dirt road on the right hand side. You can drive down to a platform where you can park or camp invisible from the road. Lovely place!

You can reach the river for some washing or the dishes - if you find the pan we accidentally dropped let us know ;-)

name: Swiss Bistro
description: Swiss Restaurant with a lot of swiss specialitys. You can have Fondue with cheese/meat or chocolat. Also really good coffee. They have a Finca 40km more east. We didn't go there, but it looks nice.

name: Taller Automotriz America
description:
Mechanic in Quito, helped us with electrical work for the inside of our Kombi, as well as helping with our window. They do electrics, mechanics and painting as far as we know, perhaps other things:)

They were efficient and nice, did all the work within three hours the same morning we arrived with the car.

name: Quinua Restaurant
description: This restaurant is incredible. I am not sure if they make breakfast and I'm pretty sure they are closed for dinner, but I go here a lot for lunch. The full lunch costs $4.75 USD but they make a downsized version for less. For the full lunch, you get soup, a huge plate, juice, tea and dessert. You will be over full. Everything on the menu is vegan and tastes very fresh. Each day there is something different. They also have free and fast WiFi. Highly recommended.

name: Hotel Miravalle
description:
Visiting Cotapaxi on our way from Latacunga didn't leave us enough time to get to Coca. So we looked for a cheap overnight in the route. At this hotel we paid $24 for one dubble room plus one single, so $8 pp. This took a little negotion and/or misunderstanding as the lady started at $15 pp for a room with tv and $12 without. We wanted without Turns out they don't have any without!  Neither room with private bathroom. No breakfast. 
Not a young place, but it looked clean. Matresses were good, but under the sheets was either plastic or nylon that made you feel a little sticky. Electric hot water in showers.

All rooms were vacant and open when we arrived. But it filled up well later in the evening. At least 5 cars were in the parking.
It's on a crossroad on a main road from the busstation, so the buses will be heard early in the morning pulling away. Another minus was the bell system. To get in or out of the hotel, one has to push a bell. Someone will come and open the door. Security wise fine, but the bell can be heard from most rooms. The first guests left at 5 am.

Large secure parking, no height problem, see photo. Didn't ask about sleeping in the parking place,

name: Per kilo Lavanderia
description: Most of the lavanderias around here price per item and are very expensive. This is the closest 'per kilo' place that I could find to the Miltary Car Park. Nice lady, fast same-day service (if you deliver between 9-10am) $1.10 per kilo.

name: Sher-e-Punjab Indian Restaurant
description: Excellent indian restaurant run by a nice  British-Indian chap. Any fans of Indian food will like this, but it will be particularly familiar to any Brits who miss the classic 'British' version of the curry-house. Only small down-side.... no poppadums!!!! :-0

name: Off Hwy Ecuador 45
description:
Camp here and park while you go to Shayari community. Talk to the owner Mary-Sol, she will arrange everything for you.  We tried to go to the community by our selves with our 23' long, 2wd RV, but the road was too rough. We drive back here and took a taxi for 25usd.

**we drove with our 2wd sprinter and it took 2 hours and $2 for the boat crossing 7-5pm 

For more info see the tag: Sayari Community

name: Shayari Community
description:
We booked our trip here with the help of Mary-Sol at Kuriallpa in Cascales.

This community is very nice to visit. We walked into the forest and saw monkeys, birds and others. The cabanas are very clean with a private bathroom. We spend 1 1/2 day and did a lot of things: walk in the Amazonia with wild life observations, make all the process for Chocolate, moto ride to go ata Laguna and fishing Piranhas!

30/adult 
15/kid

Include everything.


What a nice place to go. 

Call before:
Phone: 063019399
Cell: 0986627315

Email: ctcshayari@gmail.com


Highly recommend.

name: landrover parts
description:
here you can get almost all parts you need for your landrover 

09 9189 7844   speak to Ismael Cardenas

name: Casa Witoto
description: This is the house of Kerstin's familiy, who does tours for tourists. Theyre office is by the Malecon at the End of street Amazonas. But here they live and also show to tourists theyre home and indigenous Arts. If you like to do a tour with them, go to the office first. We stayed here for free because we booked a tour. But if you are looking for a Place to stay, ask here, because here are more people arraound then by Kerstin. It costs about 5$ pppn. But can chance.

name: Limoncocha Hostel
description:
We've been to this hostel because we wanted to visit the Limoncocha reserve and we knew from Lonely Planet they offer a 3 days tour.
The hostel offered us to use all the amenities for free while waiting for the beginning of the tour the same day. We even let our van on their fenced parking lot during the 3 days in Limoncocha, for free as well !
The lady from the hostel was very friendly.
It was a really good surprise after the Baños lucrative atmosphere.

Tour info : 
It costed us 180$ each for 3 days, excluding 12$ for the bus, round trip.
The tour is led by Juan who is very nice, he only speaks Spanish.
Payable by cash only.
Ask the reception for more details.

name: Reserva Jatun Sacha
description:
Reservation in which there is a 30 minute trail to reach a tower 30 meters high that you can climb to see the area from above the trees.
Admission cost 6 dollars but we were allowed to go through 2.50.
-
Reserva en la que hay un sendero de 30 minutos para llegar a una torre de 30 metros de alto que se puede escalar para ver la zona desde arriba de los árboles. 
La entrada cuesta 6 dólares pero nos dejaron pasar por 2,50.

name: Quetzal Chocolate Tour
description: Highly recommended. $10 seems a lot, but this is very interactive, very interesting and informative. Worth the money. Takes over an hour, lots of sampling at the end of chocolates and some other very unusual choc-related products. I did the Choco-Museo stuff in Cusco, but this is much better.

name: Los Tuneles (lava tunnels)
description: Pretty cool lava tunnel. it is about 500 meters long with an entrance in each end. we saw several turtles at this entrance also.

name: Hotel La Casa del Montañero
description: Nice place near North entrance to Cotopaxi National Park. Secure parking with no height restriction. They are also guides for climbing and trekking Cotopaxi, Chimborazo, Illinza, etc. $20 for a single with breakfast.

name: Vilcabamba
description:
Quiet. On a former basketball court a few steps from the city center.
--
Tranquille. Sur un ancien terrain de basket a deux pas du centre ville.

name: terrain de volley
description:
free place with beautifull view.
we stay 1 night.
next the road. 
a little trafic during  the night

name: Oro Cabanas
description: Hotel Oro Cabanas with Jacuzzi and Hot showers. We found it by accident on our way to Quilotoa from the coast as we needed to acclimatise. Realy friendly owners they let us camp for free and let us use the Jacuzzi and the showers for an extra 1$ pp.Has a restaurant and Wifi.Great place!!!

name: Town Centre Parking
description: Very friendly parking lot, really nice family.  No problem parking overnight. Very clean toilets.  No showers but we could use the tap to fill our truck water-tank (not sure if potable but we filter so we didn't check). Height at entrance ok to around 3.5m. Plenty of space for big-rigs but turning in/out might be tight for big-rigs if cars are parked outside on the street. 75c per hour normally but negotiate a discount for overnight. Surprisingly peaceful for a town centre site.

name: Doug Edwards - wildlife hikes and outdoor photography workshops
description: Doug is a Canadian retired here and loves sharing his passion for the beautiful Intag Valley, the wildlife and photography. He'll take you out on short (or long) walks in the area. He lives on a small farm which also takes in work-away people at busy times. Contact Doug on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/doug.edwards.3133) in advance if you would like to meet him. We had a great time. Depending on things on the farm at the time, you might be able to park-up for the night too. No access for very big rigs.

name: On the square
description: Spent a quiet night on the square of Arenillas. Around midnight the last shops close, it's still kind of light, but peaceful. The only thing that scared us a bit was the school bus honking endlessly at the house in front of us at 6am.

name: Tosagua gas station
description: Not a bad place to sleep. There's a little parking for trucks and it's quiet at night. Super clean bathrooms and free cold showers.

name: Cafe Tarpucamac / Finca - buy local coffee
description: $5 for 500 grams of local Ecuadorian coffee

name: Finca Nunkuy - Fabrica de Chocolate
description: Ask at Comedor Maito in Yamanunka about buying chocolate from this finca.

name: Lagunas Verdes
description: Open space to stay in a vehicle or tent.  Gets very cold as it is at 12,996 feet elevation

name: Cafe Golondrinas - buy locally grown coffee
description: A great place to buy Ecuadorian coffee grown nearby.  Local coffee collective. They can also teach you a lot about the process of coffee selection and roasting (currently in Spanish only).  Had an incredible time here.

name: Restaurante Monte Loma
description: The day I was there they had Pollo/chicken $2.50 & Tilapia fish $3.00 for Almuerzo/lunch.  It was very good.  She also has a Hospedaje on the corner (next to the restaurant) where you can sleep.  She charges $5 per person per night for a room.

name: Cayambe - Coca Nationalpark
description: Nice spot at the entrance building of the park. Next to the little house is a shelter, where you can pitch a tent, secure from rain. We asked the park ranger for permission and it was no problem, a very friendly guy. A bathroom with running water is behind the house (no shower). Big rigs can park on the parking lot beside. The road until here is a little bumby but even with rain ok.

name: Renovaenergia
description: Solar distributor that helped us with our solar panels.Great people

name: Migración Quito
description:
Near to the Carolina Park. Not easy to park outside.
Come here first to get Certificado de Movimiento for TIP extension or for Visa extension

name: La Chocolata
description:
Artisanal Beer made here in Mompiche!  It is tasty.  

They had a Rubio (similar to IPA) and a Roja (with caramelo malt). Achu Craft Beer.  They use Chilean and German malts, hops & selected yeasts.  $2.25 200cc and $4 550cc

Also, they have some vegetarian and vegan options on their menu.  They even accomodated gluten-free!  They were very attentive to dietary restrictions.

They have healthy breakfasts & salads ($2-6), homemade pasta, homemade bread, crepes (savory or sweet $1.50-5), sandwiches ($5-6), smoothies ($1.50-2.25), and desserts ($1-2.75).  Main dinner courses are $6-7.

Closed on Tuesdays & Wednesdays.
Hours are roughly 9:30am-1pm and 6:30-10:30pm


Free wi-fi
,

name: Beach Camping on Isla
description: Tent camping on island.  Able to walk to island during low tide.  Otherwise, you can take a boat across and moto taxis can take you to the boats if you decide not to walk.

name: Very nice beach and best Kitesurfingspot in Ecuador
description: Very nice big beach and a lot of space to free camp on the the sand road next to the beach. There is no facilities but very safe and quiet. The Restaurant  Don Willy 2 offers cheap bathrooms and hot showers. Only at sunny weekends the beach can get busy. Wifi from Donkey Den Guest House Code: Donkey44

name: Hotel Bambus
description:
Travelling with 4 people in a van with 2 sleeping places we ended up here. It was $13 pp for the room and they let the other 2 park and sleep inside for free. There's a swimming pool, pool table and ping pong, very nice! Good showers with hot water. Breakfast was $3.50, but not terribly good. 

Note: the entrance for the car is low, we only just fit through with the bars on our roof. I believe we are about 2.10 or 2.20 high.

name: Bonanza Brewery
description:
Beer garden, brewery, homemade sausage a few kilometers away from Portoviejo. The German owner is friendly, you can park and sleep here on gravel in the parking lot for free, granted you eat or drink something from the restaurant.
The restaurant is good, although a little but pricy. The main attraction are the beers (home-brewed, blond, amber, IPA... and others) and home-made whisky and rum.
You can have a tour of the brewery on Fridays.
Overall, good place to have a drink and sleep.
—- 
You can also buy homemade German Bratwurst, Leberwurst (liver wurst) and Salami. Lecker! Yum-yum!

--
Owner passed away unfortunately but his wife seems to continue the tradition and still hosts guests.

name: Cabalonga Eco-adventure
description:
Nice camping right on the beach. They normally do only tent camping but they have one spot where you can park, it is pretty small (ok for vans or 4x4, not possible for RVs or long trucks).
$5pp, with hot shower, good wifi, bone fire place and electricity.

name: Main square San Pedro
description:
We parked on the main square of San Pedro de la Bendita.
Good overnight street parking, public wifi (limited to 30min per device), public bathroom.

name: lavanderia
description: laundry where you can leave your clothes : 12kg for 7 dollars. same day service

name: ATM Banco Pichincha - cajero automatico
description: ATM machine to get out money with your debit or credit card.

name: Ivan Leon Mecanica
description:
Very helpful mecanico AND he lived and worked several years in the United States so he speaks english. For those struggling with Spanish this guy could be the solution.

Mecanicien sympathique et très serviable ET il parle anglais, comme il a habité et travaillé pendant de nombreuses années aux USA.

name: manglares Sendero Aulladores
description:
Here is the beginning of the sendero Aulladores. 1400 m walk.
We saw a lot of monkeys! the first ones 50m after entrance. To see them, stop walking, look at the sky and search the trees which are moving. You will see them. DO NOT enter without mosquitos repelant !!

name: Hostal el fogon del paisa
description: Place is cheap, 18 dollars for two. Room with private bath, hot shower and good wifi and a small parking garage fits two cars or small sized truck. Not the cleanest place, had to ask for new bedding. There is a  restaurant on the bottom floor.

name: PS Gas station outside of Guayaquil
description: Big, safe, free PS gas station. We just wanted to break the distance between Montañita to Chimborazo through Guayaquil. Very noisy. Along Hwy E49. They also have free showers but they are super smelly & filthy.

name: Parking at malecón
description: We stayed at the malecón in the outsides of Manta as in the city was no good places. Very noisy until 11pm as Many people come here to drink. We speak to Anger the owner of sunset bar and was very welcoming, Also talked to the police. Very quiet after the party (11pm)

name: Under the bridge
description: Very quiet and beautiful place to sleep. We stayed 2 nights. Some tourists Came to see the river. Only for small trucks

name: D'gustar
description: Almuerzo (lunch) plates for $2.50 includes soup, main plate, juice and small dessert.  They have breakfast and dinner options for the same price as well.

name: Apple Computer & Phone repair: Mac work
description: Apple/Mac fix it shop.  Very knowledgeable and helpful.  It states English Spoken on their door (I did not test as I know enough Spanish).

name: Moto Tires
description: Great selection of motorbike tires including aggressive and dualsport tires with these brands Maxxis, Metzeler, Pirelli, Kenda, Vee, and a couple others.  The best selection in stock that I could locate in Cuenca.  David Leon is friendly, knowledgable, and helpful.  He has a guarantee on all of the tires he stocks.  They include the tire change in the price of tire.   He sells a few helmets and gloves.  There is a moto part store directly across the street for oils, lights, etc.

name: Phone and Computer repair "Compu Cell Solutions"
description: A place to buy charging cords for Android or Apple phones or to have a new battery put in a phone. (Had this done for Iphone 5s).  They also can repair other phone problems for Android and Apple as well as diagnose and repair computers both PC and Apple.  They also had a sign for Arduino.  It appears they can configure and install security cameras as well.

name: Paradero tío cajas - Hostería Las Cajas
description: Free coffee if you buy bizcochos! Also get dulce de leche and queso de hoja. Good place to eat a snack! Clean restroom.

name: Hotel L Moned
description: Newish hotel on a corner at far end of town with aircon, flatscreen tv and hot showers with a double room for $28.50 Secure parking was arranged nearby for our 4x4 in the price. The town is not bad for a border town if you are going to or coming from Peru.

name: Backpacker Hostal
description: Super nice place with rooms around a green patio. People are very friendly. There's a parking closeby that you can use. Paid $20 for a double room with bathroom.

name: PetroEcuador Chunchi
description: Safe gas station to spend the night at. Friendly staff, and gorgeous view of The Valley

name: Tire street!
description: Lots of tire shops here! There's also Repuestos not far.

name: Flat in front of the ocean!
description:
Free and flat place right in front of the ocean! Locals and expats came to talk and told us that the place is very safe. Nice beach at low tie and can walk for miles.  Fishermen near to get shrimps and langosta. 

Hide from the main road.

name: Zona de Camping
description: Camping zone for the lagunas.  Stream nearby for water.  Gorgeous views.  Lake is not much further along, but it is much windier at the lake edge.

name: Munay Backpacker Hostel
description:
Nice place, super friendly atmosphere, decent facilities. SECURE PARKING. $5 per night in dorms. seriously there is no other place in guayaquil with this price and garage. they will store your vehicle as well if you decide to go to Galapagos, for $1.5 per day. the owner lives here too and she s a nice girl that helps and attend her guests brilliantly. 
contact her directly via whatsapp for reservation so you don't pay the booking.com fees.(which are 60cents anyway)
+590987277227

name: Open Air Vegetable, Fruit and Cheese Market
description: Under a massive roof (where basketball court is) there is a large open air market with various vendors.  Was open on a Wednesday evening until 9p.m.  Open all day Wednesday, Friday and Sundays I believe.

name: Camping sports Store
description:
Camping oufitter
