Store with camping articles

name: Casa de Tarzan
description:
Super cool local attraction. This local family build a tree house in a 300 year old tree. 
it is also possible to rent it for a night to sleep in. 
They have a small Cafe with banana cake, coffee and homemade ice cream. the passion fruit ice cream was awesome.
Entrance is 2 usd pp
To stay overnight is 25usd pp.
Ropeswing and Zipline. 

Totally worth a visit if you need a break from all the water activities

name: Cabañas Bambus
description:
Beautiful green garden with bungalows for $50, rooms with shared bathroom for $25 and camping for $16 for 2 persons. There's a good swimming pool, ping pong and pool table, barbecue ($5 to use), kitchen and warm showers. We saw kolibri's in the garden a few times. Very nice place.

We negotiated a room + camping spot for $32.50 a night. Only in the weekend another guy arrived who wanted to charge us more, so we left. Also, he was cleaning the swimming pool with the dish washing product and sponge and put it back next to the sink after - best to use your own!

name: Fish Market
description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Manta doesn't really offers much in terms of attractions. its main industry is fishing so this is the heart of the city. go there early (7 or 8am) and watch the enormous quantity of tuna and swordfish being brought in by the fishermen on the beach. then watch them sell and chop and filleting their fish incredibly. then eat in one of the side stall that sell Encebollada, the typical food. $2 for tuna and $3.5 for mixed, incredibly fresh, fish soup.

name: Las Luciernagas
description: Hostal with very friendly and helpful owner (swiss). He let me sleep on his parking and use the hostals utilities. 5min walk outside of Mindo, very quiet. There are also cabañas to rent. Willy is a great host and shows you the possibilities of Mindo activities. On some he has special price.

name: tecnicentro Firestone
description: Sale of firestone. Very Good gomeria! Service is excellent. Prices are really correct. Very friendly people.

name: Petroecuador Mitad del Mundo
description: Gas station a 5m to Monumento Mitad del Mundo y Unasur, open 24h, secure, wc and wifi of Parque Unasur. (we stay here in the week day). I think posible Parking for Big rigs. Free.

name: Gk Torno
description:
Pedro is the owner, a very friendly guy!!!
He is not a mechanic, he is a welder and lathe operator. Very recommended

name: Zumac Sisa
description: You can camp in the parking lot of this nice hostel/hotel for $5pp, which just happens to be run by the best people ever. Pablo will be the greatest host you'll have encountered!! There is an outdoor BBQ and indoor kitchen, outdoor and indoor shower, bano, very fast wifi, hand laundry, fire pit, chill out lounge area, and also rooms with private bath for $10pp. Safe and quiet and close to supermarket, restaurants and veggie stores. Chevere!! Pablo can arrange tours: tubing, rafting, jungle hikes etc. He's very knowledgeable about vehicles too so can help you out in a pinch. Warning, Pablo and Marcia are so nice, you may never leave!!

name: Lavanderia
description:
Washing and drying. Ready in 4 hrs. 

Nice and cheap  1$ per kg.

Two shops here.  We used the one on the East side of the street.

name: Gas Moto Motorcycle shop
description:
awesome shop. mostly ktm but will for sure help anyone. they speak good English and the mechanic is German.
we got oil and could use the workshop to do the oil change

name: El Jardin Motel
description: A 'love' hotel so you get your own parking garage. Double room with private bathroom, hot shower etc for $12 per 10 hours. We paid $24 for the whole night. Quiet location and only a short taxi ride into the town. Wifi is available but they said no initially but gave it to us later. You have to ring reception to be let out of the place, which was new to us. A good stop after the border crossing.

name: Cojimíes Beach park
description: Parking area in front of the beach. Very calm and safe. Perfect and free 😁👍🏽

name: el sabor de Soñita
description:
this little stall, inside the marvellous fruits and veggies market, is literally awesome.
I had a "hornado" which was great and super tasty. if you just pass by, you can try the meat and that's it...but you ll end up eating there because it frigging awesome. 
seriously. $2.5 for a delicious plate of grilled pork, pork skin, mote sucio, mash potatoes medallions and a nice onion and tomatoes salad.
attention: market is open only on Sundays, Wednesday and Fridays.

name: Parking lot at malecón
description: Quiet place to stay the night in tena. No one cared about us been there.

name: Cabanas Pusara
description:
Very basic hostel with dorms and private rooms. Can book here for a boat trip on the lake. Saw loads of birds and some monkeys.
Save parking for bikes.
Seems possible to park cars and vans across the hostel for overnight.

name: solca dominguez
description:
Workshop works multibrand. Between Salinas and Santa Elena.
--
Taller mecanico trabaja multimarca en la libertad entre salinas y sabta elena.

name: Dentist (Centro Especialidades Odontologicas)
description:
Dr. José Acosta Vázquez, 
General dentistry, oral rehabilitation, fixed and removable prosthetics, implantology
Dr. José Acosta Vázquez has removed bad implants from Bolivia and put in an excellent work new. We can recommend the practice with all problems and wishes. The prices are correct, moderate and cheaper than in the USA and Europe!
Dr. José Acosta has now been practicing dentistry for 35 years!  He has specialized  in oral rehabilitation, including ceramic crowns, bridges and veneers, as well as implantalogy for more than 23 years. 
The Acosta-Vega team has been working with expats for last 10 years. In fact, 50 - 60 % of their patients are from the USA and Canada. They also treated people from Europe , New Zealand, Russia and Australia.

name: Quesos y Quesos Delicatessen
description:
Locally Made Chocolate, cheese (including aged varieties), and Liquors.  Also artisan crafts.  They also have food and shakes.  
***You can find some of the same chocolate and cheese (but we didn't find the aged elsewhere) in the small village of Salinas about 20km away, for much cheaper, if you have the chance to visit.

name: Cabana El Cerrito
description: Covered area with hammocks and benches.  Bucket flush bathrooms nearby.  Right on a river where you can swim, bathe or even kayak (they have boats).  There are volleyball and soccer courts and pool (billiards) tables nearby.  Tent camping welcome.  Could also sleep in a vehicle.  Locals are friendly, curious, and polite.  To cross the river you pay $1 for Motos and $1.50 for cars each way.  Some months you cross on a bridge, other months by a large canoe (when the river is higher).

name: Laguna Azul
description: Quiet place to camp next to some gorgeous jungle swimming holes. $5 per tent and $3pp to access swimming holes. The river is beautiful and the families who manage the site are super nice. Bathrooms, running water, restaurant.

name: Banco del Bank
description: Two ATM machines here to get cash.  Banco del Pacifico is next to them.  We had luck here, when another ATM several blocks away did not work.

name: National Parque Oficinas
description: This is where you can get permits to camp within the National Park.  Registration costs $10 per person per location (this is for up to two nights max per camping location) and you will need your passports.  Hours 7:30am - 6pm with a decent lunch break (approximately 12-2).

name: Residencial El Viajero
description: We just took a hot shower for u$d1 per person and they invite us to camp in their land. The water is running for the hot spring. They have accommodation for u$d10 per person but we didn't stay in the hotel.

name: Comedor/restaurant of encocadas, marisco and fish
description: The other restaurant is close. This is only there are here, and have parking in front. The friendly family prepares at the moment the best encocadas (tipical dish with fish and coco) and others dishes of fish and mariscos. Very tasty and cheap! 😜👍🏽 you can sleap also here. Is very calm and safe.

name: Tourist Info/Municipal Offices
description: Tourist Information office as well as government offices in the Municipal building here.

name: Termales Jamanco
description: These are now thermales for 4 dollar pp. super clean and very nice ambiance. 7 big hot pools. they let us stay overnight for 5$. toilets are clean and shower is hot. a great place to overnight!! nice owner. big flat area to park. very quiet at night.

name: Valle del Rio Restaurant
description: Super friendly people. Buy trout lunch and barter that for camping on lush green grass soccer field. Wonderful and safe.

name: Thermalpools
description: Reina del Rosario, is a Thermalbath by the street. Is like ecuadorian standard. The water is 42 Grad hot. We ask the owner and we can stay here overnight. We pay for 2 cars 5 $ and for the bath 1$ for one person. You like it, when you come from the cold Chimborazo.

name: CodeSolar
description: Peter, a german man, is a specialist  for solar panels. We have problems with the panels and he checks quickly what can be wrong. On the same day you can sell new one. When you wan't he can fixed the panels on your car. He is very friendly and helpful.

name: Zamora Rio Bombuscara
description: Quiet place on the edge of Zamora near the River. Far enough from the music but safe because of the houses nearby. No facilities.

name: Vulcano
description:
Volcano is open. 2-3hrs from the NP entrance to the Refugio. From there 5-7hrs to the top.
You can sleep in the Refugio for $10. $2 pp for "trail maintenance"

Depending on the weather conditions you need cramps, helmet recommended.

The parking at the park entrance is not flat, no possibilities to camp there.

name: Chimborozo Park Entrance
description: No motorcycles allowed in the park. You can camp for free in the parking lot or in the entrance of the curious shop under the roof.

name: La Fak restaurant
description: The best pizzas! And good coffee and cold beers!

name: La Canoa Camping/Hostal
description: We were only going to stay one night, stayed 19 nights! We looove this place. It’s at the end of a dead end street in front of the beach, so trucks can park if you pay camp fee. There is also space inside for several cars to park, no height restriction. Places to pitch tents, private rooms and a dorm room also. We payed 15 dollars  for two to stay in  the dorm room we had just for ourselves, overlooking the ocean! There is a kitchen for guests, very clean bathrooms and showers, large outdoor fireplace, many hammocks, and dolphins swim close to the beach in front. They rent bikes. The owners are the nicest family, they took us out to some beaches and made dinner for us a couple of times.. made us feel like family. Cristobal, the dad, has worked in tourism his whole life and loves to travel too, he can let you know what to do around here, there is so much 19 days weren’t even enough.. contact: lacanoac@hotmail.com phone: Cristobal Ventura and Lidia Baque 0993406552- 0991966417

name: hostal paufi
description:
This is a village with 20 families. there are 3 restaurants and nothing else.
although there s this hostel, a very nice 3 stories house with sea view, hammocks, nice single and double rooms with bathrooms (cold water but it s not too cold) and a small kitchen. there s private parking too. 
to me it was heaven since there's not a single tourist or anybody else around. Just unplug and enjoy this beautiful corner of the earth, chilling with the sound of the waves.
black sand, palms and some delicious seafood. 
don't miss out Playa Africa too!

you can call ahead and they can pick you up from the main road.

Jacqueline Vera
+593 0985961454

Carlo julio Vera
+593 0990460983

name: Comedor Valentina
description: Copied from http://ioverlander.com/places/44569-senora-lourdes

name: Puerto Chino Beach
description: There are tables and benches in the trees as well as a few grills so you could build a fire from charcoal or wood (if you bring some along) for cooking.  And tent spots.  ***Must get a permit to camp ahead of time at the National Park office in the main town.  $10 per person for registration to camp for maximum 2 nights***  Nice beach, but small especially when the tide is in.  Saw a lot of sea turtles, some sting rays, sea lions (you can watch them from above if you climb up nearby rock formation and you can snorkel with them), and birds.  You can walk uphill for about 10-15 minutes to visit the Galapagueria which is free.

name: Trailhead to Puerto Chino
description: This is where there is a parking lot at the beginning of the walk to the beach.  This is where buses or taxis will drop you or where you would leave your bicycle to go to Puerto Chino beach.

name: Lucky's Restaurant
description:
$4.50 for meals and tastier than other places around.  They also have a la carta choices (different prices) and vegetarian options.  Worth a try.  Friendly staff when we were there!  
04.03.2020 Almuerzo for 5 USD

name: Playa Africa
description:
a beautiful spot to camp right on the beach. you can use the facilities of Comedor Valentina if you want.
in case of bad weather you can also sleep inside the museum, which is on top of the hill. El señor Archimede will host you and entertain you, upon his permission.

name: Punta La Barca
description:
Hostel, dorms, and cabanas on a hill overlooking the beach. Quiet, safe, and relaxing. Ideal for overlanders, kitesurfers, and digital nomads.

$12 in dorms with homemade breakfast. $20 for a private. $5 camping or sleeping in vehicle.

Good wifi connection, especially for rural Ecuador. Hot showers, good kitchen, and beautiful chill out area upstairs with hammocks and couches. 

Dinner and drinks can be ordered for extra. Laundry service available. Newly constructed work/yoga cabanita as well.

Great owners and the place has a nice vibe. Big big rigs won't fit. Sleep and wake to the sound of the Pacific.

name: Travesia Hotel and Kite
description:
Good Hotel with Pool and everything you need. Very clean, secured parking (height restriction 2.6 m approximately).
Kitespot across the street. :) 

Normal price is 80$ for a double room. We paid after short negotiation 40$. But we are the only guests at the moment.

name: la casta
description: very nice place to stay for some days and relax. (no camping). 18$pp in simple but nice and clean room including a very good breakfast. also a very good restaurant with delicious food. lavatory 5$. very fast internet. spa should be finished in december. the owners juan and adrian are very nice and very helpful. adrian is also a guide and has excellent tips. dogs are very welcomed. highly recommended place!

name: Hostal Pachamama
description: nice and simple place right in front of the mirador. $15 for a single room with double bed, a wood fire heater, hot showers. dinner and breakfast included. very fast wifi accessible not in all rooms unfortunately. despite of the bad Google reviews, they were nice enough with me. dinner was simple but enough. and so breakfast.

name: Parking next to the Palmeras
description: Quiet place in front of the sea, right next to coconut trees. The police didnt care we stayed 3 days.

name: Hotel la casona
description:
old building placed in front of the main square. Nice inside square with tables and lots of light. fast wifi and lovely family attending the guests.
I parked my bike inside.
paid $15 for a private with bathroom and negotiated for breakfast. 
prices could be arranged I think since this is a small family business.
oldish but good.

name: Mercado Municipal Isabela
description: Place to buy foods as well as to eat meals.

name: Bicycle shop/Benetto/bike rental
description: Great place to rent bicycles as they keep them in good shape.  Super friendly and helpful staff.

name: Nauti Dive Shop
description: Scuba diving off a sailboat.  Decent equipment and guides.  Really nice to spend time on the sailboat as well.

name: Blue Evolution Dive Shop
description: Great dive shop.  You can also rent snorkel gear.  Great, friendly and competent staff with good quality equipment that they take care of!

name: Termales Aguas Hediondas
description: Hotsprings with three different pools, 35 - 55 ° warm water, hiking trails. Price: 1.50 dollars per person

name: Hidden alley with a view
description: A quiet side street next to some apartments with space to park on the street. Currently an open field on the right that lets you see to the ocean. It is a nice quiet alternative to the other spots in Salinas.

name: Near Aguas Hediondas
description: great place to stay as long as you want. its cold but nice. very safe and peaceful

name: CindySol (Diving & Snorkelling Tours)
description: very good agency! we did the day tour to leon dormido / kicker rock and the beach cerro brujo. good equipment, very good guide (alejandro, speaks english), good lunch. we were very lucky and saw many hammerhead sharks, other sharks, turtles, fishes etc. paid 100usd per person. they had a gopro and alejandro took many pictures of the animals (if possible with us), we got all the pictures on our sd card for free!! we had a perfect tour! highly recommended!

name: Ecuador Bike rental - Sleipnir
description: Davo does rent bikes and is an avid biker. He will help with advice on Ecuador and can help with references to parts and accessories services and  beer

name: La Libertad
description: Traveling from Macas to Cuenca our car broke down and this beautiful simple family opened their parking place with generosity so we could spend the night. No charge.

name: Wilsport Equipment and Repair
description: This place can repair backpacks, motorcycle luggage, clothing, etc.  They have all sorts of fabrics, fasteners, straps, and other materials.

name: Laundry / Lavanderia Los Angeles
description: $0.40 cents per pound for getting laundry done here.

name: La Rápida clothing repair
description: A good place to get zippers and buttons replaced on clothing or purses.  There are several other places nearby for different types of repairs including for shoes.

name: Moto hell
description: Specialist in dualsport motorcycles and parts and Kawasaki Suzuki and other brands. Run by Michelle and Angel very good people they take good care of bikes

name: Cascada La Poderosa
description: Entrance to the Podocarpus national park where the waterfall La Poderosa is. Parking lot is 500m before this location. 15 min beautiful walk through the jungle. You can take a bath inside the waterfall!

name: Centro Municipal Artesenal
description: Market of many shops with tasteful and high quality handmade items.

name: Accion Sports
description: They sell backpacks, tents, hydration reservoirs, some camping gear, gas canisters (camping gas and Coleman) 10$, and clothing.  Hours 10-1 and 3-7 Monday thru Friday.  Open until 2 Saturday.  Closed Sunday.

name: Race Tech - suspension for motorcycle
description: Diego Salvador is a pro with suspension and can fix all brands of shocks for bikes. He can be contacted at +593 99 970 21 to make an appointment.

name: Agucho's Motos
description: A moto shop with all sorts of parts, tires, helmets, gloves, luggage, etc and a moto workshop/taller down the alley next to the shop.  There is no balancing machine in the Workshop or nearby.

name: Auto PIT'S service intégral automotriz
description: The boss is Giovanny Barros. cellular 0997540911 Very good mechanic who intervenes on all vehicles for all problems.

name: Wild camp near waterfalls
description: Flat spot with a small cover place surrounded by jungle. Perfect spot to start the short trails to many waterfalls and caves. No facilities. Free. 4x4 is not mandatory but by rain will help.

name: Lavanderia Arco Iris
description:
Open Monday - Sunday from 8am until 6pm.

Super service for the same day. We get all our clothes washed and dry back after 3 hours.

name: Wildcamp Muyuchi
description: We found this place after checking the other wild camp spots on iOverlander. Because of the rain the other spots where to muddy and here it was ok. The place is not really leveled but with a little car it’s ok. Coming from north turn right after the busstop before entering to the little town of El Tablon. There is a nice view to the village of Zumba from this spot.

name: Amarun Waterfalls
description:
5 $ entry/pers. 20 $ / pers. for watching birds ( rock Peruvian). 4 impressive waterfalls at the Amarun Pakcha community!
2 natural showers (good massage/rainshower).
You can walk behind the third one and find a little cave.
A tip will be requested.

name: Jodoco Belgian Brew
description: Fingerlicking excellent steak au poivre. All food we tried was delicious. Belgian imported beer and authentic Belgian beer brewed in Cuenca, which is as good. Triple 9% alcohol etc. Only 800 meters from the overland camp place 'Tu Parada en Cuenca'.

name: Used Books - bought, sold & exchanged
description: Used books bookstore with some books in various languages!  Another across the street.  There are also some tour/adventure guides on this street.

name: Amarun Pakcha
description:
No car access!
Near Vucano Sumaco
Beautiful campingground (6$) and cabins (dorm 10$ p.p. private double bed 25$)
waterfallshowers and natural food
lovely community and people

name: auto pit's bosh service
description: good mechanic good service he did à very good job. very serious. vérifiéd the auto After thé job! very recommandable.

name: On the beach
description: Nice place in the beach at the end of the streeet, near a restaurant, quiet and safe. The owners of the restaurant are really nice familly, they welcome us with buena onda. Menu cheap and good food.

name: Casa Giralda
description:
Hotel, with big spaces. It costs $5.00 per person but they´ll throw in: use of their shower, public baths and use of the pool. 
Extra breakfast with eggs for $6.00
Quiet, close to the city, with big parking and wifi.
Better go in weekdays

name: Hugo's house
description: I'm just adding to the first post...first I'm not a 100% sure the coordinates are correct- he's a direct 3-4 blocks away from the main beach- not the beach with the condos...and- although this is a safe and good option, the energy of the place is not great. We left for that reason after the second night. I only recommend this if you don't feel comfortable sleeping on the street.

name: Cafe Ñucallacta
description:
aaaaah. finally good coffeeeeee! cheap too.
$2 for a large cappuccino. awesome!
if you like strong coffee, this is for you. Good cakes, good wifi.

name: Bermeo Hermanos Outdoor Store
description:
Location correct

Outdoor store in the center of town.  Has snorkel gear, camping gear, fishing gear, shoes, etc

name: BP - banco del perno. pernos and parts
description: good place to buy everything for you car and bikes.

name: PetroEcuador - Santa Rosa
description: Friendly Staff, bathrooms. Place to park to spend the night. Beware that south of here no gas stations open past 6pm.

name: montecristi hats
description:
where you can buy real "panama" hats
bertha can also show you she makes them.

name: supermaxi
description: supermarket supermaxi with a big parking lot to park your car. no high clearence.

name: Mirador Nariz del Diablo
description: Just a few minutes from the highway, you can make a quick stop to see the Nariz del Diablo just by a restaurant. $1pp to go to mirador.

name: lavanderia Qualité
description:
0,45$ por pound (lb)
open from monday to saturday : 7am to 8pm

name: paseo shopping riobamba
description: shopping center with food court, supermarket...

name: Hacienda releche
description:
paved parking lot near a playground.
no facilities. 
free.

name: Chez Roberto
description:
Parking lot of a restaurant "Chez Roberto, grill & bar"
Restaurant open from Thursday to Sunday.
the owner or owner cousin lives there, so you might find someone to ask from monday to wednesday

grassy area, you might need rocks or wood to level a bit.
toilets open all night.
water tap where you can fill up your tank.
wifi.
we paid 5 dollars per night for our RV, 2 adults and 2 kids.
quiet on sunday, and monday night (might be a bit noisy on weekends)

name: lavanderia
description:
3 $ for one big bag of laundry.
same day service possible

name: las cavernas de la casa del arbol
description:
3 dollars per adult
1,5 dollars per kid
fun pictures in the cavernas

name: Laguna Azul - Balneario / Swimming Holes
description:
Beautiful river with water holes - water is crystal clear, with one river cascading into the Rio Jatunyacu. Lush jungle setting. There are 4 different pools with easy access. Pool number 3 ideal for kids with a small beach. You can jump from the rocks and there's a rope swing into one of the pools. There's a small restaurant onsite, plus toilets and showers.

Entrance $3pp

It is possible to sleep on the parking lot (bathroom available), just ask the family running it - they are super nice.

Really lovely scenery looking up into the Rio Jatunyacu valley, and one of the best spots of river we have seen so far in South America!

The last 9km of the road is ripio / gravel - bit bumpy but no problem for 2WD when it rains. But, the pools are closed when it's raining.

name: MIC - museo interactivo de ciencas
description:
museum of interactive sciencea. very interesting with kids, young ones to teenagers !
3 $ per adult
1 $ per kid
cafetaria was not open when we were here, so don't forget to get snacks with you, your kids would not want to leave !

name: Garage - Parking lot
description:
secure parking lot with a lot of trucks.
gate closed from 10:30pm to 6am

asked for 3 dollars per night
not fancy but ok for 1 night before crossing to columbia.

name: Consumer Gas Hno Miguel 12-25 y Sangurima
description: Possibility to have the bottles refilled if you have the adapter otherwise you can buy a gas bottle of 13 or 5 kg and the charming boss helps you make the necessary connections. This bottle can be recharged in Colombia, Peru and obviously in Ecuador. excellent address.

name: Cash Machine
description: If coming from Peru this is the best place to get cash - ATMs in a big bus station right on the highway, easy to just pull off and there's lots of space to park. Easier than bumbling around a town trying to find an ATM.

name: El Mirador de los Túneles
description: 30 minute loop to see lava tunnels. About a 20 minute walk from town.

name: Galapagos Evolution Dreams Tour Agency
description: Knowledgeable and kind tour agency. I contacted Jorge before we got to the island for suggestions. We knew what we wanted to do before we got here (for Santa Cruz, Isabela and San Cristobal), and he finalized everything when we got to the island. His number on WhatsApp is +593 98-780-9882 🐢

name: cabaña Iluku
description: It's a very friendy family, Fredy can guide you through the Limoncocha lake and into the river. Contact +593981426850

name: Pacarina Gualinga
description: is a very beautiful place next to the river. A flat terrein, nice people, very quiet at night, good wifi

name: just a flat pull-off
description: noticed this on the way to the quarry creek. would make a flat spot for the night, east to find with no services

name: teleférico parking lot
description: was told possible to park overnight, we didn't.

name: Robin's house
description:
Robin rents rooms in his house for 3$ person/night. Shared kitchen and toilet. He also give the posibility of park at the quiet street in front of his house and use the toilet, kitchen & wifi for 1$ person/night.
Warm water, electricity (110V and 220V) are in process, he is also building a place for overlanders at his property.

name: Golden Prague - Brewery & Restaurant
description: What this place may lack in atmosphere it more than makes up for in good craft beers, amazing food and fast wifi. Huge place with in house brewed beers - happy hour 3 - 7 (half price beers). Beers available to takeaway in your own bottle. Food is reasonably priced and is the usual burgers etc plus some Czech specials. Menu del dia is $3.50 and it's incredible - good value and delicious food. Open everyday for lunch onwards. You can take your kids (inside play area), and the dog (pets permitted). Also, there's a Supermaxi supermarket across the road.

name: Centro de Salud (Public Health Care Center)
description: If you get suddenly sick, you can get checked out here for free.  Bring your passport for identification.

name: Papallacta town
description: Free option in town. Wide road next to a emty indoor football field. Has a good view of the mountains and super quiet. No traffic what’s so ever. Another option is 100m up from this road, there’s a green church with a small parking lot.

name: Olympus water park
description: expensive but nice. tried to stay at the other spot close to here on ioverlander but no one was there, so we stayed here. payed 25$usd to camp in their lot. they let us swim in the pool and use the showers. very nice employees.

name: La Minga Hostal
description: A great hotel right on the main square of Salinas. $10 per person per night, double room with own bathroom and hot showers. Parking for motorcycles (will fit about 5 maximum). Nice vibe, very clean, staff friendly an close to everything. Lovely view from rooftop.

name: Mama Miche Cafeteria with good Cheese!
description: This place is great. Under a dollar for a good coffee, good hot choc $1.25, burgers and chips $3.50 (very good) and they sell fresh cheese which tastes excellent...the best cheese I've had so far on my travels in South America. They also sell snacks, chocolate etc. Lovely people.

name: Ocean Freaks - Kite surf school
description:
A nice guy running this Kite surf school with very nice team. You have a 8h package (with 2h extra) for 350$ and it worth it! The conditions where absolutely perfect to learn kite surfing. His mom run the restaurant just above and do very good menu with starter (ceviche or soup), main and juice for 5$.
We putted our tent just above the beach and he let us the toilets open, we had access to the shower and there were electrical plugs outside... Everything for free, what more?

name: Village Huagra Corral
description: A free place overlooking the valley below. Its a flat spot on the side of the small junction off from the main road. If you don’t fancy sleeping 4000+meters, then this is an option before the national park. Quiet and with a good views.

name: Hostal Azul
description: A nice, clean hostal on the side of the road coming into Pelileo. $15 per person, per night including breakfast, wifi, parking (secure lot) and hot water. You can also have a suite with sitting area and fridge for $35 total per night. En suite bathrooms. From Pelileo you can see Tungurahua volcano really well if clear. You can also see the top of Chimbarozo in the distance in the other direction.

name: Refugio Volcan Imbabura
description:
Highest accommodation I could find on the road to the Volcan Imbabura trailhead. Clever and Aurora Toqueres, a Quechua family, are very hospitable. They have three daughters and are very friendly. They have constructed a little cabin with 2 bunks and a separate full bathroom. Very clean. Blankets, pillow, towel, toiletries provided - even TP!  
I had dinner (light, as is Latino custom), breakfast and a big lunch (after summiting). Total cost was 20$. They also arranged a ride to the trailhead for me, saving about 400m of vertical, for 4$. 
There is wifi in the house (breezybutter125) and computers as they sell internet time, but it's included for lodgers. 
There is lots of space for camping and RVs, and a fire pit. Clever is also building a restaurant with a fire oven for bread, etc. the 2nd floor has an awesome view, including Imbabura. He expects it to be ready around January 2018. 
If you're coming to Volcan Imbabura don't hesitate to stay here. You won't be disappointed. 
Their phone number is 0982569498.

name: El Tío hostal/cabañas
description:
Very nice farm/hostel in the middle of the hill. The main office/reception is near the town center. You can find it on iOverlander or simply ask to the lovely indigenous people who live here. 
$10 for a private double bed. Bathroom outside and volcanic shower. Not too hot. No wifi at the place. Just at reception.

name: Plaza de Loja
description:
Enfrente de la plaza. Baños a metros en la gasolinera de la esquina. Puesto policial (camión grande aparcado) a mitad de cuadra y policías recorriendo durante el día. Justo en el centro. A tres cuadras del mercado central. Dejamos el auto ahí durante dos días enteros mientras paseamos y dormimos dos noches. De día hay mucho movimiento, de noche es más tranquilo y silencioso. A la mañana temprano arrancan los ruidos. El lugar es seguro y muy bien ubicado. Hay carteles que el estacionamiento es pago, pero nadie vino a cobrar nada y fue gratis. El spot del estadio no nos pareció seguro,muy desolado de noche.
---
In front of the square. Bathrooms to meters in the gas station of the corner. Police post (large truck parked) in the middle of the block and policemen traveling during the day. Right in the center. Three blocks from the central market. We left the car there for two whole days while we walked and slept two nights. During the day there is a lot of movement, at night it is quieter and quieter. The noises start early in the morning. The place is safe and very well located. There are signs that the parking is payment, but nobody came to charge anything and it was free. The stadium spot did not seem safe, very desolate at night.

name: cabañas del pescador
description: very nice place. At this moment, no charge to stay here. Don Pedro is a very kind person. There are cabañas too. Wi-fi very good at the restaurant. Dinner and lunch good prices. Hot shower at the cabañas, not outside

name: Hostal Carolina
description: A really nice hostal in this small town...it may be the only one? $10 per person for a room with fan, $15 per person for a room with air con. TV, private bathroom, cool water, swimming pool at perfect temp. Lovely guy who owns it. He went tightened my exhaust and gave me an Allen key to take with me! 5-10min walk to main plaza with plenty of places to eat (typical Ecuador food mainly served...about $2.50 per person). Plenty of parking and under cover for motorbikes.

name: ATM: Banco Pichincha
description:
Only ATM in Mindo.

No extra charge using my European Visa card.

name: Hosteria Bella Napoli
description: This place is great, right on the beach and in a quiet location about 5 minutes walk from the main sea front bars etc. It has secure parking and rooms are $25 standard double and $30 with sea view. Hot showers, wifi, restaurant with good food (breakfast and dinner) and they can arrange tours for you. Very friendly owners. A little noisy from about 8am due to construction works.

name: hotel Rosario
description: Across the street from hotel chaparon but only cost $5 for a single room.  I was going to stay at chaparon  but my KLR would not fit in their hallway and they suggested leaving it on  the street.Might be ok to leave on the street but way too much traffic for me. Across the street, hotel owner let me park my bike inside their vacant store front with enough room there for ten motos. the catch was I had to stay at his hotel. kinda old and simple but I slept well knowing my bike was safe

name: Automotriz Pérez
description: Needed brakes and a transmission oil change. This mechanic was recommended to us by Pablo from Zumag Sisa hostel. All good.

name: Zea taller de aire acondicianado
description: Our truck a/c needed a service and this place was handy.

name: Bosque petrificado de Puyango - Parking lot
description: We can park overnight on the Parking Lot by the Enter to the Petrified Forest. There is a Toilet open 24h. It's Place for max. 2 Big Rigs.

name: El Cielo
description: This is the place to be if you want some sleep while in Montanita. It's tucked right out the way about 10-15 minutes walk from the beach an centre of town, which has loud music most of the day and night. Parking for bikes on site. Very clean kitchen and downstairs communal area. Large double room with plenty of shelving to put stuff in the room. Separate bathroom with hot shower and is kept clean. $18 for the double room per night. $5 returnable key deposit. Lovely people running it. Not sure how much dorm beds are but they are available. Drinking water available. Tap water non potable. Wifi is good.

name: Hotel Lago Imperial
description: As our rig is too tall for Hotel Mario we came here; no height restriction. Negotiated and paid $40 for one night in a room plus parking for the next two nights while on a tour.  Room is not huge but had good AC, nice pool, an enclosed trampoline and decent Wifi.  Claro reception good too.  It's possible you could sleep in your vehicle as when we parked, the security guard asked if we wanted power.  He put us right beside the bathrooms/showers for the pool. The parking is around the corner on right if you are facing the hotel. There is a lavanderia right across the street. $1 per kilo.

name: Tequila Hotel (with informal campground)
description: Nice place on the beach with 20us rooms wifi and a nice swimming pool. Owner says camping is possible but not for too biggish rigs. Walking distance to town

name: Hotel Blacio
description:
$12 for a single with private bathroom, small tv, no fan or airco.
Parking for one 4x4 in garage next to hotel. Otherwise large parking space up the hill; belongs to hotel so no extra costs.

Forgot about the Romeria hotel, otherwise would have gone there or haggled for the price difference.

name: One night stay
description: This is a POLICE STATION. If you go hear they are friendly to travelers, and will find a space for your vehicle that is safe and close by. We have the front of someones house for the night. Not fancy just if you NEED a place that is free.

name: Football Pitch
description: We asked around and the locals of this village told us we could camp at there community football pitch. We highly suggest asking as well, just a formality and good way to get to know the town. The same people gave us some veg for dinner as a kind welcome present! Locals are extreamly friendly. No facility's but again if you ask the locals they can give you potable water. Beautiful views and quiet on the hill above the village

name: La Mariposa
description:
This is a great place within a minute walk of the beach and close to everything. The lovely owners made every effort to get our bikes in to the garden area so they would be safe and even let us put our bikes in front of an unused room so they would be sheltered. The rooms are $25 per night including wifi, private bathroom and properly hot showers. Great view from the terrace. Breakfast is $3.50pp incl coffee, juice, a good size fruit salad, toast, 2 eggs, jam and butter. Extras are cheap to. Also they serve breakfast until 10.30 which suits sloth-like beings such as myself. Super clean, room cleaned daily and just a lovely place. 
No parking for cars just a few bikes in their garden area which takes few minutes to sort.

name: Mauna Suites and hostal
description: Very nice hotel away from the noise and partying of the city center.  7 rooms and 4 of them with kitchens. A nice breakfast is included on the 3rd floor deck with  a great view of the ocean.  Parking for Motos and small cars only.  No camping available.  Strong wifi.

name: water
description: Sells aqua purificada (purified drinking water n the botellón) for $2.25 (20l)

name: Hotel Manaba
description: An affordable hotel with a large secured yard for parking that has private rooms as well as hostel-like tents. Paid $10 for one person for a room with private bathroom with cold water.

name: Sumpa Hotel
description: Rooms with $10 a night (without TV) and with $15 (with TV) that accommodate up to 3 people. A/C and hot water. Large secured back garden for parking cars and motorcycles.

name: ESCAPES VICTOR
description: a really nice place to fix your car/van or combi. Fair people super generous and honest :)  We had to fixed the direction of our van and to "put some iron staff on the floor oof the front seat" cos we had corrusion and the rain was coming insinde!

name: Hotel Casa Fernando
description:
It is a very nice place in front of the hotel. Fernando and his wife are very helpful und friendly. They help you every problem. It is a new hotel with elektric, water, warm shower, wash machine. The place is very quiet und save and good for big RV near the thermal bath. Fernando speak english, german und spanisch..... a perfekt place to stay same days..  5 USD / person
look at: www.lacasafernando.com

name: Restaurant Paraiso Terrenal
description: Nice spot at restaurant with marginal rest rooms and no wifi, but great view overlooking cliffs, beach and village. It took some rocks to park flat  Didn't have much food, but beer and fish. They let us stay; I left a tip.

name: Toyota
description: We went in for a oil filter for our HZJ 4.2 diesel cruiser, a bit expensive but they had one!

name: Community Hostel Alausí
description: Traveling through all of Central and South America, this has been by the far the best hostel I’ve been to. Safe neighborhood, newly renovated, AMAZING breakfast ($3,50) and dinner ($5) by their in house chefs. Dorms are around $12,50pp and the private rooms are 30 or 50 a night. There is street parking outside for a van, bikes or small rig. they also have a separate house that accommodates bikes and motorcycles and is super safe!  Would highly recommend staying here. The owners/owners son are from the States and are amazing people.

name: Boom Graphics
description: Very good place ir you want to make graphics (stickers) for your van. You can also make your presentation cards, flyers, and so on. Is a family owned graphic and they are very helpful and nice persons.

name: Beach camp between turtle nests.
description: nice free beach with no facilities. cops said it's safe, but were only concerned about not disturbing the nests. fires on beach are ok.

name: El Paraiso
description: Thermal bath with many swimming pools and two slides. Also campground with toilets, hot shower, bbq... everything for 2,5$. Big rigs friendly.

name: Trattoria Gabriele
description: great Italian restaurant. chefa italiana chef Germán. very steep uphill keep going. we slept in the street in front of the monistery. very nice calm and secure..

name: Restaurant La Vaca Parrilla Argentina
description:
When we saw the sign that says "Parrilla Argentina" we didn't doubt to stop and try some dishes. Absolutely our best meal in Ecuador, excellent place to have BBQ or hamburgers with quality meat! They also serve some Italian pasta as ravioli. Good place to have a break of the typical Ecuadorian food.
We tried the Bife de Chorizo (sirloin strip steak) and it was like going back home to Argentina and the hamburgers have a great size and are delicious too!
The owners Gina & Renato are very nice and they were glad to meet foreign travelers as they are planning to travel as well in the future.

name: Vistamar guest house
description: Really cool owners and guest house to stay. Rooms are clean and the place has a nice atmosphere. The owners are surfers and very nice people. Less touristy than many other places on the coast and a nice place to hang for a week. Paid about 30us per day for a private double room and private bathroom. Can use their kitchen and good wifi

name: MHRolandito
description: A shop for Hydraulik parts. They pressed us a new hydraulic tube and fixed it in the car for 10 dollars. Real good Sortiment. At the other side of the road servicio de lubricantes, parte of their shop. Nice and fast.

name: Runa Wasi
description: Nice place, close to Quilotoa. Free parking, fee is voluntear and very good restaurant. Wifi free. Be  nice and spend some money at the restaurant

name: Backpack and zipper repair shop
description: They can fix most backpack problems, from sewing to repairing zippers. Used my broken zipper on my bag for 3USD in one hour.

name: Feria agroecologica
description: Every Sunday until 2 pm. Organic fresh products from local farms. Lots of veggies, goat cheese, honey, etc...

name: Gualingo
description: clean, quiet, and secure hotel with  parking for Motos and cars. I don't think larger rigs will fit. owner is very friendly, but only speaks Spanish.  Great place to stop before crossing into Peru.

name: R&P Servicio Automotriz
description:
it's a great car bodybuilder, very effective, fast for a good price.
there is WiFi on the spot waiting time.

name: Seguri Llanta - Alignment etc
description: Good wheel and tyre service centre. The manager Cesar is a nice guy and speaks a little English. Only alignment is $10, and balance and alignment is $28 (Mondays and Wednesdays it's $18). They have all the electronic equipment and did a thorough job (better than other places we've been). Lubricentro for oil changes also. They stock some Continental and General tyres. Large place that also services trucks so there's space for big rigs. Wifi available while you wait, plus there's small onsite restaurant serving up delicious menu del dias.

name: Market Sangolqui
description: Really nice local market, very big and not touristy at all. We enjoyed it a lot to walk around and do our groceries. We heard it is especially big on sunday, we visited on sunday and indeed the market was huge. It is just in normal streets that now are closed for cars. We found a nice quiet parking spot on the location of this waypoint. Mostly they sell food but also lot's of other everyday-live stuff. If you are in the area on a sunday don't miss it!

name: memo moto
description: Great motorcycle Guy.Works on big bikes for great prices.This awesome guy runs his business here and didn't want money for oil change and tire change.So I just bought him lunch.He used to travel on motorcycle a lot.Can't recommend more.Very very nice guy.

name: Macaw Hospedaje
description: This is where you check in and pay for the parking Macaw lot.

name: Columpia
description: More swings. Nice view over Banos with small Cafe.  Swings $10pp for big tall double swing, $8 pp for single shorter swing.

name: Vincents House and Camping
description:
Like everyone you meet on this journey, Vincent is a really nice guy. I met him in the street and he invited me over for coffee and the rest is iOverlander camping history.
He's in his 60's lives P.T. in Ecuador and P.T. in USA. So his English is OK.
-The house is right beside the train station, there is secure parking outback for probably two big rigs or three small ones. I parked my bike inside and could tent inside.
-Has hot shower, wifi, laundry (for a fee)
-Camping is $5.
-They also own a large farm with "termals" hot water pool about 45mins away. I marked it on here as "Victor Termals". It's probably free to stay there as they are still building. 
-WhatsApp Victor in the day before (in Spanish) as he might be at the farm.
+593 0969 386269
*I attached a photo, it's the green house next to the Tiki Coffee shop.

name: Rive hotel
description: Hôtel on the road to esmeralda. Big parking with secure door (adapte for big rigs). Room with 2 double beds 35$. Perhaps room with one double bed is cheaper. Hot shower. Good wifi. Restaurants nearby. Perfect for one night.

name: Streetparking behind the church
description:
parking in the steet behind the church. We asked a neighbour and he ment "claro".
Quiet, nice view round. We felt good.

name: Sebascar vw mecanic
description:
Jorge is the mecanic of the Volkswagen club in guayaquil. 
He works good and fast. He took out the motor of our vw kombi and fixed the problem with his team in a couple of hours. Very professional  and very friendly. 

Jorge es el mecanico del Volkswagen club en guayaquil. Trabaja bien y rapido. El sacho el motor de nuestra vw kombi y lo arreglo en algunas horas con su equipo. Muy professional  y muy amable.

name: El manto de la novia waterfall
description: The waterfall is across the river. You can take a basket style cable car across (but you don't actually get to get off) for $2pp.  A little bit of cheap fun!

name: NP. Podocarpus (also huts)
description:
Official camp grund for free. Alternatively they have some huts with beds and mattresses ($3/ppn), some have privat bathroom. The WC is very clean with soap and paper. There is a rustic kitchen area under roof with BBQ, water tap, bench and outdoor cold shower. But who need it, around the site 10-15 min walk each there are several nice waterfalls. The rangers have no problem that we use our cooker somewhere near our tent instead inside the kitchen. Tap-water was recommend to cook before drink. In the bathrooms there are electric sockets. 
Really beautiful forest camp with lots of strange birds. We stayed several days aside a (not rent) hut and using it as rain/sun shelter its bench and light. On weekdays, we were most time the only visitors. On weekend it was very popular, even others overnight here. But at night it was always so quiet that we could hear the night active animals (we saw opossums) passing by. There are 3 short paths to 3 small waterfalls and one steep to Mirador. Also big 3h jungle circus trail is possible (not marked, but maps.me knows it as El Campesino).

name: Theft Area
description:
This area has some nice waterfalls for a dip. BUT, be careful, also has someone who break into cars. We lost some outdoor equipments and 5 mongos within 1 hour.
In this good weather afternoon, we parked and locked our not beautiful and dusty van (but with chilien plate) on this spot just aside the E45. At the meantime, some 5 or 6 teenagers also arrived with a pick up taxi at this entrance for a swim. They left the river maybe 20min before us. When we came back to car, the back door was not totally closed and all the food and cloth inside was a mess. The police told, burglary happens sometimes.

name: HOT SPRINGS!!!!
description:
You can also sleep here with the van or tent. 

Awesome remote springs on awesome road from cuenca. Advgold! Pretty sure wild camp ok. Be a champ and take out bag of garbage.

name: Cascada Colorada
description:
There are hundreds of nice waterfalls in this area, this is probably the only one you can pay for. The official entrance fee is crazy 5$/p for foreigners but the guy requested "only" the 2$ like for locals - maybe he had seen our long faces at reading the tarif or he just don't want his only visitors at a weekend day to leave...

He showed us around personally. There  are 7 small 1-2 meter high waterfalls with yellow-brown water colored from their special sand. In total we think it had been nice waterfalls, but not fascinating. We doubt it is worth the 12km detour on average stone road from Limon Idanza. And we think even for 2$ it was totally overpriced - so now we know why we had been the only guests.

name: Garden house  Hostel (& CAMPING)
description: Really nice place rooms are between 18us and 30us. Clean and nice rooms, super good wifi. Walking distance to town and safe parking for vehicles. Big rigs won't fit into the property. Camping is possible but have to be arranged.

name: Cabañas Del Pescador Hosteria
description: This place has simple cabañas with double bed, private bathroom and hot showers for $20 (2 people). Parking directly outside and out of sight of road so quite safe. TV also but we didn't try it. Average Wifi in the restaurant and a log fire. Wifi does not work in the room but the food is nice in the restaurant and there's plenty of choice for drinks etc, and it's warm. We had dinner for $8 total. Very nice owner.

name: Canoa to AmaZOOnica rescue Station
description: If you don't go left towards the airport but keep on going straight, about 15 min, you come to a gravel road. Follow it until there are some rusty signs, one of them for the amazónica rescue station. Go left here, you can park at the house and they take you there at 5usd each way or you can wait for a local canoa to pass by that is carrying fruits or whatever. The take you for 3usd each direction. A lot cheaper then from the other spot in overlander where they wanted 40.

name: Sacharose (camping option)
description: A Rose farm ti visit. It is posible to Camp there for free. very quiet. also It is a cattle farm

name: Guango Lodge
description: Very cozy hotel with full pf humingbirds.

name: Frame repair
description: 1 Year of endless ground waves in south america totaly break the frame of or car. He did a good repaired whithin 1 day for $80. You need to show up exactly at 8:00 or the day before - around 8:10 he started to tell everyone come tomorrow morning.

name: Allignment
description: Proffesional computer based allignment within 10 minutes for 10$. First time he showed us that car need frame repair first and didn't charge us.

name: Free WiFi
description: Shoping mall with working free wifi and tables at the food area.

name: Electrico Mecanico - Su Auto
description: Alberto is a really nice guy and was recommended to us by another mechanic. He fixed our headlights which have been temperamental for months, and no other mechanics / auto electricians have figured it out. Big garage with a roof, but it's very high and would fit the biggest rigs.

name: Tickets and Boats Coca > Rocafuerte
description:
You buy tickets and board the boat to Rocafuerte here... There are 2 companies (both offices located here) which go on various days - Kamu Kamu and Cooperativa de Transporte Fluvial (CTF). Arrive an hour early to get your ticket - $18.75pp. Bring passports as they are checked before you leave. 

Take water and snacks for the trip, and the boat also stops for lunch in a village halfway. The boat is fairly basic - it's a long river boat with open sides, seating for approx 70 people, life jackets, a bathroom, and shelter from the sun / rain. 

It's a (long) peaceful journey (you will probably doze through most of it), interesting to see the communities (and Petro Ecuador) on the river, and there's beautiful scenery of course. 

Photos of the timetables and contact details of boat companies are attached. 

TIMETABLE:

COCA > ROCAFUERTE (approx 10 hours)

Monday 0730 (CTF)
Wednesday 0730 (CTF)
Thursday 0730 (CTF)
Saturday 0730 (Kamu Kamu)
Sunday 0730 (Kamu Kamu)

ROCAFUERTE > COCA (approx 12 hours)

Monday 0530 (Kamu Kamu)
Wednesday 0500 (CTF)
Thursday 0530 (Kamu Kamu)
Saturday 0500 (CTF)
Sunday 0500 (CTF)

* no pets are allowed onboard. Taking a bicycle should be fine depending on number of passengers and luggage, but not sure about a moto - have to ask, and maybe organise you own boat.

** don't bother trying to find current timetable info online, we found it's all old and inaccurate. The above was correct as at December 2017, but if in doubt just turn up in Coca - you can probably find a boat going downriver every day, or charter one.

name: Sierra Alisos
description: Idyllic setting, panoramic views of multiple surrounding volcanoes including Cotopaxi, situated alongside the huge forest reserve that they own. Pricey at $10 per tent/rig to camp/park. Or $9,5 per person and includes farm breakfast, which is fantastic, including yogurt from their dairy farm. Lots of green space to choose from. To get there, there is a sign on the highway (km9) marking the turnoff for Sierra Alisos. The 3.5 kilometers, 2.2 unpaved and the last part is steep. Call Raul ( +593-989-405064) IN ADVANCE. He is a motorcycle enthusiast and offered me loads of great routes as only a native rider would know them!  220 V output is available.

name: Fresno Car Center
description:
Profesional and competent mechanics. Big and clean garage. They do all kind of work from oil change and carwash till engine rebuilding ... Big rig friendly and pet friendly. You can sleep in the car. There are toilet, warm shower and wifi. Owner speaks perfect English. 

Location updated.

name: Hostal Chimborazo
description: Nice little place right in front of the dock when you arrive - the people running it are lovely. Clean basic rooms with private bathroom, surprisingly good wifi, TV and a huge fan. Paid $10pp pn. There's a nice balcony with a view over Rio Napo, which is the perfect place to be for sunset. Few (and only) places to eat downstairs and next door.

name: VW Mechanic- Escobar
description: We needed a mechanic for our vanagon badly and after searching around the area, this guy was the man for the job. His name is Teófilo Escobar and he has been working on VW for over 50 years! He is about 70 years old and still climbs under the vans like nothing. He worked a week on our vanagon, taking apart our entire transmission and putting it back together with new transmission bearings. Him and his employees worked diligently on our van and even worked on our brakes and other things while waiting for the bearings to ship from USA. Did I mention he is really affordable too?

name: Tambo Condor
description:
This place is fantastic. For $15 per person you have a room in cabaña with a beautiful view on Laguna and mountains where you can watch condors nesting on the rocks and a lot of hummingbirds. The scenery from the room or balcony is breathtaking. You can also camp for $3 p.p. In cabaña you have a kitchen, tarraces, fire place and they provide small heater for your room because it's cold there. There is a restaurant where you can have a meal for $5. We also recommend to drink a delicious tea from this region.
To get there from Pintag just follow the road to Reserva Ecológica Antisana.

name: La Pradera - container bars and food trucks
description: A bunch of bars and food places in shipping containers, incl Inka Burger, Camino del Sol (good craft beer), Gin House. Cool place with indoor and outdoor seating. Parking available ($4 per day), and short walk from Parque La Carolina.

name: Under the bridge
description: Lot of leveled space under the new bridge, easy accesible. Unfortunately quite dirty due to rubbish. The river has remarkable clean water. Traffic noise is notable but not too bad, the insects are louder. Enjoy!

name: Potential Theft Areas
description: Stopped for snacks, paid too much.  upon leaving was approached by very aggressive beggars.  Had to drive away with them pounding on the truck.  About .5 miles down road police clearing some impromtu road blocks meant to either delay or cause damage to passing vehicles.  would recommend not stopping for a few miles in either direction.

name: Bandido Brewery
description: The only place you should go in Quito if you want good craft beer and good pizza. Seriously, we were recommended this place by tons of expats. Happy Hour Monday - Friday 4pm - 6pm ($3.50 for a pint). The IPA and Saison are epic. Pizza $11 - $14, plus tacos, burgers etc. Live music on Tuesdays. Gets super busy so get there early if you want a table.

name: Cascadas Aguaventura (waterfalls)
description:
Amazing place to spend the day and the night. Trail thru Several waterfalls to see, swim, and jump. Also the river. All Beautiful in this lovely ecopark. Jorge , the owner built all the infraestructure with love and Care. they have also a restaurant with very good local food. We ate a complete menú with fish, patacones, rice and salad for 4$. We spent the night at the parking Lot. Safe and Nice. We highly recommend this place. If you camp in tent you can choose to do it right Next to the river or the waterfalls.

Espectacular lugar. Varios senderos a distintas cascadas para ver, nadar y tirarse. También está el río. Todo hermoso y cuidado con amor por Jorge y su familia q construyeron todo este emprendimiento. También tienen un restaurante con comida local riquísima: menú de pescado, arroz, ensalada y patacones 4dolares. Parqueamos a dormir en el estacionamiento, quienes acampen en carpas pueden hacerlo donde quieran (al lado de las cascadas o el río tienen unos techitos ideales). Recomendamos este lugar para pasar el día y la noche.

name: Hotel Reina Del Cisne
description: We paid $7 per person for very simple room with shared bathroom with cold shower. Secure garage for cars and motorcycles.  Very friendly owner who helps you with everything.

name: El Geranio
description: Nice basic rooms, breakfast included and with secure bike parking. 12$ pp including breakfast

name: El Maple - Vegetarian / Vegan
description: Really nice place, feels like being at a cafe back home. Big menu with loads of vegan options - burgers, pasta, salads, Asian noodles, ceviche, cakes and desserts. Prices aren't too bad (eg. from $4.50 for a burger with salad). Lovely staff and good music. Fast wifi - it would be a nice place to come work online. Definitely recommended, especially if you're in need of something green and crunchy! Open everyday.

name: Cerro Mandango viewpoint
description: Nice one hour hike to a look out point over the whole valley. The place is a little remote so take along plenty of water.

name: Bar caña dulce
description:
This is an amazing bar located on the beach where you can find fresh milkshakes for $1.50, beer, mojitos, etc. It's near Hostería Camare and at 10 minutes walking on the beach from Punta Prieta. I really recommend it because is very clean and the owner Fabian is a very nice person. Is a beautiful place that you must visit if you stay around Bellavista. Also you can ask them to cook you food at the Restaurant Albita like fish, shrimps and more traditional food. I really recommend it! 


MODERATOR NOTE: Owner states they also offer camping in front of the beach. Contact: 0959709175 WhatsApp
También  ofrecemos Camping frente a la playa, contactame 0959709175 whuatsapp

name: Usa  Yaku
description: This is a great place for RVs.  Big parking lot.  Next to a beautiful clean river.  There are caves to explore and waterfalls.   There are hammocks to use. Decent toilets. One of the best places to camp and have a quiet day.  Highly recommended.

name: Erco tires/oil change
description: Exellent place! Valvoline oil and good price and work. Nice Vibe too. Fully recommend.

name: Bodhi Burgers
description:
A cute 50’s style burger place, kinda In-and-Out. Delicious burgers and they have a veggie options (yay!!).
Burgers at US$ 1~4. Delicious fries at US$ 1,60. They have helado as well but we didnt try.
Big Pilsener for 2 dollar.
You should try this place!

name: Hostal Dreamcatcher
description:
One of the cheapest options of hostel in Cuenca (searching via booking), but God how people didn't respected us!

The place is not that bad, but it is the typical backpacker place with people on their 30's (almost 40's) and doing drugs and drinking all the time. Oh, of course, with loud music.

We were in a private bedroom upstairs and the music was on until 1:30 AM with people laughing and talking super loud. One of the girls in the next room went down and argue with the drunk guys and asked to turn the music off. The guys (including the owner/manager/whatever he was) started laughing at the girl.

9 months travelling South America and this was the place I felt more disrespected.

What I am trying to say is: please, avoid this place. There are lots of options in town, don't fall on this trap.

name: BeerKingo Cervecería Artesanal
description: This is an artisan brewery in Rio Canoa, 7 km away from town. It's a secluded, beautiful place with delicious beer. You can camp at the flat parking lot, there's space to hang out, a bathroom and a shower. This is a good spot to take a break from the beach and the party towns on the coast, nice and quiet. $3 per person for camping in your vehicle.

name: 10 de Agusto mercado
description: indoor market for fresh veggies, herbs, meats, crafts.  THE BEST food and the cheapest prices in town.  A must see.

name: Mangrove forrest walk
description:
Here is the bridge to the mangrove forrest of Isla Santay (free entrance, 8am-5pm). The total walk to the small village are 7km flat forrest. Beside the nice mangrove forrest there is a really huge bird colony after about 2km and several crocodiles at some pools aside the village. 
There are some parking lots directly in front of the police station. The new bridge to Guayaquil is destroyed - rammed by a ship. Instead, the village offers boat service to Guayaquil for 3$/person, but it is hard to get from Guayaquil back to your car with public transportation so expect 8-10$ for a taxi. We decided to just walk the same way back. (Cycling would be another option. You can rent at this spot.)

name: Sangay Park
description: This is the last drivable point at west entrance of Sangay park. It is a quiet lonely spot aside the river you can stay. From here it is a 6km walk (or 4x4 drive at low river) to the never finished refugio located at the end of this openstreetmap road. The unfinished refugio offers only a roof and water of the stream. From the refugio there is a well prepared 12km jungle track to lagunas Sardinayacu, but we failed to do it as heavy rain robbed our motivation at half way.

name: Quiet grass
description: If you are like us searching for a quiet place you will not find it at town. Here is a big gras ground 30m aside a rarely used road without traffic at night time. 200m away there are 2 farm houses and a road light and at morning birds and cows come to visit.

name: Protección Industrial
description: A great outdoor gear/commercial safety equipment store! A really knowledgeable owner, Diego.

name: Casa De Campo Curiñan Campground
description:
Beautiful grass field with great views over the mountains and the town of Otavalo. The reception for Hostal Curiñan is on the opposite side of the road.  Quiet and safe camping with bathroom and hot (not always) shower for $5 pp (kitchen included）Only young kids can stay for free. 
Big gate (see photos) fits big rigs.
Wonderful friendly owners Jose and Matilde will ensure you’ll have a wonderful stay.
curinanotavalo@yahoo.com
099 36 27 166 /0991903341

name: Parking by The River
description: Free parking near the Rio Tomebamba. During the morning and evening until 10pm there is a lot of people walking around, the view is beautiful and the place is quiet. The police drive a few times here. We had a very quiet evening.

name: Primax Gas Station
description: We witnessed an assault on two girls at the edge of the Tomebamba River, so we chose to sleep at this 24-hour gas station. We talked to the attendant and he was very attentive and told us that staying was OK. We had a very quiet night here.

name: Bosque los Arrayanes (myrtle tree forest)
description:
A quiet spot next to one of the supposedly last myrtle tree forest in Ecuador.
The access road is cobblestone with little traffic.
A level spot in front of a closed building. A water tap is available at the building.
There is a short (20-30min) hiking trail through the pretty forest.

name: Cascada El Chorro
description: The Cascade El Chorro is wonderful, 1 dollar entrance per person, for those who come by car, the road is of very good quality.

name: Parking Free
description:
We arrived late at the waterfall, parked in the parking lot of the green restaurant and asked if we could sleep, they said yes and we did not have to pay anything. We had a very quiet and peaceful evening.

now is charging 5 USD per car.

name: Hotel La Posada de Andres
description: Nice place on the road to Guayaquil with big parking lot behind the hotel. friendly owner. Paid 30 dollars for two bed room. wifi ok, air con.. Clean but traffic noise.

name: Lo de Fausto
description:
A cheap camping site/hostel a bit 
out of town. 2.5 usd pp to camp. 

Nice owners and most travellers are backpacker's from South America. WiFi, swimming pool, steam room and sauna, cooking area, a place to leave your luggage and hot showers.

name: Volcano Imbabura Trailhead (+wildcamp)
description:
DRIVE: If you follow the signs for Cerro Imbabura they lead you up a steep cobbled road to here. This road isn't shown on Google Maps and Maps.me showed it as a footpath (on OSM as a grade 4 track now), but it is a reasonable road. The last section (1-2km) is dirt but good condition WHEN DRY. We got up here in a 4 tonne RWD Roadtrek but after a night and day of rain the dirt section was absolutely treacherous and I wouldn't recommend it unless you have a 4x4.

WALK: on the way up we took the little footpath behind where we parked horizontally over the quebrada, vertically up to a track, then left to the small white water plant building where we found the official footpath (approx 300m). On the way down we took a farmer's track which brought us to the road we parked on about a 100m up. Both fairly easy if you track on Maps.me.
There is a thousand metres climb to the top in about 5-6km, so you can imagine it's pretty relentless. It wasn't the altitude or evelation gain that made it hard, but the quality of the track as the lower half is through grasslands that turn into a muddy slick mess when wet. The higher track is also muddy but more rocky so not as bad. I'd strongly recommend walking poles or at least a stick. 
Fortunately the track is pretty easy to follow, even in thick clouds. It took us (mid fitness 40s) about 4 hours up and about 3 down. 

SLEEP: At 3,500m the road turns into a more narly and narrow 4x4 track, but there is ample room to park up for the night. You might be able to squeeze two vehicles here at a push, but you can always find something a little lower (didn't see anything higher). There's even a refugio a few hundred metres down, but it was closed up (although toilets and showers appeared open!).

name: Banco del Pacífico & Wifi
description: One of two branches with ATM.  Was able to withdraw $300 with $1.50 fee.  Also there is open wifi that you can use from the small plaza. Not the strongest but there where a bunch of locals using it when we were here.

name: Platinum Class Hotel
description:
Barrio Amazonas, Calle Cesar Villacis y La Unión esquina

Was here because another traveler recommended the place to me. Mery and Louis, the owners are absolutely lovely. Louis took me to a local fruit market and showed me around. Could try a lot of fruits there.
The rooms are clean and with A/C. Internet works very good.
Secure parking for motorcycles and cars up to 3m height under a shelter is possible. Max hight is 3,45m

Also breakfast and dinner are no problem. Very nice people!

name: Pura Vida Restaurante
description: A small restaurant on the beach that can take a few campers/tents.  Great pizza oven $6 ea. Big Club beer $2.30. A young Brazilian and his Chilean partner own it. Beautiful beach setting.  No wifi yet.... Charge $4 per person.

name: Baños Spanish Center
description:
Spanish school, $7-8 per hour of 1-on-1 classes, usually arranged 15-20h per week.

Elizabeth, the owner was lovely, and let me camp in her super-secure front yard behind tall walls with garage door for $3 per night (1 person) while taking classes including bathroom/shower and WiFi, as well as offered homestay-style 2 meals per day for another $7. I also parked there for $1-2/night when I went on a tour and she did my laundry for $5/load. Only small vehicles can enter, at 2.1m height was brushing on trees.

She also offers home-stay and an apartment with kitchen, might be a good option for bikers. 

Her 2 inseparable dogs will fight over your attention in very different ways, one totally mellow and the other completely hyper they get jealous of the attention the other one gets; cute but some dog (training) skills might make your life easier. :)

www.bspanishcenter.com
WhatsApp ‭+593 98 704 5072‬

name: The Pub - Cerveceria
description:
The Pub has to have the best craft beer in Cuenca - it was actually named Best Craft Brewery 2017 by Gringo Post Cuenca. 

They have about 5 in house beers on tap, and have a new addition every week. Brewers / owners Greg and Shaun are from the US, and are passionate about brewing - they love talking to customers and one of them is always at the bar. Full of locals and expats alike, small place with good atmosphere. Happy Hour 5pm - 7pm ($1 off the beers). Good food which changes almost daily - Tuesday taco night, Wednesday and Thursday it's sliders, and Friday and Saturday is pizza. Open from 5pm. If you're into craft beer don't miss this place !!

Admin - please don’t delete this place. It really is one of the best (better than the Indian restaurants no one can find etc).

name: THE Electronics Street
description: Loads of electrics/electronics shops under the basilica and all along the street.   Every connection or part you should need and super cheap too.

name: ALMACEN ING Jacome (gas fittings shop)
description: Apparently the only place in Ecuador who sells adapters for RV vehicles and alike. If you need something gas related for your rig this is the place to come. We were sent here by the nice chap at Enigas put of town. The old guy in charge spoke excellent English too.

name: Park with free WiFi
description: 30min free municipal WiFi network accessible even from parked car.

name: Infocentro Bolaspamba free wifi
description: Free and public info center with free internet, local workstation as well as WiFi.

name: Infocentro Mangahurco free internet
description: Free internet for visitors, just local workstations, not WiFi.

name: Infocentro Cazaderos free internet
description: Free internet for visitors, just local workstations, not WiFi.

name: Hostel la estancia
description: Simple, cheap, clean rooms close to the airport. Private parking. $15 per room.

name: Tuzco Hotel
description: Very nice hotel. Parking available, walkable distance to the beach. Pool, breakfast. They can set up the your to Isla de le Plata for you.

name: small dead end side road from panam
description:
wild campsite with amazing views
you get off the panam just before a bend going south. a dirt road goes down and a new road goes right after about 200m (where the local dump is). that's a dead end which isn't used by vehicles any more. no facilities and free

name: Outdoor goods
description: Small outdoor store/trekking company. Odd selection of gear and small

name: Los apes camping climbing gear
description: Decent small size camping and climbing store, clothing, shoes and gear

name: Cotopaxi equipos
description: Camping climbing and fishing gear, assorted brands but more Coleman gear than high end

name: Canon del Rio Toachi (+camping)
description: Nice place, great canyon. Possible to stay a night. No infrastructure!

name: Canoa beach
description: So we checked out the spot that is right along the path onto the beach, the poster was right it's not very nice, lots of trash and really in view of everyone. The access road leads to the beach and we drove onto it and turned right and drove down the beach. We found a flat spot off the sand right behind the abandoned factory that hides you from the freeway and most of the houses. There is still a lot of debris that washes up with the tide but it was free and safe. Locals drove by on the beach and don't seem to pay any difference. Surf right out front on the beach break. 4wd is a must as the sand is softer the closer you get to the vegetation. Overall nice spot away from everything

name: PetroEcuador
description: Last place we could purchase regular gas before crossing into Peru.  There are stations closer, but either only sell to motorcycles or only have super or diesel. One would only fill one Jerry can with ID! and we have three so we came back here and he filled the other two.

name: Reserva Arenillas
description:
Nature reserve that allows camping in the parking area.  This was apparently on iOverlander previously but was marked closed.  You can stay here for free, with bathrooms, a shower and electricity if you park near the large palapa.  it's 4km off the highway and the closest quiet spot we could find before making a run for Peru next day.  Bano has a seat but no paper. Wi-fi!! 

Coming from Peru - don’t trust Google maps, which will try sending you through a dead-end non-existing road. The only real road is on Transversal Sur/E50 (main highway), turn right when you see the sign for the Reserve and then follow the unpaved road.

name: Supermercado
description: Great grocery store with everything you need including real peanut butter!

name: Garage Luis
description:
Luis the owner is friendly and effective. garage specialized for trucks and buses but has agreed to repair our motorhome. specialist transmission, engine ... large field Park waiting parts, water, electricity possible. speak only Spanish. garage is located near the motel Casa Del Amor and a deposit gas tanks on the edge of a way a little on the outside of the city.

luis le propriétaire est sympathique et efficace. Garage spécialisé pour camions et bus mais a accepté de réparer notre motorhome. Spécialiste en boîte de vitesses, moteur...Grand terrain pour stationner en attendant les pièces, eau, électricité possible. Parle seulement espagnol. Le garage se situe a proximité du motel casa del amor et d'un dépôt de bouteilles de gaz sur le bord d'un chemin un peu à l'extérieur de la ville.

name: Ecuador Immigration Parking Spots
description: Parking spots directly next to back door of Immigration. Police said it was ok to sleep in vehicle. Many travelers camped out around building—- is open 24 hours, so noisy all night. Felt quite safe, bathrooms available all night. Big rigs could fit in lot across the road in other parking lot marked on iOverlander. Parking spots here seemed quieter than the lot at night, but only by a bit.

name: Sangay NP - parking lot 2
description: Personally we felt this parking lot was a tiny bit better than the other one, but you can't go wrong with either.

name: Hostal los Molinos
description: 12$ for a very spacious 1 person room with bathroom and cable TV . wifi in the room . big comfy bed. motorcycle parking half a block down (part of hotel) for 1$. cars 1,5$.

name: TODOTERRENO
description: OFF ROAD shop, we made custom 4x4 parts, suspension works and any kind of metal pieces for your truck.

name: Performance Mechanica Integral
description:
Good mechanics, reasonable prices and an amazingly helpful English- speaking boss. He discounted our price without me asking and did loads of exploratory work for free. He also invited us to use the bathroom any time or get water. 
Open by 8am, closed for lunch 1-2.
Lots of overlander stickers inside (bikes too) despite no-one bothering to add it here. Couldn't recommend highly enough. 
phone: Xavier +593 995515206

name: Max Motor - Mechanic
description:
Brought my Toyota 4Runner here to repair my 4wd, suspension and install a metal panel to shield the engine from underneath. Eduardo took great care of my car. 
Better rates than in Quito. 
Contact Eduardo at +593 99 273 9154

name: Parque Omaere
description:
Small native forest reserve specializing in medicinal plants.  They give walking tour through the forest with good descriptions of plants and the indigenous people of Ecuador.  You can purchase tinctures and medicines made from medicinal plants.

Tours in Spanish, English and French.  The guides are very informative, you can easily spend several hours here, let them know how much time you have.  Worth the $3pp.  

We parked at the nearby Malecón Barrio Obero parking area and paid the guy a dollar (in maps.me).  From there you walk in to the park.

name: Jardín Botánico Las Orquídeas
description:
Incredible place to visit and learn about deforestation effects.This is more of a native jungle restoration project with some orchids growing within.
