Omar has worked for over 30 years on this project and put his heart and soul into it. He explained the devastation the local jungle forest had experienced. Due to the larvae delicacy sold in markets, the multiple varieties of local palms have been eradicated. Even the soil around Puyo isn't fit to grow fruit.

He gladly walked us through his work. His vibrant daughter loved giving us a tour of the photo and bug exhibits.  Our tour was totally in Spanish, Omar only knows a few words of English. 

Omar has also built a special facility for kids with special needs to visit and learn from nature, this is something really special.

name: view of the volcano and nice walk
description: Nice walk through the rainforest with many views of the volcano. Just keep on going on the road past the giant swing, road turns to dirt and is very steep in areas, but the view is well worth it.

name: Full Traccion - 4x4 mechanic
description: Mechanic specialist on 4x4. Does suspension, bumpers, skid plates

name: Volcano View Campground
description: You can find a beautiful canyon about 150 feet deep where you can rock climb after a 20-minute walk. $5pp to camp. At night you can start a campfire in the center of the site.  If needed, rooms are available for USD$40pp a night. Spectacular views of Chimborazo and lots of hiking options.

name: Nice spot next to the river
description: Nice spot to camp next to a clean river 4x4 is preferred

name: Mega Auto
description: car body workshop and painter. they removed dents from our back doors and repainted them. did a very good job at 100 USD per back door. Also had a welding job done here. Overall we were very satisfied with their work and work attitude.

name: Mindo Ziplines Tour (+campground with tour)
description:
There are two zipline operators in Mindo, next to each other. Both seem to have 10 cables. This company is run by 4 brothers from Mindo, the other is a company from Costa Rica.
Double cable system, felt very safe and the guides are very nice. On some lines you can do a guide-accompanied superman (head forward). Cost is 20 USD.

Here you can spend the night in the parking lot if you do the tour. There are clean  toilets available during operating hours 9-17h (may be left open during the night if you ask?). Dog friendly.

name: Tulipe archeological site
description:
Ceremonial pools of the sacred valley of tulipe
3$ entry fee (kids 1$)
schedule wednesday to sunday 9.00am to 5.00pm
they allowed dogs except of the museum

name: Museo Templo del sol
description:
Nice museum on a old inka site
with a exhibition from a indigenouse artist (Ortega Maila)
outside a lot of stone sculptures 
open every day from 9am to 5 pm
small tratitonal dance performance
overnight parking in front of the museum possible, there is a big parking lot, but not level, quiet at night

name: Dental Solutions
description: My husband and I came here to get some dental work. I had a root canal $380, 1 crown $380, 2 fillings $30/$45 and a teeth whitening. My husband also had a crown replaced for $420. It’s a husband and wife team. He speaks English. They are extremely nice and professional, we highly recommended them. We had everything done within a week. WhatsApp +593 998 122 320. 1 Mile from Circulo Militar parking, you can walk or take a taxi $2. www.dentalsolutions.com.ec

name: Camping Cedro (Hotel, Restaurant)
description:
Big flat green area for parking the vehicle in the patio behind the restaurant. Enough clearance to drive into the back (around 4m hight).
Space for around three vehicles.
Close to city center, safe and quiet.
Owners are really helpful and friendly.
They will help you with all your needs. Very close to the hot springs.

Enter from Montavalo street

name: lugar para estacionar sobre calle iguana
description: One of the few places to park in the shade in mompiche, on the iguana street, a little further on from the hostería casa iguana, one block from the beach. Super quiet, many mosquitoes.

name: Fondue Garden
description:
Fondue - cheese, chocolate, and lots more. We refused to pay $20 pp in Banos, but here it's <$20 for two, and even cheaper in day ($18 12pm - 3pm).
If only we'd know it was free corkage! Still happy hour cocktails 5-7pm.

name: Dental Center Dental Laser
description:
It isn't easy to travel with a pain. We found this center, where actually work father and son (which is great if a consultancy is needed), kind of accidentally. I spent two weeks in Macará by regularly visiting this dentist(s), almost on a daily bases, to solve my issue. Well, I'm used to slightly different standards, but I'm not home - we are traveling - and consider this I have to say, with the equipment here, with the approach of the doctor, with his patience and willingness, understanding to explain everything to me - however I speak Spanish just a little - I'm very satisfied and I'm not worrying recommending this place to anyone in need.
P.S. don't get confused, there are two dentists just next to each other.

name: Comedor El Mirador
description: Edmundo & Christina are such kind people. They own a nice piece of land that overlooks the smoky mountains and forest. We camped for free, but purchased some beers from their restaurant. 10/10 would camp here again! Big rig friendly. 4x4 only needed to get to the top part of the property, not necessary though as their is plenty of space below. Bathrooms and a shower available.

name: Fresh Truchas
description: here you can buy fresh truchas directely out of the pool. Perfect for your bbq. Very nice owner.

name: 100% pure honey, miel de abeja
description: Honey and pollen sold here. $5 honey $10 pollen. Local, and super nice people.  Approach the blue 2 story house on the left side of the road.  Approach with caution, there is a dog and he's there to protect his family.  Sweet people and sweet honey.  To exit, make a u turn and head out the same way you came in.

name: Rio Blanco
description: Great space to park or camp on the edge of the river, beautiful scenery, free, without services.

name: Full Standard
description: Mechanical and body Shop. Off-road and all kind of rigs. Owned by off-roaders and racers. Can help with almost everything. Contact +593992668608

name: KaMa Birds wild Camp
description: Big parking next to line bridg (5$) parking free. Nice view. Nice natural sound. Roud no posible for big truck (more to 2.2m, 3.4 and 7m)

name: Hotel Miravalle #2
description: Nice, clean, quite hotel in Aloasí not far from Panamericana and Akí supermarket. Rooms for $15-24/night. Safe parking for bicycles, motos.

name: Auto Class sistemas de escape (muffler shop)
description: This is the place if you have muffler issues. They welded our resonator to the exhaust for $20. Friendly owner and speaks English

name: Paco’s house
description:
Nice place in the middle of the mountains. Paco was so friendly and helped us to fix our camper.
Also, there is a trail “Mirador El Balcón de Hawapata” with a beautiful view of the town. The Quilotoa Volcano is 10 km away. 
Cheap!

name: P&S Petrol Station
description: This is the first place we saw restrictions on fuel. It said no heavy vehicles with international plates. We were able to fill our 6m (19ft) Roadtrek with no problems.

name: PyS Fuel station
description: Gas station before Vilcabamba, there is not one in the town.

name: El tio taller de latoneria
description: Body repair shop : Milto was very nice and efficient just after we got hit by a crazy quad. We were not able to close windows+door on the driver side... after 30 minutes everything was working well for a very honest price.

name: Gas station
description: Gas station with big parking lot. The staff was so friendly. Clean bathroom. Free

name: Land Rover Mechanic - best in Quito
description:
If you are overlanding with a Land Rover, look no further. Edison and his colleagues are members of the Land Rover Club Ecuador and can provide excellent and inexpensive service - also on short notice. But you can WhatsApp well in advance: +593 99 921 2634 (I think Spanish only)
We had our Defender there for a service and everything was perfect

name: P&S griffo parking
description: large lorry parking next to Griffo showers and toilets, 24hr tyre repair shop and armed security all night     Noisey as hell just off the Panam but safe and FREE

name: Flat place beside road
description: Flat place nice for overnight. No facilities. Low traffic during the night and beautiful view in the morning

name: Tu Parada en Cuenca
description:
Family house with a cement parking lot where two cars and several tents can fit. 5 dollars per day per person. Access to the bathroom, kitchen and wifi. RV waste tank dump in corner!
The service is excellent: the family is friendly, flexible and affectionate. the whole place is pretty clean and comfortable.
There is an outside kitchen with a roof and a fridge, fast WiFi. 
They also offer rooms, see other entry in iOverlander.
Whatsapp & Phone: +593999551028

NOTE FOR BIG RIGS: The entrance gate has a height of 3.45m
----
casa de familia con un estacionamiento de cemento donde caben dos carros y varias carpas. pagamos 5 dólares por día por persona. con acceso al baño, la cocina y el wifi
la atención es excelente: la familia es amable, flexible y cariñosa. todo el lugar esta limpio y cómodo. Tubería disponible para aguas residuales.

name: Gas station
description: Big parking lot. Open 24 hours. Bathroom clean. Friendly staff. Free

name: Hostel Cabañas Quilotoa
description: Hotel located besides Dorita Pizzaria. Hot water worked for a while. Bad internet and worst people running the place! We were charged 15 us a night (initially they wanted 12 p/p we negotiated without breakfast). For 3 times someone of the staff entered our room without knocking at the door, at 9 o’clock a woman said that check out was at 10 and we should start leaving!!! Worst experience in Ecuador. Choose somewhere else!

name: Hotel Costa Paraiso
description: Hotel Costa paradise. In front of the hotel, wonderful beach with trees and palm trees. Lot of shade. Free wi-fi .Very quiet and safe.

name: Hotel Margarita 2 + free secure parking
description:
Nice Hotel in a good location. Booked from booking and payed 20 usd for 2 persons and a free private secure parking for 4-5 cars. There is height restriction.
Got a room on the terase with kitchen. Very clean, also fast wifi.

name: Casa de Campo
description:
This is just an AMAZING place. We absolutely fell in love with it. It is an B&B/horseranch with a lot of space for big rigs and tents. Jeannie the owner is a wonderfull host. She is originally from America and speaks perfect english and spanish. 
The B&B has 6 rooms. Hot showers and electricity are available. There are hammocks and even a campfire pit. 
The surroundings are absolutely stunning. There are a lot of trails you can hike. You can do horseback riding or mountainbiking around the Cayambe volcano and  waterfall.
If you are around Quito and need a place to just relax and enjoy the nature than this is the place to stay!
The place does'nt have a set adress. Coming from calle napo after about 1 km you will see a blue water tank on your left. At this point you will take the road to your right. Follow the road for about 0,5 km till you see a yellow house with a green rooftop on your right. This is Casa de Campo

name: Casa Jaguar
description: place of rest and tranquility, place for parking, camping and services to be comfortable, any contribution to the house is always welcome, have a house when you can. near the beach. please notify your visit in advance.

name: Thalassa Greek Taverna
description: North Indian and Greek food. Prices are a little high around $7-$10 per dish but the Indian food is very good and authentic. The owner and chef is West Indian and it shows.

name: Moto Parts
description:
Good Mechanic for Motorcycls.
have some parts but only the chinese.
But there is possible to send eine parts form Cuenca
tel.: 2273198

name: Boulder Fields
description: There are quite a few climbable boulders in this area, although a lot of it would need a bit of work to clean off lichen on problems over V1.  This GPS location had the easiest and cleanest problems I found in my short morning climbing session, with a couple overhung problems.

name: Mi Comisariato
description: The store you can buy everything at. Very good place to stop if you are coming north after crossing the border from Peru. Guarded parking lot and no height restrictions.

name: Parque Tena
description: Parking lot in side of a big park in the center of Tena. Free. Toilets and games for kids and sports. Possible to stay on the parkings on both side of the park. A bit noisy until 11PM but quiet enough. A good spot for the period from wednesday to sunday when the disco is on at the other side of the river (other free spot ioverlander)

name: Lumicon Farm
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this post was added by the owner. Has not been Overlander verified.

Place on the river beach  in between the mountains and the amazon ,close to a national park , with many crystal rivers and waterfalls perfect for bathing..simple jungle  cabin living, volunteering, retreats. Connecting with the nature and with ourselves, off the grid living with a deeper sense.....

name: hostal ayora
description: hostal decided to fill my room that was already booked on bookings . com  Dishonest owner would would not even look at his computer even though I had a confirmation  BE WARNED

name: Little church
description: Very quiet level lot in front of a small church aside a small village Playa del Carmen. There are 3~4 houses around, not much inhabited, and with street light. Nothing fancy but perfect sleep near to Cuenca without police.

name: Near cemetery/topiary gardens
description: Park on same side of street as the cemetery/topiary gardens but down the street – not in front of them. Overnight o.k. anywhere in town that doesn’t say “no parking” or have yellow lines. Don’t miss the topiary gardens. They are awesome! And free.

name: Sunday market
description: A lot of farmers came here with fresh vary vegetables and fruits, great selections! There are also clothes and other daily needs. The locals came with beautiful traditional dresses we saw no tourist.

name: Refugio Guagua-Pichincha
description:
This is the Refuge Hut short before the summit of Guagua Pichincha. You can get here on a very steep dirt road starting in Loa. Depending on your car you will reach the refuge or park it further down (without 4wheel drive this is what you will do).

Also you can hire a 4*4 taxi that will bring you up to a flat space for 20$ (just ask anybody with a pickup in the village), from there you will walk approx. 1h to the refuge.

There is nobody up here overnight (somebody came in the morning, not sure if that’s every day) but keys are next to the door on a string and there are 16 bunk beds without sheets inside. There is also plenty of space for tents although with the cold wind you will maybe consider sleeping inside. If you reach the refuge by car there is enough space for any kind of rig. 
There is no possibility to cook but tanks of rainwater. 

After we slept here we started at eight in the morning, reached the summit half an hour later, crossed the valley to Rucu Pichincha which we reached at 2pm and then took the TeleferiQo (5$ one way) down to Quito again. 
Enjoy!

name: Mirador Toachi
description:
A lovely family runs this Mirador. There is a parking lot, a small forest and stunning views into the canyon. Over the days they sell food and drinks and although there is no offer that says so they let us stay over the night. When asked what to pay they didn't know so we gave them 10$ for the 3 of us. There is running water (not sure if potable but in this altitude you probably can), a clean toilet and plenty of space for more than one big rig. Tent camping is possible in between the trees.
Only downside, the parking lot is right next to the street but it seems there is not a lot of traffic in the night.

name: Amazing climbing spot Santa Clara Alta
description:
There are three different spots for sport climbing down the river with route difficulties from 4 to 8. You get there following a little path down the river from the other iOverlander spot "Cascada Condor Machay". There you will also find camping possibilities. Tent camping is also possible down here but no other facilities except the river. Bring your climbing equipment and enjoy the beautiful nature! And of course take your trash!
For more information and Topos of this area and other climbing spots in Ecuador visit www.monodedoecuador.com

name: Playa Negra
description:
It is a somewhat scratchy and quite steep road to get here so 4x4 is a must and we don't advise trying to get there when the road is wet.
But once you reach the turn you'll be regarded with amazing views. In the turn there is enough space to turn around and park, maybe even for two smaller vehicles. 
The road leads down to the beach that you have to yourself in the morning and in the evening. Sunsets are stunning. One night the water was lit up from phosphorus algaes.

name: By the river
description:
Because we had to wait until Monday for a mechanic to open we settled here.
Next to this place is a pumping station where Pepe, a nice guy is working at night. He told us it is not save but we had a good feeling about it and nothing happened. You are not visible from the street so we doubt anyone except him will notice you.

name: Mecanico Pererez
description: These guys quickly found the reason for our leaking cooling water and repaired it in no time for a super fair price.

name: lacho Pasajeros
description: Guilmay is the only efficient personwho is  selling inter island tickets for 25$ Every body else sells for 30$ which adds up if you are trying to see as much as possible.Buy a return ticket as there is only one sales point HERE on Santa Cruz .you can always telephone them with the number on your ticket to change the date or time ask for a  card.

name: Hostal RNC
description: Nice and cheap hostel. We paid 17USD for a matrimonial room with private bathroom. From outside it stinks a little, but the rooms are nice and clean. They have space to outro the bikes inside. It was ok for a night, it doesn’t have internet but the guy gave us the password of the neighbours WiFi.

name: casa taller soroche de los andes
description: family country house with a big garden for free camping, toilet, shower and avocado trees

name: Quinta la Posada
description:
As of right now, this place is open again. Stefany and Santiago have great plans for this site. As is, it’s good for overlanders of all kinds, except big rigs, because the gate has exactly 3 meters of clearance only. Plans are in the works already to raise the clearance to at least 3.5 meters.
While the restaurant is still closed (may reopen later), an indoor kitchen is available for overlanders to use. There also is a wood-fired outdoor kitchen with bbq and earthen bake oven.
There is a large grassy area to park vehicles and pitch tents, and four cabañas with private bathrooms are available for rent. In addition, foundations have been set for two A-frame huts and a rustic log cabin. The small pool is no longer in service.
The water is good to drink; we’re there right now, and we do. Outside faucets are available. Wifi does not reach the camping area, but it worked well in the restaurant and common areas.
Stefany may be reached by phone and WhatsApp: 593 983 105 079

name: Rio Catamayo Turnout
description: Nice quiet little turnoff just after bridge when heading north. Bit of a small sand and gravel operation but level parking spot about 6 feet above river bank suitable for any size rig(s) 2 or 3 could easily fit in. Concrete bench close to river. Water was clear in evening however with light rain it changed to muddy from further up stream overnight. Not visible from road as you are down a small hill next to bank with road way above. Almost no cars overnight. A local person said no problem for camping here. We enjoyed a peaceful night here.

name: Parking lot in Riobamba
description: - Parking at a tire store/gym fitness center   We were told that street parking is not safe. We stayed in a parking lot for a tire store called “Importadora Turjillo” and “Dayfer Gym & Fitness” for $2 a night. Gate closed 10:00 pm to 8:30 am but security guard can open it for emergency. Closed on Sunday. You could stay over on Saturday and security guard would let you out but no one could come in on a Sunday. Security cameras also. Contact very nice young lady or young man in the tire store to make arrangements. You must arrive from the north side because it is a oneway street. Turn right immediately after the PS gas station, cross the RR tracks and drive straight into the lot.  Fairly quiet. 1.5 - 2 km to main plaza areas.

name: Gas station
description:
Parking at the gas station on route 30. We bought diesel and he didn’t charge us to park overnight. Water but not sure if potable or not. Fairly quiet.

update: this is a retired station. no longer in service.

name: Hotel Borivi
description: This is a great place. 15$ for a double room with private bathroom. Simples but very clean, central and with internet. A bit noisy during the day, but it is ok. We could leave or bikes upstairs.

name: Solo Clásicos
description: workshop specialist car cooled air. Fernando yunga is your owner. a great mechanical. the best car Volkswagen in Basin.

name: Gas station Mobil with huge parking area
description:
We tryed find some parking lot for night, but we wont sleep in city. This gas station is near main road, not in village. There is a huge parking area for FREE parking. Some trucks are sleeps there too. 
Baňos are there and they are for FREE too. Just need yours own toilet paper.

name: Bamboo Camp Beach
description: Beautiful place for camping with all confort.

name: Parador El Saman
description: This place has amazing local snacks. They make fresh yogurt, empanadas, chocolate, yuca bread, piqueos, marmelade and all we ate was delicious! Totally worth to stop by. They also have a big parking lot, so you may be able to camp with big rigs but it can be noisy as it is by te highway.

name: Fast Laundry with drying
description:
In two hours. We had 7 kg and price was 7USD, so $1 per kilo. Wash and dry, no ironing. Good price and nice people.

Opening time: 
Monday to Saturday 8:15 - 12:15; 2:15 - 6:30 Pm.
Sunday 8:15 - 12:15; 2:15 - 5:30 Pm.

name: Street parking near mirrador
description: Last chance at night for safe parking. This spot is on street in village Pomona. There is mirador to the jungle and some trail. Next to the building “Ministerio del Interior” with toilets which are for free.

name: Lisan Wasi Kichwa Village
description:
Kichwa Village in the jungle. Here you can park your car and take a walk for  about 1 km. You will find a nice place with bamboo houses, garden of orchids and small culture of nice family. You can also stay here in bamboo house for some days and take a rest.
Traditions, ceremonies, medicinal plants, baby wooly monkey, artesanías, blowing darts etc.
Very kind people trying to preserve and share their way of life. 
Spanish or basic English.

name: The end of Road
description:
Just take left side (way to Macas) and go straight on. There are some houses around the road, but nobody was there. 
This is end of road, so good place for night. Under trees, calm place. You can make fire here, if you want - just need some wood.
Enjoy and good night

name: Lavanderia Lava Facil
description: New lavanderia.  Recently opened. 4 washing machines of different sizes with a very big (3.50$ 7.50$ machine).  Several dryers. Lady very nice.

name: Pasohurco (quechua-paso de agua)
description: This family owned place is a perfect stop in this area if you are looking for a place to sleep and really good food. The food was fantastic and cheap and they didn't even charge me for camping. I gave them 5$for 2 nights. The toilets are very clean and they have showers. Big parking lot outside and a great view. highly recommended

name: Parque Lago
description:
We were surprised that this place was not here before! Parque Lago is a National Park. Very quiet even during the Easter holliday. You are alowed to camp here for free, lots of tables and barbecue areas. Clean toilet with toilet paper and cold shower. The parking lot is big and looks good for big rigs. Energy point by the administration. A few locals playing volleyball and biking around. The park closes the gates at 18pm and there are guards during the night. Feels safe and the staff were super friendly and happy that we were there. 
—-
Access: Coming from the west you have to do a u-turn (on the highway!) about 250 m before the toll station. Take the bicycle path(!) for about 200 m to the gate of the NP.

name: Los Sanduches de Doña Piedad
description: A Cuenca institution since 1975, Señora Piedad and her daughter Miriam serve the best little turkey and porc sandwiches for $1.85 each. Slow roasted for 8 hours with secret spices and served on a small bun with spicy sauce and you add a bag of chips and coconut juice and you have the perfect lunch. Open Monday to Friday 8:30am-8:30pm, Saturday 9:00am-1:30pm, Sunday closed. Many have tried to copy then and you will see many similar restaurants in the area but this is the original!

name: Behind bus-stop
description:
When you are going to Loja, take right side and there is a gate to the some turistic atraction. After your turn you will see bus-stop (parada), behind this building is place which is covered by rock. This spot is not available from main street E35, so for night it is good.
There are nice views to hills and nature around. Not so noisy and FREE. Good night 💤

name: Mechanic Jonny Sambrano
description: Our car died in San Jacinto and we were introduced to Jonny Sambrano. He is an amazing mechanic that knew exactly what to do. Our car had been experiencing decompression and mechanics in Peru did not want to touch it and they quoted US$3500. Our mechanic in Argentina verified that he would charge also U$3500 to do the work if we could make it down there.Johnny did all the work and rectified all the parts of the motor for $1000. We can now continue our way north into Colombia and we know that our car will take us safely all the way down to Argentina. We highly recommend Jonny. He knows a lot and it’s a very honest person. It may be a little hard to find his place ask around as he is very well known.

name: Rio Anzu
description: turn off the main road to follow this location onto a tarmac road then unsealed . The route is not on Mapsme so follow the river direction ... the large carpark with river and mountin views is flat and friendly ... the SMALL vehicle bridge can also be attempted to stay on the other side ....much  better than the Griffos?

name: Grand Canon del Hutaraco Mirador
description: Elevated parking and camping (your own tent or in a cute Refugio ) of the mirador, sheltered seating area, fire pit and wood, showers, toilets and a washing machine if you need it, Wifi will be available in the future. The site is still being improved ... amazing views into Samaco national park and the  Volcano and down onto the Rio Coca. Worth getting up at dawn. Lionel who lives here with his family has a wealth of knowledge of the whole area. Lots to see and do from this location from the usual chocolate factory to ancient mollusk shell fossil caves..  he speaks perfect English and is interested in sharing his pride in his area rather than ripping  you off . 5$ camping. donation to park in camper!.( unclear as no casarodante have been here!) negotiation on use of washing machine...less road noise than other sites on this route

name: Bridge over deep canyon
description: A real beautiful place. The small bringe over the canyon and the river is stunning. You should see it, when you pass Banos, it is just a few meters away from the main road.

name: Cuenca Escape Room
description: Cuenca Escape Room, incredible fun and very good price a hour of fun!!! Something new to do in Cuenca!

name: Hostal mi madrigal
description: Nice cheap hotel in Tulcán. We asked around town but this was our best option. Hot shower, WiFi, tv, big room (three beds, four cyclists and four bikes and doesn’t feel cramped) for $24... the owner is very nice and originally asked $8pp but was open to negotiation. He also said we could use our stove which other hotels wouldn’t!

name: Laguna de cube community
description:
Community run hostel and jungle tour association. The machu-chindul reserve is a hidden gem. It’s a humid tropical forest, separated from the Amazon because of the rise of the Andes. This means a lot of the same wildlife as in the Amazon (monkeys, caimans) and some endemic species but with better roadacces (1 hour on fairly good gravel road, we made it with our 2WD, but can be difficult if it rains a lot).
The hostel is community run and all of them are super friendly! 
Price: camping with our car was free, while a bed (room size depending on preference) was 12 US dollar per person. Every meal was 3 dollar including juice and fruits. They went out of their way to please every wish we had and Manuel (ranger) gave us private tours in the reserve. When we were there we saw no other tourists and there were fewer mosquitos then the Peruvian and Bolivian Amazon.
To conclude: a cheaper and more authentic way to do a jungle tour.

name: Café En-Dulce
description: Very nice place for breakfast, coffee, good bread and cakes and pralines! Prices are very well, food is delicious and beverages too. The ambiance is very nice and you can watch how cakes, bred and croissants are baked.

name: Panadería Artesanal
description:
Sourdough ciabatta, rye or regular bread fresh from a huge wood fire stone oven. Enjoy! 
Sweets are super tasty.

name: Hosteria San Jose
description:
lovely farm hotel with large indoor pool, awesome showers, game room

we paid $3 to park our van and use showers for 2 adults and 2 kids plus $8 for pool and sauna for adults and $5 for kids. pool is indoor and very warm. 

there’s a water spigot. 

plenty of flat space for numerous cars and rigs.

name: E10 treetop carpark
description: quiet ,safe ,free, you can position your rig to not be seen from the road at the carpark next to an unused football field Great treetop view once the rain stopped

name: Gas Station
description: Gas station with room for big rigs. Free. Small food store and a hotel on each side. Noisy but not problem with ear plugs. Got 5 gallon water bottles 200 meters away for 90 cents a bottle and siphoned it into our tank. Were able to drive right in front of the water place so very convenient. -.91894  -80.44523

name: Hacienda el Sinche
description: Really lovely hacienda with great food. Owner Xavier showed us his cows and the milking process which was really interesting. Had a great lunch (soup, rice, egg, cheese and desert) for 7usd pp. Cheeses are homemade and soo good!! 6 generations of cheese-makers at this hacienda. Rooms are 50 usd each including meals, but did not see them cause way too expensive for us ;-) you can also camp at his place

name: Kallari Chocolates & Cacao
description:
Geovanny is an absolutely lovely guy who works for Kallari chocolates.
He gave us a very local and informative cacao tour in the surroundings of Tena, including tasting fresh cacao, roasted cacao, as well as selfmade chocolate fondue and Kallari chocolates itself at the end.
We did the whole process from harvesting till eating grilled bananas with the chocolate fondue at some locals house next to the cacao farm in the jungle.
He offers different kind of tours, depending on what you like to experience. Our tour cost us 15 $ per person and endured from 09:00 - 13:30, which was really worth it.

Opening times are:
Mo-Fr: 08:00-17:00
Sat-Sun: on request
If no one is at the office, just give him a call or write an mail and arrange a private tour with him.
Geovanny Grefa: 0983667077
Office: 062847050
Mail: paulg20007@hotmail.com

name: super maxi (supermarket)
description: decent place, big parking lot, good veggies and fruit and everything else. bottle of Jack Daniels (750ml) is $70usd!

name: Hotel Swisspoint
description: nice place, secure parking inside for motos, fast wifi, nice rooms (super clean) with good bathroom and mini fridge. pool, outdoor seating area, each room has a table/chairs outside. auto parking out front, can be found on booking.com, $30 for a double (2 people, typical small bed)

name: Quiet place away from the street
description: Nice big place between restaurant and hospedaje. Flat with grass. Hided from the street. Quiet. For one night perfect. We asked the people from the hospedaje before and it was ok. 10$.

name: Hostal 4 Rios
description: Nice hostel. Parking is secure and covered, but the entrance probably only has about 8 ft of clearance. Owners were very welcoming. $10 dorm, $20 private. Internet was OK.

name: Petrol station
description: Nice patrol station which let us fill our water tank. The worker says it’s portable.

name: Street parking
description: West of Guayaquil on a divided street just off route E40. Park on the side facing E40 because that side is wider. We asked police if we could park overnight and they told us to park there (right across from the police station) and if we had any trouble to come to them. We were in front of a small grocery store that is open all night. Fairly quiet. As a courtesy, ask the police.

name: mega maxi and huge mall
description: big supermarket, unlike the other little one that is marked (did not even have bananas or peanuts), this one has it all. height restrictions to enter the garage, can even get an oil change! The mall is 3 stories, lots of stuff

name: Huillacuna
description: We highly recommend this hostel, super quiet, cozy and cozy place. Great kitchen, hot shower, internet and rooms. We paid $ 10 per person without breakfast, with breakfast included the amount is that $ 15. The little busy street, parking place in front of the hostel and very safe, we leave our van without any problems.

name: trout fishing and restaurant/ cabin
description: asked if we could park overnight and they agreed to $5. seems we might have been the 1st. trout fishing ponds and small playground area. dogs barking a lot. shower in the room they opened for us was supposed to be hot but barely warm. nice fireplace in the restaurant. mediocre spot.

name: Dr.Go
description: $20 for review and health very for the agricultural office. Vaccinations, products and very helpful and friendly service. Speaks English

name: Carpas Cali
description: This store makes custom covers for tents (events), rooftop tents, sun protectors, truck cab covers, etc... they have a heat press machine and get all their materials from Colombia... the owner Rodrigo Carlosama and his family do excellent work and WAY cheaper than anywhere you will find in Colombia (trust me I know) or Peru... I paid only $80 for a completely new cover for my Howling Moon Rooftop camper... he made the new one perfectly with only 2 days notice.  Very happy with the work and the price.  Rodrigo’s Mobile/whatsapp is +592992150151 / local 0992150151

name: Wilson Machilana Garage
description: This place was recommended by Hans from Sommerwind... Wilson specializes in painting vehicles and did a fantastic job sanding, prepping and painting the bottom of my Hilux.  I spent a lot of time on the coast in Colombia driving through roads flooded with salt water and the corrosion was everywhere.  Wilson and 3 of his guys worked  just on my truck and finished in 1 day, talk about fast!  And they didn’t cut any corners.  I supervised the job to make sure, and they did very good work.  Only $200 USD for everything.  Great deal and very satisfied.  Highly recommended should you need any paint work done or want to take care of your undercarriage.

name: Casa de Hacienda La Jimenita
description: Beautiful and peaceful place. Parking place in the garden of the hotel with grass. Safe  with a big close door in the front. The hotel is amazing and a lot of hummingbirds are around. Thay have a big area with tracks and Lamas. The people are very nice and friendly. We stayed there for a few days and during the galapagos trip. 15 $  a day. Please ask before coming: reserves@jimenita.com

name: Gas station
description: Just west of Piñas on route E585.Clean restrooms with toilet paper, toilet seats, water, soap, and air dryer. Several restaurants and tiendas right there. Not quite level.

name: Marisqueria el cabana
description: Excellent restaurant on the E50, easy parking , just next to the main road. Try their parillada de marisco - 12 $ - seafood selection grilled- absolutely a must! They have WiFi too!

name: Chevrolet Dealership
description:
If you are in need of any Chevy service, ask for Juan. He speaks great English and was able to help us get a diagnostic check up on our truck. They don’t stock parts for US made trucks, but he went out of his way to call all of his contacts to find what he could. Outstanding service here. He recommended we travel with more than one fuel filter as back up and even wrote us a letter for customs in case they ask why we travel with spare parts (they can assume we are selling them and tax us). 

He was able to find an air filter for us to replace our dirty one. He had us go purchase the filter in town so we didn’t have to pay extra for Chevy installing it. He even arranged transportation for us to buy it. 

The fuel filter is not common in Ecuador so we still need to find one - the hunt continues. 

Still amazing service and hopefully you have your own fuel filters as back up.

name: Hotel Marcia
description:
Hotel and Restaurant on main street opposite a gas station. Cost of a double room 20$ but the Lady was so nice to give it to us for 15$. 
Clean standard room with secured parking behind the hotel. A lot of space for cars and motorbikes. Gate is locked overnight.

name: Hotel La Chorrera N*1
description:
We had double room with AC for 15$ for 2 people. No window and not the cleanest room but it was ok for one night. 
Garage for Motorbike available as well.

name: Italian Restaurant
description: Awesome authentic Italian restaurant run by Italians from Rom. Amazing Pizza and even better Lasanga. Definitly recommend this restaurant as we ate there for a week every night.

name: Residencial Loja
description:
Hotel with wide entrance to the courtyard where you can park your cars and motorcycles. Simple double room with shared bathroom is 6$ per person. 
Also 6$ for a single private room.

name: Hostal Caribe
description:
Hotel with courtyard for secured parking  (cars and motorcycles
). Simple double room with shared bathroom 5$ per person. Really hot shower with pressure!!!

name: Tour Guide Luis Ramos and juan carlos
description:
To us, a group of 3 and a puppy, a guide called Guillermo was also recommend on the boat trip to NR. 
Somehow we felt that he and the other official guides around the hostel were to pricey for what they offered. So we started to walk around and looked for a independent guide/local and we found Señor Luis Ramos.
At the beginning we weren't sure if we could trust him, because what he offered us seemed too good! But he kept his word and made our jungle experience unforgettable.
We told him that we've tents and food with us and that we'd need him only as guide. We stayed for 3 days/2 nights and he charged us 20 dollars a day per person. Probably the price was that low because it was during the low season, but he also told us that he liked our attitude and way of traveling.
So what he finally did for us included the boat rides to his camp ground in the jungle, he put up huge tarps against the rain, brought water and food (sweet water sting ray for breakfast!), took us cayman and dolphin watching, piranha fishing and guided us through the jungle on hours hikes. He's flexible with the program and really incorporates your suggestions into the day trips.
This man as guide (his observation skills are truly outstanding) and friend was more than we could ever think of and we can highly recommend this person to everyone out there even if he would charge more money!!
You can reach him directly (only with Ecuadorian phone number)+593969868807 or message his son Raúl on whatsapp
+593968095175.

name: Finca Miel Del Cielo
description: We are a rustic farm and have outdoor areas for camping as well as a rustic cabaña that we rent and a fully furnished house with kitchen, queen bed and bath tub. We have outdoor kitchen facilities and bathroom and showers. We have camping with views of our own cascadas as well as creeks and mountainside to enjoy. We are starting a winery and have mead of several local flavors to try and purchase. If you're interested in coming by for a wine tasting or need a place to stay please email at mieldelcielomindo@gmail.com. We are unavailable all Saturday's for tours or check in however checkins on Friday afternoon and checkout for Sunday are acceptable. Absolutely no parties as we work hard most days and need our sleep at night.

name: feelglamping
description: A new experience of lodge glamour and camping located in a perfect site to enjoy your vacation in Canoa.

name: Pantavi Hosteria and Spa
description: Nice little hotel which leaves no wishes open. It offers besides nice rooms with hot showers a small swimming pool, a Sauna Bath and a Turkish Bath.  The restaurant serves good food and the crew is motified and professional.

name: Balsa Surf Camp
description:
Amazing atmosphere at this beautiful hostel. It is located really close to the main surf point. We were able to stay in the secure parking lot with our Truck camper. The owner Rasty and his wife Julie like the idea of overlanders at their hostel. Over the next two months they are planning to build showers and toilets for overlanders. 
As per now they offer cabanas and you can use the toilet at the restaurant. The restaurant on site offers delicious healthy food. Furthermore they offer yoga classes (free for paying guests) and surf lessons. There are hammocks on the lovely property for your use as well as decent WiFi. We were able to fill up with water and plug into electricity as well. The entrance is large enough for big rigs, but there is a tree that you need to navigate around which can make it challenging, but doable. Lovely spot! 

Feel free to contact Rasty or Julie under: 
balsasurfcamp@gmail.com
Www.balsasurfcamp.com
Tele:
00593(0) 42060075

name: Armas family hotel
description: A simple hotel, 10usd. Tv with bad sígnal, wifi, cold shower.

name: Salvador Hostel
description:
10usd for room, clean , smart tv and fast wifi.
Our bikes inside

name: Unimédicos
description: Av. Remigio Crespo Toral 2-160. phone number: 0996381621 Dra. Marìa Andrea Sànchez and a male doctor. Two excellent young doctors both speak English and Spanish, $25 USD for a thorough consultation, saw me 30 minutes after I called.

name: basquetball place
description: parking safe water internet electricity super safe and no sound night

name: Cozy church camping
description:
If you walk one block away from the river, you will find a closed church with plenty of space in front of the door. The entry has due to a huge roof a perfect protection from rain and two plugs to recharge your batteries! Around the corner on the right side of the street in front of the church follow the road back to the river, on the left side you will find free drinking water as much as you need! 
We talked to the locals, it's ok to camp here, very quite at night. Seems the church is just open once a week, probably on Saturday morning but this info is from the local kids. Perfect spot before heading into the Yasuní National Park.

name: Melyang Hostel
description: Grass area in the garden for two or three van size vehicles or tents. You can use the shower in one of the rooms. Kitchen and dining room is available and included in the price. Terrace on the covered roof is beautiful. You can fill-up your tank from the tap in the garden. They have laundry for additional price and a free sink for washing in the garden. Price is 3$ pp. We paid 5 for two of us and van. Water is not drinkable unless you boil or filter.

name: Viva Mexico
description: Emerson is a friendly and talented Mexican cook who has established a small restaurant 1 block from the town square.  His burritos and tacos are delicious and his homemade hot sauce is so good you’ll be trying to buy some to take home with you!  He speaks excellent English and is very knowledgeable about the town and tours and can advise you on pricing and things to do.  Highly recommended place for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  He lives at the restaurant and if he isn’t open don’t hesitate to just ring his mobile 0987008471

name: Indigenous Catequilla Equator Line Marker
description:
Did you know the Mitad del Mundo isn’t really on the equator???  It’s about 200m off!

Come up here instead.  There’s a tall metal sculpture at the top of a hill that marks the equator, this area is significant to the Incas. Come up this dirt road and look down into the valley and enjoy the view.  We thought that this was a great alternative to the tourist trap in the valley.  

Probably could camp here too.

name: Fresco Cafe
description:
Nice cafe for breakfast, lunch, coffee and sweets. Good coffee and heavenly carrot cake! All vegetarian and vegan options. Staff is really friendly and the iced tea is jummy (ginger). 
And free filtered water!

name: Cabañas Camarones
description: After the Earth quake the owner starts to rebuilt the completely destroyed site. 5 of the 7 cabañas are ready to be used. Very nice place directly at the seashore with palm trees, a nice restaurant and good food. The cabañas are simple but nice to be.

name: Imbavet
description: Good veterinary service for your dog. My dog had an elbow inflammation and it was taken care with high professional knowledge.

name: Tsanka Nunka
description:
Opportunity to visit a “real deal” Finca.

From Zamora towards Yantzaza there is a big bridge at a point called Saquea and you drive towards the left direction to Yacuambi. The next town is Piuntza. After the main square two streets, make a right and you are leaving Piuntza towards El Carmelo. You go over one small bridge, a minute after a second bridge and thirty seconds after you come about a curve and on your left hand side there is a roofed bridge. That is the Finca owned by Leoncio. He just started planting lots of stuff and you can learn, help or just tour his property with lots of medicinal plants and also Yuca and Plantanes. If you are on bike you can camp on his property but if you are on your car,or RTT on the side of the road. Not much traffic at night, quiet enough. Big rigs may be too heavy for the bridges, would need to check.

name: Petro Ecuador
description: Will not sell gas to Colombian plates. Told to drive on for 100 kilometers to the next gas station. Cash only.

name: PSy
description: First spot we found that would sell us (folks with non-Ecuadorian plates) gasoline. It's on the left (heading SW from Tulcan & the Colombian border) past the second toll booth.

name: Mercedes Benz
description: Having an axle to replace on my Sprinter 4x4, I have been very pleased to meet Lionel speaking English. Instead of replacing the axle by a new one only available in Germany, he des assembly the defective part and replaced them with new one for 1/3 of the price. You can call him 09 8 331 9204.

name: Hostal Aya Huma
description:
Hostal with campground area. The space can fit several vans, large ones too. Kitchen, Bathroom and shower close by camping area, hot shower a short walk away though trees. Wifi at reception. Restaurant attached. $4 pp.
The reception and parking area are separate and you can't drive to reception directly as there are railroad tracks. Just follow Google maps to Hostal Aya Huma, there are a bunch of signs for it in the neighborhood. Park and walk across unused train tracks to reception/restaurant. They will direct you to parking area. Cool place!
They do sweat lodges for $15 pp right by the camping area.

name: Raft Amazonia
description: A great tour operator for rafting, kayaking, canoeing. Run by a Quichua family: father and sons with extended members of the family involved. Super friendly and great fun.

name: Comundad Cotocoche
description: Community of indigenous where you can tour their community. Nice artwork, Jewelry for sale. Let us try their blow darts. Offered to take us down the river in authentic conoe , but water was told swift for us that day.  Cool metal swinging bridge to walk to community. Small area for Parking at the bridge.

name: La Casa Azul del mirador
description:
Nice place, newly established with cabañas equipped with private bath and warm shower. The cabañas are equipped with kitchen. Beautiful view over Puerto Lopez. Open since April 2018. The restaurant serves preferrably italien food like pizza and pasta! In the afternoon between 18:00 and 19:00 happy hour! The Swiss/ Ecuatorian/Italian-owners keep the place clean to European Standards.
Price depending on season between 30 and 50$.
Tel. +593 99 392 57 02

name: Roots Backpackers Hostel
description: Super modern. Clean. Clean quiet neighborhood. Plenty of street parking. No “secure” garage but I honestly didn’t feel it necessary. I left everything strapped to my bike out front. I think it was about $17 USD/night

name: Parqueadero Santo Domingo
description: parking lot near historic area. $5 for day , $3 for night. got there at 4 pm and will be $4.50 until 8 am. 75c/hr

name: Friends Hostel
description: Not a bad hostel in a great location for old Town. About $21 a night for private double. Hot shower in room. Kitchen facilities pretty clean, WiFi is ok. Parking nearby at lots but not included. Santo Domingo seems to be cheapest in area.

name: Ecuador Immigration
description: We arrived at the Ecuadorian immigration, it was already 3 pm, we stayed for 4 hours in the queue to get out of Ecuador and another 1 hour to enter Colombia, as it was too late, we made friends with one of the Ecuadorian guards and asked if we could sleep here, he said that Customs is super safe and quiet, so we were parked right in front of the guards. We slept very well and it was very peaceful.

name: Mecanica Amazonas - Taller de soldadura
description: Marcos worked in this workshop doing autogenous and electrical welding work. He helped us repair the engine support of our Kombi that was rotten and had fallen off. It was a very complicated job because of the precision that is needed but Marcos solved it perfectly. He also let us sleep in his workshop, where there is a bathroom and shower.

name: Balneario Batancocha
description: Beautiful place to camp by the river. There are bathrooms available and small shelters to use. We went off season, and the people in charge there Let us camp for free. There River is fresh and really nice to have fun with children.

name: Urku Wasi Hotel and Restaurant
description: A family hotel and restaurant with good Almuerzo. We had lunch here and they offered to bring us to Quilotoa and a room. Very friendly!

name: ProBici
description: Great mountain bike tours can be organised here. We did a day tour down Chimborazo using mainly backroad trails. It was a great day out, amazing scenery and vicuñas Cost $60pp.  They also organise many other one day and two or three day tours.  High on safety. Great guide and support vehicle in case of problems. The tour we chose started  at 4,800m. We hiked to 5,100m to a lake and then returned to 4,800 m to start our bike tour along a dedicated MB path. Highly recommended. Www.probici.com

name: Hostal Girón
description: nice little hostel in town, close to restaurants, stores, and plaza. off the main highway, so quiet at night. all rooms with shared bathroom. $7/person. wi-fi, tv with cable, suicide shower that actually got hot. they allowed us to park our two big motos inside--could easily fit more. gotta go up a curb to get in. nice young couple runs it.

name: Puyo
description: Free camping possible under a placed roof next to the walking route along the river. Visible but safe. Close to the city Puyo, only accessible by bicycle or walking. Free parking on a parking lot nearby.

name: Tecnifaissa filters
description: We are driving a vehicle that is not commercialized in Ecuador and ran out of fuel filters. The people at Tecnifaissa were  able to do six at five dollars a piece in 24 hours. We highly recommend them. This was after we went to every possible store in Quito, North Ecuador and south of Columbia.

name: Garner Espinosa Diesel Specialists
description:
Diesel specialists. Really good thorough people that saved us. Our car was having major issues with valves, bujias and they were able to find all parts which it was kind of a miracle since our vehicle doesn’t exist in Ecuador. We highly recommend them. We arrived here after the recommendation from the team at the Renault dealership. They have a top of the line lab onsite and for 3 U$ they rotated our tires!
Señor Ruben is the admin manager and Alejandro is the Lab manager. Both solid people that went above and beyond to find the issues, find the parts and solve our problem.

name: T-Drones
description: If you are like us looking for a place to repair any kind of drone, this is the place to be ! really friendly and fast people.

name: Hostelito
description: Nice "Pod" hostel with small secure garage for motorcycles. $11 per night with a good breakfast.

name: El Refugio
description:
Pools for $16
Massage $33
Steam box $9

Fun place, very clean seeming. Great service. You get half a pineapple at the end. Lots of tea too.

name: playa free camp
description: On the beach. Shade with trees. Public restrooms for 0,1-0.25 Dollars. Very good and safe spot.

name: Argos clinic vets
description: English speaking vet. Very informative. $12 for flea drops. Can do papers if required

name: Hostal Micronia
description: Cheap and cheerful. We paid USD$22 per night for the two of us. - air conditioning - en-suite - central location - charged per room! - decent wifi

name: Huasi Quñi
description: really lovely family run hostal. we found it on booking for $22/night for a matrimonial with bathroom, breakfast included. breakfast was bread, cheese, jam, eggs, fresh fruit, fresh juice, and coffee. secure parking, though with some size restriction--not a problem for motos up to SUV. there is a fully furnished kitchen you can use, and a covered terrace with sofas and chairs to relax on. we thought this was a really great value for this area. easy walking distance to everything in the city.  highly recommended!

name: Cafeteria Incas -at Curinan hostel-camping
description: Great cafe located opposite hostel curinan, in the rural setting of octavalo. Walk up the cobbled street butte railway track and get a cheap cafe with a fantastic view of mountain cotocatchi. Organic foods at local prices. Sandwiches $2.50, coffee$1.50, tradional soup $2.50. Super friendly family run cafe and worth the walk from central if your not staying here.

name: River Cascades
description: Fresh water river popular at high season weekends I suspect ..carpark is protected from the river.. great pools (very cold)to swim in and able to tuck in out of sight VERY QUIET and free

name: Dentist
description: We got cleanings for $20, cavity fillings for $15. Maybe not as thorough of a job as the USA but teeth looked shinier!

name: volcan Trillizos
description: Awsome trek inside "el crater". You just have to ask Ulise the guide, wich have a equipment in very good shape. We paid 60$ per person. If you want someting great and not very famous (so not full of people like every other place here) it is the thing to do here ! Plus Ulise is very nice :)

name: Galapagos Verde Azul Hotel
description: Great family run place. Initially booked online for $65/night for two nights. Stayed the remainder of our stay in a $50/night room without paying all the booking fees since we were here. Owner knew we were trying to save on costs and helped us out with switching rooms. Clean pool, hot showers, good breakfast. Room cleaned daily with fresh towels, easy walking distance to town, and quiet nights. Wifi was decent, and better at night.  Shared mini fridge in the hallway outside room helped keep the dining out costs down! Water cooler in the lobby for filling up water bottles for our daily excursions. Super kid friendly as owners have a Son (4) and Daughter (8) that live onsite. And yes, the hotel is all green and blue!

name: Street parking outside Hostal Sara Allpa
description: We parked right outside this Hostal and paid $2 each to use bathroom and hot shower. Quiet enough night before the market.

name: La Posada
description: Perfect Hostel to start hiking "Quilotoa Loop". The owner Victor helps you organizing all overnight stays on that three day hike through the central Andes of Ecuador. He explains you how to get to where, gives you a little map and stores the luggage you don't need without charging. The Hostel is close to everything you need in a town and to the bus bus terminal it's a just 10 minutes walk. Price for a double room is 20 USD, if you don't book via Booking. It includes towels, soap, tea, instant coffee and trinking water. There is hot showers and comfi beds. Victor knows how to take care about low budget travelers and hikers!

name: El Vaquero
description: We stayed the night here, while hiking the "Quilotoa Loop Trail". We booked two beds in a dorm and got one for our own. The price is 15USD, if you don't book via Booking. It includes a great and big breakfast as well as 3 course dinner perfect for hikers, hot showers, trinking water, towels, shampoo and soap, FINNISH AND STEAM SAUNA and a really nice service. They know how to treat people and especially hikers :). The trailhead is right behind the hostel and there is an awesome view to the mountains. You can even see the crater of Quilotoa, if there is clear weather conditions. A really really good Hostel!

name: Hostal Chukirawa
description: We stayed here our last night, while hiking the "Quilotoa Loop" Trail. We booked two beds in a dorm and got a private double room. They wanted to charge us 10 USD more in the end, but we managed it still paying the 35 USD for us both. The food (breakfast and dinner) wasn't the best. Especially, when you compare it to the food of the other Hostels on that trail. At breakfast we didn't get milk for our coffee and no jam, although we asked for it and others got some. That's rude! But except that, we got hot water for making tea, the price includes the breakfast and dinner, towels, shampoo, soap and drinking water. Both, the private rooms and the dorms have an oven, which gets fired in the evening, if you want it (no charge for that). The beds are comfortable and they have a nice community area with an oven as well. The WIFI is average and they also have three computers for public use. The location is very good, right in front of the trailhead of the "Quilotoa Loop" and the entrance to the crater. So, not the best, but good for one night and from what we've been told the other hostels there are even worse.

name: Balsa Surf Camp
description: Very beautiful inn very close from the great surf point break with all the facilities, security the 24hours, surfboard rental, spa and yoga lesson for free everyday! All the room are new and private bathroom with balcony and hammock in a luxurious and beautiful garden. Great home made food too in the Eden restaurant, fresh seafood and veggie options too! Rasty the shaper make beautiful balsa wood surfboard try it!  Expect $25 per person at least with include a great breakfast and yoga lesson! worth it!

name: Ranchito San Martin
description:
Ranchito San Martín is a country house for travelers which is run by Patricio a very kind gentleman from the Quito Combi Club. He made this house to receive all kinds of travelers, with Combi and without it too. The place has several rooms and beds, bathroom with cold water shower, WiFi, place to park the car and a garden with a beautiful view. It's free, but if you want, you can help Patricio to maintain this place.
--
Ranchito San Martín es una casa de campo para viajeros la cual es manejada por Patricio un señor muy amable del club de kombis de quito, "tribu en Kombi". El hizo esta casa para recibir todo tipo de viajeros, con Kombi y sin ella también. El lugar cuenta con varias habitaciones y camas, baño con ducha de agua fría, WiFi, lugar donde estacionar el carro y un jardín con una vista hermosa. No tiene costo pero si uno quiere puede colaborar para ayudar a Patricio a mantener este lugar.

name: Hostel Rubby
description: A simple hostel, we presume still under construction a bit. They let us park in the parking spot to spend the night. No charge.

name: cancha de voleibol en Zumba
description:
We arrived at 18:00 at Zumba, at the left we found volleyball court, a few blocks before reaching the town (from Ecuador to Peru), they let us camp in our trailer here, under the roof of the court. People live around but are friendly. It is a safe place. there are bathrooms available all night.
--
llegamos a las 18:00 a Zumba, encontramos la cancha de voleyball a mano isquierda, pocas cuadras antes de llegar al Pueblo (de Ecuador hacia Perú), nos dejaron armar nuestro trailer-camping aca, bajo el techo de la cancha. vive gente alrededor pero es amable. es un lugar seguro. hay baños disponibles toda la noche.

name: Hostal Dino's
description:
Nice clean place. $12.50 for private room/bathroom with hot shower. We asked about dorms but the owner said every room is the same price. Also includes free big breakfast of eggs, fruit, yogurt, granola, bread, coffee, juice. Looks like street parking is OK. I left my bike in Latacunga while hiking the Quilotoa Loop. 

Note that Maps.me has this marked in the wrong location.

name: Hotel Jira
description: It is a good and cheap option. It is 15$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom. It has a big secure parking. They let us use the kitchen to have breakfast. It is in the city center. We thought it would be noisy, but the rooms are at the end of the corridor - very silent and clean. They give towels shampoo and soap. There are some cheap local restaurantes a few blocks away as well.

name: Pakari Tampu
description:
7 cabanas for 20 people. Each with private bathroom. Hot water. Very clean. Lovely garden. Room for one car inside a  big gate. More cars can park in the street of this very quiet village called  Namarin. 3 km from Saraguro. Don‘t follow maps.me if you don‘t have a 4x4
You are allowed to sleep in your car and use the bathroom for 5 US
The cabanas are10 US. They offer freshly cooked food and breakfast. 
You can also use the well equipped kitchen. The owner is a traditional doctor who knows a lot about medicinal plants. He treated my inflamed hand very well. 
He started a very interesting programme with 7 families who offer accommodation and a cultural introduction into the life of the indigenous population. Minimum one week. 20 US per day. I wished I had had the time for it. 
There is the chance of extreme sports from the Mirador near by.

name: Estación de Peaje
description: Next to the toll plaza there is a parking lot where you can spend the night. Safe. It has bathrooms and cold shower free. The only bad thing is the noise to be next to the road.

name: Bugs Auto Parts
description:
A great place specialized in air-cooled VW.
Fast and efficient work.
Its owner is Marlon Rodriguez, if the workshop is closed you can call and help solve the problem (+593994519088).
It also has sale of spare parts VW.
_______________________________
Un gran lugar especializado en VW refrigerados por aire. 
Trabajo rápido y eficiente.
Su propietario es Marlon Rodriguez, si el taller está cerrado se puede llamar y el ayudará a solucionar el problema (+593994519088‬).
También dispone de venta de repuestos VW.

name: Fishermen selling fish
description: Very cheap place to buy fresh fish or a crab from a fisherman's fridge! $1 for a 30cm pink fish (don't know the name).

name: Salango beach
description: In front of the shack offering tours to Salango islands, you can park the car at the beach. We asked around and everyone welcomed us to stay the night. The next day we visited Salango island. If you are a bit adventurous, just rent a canoe and row to the island. It takes about half an hour and you can enjoy your own time as you are not bound by the tour timeline.

name: Yumbos Chocolate
description:
Artesanal Chocolate tour. Personalised tour with lots of samples hot chocolate and chocolate tea and fruit platter. 
No pressure to buy. $8 pp

name: Bomberos
description: Bomberos welcome us touring on bicycles or skateboard. we slept in their classroom with electrical point to charge phones. there is a hot shower.

name: Delta del Paute
description: Nice place, safe, wonderfull view, 22km to Paute

name: Casa de Edu y Martha
description:
This is the house of Eduardo and Martha. Very friendly ecuadorian couple whose kids left home. They are interested in having company sometimes. They live in a closed urbanizacion (named UTE). They'll let you camp in their backyard or in front of the house. They also let you use the hot shower and washing machine for a little contribution. They will love to share breakfast with or take you around in town. They only speak spanish so are interested in meeting spanish speaking people.. contact Martha on whatsapp or mail before going there, as you can't enter the urbanización without their consent: 
mail: marthiregi@hotmail.com
whatsapp: +593 99 821 56 94

name: Casa de don José
description: José’s house have two rooms available. For cyclotravellers is perfect. He and he’s son are very friendly. You can use kitchen. Not space in the location for Overlander RIGS, the parking lot is a few blocks nearly. $10 dls for a room with tv and bathroom and a concert of mariachi from his son.  They speaks spanish and italian

name: Bomberos Saraguro
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Place to stay for cyclists and possibly motorcyclists, not for vehicle or tent campers.  

Strange and dark place, next to a cock-fighting ring, you can see (and hear) the birds in cages, so sad. In other hand the camp is ok, you can use the bathroom with hot shower, and wash clothes. And cook with gasoline, bikes inside secure. Maybe Just for cyclotravellers.

name: Hotel Rodelu
description: Great hotel with friendly staff. Parking for small rigs. We parked in the street in front of the hotel and it's OK. In the historic downtown.  The restaurant has delicious food and low prices. The owner is a traveler. Great talking about trips around Sudamérica.

name: Café Color Tierra
description:
Beautiful place to connect with natura and experience camping and waterfalls.
--
Lindo lugar para conectarse con la naturaleza y experimentar camping y cascadas

name: Hostal Yakumama
description: Nice big hostel, close to the main square, dorm for 6,5 $, kitchen, living room with TV and movies, tennis table, hot shower, breakfast for 2-3 $

name: Humboldt Kites
description:
This is a Kite School with Camping, dorms and private rooms. They also serve some food and drinks. The lasagna is really good, it's made by an italian. 
The owner, Andi, is german. He's really nice and made us feel very comfortable. 
There is an 8h package for beginners which we did. It's with private lessons and costs 300$. 
Camping has an outdoor kitchen and costs 7$ pp. Good wifi all over.
Very chilled place. We loved it there and learned a lot! Go check it out, it's so nice.

name: Finca Pinguino Yoga Farm
description:
The Finca Pinguino, an intimate rustic ecolodge set in the middle of Ecuadorian nature. 
An exceptional location : On the top of a hill, overlooking luxuriant nature Horses & farm animals 
A reforestation project and a peaceful atmosphere, reflecting the owners’ love for yoga and its values.
Tasteful veggie food from the farm or nearby communities available between 3-5$/meal.
An almost exclusive Yoga shala available, with a maximum of 6 guests. Two passionate and receptive hosts, who also know how to respect your need for privacy.
Camping spots available for vans and tents.
A wide choice of activities, including : Yoga classes and retreats- Our speciality, Horse ride, Healthy & veggie cooking workshop, Gardening / Participation to the “Nourishing Forest” reforestation project. Slackline introduction and Board games nights, by the fire and stars above. 

Chat or revitalize yourself. Most of our guests choose to stay at least 2 days and 2 nights to fully enjoy the Finca Pinguino and the dozens of things there are to discover there :)

name: North Star hostal Guayaquil
description: Dorm (5 beds) for 15,25 $ (incl. tax) via booking.com. Close to the airport and main bus station. Clean, hot shower, great breakfast for 1,5 $.

name: Bomberos El Coca
description:
Very friendly people, I stayed there in the kitchen (more quiet) but you can put your tent in the car park. They said that's not the first time they host people there.
Note: I'm cyclist, maybe not for RV camper.

name: Salinerito
description:
They sell cheeses from Salinas, sausages, oil, dried fruit, chocolate...
But cheese is the most important. It is so good!

name: Parque Central Oña
description: Parking spots near Church and park. Very clean and friendly town. Restaurants and cafes nearby. Clean and free public restrooms just a few steps away (righthand side of the church) The restrooms are open and clean at 07.00 AM. Safe and quiet. Police are friendly. The adobe architecture is very beautiful in town. Buildings from the 1950s are in very good condition.

name: Hostel Latacunga
description: it might seem like a posh expensive hotel but they have dorm beds. I thought I paid $10 for a dorm bed instead I got a single room without bathroom. that is all I need for a good rest

name: Andes bike shop
description: When my brake cable snapped, Anthony fixed it at no costs. they have no stock of long brake cable that I needed. Anthony accompanied me to another bike shop to buy one. Friendly service

name: 7 cascadas
description:
Beautiful place, it's Victoria's cabins, they have food and the best attention by their owners, Maria Victoria and Clever. They have bathrooms and showers, cabins and camping space. 100% recommended. There is an amazing trail that takes you to the 7 waterfalls and natural slides.
Incredible, beautiful place
---
Hermoso lugar, está las cabañas victoria , tienen comida y la mejor atención por sus propios dueños , María Victoria y Clever . Tienen baños y duchas , cabañas y espacio de camping . 100% recomendado . Hay un sendero increíble que te lleva a las 7 cascadas y toboganes naturales . 
Increíble , hermoso pasen a conocer .

name: Hotel Kuyllur
description: Lovely family run hotel with clean and light rooms with views across the valley. Not finished when we arrived but will be lovely when completed. Owners are open to bargaining,we paid $14 for a couple. Place to park vehicles off road and space in the rooms for bicycles.

name: Lava Fácil
description: Laundry, we left ours early evening for collection midday following. Very friendly.

name: Bizcochos San Pedro
description:
Very good bizcochos indeed are made and sold here, bag 1 US , you can watch the process. There is also a cafeteria serving hot chocolate, coffee etc with these bizcochos.
As bizcochos can be kept for 3 months I find them perfect for camping and emergencies.

name: VIP Auto Care
description: Xavier was recommended by family of a friend in Quito. We had to get our breaks done and he was super helpful. Worked on it same day and resurfaced everything. Didn’t try to sell me anything I didn’t need. Obviously I didn’t haggle search around for price, but the whole operation is very legit. He was also able to give me contacts for insurance and for shipping options.

name: Cabañas de Mechahuazca
description:
Here you can stay at a community based cabaña. There also is a defined area for camping and Rigs of any size can park here over night.  When we where here the street was dry. If this is the case, you easely could reach the cabaña with a 2WD. Maybe it's a bit tricky to get there if the road is wet and muddy. Water, Toilets, a gas stove and Electricity could be found in the cabañas. We paid 12USD per person and night for a night in the cabaña. One of it has an oven and one an electric heater. All in all they are very basic, but they had been a better alternative to our tent. The nights are cold up here but you have an amazing view on the northface of chimborazo!

If you need the key for the cabañas, you have to ask for Leonardo in the surrounding houses. He is the 'manager' of this area, lives 10min on foot away, speaks spanish and some basic English. The water comes from a source next to the buildings. We boiled it before drinking just in case.

There are a lot opportunities for hiking around this place.

name: Campo Wasi
description: Lodging in country house in San Isidro Riobamba with view to the Chimborazo and El Altar volcanoes.

name: La Estacion del Sabor
description: $10 private room with hot shower bathroom. Small TV though as if you will watch TV. intermitten weak WiFi

name: Kuyana Lodge
description: Great place, in middle of forest by the river.  It s a Lodge but you can contact then for camping option.  +593998017455 Ivan is the owner

name: latacunga rodrimotor mechanic
description: nice, feiendly, quick service. knows land rovers but works on any car. payed 8dolars for small job. phone 028033219.

name: Shiripuno Comunity
description:
It's a pueblo beside the Napo River, very quiet. We stayed 3 overnights in street near football camp. Our
sons played with children of comunity. Amazing! The Center of Comunity Tourism offers cabanas, restaurant, dance and music shows,
handcrafta, artesanal chocolate and tours. Great place and very friendly people.

name: Recordmotor vw and honda
description:
VW Dealer
They repair VW and Honda
and you can pay by creditcard without extra charge

name: Chasky Wasky Hostal
description: $12 per person in an individual room without bathroom. but I bargain it down to $10. clean but very cold no heater. so suit up. at least hot shower is very hot

name: Laguna Secas
description: We camped for $3 per person per night. Space for maybe 2 vehicles, small flat grassy area. Cold and windy when we stayed but very quiet and dark. Baño clean but no seat or paper, cold shower. Restaurant on site, we didn’t eat there. There is a nice short hike thru the lava field to the lake. No WiFi and we could not get any cell service.

name: Hostería Los Molinos de Yanayacu
description:
No camping in vehicle or tents. Rooms are available. but NO camping. 

Good spot. Kind of pricey: 35$ each, which we got down to 30. Including breakfast. Nice room, bit dated but cool decorations and spacious. Very hot water. No WiFi.

name: Hostal White House
description: Nice Hostel, close enough to most places. Comfortable bed, very clean, ok Wi-Fi compared to other places on the islands. great, very well equipped kitchen, very close to the market for cheaper veg&fruit. Paid $115incl. tax for 3 nights. Nice family runs this place, you're better off if you can speak Spanish.

name: Primax
description: Big primax gas station. They allowed us to stay overnight at the parking lot. Very friendly staff. Free modern and clean toilets inside the shop. A bit noisy but for one night ok. Open 24/7

name: Abby's Hideaway
description: Nestled in the Pastaza Canyon in front of Tungurahua Volcano, this is the perfect place to get away from the town of Banos, but close enough to be accessible. Along with the many fruit orchards available for the picking you can enjoy the relaxing sounds of the river from a hammock and the amazing views of the highlands.

name: Beautiful spot overloooking the scenery of mountains
description: Perfect place for staying overnight. You can not be seen from the main Road and Italien perfect flat. Just perfect for staying with an amazing and overwhelming view. Absolutely quiet and feeling very save. The Stars are shining very intensive.

name: Kajwi Creperia
description: Love this place! excellent coffee and crepes! Had to eat two crepes haha! Really good price! 0.75usd for espresso doble

name: Primax, "Gasolinera Chone"
description:
Open 24 hours. 
Contamos con / we have:
•	Parqueadero amplio / wide parking spaces,
•	Duchas / showers,
•	Bar,
•	Servicios Higiénicos / Bathrooms,
•	Rampa para revisión mecánica de autos / Auto service ramp,   
•	Circuito de cámaras / Security camera system 

Sus mascotas son bienvenidas / Pet friendly
Estamos en el Mercado desde 1986 / We've been in the market since 1986.

name: Las palmeras
description: double room 50 US DOLLARS for 3 nights. on beach front away from late night disco. pounding seas fabulous view pelicans swooping on wave crests. clean. friendly.helpful. secure parking for motorcycle.

name: Wild camping on the E10 at the Bridge before La Bonita
description:
Nice quiet flat place on the E10, next to a bridge and a roaring river.
1km to La Bonita.
At 1900mtr in the clouds. 
In former times there was a  natural river crossing.
Traffic is very rare.

name: Laguna del Salado
description: Beautiful lake with a grassy spot big enough for a couple of tents, and parking space for big rigs. There’s no water here but on the weekends the bathrooms are open. Very quiet and very safe.

name: Midori Sushi
description: Great Restaurant - not just for Sushi, you have to try the seared Sesame Tuna. It's a massive piece of tuna covered in Sesame seeds and just very quickly seared. With ginger rice and salad. Good salad that is, not just iceberg drenched in vinegar but proper Romana salad and nice veggies. It's all nicely presented and all of good quality for a fair price ~15$ for the tuna dish, it is really worthed that!

name: Beautiful spot!
description:
Great place! Tent and vehicle. Water and flat! Very safe.
Would need a 4x4 to get here.
If you are cycling the TEMBR is a great place to camp after Cuenca!

name: Finca Mono Verde
description:
We are an experimental organic farm working on tropical agriculture with a strong community support component.
We are highly motivated by nature conservation, Agroforestry and a deep love for earth.
Come and join us a short-term volunteer or long-term intern.

Finca Mono Verde offers comfortable bamboo cabanas, safe water to drink, electric power, composting toilets and 3 hearty meals a day based on a vegetarian/Manabita.

What we do?
*Artisan production and processing of coffee, chocolate, moringa, jams, preserves, and more.
*Permavulture, Agroforestry, eco-building.
*We support community-based initiatives such as: handicrafts, silk screening, artisan fisheries, textiles, and more local initiatives.

Finca Mono Verde has a direct connection to Earth, to the Manabita smell of coffee in the mornings, pleasant work and relaxed environment  while you can enjoy stunning sunset, hammocks and nature. An ideal place to learn, experience community life and be part a home-oriented project.

name: Hostal San Luis
