description: Loja is a great town to relax for a few days. We stayed in the backyard of San Luis hostel for three nights sleeping in our vehicle and using common toilets and a shower in one of the empty rooms. The staff was friendly amd we paid 5$ per night after a bit of bargaining.

name: Pasitos Puntada - sewing
description: They have sewing machines and made some covers for our mattresses. Perfect work for a really small price! Every shape you want they can make. Either bring the fabric or she can get it for you.

name: Hosteria Amazonas
description: large complex. can chain motorcycle to railings outside room. wanted 28 dollars, negotiate to 20 for double bed room. suicide cold shower. restaurants walking distance. friendly good.

name: El Aliso (centro touristico)
description:
Hôtel : 10 USD single room, whit bathroom, hot shower, tv, clean, wifi in some room, friendly women 
probably the cheapest option in town

name: Hostal Espinoza
description:
new hotel : good wifi, tv, hot shower, quiet  very large secure parking
i paid 10 USD for a single room
Double are between 22 and 36 usd
cel 0984711326
telf 2239034

name: cuyabeno river lodge
description: 21kms past Tarapoa towards Puerto El Carmen de Putumayo. All Roads tarmac and good condition for motorbike.  Tourist office on left just before bridge. Call them at Tarapoa on 022527751 to arrange room as there is no signal or wifi at the touristoffice. We were quoted 40 dollars per day per person and  another 20 to enter the park. Then another 10 to secure the bike. We locked it at the owner lady's front yard. We were collected by boat 15minute ride into lodging. All activities and meals included. The agencies in Coca charge 265 dollars per person for a 2night/ 3day jungle trip ( total way over 500 !!) by riding and booking ourselves we only paid a total of 210 for two. The guy at the desk in the tourist will not let you into the park without a confirmed 'agent' which is why you need to phone and book direct so the lodge can vouch for you.  Great fun in the jungle.

name: sundown
description:
Nice place outside of chaotic Canoa. It's kind of a hotel that focuses on their  Spanish School, mostly Americans.
They have a big area that you can camp in with an ocean view (5$). Fast wifi in the well equipped kitchen area (extra 1,5$ to use kitchen). Super calm and quiet. Can rent surfboards. Owners nice and speak English.

name: TSP automotores
description:
We litterly rolled in here. For some reason our acceleration decided to stop working and it got worse every 50 km until about 70 km before Quito (we were coming from the San Miguel border), the acceleration just stopped every few minutes, shutting the motor down and making it a terrible situation high up in de Andes. We tried to drive to another mechanic which was stated in iO but couldn't go anywhere else as our motor just stopped right in front of this place. Luckily it looked like a very good and professional garage. And it was. They started helping us right away and figured out what the problem was; the exhaust was clogged with gunk from gasoline (apparently happens to all cars due to bad quality of gasoline, not only in Bolivia but anywhere). Very professional and friendly people. They have all round knowledge, a computer to read any vehicle, they do all sort of things. 
No height restrictions. 
Fair price for cleaning the exhaust and fixing the front brakes right away.  

Phonenr: 096 770 7617 (Whatsapp)/3 895 389
email: tsp_automotores2206@hotmail.com

They also have WiFi.

name: Car wash and oil change
description: A very good place to wash your car and to change the oil. They washed our truck outside and the bottom and I payed 20 US-Dollars for more than 2 hours of work.

name: Lavanderia Otavalo
description:
Very reasonable - cost by weight. Clothes in at 1400hrs, told to collect at 1700hrs.
Note, there are TWO 'Unidad Educativa Otavalo', the lavandaria is one block south of Santa Fe Hostal. It's a long walk if you head to the college at the northern end of town!

name: Duragas
description: We basically drove all around town and this place was able to sell us a 5kg gasbottle for our stove. We already bought a Ecuadorian connection for 8$ at a ferreteria, so good solution in case your in need!

name: Yellow House Bird Trails
description: From this place you can walk up into the forest where there are five different trails. You can see a lot of birds and plants. At the entrance you pay 6 dollars per person and get a map.

name: Nazu City Hostel
description:
Nice Hostel in the heart of everything. 
Not easy to see from the street. They could use a better sign. 
Hostel is on second floor. 
Parking available for motos, maybe a car in the garage. 
$14.00 for a dorm bed. 

Good place to jump off for the Galapagos. 

City Life, City Noise.

name: hostel alejandra
description: at Santander Rosa on top of the hill. restaurant for lunch and bbq dinner. clean cosy. no toilet seat 15 dollars for matrimonial.  friendly cheerful. we used their tumble dryer to dry sopping wet clothes. locked motorbike in their garage.

name: Hostel Margarita
description: stayed for 5 nights at 20$ p/ night with 5$ discount.  clean comfortable.  excellent location for old town and city bus tour.  plenty restaurants and easy walking.  kitchen. motorcycle parking in garage.

name: Islote las Tintoreras
description: great snorkeling side where you can spot sharks, penguins, turtles (loads!), maaany fishes, blue footed boobies. we even saw a huge ray! you have to go with a guide, as it is in the national park. we went with 'paddle to penguins' in kayaks and it was a great experience! (50$ pp) we were lucky and it was sunny and the water very clear. highly recommended!

name: Hostal Segovia
description: Nice cheap place to stay right in the city centre. Oasis was renovating their campsite and the hotel itself seemed expensive for just one night. This place has rooms for $6/night with shared bathroom, or $7 with private bathroom, rooms have parquet floors and are large and comfortable. This is a cheap hotel and has all the pros and cons of a cheap hotel, but good for one or two nights in Riobamba and really conveniently located. Get a room facing the back if you want to avoid the street noise. Secure overnight parking for motorcycles, I think one small van could fit, too.

name: Baloo Hotel
description: Beautiful hotel with tiny cabins to stay but also has small parking where we set our tent roof for a couple of night for $5 dollars per night a real deal that we negotiate after spending one night in a room, even for campers it has got clean showers and restrooms, also have a shared kitchen for everyone to use, the place is run by a friendly english man called felipe.

name: Hostal Villa Colombia
description: Safe hostel with parking lot (2.20mts high) with sufficent space for.m small campers at a nice price of $10 dollars per person we did not ask for permission to set our roof tent but the owner is very flexible and nice person who also runs tour to isla plata at 30 dollars which is cheaper that at the malecón as they have their own nice boat.

name: Community Hostel Quito
description:
Community Hostel Quito empowers local communities one location at a time! This hostel is the place to go with a big dining table to help people meet and to see what Quito is all about! Breakfast is $3,50 and dinner is $5, there in house walking tour is amazing and they have there own travel agency to set you up with everything you want and need to do in Ecuador!

Dorm bed 10 dollars

name: Hueka Grill
description:
Only had chicken when we came but was very good. Soup and main dish with drink for $2,50.
They also have WiFi and plenty of space on the road to park whatever rig you have.

name: Tía supermarket - free wifi
description: Just a supermarket but WiFi is hard to come by in this town

name: Zarza beers burger y mas
description: Awesome little bar to enjoy zarza beers ( made in Loja ) and the food is quite amazing, the owner smokes himself bacon, sausages, etc etc... one of the best burger I had in my life. Unbelievable :D

name: El arriero
description: Restaurant with well priced and abundant food. Trout (rice, salad, chips) with chicken soup, plus drink for 7.50 and ok for sleeping in carpark. Wifi available if close enough. They close at 8pm so ask before! Came for dinner, back to pools, then back for sleeping here.

name: Kombi Mechanic
description: A Kombi mechanic, not 100% recommendable, but good for a small fix. They have loads of beetles and kombis and are quiet known in Ecuador. I still had the feeling that they wanted to take my money so know exactly what you want to fix and have an idea how much it costs.

name: Luz Clarita
description:
A nice, quiet hostel from where you have a great view over the city. The rooms are basic but clean and cheap (range from 4 tot 10 dollar). They charge a dollar a person a night per tent or van. It is located immediately next to the Panamericana.

It is an easy walk to the city center. Also a great place to hike to the Peguche waterfalls, the condor park, El Lechero mirador and laguna San Pablo.  A perfect daytrip.

name: Chibuleo marketground bevor the town
description:
Quiet place next to the road from Abato to Chibuleo.
Be aware on a Wednesday morning they were slowly building up a small market.

name: Cafe Portal 16
description:
Great cafe!
The food is really good. The coffee is great and the atmosphere is prefect for a cafe setting. 

Good WiFi and outlets for computers. 

The owner is friendly and will welcome you with a smile.

Good place to computer and chill

name: City Moto Sport
description: Friendly and professional general services, stoped there for a friend recommendation, front brake maintenance, bike wash, chain tension adjustment and librication for $10usd

name: Guamani
description: We stay in this place at 4100 meters . In front of the guardian bulding of the Cayambe-Coca National park  . They are very nice , they accept without any problem . There is water . You can continue the narrow road two more kms but depend of the weather . For us it Was a very cloudy ,raining weather . There a population of 80 bears around ,fox ,and a lot of another types of animals . ok with our Rv 7,30m . There is start of hike here . Top with sunny weather ;)

name: Lavandería Lunes a Domingo 8 a 21
description: Laundry open long hours. $5 for big bag.

name: BurbuClean
description:
Nice and friendly Laundry. 
A big bag for 5;-$ 
Ready at same day.

name: Faro Punta Chapoya
description:
Nice spot at the lighthouse. 
Easy to camp. Quiet at night. 
A little busy at weekends.

name: Top of the mountain
description:
Big parking lot on the top of a mountain, quite quiet. 
Mirador.

name: EP Petroecuador
description: Gas station. Free shower and wifi. Nice view. Quiet at night.

name: FREE and quiet
description: Big place for big rig. Near Road but quiet. Feel safe. (No longer applicable- To access you have to pass on papallacta because the road is one way). No facilities.

name: Nestlé free water tap
description: Free potable water from the Nestle plant. Just pull up on the side of street and fill up.

name: El Reventador (Town)
description:
We stopped yesterday evening on our way to San Rafael and had a good dinner at MiKasa. Food was good, 4$
I asked the owner if it was all right to camp on the main street, and he happily redirected me to this ground behind, where we had a very quiet night. Public baños next door on main street.

name: Mercado central Tena.
description: Central local market here , different type of vegetables , meet, and local foods here . For good prices ;) . Worms «chouta curo » y local leaves to make bebidas

name: RC Tecnicentro
description: stopped here to do some work on our brakes. very friendly owner and family, good work, fair price. highly recommended!

name: waterfall/thermals el tingo
description:
Armando and his daughters run a nice thermal (not that warm but beautiful setting) and mineral water pools next to the river. we camped at the entrance where you have a spectacular view of the canyon and river and had a super silent sleep with faint river sound in the background and there is a canal flow next to where you camp to wash dishes or something. they have a small trout farm, a mineral spring where you can fill up a gallon for yourself to take, pools and nice waterfalls. free to camp. 1 dollar entrance to their pools, 3 and 5 dolar trout meals. It used to be ran by an ex-ecuadorian president back in the 1930s. very lovely family, sleep, river, views... basically all the best elements for overlanding. 

entrance to road is at the large curve on the higway. look for wooden sign that says "cascada el tingo"

name: hostal acacias
description: we didn't stay here but they have space for one big rig ($5) locked or several bikes and to shower and use wifi its $3 pp. it's the only place we've seen where you can stay in your rig and not pay for a dorm.

name: Splendid--Self Service Laundromat.
description: One of the very rare self service lavanderías. Prefer this than having someone else do it, especially the delicates.

name: Street Parking - Main Plaza in Zumba
description: Street parking. Asked if it was ok and was told there's no problem. There is a Batallon Militar nearby so we felt safe. There are public bathrooms in the plaza (free).

name: Apart-Hotel Rincón d'Olón
description:
Your Room or Studio includes: HD-TV, WiFi, A/C & Ceiling Fan, Modern Bathrooms, Orthopedic Beds & Complimentary Mini-Bar
We offer Plenty of Amenities & Facilities, Competitive Rates and Long-Stay Discounts. Enjoy our Pool, Gym, BBQ, Free Bikes, Boardgames & much more!
Our Breakfast Buffet (8.30-11am) includes Fruits, Artisan Breads, Juice, Granola, Eggs, Ham, Cheese, French Press Coffee, &tc.

Buffet Breakfast at Apart-Hotel Rincón d'Olón
Thanks for your interest in our Boutique Apart-Hotel in Olón: Ecuador's #1 Beach Town! Contact us here or Call: +593 (0)991 224 223

 horse-olon-beach
 Surf Olon Beach
 whales-olon
In Olon, there are Plenty of Activities! Ideally situated for Trips to Isla de la Plata, Whale Watching, Los Frailes Beach & Agua Blanca
Enjoy White & Sandy Beaches, Green & Pristine Hillsides, Safety & Relaxation, Tours & Trips, Luxuries & Comforts, International Gastronomy & Best-in-Class Service.
We're #1 on TripAdvisor & Booking.com with a 9.5/10 from 500+ Reviews. We'll try to make Your Holidays as Perfect as Possible.

name: Ecuaradiadores
description: Very friendly and competent owner who quickly found out that my radiator was fine. See pictures for a list of all the services they offer.

name: parqueo de jipiro parque
description:
Great space for parking in Jipiro park. Free to sleep safely and not so far from the center. It has bathroom services (free all day), hot shower (7 until 20) for 1 dollars, pools for 2 dollars and free water (not drinkable but good for cooking)
People just arriving, asking and parking. 

Google Translated from original:
gran espacio para parqueamento em parqueo de parque jipiro. 
gratis para pernoitar seguro y no tan lejos del centro.
Tiene servicios de baño  (gratis todo el dia), ducha caliente (7 Hasta las 20) por 1 dolares, piscinas por 3 dólares y agua libre ( no potable pero Buena para cocinar)
buenísima gente solo llegar, preguntar y parquear. 
recomiendo

------
good place to stay at nigth.
its a big place in front of The municipal pools, in parque Jipiro.
secure, Free and no so far to The center. 
they have WC free, hot shower (1 dolar/7am at 8 pm), pools ( 3 dolar) and free water ( no potable but for cooking i think its ok) 
friendly  People.
 just ask for the woman in the entrance and everything all right to pass all night.
really good place.  
i think is a good place for big rigs

name: Calle Tarqui
description:
$1.75. By Calle Tarqui 6 63

Very good place to take a hot shower.
--
duchas calientes públicas. 
cuesta 1,75 dolares por persona.
bien calientes, limpias, buena gente.
bien localizado, próximo al centro.
recomiendo.

name: Free parking
description:
We parked on this street park.  There were people who were charging in the street of the park. Very quiet at night, safe and silent

Estacionamos en esta calle parque habían personas que cobraban en la calle del parque. Muy tranquilo de noche , seguro y silencioso

name: Kiteschool and Hang Out Kite Ecuador
description:
In March 2018 Javier and Mike moved their kiteschool over to this place. We stayed a month and had an awesome time here! We had classes with them and rented gear. We could also use their wifi, kitchen, toilet and shower.
Their teaching is really good and the rental gear only the newest North and  Ion gear. They also sell gear, for that ask Javier to make you a good deal.

Contact Details:
Javier Negrete
+593989731480
www.kiteecuador.com

name: Taller Chimborazo (Bicycle Workshop)
description: Basic bicycle shop and workshop. Was able to buy Shimano mineral oil for hydraulic disc brakes.

name: taller eléctrico ponce
description: The guy is specialised for electrical issues (current supply, starter...). he did a good job with us and the price was fair : 90$ for solenoid changed. no way to sleep in the car.

name: Lost friendly village away from main road
description: We asked the locals next to the tienda if OK to park for the night, they immediately said sure and showed us a level area right in front of the church, opposite a football and basket fields. Became very quiet once the local church finished their business.

name: Servicio Automoto Romero
description:
we can't say enough about Carlos who owns this business. we broke down in Cotopaxi and we're towed here. he was very attentive and worked diligently to get us back on the road. he has the ability work work on big rigs with no height issues. if you need a mechanic this is the place to come. 
our rear axle and differiential both broke and we were able to get the parts made not a mile away.

name: Centro Recreacional Catamayo
description: Playground and informal campsite with cold showers and running water and an ostrich !!!!! Booya. The best way is to stop at the municipalidad near the main plaza and ask for permission to camp the night here, so that the guard hears it from them. We came on cycles and had a lovely night, never too cold, and clean bathrooms. We left our stuff here and went to eat dinner in town, it’s super safe, well lit, and also perfect for kids. Dogs not allowed in. There’s a parking lot in front for big rigs and cars.

name: Policía Vilcabamba
description: Police station has a nice, big, safe parking lot (big enough for big rigs I should think) and a covered area in the back for motorcycles/cyclists. I put up my tent in the back. It’s right in the town center but quiet at night and they’re very nice. I think they have decent WiFi (haven’t used it yet) and clean ish bathrooms.

name: Gas station Masgas
description: Gas station 24 hours open, toilets, showers, mini market, food. Little parking lot for trucks (next the white shower building). Noisy next to the road.

name: Manuel’s Launch Ramp La Guacachina
description: This is another launch ramp for paragliders just uphill of the “official” one with restaurant. There is ample and level parking for any size vehicle and plenty of spaces for tents. Manuel is the owner of the land and very friendly and accommodating. There are plenty of hammocks and benches to hang out in. There is no running water, electricity, or wifi. There is beer, soft drinks, and drinking water on ice. Toilets are bucket-flush but clean. It is absolutely quiet and safe at night. Manuel takes donations. We bought two beers from him and gave him $4 extra for the two of us for one night.

name: Hostel Nativa Whale
description:
Hostel made from geodesic domes. The hostel is still under construction but they have two domes finished, one for 8 people and another for up to 4 people (we paid $25/night for 4 people). There is also a small area to camp if you have your own tent or they have two tents to rent ($5/pp). There is currently no grass for tents and space is a little limited. Located within walking distance to town (10-15min). Owners helped us to organize whale tour ($20/pp). 

Common and kitchen areas are shared with owners. Quiet at night. Kitchen is simple but totally adequate. WIFI is fast.

name: El Tobogan Ilalo Campground
description: Establish Campground in Quito at Ilalo Volcano foot with basic services, water, light, electricity, toilets, kitchen, parking, tent ground, etc.

name: Chuza Longa Home
description:
What a great B&B! Nice room with private bathroom. The commun area is spacious and nice to hang out in, the host will go above and beyond to make you confortable. 

 Great to be there on Thursday for the big market. Safe parking right in front of the hostel.  Hot shower and decent WiFi.

name: Posada El Ingañan
description:
Nice guesthouse run by a friendly couple. Very accommodating for cyclists. Will cook dinner and breakfast. $20 single bed. $20 for the matrimonial rooms. Possible food included.

cell:+953 (0)985075012. Fijo:3012525

name: el camping de doña elsie
description:
excellent place, very friendly people, attended by their owners

----

excelente lugar, gente muy amable, atendido por sus propietarios

name: balneario by the river
description: Quiet place by a nice river for swimming. Small cultural cafe about to open. Run by two young locals and some volunteers. Bathrooms running water, electricity and slow council internet. Small parking, 2 dollars if overnight stay.

name: La Casa de “Santy”
description: It is backpacker hostel with very friendly owner Santy. 4 $ p.p. night, 2 rooms with 2 dorm with very big beds, kitchen, hot water, laundry for 2 $, 5 min to the center. The entrance is same for hostel La Casa Amarilla City.

name: Tosta Cafe & Pan
description: They have the best bread we've had in all of our travels so far! And We've been to most of the German and the French bakerys. A true gem.  It's hidden below the street so keep an eye out....you can find parking on the side street across from the cafe.

name: Hostal Turista del mundo
description:
Very nice small and clean hotel with very friendly owner. We had very bright and quiet room to the back with a nice view to the river. 8$ pp for a double with shared bathroom, 10$ pp with private bathroom. 
Hot showers and good WiFi available. 
At the top floor there is a good equipped kitchen and two common rooms (even with hammocks). 
In the courtyard there is enough space for bikes (there were already two motorbikes so I guess it’s no problem).

name: Parque Recreacional Jorge Felipe Rivadeneira
description: Good place to sleep, very quiet, excellent to spend the day, it's free and safe.

name: Dique rio Tunants - Pablo Sexto
description: a very good place to spend the night, you could stay if you wanted an entire month in and you would liking. Is a small dike having attractions water. very safe, very quiet, people is Super friendly.

name: Dique Rio Tunants. Aqua Park
description: excellent place to visit, Crystal water, very fun. ideal for spend with children family.

name: Cave of Tayos - cueva de los Tayos
description:
Is the comuidad where have cabins, perform ceremonies, meals typical jungle, tour to the cave of tayos. Is one of the best experience in the Forest. you can book before if you want.

phone: 0999597249 / 0985445581
Facebook: @CuevaDeLosTayosTayuJee
Mail: cuevadelostayosjee@gmail.com

name: Enter to cave of the Tayos
description:
Besta place for sleep, very very quiet!!! Incredible. 
here begins the path that leads to the community who owns the cave of tayos.

name: Simon Bolivar Fuel Station
description: A good place for sleep - very quiet for being a fuel station. Also has bathrooms very clean, with cold shower. People are very friendly.

name: Soga Lounch Hostel
description: Soga Lounch is a pretty site to rest, near ocean. You can to take breakfast, beer, there is pool... There are room  $14 without bathroom private to two person and $25 with bathroom private.

name: Hotel Victoria
description:
Great option in Chone, it’s not cheap but it’s pretty decent. ($25 per person)
It is in a relatively quiet zone in the city, and near everything. 
Has a big parking lot next to it.

name: Tierra Madre Hotel and Spa
description: I know the name of this hotel sound too posh for us overlander traveller. Not just the sound of it, but the hotel is too posh for me to actually afford it. But it is affordable. Found this gem in Airbnb. They got a tiny private room with outdoor shower that is just 3 steps away. The best how shower ever. Paid $9/nite and I can use the hotel facilities: pool and hammocks everywhere. Parking is open but inside the compound. No kitchen to use. Free flow of drinking water all day. Free coffee and tea in the morning. Loving this place after long ride from Peru. They also have room for 2 person. Check out their page in Airbnb. I don't know whether we can walk in and ask or not. Maybe you can try. ask for the Hobbit room no. 23.

name: The Mudhouse Hostal
description: Mendee and Andrés have a very nice place on the main road a short distance from the beach. Mendee is from the states and Andres is Colombian. There are cabanas with private baths, private rooms with shared bath and 2 dorms. Super clean and comfortable. Shared kitchen is well equipped and super clean. We paid $25 a night for a super nice spacious cabana, dorms $8-15 a person, you can negotiate. No camping available.

name: Rico's
description:
Nice restaurant with a lovely garden and a bar in the back! Good wok with noodles (or rice). 

They also have breakfast (with homemade bread), pizza, sushi and various from the grill.

name: Villa Luisita
description: A nice and clean family-run hostel within easy walking distance of the Town Center. We negotiated double rooms for $15 per person, shared bathroom between three rooms. Has secure parking for motorbikes and a car or two, just far enough out of town to be quiet and peaceful. Has faster than average Wi-Fi in the rooms, would recommend this place and be happy to stay here again.

name: Cherusker Brewery
description:
Cerveceria Artesanal Alemana. 
They brew their own German style beer. You can choose your size, and the largest is Oktoberfest style mug.
I tried the wheat beer and it had hints of banana. Also available Oatmeal Stout, IPA, Trappist Ale, Summer Blonde. Food is excellent. I had Jagersnitzel and it was large, and a good mushroom sauce. Excellent value.

name: Bombuscaro Hotel
description:
Nice tall hotel near the central market. Parking is across the street in the underground parking garage. Height limit is 2.20 cm.  Single was $30, but on bookings $25. They gave it to me at $25. 

Clean rooms with a great view of the market and the surrounding mountains. Great breakfast, coffee, eggs with ham, croissants with cheese and juice. 

Inside has nice lobby and lovely spiral staircase, or elevator if needed. Dog friendly.

name: Hostal La Casa del Camino
description:
Nice hostel, they offer dorms, Cabañas and camping. We stayed at a cabana with private bathroom for 9$ pp. 
Wifi is average and reaches more or less the cabañas (weak and a bit unstable signal but basically working). 
There is also a small shop. Owners are relaxed.

name: Large Parking lot on ocean
description: This is a large parking area right in front of the ocean.  the sign on the road says $2 for parking. The young man in attendance charged us $5 for camping.  There is a basic, bucket flush toilet.  Good place to spend the night.

name: By the river - Shiripuno Community
description:
We stayed on this nice little sandy place right by the river for US$ 5 per car (with two people) and were allowed to use the facilities. Cold water shower and flushing toilet are 100m walk away. We were even allowed to light a little camp fire. 
Great spot, but unfortunately one guy always asked us to move to the main parking lot during the day so the "view from the river" wouldn't be disturbed. Then again, our guide, who claimed to be the chief of the village asked why we were moving our cars before leaving for the tour and said we should leave them there during the day...bit confusing and annoying. 
Other than that, fantastic spot.
Big rig friendly, lots of space.

NOTE: Since you have to move during the day, don't bother if your rig requires a lot of preparation to move or if you need your time every morning. Beware if there is lots of rain. The river is 3-4m down below but it has happened that it reached the top flooding the spot and also the entire village/area.

name: Nativa Whale Camping Domes
description:
Whether it is for whale watching, a quick recharge of vitamin "see", or just to escape to the tranquility of this small fishing village on the Ecuadorian coast in the province of Manabi, you will be pleased to have chosen Nativa Whale Camping Domes for your stay

OUR ROOMS
Experience luxury camping in our custom-designed geo-domes, elevated on a raised platform. Each dome is furnished with reclaimed pallets frame beds complete with linens and a versatile table and chairs to round out the living space. Choose between a small domos, large dome, tents, or just an empty space to place your own tent. Electricity and free Wifi are offered in each dome.  Additional amenities are located common domes on site.

name: La Casa De Mamita.
description:
We stay here some good time with this family . Mamita is the mother of Rayu ,we meet him at el paseo de los monos closed to Puyo . We come in their community with him . The Puerto of Santa Ana community is a simple place ,local place ,not a tourist place . And they want preserve their tradition and the nature . They re very welcome to share their tradition . And his mum can prepare some local speciality , Mito con palmito , camote ...
They've got two simple bedrooms but we stay in front of their house with our 7 meters bigrig . Here you cook with the raining water , wash you on the river , make ceremony with shaman and 3 meters Boa across the river  in a crazy basic cable , you can discover the simple things and beautiful place . 
A very good expérience for our family to stay with the Rayu family. 

When you arrive , just find water tower , the casa of Mamita is the first house closed of this tower.

To stay in a room , with food is 10 dollars .
But if you want stay in front of their house , ask them the price . It's depend if you want try some food . Or make a donation .

name: Los Arrayanes
description: We stay more than 10 days in this little montain village over the clouds . The road is rought but it was ok with our 24 feet RV . We stayed on the plaza in the front of the little church . There is just one family in this community . Here we learn to make cheese with Jorge ,the responsable of the queseria . A lot of hike to make . Probably the most sunset of our travel . Sometimes during the afternoon is cloudy but every times in the evening the clouds go down. Fresh milk every morning , fresh cheese, the sound of silence . Los Arrayanes or «el pueblo sobre las nubes ». At the time is free but the community want develop for overlander . Not a lot of services , source water , «dirty toilet» . There is a ranchera with vegetables and alimentation on sunday and thursday . dustbin truck on thursday . You can  take a ranchera or a pick up( 50 cent) to go to Salinas or la Palma. The market at La Palma is Friday , the road is nice but hard with a truck.... , simple things of the life here , top!

name: Mendogas
description:
We refill our 20 gallon fixed tank of our RV for 10 dollars . There could be a refill bottle, ask. The workers are very welcome and happy to see foreiners.

Nous avons rempli notre reservoir de propane , 20 galons pour 10 dollars . Il a fallut dévisser la conexion . Les ouvriers sont super sympa et content de voir des voyageurs.
Ils peuvent probablement remplir des bouteille tous types vus leurs raccords. 
fermé entre 12h et 14h .

name: Hostal Alpaka
description: Warm food, warm bed...what more can a traveler want?! We stayed one night in a triple room (4 of us) for $80 including breakfast and dinner. Good parking and available RV camping in the parking area for free. Internet is reasonable, people are really nice!

name: Very rough road
description: Use extreme caution: this is a 2km section of very rough, dirt road. Many deep ruts/holes; steep/sharp turns with sharp rocks in some locations. Do not attempt without high clearance 4x4 with low-range gearing. Motorcycles, however, should be fine. Conditions worse when wet.  If wanting to go to one of the informal campgrounds (marked on iOverlander) on the west side of the lake, best approach is the cobbled road leading directly from Otovalo. NOTE: that road doesn't actually show up on GoogleMaps or iOverlander.

name: María la Panadería
description:
Nice bakery not your typical Ecuadorian panadería. She has masa de madre (sour dough) and a nice selection of pastries, breads and desserts. Everything is vegan and delicious. The coffee was very good and I enjoyed my Guayusa tea.
Every other Saturday morning workers from the organization Huerto Manias de-mente orgánica is there to talk about  their organic products: marmalade, pestos, krauts and more. Their products are a bit pricey but it supports a good cause and enables the people working in the gardens and making the products to make a living. The products are always available for purchase here.

name: Roca-Trac
description: "Soldadura" nice guy helped us right away with a small welding job. 30Bls.

name: LA RUTA
description: Great place, nice people, can camp anywhere or have roofs for cars or vans.

name: LA RUTA
description: Great mechanic, with scanner, offers fixing the car while you stay at the place, it is 10km from Canoa, and buses passs by the door :)

name: Recreation Site
description: We stayed one night here , You can park a big RV. It was very quiet and safe for us. There is light during the night . There is big playground for kids and sports fields. There are all services, more or less clean, for FREE.  There is a big swimming pool and turkish banos for 2,50 dollars and 1 dollar for kids.

name: the tower of theater
description: There is a lot of beautiful cheaper music concert ,ask information at office. And a very beautiful view of the town for free. In the same building, a small music museum . The interset of this place is the view of the tower and the very old theater around 1875. We can see here an orchestra for 5 dollars 2 adults and 2 children. we stay in the parking of front during the night , after ask at the office.

name: Hostal Machalilla
description: Nice and clean hostel with big common areas in the middle (hammocks and terraces). Double room was $10 pp with private bathroom and very hot shower. In the courtyard there is space for bikes and basically for cars as well (only the entrance seems a bit low clearance). There is a kitchen as well.

name: Hot showers Montañita
description:
Here you have showers and toilets.
A yellow house. Good people, clean bathrooms and very hot showers.
shower: 1.50
Bathrooms: 0.75

name: Wild camping with beautiful view
description:
Wild camping spot with beautiful view over a valley. Secluded, quite and safe. It is on a small dirt road that circles a small mountain but while we were standing here, only one other car passed by.
It was very windy but ever place we looked at in the area was like that. 
How to get here: Take the turn off from the main road into the excellent (presumably soon to be paved) dirt road for about 1-2km and then turn left.
We easily fitted two cars. Big rigs would have a very tough time turning around. Anything until 6-7m (18-21ft) should be fine.

name: Better than nothing close to the park
description:
parking good for big cars.
Next to the park El Mamey.
sure the police pass several times and neighbors good people.
No bath or shower but for a good night

name: Valladolid
description:
Very nice village , good safe and calm place to stay the night here . Free , potable (local) water , toilets . There is average Wifi at the restaurant , they give the password if you eat or drink something . The people are very welcome here and the countryside is wonderfull. Panaderia, papeleria, tiendia here ...;)
There is some very old wood house , built more than years old.
It's possible to put water on your tank of your truck here .

name: LA RUTA
description: 3 usd a night per person, animal frendly!

name: Mercedes Benz taller Marco
description:
Marco is specialized in Mercedes benz cars and helped us out with a electrical problem. EDC light turned on and van didnt start anymore. 
He had the knowledge and tools to fix this problem within a couple of hours. Place looks shabby but great work!

name: Tour guide Fernando Sifuentes
description:
Fernando operates trips to Yasuni Park from Nuevo Rocafuerte. He can tailor the trip to your needs, provide basic accommodation (tents, bedding) and three meals a day. We did a tour with him and saw dolphins, Giant otters, Sloths and four kinds of monkeys plus many birds. He is  keen on birds and can identify many of the species in the park. The more people there are the less expensive it becomes. He starts at $95 pp p day but this can drop to $70 or $80. Fernando has two boats - one large and one small and we spent many hours walking, birdwatching and doing trips on the water. Our days started at 6.30am and ended with spectacular sunsets on the lagoon. 
contact Fernando at +593980519789

name: Mirador
description: On the road from Zamora to Loja. Eventually could stay overnight. You would have to level your camper. Traffic at night is not much. There are more such pullouts along this road.

name: Hotel Carolina
description: Nice clean hotel on the way to Loja. Matrimonial $20 and parking $5 but gave to us for $20 all up. Private bathroom with soap and towels, cable tv, view overlooking the valley. Cold showers. WiFi connects but doesn’t work.. but would recommend for a stopover to anyone considering driving this crazy road in the dark!

name: Bella Italia
description:
Great authentic italian restaurant.
Very good food, nice staff, italian music. And the owner is a very generous person  ;-)

name: Tecnomotor
description: We were there because our sprinter broke down. Tried to find the the problem for 1,5 days. Found it.. the computer was broken. Send us to an specialst in Puerto viejo... dont want any money for his work - 1,5 days checking every cable and connection. Unbelievable nice people. They have wifi as well.

name: Electromecanica Venecia
description:
Electrician ... re-engineered motor starter 

Eletricista...arrumou motor de arranque do motor home

name: Machala
description: Overnight on the sidewalk with a motorhome, in front of the police. Safe, but a bit noisy. There is no bathroom, no energy.

name: Dead end road next to river
description:
Dirt road , before the bridge on the right side of the main road. At the beginning you have a little bump with water you have to cross. Not 4x4 needed but also not for big rigs. 
Lot of birds, silence and nice view . The river is low and the road  on the right side is a little bit above. We had nice overnight and felt safe.

name: Estacion de bomberos Tena
description: We spent one night in firefighters, also came about travelers backpack. Captain very good person very friendly. We went to ask for shower and ended up sleeping there

name: Parque Juan Benigno Vela
description: Very good place to spend the night in the city, a small street next to the park which has trees right on the pavement, very quiet, seems very safe, and has no traffic almost.

name: Artes moto Fabrisio Ordóñez
description: Motorcycle shop, fabrisio is a profesional technician, checked the front breake and changed the rear bearings, fair price

name: Ranger Station Sangay National Park
description: If you can get across the river in your vehicle this is where you end up, otherwise it is a 6km walk here. The building is complete and there is designated areas for camping and parking but there was no one here. It looks like eventually there will be a bathroom but everything still looks to be work in progress. The trailheads to the lagunas are here too.

name: Parque Real de los aves exóticas
description: In this parque you can see a lot of different birds (ducks, pigeons, pheasant..). The owner of the parque has build it up 18 years ago and besides the birds in cages there are also free living birds which chose this park to live in because of its beautiful flora

name: Hostel Bauhouse
description: Cosy and friendly hostel near to main Park, Calderon's Park.

name: Casa de Juan Gabriel - CLIMBING
description: If you want to climb in Cojitambo, it is the PERFECT place. Juan Grabriel is a guide and you can homestay in is house too. He knows everything and you can rent material if you don't have it or just ask him informations. Just give him a call +593 999 52 33 76, or send him an email at ecotrekexpeditions@hotmail.com. There is a climbing sign in front of his house.

name: Above the river- out of sight.
description:
good for overnight or short brakes. In the middle of nowhere.

Plain, enough space for 3 middle sized RVs or 2 big rigs. quiet, bitween the road is a dam, just a few coats come for visit.

name: Casa de Filtros
description:
Good sorted shop to buy all kinds of filters (oil, diesel, gasoline, air). Really nice guys who are helping with everything and have a good knowledge.
We got our diesel pre filter here.

name: Ao lado do parque
description:
Quiet place, close to the center. Apparently safe.
--
Lugar tranquilo, próximo ao centro. Aparentemente seguro.

name: Hostal Carlos Jaramillo
description:
Very nice hotel, rooms are quite big and the beds are comfy.
There is a large garage available (could fit 2 big rigs I would say).
The owner is nice and offered us to use his kitchen if needed.
They initially wanted 20$ for a matrimonial room with bathroom (only cold shower), but we ended up paying 15$.

name: calle cerca del río tranquila y segura
description:
street next to the river and near the shopping center.
after a bad night parked at the tap (near the hospital).
We found this street and slept three nights here.
It is safe (houses and shops nearby) but very well so quiet. For one or two good nights.
It has tienas, restaurants and simple hostels nearby.
--
calle ao lado del río y cerca del shopping center. 
despues de una mala noche parqueados en el grifo (cerca del hospital).
Encontramos esta calle y dormimos tres noches acá. 
Es segura( casas y tiendas cerca) pero mismo asi bien tranquila. Para una ou dos noches bueno.
Tiene tienas, restaurantes y hospedagens sencillas cerca.

name: Duchas shower
description: Duchas por 1 dólar. Agua caliente, no muy limpio.

name: Zen Wei - Vegetariano
description:
Cute vegetarian oriental food restaurant. The owners are from Taiwan and very friendly. Rich food and at a good price.
-- 
Lindo restaurante de comida oriental vegetariana. Los dueños son de Taiwan y muy simpáticos. Rica comida y a buen precio.

name: Cafenoa
description:
Internetcafe & Turist information
surf rentals
STICKERS

name: Confecciones Caluco, locally-made backpacks
description:
If you're looking for a reasonably-priced hiking backpack or smaller day pack, this is a cool place. The owner Carlos sews the bags himself. You can see him stitching the pieces together when you go!

The bags range from $20 for a school bag to $60-70 for the big packs with external aluminum frames. We bought two medium-sized bags for $30 each for trekking (sorry I don't know the specific sizes). He also makes waist packs and other small bags. I included some pictures of the examples, but I'm sure he could make a specific color for you if you wanted.

Check this place out if you want a simple but affordable backpack made in Ecuador, and also to support local business.

name: old road
description:
next to main road, quiet, not seen from the road, good for a night . 
There is also a meadow, were you can put up a tent.

name: los monos, monkey rescue centre
description:
4$ for adults. 2$ for kids
very nice place to visit or volunteer.
Owned by Ivan a swiss (French speaking) passionate.
Here you can see many rescued monkeys, parrots, snakes, coatis, and many more! Definitely a better option to see wildlife than the indigenous communities.
the setting is a beautiful natural forest.
Some animals such as coatis and small monkeys are in total liberty.

name: mecánica automotriz - alignment too
description: 15$ for the alignment with machines, 2$ for balancing, and they charged us 5$ for cleaning the brake's pads and fixing another weird sound that we had where the brakes were. they were really friendly and recommended us touristy places to visit.

name: Posada Puerto Napo
description:
Family accommodation, suitable for groups, and economic! Fabián, the owner is really friendly and in his hostel he has rooms for groups and couples, has an area to relax, pool and wifi! In addition he is always willing to help and organize tourist activities such as rafting and act as a guide to nearby tourist spots! He let us stay in his parking lot when we hired rafting with him, we really enjoyed it!
-
Hospedaje familiar, apto para grupos, y económico! Fabián, el dueño es realmente simpático y en su hostal tiene habitaciones para grupos y para parejas, tiene una zona para relajarse, piscina y wifi! Además siempre está dispuesto a ayudar y a organizar actividades turísticas como rafting y guia a lugares turísticos cercanos! A nosotros nos dejó quedarnos en su parqueadero cuando contratamos rafting con él, lo disfrutamos realmente!

name: Rafting - Fabian
description:
Si quieres hacer rafting, Fabián es el hombre! Por 50$ puedes pasar un día entero haciendo rafting, con almuerzo. Son en total tres horas y media a cuatro en el agua, en un río nivel 3-4 de agua azul y limpia! también tienen la opción de contratar medio día por 30$
lo pueden contratar en la posada Puerto napo, o vía: +593998876193
-
If you want to do rafting, Fabian is the man! For $ 50 you can spend a whole day doing rafting, with lunch included. They are altogether three and a half hours to four in the water, in a 3-4 level river of and clean blue water! They also have the option of hiring half a day for $ 30, he speaks a bit of English, you can hire it at the posada Puerto Napo or via: +593998876193

name: Hostal Limoncocha
description: You can camp at the parking lot of this beautiful Hostel and use all the amenities for 2 Dollar per Person. It has a super relaxing terasse with hammocks, a fully equipped kitchen, hot showers and they offer drinkable water for free. The Internet works very good and the german owner helps you with everything you want to know about the area. Laundry service available. We recommend this place :-)

name: Mega Clean self-service laundromat
description: We walked by this place and wish we'd known about it earlier because I prefer to do my own laundry! This place looked awesome! There are dozens of shiny new industrial washers and dryers here. I added pictures here, but they also have a Facebook page called Mega Clean Lavandería (Cuenca). For example, they have washers that are priced as 2.50, 3.50, 4.50, and 5.50, depending on size.

name: Tequila...
description:
We stumbled upon a distillery of agave that makes alcohol and other agave products like agave honey. The family that run it make a product that is really high quality and is similar to tequila but processed differently (they are trying to call it miski along with a handful of other producers. You can camp here with them as they show you their process and give you free samples. Me being from mexico I highly recommend stopping by here and taking a bottle or 3 (like us) of their wonderful product. 
Turn off the main road at -3.410045, -79.149948 and keep going on dirt road, stay to the right at the fork and then to the left when you get in the main town. 

Don Isaac is the name of the owner and the company. The family is incredibly sweet and it is very calm and untravelled area. worth a visit. 

As of 2023 they also have a smal little sign.

name: Estation la Cadena
description: It is the parking lot from the toll station. Not a nice place, but i can not find an other one in daytime. Verry noisy and dusty, but it seems save. There are Policeman nearby they take a look at the place from time to time. WC and shower.

name: Near Cojimíes on the beach
description: Beautiful place near the sea, the owner don't have problem to bring some space to travel people. Its free $0, very quiet, there some vigilant in the night. You can sleep in "hamacas" or your tent.

name: Kendall motor
description:
workshop for truck, bus, etc.Spa large .. has, water, light to spend the night when they tidy the vehicle.

oficina para caminhão,bus, etc.espaco grande..tem, água,luz para passar a noite quando arrumam o veículo.

name: Mecanica bus,caminhao,camionetes,autos
description:
specialized mechanics for bus, truck, pickup, cars.
Large terrain where you can park inside the generator for power and water while cleaning the vehicle.

Contact Lucas. + 593/0990671685

mecânica especializada para bus,caminhão,camionetas,autos.
Terreno grande , onde pode se passar dentro do motor home com energia e água enquanto arrumam o veículo.Contato Lucas.+593/0990671685

name: La Casa de Gina
description:
Hostel, restaurant.
They have rooms for 10$

name: Autolider, Mercedes Benz Dealership
description: Mechanic for trucks, they moved from other place. They did some minor work for us, made us not really happy. Communications difficult. We stayed and waited nearly 2 days.

name: Freedom Bike Rental
description:
We stored our motorcycle here for three weeks while we visited Canada, the best storage option by far in Quito.

We can not say enough about this place. Great staff, and a wide variety of services. This is the only place we’ve seen on our travels where they rent large adventure bikes. They also rent scooters and cars, and have a mechanic shop working on all makes of motorcycle. I highly suggest to stop by to chat with them and have a coffee, even if you aren’t renting they can provide you all the recommendations of where to go and what to see.

name: Liguiqui Beach Camping
description: Beautiful flat spot overlooking the coast, we saw lots of whales. We were here on a Saturday, a few families during the day and then absolutely no one in the evening or night. Restaurant on beach served a pretty good lunch.

name: Good hospedaje - very cheap
description:
A nice, modern hospedaje at a families home. The guestrooms, bathroom and kitchen are seperated from the family. Well maintained, clean and good facilities like a livingroom with couches, tv & airco, kitchen with good cooking facilities (pots, pans, blender, oven, tostimaker), drinkwater for free, fridge. Good wifi. Hot shower, towels, toiletpaper and handsoap. Free use of washingmachine.
 $10,- for 1 person, $16 for 2 persons, $26 for 3 people per night. 
They have several rooms, we stayed a week but were the only ones. Maybe because it's a bit further from the beach than most hotels, but it's only 500 meters and totally worth the short walk.

Whatsapp of the owner Maria Esther 096  9168155
Email: mtandalla@hotmail.com

Recommended, considering price/quality.

name: Playas
description:
Quiet place with shady trees near the beach. Apparently safe and relatively clean.

Lugar tranquilo com sombra de árvores perto da praia. Aparentemente seguro e relativamente limpo.

name: Tecniguay
description: very professional person for change tires, oil etc... for big rigs !

name: Huge Mercado
description:
We stopped here for lunch by chance on Sunday. And it was a huge. There are so many restaurants and groceries shops in this place.
It may be bigger on Sunday. And be careful for your belongings, local women told us that there are many thieves.
Enjoy

name: Camera batteries
description:
If you are looking for camera battery, come here.
They have Canon, Nikon, Sony and more. It’s not original but better than nothing!
The store “Inpormel” is located ground floor in the brue building “Edificio el Cisne”

name: Bomberos Cayambe
description:
Good fireman in Ecuador.
They allow me to stay in the gym, bathroom, shower, wifi if you ask, kitchen.
One block to the mercado and two to the supermarket.
They are proud to have a guestbook and help travellers!
They are nice and friendly but they don't like to speak too much... 
Thanks you guys

name: turbo diesel H&h
description:
laboratório de bicos..bombas injetoras.turbo.+59302452251/0997316881

The specialize in Injection pumps and turbo.

name: garza roja
description: swimmingpool parc perfect with childrens in the nature. a bit old but clean. with 2 museum. entrance 3 dollars p. pers. during week, $6 on week-ends. very nice place. with restaurant inside.

name: Carliza 2 hotel
description:
A very low budget hotel, after bargaining $19,- for 2 persons. 
Private room with double bed, a fan, bathroom with hot shower and cleaned every day. A basic shared kitchen. Potable water for thee & coffee. WiFi is so so. During evening/night nobody is at the reception.
If you don't care about a fancy place, but just need something cheap with basic facilities, this is the place. 
Another advise: Buy some of the delicious, well filled empanadas for $1,- next to the market, daily between 4 pm - 9 pm!

name: Izhcayluma Camping Area
description:
$10pp. A separate space from the hostel above. It has its own WiFi network, a covered picnic bench, four 110v electricity outlets, and a water spigot (near orange trees). Bathroom/shower with hot water about 30 meters away. You can still use all the lovely hostel facilities (observation decks, pool, restaurant, free yoga). Staff are very friendly; despite being a resort-like place, they are welcoming to us overlanders! The German owner also makes three types of beer served on tap.

Pets can stay in a camping car . If you want accommodation you have to rent a cabana so that the pet can sleep on the terrace. Pets are not allowed in the rooms.

Don't go up the driveway! The camping area is just as you pull off the road, but it is secure, with privacy hedges and a dedicated surveillance camera monitoring the parking area at all times. Vehicle gate closed at 10pm. Tent camping not permitted.

name: Tailor- Fix Clothes
description:
A very good and friendly tailor. Fixed our clothes fast and in good quality. 
Very cheap.

name: Radiadores Pineda
description:
In Quito repair of radiators, intercoler, repairs.
address Garcia Moreno s / n PB.y passage Pacha "Llano Grande" telephone + 593/0987894044

Em Quito revisão de radiadores, intercoler, consertos.
endereço Garcia Moreno s/n PB.y passagem Pacha " Llano Grande" telefone+593/0987894044

name: Tecni Prrcision/Retifica
description: empresa especializada em retifica de motores, soldas especiais,etc...Endereço.Dir.El Morlan N314 y Samuel Fritz fone +593/2813310/0999958398/carlosnevpas@hotmail.com

name: Lá choza del sol
description:
Excellent place !! Quiet and comfortable, affordable price, shared kitchen. Place to build a camping tent, place for a motohomer, car with automotive tent. In the establishment there is room with up to 7 single beds. Place to wash clothes by hand and a wood burning stove. Near the beach walking 4 minutes. Entrance with 3 meters of height. Mr. Luis Sarmento mobile number: 593-0986869890

Excelente lugar!! Tranquilo, preço acessível, cozinha compartilha. Lugar para aramar uma barraca de camping, lugar para um motohomer, carro com barraca automotivo.

name: Parqueadero
description: Parking lot in the middle of the city. Gated at night, very clean. 4$/night and we could use the super clean toilets (there is even a electric shower, which we didn't use). Family lives here and is very friendly and welcoming! Height restrictions are about 2,7-2,9 m, small vehicles fit easily, bigger vehicles might be possible in the back.

name: Free shower
description: Free cold showers and big parking lot just by the tool payment.

name: Hostal el encuentro
description: Very basic rooms with shared basic bathroom but safe place to store your bicycles. We paid 7$ per person. Expensive for what it is but Ecuador is more expensive than Colombia.

name: Hotel Mi Casa
description: Decent hotel if you are passing through. They have a large parking area. The entrance to the hotel is from inside the car park, not on the main street. $20 for a double room, AC, private bathroom with cold shower. The room was large and clean. Good wifi. Lots of restaurants and food shops close by.

name: Quito Airport Camping
description: Offering free WiFi and an outdoor pool and jacuzzi, Quito Airport Camping is located in Tababela, 12 minutes from Quito International Airport. Parking is available on site. We speak your language. We offer warm showers and bathroom, Wif-Fi free electricity, and a nice view in an environmental and nature place. Parking cost $2 per day (for just the camper). $5 per person if you sleep in the camper or use a tent.

name: Hostal Cañaveral
description: Great place. Well organised and clean. Flat grassy area with palms. Hammocks, slackline. Clean toilets and showers.  Average WiFi. Camping 8usd pp/ room 20usd pp. Breakfast included. There is a small  restaurant. You need to preorder your meal a couple hours before.

name: La Garza Roja
description:
We parked for free in the front of the cultural park La Garza Roja. Right in the nature near the river, very quiet. We asked the guardian for permission. Lots of mosquitos. During the day if you pay the entrance fee to the park you can use toilet,  restaurant, shower, swimmingpool. Very nice museum.
 Perfect place for children.

name: Los Jaya' V
description:
Restaurant. Good parking lot. Breathtaking views. TV. Hot shower. Small grocery. Close to a road with little traffic. Very convenient position just in the middle of Cuenca and Macas. There is a good paved road heading to the river Paute.
Sleep there charge 2 USD per person. Hot Shower, 1 USD per person. Very safe because close military barracks. Also policlinic just in case. Very good internet signal.

name: Lagunas de Mojanda
description:
This is just the most amazing place, you can't miss it! 
We arrived to the lake after almost an hour from the closest city, and we were amazed by the view of the lake. The way is not hard, but a bit long and there are no shops nearby, so take everything you need. 
We did wild camping a few meters from the lake. We could do a fire, but since the area is pretty wet, we brought our own wood. It is also cold at night.
Don't miss the trekking to Fuya Fuya! Takes a bit more than 3 hs to go up and down.
BUT be careful! While we were doing the trekking, somebody open our car... Nothing was missing because probably the alarm scared the guy. We were lucky...So try to leave your car where other campers are. (Because one might think the area is peaceful and lonely but you can't trust..as we did...)
Anyway we loved the place. One of our favourites.

name: La Casita KoKopelli
description:
La casita de los mochileros, casita basica con dos habitaciones, capacidad de 4 personas máximo, sala, cocina básica y bano a compartir.
8$ con el desayuno.

name: Hotel tren al sur
description:
Hotel Tren al Sur is a great hotel. 
They charged 10 - 12 USD per person.
It is a very clean hotel with very friendly staff on reception, Luis and his Wife.
There is pretty good Wifi connection,  extremely hot water and they have garage too.
It was the best option in town for the price.
We would stay again here defenitely.

name: Retificadora Toalombo
description:
grinding of large motors, cylinders, head, welding, etc.

retifica de motores grandes,cilindros, cabeçote,soldas,etc
+593/0999342585/3265343=Angel

name: Antisana parque
description:
Antisana Ecological Reverse offers a diversity of life zones and is considered One of the ten "hot spots " in the world by being located in the upper Basin of Napo River. It is possible to Drive into the parque with bigger Rv's, the road is mostly paved.  No entrance fee only registration on the entrance. Entering from 7.00 - 17.00, last entering till 14.00.
We saw condors flying, a lot of humming birds, caracallas,  coyotes, a lot of rabbits and a stunning nature. Hiking is possible it you have the condition for the altitude over 4000 m.o.S.

name: Quilotoa view point
description: You can drive up to this view point and spend overnight for free. Nice view and quiet place. The road is a bit rough but not bad. There is a small shop there where you can drink coffee and beer. It was no problem for the owner’s shop to sleep at this place.

name: Biblioteca
description: Come here on the top of the building for a nice view around.

name: Sabroson de Carmita - almuerzo
description:
Nice almuerzo restaurant off the panam. Large eating area with direct view of parking spot.

Two choice of soup and two choice of main course.

I had the beef soup and the Chuleta and I was very pleased.

Fairly large portion of meat with typical beans, rice, sliced onions and Avocado.

Also came with a banana and red fresh fruit juice.

Friendly staff.

Price 2.75$

name: Achik Wasi Hostel
description: Parking of the hostel, with access to the bathroom. We slept on the car, paid 5$ for the two of us, for one night. Could be difficult for big rigs.

name: Santa Maria
description: A big good and cheap supermarket , parking for big rigs no problem

name: Warm shower
description: only site that we found for hot shower, we paid $ 2 per person, the cold shower costs $ 1 but in square out 0,50 is only for hot shower here.

name: Hostal San Marcos - with secured parking
description: Clean hostal, large parking garage. Internet is very bad (cant navigate really) just good for texting and WhatsApp. 10$ solo in a room with private bath. Did not try to negotiate.

name: Petro Ecuador (near Colombia border)
description:
No problem buying gas here for my Canadian Motorcycle.
Pretty much the last station before crossing into Colombia. (There was also another station 6km closer to the border) 25km driving distance to border crossing.

name: RS Multiservicios
description:
Friendly people, excellent work on our Land Rover Defender TD4 2.2. Change oils gearbox, transfer box, differential, etc. Very professional. Correct prices ($ 170). I highly recommend!
--
Excellent accueil et travail sur notre Land Rover Defender TD4 2.2. Changement huiles boite de vitesses, boite de transfert, differentiels, etc. Tres professionnels. Prix corrects 170 $. Je recommande fortement!

Jacobo Ramirez 0992832306
rsmultiservicios@outlook.com

name: El Refugio D'Grace
description:
Motel in La Mana. Hotel with camping possibilities. When camping you have access to toilets and cold shower. 5$ per person. Hotel has warm water (electric). In quite part of town with garden. You do hear the road. There is an area with a sink where we cooked with our own cooking gear. Very friendly host.

Nice place with a kitchen. Laundry 2,5 $. 10ppn. I think you can ask to stay on the parking, but don't know the price for it.

name: Taita Panadería
description:
Lovely little bakery, good quality and really cheap, you definitely have to go there!
The people who work there are a bit shy at first but if you talk to them you'll see that they are very very nice.

name: PubliiG
description: Graphic design place. You can get your license plate reprinted for extras. Great services, fast and cheap. Gabriel y Anahi are super nice and helpful.

name: Taller El Gato
description:
We had a loose tire, these super nice guys here hooked us up with a new ball bearing and got us back on the road in no time! 
Good mechanic experience!

name: Posto P&S Gas Station
description:
Good  and clean gas station to spend a night. Seems safe. 
Water available.

name: Hostel
description:
Recently build hotel with camping possibilities. Extra building in construction. 
Restaurant on site. 
Great walking trail through bamboo. 

Not sure if real big rigs fit under entrance.

name: Hostal Athene Moon
description: Great hostel with good WiFi and comfortable beds.  $24 for a private room with private bathroom.  TV in room, clean sheets, free fruit for smoothies.  $1 per kg for laundry.  Nice staff.  Free filtered water.  Not a party hostel.  Close to everything.  Highly recommend this place!  Hot showers.

name: La mirada del Solitario George
description: Small budget hotel. A bit aside of centrum (10min walking or taxi 1,5$). Super clean, cosy and silent. Big kitchen to prepare your meals. Owners always smiled and friendly. We paid 227 usd (tax 12% included) for 6 nights for double room with private bathroom (booking.com). Cash only.

name: Hostal Panamericano
description: Cheapest place we could find in town. $20 for a double w/o bathroom. Simple and clean. There is parking for a motorcycle or maybe a small car.

name: Andes Camp - 4x4 mecanic and awnings
description:
As a traveler himself Jaime and his son Javier produce awnings and have a mechanic shop specialized in 4wd
They have one, two awnings in stock, usually 2x2m, for other sizes they do it in about 4 working days.
Whatsapp +593996892888 Javier
(Little english possible ;)
They have a big property, so you could also sleep here they say.

name: Agua Purificada
description: Potable water, 20l for 2 USD. Will fill your canisters.

name: Congas
description: Friendly place. They tried hardly but they couldn't filled our 3kg argentinian bottle.

name: Immigration Police
description:
If in Vilcabamba, this is the best place to get a 90-DAY EXTENSION to remain in Ecuador beyond your initial 90-days. Very quiet, low-volume office run by helpful staff. Excellent parking on quiet street. You will need the following: (1) passport; (2) color photocopy of passport ID page and original Ecuador entry stamp; (3) extension request form that you will get at the immigration police office (you will need to provide some kind of Ecuador address which can be a campground or hostel); (4) $128.76 cash, to be paid at Banco del Pacifico in Loja.  
Process:
1. Go to immigration police office and get the extension request form and instructions for paying the $128.67 at Banco del Pacifico (3km north).
2. Go to Banco del Pacifico; pay using the instructions provided at the immigration police; get receipt!
3. Return to immigration police with payment receipt, completed extension request form, passport, passport photocopy of ID page and entry stamp.
4. 90-day extension is issued while you wait: small piece of paper that you keep in your passport. Any remaining time from your original 90 days is canceled; you now have 90 days beginning on the day you receive this extension, so it's best to wait until your original 90 days are almost up. Don't lose it! 
The whole process, including trip to bank and back was less than one hour. No requirement to show vaccinations or to have health insurance (we asked). Very easy.

name: Valdivia ecuador
description:
south entrance to Valdivia, next to the beach, there is a bus stop with restaurants, most are empty, very good parking area, lit all night.


entrada sur a Valdivia, al lado de la playa, hay un paradero con restaurantes, la mayoría están vacíos, muy buena zona de parqueo, iluminada toda la noche.

name: EduMotors
description:
Good, reliable and honest workshop recomended to us by locals. Reasonable prices. All the mechanic and electronc issues, oil changing, car wash etc. Really friendly to travellers. 

FB: EduMotors EduLiquid

name: Finca El Piura
description:
Finca with the best view of Sucua ! The road is not on maps me.   ripio road is steep. need a 4x4. Finca with areas for camping, toilet and showers. opportunity to sleep at night for 5 $ pp and half for children. offers guides to discover plants and flowers. also cane juice on site. there are busy weekends, barbecue grills, but during the week there are no motel people . but it's better to reserve two days before : whatsapp 0985116801 or 0992284473
..... 
Très belle finca avec une splendide vue sur sucua et les montagnes ! 
la route de ripio est avec une forte pente. necessite un 4x4. finca avec des aires de camping, toilettes et douches. possibilité de dormir la nuit pour 5$ pp et la moitié pour les enfants. propose des ballades pour decouvrir les plantes et les fleurs. vendent aussi du jus de canne fait sur place. il y a beaucoup de monde le week end pour faire des barbecues mais la semaine il y a personne. mais c’est mieux de prevenir deux jours avant grace a whatsapp 0985116801 ou 0992284473 

Il y plein de papillons, de colibri et des jeux pour enfants ! Un vrai paradis !!! 

camino de ripio es con un fuerte. necesita un 4x4. Finca con áreas camping, baño y ducha. oportunidad para dormir por la noche para 5 $ pp y la mitad de los niños. ofertas de baladas para descubrir las plantas y Flores. también llevar el jugo de la caña de hecho en el hotel. hay ocupado fin de semana hasta área para parrillas, pero la semana no hay tan persona. pero es mejor de llamar dos días antes para reservar WhatsApp 0985116801 o 0992284473

name: Quinta mendoza
description: Little quinta with pool. showers, toilet and barbecue. is it possible to stay for the night with portal closed.  horse for hiking and sport fishing on the site.

name: Albergue de Turismo Comunitario de San Pedro
description: It is a small community supported hosteria. You could park your rv on the gravel next to the place. Clean beds and a bathroom. 5$ per person. We arranged breakfast with one of the local people. You could also ask for dinner. Small local community!! If you have a free standing tent there is space for you!

name: Swiss Corner - Restaurant & Bakery
description:
Swiss restaurant (with Cordon Bleu, homemade Bratwurst and Älplermagronen...) and swiss bakery (with Zopf, Ruchbrot and Nussgipfel...). Great products, good service, very recommended!!
Prices: menu 12-15$ / bread ~2$
We only found it on our last day in Quito :(

name: Pension Crucita & camping
description:
A good hostel, with access to a kitchen, good WiFi and sufficient parking for motorcycles
Kind owners. 

$6 per person per night. if you stay longer they will reduce it to $5
very close to the town square and other shops

name: La chocolatera
description: The most western point of Ecuador. Beautiful free site. Overnight camping/parking is not allowed!

name: VW Mechanic Roberto Naula
description: Roberto Naula is a good vw mechanic. He's experienced and affordable.

name: Gecko Mauro
description:
Mauro is a good mechanic and a very nice guy. 
Whatsapp 0994118007

name: Linea mitad del Mundo Calacali.
description:
Mitad del mundo  Calacali.
Ligne d'Equateur á Calacali

name: Primax GranSol Supermarket
description:
There's a small parking lot behind the Primax gas station, right in front of the supermarket.
Toilets were clean and open all night.
Good for a night before going into the national park. Probably can't stay here during the day.

name: Comunidad Shirypuno
description:
You can take a boat from Misahualli for 1 dolar to the Indigenous Comunidad Shirypuno. There you can ask their president Klever and he will allow you to put your camp for free. There are shops with basic food.

Se puede tomar un barco de Miahualli por 1 dolar a la comunidad Shirypuno. Alli se puede preguntar el presidente de la comunidad, Klever, si puedes poner la carpa alli y normalmente no hay problema. No te cuesta nada. Hay tiendas con alimentos basicos

name: Casa La Caracola
description: Just minutes from town this beautiful place has a comfortable room, private parking, and an amazing view of the city. $20 for a double room. Best way to describe the property is a nice private residence with great hosts.

name: Vice Gas Station
description: it is yust a gas station 24h open,  Toilet, showers, mini market, may be noisy

name: Dos Lagos
description:
Its awesom ride thru Cajas NP on the other side. It looks like its good place to sleep as.well. Regardig the Guard its OK.
we only have a pickning and good walk around.

name: two officers threatening to impound your car
description: We were being stopped on our way to the Peruvian border. Aduana officers told us that TIP needed to be in our name not in the person's name we were driving the car in. Repeatedly said it would cost us more than 700 USD and we needed to show up with original TIP holder to get car back unless "we were able to find a solution". Threatened to impound our bags as well. Luckily, we could call the Ecuadorian notary who created our poder - not sure what would've happened elsewise. Reluctantly let us go.

name: Gasstation PetroEcuador
description:
This busy gasstation is open 24/7, friendly people. Not many parking possibilities but no trucks stay here so shouldn't be a problem. We parked next to the kiosk and the aircompression.
The cute 10-year old kid Erik from the kiosk is happy to meet foreigners and speaks proudly a few words english. Please say hi from his amigos Janneke & Ralph from Dutch on Wheels or "Janeth & Rafael" from Holanda.

name: Mindo Lindo
description: Private Reserve run by an Ecuadorian-German couple. beautiful setting. nice large terraces with colibri drinking stations. an incredible amount of hummingbirds as well as other species. very tranquil. incredibly nice owners. Heike is an ornithologist. they also offer tours. you can stay in your car next to the big house. Also, they have beautiful rooms. We got tempted and stayed in a room. also possible to get breakfast.  nice trails for birding on the premises. Spanish, German and English spoken. contact: 0998079177

name: Laguna de Busa
description: Camping, Overlanders, and rooms... Bathrooms, restaurante and big lake with nice facilities... 2 dolar p/p, 5 dolar for camping... Don't know te rooms rate...

name: amazonian tour & cabania
description:
Henry provide tour in Amazonia in a comunity kichwa. For us 3 days deep in the jungle (4 hours by bus and 3 hours by canoë from Puyo). 500 $ all included for 8 person. Henry is a very good guy and explain eveything you want about the culture and the region. wonderfull experience and really imersive because no other tourist. You live like an amazonian (food, fishing, talk with local...). 
Otherwise it is possible to sleep in the cabania of his parents just in the  other side of the river near cascada hola vida. Very beautiful place (you need to call and they came by canoë to search you). 20$ per familly per night. 2,5$ for a local meal. 
You can join Henry by WhatsApp +593 98 452 2834.

name: Nuevo Pueblo cheese Factory
description: local cheese Factory - artesanal cheese done in Swiss style and quality. butter, fresh cheese, Gouda, Tilsitter with different herbs and spices, Mozarella. very tasty. Good prices. Give it a try

name: Hostal Gran Macará
description: Big hotel with a large gated garage, big enough for big rigs (4 lorries parked overnight when we were there). $10 for a matrimonial room, which is good value with own bathroom (cold shower only) but with towels and soap, very clean and friendly staff. WiFi, tv in room and comfy bed. Quiet overnight and five minute walk into the town where there is central market, supermarket and restaurants. Just off the main road.

name: Hostal D’Rio Cariamanga
description:
Hostel in the centre of Cariamanga, right off the main plaza with large secure parking area behind. Quiet at night, nice sized rooms with own bathroom (hot water, towels, shampoo and soap) and comfy beds. WiFi and tv in rooms. $16 US per night for matrimonial or double room. 10 for single. 

We looked round others and Hostel San Francisco was the cheapest at 14US but the locked parking garage is just up the road so we didn’t want to leave our bikes there as you have to ask for the key each time. Grand Calvas Hotel was a really really nice place but 25 per night and Hostal Pamplona was 20 per night, both have garages too. 

Couldn’t find any info about the road E69 but it’s a well paved road, seems very new and pretty quiet. No problem with any vehicle. Reasonably hilly but not too steep. Not many opportunities to wild camp (in tent) as a lot of the road is fenced off, lots of small villages on way though to buy groceries.

name: PS gasolinera
description: We asked if we could spend the night at the gas station and they said yes right away, a safe place and the lady at the minimarket is very friendly! There is free wifi password

name: Kurt Nieding Repair Shop
description: Kurt Nieding is a german guy and he has a repair shop for Mercedes, BMW, Audi and Porsche. But he likes to help all Overlanders. He did a great job on our heavy Mercedes Atego Truck. His repair-shop is located in a guarded comunity called ‚El Aromito‘. There is no sign at the entrance. So please give him a call in advance: +593998304533 / knieding@hotmail.com. Kurt speaks german, english and spanish.

name: Fragatas y Delfines
description:
Nice place to see dolphins! 
They take you on a little boat along the river close to the coast and show you a lot of playing dolphins. Friendly staff!

name: Infiernillo pulularía
description: This is a beautiful place to camp. 4x4 vehicles.  No big rigs. Small river close to take a bath clear water. Space for 4 vehicles.  Very quite place 30 minutes from pulugua village.

name: Wasi Kichwa
description: A native family of farmers and musicians welcome you on their country home only 3km from the center if town. A good place to imerge yourself in a Quechua culture. 3 dollars pp in a tent, 5 dollars pp in the room.

name: Lavanderia
description: Small laundry service located downstairs from the street level.  They will get your laundry done in 3-5 hours.  Costs $1 per kilo.

name: Equipos Cotopaxi
description: Outdoor store that sells butane/propane canisters for camping stoves.  Hard to find type that works for jetboil type mountaineering stoves.  $9 for a 500g bottle.

name: casa del arranque
description: The place to repare the starter of every type of véhicules. they can make new whith an old one if they don't have the new pieces. Very good place. on the Av. Prensa left side coming from quito just before Av. Florida.  You can find the shop on Facebook whith the direction and phone number and open hours.

name: Donde Tadeo Hostel
description:
Very comfortable, the people are very friendly. We pay u $ d 5 per night for 2 people for sleeping in the camper, and we use the services of the hostel: kitchen, shower (good pressure and hot water), bathroom and living room with tv, pool. All very clean spaces
In addition we were able to wash our clothes: a full washing machine (6 kg aprox) for u $ d 5 with drying included.

name: Olas del Mar
description: Nice little fish-restaurant. The owner is a fisher man who serves you nicely. Always fresh fish. Standard meal (almuerzo/merienda) costs about 3usd, ala carte about 6 to 8 usd (camarones, langostines, cheviche).

name: Parque San Sebastian
description: An another parking of the park without zumba at 6 on the morning. Free and 10 minutes walk from the center. There is a big place just in front for the children. Really better than the other parking of Parque San Sebastian.

name: Filtrocorp
description: Fuel and oil filters. Huge selection and very helpful in finding a solution to our fuel and water separator needs. Super cheap.
