name: ATC Auto Tapiceria CAYAMBE
description:
Vincente GUAÑUNA Tapicero in CAYAMBE.
He restored the seats of our Land Rover in a remarkable way, at a very good price.
---
Vincente GUAÑUNA Tapicero  a CAYAMBE. 
Il a restauré les sièges de notre Land Rover d'une maniere remarquable, a un très bon prix.

name: Masgas Petrol Station
description: Masgas petrol station with free cold showers, tap to fill water tank and two hoses to wash your car for free or wash dishes.

name: Marcos Pizza
description: Excellent New York style pizza, great tomotoe sauce, brick oven!!!!!! Owner speak English, Spanish and Chinese. Nightly specials, Tuesday 2 med for $15, 2 large for $20. Highly recommended!

name: Gas Station
description: PVD Gas station with “Pio pío” restaurant,  groceries and bathrooms. Pretty clean. Touristy. Seems very safe and well illuminated.

name: Bosch Battery center
description: we came here for a diagnoses of our battery. top service to check for free. trustable and professional

name: Starlight Inn
description:
Nice campground with beautiful view outside the village on the way to Isinlivi/Chuchillan.
To camp is 5 dollars p.p., they also have beds for 8 dollars p.p.
Breakfast costs extra.
They have warm showers, wifi, kitchen and a campfire spot.
The owners are very nice and help you with everything.

name: La Posada Cuencana
description: This Hostel is a lovely spot to stay. The interior is stunning inside made of dark wood and a glass roof covers the breakfast room. I paid 40 $ for a double room with a little balcony. Single rooms are 30 $.  It has a secured parking one block away. Not suitable for high vehicle over 2.10m.

name: Persian House
description: Located at the entrance of Mindo, about 300 meters from the main square, this Persian restaurant opened its doors in the first trimester of 2018, and has been captivating locals and visitor with its cozy interiors, delicious meals and friendly atmosphere

name: MotoLab
description: Moto mechanics. Francesco is from Italy (speaks spanish and italian), others are locals (one guy speaks english [and french, that's what he said]). A fancy place with lots of tools including a scanner for FI bikes' brains. There is a mark on OSM.

name: Dulce Tradición
description:
Great small place for sweets and try/ buy pack of local coffee.
Try the choco bananas they are incredible

name: Ridge camp above Angamarca
description:
Only accessible for cyclists and maybe motos at a push.

Look for a sign for the walking trail, take the dirt road but almost straight away on the right follow a small track up to an abandoned building and large pine tree (need to push bikes up). 
Lots of flat space in front of the house to camp in grassy meadow overlooking Angamarca on the other side of the valley and even a flat spot under a tree for a sheltered camp spot. Nice views, good sunset and really quiet at night.  Great place to camp!

name: CORRUPT POLICE
description:
They stopped us and wanted to know if we had fire extinguisher, triangles and first aid kit since its mandatory in Ecuador.

We had all the things, but our first aid kit wasnt a kit with a proper label on it. It was our own kit.

After 10min of discussion they asked us for money in order to avoid the fine.

We just said no and they let us pass without any more efford.

name: La casa de Jeimy San Cristobal
description:
Hello
There is so much hostel here...😆!
But we have try this one and it was ok.
They have rooms for 5 personnes so it's perfect for us with 3 children(around 80$)
Great rooms with view in the sea,private bathroom, lot of commun place to eat with hamacs on the last floor with nice view.
It's clean.
The owner is friendly.
Fo the price and pictures you have a lot on booking...😉
Enjoy😎

name: ATM Nexo
description:
Hello
It's an Pichincha bank ATM but it's write Nexo. 
It's the yellow one...!
With this bank and N26 card we haven't fee for our money.
We have take here a lot of dollars for going to Isabela (there isn't ATM on this isle!)
Each time by 500 dollars and it was ok
There is 2 others ATM here...
Banxo Bolivariano and Banco del pacifico.

name: Insular Hotel
description:
The owner and the crew are really friendly.
For a five persons family they have one big six place bedroom and it's really cool.
It's a clean place and you are just between the the 2 main beach (and free activity) and 15 mn walking from the port.

name: Parking place for night
description:
It's not the spot of the year...but...!
If you have a truck too big to go to the Cedro hostel near here, or if the Cedro hostel is full, it's a good alternative 😉
It's the parking of the town (may swimming pool before.
At the bottom of this place you can put your truck in the grass.
You can have electricity, wifi, water potable, and toilets (not clean).
There is light the night, there is also camera and a guard.
The price is 5$ for the day and 5$ for the night.
Quiet and safe night here..
This place do the job just the time to visit Banos.
But I would have prefered to go to Umberto house...😉

name: Hostal Casa Amigo
description: great place to park in your bus. Antonio the administrator is a really nice guy, always willing to help. We were going to stay for 1 night and stayed for 4 nights because we felt very comfortable. Available bathroom, shower, kitchen and electricity to charge electronic devices. $4 us per night

name: principal park azogues
description: nice park. Place to stay overnight and then park to enjoy during the day. no cost. Bathroom available for us 50

name: N/A
description: On a corner, enough space to pinch a tent or parc 2 /van/cars.

name: San Miguel 2
description: Basic hostel. Luis, the host, is a realy nice guy. 5 dollars pp with private bathroom.

name: Canoa Suites y Camping, Canoa
description:
Really beautiful and nice place outside Canoa, quiet and lovely location with direct access to the beach. Only 10 minutes walk to the village with several bars, restaurants and shops. Maija and Peter, a young couple from the states are nice hosts and speak english and spanish. Overlander are very welcome.
You can use the covered outdoor kitchen with seating, hammocks, shower, toilet, good Wifi, fireplace, electricity, also suitable for big rigs. 20 $/ night for 2 pers.
They also have suites to rent from 75 to 125 $ per day.

name: Fuya Fuya Hike
description: This is the beginning of the Fuya Fuya hike to the top of the south facing peak. Panoramic views at the top. Wonderful hike, but gets steep towards the end. Bring poles if you have them, or grippy hiking shoes.

name: Ahitana’s
description:
very Nice town, quiet and beauty.
i have 1/8 of chicken un other restaurant near to this, 2.5 good lunch at 18 hrs, no problem. lovely people and faboulous rain

name: Condor Matzi
description: Cosy family-run hostel in Zumbahua, bit rough around the edges but it’s clean and warm. Space for bicycles inside. $7 per person which is great value - rooms for 2-6 people, hot shower (shared bathrooms), great well equipped kitchen (oven and blender!!), WiFi, sitting room with fire and free tea. Friendly owners who will go out of their way to help. Opposite the main plaza which has an amazing Saturday market too. We had a relaxing few days here and it felt like home by the time we left!

name: Carlos y Kathy's Place
description: From Quito, we're looking for a place to overnight close to Perdenales but not in the city. We kept driving 20 minuts from Pedernales, we crossed the latitude 0 and on the main road following the ocean, we stopped in a small village of fishermen named La Cabuya, you can see a sign on the road saying Cabañas/Habitaciones, take the road (the first right, just where is the coffee shop) on the right facing the ocean and at the end the last house on the right  side, you'll find this happy family.We asked them where to park our Renault master2 (2m5 high 4m5 long) and the family propose us to park directly inside of their garden, in front of the ocean with a terrace, mangos and hammocks. We had the access to the bathroom of one of the cabañas, with toilet and cold shower. We made a little trip with them, good fresh yoghurt on the road going to the South called Yogur Don Lalo. Usually a cabaña is 20$ for one night but as we slept inside of the van, they told us that we could gave them whatever we wanted. We gave them the last 10$ we got even though they deserve a lot more! Don't miss the breads of the grandma up to the main road (cafeteria Doña Letty) made from 3pm until the night! We asked them to add the place on iOverlander, it was the first time for them to host travelers like us but really interesting and nice people!

name: Gopro and Camera Store
description: Here you can find a lot of things for cameras and underwater-cameras. We got a new battery pack for our Sony.

name: Hostal Pakari
description: Good for a stop through. Clean rooms, decent wifi. Not really near anything, so make sure to grab dinner beforehand. There is underground parking, perfect for motos. Bit of a tight turn at the bottom. A regular sized truck/van should be ok. But anything tall or wide wouldn’t make the corner. 3-4 parking spots out front. Not near the action, so should be safe. I have a queen bed, private bath for $15

name: Hotel Santander "Don García"
description:
Clean and cheap hotel. $15 USD for a room for 2 people. TV and private bathroom with hot water :)
Good wifi, free parking (2.30 m. high) 

Also you can pay $5 for 2 hours room LOL

name: Mashpi Amagusa Campground
description:
Nice little campground for tents in the Mashpi region. 
Water toilets and electricity, no showers. 
Price: 5$ per tent, 10$ per person per day 
Access only per foot, no cars. No cars on the campground. Have to be parked outside.
The owner Sergio is a very good guide for birding.

name: Espumita Azul
description: cheap fast clean.  paid $0.35 per pound same day pick up

name: Restaurante Carmita.
description: Very good indeed. Simple menu but really tasty. I choose not to have the soup, and for that I paid 2,50 for the meal with a natural juice included.

name: PS Centro Flavio
description: Big gas station. Clean Toilet and grocery store.

name: parking between the trees
description:
a large space between the trees. The only "good" space we find. We stayed two nights it seemed safe. no facilitation. better than nobody

-ORIGINAL POST-
parqueadero entre los arboles

un gran espacio entre los árboles. Lo único "bueno" espacio que encuentramos. 
quedamos dos noches nos pareceu seguro. 
ninguna facilidade.
mejor que nadie

name: El Flaco
description: Looked at our brakes and moving parts. Helped us right away.

name: Chill out house
description:
We paid a mini apartment with kitchen for $ 20 (for 2 people) 
It's right in front of the beach, super recommended. Nearby there is a shop and it is 5 minutes walking to the village. The guys who attend are nice and they speak Spanish and English.
Have good wifi and you can parking here. 
Also they rent for week or Month.

name: Las Fragatas
description: Contains two rooms, each of which has a small private cooking area. Access to free washing machine. Nice hammock courtyard area, great sunset views from the little rooftop area. Friendly caretaker. A bit out of the way, but a nice place overall. Usually 15$pp but we got it for 25$ for two.

name: Casa Michael
description:
Hostel in a safe and nice location. Good vibe, great WiFi, Netflix on a big screen, nice kitchen, courtyard with hammocks, ping-pong and a carambole fruit tree from which the delicious fruits can be taken. Also foresees free luggage storage for trips to the Galapagos. 
Michael, the owner, is very cool and helpful for any tips on Guayaquil or Galapagos. Felt like our home in Guayaquil.
We paid 25usd in total for a double room

name: Finca Verde
description: FREE camping at Finca verde. It is a permaculture farm with incredible views, located about 40min (uphill, muddy) walking from the main road (busstop is Pueblo Viejo). This path is impossible to access with any kind of vehicle, but a new road is under construction. The new road starts a bit before pueblo viejo and currently leads to a waterfall which is only about 15 min (mostly flat) walking from the farm. In any case, I highly recommend calling Michael, the owner, in advance, to get more information. +539989357315. We stayed there as part of a workaway, which was a wonderful experience! Make sure to say hi to the awesome pets for us, especially Kun!

name: Flipper Hostal
description: A nice hostal, well located. We paid 20$ (for two pers) for a double bed with private bathroom (with hot water) and mosquito net integrated. Fan but not TV.

name: Hotel del Sur
description:
Hostal very cheap but nice. We paid 10dollars for a matrimonial room without bathroom.
Well to stay one night and to visit puyango forest the next morning.

name: Hostal Pasiones
description:
A cheap and nice hostal, well located. We paid 16$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom.
A bit noisy during the night. TV

name: Hostal Posada del sol
description: Hostal near to the airport and terrestrial terminal and cheaper than the others around. We paid 26$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom without hot water (more expensive with). Very clean. TV

name: Hostal Mirador
description: Nice hostal. We paid 25$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom during the artes festival of Loja and 20$ after. A bit noisy (bab windows isolation) but well located (not in the center but near) and near a laundry. TV

name: Colonial House inn
description:
Very nice Hostal, well located with guys very friendly.
We paid 20$ for a matrimonial room without private bathroom. Free bananas and city tours. There is a garden.

name: Expohostal
description:
Near the terrestrial terminal, well located if you only want stay one night in Loja.
We paid 27$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom.
A bit too noisy (cleaning service at 5a.m)

name: Hostal Jesus del Gran Poder
description:
Cheap hostal (16$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom) but room very small.
Bad located, near to the main avenue, very noisy during the night, ring bell all the time. Careful to the mosquitos! TV (old one) and fan

name: Inti Sisa Art Guesthouse
description: Very nice Hostal, but expensive. We paid 50$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom. The breakfast is include and free service. The Hostal work with a school and a paid for it (it explains the price). A nice walk begin near the Hostal with a city panorama.

name: Hostal Anita
description: Cheap hostal, well located. We paid 15$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom. A bit noisy during the night. TV + Fan

name: Next to maquipucuna
description: Just before maquipucuna reserve there is a place for few vehicles. Probably one big rig.  Flat surface.  River very close.

name: Cabañas Río Grande
description:
Nice place to camp, very close to Intag's river. Its a small lodge with its cabins if you don't want to camp. You have all amenities there, bathroom, restaurant and a perfect condition swimming pool. 
The camping area is a nice, flatted volley ball court.  We did a fireplace there and made a bbq. 
Its a pet friendly place. 
It costs $5.00 per person for the camping, don't know for the lodge part.

name: Hostel Pucará
description: very clean nice quite hotel.  hot water with good presssure, parking for trucks and bikes...not sure about big rigs maybe..., wifi, TV very co.fortable bed and a  few blocks frim center of town.  very friendly staff.  much better option option than caribe or resedencia loja which were quite run down and not so friendly.   $10 single w/private bath.  $15/double with shares bath.

name: Hotel Delicias
description:
Basic room with double bed and private bathroom. Paid $10 for 1person.
Safe parking for motorbikes or cars. Wifi.

name: Playa Arena Cabanas
description: They are very beautiful and very well-kept cabanas. There are double rooms or shared rooms with TV and fan. Large shower and toilet. Nice pool. Electricity .. 110 volts. Price ... $ 20 per room. Pacific Ocean is 150 meters away. Even large cars can easily park here. Door height ... 3.80 m and width ... 3.50 m.

name: Mega Kywi
description: Home Depot type store   tools , batteries, tires, home goods, camping tools etc. Bought truck batteries here Bosch reasonable price.

name: Mexico Demis Sabores
description: If you’re looking for amazing Mexican cuisine, here’s the place to stop! Lovely couple husband wife and and wonderfully refreshing experience in the heart of Ecuador

name: Hostal San Jacinto
description: Hostal in front of the sea with swimming pool. We paid 30$ for 2 with breakfast.

name: Hostal Sol Inn
description:
Great, brand new place with amazing murals everywhere, even within the rooms! Run by Darwin, who's very nice and welcoming. $20/night for two people in private matrimonial room with private bathroom and hot shower. WITH AIR CONDITIONING. Located just one block from the beach and most tour companies.

Tent friendly, $5/night per tent (or possibly per person?).

Motorcycle parking inside the gate in the courtyard.

Laundry service available, $1/pound. ($2.20/kg)

Shared kitchen area, lots of nice hammock-y and common sitting areas. One block from the main street with grocery store, restaurants, and shops, too.

name: AmaZOOnica
description: Great wildlife reserve full of monkeys, birds, turtles, and other creatures. Need to take a brief boat ride up the river to arrive (see point for Canoe Launch). NGO funded by visitors and run by volunteers, worth a visit if you’re in the area. $4/pp entry, tour included in price.

name: Oleaje Hostal
description:
Nice little hostal in front of entrance of the sea where is crazy view when the sea is up. 
Nice terrace.
Paid 30$ for two

name: Cancha de futbol y balneario
description:
Right next to the river, good space to park on the field under the trees, there is a free balneario with hammocks and well-kept green space, Conde is the man who works there and let us stay and use their bathrooms without a problem, very friendly.

Justo al lado del rio, buen espacio para parquear en la cancha bajo los arboles, hay un balneario gratis con hamacas y espacio verde bien cuidado, Conde es el señor que trabaja ahí y nos dejó quedarnos y usar sus baños sin problema, muy amable.

name: Laundry Service
description:
Laundry service with very kind staff. 

0.45$ per 1 lb of ropa.

You’ll find it at the small grey door (see picture).

name: Quinta El viejo molino
description:
Quinta el viejo molino is an old  country house that was restored to host guests. It has 4 rooms for rent in the house and one more in the tree. Wifi available. They also welcome big rigs and tents. They have two natural sources and many paths inside the forest and to a beautiful (small) waterfall. It is managed by Mauricio and Fernando Gaibor, two kind boys that will help you in everything you need. If you want to ride the Mamá Rumi path or go to the Chimborazo, they are the right guys.
The way down is a dirt road but I had no problem getting out with my 2WD VW Combi


Prices:
Car/Tent 5 USD ppn 
Room 25 USD ppn

name: Casa Coral
description:
Casa Coral, camping for small rigs (max. Height 2,5 m) with shower and toilets about 5$ per car, good WiFi and restaurant in front of the beach. Just 5 minutes walk to the point. Restaurants, Groceries and everything you need in walk distance! Very nice little town with very friendly people! 
Try the street food and get almuerzo for 3$ in town.

name: Camping in front of point
description:
Go first to Casa Coral in Mompiche for check-in! (It’s also an overlander spot!
The owner of Casa Coral is building some cabañas and he is offering to camp at his property! Its right in front of the point and on the other side of the beach from Mompiche! 
Very quiet and the best view you can get in Mompiche!
No facilities yet!

name: paradero di carlo
description: Very good private rooms for a nigh, clean and comfortable. The people are kind.

name: cafe molina
description:
nice cafe run by a nice lady. they have good coffee, a decent machine. I had a black forest cake too which was nice. 
coffee from 1.50 to 2.80
cake 2
3 craft beer on tap for 2.50
of course this is a tourist place but they made it really nice. 
also sells coffee and cheese and general items

name: Hostería Chiguac
description:
Ancient farm with a lot of charm. 
15pp w/ breakfast.
and very gentle people with a great breakfast... (fruits, eggs, mora juice and croissants). Belly, happy!

name: Lita Petrocomercial
description: Gas, diesel, water (free), air (free).  No mini-market.

name: grassland beauty views
description: As you head south on the main road, as you approach the crest of a hill there is a slot left dirt road. Following this down takes you through some trees and eventually you find yourself on the grassy hills with amazing views. Hard to level, hard to get off the track completely but we didn't see a soul and the views are stunning. Small vehicles or perfect for tents

name: nice place by the beach
description:
About 3 kilometers from puerto Lopez, on the right side of the road. There is a large concrete plateform with a roof (~15 by 5 meters). Safe place to sleep for a night, easy to install some hammocs on the pillard. Its possible to park one or two small cars next to it, but no place for big rigs. We made a fire on the beach without any trouble.
Very quiet, we just hear the sound of the waves.

name: Flying Donkey Hostal
description:
Nice colourful hostal, dorm for 9 dollars (12-2023). Fast WiFi hot showers.

For the overlanders that just need a shower:
Hot shower with shampoo, towel and soap for $2.
Friendly and kind staff in Flying Donkey hostal.

name: Hostal Aguilera
description:
Hostal well located and with parking U $ 40.00 double room with Wi-Fi and private bathroom
----
Hostal bem localizado e com estacionamento U$40,00 quarto casal com Wi-Fi e wc privado

name: hotel texas
description:
for my relations almost fancy. got the room for two people for 20 instead of 45. 
has a pool, too.
owner is nice and a motorbike enthusiast.
big parking space

name: Cabaña las Palmas
description: One of the best landscapes of the province of Manabí, the very friendly people care about the welfare of the visitor. In this place I met Humberto Laaz, a young entrepreneur in the area of ​​ecological tourism. The place has a large parking area and camping by the river and the waterfall "The jump of the armadillo" helped me connect wifi from his neighbor who helped us with the password. Provide bathrooms, electricity, and plenty of water. I hope you visit and other opinions.

name: Shanandoa The Pie Shop
description: I know it’s been a while since you had real pie! This is the spot.  Crust pies, merengue pies, cream pies.  Generous cups of coffee. Sandwiches and more.  Basic diner decor. Overlooks the famous market.

name: Fruit Vegetable and Meat market
description: Seen enough ponchos and flutes? Head over here for fresh veggies, fruits, meats, spices and beans

name: Beach camping
description: Nice camping place in front of the beach without amenities. Perfect for big and self-contained rigs. You can walk at the beach to Canoa ( 2km ) in order to buy supplies or hire one of the Tuk Tuks. 4x4 is recommended due to soft sand. Enjoy the place and keep it clean!

name: La Sigseñita Sombrero
description: A very good place to buy a panama at 15$ or less. You can see how is done. The wife is very friendly. Very good hat! Highly recommended.

name: Hotel de las Culturas
description: 30,-$ for a single room breakfast included - proper, quiet, comfortable, wifi, etc. - unfortunately no parking place, beside that a relaxed place

name: Estación de servicio la granja
description: We passed the night. Friendly staff. A bit noisy

name: Hot shower at Pensión Tierra Santa
description: Hot shower at Pensión Tierra Santa for $1,5.

name: Laberintos del Chiguaza
description: A  small sealed road leads for 600m to a paved space next to the River. Big enough for 2 or 3 big rigs. Quiet place. Accommodation available at the centre also.

name: Rusticos Finkeros
description: Really chic, quiet and high quality restaurant - good Argentinian red wine, natural juice without sugar, best salad since long time, perfect meat (filet mignon), even a nice dessert (what is rare to find in Ecuador) but unfortunately no good coffee/espresso :-( Everything together for 20,- bucks.

name: Vinos Zamora
description: Tasty vines made of fruits - 10$ per bottle but really good.

name: Tecnicidrio 2000 Auto Glass
description: When your driving a vehicle that doesn’t exist on this continent and some jerk breaks your window and steals your stereo you can come here and they’ll make you a window. We’re driving a 99 Ford F-250 and had a new passenger front window manufactured here because we could not  find a replacement anywhere in Ecuador. Great people here

name: Panadería Mi Escondite
description:
Talk with Roberto and taste his delicious bread.


Charla con Roberto y prueba su delicioso pan :)

name: Refugio Terra Esperanza
description: Unique hostel run by local family of leatherworkers.  Decorated with art and contributions from previous guests.  Warm beds, hot coffee and a fireplace at the foot of Imbabura.  The young owner has climbed everything in Ecuador and is super helpful.

name: Hostal Amalur
description: Very nice Hostal, well located, clean. We paid 22$ for a matrimonial room with private bathroom and hot water. Mosquito net, kitchen access, restaurant patio. Not TV

name: PRIMAX
description:
New gas station.
- refill water
- internet (open Wifi)
- shop open till 10pm (Mini Market) 
- WC
- showers
- restaurant (soon to open)
- secure place to park your vehicle during the night

name: PRIMAX Gas Station
description:
New gas station.

- secure place to park your vehicle during the night
- internet (open Wifi)
- refill water
- shop open till 10pm (Mini Market) 
- WC
- showers
- restaurant (soon to open)

Very, very lovely owner at the shop. She was very interested to know about us and even offered us some eggs from here chickens.

name: Military checkpoints
description: They use GoPro to take photo of the car. And register original passports and TIP. Very nice people.

name: Autoservicio El Mecánico Bermeo
description:
Home and Very competent staff. Changing the clutch done in the afternoon. We even could stay and sleep on the spot.

Super accueil et personnel très compétent.
Changement de l'embrayage fait dans l'après-midi. Nous avons même pu rester dormir sur place.

name: botanical garden „reinaldo espinosa“
description: here is the parking spot for the oldest botanical garden (since 1949) in ecuador. only open mo-fr 7.30-12.30 and 15.00-18.00, sa+so 13.00-18.00. entrance fee foreigners 1$. you can find podocarpus-, chinin trees and many more named plants.  it is worth a visit.

name: Migration
description: Place to get you visa extension and certificado de movimiento

name: Petroecuador
description:
Super clean bathrooms, super friendly staff, cold water not drinkable, 24hrs super friendly security


Banheiros super limpos,pessoal super gentil,água fria não potável,segurança 24hrs super simpáticos

name: Scenic Drive - Cayambe-Coca NP
description:
It is possible to drive from Otavala to Papallacta through the national park, at least on 2 wheels. after the turnoff to Oyacachi.
I read that you theoretically need a permit but on a motorbike you can just sneak through next to the gate. 
I saw some trucks and locals on the way so maybe it is even possible to do this drive officially. 
On the Papallacta side the NP gate was open but you end up in the parking lot of the thermals so there is another gate. On a bike you can just go around.
The road coming from Otavala to the turnoff to Oyacachi is a mix of cobblestone and packed gravel. sometimes a bit bumpy but definitely doable with 2wd.
After the turnoff to Papallacta, it is gravel with potholes but not too bad. 
We did the whole drive with a heavy bike, two people and luggage in around 4.5 hours.
it is a very nice drive and you go through different landscapes.

name: Casa Desideri
description: Wendy welcomes you very gently in her beautiful house that is comfortable than you would expect in that region. Everything done with love. She has rooms with bathroom and hot water for 7-15 $ per Person.

name: El paraíso Cacao farm
description: Tórtillas de Yuka con queso and hot chocolate without sugar - home made by grandmothers hands. Hard to find because there is nothing visible before you’re behind their house.

name: Hostal Doña Clarita
description:
Private rooms, only shared bathroom. 15 USD per person including dinner and breakfast. Food is very good and the portions are gigantic.

When we arrived here on Saturday, other hostels were fully booked, but here was just one guest (I guess because these guys are not on Booking.com, only Airbnb).

Supported by a lovely local family.

name: Chapeleta hostal
description: Gets really good reviews and have to say it’s a nice place to stay. $20 for matrimonial room with en-suite, incl. a Continental breakfast. Has a kitchen upstairs and sitting room, with quick WiFi in whole place. Really friendly owners who collected us from the airport at 1am for $5 extra. Street parking but in a really quiet area. Grassy patch out the back where you could maybe camp in a tent? Would stay here again.

name: Next to a river
description: Small place (but big enough for a van) beside a nice river. Road is not on MapsMe but really good (except for a few meters).

name: Rio Arguarico
description: There is only this place around 40 km where you can stay alone by the big river - no disturbing lights, just you and the water. Nice sunrise! There is even some 3G connection.

name: Son Parrilladas
description: The best place with the best people in this freezing cold city!! They have so much artesanal cervezas from the region with special ingredients like guayusa - you have to try. Their food is not bad at all. I recommend a lot.

name: pueblo santiago
description: we stayed overnight right in front of the big iglesia at the plaza, after having asked locals. there are baños, water tap, wastebaskets; no claro reception. very quiet.

name: pueblo puela
description:
as the spots at the river were very wet and three guarding dogs at the gravel pit we came here. asked the locals if it is ok staying here. we were welcomed with a plate of fresh fruits. 
baños (not very clean), water, waste baskets, claro reception, really quiet.

name: Gitarras Borja Lago Agrio
description:
Guitar-Producer, old señor who build a lot of different string instruments.
0969147064 is the phone number

name: tame / tame cargo
description: If you need cargo service or tickets for you concerning the airport in Lago Agrio here is the office of lame.

name: Finca Arboleda
description:
Beautiful farm by the river own by José and Anibal. They love to host travelers. José is a guide and knows very well the area.
Their property is quite big, full of fruit trees, coffee plantation and many local trees and vegetables. There is a flat area that fits 4-5 motorhomes, and a house to host backpackers.
They also offer a volunteer activities to learn all about coffee, vegetables plantation and tree reforestation.
As a guide, Jose can take you to a nice trekkings to the Parque Podocarpus, Bosque Nublado or different waterfalls.
We stayed 4 days in their property and we really enjoyed the time we have been there. They are really kind and know a lot about the area.
The farm is just 4km away from town, next to the path to Palto's waterfall. The road to the farm is asphalted, just the last 300 metres is dirty road, but in good conditions though.

name: Lavandería Ambato
description: Big self service laundry. From $3 washing, about $0.25 drying/10 min.  Easy for parking. Free Wi-fi and clean toilets.

name: Police check
description:
Police stopped us to check our car for drugs, arms or any other illegal things.
Came in the vehicle and opened every closet.

name: Veterinary
description:
cheap and friendly vet, we got a rabbies shot here for $8, walked in, waited 10min, got the shot and walked out.
next to the Ñucallacta coffee, one flight of stairs up.

name: Hotel Chunchi Imperial
description: Been traveling through Central and South America for the last 3 months and this is the first negative review I'm writing. On a positive note, the hotel had very clean rooms. Stayed here two nights, first night was fine. The second night at about 10 pm I couldn't sleep because someone was talking/yelling so loud, and it was the front dest lady talking loudly/yelling to someone on the second floor. I asked her politely to quiet down so I could go to sleep, it was obvious she was annoyed by my request but after about 10 minutes she was quiet. Right next door to the hotel is a ferreteria, with a large yard, they locked the gate at night with two large dogs that barked pretty much the whole night the second night. The TV reception and the wifi was horrible. When I went to check out the guy at the front desk questioned whether I paid for the second night, which totally amazed me since I paid HIM the afternoon before. I'm sure he was trying to scam me, but I stood my ground and would not pay. Partially my fault because I noticed they didn't write anything down when I was checking in, and I should've gotten a receipt.

name: Kichua Union Muyuna
description: Came here for Ayhausca ceremony. Ask at marina in Puerto to go here. Cost is 5$ pp. You can have private overnight ceremonies here for  40$ US . There are cleansing, healing, or an Ayhausca  ceremonies be sure to ask for what you want. They are very kind people there,when in village ask for Wilson Or the Shaman Oswaldo, they will take care of you. They  provided a bed to sleep. Current phone # s are 0981086153 or 098821175

name: Shiripuno Lodge Turismo Comunitario
description:
It is a community tourism initiative. They have dormitory style rooms in traditional houses with or without private bathroom.
Prices: 10 usd per person with shared bathroom; 15 usd per person with private bathroom.
Meals are served and cost 5 usd per person. 
In front of the lodge there is a flat pebble beach big enough for 2 or 3 vehicles. Free overnight camping might be possible here  (ask permission to the lodge staff).
A very good way to support directly local tourism.
Nice location in front of the Rio Napo.

name: Dolomiti Embutidos (Ham, Salami Factory)
description:
This is a meat processing factory producing italian style prosciutto (ham) and salami. The owners are italian. 
The products are great and sold in 100grams packages.
A must stop in Salinas for good charcuterie!

name: Hostal Las Brisas
description:
Nice hotel with private secure parking. 
Paid 15 usd for a single room with bathroom. 
There is a shared kitchen that can be used.

name: Road to Cochasqui Archaeological Park
description:
The road to the Cochasqui Archaeological Park is more like a mountain bike trail than a road. Very deep ruts, narrow sections with danger of flipping your rig.
There is a 3km section that's extremely difficult offroad - it tooks us about 2 hours for that stretch in our Land Rover Defender 110, almost flipped it and we bent the track rod. And that was downhill - if you go up, don't even try this without lockers.
Coming from the lake, this point is the last point to turn around, see picture.

name: Fresh Life AguaPurificada
description: They sell water to fill your tanks or jugs.  One garrafón is $1.75.  But beware they are closed for lunch between 1 & 3 each day! Parking in front of car dealer across the street.

name: Izaboo
description:
Wilson, Paulina and Kiara's Place! A lovely family who moved from Quito to the cost and love to share with nice travellers!
They have a good space for cars and tents.
Contact him before you go to ask permission and to say how big is your 'home' so that you are sure it will fit there.
Phone number (whatsapp): +593 98 740 3636
Good wi-fi and nice environment!
Punta Blanca is a lovely fishermen village with a really nice beach!

name: Hospedaje Paisaje Andina
description: Nice hostel with friendly staff. $24 for room with bathroom, $20 without. We negotiated $20 for the last en-suite room because the only other room for $20 was tiny and with a small double bed (room 1). Room 3 and 4 were better sized but beds quite hard.  Good WiFi that works in the rooms. Suicide shower but very hot and good pressure. Towels and soap provided. Can leave bicycles in reception which is locked at night. Bit noisy in early hours with buses outside but quiet overnight.

name: Mirador de la cruz
description: very quiet place to spend a morning or afternoon. I stop to made cleaning and workshop well. you can see all the city of the sugar based on industry.

name: mercado alemán
description: 8.00- 20.30 pm monday to saturday, sunday 8.00-15.00. holger stahl has opened this bakery om 31.1.2019. a good selection of fresh german bred, bretzel, beer, cakes, marmelada, rothkäppchen sekt. you can park in front with a car up to the size if a sprinter van.

name: Window tinting and security film
description: Can get your windows tinted and security film installed.

name: free wifi at central plaza
description:
45 minutes of free wifi at central plaza

look for "municipalidad" net

name: Thermal baths "papallacta"
description: Most beautiful thermal baths we've seen so far, much better than Banos. Very clean and fantastic view. Definitely worth the detour from Panamerican highway.

name: Chocolate Factory-
description: This is the local chocolate manufacturer. Weekdays there is a tour available.  The store sells wonderful chocolate combinations at great prices.  A few other snacks for sale. Bathrooms upstairs.  Possible to park here overnight but not ideal.

name: Sayausi Mechanic (english speaking)
description: Mechanic workshop directly behind the primax gas station. Can do all sorts of stuff, the owner (forgot his name) used to live in the US and speaks english and runs multiple shops, so he might not be always here. Also next to it is a big car wash. As usual in SA, think of any mechanic as a bandito - will possibly save you a few bucks ;-)

name: Hostal al Paso
description:
Nice hostel with safe parking for motorcycle and cars. 12usd for private room with shared bathroom and fan. 15usd private bathroom. That also have rooms with AC. 
Internet fast.

name: First Church of Ecuador (1534)
description: This is a beautiful church and a small museum.  Female tour guide speaks English and has good info about the history and dates.  Costs $1 pp for museum.  Free to look in church.

name: Aurora and Carlos house
description:
Today our got broke near the town of Cristobal Colón and we stayed in the parking lot of Aurora and Carlos house. It is an open parking lot on the side of the road. Very nice people, they gave us vegetables and fruit. The place is very quiet and very safe. In the town of San Cristobal you can buy food. There is also a restaurant in the parking lot but it does not always open.

Hoy se nos malogró el auto cerca al pueblo Cristobal Colón y nos quedamos en el estacionamiento de la casa de Aurora y Carlos. Es un estacionamiento abierto al costado de la carretera. Muy buenas personas, nos regalaron verduras y fruta. El lugar es muy tranquilo y muy seguro. En el pueblo de san cristobal se puede comprar comida. Tambien hay un restaurante en el estacionamiento pero no siempre abre.

name: Motozone
description:
Very helpful Moto garage. The owner speaks some English and the daughter is fluent. They do a lot of work on klr and Honda police bikes here decent setup.
Also stocks Moto tyres.

name: Los lirios
description: Nice hôtel near the center with secure parking the boy and girl are very friendly. The room very clear we paid 25 US$ but they are room at 20.

name: Santuario al lado de la ruta
description:
Super quiet place to spend the night. It is easy to accommodate the car on a flat surface.

Lugar súper tranquilo para pasar la noche. Es fácil acomodar el carro en superficie plana.

name: Gas Station Petro Rios
description:
By side the E 30 highway. In the way to Manta. Between Quevedo city and Puertoviejo.
Little noisy but safe and has toillets with showers. Wifi, shampoo, alcohol gel, paper towels.

name: masgas corazon
description:
Big flat area in the gas station at the entrance of the city
Toilet and electric shower 24/7 (not very hot water though) for free
They also rent rooms for 5usd/night
A bit noisy at night (dogs mostly) but very friendly people
Seemed better than the hotel nearby, where the water in the bathroom was totally cold

name: Primax gas station, all new
description:
New gasstation, where they allowed us to stay the night next to some grass and palmtrees.
New toilets and market (not opened yet).
Lots of busses stop for the toilet. Some roadnoise.
Still over 3000m seelevel!

name: Nice Beach
description: Cool place to snorkel and swim. There is nothing so you have to bring water. Last 500m you have to walk.

name: El Garrapatero Camping Area
description: At this small beach you can setup maximum two tents but it’s wonderful !!!!! Bring snorkel-stuff and water.

name: Sara Lodge
description:
Beautiful lodge, amazing views, they receive all travelers. They just opened, don’t have prices yet but is worth the stop! Much nicer than the entrance of the park

Hermoso lodge, imponente vista al valle, reciben viajeron de todo tipo. Abrieron hace unos dias y todavia no tienen precios, vale la pena venir a conocerlo y dormir antes o después de visitar la laguna cuicocha.

name: Complejo Turistico Hermanos Castillo
description: Basic resort with basic bar, swimmingpool, voley pitch. They let us stay overnight for a tip. Wifi not working at the time. Quiet at night. Entrance highth: 3.5 meters

name: Parking at "Parque Las Candelas"
description: quiet and safe place with good free wifi, near to some commerce. No one residential amenities, thus basket and multisport field

name: Banana Bread!!!
description: This place on the side of the road is selling delicious, homemade, warm banana bread.  They make it right there and it is wonderful.  Help this little family out by stopping and paying a dollar! They will bring it to the window, you don’t even have to get of the rig!

name: Kite ecuador
description:
Kitesurf school at santa Marianita
They can provide you lessons or just rent equipment, which is quite new and well maintained. They also do stand up paddle if you prefer
Javier is super friendly, speaks spanish and english, and can also provide you advises if you need
Careful the off season is feb-march (no wind)
www.kiteecuador.com for more informations 
Or call Javier +593989731480

name: Parking/Camping El Garaje (Daniel)
description:
Small Parking lot where we parked during our 10 days on Galapagos. Daniel the owner is very nice and runs a Restaurant and a small shop right on the property. The Parking lot could fill maybe two campervans, so it is not really big, because there is an old car permanently parked there. Paid 3usd/day and could also sleep in the van. You probably need to haggle your  own Price ;-) Basic toilet and hot (electric) shower available. Best would be to contact Daniel in advance (e.g. whatsapp): +593 992 221954 
It is also close to the mall del sol with fast wifi and more or less expensive crap.

name: Museo Quilotoa and more...
description: This is a one floor museum, on floor workshop, one floor cafeteria.  Also they can guide or drive you on a great adventure for $20.  And if you need parking with bathroom and shower service, just ask.  They will help you.  Great guys and well connected.  Stop by! Mention this post so they know it works!

name: Electrician and mecanic
description:
Douglas is a top mechanical electrician. He was referred by iveco garage and managed to fix our air con. We had tried 3 air con specialist before ( in Argentina, Chile and Peru !). That guy ( owner of the garage ) is the top of the top!!!!

note: he is not only an aircon specialist, he is a electrical mechanic so can help with any electrical issues.

name: Praia Salatita
description:
Beautiful place to watch the sunset.
We talked to the owner and he alowed us to camp at this place.
Please keep it clean and help cleaning other's garbage.
Quiet and beautiful beach.

name: Parking 24/7
description:
Easy parking by the airport. $3.50 per day. Includes a shuttle ride to and from the airport. 
Www.parking-24-7.com
Info@parking-24-7.com
(+593)9 8288 8684

name: Zaruma
description: Parking place in the street near the center of Zaruma, a nice village very difficult to drive with a big rig, but if you call a Motoche (a local police agent very friendly) at the phone number +593 99 324 38 74, he will came to met you at the village entrance and drive you to the parking place near to the center. Is not very flat but it’s possible get level. A bit noisy during the day but quiet from 21h. Absolutely sure.  Enough place for tree rigs.

name: Reserva Jocotoco
description: Nice bird reserve with a lot of colibríes and other birds, snakes and more. Better with 4x4. 8$ per night and 20$ foreigners entrance. Great experience.

name: Communidad Ailyo Auharina - Ayahuasca
description:
The Shaman Fabian Clemente recive you at his place for the ceremony and the night.
You can asist at the process of the preparation of the aya. 
You sleep at the place. After the ceremony. 
(Take your camping equipment) 
Contact the shaman 09 92151502
We paid 50usd for the ayahuasca and the cleaning ceremony.
Serious experience! He has childrens and peacefull place near the river.

Other number 0962828136

name: Shikary, mechanic for allignment, shocks, engines,...
description:
Big garage where we did an alignment. Very professional work. They are also working on engines,..
3m high vehicle is no problem!
They also sell tyres and all sort of parts.

name: Garage Guillen
description: They changed our brakes so quickly ! Recommended for brakes, oil change. Contact number 0999076879

name: Overlooking the river
description: There are two turnoffs just northwest of the bridge crossing the river. The lower one is signed as a fishing spot. We didn't dare with our 2wd as there was a fresh mudslide covering most of the way. So we opted for the upper one, where you are overlooking the river. There is a small space to park your car on the right, not really level but good and pretty enough for a night after crossing borders.

name: Hostal Puertas del Sol
description: Nice basic, small hotel with clean rooms and free secure parking, for smaller rigs (max. height 3m, width about 2.7m). Our van could fit super easy (GMC Safari). Paid 16usd for a night, private double room with private bathroom. On booking it would have been 20 excluding ~3usd taxes etc. good wifi, which was 1usd per person (first time we had to pay extra for WiFi).

name: Dique Huamboya
description: It's a great place for stay a sun day or spend the night. you can swim in river, there are showers, there is a small bar with snacks, there are a lot of water attractions. people is friendly

name: Euro vehículos
description: Small garage but the boy can do everything. He repaired our Land Rover defender: he maked a new piece protection of turbo, the electric break, and all nivel oil, the joint of the transmission etc...,, good price and we could visit quitly the Town during 5 days also he keapt our car in a secure garage

name: Swiss Corner
description: Typical German Swiss bakery and restaurant. Zopf brot!!! King bread, and the good cakes and pies! Röstti! If you are homesick(heimweh) stop by! The place is legit! I felt like I was back in Luzern. They have parking but height might be an issue a sprinter van might be too high.

name: Museo Jama
description: This is a small (air conditioned) museum containing some fantastic pieces of ceramic work.  Representative of the communities along the coast between the rivers.   Free and worth a brief stop.  Pin is in parking area across the dirt road.  Clean bathrooms too!

name: Yuracfaccha Guard Station
description: Guard station with gate that needs to be opened to pass onward to Papallacta. To drive the road to Papallacta you need to first visit the town of Oyachachi to purchase a permissions document. The document can be purchased at the tourism office down by the termales entrance. We were charged $2 for permission.

name: TRG general mechanic
description:
Rocco is a great guy who went way out of his way to help us out after we were robbed of a spare tire on our Ford F-250. If you need anything contact him and he’ll be happy to help in anyway possible 

+5932257928
Rocco32020@gmail.com

name: Museo Centro Cultural Manta
description: Free admission. Free parking in back even for most big rigs.  Inside is AC! Clean bathrooms.  4 floors of stuff including a children’s room that can be touched! Nice stuff. Nice people.

name: Sabor y Tradicion D'Santiago
description: Lovely oasis on side of the road. Little pools and mini falls with fish. View over the hillside in the back. Mostly your standard almuerzo but trout of course too.

name: Showers!
description: This gas station has clean bathrooms, overnight parking and easy access showers.  Also air and water.  It is new and the minimart isn’t stocked yet. But hey, who doesn’t need another shower in this humidity?!

name: Private house
description: We bought a 5 gallon at this house because we didn’t have enough to make it to the next gaz station which is an hour away.

name: Glass Vita
description:
Customised windshield. Very effective and fast service, 12 hours to make the mold and manufacture a windshield for our truck.
400$ complete service.

name: Hostal Miramar
description: Family owned hostal. Very nice atmosphere. They do have a pool, too. Unfortunately the gate (really noisy) was opened and closed several times in the night. Paid 24USD for matrimonial with private bathroom. We could park our 2 motorbikes in the secured patio. You can go by foot or by tuktuk (0,50USD) to the city centre. Many different stores, e.g. TIA market or cheap restaurants (e.g. Salchipapa 1,75USD).

name: Cascadas Kintia Panki - Culture Of Native People
description: It's a place where find native people, you can swim in river, see native dance and camping wiht native people.

name: Plaza principal Logroño - Scuare Logroño
description:
Logroño is a small town, nice people and very safe. We parking our motor home at scuare, police man said us: " no problem". There are toilet and free wifi.

Logroño es un pequeño pueblo, con gente amable y muy seguro. Nosotros estacionamos nuestra casa rodante en el parque principal, la policía nos dijo que no había ningún problema. Hay baños públicos e Internet gratis

name: Parque infantil - piscinas - unidad deportiva
description:
A well place to stay night, there are toilet, is a pool with show, however we don't used it, so we don't know if is free

 Un buen lugar para pernoctar, hay baños y está la piscina con ducha; sin embargo nosotros no las utilizamos, entonces no sabemos si es gratis

name: Hospital Gualaquiza
description: It's the town hospital, there are laboratory

name: Playa municipal tunduli
description:
A very good place to stay the day or stay the night. A big parking zone ( we have a big motorhome), it's possible camping. There are toilet, showers, barbicue, and you can swim in river. It's quite and very nice.
Un muy buen lugar publico y gratis para estar de día, o pasar la noche. Zona de parqueo grande (nosotros estamos en una casa rodante), posibilidad de acampar. Hay baños, duchas, barbique y se puede nadar en el río. Es tranquilo y muy agradable

name: Sprinter Maestro Juan Pesantes
description:
Sprinter specialist in Cuenca. We had a blown glow plug and a torn coolant hose which they diagnosed fairly quickly with a scanner. Both repaired, but shortly after leaving the shop we now have a new squealing coming from the turbo hose which they couldn't seem to fix. Juan delegated his minions to work on our vehicle immediately which was nice for timing, but perhaps left us in more inexperienced hands. We spent $100 on parts and labor which i felt was very fair, honestly made me question how they make any money considering parts/ scanner cost  $90 and 3 mechanics worked under the hood for hours.
Note the shop is obviously equipped for south American sprinters which vary slightly from German or American made models, so the whole shop was scratching their heads when looking under the hood and perplexed by automatic transmissions. We spent the entire day there and had to leave to withdraw cash as they don't accept cards. 

Call for more info or avail. 
Juan-099 292 2107

name: Bordados a mano (Handmade goods)
description: This shop and several others along this small section sell hand embroidered clothing, household items, etc.  This is not junk. This is good quality fabric, fashionable cuts and beautiful colors.  Handmade by the indigenous women in the Pueblo’s around this area. Also they sell indigenous blouses, skirts and wraps.  Not cheap to buy but free to look. You will see the locals wearing these items as they tend their sheep and gardens, but you won’t find these products at any store or market. (Similar looking Indian and Chinese knock offs are sold at Otovalo market) okay, I am a little crazy about good quality fabrics and handcrafts!

name: Cabañas Armonia y Jardin de Orquideas
description: Nice cabaña in Mindo. Paid 19USD for matrimonial with shared bathroom, breakfast included. Rooms are clean and the area around is quiet. Lots of birds and plants in the beautiful garden. Could park our 2 motorbikes secured in the garden.

name: Place on the river
description: Right on the river we found a free public place. Good for swimming and staying for a night or more.

name: Metalica Master
description:
Excellent welding Taller. Fast and tidy. They weld all kind of materials. There is also a carpenter beside.

Ask for Mr Olavo. 
wsp +593 9392 9060

name: Huge parking lot
description: Ideal for big rigs and all kind of vehicules. 5 minutes to the city center

name: Pasaje del mono
description: Monkey trail, here you can see monkeys, about an hour

name: Parque Gualaceo
description:
Beautiful spot, safe and calm. There are security cameras and good wifi. The people around were friendly. Toilets close by.

Hermoso lugar, seguro y tranquilo. hay cámaras de seguridad y wifi bueno. personas del lugar amigables. baños cerca

name: Hotel Wakiz
description: Nice hotel with secure garage we have a defender 110. Only one car. Good wifi hot water everything are ok we paid 22$ for two people one night. Good stop.

name: Casa Cultura Carchi
description:
Excellent small museum with an intro to some artifacts, modern art and historical art of Ecuador. Free admission but they want a comment when you leave.  Nice bathrooms.  Try a couple of doors to find the entrance or ask guard.  Park near cute poncho sculpture. Can also walk to topiary gardens from here.  
It is closed on Sundays.

name: Pie Monte guardiania
description:
Guards house at the entrance of the Cayambe Coca Park.
We stopped here because we were too late to reach the Cayambe refugio 
Flat area for two cars, toilets 24h and very friendly staff

name: Tío Jessy parrilla - bbq
description:
Wow. ten dollars dish came with huge meat (bife de chrorizo) which is New York cut plus some chorizo. Comes with two side dishes. Best deal and quality. 

Parrilada con platos gigantes para compartir entre dos o tres al menos si pides el bife de chorizo. mucha carne más chorizos más dos acompañantes. Imbatible por 10 dólares el plato

name: Hotel De Las Flores
description: Nice family run hotel hotel with a really good breakfast place included. On iOverlander it’s few hotels in Ambato but there are many. We was in town for the flowers festival and stayed at this place. We payed 66 $ a night. The hotel has a big secure parking lot and a small garage you can park your motorcycles in. The service was great and the staff was very friendly to us. A bit upscale maybe but better then the hostel far out. Stayed in a two bed room with hot shower and breakfast

name: Cascadas de Alex
description:
We are a place full of wildlife, habitat of howler monkeys, toucans, and many other species. The campground is surrounded by the Olon River, and has trails that take you to the viewpoint, the walk is 40min. and another path that leads to the waterfalls. The place offers bathroom, shower, stove, bbq area. and a pool. All surrounded by the jungle. A true paradise for those who seek to get away from the noise of the city. It is located in Olon, at the end you will find a dirt road that says El Retiro hostel, that is the road and it takes about 20min then it crosses the river and enters the jungle. You must cross the river 4 times following the path and you will reach the indicated coordinates. For more security in the town of Olon there is a Zamora hardware store, there the owner of the Cascadas de Alex works 096-985-4943.


Hemoso lugar lleno de vida silvestre, habitad de monos aulladores, tucanes, y muchas otras especies. El camping está rodeado Del Río Olon, y tiene senderos que lo llevan al mirador, la caminata es de 40min. y otro sendero que lo lleva a las cascadas. El lugar brinda baño, ducha, fogón, área de bbq. y una piscina. Todo rodeado de la jungla. un verdadero paraíso para quienes buscamos alejarnos del ruido de la ciudad. Esta ubicado en Olon, al final encontrara un camino de polvo que dice hostal El Retiro, ese es el camino y toma unos 20min luego cruza el río e ingresa a la jungla. Se debe cruzar el rio 4 veces siguiendo el camino y se llega a las coordenadas indicadas. Para más seguridad en el pueblo de Olon hay una ferretería Zamora, allí trabaja el dueño de las Cascadas de Alex 096-985-4943.

name: Jeep specialist “Esteban Chemali Talleres Jeep”
description: Shop specialized in Jeeps. We saw all models and year makes here. Good price, good work, certified mechanics. Esteban (Dad and son) love Jeeps, and love racing and have a racing team, so not only the know everything Jeep they knew everything car. The attention of the workers was amazing. Even if you need just an oil change for you Jeep I would stop by!

name: Hotel Nautilus, Ayangue Ecuador
description:
One of the best beaches in Ecuador very little visited, Hotel very complete comfortable rooms with private bathroom hot water Air conditioning very familiar, and staffed by its owners an Italian and Peruvian couple who help you with everything you need, parking for 3 cars Small NO Big Rigs, NO pets, the hotel has access to the beach and the best view of the place, the town has no nightlife, offers diving, boating, hiking and good food. US $ 15 P / P Ask for the owner Carol to agree price per stay. Nautilus Casa di Mare
---
Una de las mejores playas de Ecuador muy poco visitada , Hotel muy completo habitaciones cómodas con baño privado agua caliente Aire acondicionado muy familiar , y atendido por sus propietarios  una pareja de Italiano y Peruana que te ayudan con todo lo que necesites , estacionamiento para  3 autos pequeños  NO BigRiders , NO mascotas , el hotel tiene salida a la playa y la mejor vista del  lugar,  el pueblo no tiene vida nocturna, ofrece  buceo , canotaje, caminatas y buena comida. US$15 P/P  Pregunta por Carol la propietaria para acordar precio según estadía. Nautilus Casa di Mare

name: coffee bar el mercado
description: easily the best coffee (fancy/good style coffee) in cuenca. we’ve tried a lot and have been looking everywhere for beans. they have a great selection from excellent ecuadorian roasters. not just your normal strong over roasted bean. great coffee preparation, and the first time we’ve gotten a real chocolate chip cookie since the usa/canada.

name: A lavar la ropa -  cheap and wifi
description:
good place to do laundry. You can leave it and take bus to historic center or do it yourself and enjoy table with wifi. 

buena lavandería con posibilidad de dejar ropa a lavar y tomarte el bus al centro histórico o hacerlo tu mismo mientras disfrutas de una mesa con wifi. Económico

name: Hotel Plaza del Teatro
description: The location is close to the theatre Sucre. This old colonial hotel was renovated but keep this old fashion room and furniture. The big advantage for me is that he has a close garage accessible directly from the interior of the hotel. At the reception the guy who receveur me is a fan of motorcycle. I did not pay for the Garage. The night cost me 18 USD for a very colonial room

name: MIRADOR EL ROCIO
description:
The most beautiful view of the sea that I found in Ecuador, restaurant restrooms and parking, Mr. Miguel owner is adapting the space for overlander, viewpoint of the bay SALAITE and the islet of the WIDOW, good food and good price. Call Miguel 0980134601 and ask for service

la vista más bella  del mar que encontré en Ecuador , restaurante baños y estacionamiento, el sr Miguel propietario está adecuando el espacio para overlander , mirador de la bahía SALAITE y el islote de la VIUDA, buena comida y buen precio.llamar a don  Miguel 0980134601 y pregunta por servicio

name: Neptalí Cafe
description: We had a great couple coffees here. Luís runs the business, his grandfather started their coffee farm years ago and he’s continued it to keep growing and harvesting beans, roasting and preparing their coffee. v60 and flat white were both great. bought some beans too. 2 drinks, 1/2 lb of beans and a cinnamon bun for $9. WiFi spotty in the food court but might work better some days he said. power outlets to charge devices. other food in same place

name: EL CARDENAL HOTEL
description: The Cardenal Hotel features accommodation in Loja. The property has a bar, as well as a restaurant serving American cuisine. Guest can make use of a garden. El Cardenal Hotel offers some units with mountain views, and all rooms include a private bathroom. A continental breakfast is served each morning at the property. The accommodation offers a terrace. Cycling is among the activities that guest can enjoy near El Cardenal Hotel. With staff speaking English and Spanish, guidance is available at the reception.

name: La Luna
description: Lovely hostel approx 3k from the Pan Am turn off. Has dorms, camping and self contained rooms. Camping $8 a night/dorms $14 both include breakfast. Good wash facilities but showers are cold. Lovely lounge and veranda with hammocks and mountain views. Access road is cobbled and a bit rough in places. Took 10-15 mins to ride with fully loaded KTM 950. Good simple food available with veggie options. Mains $7. Good selection of beer and wine. Ignore google location as this is wrong. Maps me is accurate. Front gate has double door (approx 15 feet wide) and no beam. Parking spaces for 3 cars or so.

name: Street Parking
description:
Small site next to a small street heading from the Panamericana to a little village. Since it is underneath the Panam, it is not as loud as right next to it. This was the only place we found.
Interesting for cycle travellors who want to split the mountain. but be careful with the spiky plants growing on the ground
Consider going uphill about 200m for a pull out with a water tank.

name: Sr Pila Electromecanico
description:
we've got a problem with the alternador and motor de arranque (alternator and starter motor) and Sr Pila and son took care of it. Both very professional and reliable, they took out both parts, fixed the issue and cleaning then up, as they got lot of salt and got rusted from past adventures in uyuni salt flats and Peruvian coast.
20 dollars for fixing each part. A friend from Tena recommended this mechanic to us. 
The parking area is quite big, even  for big rigs, and you may be able to sleep here in case needed.
Definitely recommended

name: Mecanica Mechozo
description:
Excellente taller, specially for big rigs.
he helped us with many problems
Good and fair price

name: Riverside parking
description:
Huge flat gravel parking place right on Rio Chimbo. Space for tons of Campers. Close to the village with lots of restaurants and tiendas. 
Very good for staying overnight. We felt save. FREE.

name: Beautiful riverside
description: Very nice spot. Big flat area. It seems a private area but we acessed easily from the main road.

name: Lavanderia
description:
For Big Loads.

Selfservice or Bring In Service.

Machines  7kg,  12kg, and 20 kg
Price.         5$.      7$.           10$

Open every Day from 8am to 7pm
Sunday                         8am to 6pm

name: P&S free cold shower
description:
Free cold shower at P&S

Ducha fría gratis en P&S

name: Hostel El Sunrise
description:
Nice and Clean Hostel.
Secure Parking available in Garage.
Max. 2 small Cars or 4-6 Motocycles.
Asked 15$, Payed 10$ for a Single Room with private Baño,
if I Check-out before 8AM next morning.
Daugter is nice, friendy, and helpfull.
Dama de Casa a bit grumpi.

name: Laguna Yambo
description: Nice place with a lagoon. Steep and narrow road. There is a restaurant. Flat parking area with bathroom for 0,15 cents. In the future, will be showers too.

name: Santay National Recreation Area
description: A national park on an island which is mostly manglares

name: Hickory Burger
description:
Hickory burger. It was always full of people so we give it a try even considering the high prices 4.5 to 6 dollars (cheap) just for the burger. Big Deli was fantastic! They open from 3pm until 10pm. Enjoy!

La mejor hamburguesa del viaje. Le dimos una oportunidad a pesar de los altos precios. La Bit Deli3es genial. Abren de 15hs a 22hs. precios de 4.5 a 6 dólares

name: Mirador Guápulo
description:
Viewpoint faceing Northeast.
One of the rare spots in Quito, where you can look down the Valley, without haveing a Building in front.

name: Ian Taylor / broker for IVSS
description:
Ian Taylor / broker for IVSS
If you shipping with IVSS this is the place to do you paperwork. Easy and efficient. We spoke to Daniel Morales who's office is on the sixth floor of this building (El navío). It is overlooking the port where you drop you veh off.

name: Chiringuito
description:
Hi. I am Raul, this is my place.
It is very quiet and calm, perfect to relax and practice surfing.
For questions or reservations just text me (I only speak Spanish).
.....
Hola es Raul, es mi lugar.
está muy tranquilo para descansar hacer practicar surf. mesaje mi para reserva algo pregunta mi numero es: +5930995141342 o +5930984713331

Old description:
By far the best place to stay in Mompiche (considering the Malecón is gone)...

Space for a handful of campers on grassy flat-ish area, clean bathrooms and cold showers. Restaurant area with tables, wifi and a view of the wave. Access to a great swimming beach and small surf waves. 10 minute walk to town at low tide.

$5pp

name: Hotel Yormari
description: Nice, clean, modern place. Stuff is extremely nice, rooms are big with tv, wifi, ac. Well worth the $50 for 2.

name: Parking GARAGE
description: good spot, toilet and grewtcpeople. 2 dollars

name: La Turquita - Libanese food
description: Incredible Libanun restaurant, falafel sandwich for 3,5$ and 4$ for chicken. Insanely good.

name: Persian House
description: Amazing place!! Almuerzo for 3,99$ with soup and juice. Different options it depends of the day. I had a falafel plate and it was incredible. A couple from Iran run the place, so if you are tired of Ecuadorian food, travel in Iran without plane ticket!

name: Laundry Lavandería
description: 1$ per kilo, very fast arrive at 10am ready at 3pm.

name: Happy Fruit Finca Agro Ecologica
description: Happy Fruit. This place is a beautiful experiment in eco-farming and agro tourism. Take the hike and enjoy the fruits off the branches. Stay for a few weeks as a volunteer

name: Continental Bicirepuestos
description: Large bicycle shop with many bike parts. Found a spoke tension tool for my motorcycle which was not available at the motorcycle parts shop. (Update: was way too small for my moto spokes) Also bicycle mechanic on site.

name: Backpacker Mapacho House
description:
Hello, we are BAKCPACKER MAPACHO HOUSE, we invite you to come and enjoy the best waves in Manta, Ecuador.
______
Hola, somos BAKCPACKER MAPACHO HOUSE, los invitamos a venir y disfrutar de las mejores olas en Manta, Ecuador.

name: Fernando escape
description: very good mecanics for echapment. very friendly and very good job and cheap

name: Honda Moto and Car Mechanic
description: Honda dealer, moto, car mechanic. On the corner, sorted new brake pads and new air filter for my Honda XRE 300 same day.

name: El Sombrerito
description:
Excellent restaurant with amazing view on the beach.
Fresh fish and very nice family owners. 
Dishes large served between 6 and 20$
Highly recommended!!

name: Jardin Botánico
description:
here is the jardin botanico.
3$pp
you can see orquideas, palmas, selva trees, butterflies, parrots (not on liberty) turtles, fishes and kind of squirrels
at the entrance the guard has repelant against mosquitoes 
at the carpark there's a verynice view of the city
today we were alone in the park !!!

name: Parque Histórico Guayaquil
description:
Beautifull park with animales and trees
Free entrance (donation)
much better than jardin botanico (north)

parque muy hermoso. se puede ver animales y árboles.
gratis (volontario)
mucho mejor que el jardin botanico (al norte)

superbe jardin. on peut y voir beaucoup d'animaux et d'arbres
l'entrée est sur donation mais ça vaut la peine !
bien mieux que le jardin botanique au Nord

name: Hotel Internacional
description:
Situated on the pedestrian-only walking street, this is a cozy $8/night hotel private room and private bath. The owner (Cesa) also has a few renovated rooms in the back listed on Airbnb. He is extremely friendly, but you might not meet him unless you hang out towards the back, first floor where he lives. Then he will probably allow you access to the beautiful kitchen used for Airbnb guests, and give you his PW for faster internet. 

We were absolutely not supposed to have brought our motos in, but the front desk guy helped me get it into the very back,  a covered courtyard area. You must drive through the hallway for the shopping center.

name: Change Colombian money for perfect exchange rate!
description: Right as you’re going under the welcome to Ecuador sign, there’s a few folks on the side that will change money and the woman gave us a great exchange rate! $150K pesos for $50USD.

name: Itapoa
description:
A Vegan restaurant ! Friendly! Nice !! And even cheap!
They’ve got happy hour !
A bowl for 6 dollars 
Also a good place to stay with RV, not to big. Very nice people. The place is right on the malecon.

name: cascadas 4eros
description:
we arrived by chance. at night the small waterfall sound was a lullaby. we parked our motor home Mercedes Benz 608 and our daughters played peacefully. many trees and the owner is a motor home enthusiast. on the weekends there are plenty of locals swimming and grilling
---
llegamos de casualidad. a la noche nos arrullo el sonido del agua. aparcamos nuestro motorhome mercedes benz 608 y las niñas jugaron tranquilas. muchos arboles frutales y el dueño es entusiasta de los motorhomes. los fines de semana se lle a de locales bañandose y haciendo asado

name: Parque de Logroño
description: Nice big and flat parking free. Sure and quiet. Lots of beautiful places to visit. Shops. Free internet.

name: All Vegan Restaurant
description: Amazing 100% plant based restaurant. Everything is vegan & whole food. Nice view, directly at the beach. Small menu with Thai Curry, Burger, Falafel, juices...on Sunday they have a buffet from 1 to 3 pm. Try the Burger! It‘s incredible!! One of the top vegan dishes we‘ve had in SA.

name: Gasolinera PDV
description: PDV gas station on the route, has a bathroom and shower for free, the people are very friendly, next there is a market. In front there is a nightclub, for lovers of the night. They allowed us to sleep with the van.

name: Gasolinera PDV
description: We spent the night at the gas station, quiet place, free toilets and showers, very friendly people.

name: Hacienda Chan Chan
description:
Staying at a charming dairy farm. If you are looking for a quiet place in between beautiful mountains north of Cuenca, this is your place.
Luke, Julie and their 5 kids have migrated from the United States and now own 90 hectares of pasture and native forest where they offer private quaint wooden cabins for rental. 
They offer a two-bedroom chalet and a two-bedroom bungalow for 35 dollars a night. Just recently, they finished an awesome treehouse with spectacular views with one bedroom for couples that they rent for 40 dollars. A delicious artesan breakfast with their dairy products is included. All cabins have a small kitchen, hot water 24/7, electricity, a wood stove and WIFI. No problem to park your vehicle here. 
We were staying at the farm for a month, working as volunteers because we got a recommendation from other traveler friends. We had such a good time here. It was a nice break after 15 months of travelling and honestly the best cheese in whole South America. This family and landscape are just amazing! Highly recommended!

name: Restaurante La Morenita, Javin, Ecuador
description:
This was about 2 km east of town. I spent 1 night here while on a solo bike tour. I was ascending to El Tambo on the E40. Manager Manuel said I could camp there under cover next to his restaurtante for free. He said veicle tourists could camp in his large parking lot, also for free.

See photos, at the end of Day 8 of my blog: http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/doc/SAm19tim . I enjoyed my covered camp spot next to Manuel’s restaurante. This had convenient chairs. He is a nice guy and likes cyclists. Pros: camped on concrete under a roof. Flush toilet with sink and water. (No TP or soap). (Cold) shower. 110V inside and also outside in the camping area (high up on one of the outer posts). I enjoyed Saturday lunch in his restaurant and had worthwhile discussions with him, his relatives and various guests. Restaurant was open 05h00 – 20h30. It was closed when I left (Sunday) as it was voting day. Cons. Until late, it was a bit noisy from passing trucks. Still, I slept OK. Wi-Fi was available in the kitchen but did not reach the dining area. I recommended he move the router (which was hidden behind a wall) to give it an unobstructed view of the dining area. Guests perhaps don't mind, but if more cyclists or vehcile travelers arrived and asked for Wi-Fi he would probably move it.

Manuel said camping was free, but I thought it worth $5, which I gave him. I encourage others to do the same. This would likely motivate him to make his Wi-Fi available in the dining area.

name: Cancha (Sports Stadium) de Voleibol y Basquetbol, Ducur
description:
I spent 1 night here while on a solo bike tour. I was ascending to El Tambo on the E40. See photos and captions, Day 9 of my blog:http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/doc/SAm19tim. I much enjoyed my overnight here. A very good free camp. Pros: indoors, in a secure environment. After the building had been closed for the night, I could leave anytime via a locked side door, but once out could not return as the side door needed padlocking from outside. Smooth concrete floor for tent. Bathrooms (unisex) with flush toilets and washbasins. (No TP or soap). No 110V but a power cable was provided by my hostess Mary. Cons: Very festive until 21h00 with well-behaved if bouncy kids, adults and soccer games. (For me, the kids were a pro). Bright lights until about 22h00, then quiet and dark. Street dogs barked off-and-on during the night, but weren’t too loud. I slept well.

From Thurs evening thru Sun evening, Mary ran a small café inside the Volleyball/Basketball Sports building (“La Cancha de Voleibol y Basquetbol”). She said sure, I could camp inside the building. A kind and helpful lady. My assigned space was covered and secure, with space for perhaps 6 tents. Bathrooms and water were close by. The Cancha would be open until about 22h00 when she locked up and went home, to return at 08h00 the next morning. However, she would not padlock the steel gate next to where I was to camp (see photo). I could slide back the bolt on the inside and leave earlier. Others seeking a good camping area in Ducur should visit the Cancha and ask for Mary or Anibal (see note below). Mary had a few tables with 110V in her café, where one could use one’s laptop and charge electronics. She offered coffee (basic but cheap- $0.30), and French fries with fried chicken ($0.50 – a good deal).

I asked about Wi-Fi in Ducur, and was told by several folk that there wasn’t any service. My Claro cellphone had a strong talk signal but the data signal was “E” (not 3G or 4G) and was too weak to be useful. However, the next morning my “T-Mobile One” plan registered 3G and enabled me to do my emails and text my family.

Notes
1. The cafeteria is closed Mon thru Thurs evening. If wishing to camp in the Cancha on these 4 nights, Mary said to ask for a guy called Anibal Buñay. He is normally round and about the Cancha. Say that Mary said to contact him for permission to camp inside.

2. There is apparently a community hall (sala communal) in Ducur. One could seek out the guy in charge, Martin Vermeo, and ask to camp there. Several folk said he would give permission. He is a member of the “Junta Parrochial”. We looked for him but he wasn’t around.

name: Hotel Samara Huasi, Suscal.
description:
I spent 1 night here while on a solo bike tour. I was heading toward El Tambo. See photos and captions, Day 10 of my blog: http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/doc/SAm19tim. I enjoyed my stay here. This was excellent, and is recommended 

Pros: Excellent value at $20 B&B (my best value so far on this tour). Modern and well-appointed. Opened about 1 yr ago. Scenic setting with mountain views front and rear. Peaceful if facing the rear, away from traffic. Fast internet in my room (6 Mbps). Copious hot water. Comfortable bed in a spacious room (#11). Fair breakfast at 07h30 with eggs, toast, juice, coffee. Good cafeteria next door with Wi-Fi and lower meal prices. Cons: no mirror in my room or bathroom. Some dogs barked in the evening but were quiet during the night.

name: Mirador del Oso Andino
description:
Campsite with bush baño, table, and a wooden structure for viewing los oso. Administrator Danilo Vásquez is very welcoming. Charged $20 pp for a night (children 10 and over, pay too). We spent hours watching two mother bears with cubs. You need a good set of binoculars and for photos a good lens. Fantastic experience. 
Text Danilo at +593997047847

name: Mera
description:
Hotel rayjú
Quiet $ 10 per person
Strong Internet
Hot shower
----
Hotel rayjú
Tranquilo 10$ per persona 
Internet fuerte
Ducha caliente

name: El Cafecito
description:
This is much more of a cafe than a hostel. 6 bed dorms (got it for $7/night) and private rooms above a popular locals’ cafe hangout. 

-gated, uncovered parking area for a few motos
-does not have much a social atmosphere with other travelers
-hangout space is going to be the cafe, but there is outdoor seating as well. Both very lovely areas with lots of books
-Hot showers with excellent water pressure
-no kitchen to use
