-nice big dorm rooms and bunk beds with plenty of space and large lockers

name: Oil change / Cambio de aceite
description: Good oil change place. They had the oil that we needed - 15W-40. For 3 gallons of oil it was $54

name: Hostal jima
description: Old quaint clean hostal just outside village near cemetery. With slightly warm water. We paid 10$ per person. Enough space inside to store bikes.

name: Hostería Parador Los Colorados
description: Better choice than anything we saw in Santo Domingo. Large parking space, balcony from room overlooks the river, lots of birds, breakfast included. $40 for 2 people. TV and aircon. No wifi. Decent room and bathroom. Carpets  need to be replaced. Hallway carpets needed to be vacuumed.

name: Mailiy´s
description:
Super nice food and fresh.
Trout grilled with salat and fresh french fries, plus rice and a big platte of soup for 3 USD.

Do not miss the HOME MADE FRENCH FRIES, extra plate for a 1,50 USD !!

name: Wild camping beside the tiver
description:
Huge flat parking. No charge in the week.
Lots of space for big rigs !!!
super quiet. Close to the bridge and the river. You can get water for free.

name: Nabon abner Piedra
description:
Just outside the village new hostal, hotel. Quite, clean, enough place for the bikes. Warm water. 10$ per person. 
If they are not here as at the square for Abner Piedra. Or call 0994983200

name: Bar Cevicheria
description: Awesome drinks and ceviche right on the water. We were very pleasantly surprised. Super chill but the owner cares a lot about the quality of his drinks and his wife’s ceviche and patacones was reallyyy good.

name: Isla Corazón y Fragata Visitors Center
description:
This is the park’s administration office and a small rural community that offers tours to Isla Corazón. Beautiful mangrove area with plenty of birds and nesting sites. We had Alfredo as a guide and he’s a wonderful person who’s lived here all his life and will tell you about the changes in the area due to human intervention and natural disasters. They also cook what they fish here such as crab, shrimp, etc, all delicious and you get to meet the families that live here. Boat tours cost $15 pp and food $4pp. 
We were invited to stay by the vet that works in the admin office, since he helped us rescue a turtle in Canoa. However, we asked Alfredo (head of community, whatsapp 0969486033 ) about the possibility that other overlanders could stay and he said you’ll be welcome to stay the night too. There is enough room for small to midsize vans. Clean bathrooms and friendly staff.

name: Reserva Rio Bravo trekking and camping
description: Hikes to 3 waterfalls in the primary cloud forest- not touristy, very peaceful and quiet. Guide is optional and speaks English. Very beautiful reserve. Entrance (day-pass): $9 pp. They offer tent camping: $16 pp first night and $7pp from then on, and you can park the vehicle at the entrance (small vans, better if 4x4 to get there). Hoy shower. The owners Juan and Sonia are very welcoming and nice. They offer food if asked in advance, but they will also offer free coffee and fruit. Plenty of birds and a beautiful garden. Soon they will have cabins too. Phone: 0997863172 (Sonia), 0992414818 (Juan). Pet friendly, but they have two big but friendly dogs. No wifi, but there is Claro reception 3G.

name: Jardin de las Mariposas
description: New Mariposario/ Butterfly house in Mindo, run by a local and friendly family. Beautiful setting. $6pp ($4pp children) and they have a path that leads to a waterfall where you can swim. About the same size as the other mariposario. Opened only 15 days ago, not as touristy as other attractions in Mindo. They have a small snacks shop too

name: Next to the lake
description: Flat area next to the lake (nice view) and road (quiet). It is also an entrance to the racetrack. We camped in our vw bus. Very peaceful night (Tuesday night). Police drove by several times -never stopped to talk to us- and we felt safe. In the morning, many locals use the bike line for running, biking and skating. Our cats could roam around freely and explore the area! 😸😸😸

name: Restaurant L’Angelo Italiano
description: Normally we’d never go to Italian but this place was right across where we parked the van (at La Casa which we suggest) and we’re pleasantly surprised by a great thin crust pizza and a really good spicy arribiata pasta. Super nice waitress, great service, cut street tables with candles. Definitely suggest it! We returned a second night just for wine and they gave us free bruschetta!

name: Commercial hotel
description:
It is clean. 20$ for 2. Internet is weak

Es limpio. 20$ por dos. Internet no fonctiona bien. Personal non amable

name: Overlook
description:
Flat spot to camp, completely off the road in a slightly raised pullout. We slept at the one about 8km East of here, so didn't also sleep here, but wanted to add it for others. Steeper broader view than the last spot, and more off the road, but, no lake! 
(Note: further west there's a couple bad spots on the road, I wouldn't recommend big rigs, especially if it's raining)

name: Petro Ecuador, Gas station for foreign cars too
description: We have been able to buy gasoline here with our Mexican plates

name: Nueva Loja
description: Lago Xtreme is a Traditional Food like MAITO and CHOTACURO or MAYON (worm). It’s complete with Botanical garden, Adventure’s Game like Paintball

name: destacamento militar
description: they didn't allow us to stay overnight in the reserve so we asked at the military facilities. they are super friendly and let us stayed, hooked up to electricity and even we did some laundry.

name: La Virginia
description:
$10 per camper per night.

Very good place by the sea and 10 minutes walk from the city center by the beach, kitchen, swimming pool, electricity, shower, toilet, wifi, very quiet, all vehicles possible.

name: Agua Refill at Mini Market
description: There is a tap water spot here where you can fill up your tanks. To the right of the gas pump.

name: La Ramada Restaurant “ Giovanni’s”
description: This is the correct location for Camping at Beach La Peñas . Behind restaurants on the beach.

name: Cascadas de Manuel
description: Beautiful place just 10km from the main road.  If you are looking to connect with nature, this is the perfect place.  The main attraction is the 8 waterfalls, the path is easy to follow, although you must make an effort as the road is steep but not difficult.  Place allows the entry of pets on a leash.  Large truck parking, offers bathrooms and showers.  It also has a restaurant that offers lunch and dinner.  In the camping area you have a cabin with electricity.  The price usd 5/person for camping and usd2 /person if you only want to visit the waterfalls.

name: tourist information
description:
tourist information: free maps and information about Quito's historical center
they also have lockers, maybe they can be used by tourists to store their stuff there

name: Santa Rita sports fields
description:
A very good place if you are late to arrive to Cotopaxi or to Quito. Flat, quiet, safe, no dogs, no people. Possibly view to Cotopaxi volcano. Just 1 km from Panamericana. 
Un gran lugar si se te hacer tarde en ruta al Cotopaxi o hacia Quito. Plano, silencioso, seguro, sin perros, sin gente. Posible vista al volcán Cotopaxi. A un km de la Panamericana.

name: Pescado restaurant
description: Family restaurant - very nice owner. Fish (trucha).  ‚Plato’ fish + platano fritos + rice + salad + fresh juice (sugar cane mix with naranja) 5$ !!! Very good, taste and cheap, tottaly recomend. For us better than more commercial place near the cascada del diablo ;)

name: Cabaña Jagannatha
description:
Big grassy field to set up tent, park your rig, or a second floor, super fresh, with already set up tents.
Privates as well.
300 mts from the beach. Adjacent to the main road.
Kitchen is basic.
Nice shower rooms and toilets.
Yoga in the morning everyday.
Fair price for camping, drops if you stay longer.
No smoking or alcohol allowed. Not a party place. Super tranquilo.
Close to surf schools.

name: BULK STORE: Te Quiero Verde
description:
Great place the buy food with zero packaging!!! Buy only what you need by weight, bring your own containers (or use theirs) and be left with no plastic packaging to throw away (hip hip hooray!!!). Seed, nuts, grains, spices, sweets, tea, coconut oil, olive oil, soap, toothpaste, deodorant, and more ALL IN BULK! 

Also have some kombuchas, hummus, artesanal beers...

Reasonable prices and zero waste!

name: Hostal Jardines
description: Cheap basic hostel in the center of town with very large rooms, we asked for a double and got a room with 4 beds! 10$ per night, average wifi, shared bathroom with not so hot shower, outdoor kitchen. Safe garage to lock our bikes.

name: Cuscungo Cotopaxi
description: Small hostel with all the basic amenities. Ideal if your intention is to go visit the volcan Cotopaxi and its surroundings. They help you with the organization of the transport or guide you how to do it on your own. The staff is very friendly and the clean place.

name: Fish market - Mercado de pescado
description:
If you like to cook fish or seafood, this is your place. Daily catch and cheap. Big shrimp and great fish.

Si te gusta cocinar pescados y mariscos no te lo pierdas! buenos precios y todo fresco

name: Central park
description:
It's safe and one block from beach.. You have access to water and bathroom. Shower 50c. Weekends, there are  people taking care of the block so you have to tip them. Free WiFi (slow).
.....
A una cuadra de la playa con acceso a agua y baños. Ducha por 50c. Nada mal. Los fines de semana hay cuidadores de coche que te querrán cobrar. Wifi gratis (lento)

name: Muyuyo
description: hotel with parking lot for three or four vehicles. Big rig friendly. 5 dollars per person with breakfast. Great wifi. Bathroom at restaurant. Shower also possible. Beach access. Calm beach bay. Snorkel onshore. Buy  local fish and seafood at libertad and spend a few days here

name: Secret Garden Cotopaxi
description:
Very very nice hostel to stay. They have 3day/2nights package deals for $95pp. Includes all meals (and they are really good) all day coffee, tea, banana bread, a two hour waterfall guided hike, a full day guided hike, 24h jacuzzi, and transportation to the place if you need. 
You also can book separate nights for $40pp, not cheap but it’s also all inclusive.
They offer also other hikes and activities but you have to pay extra.
The vibe and the atmosphere is really good, despite the prices it’s really worth it. Very recommend!!

Book in advance through their website.

name: western union
description:
I had problem to get money! The atm takes only visa, no master card!
You can send money  online to western union!

name: Sazón Colombiano
description: If you are on the way from Peru to Guayaquil and you crave a nice lunch, make sure to stop at this small restaurant. The food is delicious and the owner is very welcoming! He has his own cacao plantation in front of the restaurant and you can try fresh homemade hot chocolate! We loved that place to rest and eat to continue our trip!

name: 4x4 mechanic Rafael
description: Great mechanic knows 4x4 vehicles. Convenient location speaks some English he was able to find us some XZL Michelin tires 335 80 r20 big Rigs OK

name: Gas station, with cameras 24hrs
description: Good spot to stay overnight, we spend 2 days here, toilets good, water in gas station, and good free wifi from restaurant, just ask and they give to you. We stoped at the side of the restaurant, wifi works well day and night. great spot for any cars, a lot of trucks stops here at night. No showers, gas station 24hrs.

name: centro cultural tránsito amaguana
description:
Nice small museum about the indigeneous fight. Very interesting.

Pequeño y lindo museo que trata de la lucha de los pueblos indigenas. Muy interesante. Colaboracion libre.

name: La Belga
description:
A lovely restaurant in the city of Cuenca. The Belgian owner Joël prepares delicate international food every day from fresh products bought at the market.
You get juice + starter + main and dessert for only 3,5$, and for such quality it's unbeatable!
For example you can get vegetable tempura, homemade soupe, pesto pasta, Iranian style rice, Thai curry, milkshakes, smoothies, etc....it changes every day!
We went to have lunch there everyday since we discovered the place, it's sooo delicious!
The ultimate place in Cuenca if you got tired of the ever same almuerzo.

La Belga is located just one street souther, in the calle Pedro Toulop on a little square. 

Location updated.


Opening hours:
MO-FR 12:30-22:00
SA 12:30-24:00

name: Petroecuador (sells to foreign plates)
description: This fuel station sold us diesel no problem whereas the two previous ones (coming from Ecuador to Colombia) refused to sell to foreign plates.

name: Soul advertures
description:
Manino offers adventure tours in quads and bike, for hours or days by camping around the Olon Bambu forrest. He knows a lot the place, is very nice and is very specialized in nature, local culture. Very recommendable. 
$35 for 3.5 hours tour by bike were unforgetteble! Don’t miss!!
www.souladventures.es

name: Quincho place
description:
place for several vehicles.
big rig friendly
direct at the beach
under palmtrees
quincho available
we've stayed 3 nights. it's very quiet. the cops made round several time during the night.
some trashes we arrived but we've cleaned it !!!
we have bought big shrimps directly at the fisherman at 1$/shrimp at the harbour
if you have a good antenna you can reach "billonthehill".

name: Camping club
description: Nice place near river, local club camping. We ask owners and stay there. Big pool, safe place. Not cheap, we pay 20usd per camper an 2 person.

name: Velasco electrónica transformers 110v-220v and reverse
description: After looking in lots of shops all over Guayaquil we finally found these shop where they sell transformers 110v-220v and reverse, with 300w, 500w, 1500w and 2500w. The 2500w was 80 US$. Good product and price and just in the center.

name: GS Custom Garage
description:
GS Custom Garage is a multi-brand mechanical workshop. We were for 7 days solving some problems with the clutch and starter of our VW Kombi T3. Mauricio, its owner, has a lot of experience in Volkswagen and helped us connect the board's witnesses. It is a reliable place for other travelers.
---
GS Custom Garage es un taller de mecánica multimarca. Estuvimos durante 7 días solucionando unos problemas con el embrague y el motor de arranque de nuestra VW Kombi T3. Mauricio, su dueño, tiene bastante experiencia en Volkswagen y nos ayudó a conectar los testigos del tablero. Es un lugar confiable para otros viajeros.

name: Beach Parking in Montañita
description: During low season at least, this is the best place to stay if you are travelling with a van. The parking is 800 meters from the city center and along the beach. Very quiet and safe, we spent three perfect free nights there. A bar-restaurant in front allows you to use showers, toilets, kitchen and wifi for only 1$ pp - unclear whether this is still valid.

name: Parking
description: You can sleep in your van in this parking. This is open from 8am to 9.30pm. Secure parking in the historic center, very well located. We paid 10$ for 24hours. People are very nice. Pet friendly.

name: Gas station/Gasolinera
description: We stopped here just for the night as we wanted to refill our propane bottle at the Eni Station nearby in the morning. We asked one of the employees and said it was fine if parked next to the trucks. The place is open 24h so it feels safe but nothing special, just a had station by the road

name: PC Laptop Quito
description: We came here with 2 Notebooks. It soon became clear that both hard discs were damaged after one year dirt roads, bad gravel and washboard. The last savings to externals were incomplete due to mentioned so we were quite desparate. People here are extremely professional and helpful. We communicated in my bad Spanish and Translation Programms as here nobody speaks English. Their repair tools worked for nearly a week, we also had a change to SSD discs, they were so kind to also "help" with some hours Internet so we could re-install some programmes and tools a.s.o...All for a really reasonable price and good/friendly service. We can highly recommend and besides...who stays at Citypark can walk in 15 minutes (we did several times in that week)

name: Camp site in Mera
description: Spot to stop for the night. Not too much more than that. Quiet at night.

name: Amarelo
description:
Nice little restaurant that offers quality Mediterranean cuisine. For vegetarians the risottos are tasty, and for carnivores the piece of beef is very tender. The cocoa brownie from Ecuador is a drug! The 3 German beers are tasty. The whole team is nice. The owner owns this restaurant and the Honey Cafe next door. We recommend 2

Jolie petit restaurant qui propose une cuisine méditerranéenne de qualité. Pour les végétariens les risottos sont goûteux, et pour les carnivores la pièce de bœuf est très tendre. Le brownie au cacao d’Equateur est une drogue ! Les 3 bières allemandes sont savoureuses. Toute l’équipe est agréable. Le propriétaire détient ce restaurant et le café Honey juste à côté. Nous recommandons les 2

name: Hostal Imperial
description:
Rooms for 2 or 4 persons, between $25 to $35 with breakfasts. Perfect locality. We recommended !
.....
Chambres entre 25 et 35$ avec petits-déjeuners et parking compris. Le petit parking est fermé et sécurisé avec une caméra. Accessible pour petits et moyens véhicules. Ogusto le patron est adorable. Il gère son hôtel en famille. Chiens acceptés sans suppléments. Cet hôtel est parfaitement situé, dans le quartier animé « La Mariscal ». Il y a un arrêt de bus touristique Hop à 100m qui permet de visiter tous les sites incontournables de Quito. Il y a aussi l’arrêt de bus « Manuela Cañizares » à 500m qui permet d’aller au centre historique en bus de ville pour 0,25$ par personne. À proximité se trouve la place très animée Foch.
Coup de cœur pour Ogusto avec lequel nous avons longuement parlé de tout et de rien. Nous sommes venus à 2 reprises dans cet hôtel. Nous recommandons !

name: Vehicle Drop Off
description:
this is the place where you enter with your car if you want to ship it from Ecuador

before you can enter you need to register and ask for the permission in one of the offices in the containers

rent a helmet, signaljacket and hardboots (1.50 USD half-day)

the waiting game begins afterwards ... aduana, drug control ... etc 

good luck!

name: Mundial City Hotel
description: Nice little hotel with very secure van parking. We paid $60 for 3 of us in one room. Hot shower, fast internet, pool with slide, air conditioning, fridge in room, big breakfast included. Lavandería one block away took just a few hours to wash and dry. They can't store your van while you go to the Galapagos because their parking lot isn't big enough, but we stayed here before and after our trip to the Galapagos. Faucet in parking area to refill your van tank. (I don't know exactly what's "big rig" so I left that unknown but you can see the parking area in the photos I took)

name: Tecnomotriz
description: Do not go here. these guys unfortunately let people work on your car who have no idea what they're doing because they usually work on much newer motors but it took them 5 hiurs to finally admit this. avoid!

name: Lavandería de Nieva
description:
We had our laundry done here; it is the cleanest we've seen our clothes in years! Nieva still washes all the laundry by hand. We try to help her to save for a machine by giving this small promotion...she deserves it! 
Normal rate in this area is $1.50 per kilo. We gave some more to get her started.

name: Assault
description: Hotel Costa Paraiso. On the coast. We were assaulted by armed persons in this location.

name: Los Armadillos  (hummingbirds!)
description: You can drink a coffee and watching tons of colibries. Awesome bird stop. The lady is lovely who works there too.

name: Rancho Tentazione
description: Place to rest on the Quito-Quevedo bypass.  spacious and quiet place for many vehicles.  camping area.  has pool, shower, bathroom, wifi.  They do not receive pets, here are 3 large dogs that take care of the place.  Its owner Luis Muñoz 0960204444 is ready to help so that they know the beautiful rivers and waterfalls of Santo Domingo. The price is 7.0 usd per person, 15 usd a couple.

name: Hostería La Góndola
description:
La Gondola is a super nice place to stay with or without car. This place has everything what a overlander needs! Direct beach access and parking with grass and/or sand, lots of chill out areas and a bar. No hight restrictions because of two different entrance gates. You can contact the owner Sergio directly with WhatsApp +593 985125249 or just stop by and ask for a place. The price per night per van is 10US$ including cold shower, bathroom, electricity and best WiFi ever.
The staff is super friendly and helps you with everything you need! The center is just 5 minutes walking and the surf spot 15 minutes walking along the beach away. Highly recommend this little paradise!

name: Area de Recreación Nacional El Boliche
description: It is a very beautiful Natural Reserve, ideal to share with family, you can see alpacas, yamas, sheep, hares, deer, wolves of páramo and different birds; It is a quiet place to spend the night, but we recommend you take a good blanket. The rangers are very kind and attentive people with travelers. Parking without cost.

name: Free Wifi Alcaldía de Guayaquil
description:
Free Wifi at the Alcaldia de Guayaquil (townhall).
Also free wifi at the metro stations.

name: Tintoreras Gran Hostel
description:
Very nice hotel with Fernando at the front desk. When our tour operator screwed up he helped us out and got us on trip.

Nice rooms and huge beds!

name: Restaurant at Mirador el Rocio
description:
Nice restaurant with reasonable prices - Ceviche, Chicharron or pescado apanado for 5$
The owner ist very nice, beautiful view, recommended.

name: Cabaña de verano
description: Nice cabin with private room, bathroom, WiFi, kitchen, parking to 8 USD per person in room possibility of camping, overnight in your car or sleep in hammocks you just have to ask for Javier + 593 99 823 3003.

name: Casa Familiar
description:
Beautiful country house on the outskirts of Quito, ideal for getting to know the city, private room, private bathroom, wifi, parking, hot shower for 8 dollars per person. Ask for Javier +593 99 823 3003 who loves to receive motorcyclists. There is possibility to camp or overnight in your car too.
--
Linda casa campestre a las afueras de quito, ideal para conocer la ciudad, habitación privada, baño privado, wifi, parqueadero, ducha caliente a 8 dolares por persona. Preguntar por Javier +593 99 823 3003 quien ama recibir motociclistas. Hay posibilidad de acampar o pernoctar en tu carro también.

name: Cabaña en medio del bosque
description: Cabin in the middle of the country, 7 dollars per person, private room, bathroom, hot shower, possibility of camping or overnight in your car. Call Javier + 593 99 823 3003.

name: Punta La Barca
description:
Very nice terrain on a hillpoint looking over the pacific and the village. It belongs to Punta La Barca which is a small nomad place ran by a ecuadorean-belgian family. 
Nice atmosphere, good internet, warm showers, elektricity for vans, beachvolley field, common areas for cooking, relaxing and working, childfriendly. 
Big motorhomes: there's a difficult curve to go down which looks scary, but everyone comes down anyhow and never anybody got in trouble going down or up the curve. Up to you though!

name: Money exchange / wifi
description:
mi frontera cafe.
we sat for an ice cream but we found out that she can exchange peruano soles for dollars. the exchange that she offered was quiet fair, only 0.2 higher than the actual rate. we needed them for gas as they don't accept soles.
she also sells WiFi

name: free wifi
description: they're several wifi and charging points along the esplanade.

name: Estadio
description: There is plenty of parking all around the town pitch.  The soccer field is used in evening for practices and weekend for games. But we arrived on a Tuesday and enjoyed a quiet night.   There is paid camping nearby, but if you don’t need the services, this is a free option.  Police checked on us about ten pm.  Please keep this spot clean and acceptable.

name: Complejo Archeologico Bańos del Inca
description: Beautiful site carved into rock.  Park before the gate if you’re tall (on the tracks).  No one there to charge a fee or open museum. But interesting to walk through.  Note- this is the turn to get to entrance, not the ruins.

name: Casa Blanca
description:
excellent restaurant below Casa Blanca hotel located on the malecon

our second-best option for food on this island. very delicious food, good prices (around 8-12 USD per plate), clean facilities and good wifi.

we had a huge portion of fish'n'chips and a fish burger and paid 19.50 usd.

name: Warning - Vehicle export
description:
Long story short.

We wanted to ship our car from Guayaquil to Switzerland and were trapped in a 3 week-long nightmare in Guayaquil.

DO NOT use the following companies:
- Universal Cargo
- Pacific Anchorline
- Vial Group

Here is the most important information which we were not told by our Swiss freighter and neither by the Ecuadorian companies.

Upon receiving your TIP/DJT at the entrance to Ecuador, send it immediately to your freighter. From that moment on it will take 8-12 days until you can expect the departure.

In case you are using the companies mentioned above, be sure to speak sufficiently Spanish to guide your way. 

In case you are using INSA, Ltd. all is fine and you just issue them a PODER to be present in your name for the upcoming drug inspection by the police before container sealing.

If not, you need to be present in Guayaquil UNTIL the car was checked by the police, the aduana and finally the container sealed. For this present you will NOT receive a specific time until 24-48 hours prior to the inspection. Note that the inspection itself will not take place more than 7 days before the departure of the ship.

After 3 weeks of being trapped we finally made it out, thanks to the help of the Swiss embassy which intervened heavily at all companies, and the help of a former Pacific Anchorline broker Ing. Andres Espinosa. Andres speaks fluent English and Spanish and is really helpful and can assist during the entire process. Without him we would still be in Guayaquil. Give him a call if you need help! 

Ing. Andres Espinosa. Muniex Ltd. 
+593999892415

name: Las palmeras
description: Clean tidy hotel $20 for matrimonial. Cool shower (fine for the climate!) great wifi. Air con old noisy but functional. Friendly staff. Parking around the corner for 2 motorbikes.

name: El jardin
description: Very good restaurant with amazonian cooking. Try the pollo ishpingo and the camarones ajillo. Around 12$ the plate. The almuerzo menu is 12$ with a lemonade. Very very good in a beautiful garden.

name: Laundry in 2 hours
description:
3 sizes machines for laundromat (2-3,50-4,50 $)

50c per kg (less if you have more than 10kg). Very fast : in 2 hours.

name: Jardin EcoBotanico Mindo
description:
The Alcivar's garden is a wonderful place where you could bird's watching for lonfg hour. Alcivar will offer his binoculars and telescope to enjoy the view. what's more, if you want, he makes a tour for his garden where you could learn about mariposas, medical plants and nature. very instructive, a lot of tranquility.

Le jardin de Alcivar vous offre un point de vue exceptionnel sur différents oiseaux. Si le temps s'y prête vous aurez la.possibilité d'observer une grande variété d'oiseaux. De plus Alcivar vous met à disposition son équipement d'observation avec support adapté à votre téléphone pour garder de bons souvenir. Si vous l'acceptez, vpus pouvez vositer son jardin où vous y apprendrez les différentes plantes médicinales qui poussent dans la régions, les papillons, les insectes, les arbres. Extrêmement intéressant pour les amoureux de la nature

name: Laguna ataraxia
description: Nice place on shore of Laguna Taracoa with little port for canoe excursion operated by the local community! Cost 3 us $ per person to make the round trip with them paddling .

name: Tecno alineado
description: If you need align and balance the wheels, this is the best place. the owner is very friendly and very good prices.

name: Corrupt Police ! (Maybe)
description:
They stopped us because we were the only foreign in the line. They asked for ALL documents, when they realize that everything was ok, they start to look the entire car. Finally they tried to give us a ticket because of the glass was broken. It wasn't broken !. Several minutes later they ask us for money while they were writing the ticket.
---
Nos detuvieron porque éramos los únicos extranjeros en la fila.  Nos pidieron TODOS los documentos, cuando se dieron cuenta de que todo estaba bien, comenzaron a mirar todo el auto.  Finalmente intentaron ponernos un comparendo disque por un vidrio. Lo que era falso. Varios minutos después nos piden dinero mientras escribían el comparendo.

name: tyre shop
description: Good selection of tyres, helmets and other parts.

name: Plaza de Zapotillo
description: Nice town to sleep. Quiet and safe. We asked the Police, and they said no problem.

name: Santa Rosa
description:
Quiet place, beachfront and fishermen.
Quiet and friendly people, at night is safe and quiet.
Near Plaza Santa Rosa.

name: Free shower at Petroecuador
description: Free cold shower at the gas station! You can also sleep in your van if you want. There is a big parking for free if you buy gasoil (from 5$). If not, ask the guardian, and sleep for free beside the gaz station!

name: CLYAN gas station
description: Nice staff, they let us sleep in their parking for free. Free wifi on the side of the road.

name: La Feliz (Argentinan restaurant)
description:
Nice little spot run by a really friendly Argentian couple. They have a simple menu of empanadas, burgers, pizzas, hotdogs & churrasco (there's a couple of veggie options too), all homemade. Good quality for the price (between $1-8 per dish.) 

They also do AMAZING alfajores for dessert. (we're going back tomorrow for more)

name: Hill House Fishing and restaurant
description: This is not the actual bane of the palce but is just for reference.  The house at the top of the hill let us stay for free in the level lawn, they have near the fishing pools, and toilets available. They are really kind, no showers but clean toilet. A tip is appreciated as they are just starting with their fishing business.

name: Zhindar Church
description:
This place was recommended by the info center at Saraguro Town. It's a church with lots of space for any tipe of rig. The town feels safe and the people is really nice. Many options to camp around the church. Best for us was at the back where is a path that goes around the church and the view to town is amazing. 
The town of Saraguro itself is nice with a big sunday market for fresh produce and a lot of handcrafted goods. Nice stop close to main road between Cuenca and Loja.

name: Río Boquerón recreational area
description:
Area is close between 18.00 and 7.00, we were allowed to camp overnight with our bikes, after asking the guard.
Restaurants for noon, bathing in the river, children playgrounds, clean toilets stay open at night.

name: Lavadero Lavaflash
description: We stopped here to wash our motorhome, and the owner let us sleep here.

name: Street near park. Quiet, safe, free
description:
In the street, there are plenty of spaces available for parking. Free. Very quiet because few cars pass. No noise tonight.
Avoid the weekend I think because it is near a park

name: Café Libre | AMAZING VEGAN FOOD
description: ALL vegan cafe, prices range from $7-10 a dish but they are filling! We recommend the jackfruit sandwich. Some of the best vegan food we have found since Mexico!! Open 12-4pm and 7-10pm.

name: Quinta El Mamey
description: Very nice and familiar stay in first line of the pacific ocean. They offer breakfast and dinner as an extra. We had both and it was excellent! Outdoor swimming pool with jacuzzi and a nice lounge area with hammocks. We paid 30 USD for a matrimonial room with private bathroom. Owner couple is super nice and speaks Spanish, English and German. They have children and lovely dogs as well as a very good sense for eco-friendly hospitality. Also safe parking and quiet at night. We think this is best value in the region.

name: Las Mantas
description: Beautiful place in Sta. Marianita. Quiet and with a wonderful view. The owners are very kind and love to receive overlanders. Small and medium-sized space vans. It has access to a reserved beach. The only restriction is in relation to water: the supply is limited then the owners suggest that the use of water is more conscientious. Wi-Fi and Petfriendly. For now, they only offer the use of a bathroom. Price for camping: 5 p / p. This place also offers complete huts to rent by initial values in 30p.p. Charly WhatsApp: +593 98 4633918

name: Reventador view on the side of the road
description:
Small flat area on the side of the road (on the right if your are coming from Baeza direction),just passing 98km green sign. You can park here and in front of you you can see the Reventador (if there is no clouds). Just some noice during the night for the traffic.
Great spot to see the volcano and take nice photos.


Pequeño espacio al costado de la ruta, del lado derecho si venís del lado de Baeza, pasando el kilómetro 98, justo antes de una curva en U y donde hay un cartel de madera. Se puede estacionar sin problemas y pasar la noche. Desde ahí se tiene una gran vista del Reventador si el clima lo permite.

name: Petroecuador
description: Petroecuador gas station. We parked one night here. Friendly staff, bathrooms 24hs, water and cold showers.

name: CAR-FRENOS
description:
We entered to register the clutch, Mr. Paul is very professional we made an adjustment in the whole camper. He went to find us at Parque La Carolina and accompanied us to his workshop. Performs brake work, suspension, shock absorbers and clutch.


Ingresamos para registrar el embrague,  el señor Paul es muy profesional nos hizo un ajuste en todo el camper.
Nos fue  a buscar al Parque La Carolina y nos acompaño a su taller. 
Realiza trabajos de frenos, suspensión, amortiguadores y embrague.

name: Behind Bomberos
description: As we didn’t find the place at the river, we ended up here, next to the market place and behind the bombeiros (fire brigade) Quiet night & morning. Don’t know what day is market day, however not on Saturday.

name: Albergue Español
description:
Nice 2 bunkbed Dorms for $8 and cozy Privates for $10.
Not so cozy Kitchen. 1 block from the river. French/Ecuadorian owned. Teo, the husband of the Owner's doughter, is really nice and attentive. $3 for breakfast. Wifi average.

name: El Chato Ranch Ecological Reserve
description: Giant Turtle Reserve and lava tunnels. Private area so you have to pay $10pp/ 7,5$ kids. Free organic coffee and tea at the reception. We found at least 45 turtles along the walk. We took the bus and walked here.

name: Cacao Mindo Artisanal Tour
description:
Very nice Chocolate tour in English or Spanish. The owner is passionate and explained the processus very well.
We tasted many kind of combined chocolate and a fondue.
So nice!
Cost 7$ pp 6$ for kids.

name: Cascada Chamana
description: One more beautiful waterfall! You can easily access with your car/van and park just before the finca. Road is paved.

name: La Tablada coffee and restaurant
description: The best almuerzo of all the places we tried in South America! good soup, amazing carne or chicken and very good coffee. good team and great atmosphere too. everything is made with wood. definitely recommended! they also do breakfast and dinner.

name: The Secret Garden
description:
Hostal on the edge of the old town. 
Excellent views from the roof top bar/terrace.
Really busy place. Unfortunately no cooking facilities but breakfast from $2.75 and dinner at $4.95. Happy hour 6 till 7, 241.
There is street parking outside but I wouldn't bring a big rig anywhere near here.
Live music every night across the road and a fairly decent brewery about 5 minutes away.

name: Morning Glory
description: Very nice hostel that provides good breakfast. Lovely tgarden in courtyard with many hammocks to chill and relax. Quiet, very clean and well-maintained. For being close to the main drag this is quiet.Also, there is dispenser for free drinking water and free laundry service. Wifi is of course (Galapagos speed) but ok. Kitchen and fridge available to use.We didnt use this facility because we ate dinner ($6 for set) on the street restaurants. Overall, thia is our favorite hostel...about $50/night but well worth it. No camping here.

name: Laguna de las Nimfas
description: A quiet refuge surrounded by mangrove trees and a serene view of a lagoon. Close to the tourist area but far from its noise. Free!

name: La Piramide
description:
We arrived at the rivers, Montalvo. Cecilia Zambrano makes couchsurfing. They have a very large property with swimming pool, bath, showers, WiFi, bar, lodging, kitchen, pool. They accept Campers and tents.Campers: 3 Dollars. Camping: 1.50. Double bed room: 5 dollars.
It is a beautiful place on the side of the rivers, special to rest for several days, near the center to go for a walk.Cecilia and her husband Nico are very hospitable, they like to receive travelers to exchange talks and customs. Don't worry about the location, it's very safe and quiet.

name: Villa Paz Hospedaje
description:
A lovely couple, Luis and Marcela, build on the hill next to the museum at the playa Africa a house with 3 rooms. All rooms have a seperate bath with hot water and all you need. A living room and a big kitchen are also usable.

The couple is living in one of the rooms or in a seperate house they build next to it. It was just a awesome time spending with them. Helped in any issues and felt immediately like back home. 

You can relax in the hammocks at the veranda and enjoy the awesome view, go for a swim or explore the cost. The village at playa africa counts only 17 people and is very friendly.

We werent able to park our camper next to the house, because the road is on the beach and it was to soft. But we parked it at the end of the road to playa africa and it wasnt a problem at all. Very safe.
The road to playa africa was challenging for our old Ford Transit camper, but still made it even it was a bit muddy.

They charge 15 $ per Person/night, but its all money definitely worth.

For any question, just ask them. Probaly they give you a lift from the main road.
Contact: +593 987068605

name: Agrocalidad near Airport
description:
Before you go here, you need to see a vet for a health certificate and parasite treatment. Then go to a bank (quayaquil/pacifico) to pay the 26.20usd (see photo for relevant info for this). And then you can
Come here to get the certificate you need for your dog to cross the border. It took me only 20 minutes here, wow.

name: TapiForm Upholstery
description:
This is a small but fine upholstery shop. Owner Francisco (Whatsapp +593 99 338 6272) not only does a careful job, he‘s a very friendly and calm guy. If you need some work done on your car seats or any kind of cushion, this is the place to go. Francisco will try to find a solution for you. We got the backside of 3 big and one smaller cushion done for $45. Work was done very accurately. Definitely two thumbs up for TapiForm. 
https://www.facebook.com/Tapiform/

name: Street parking
description:
Big parking bays at side of the street.
Also parking lot, which was open for the night, but can be closed.
Guard at night in park next to parking.
Toilet at 24 hr gas station across the street.

name: Hotel Plaza Real
description:
Located in the center, rooms like das and pretty. The wifi is fast. The bathroom is comfortable and has hot water. We got 20 dollars double room.



Ubicado en el centro, habitaciónes como das y lindas. El wifi es rápido . El baño es cómodo y tiene agua caliente .
nos salió 20 dólares habitación matrimonial.

name: Hostel La Mansión
description:
Good place to spend the night, with shower with hot water, clean rooms and comfortable beds. Wifi . Good attention 24 hours



buen lugar para pasar la noche , con 
ducha con agua caliente ,habitaciones limpias y camas cómodas.
wifi .
Buena atención 24horas

name: Aylluwasi
description:
What a great find! This is an absolutely gorgeous place we stumbled upon. $23/night for 2 people, gigantic room, hot shower, he let us park the moto inside. We first went to the restaurant with the same name right next door, and they contacted Alberto for us. But his phone number is +57399293413
0992963413

name: Nariz del Diablo 2
description: Awesome viewpoint of track and train station. You can reach parking with small rig or motorbike. Parking is about 800 metres from this viewpoint.

name: Gas Station P&S - Yahuarcocha
description: We stayed for free, Free shower.

name: primax gas station
description: Safe place, free WiFi (slow). we sleep here 2 nights, very noisy. In the gas station are a pharmacy, supermarket and coffee store SWEET&COFFEE.

name: La Quitenita
description: Decent hostel, rooms for 10, 15 and 29 dollar, beter than average food in the restaurant, but slightly more expensive than on less touristy places.

name: Balade en bateau et bar
description:
Facebook : balsa de totora
Possibilité de faire un tour de bateau en roseau comme sur le lac Titicaca sur le lac. + il fait bar. 
4 USD adultes et 2,5 enfants. 
propriétaires super sympas

name: Ford motors Quito
description:
We had a major breakdown on a Saturday.
We got very good service, even thou it was Saturday.

name: Familia Tuquerres.
description:
Very very very warm and hospitable couple in their 59ish. Big house, 3 floors. Two-bed rooms. Kitchen. Garage for a van sized vehicle.
$6 p/p. (yes: SIX)

name: gas station primax
description: good place for sleep one night. WiFi password: TRISA2017CORP

name: Parque Pucayacu
description: Very nice and safe small town (PUCAYACU). We took this road because the main route was closed. We were driving to Laguna Quilotoa.

name: Electro Servicio Altamirano
description: We had an issue with our Fiat Ducato (main connection to the battery failed). This is the place if you have any electrical problems with your vehicle. We’ve talked to some other customers while waiting, some of them came a very long way from the coast to get their issue solved. Owner Carlos Altamirano is a clever and speedy guy with a good staff (mobile/whatsapp: +593 99 349 3218). Clean and organized place. Price: One guy working for 1.5 hours, $10.

name: Muyu
description: Considered Upscale dining but honestly affordable. They have a menu of the day that costs $12 and it is a good portion. Cocktails are a bit on a pricy side. Still great value. Beautiful view especially of the sunset, the bay and the sea lions frolicking. Nice outdoor seats! Just wonderful experience.

name: public laundry place
description: a lot of sinks for laundry or wash the dishes. the water came s from the waterfall.

name: Wild Camping
description:
I'm touring by bicycle. I wanted to figure out whether a cyclist can pitch a tent in this beautiful mountain road. Yes, you can pitch a tent, maximum 3. I felt very safe and quiet. Maybe it's difficult to get into this place by car.
Enjoy your trip.

name: Check In Bed and Breakfast
description: Cheap basic hostel, clean, friendly, perfect location. Kitchen, roof terrace, common area.

name: oil change and revision
description: really good and nice mechanic. we changes oil and filter and check all the vehicle.

name: 2nd Wild camp at Lago de San Pablo
description: Across the creek from the other camp,  but this site has grass rather than dirt. Great views of Volcan Imbabura.

name: Wild camp near pyramids
description: Good clean spot with trees near the pyramid park. Very level!

name: Wild  camp 2 near pyramids
description: Not a bad spot off the new paved road to the pyramids.  Big views but could be windy.

name: Posada Tambuca
description:
Nice hostel, well located.
We were welcomed by these AWESOME hosts Carlos and Iolanda, and had a wonderful stay for a couple of days. Iolanda is the sweetest ever.
They are very accommodating and caring.
Huge kitchen, clean rooms, hot showers.
A bit expensive (25$/night for a room for 2) but worth it.
Breakfast is included in the price.
Good wifi.

name: Galeria del primer pintor de Tigua
description: Very nice painting shop owned by the painter Julio Toaquiza very famous for his beautiful paintings. He and his daughter are very kind and are happy to explain the story of this kind of particular paintings and the story of Julio. Have a look!

name: Pacari Casa Experience
description: You can try all the Pacari chocolates here. They offer chocolate tasting experience here. They have some lounge chairs to enjoy helados and some beverages. Prices are a tad better than the one on the shops. But we saw some Pacari in the Supermaxi that is the cheapest. People here are nice and welcoming. Wifi available. Tasting tour for 1-1.5hrs at 4pm tues and thurs only though.

name: Hostal Magus
description: Nice hostel, with parking, hot shower, good wifi, tv 55 ", very clean and quiet.We pay 15 dollars per person.It is the best and most economical in the area.

name: Complejo Touristico Casa Blanca
description: We had to leave the Camping Parque Lago because of the mosquitos and got here. Ok hotel for 1 night, clean rooms, private bathroom but only cold shower, WiFi let’s you stream Netflix, big secure parking behind a gate, the owner said that lorries can go in so I guess it’s ok for big rigs, our Land Cruiser fit in with no problem, 20 USD per night incl. parking and AC but check out at 8:00 am, if you want to stay 24 hours he charges 30 USD, they have a massive pool and charge 3 USD pp for the use. The town is quite and secure, some restaurants along the main road walking 5 min away. No breakfast included.

name: Bros Mechanic Paul Velasco
description:
Great mechanic. 
Paul has been travelling on moto through South America several times on his KTM Adventure. 
Also knows DR650 inside out, as well as other motos. 

Highly recommended. 
Doesn’t speak much english though. 

His phone number:
+593 99 968 8992

name: Ila Kucha
description:
Great spot! You can spend the night in the parking space (10 usd per car), toilets open all night. They also have camping space, I think it was 15 usd. 

They are a fairly new Kitchwa community project, they are still working on it, but they have a restaurant, where you can buy some food and beers. 

Also, they can take you in canoas to the lagoon (5 pp), or walk one the paths they have made, so you can spot birds or animals (5 pp for the guide) but we went on our own because they were busy (I would recommend the guide, I had so much questions about plants or we heard birds but couldnt spot them). 

We spend a very nice afternoon talking with Mr. Washington and his nephew, he is a great man and knows a lot of the area and loves to share about his community. Also, because of the rain, it was kind of cold so we slept like babys and saw the sunrise in the lagoon. Very pretty!!

The road is paved until Taracoa, and then unpaved but ok for any car, is in very good shape. Soon, it will be all paved (thats what they said).

name: Taller Ibarra
description:
We were having issues with the car but all mechanics we asked around, had no idea what was it, or just suggest to change parts haha. Carlos, check it and took 15 minutes to figure it out, and 40 to fix it.

They are general mechanics and also have a welding shop right there, but they where very profesional, friendly and the price was fair. Recommended!

name: Car glass repair
description: Good guy repairs stars in windshields. Well done.

name: autoservicios el arbolito
description: General Mechanic workshop. Call armando taipe 0984694022

name: Itapoa
description: A nice place on the Malecon of Puerto Lopez.  The owner likes the idea to welcome overlanders on his place. Itapoa is a nice hostel with restaurant.

name: Sea Front
description:
Long beach with flat area. Only one house far away. Very quiet.
The waves are a little bit dangerous but we can fish. Wood for firepit.

name: Reserva Ecologica de la Laguna Cuicocha, Cuyapas
description: Free parking. Parking is at the entrance. Day use only: not allowed to camp here because there is an hospedaje. There's a walk called "Sendero de las Orquideas". 12.7km all around the laguna. It's possible to the see the islas better with a boat tour.

name: Puríssima Fábrica de Javico
description: You can pull right up in front, lots of space, and empty the purified drinking water big jugs into your tank. $1.25 per jug. (20liters each)

name: Organic cacao village
description:
Beautifull small village where you can get a real homemade chocolate.
You have to go straight to Patricio alvarado's house (just ask to anyone, everybody knows about him). Also he has tours (15usd) if you wanna see all the proces in his finca.
Pretty, non touristic.
maps.me doesnt show the road.
is ok with asfalt and a bit of dirtroad

Phone 0995265895

name: Private wild camp
description: Many sites nearby, this one is just 300 meters off the main road and out of sight from traffic. When the clouds cleared in the afternoon we had an amazing view of Cotopaxi. Good for any size vehicle. Claro 3G reception.

name: Papeleria
description: Can make photocopies here. 5 cents a page.

name: Fabrica de Chocolates La Paz
description: Cacao proccesing plant, La Paz. They have days for the process, so there is a risk you come and they are not working. Call in advance. 09 8196 6257

name: La Potranca
description: Nice restaurant with pool also hosteria where you can stay ! Also you can stay with your camper there is the place with green grass very big and nice overlooking the little town! Is it people are very friendly and open for Overlander’s

name: Larcachaca
description: Big flat space near the school and the community store. Amazing view of Cayambe Volcano and surrounding farming communities. Windy, calm until 4 am that buses begin to make noises. Very friendly people.

name: Hostería Alemana
description:
I added this place as established campground because the Hosteria Alemana is more than happy to welcome overlanders on their grassy parking lot (next to the hotel) with access to - - bathroom (clean / flush / with TP)
- hot showers 
- wifi (in the camping area only w/ extender)
- water with hose to fill up tank (potable)
- electricity 
and if you’re lucky the steam bath and jacuzzi is available as well to use (probably only on weekends)
But above all the super friendly welcome of Vinicio Morales (on of their employees) made our stay very enjoyable.
The place is in a secure area, to get in you need to find the bell „timbre #29“ in case there is no guard at the gate.

name: Hike up the Cotacachi
description:
Pretty complete hike up the mountain. It took me 5h15 up and down. The park guards will open the gate for you at 4am so you can drive all the way to the antena post up on the hill. It’s about 45 minutes drive, unpaved road and not in the greatest condition...
I asked the guard if I could check the weather in the computer they had, and he guaranteed me that it was going to be a clear morning. He was playing the -“Im a local and I know better that the internet”. Of course, right? Well, it was cloudy as * all the way up, and when I was already 2/3 up there I lost track and I ended up climbing (hanging on my hands) a couple of really sketchy rock walls over huge cliffs. I’m not sure how the actual trail is (if there’s any) but it gets quite hard at the end. It’s not a huge physical effort but it’s a very technical hike. If it’s a clear day maybe you can just walk half way up. It’s 4.000m on the antenas and 5.000m at the top. Watch out for the first hundred meters, since there are some deep holes among the grass and you could  break a leg. I believe the view at the top has to be epic... on a clear day... :(

name: Windshield (parabrisas) Repair
description: Very professional. He did not have a windshield for our car (VWT4) so he made one! First he removed the destroyed one, made a mould and shaped a new one. Was expensive but we needed it..

name: Primax - small museum
description: This Primax gas station has a pretty cool little museum of fuel station memorabilia. Old fashioned fuel pumps, oil cans, etc

name: Queso Cochapamba
description:
Here they produce (locally) and sell cheese. It is a family-owned business, the owners are very nice and their queso is very good.
Mozzarella, cheese with oregan or mortadella or ají...
3usd for 250g (probably more actually, the pieces are big)

name: Casa Cacique
description: Amazing spot in the bamboo palapa. Just on top of the hill right over the beach. Stunning view of the ocean. Ask the owners just on the other side of the road. It was Free for me, although I stayed 2 nights and I gave them 2 big fish that we did for dinner the second day. You can put your tent on the terrace of the big palapa, priceless. There’s bathrooms they’ll leave open for you and shower. You can probably use the kitchen as well. Lovely family, super recommended. They don’t have a price for this but it would be nice if you gave something in exchange

name: Pucara Tambo
description: Nice place with museum on the top of the mountain who is a great view over Riobamba They let you stay on the parking place and you can use the toilets of the restaurant! Also they have cabins was hot shower and private toilet and heater because at night it’s very cold! I think it’s good to phone when you want to stay there because when we come here nobody was at the place and we must go to town and search of the people Tel: 0984829262 Deisy your call and They will open the cabins and also  you can use the kitchen for cooking in the night ! Really highly recommend ! Very nice people

name: Chimborazo views easy entrance
description: We stayed here after finding the entrances to the other two nearby sites difficult to enter.  Easy access and great views.

name: Million service
description:
Here you can ask David for a personal boat (6 person max) at 100 USD just for watching whales or 150 USD also whales and going with your own lunch in desert island with birds, you can swim, there isnt any feeded turtle but some corail and few fish.
You just need 20 minuts to reach the place instead of more than an hour for isla la plata (with 16 people per boat). It's an another untouristic alternative for whales.

name: Las palmeras
description:
Nice hotel with Cabins where you can stay on the parking place and you have really nice view on the garden! In front of the parking place you have the toilet! We only come here to have lunch but you can perfectly stay ! They agreed do I have the campers in the garden ! There is also service of restaurant dinner and breakfast 
It’s a little bit expensive $15 per camper ! But very nice the stay here! Highly recommend !!

name: Hostería Oro Azul
description:
Very nice Hacienda with a big old house 110 years old where you can camp on the green flat grassy area around the house ! 
They will open a little room where you have a big bathroom where is hot watershower ! Sometimes they have events and so it’s better to call if you want to stay here : tel: 593 986085619 Marcelo Muñoz Very nice man who stays every time at the Hacienda and is very friendly!  15 $ for  camper

name: Forest lookout tower
description: Abandoned tower overlooking the valley. One of few places along the road to park. Narrow entry but we were able to park with our 7.4 mt truck camper.

name: Café Tabuga local growers
description: Great local coffee growers. You can buy directly from their tiny workshop. Best quality ever! Super nice people, the manager speaks English/French/Spanish

name: Bambú Steak House
description:
excellent steak house with generous portions. as a family of three, we had the tierra y mar parrillada for two, and we took 1/2 home.  in addition, the service was excellent.

appears to accept all major credit cards, as we were able to pay with Amex.

name: Hotel Kampak Wasi
description: Nice hotel, hot showers, very clean and big rooms, friendly staff, fast WiFi, comfortable beds, walking distance to main place with restaurants, open since 2018 so all new, secure parking behind gate, no height limit, gate is about 4 meters wide, 25USD per night

name: Home-made bread
description: This place sells home-made bread cooked in a wood oven. 7 breads for 1 dolar. Free coffee and the flour is made with the wheat from their own harvest. Also a good viewing point of the valley.

name: Laguna Cajas - 4x4 required
description:
Passing Laguna Santo Domingo. 4x4 required.
Middle of nowhere by yourself.
Didn’t want to drive further as I was alone, and we’re not supposed to camp over here.

name: Gravel Pit
description: Ended up here because of nightfall and fog. Its a big gravel pit and its still in use. But there are plenty of different leveled placed. Ok for one night.

name: Fabrica de Parabrisas - Cheap and made to mesure windscreen
description:
After a mango fell on our windscreen and broke it in Colombia we were desperate to find a new one before the police stopped us... The model (Chevrolet Express 2002) was impossible to find... In Bogota, Medellin, Pasto. Every time we spent a day searching for nothing. 

Eventually we found this vidrios that change your windscreen and do a replica of it. Maybe the simplest way after all... 
The cost was 210$ (seems to depend on the size) and we met a guy that came from Quito to change his because it is less  expensive and done quicker. The job is done in one day (we arrived there at 9 in the morning). 
Not really talkative people but they work well! 
We will put an other message if we encounter problems with it.
A good way to celebrate 1 year anniversary of France winning the world cup! 😁

name: Parking
description: There are 2 spots for parking. The price is $2 dollars per day, Nice option if you are traveling with your motorhome.

name: Naderik Hostal
description: Hotel close to the main square. Spacious and clean rooms. Wifi and hot water.15$ per night.

name: Kocsma Cafe
description:
Coordinates are not exact: from the main square walk down the steep road, it's on the left.
Excellent empanadas and juice, open early for breakfast. Recommended by local. 
Coffee I didn't try- tinto

name: Parking Tena Park
description:
Parking of the park, is very safe, all the night are rangers caring the park, security cameras, public toilet and WiFi from fire station.

Estacionamiento del parque Tena, es muy bonito y seguro, tiene guardias rondando 24/7, cámaras de seguridad, baños y wifi desde los bomberos.

Recomendado!

name: Lonely beautiful beach - Playa do Paraiso
description:
If you're looking for a lonely beach after all the touristy places here it is.
Take the road at the Jama gas station towards El Matal. At the bleached out sign which says Playa do Paraíso turn left and follow the road to the little village. where the road forks inside the village keep right and keep going.
The dirt road is a little rough in some parts but doable in any vehicle.

There is no real parking area at the beach and quite steep. No space to turn around for big rigs. The villagers in the area seem nice, the beach feels safe and is beautiful and totally deserted.
With a little effort, you probably could level out a small rig, or a tent and spend the night here.

name: Playa la Tiñosa
description:
Wild camping on the parking lot. Right on the mark is a little bit off the parking but 4x4 needed and high clearance for the last few hundred meters. The main parking is accesible with big rigs. 
Fishermen come in the morning for octopus. 
Actually if you want to camp in the most beautiful spot just put your tent on the very end of the beach, there is a flat spot about 5 meters above the ocean. Beautiful.

name: Hosteria Mario's Park
description:
Nice place along the road and on the beach with swimming pool and extensive outdoor area. 
20$ per night (apparently it is the price for low season...also I was there during the week) with breakfast, lunch and dinner included (well served in quantity and quality)

name: Hamburguesa /Choripan uruguayo
description:
yummy cheap hamburguer and choripan for 2,5 usd each (small portions but ink. glass of cola, couple of fries and a piece of banana).
Perfect for a snack or a small dinner. We had two to fill us up.

name: Quiet dead end
description:
This is a quiet alternative to the gas station on the main street.
Plastered area at the end of a dead end, street lights are on all night, rather poor neighborhood but feels safe and people are friendly. 
No amenities, only noise comes from river nearby, we didn't find an access to river, the neighbors have many animals (cows, pigs, geese, ducks, chicken, dogs).

A highlight is a white heron colony around 100m away! Don't miss hundreds of herons coming here and gathering in the trees for the night!

Best entrance to the street at the church, good for small rigs, big rig possible

Overall nice spot!

name: Amupakin
description: Nice place to park small campers or big rigs, you will get so close to the indigenous culture ,definitely some of the best of Ecuador.

name: Laguna Azul
description:
Beautiful free place in the nature, in a rural town outside the road! Low 2g signal.

Hermoso río en el que se forman dos piletas naturales de agua limpia Y fresca. Los locales vienen aquí a pasar el día. Durante la noche no queda nadie.

Preguntamos a la gente y nos dijeron que era seguro, y que cada tanto viene gente a acampar. Esto es parte de una “asociación de comerciantes”que los fines de semana venden comida y cerveza. La presidenta de la asociación (Maria del Cisne) vino al día siguiente para charlar y decirnos que nos podíamos quedar, que era seguro y que otros viajeros eran bienvenidos.

Para llegar hay que pasar por debajo del puente de la carretera, pasar el balneario La Colcha y continuar recto hasta un cartel que indica doblar a la izquierda. Desde la carretera no son más que 5 minutos.

El espacio de estacionamiento es grande, los ultimos 200 mts son de tierra nada complicado. Están trabajando para cercar el terreno y cerrarlo a la noche.

Durante el fin de semana hay baños porque va más gente al lugar 25 usd y hay algunas doñas cocinado. El domingo hay torneo de fútbol por eso más gente aún. En la semana esta tranquilismo!!!

Precio: gratis

name: La Caleta
description:
2 cabañas with double bed with shared bathroom 100m from the beach (you can hear the waves from the room!). Paid 10$ for 1 person without breakfast. 
They will soon also offer breakfast and food (salads, hamburgers, panne cook...). Quiet place with nice owners. 
Bikes can be parked safely inside.

name: Hostal Quinto Sol
description: Very great people in this area, and at this Hostel. I am a cyclist and was able to bring my bike in the room. Room for a couple vehicles, renting, good WiFi. I paid $12 for a night with breakfast included.

name: Pacha Calera taller
description: This is a women association that make artisanal jewels with natural products as tagua. They sell as well their production.

name: Sumak Muyu
description: It is a personal factory where the owner makes hammac. You can visit it for 2 $ (familly price). And buy hammac 8$ for baby 10$ for 1 person and 15$ for 2.

name: Kahala Restaurant - By Primax Gas Station
description:
Nice and new restaurant. They have a la cartes for 6,50-8. They also have regular “almuerzos”, if you ask for 3,50.
They also offer pizza and hamburgers for cheap. Nice stop.

name: In between the road and river
description: Nice flat grassy area. Close to the road, so it’s a little bit noisy. It’s also just next to the river. We stopped here, because we were driving from the sea level and approx. 2900 above the sea level was enough for us in one day and we didn’t want to go higher.

name: Luis Rodríguez
description:
Hardware store which sells also outdoor gear.
Gas canister (Campinggas and Coleman) for  9 us$
Adress: Genaral Torres 7-98

name: 4x4 and European Car Spezialist
description: He changed our cluch at the VWT4 Syncro.

name: Mindo forest coffee and tea
description: a nice place where you can enjoy a good coffee, cakes, tea, we also have coffee liqueur and so on.

name: BURRITO CHINGON
description:
Place to enjoy a delicious mexican food and at very good price, very nice and quiet place and decorated in Mexican style, excellent attention.

lugar para disfrutar de una deliciosa comida tipo mexicana y a muy buen precio, lugar muy agradable y tranquilo y decorado al estilo mexicano, excelente atención.

name: Ecolodge Azuluna
description:
Very good and clean Hotel with restaurant as well. We had a room with private bath and balcony on the 3rd floor with view to the sea. After negociacion (it was offseason ) we paid 35 $ per night without breakfast, felt very comfortable and stayed for 5 nights. Good place to relax.
The staff is very friendly an can help you to organize boat trips for the island or whale watching. We could even see some whales from our window. The beach is close (aprox. 400m)
They allowed us to eat our own food in the community area. In the village you have 2 pizza restautants and a bakery).
Highly recommended

name: Finca Heimatlos Eco-Lodge & Farm
description: Finca Heimatlos is an eco-lodge, restaurant, and sustainable farming project based on 50 hectares (123.5 acres) of pristine land right at the edge of the Amazon rainforest. Located near the small town of Canelos in Ecuador, the lodge lies at a distance of 27 km to Puyo, 88 km to Baños, and 277 km to Quito. The peaceful lodge, with its extraordinary rainforest views, is an ideal place to enjoy and explore the unique natural habitats of the Amazon.

name: Puerto Amistad
description: Ariosto is the guy! Go to the restaurant Puerto Amistad and ask him. He’s got a lot of adaptator. Expensive : 15$ for a 4l but it was our only option for a argentina bottle after looking in Manta and Montechristi

name: Taller Ayala Motos
description:
Taller Ayala Motos is a motorcycle workshop for several brands. Required a full service on our motorcycle, exchange of the oil, checking/exchange the brakes, exchange of the air filter, tightening the chain and adjust the alignment of the tyres.
The guys have been really quick and done a great job! On top they cleaned the bike. In total they charged 36 $USD. Definitely recommend this shop!

name: Ibarra Banco Pichincha - ATM with no fees
description:
Here we got money from the ATM without fees. 
Two other branches in town charged us US$ 4,48 fees.

name: Pensión Patricia
description: Small rooms, WiFi, hot water, bike storage, friendly owner named Miguel. $8

name: Hostal Le Rendez-Vous
description: Quiet, comfortable and beautiful place. 100m from the central place. Double with shared bathroom 28 usd per night, breakfast included. super breakfast, by the way... in nice garden. Best coffee we had since months, coming from the south! Wi-Fi ok. No television. Secure parking for one car. Max. height 2,40m.

name: La Casa de Rodrigo
description: Nice hostel in Baeza Colonial. We paid 30 USD for a matrimonial for 2 with bathroom. No breakfast, but kitchen. You can have breakfast at la casa de Gina, y beside. Fast Wi-Fi. Garage for 2 cars. Height 2.50m. Rodrigo is very welcoming. He also rents kayaks and knows a lot about the region.

name: Sofi Hotel
description: Recent hotel. Rooms are neat and bright. Matrimonial is 15USD for 2 persons. Bathroom, télévision, Wi-Fi. Secure parking for 2 vehicles. No height limit. No breakfast. No kitchen.

name: Free WiFi
description: free wifi. you can stay on this plaza for night. very quiet.

name: Laguna Pastaza
description: A nice lagoon on the way to la communidad shayari . A canoe ride costs 2 US. The walk to the lagoon is very romantic.

name: Tents wild camp
description:
Beside the road, flat area, almost completly hidden from the road. Dirt Hill and trees offer a wind protection. 
We can hear noise from the road. 
Only for tents. 
Not the best place but ok for one night and a good choice if it’s windy.

name: UPC (police station)
description: San Lorenzo. It is possible to camp next to the police station. Nice view over the beach and village. Shower, toilet and kitchen available.

name: Austro Gas
description: No need for adaptors for US bottles. Quick service on the corner of Avenida Loja and Avenida Don Bosco.

name: Tiestos Restaurant
description:
Excellent Ecuadorian restaurant with huge menu. It’s rather pricey with mains between $15-20 pp and starters/desserts around $10.
They also have 3 different tasting menus (each 5 courses with 2 glass if wine) for $80 for two persons 
Definitely one of the most delicious food we had in whole Central and South America. A real culinary treat if you’re willing to spend $35-50 per person

name: Taller Martin Moscoso
description: An English speaking mechanic who helped us when another nearby  seemed to rip us off. He was recommended to us by a Gringo network here in Cuenca. He's friendly, and judging by the number of vehicles in his workshop, very popular here. He used his diagnostic tool to check our vehicle and gave us peace of mind before sending us on our way, without charging anything.

name: Empanadas & Morocho Blanquita
description: Small restaurant with really cheap, good, and filling breakfasts! Range from $2.50-3.50. We got the desayuno blanquita for $3 and it came with morocho, empanada, juice, eggs any style, and fruit with yogurt.

name: Nice Campground
description:
Nice Campground next to river. They have a private lagoon for swimming. and a playground. You can also rent cabañas. The owner Carolina is very friendly and speaks Spanish, German and English. Price pP 8$. 
There is a high restriction at the gate 2.50m.

name: Residential Montufar
description: Nice little place in the center of the city. Good bed, warm sheets, quiet, hot shower, slow WiFi. They asked 16$ per person in single room, we negociated at 5$ per person in a three beds room with a little balcony above the park.

name: Hostal Escosie
description: Clean Hostal, warm shower, kitchen, good WiFi. 5$60 for a bed in a 4 beds room. Really close to the city center. Some of the rooms are not in the same building bit 30 meters away

name: mega clean
description:
Laundry at a good price.The small washing machine 3 dollars. The dryer 0.75.You can take your detergent or buy there.Mrs. Lupe is very kind!
---
Lavandería a buen precio.
La lavadora pequena 3 dólares. La secadora 0.75.
Puedes llevar tu detergente o comprar allí.
La senora Lupe es muy amable!!!

name: Hermosa plaza
description:
Large square; apparently safe and quiet to spend the night, very friendly neighbors.


Gran plaza; aparentemente segura y tranquila para pasar la noche, vecinos muy amigables.

name: The Pub's Garden
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place has not been overlander verified. Please confirm details

I wrote a few lines about this in "The pub- Cervecería" place. We haven't been camping there but Shaun, one of the owner told us he would be super happy to receive overlanders in their garden! They could probably use internet, the bathrooms, make a fire... as long as you like beer! (they probably won't ask for any contribution, but as always have a beer or two to thanks them)
As we didn't move there due to mechanical issues, I don't actually know what the facility are, where the entrance is etc... but I am sure that they are really nice people so please update when you get there!

(they are closed on Sunday and Monday, and opened every other day from 5pm. Don't know if they live there)

name: Kamak maki Centro Kichua
description:
A very interesting place which combines  medicinal plants, museum, animals , souvenirs and ceremony ayahuaska. A shaman explains a lot on the tour. The place itself is  on the river Napo. Beautiful
Volunteers are welcome.
Official prices are high but can be negotiated.
Tours can be arranged. I just looked around
Whatsapp contact of the shaman is + 593984577883 He will give you detailed information

name: Cuban Workshop
description: We arrive for a recommendation of a escarabajo store, they are so nice and good team of mechanical, the kombi be fixed so fast and with a lot of knowledge of the car we are tankful for the food work of “el rapido”

name: Tiyu yaku
description:
Kichwa women who make very striking ceramics. Ask at the entrance to the football stadium at the road to be guided to their place. The finca of this communidad is special, too. 
Recommended!

name: O'Caravana Overlanders
description:
At this place you can stay with a small family originally from Argentina but they are living already 15 years in Montañita. They have a big ground with their house and now they are welcoming overlanders of all kind! Lucas and Flor are super nice hosts and help you with everything you need! The ground is huge and there is no hight restriction. They have a kitchen to use and bathroom with warm water. WiFi included. You can also plug to 110 and they are planning to install a 220 as well. The location is close enough to the town and far enough from the noises! 5us$ per person or 8us$ for two people per night and kids pay half price! 
You can contact Lucas directly by WhatsApp +593 99-470-3832.

name: Kawasaki
description: Carlos the owner takes care of all the bikes of the police, he knows what he's doing. Very honest guy, took care of my b.m.w.

name: mountain hideaway
description: Quiet dirt road off the highway with semi flat grassy spots. The road follows a nice big creek for water. Lots of flowers growing here and gorgeous views. Google fi signal. Recommend it!

name: Laguna Chiriacu
description:
Good alternative to the laguna Caricocha. At Satuday evening we found firepits with lot of garbage and noisy people
It s forbiden to sleep at the laguna but flat area at the entrance 
The road is bumpy, better with high clearance but we saw some normal véhicule.

Quiet and cold night

name: Hotel Don Guimo
description: Nice place, really clean, lots of rooms, working WiFi, nice staff. They started by proposing 12$ for a single including breakfast, then 8$ without breakfast and I negociated to 5$.

name: Bookstore second hand Mauricio
description:
Another library with international Books (english, german, italian...) 
Few novels in French when we were there, but many different treatises
Peu de romans en Français quand nous y étions, mais beaucoup de traités divers

name: Licores la Casa Salinera
description: Small shop with local liquors that you can sample. Some of the flavors were chocolate, coffee, maracuya, lemon, orange and some more. Prices range from $2.50 to around $10.00. Súper good! Definitely recommend!

name: Hostal Backpackers
description: Little hostel in the center of Chugchilan. Maria, the owner, is very kind and take good care of her guests. She brought us to her field. We paid 10 USD for 2 persons and we get a big room. Hot shower. Terrasse with nice view.

name: Quiet lake spot
description: Nice quiet spot outside od the craziness of Banos. On the way to Casa de Árbol. Small pond with friendly ducks, two swings, and space for big and small rigs out of sight of the road. A little road noise but quiet at night.

name: Camping La Costa
description: Great campground. It has strong WiFi, clean kitchen, fire pits, hammocks, and hot water. The campground has tents but guests can bring their own tents with a bit discount.

name: Bosquefrut
description:
It is a food forest, or fruit orchard with many species, sustainable, of 28,000 square meters, with facilities for camping, rooms, ecological pool, poses with fish, more than 700 meters of trails through the forest, in the house there is kitchen and Outdoor dining, Internet and other services.
The host, Manuel, is a very helpful and friendly person, excellent chef.

name: mototech
description:
Jorge Is a very professional motorbikes mechanic, but he knows cars and builds airplanes too (!!)
very calm and helpful.

name: Loco Asado
description: "inofficial" campsite at a restaurant. Actually, you camp inside the restaurant. Good food, nice owner. Lot of people already camped here, especially downhill bikers. Price is 5$ pp. Good place to stop on the way to Cuenca.

name: Guesthouse Above Ttienda
description: Not very clean or nice. Had to stay here for one night because the other Hospedaje was closed. The owner wanted 10pp, which is by far too much for what you get. Try to negotiate him down. Best to avoid this Hospedaje/Town and look for a wildcamp.

name: Panaderia/cafeteria Taita
description: A small bakery/cafe with delicious pastries. They also serve coffee, fruit smoothie, cakes and bread. Cool atmosphere and service. Up to French quality.

name: Museo Archeologico Salango
description: A well laid  out museum of the different periods of archaeology, also a renovated old house. Worth seeing

name: Petroecuador
description:
Service station, only has a schedule of care from 07:00 to 17:00, but you can park and spend the night, there is access to bathrooms and showers, restaurant next door.

estacion de servicio, solo tiene horario de atención de 07:00 a 17:00, pero se puede estacionar y pasar la noche, hay acceso a baños y duchas,restaurante al lado.

name: Hostal Maria Princesa
description:
Nice Hostal with double rooms with private bathroom and also a dormitory. 
Nice kitchen, very clean. Everything very clean. 
Good wifi. 
Friendly owner. 
(Price dormbed 01-2024, 8 dollars per person)

name: Tienda Cafe
description: Nice little Cafe with good Breakfast. Had Yucca Waffles and scrambled eggs with coffee and juice for $5. Cakes look pretty decent.

name: Fire Department Tulcan
description:
It´s a safe place for overnight. The crew was very friendly with us. We are travelling on a bicycle and they have space for it. The place for sleep is inside and you can use the restrooms. 
You need a very good sleeping bag because the night is very cold. 
Water is potable.

name: Casa Hospedaje Juan Pablo II
description:
You can get a great view for the landscape, it´s a good place for overnight. You can go to the warm water pool and enjoy the visit at Gruta de la Paz. The price for the room is $8, there are restrooms and the water is cold. 

If you have your own tent, you can camp in the ground. We paid $3 for 2 night 2 people.

name: Near cascada del amor, restaurant parking
description:
Going to Mindo, we sleep here in the restaurant parking. Nobody here and the restaurant was closed. Quiet night. For all type campingcar.

En allant direction Mindo, nous avons dormi dans ce parking pour la nuit. Le restaurant était fermé. Il y a une petite cascade pas loin que les gens vont voir. Nuit tranquille! Adapté à tout type de véhicules.

name: Calem Hotel
