description: Hotel seems new. Rooms and everything very clean. Wifi ok but slow. Safe Parking for a car or two motorcycles. Paid 30 via booking for matrimonial with breakfast.

name: Balneario Las Tilapias
description: At the dirt road from Portovelo to Guayquichuma, overlooking Rio Ambacolas, this public balneario is a nice place to enjoy a few relaxing days. Free. The locals swim in the river, which looks fairly clean. The restaurant serves delicious Tilapias directly out of their own fish pond (8US$). Some families on weekends, very quiet during the night.

name: View Lago and vulcano
description: Beautiful Mirador for Vulcano and lake! Definitely worth a quick stop!

name: Residencia Amazonia
description: The cheapest in town, 5$ for a single, 8$ for a double. Quite noisy, not very clean, cold water. For low budget travelers.

name: Uluwatu Bar
description: Awesome mojitos and other cocktails for a super fair price! Carlo is a super friendly guy and great bartender. Passion fruit mojito was my favorite. He also makes delicious fresh juices for those looking for something non-alcoholic. There are a few food stands and restaurants around here right next to the lighthouse parking lot.

name: Last minute camp
description: After spending more than 2 hours in a traffic jam we decided to stop and try to find a place to stay since it was already night. We went exploring the roads around but didn't find anything great, a levelled spot in the corner of a dirt  road is the best we've got. We could park the rig on the side in order not to block the road but didn't see anyone passing anyway. Extremely quiet, you can only hear birds singing and a river flowing; also it's full of fireflies. Tents and bikes can find a better spot a bit further on this road by an abandoned house. Bigger rigs might have troubles turning around on this road.

name: Marisqueria Punta de Piedra
description: Angela is a lovely lady who serves excellent homemade dishes (Fresh fish and seafood). It's right by the sea so the view is amazing. It was the only place open when we were there (weekday) so we were very lucky to discover it. Rustic and we had to wait a little bit because she prepared our dishes on the spot, but it was totally worth it!

name: My bar on the beach
description:
Daily menu for 3.75. We were served a shrimp soup as a starter and then fried fish with rice salad and platano, and lemonade. excellent food! They accept credit cards but they charge an extra 10%. Fast WiFi: saltamonte. Showers for $1. Toilet free for costumers. 

PS: along this road you'll find one restaurant next to other. almost 2kms of options.

name: El Malecon
description: Beautiful place by the river. Free WiFi all along. There's a fair, a shopping mall, an attractions park (where you'll find La Perla), a food court and some restaurants. Police is all over the place. Don't miss it!

name: bridgestone
description:
Good job if you have to change pneumaticos!

On a acheté et changé 2 nouveaux pneus. Super professionnels et très bon travail!

name: Terpel gas station
description: it was late so we decided to sleep here. we asked to the staff and it was no problem. 24 hs, clean bathrooms, potable water only in the tap close to the pumps. free

name: orchidarium
description: Very interesting place. Edgar Guerrero runs this orchidarium in his own property. He grown a little forest with 120 orchid species. It took him 20 years to made it. He also has some fossil found inside the property to show you. It costs 2$. Edgar contact: +593984079953

name: Taita-Pacha
description: Beautiful community based cabañas. A lot of recycled material has been used for construction. Good rooms, some with a fireplace. Excellent bathrooms with proper hot water (not electric!). On-site restaurant with a charcoal grill and good food. WiFi available. Camping also possible for 5$ pppn. Rooms are 15$ pppn. Recommended! +593989621373 or +593969157896 for inquiries.

name: Ovejeria
description:
This is an official campground ($3pp) under trees, you can check in and register at the office nearby and choose which camping site to go to. 

No amenities if you stay between the trees (but an amazing view of the Cotopaxi), but it's not too far to walk to the toilets and other amenities at the office (Wifi there too!)

name: Wayki Hostel
description:
Cheap hostel clean toilet and good hot showers. 5$ for dorm, 10$ for private.
kitchen is ok, bit dirty. Good wifi. Recommendable for the price. good.

name: Casarte Taller de Diseño Artesanal
description:
CasArte, is a workshop of art, crafts and handmade design products such as: personalized figures, fountains, waterfalls and therapeutic water grottos against stress, decorated tiles and other personalized gifts embodied in cold porcelain, ceramic, wood, etc. ... that in the end become unique, special gifts that go beyond a common world of gifts, according to the taste and satisfaction of our customers.
______
CasArte,   es un taller de arte, artesanías y de productos de diseño hechos a mano como:  figuras personalizadas, fuentes, cascadas y grutas de agua terapéuticas contra el stress, tejas decoradas y demás  obsequios  personalizados  plasmados en porcelana fría, ceràmica, madera, etc... que al final se convierten en regalos únicos, especiales que van más allá de un mundo común de regalos,  acordes al gusto y satisfacciòn de nuestros clientes.

name: Armed Robbers
description: Armed robbers active on this secondary road close to the border with Peru. I was cycling and two guys with a gun stopped in front of me, one jumped of the motor and ran towards me. I could turn around and outpaced him. There were a couple of cars coming and off they went, I was extremely lucky. A pickup truck brought me to the main highway and told me about a gang in the area of about 14 Ecuadorians. Be careful here and stick on the main road...

name: Parque Infantil
description: The west side of the "parque infantil" is free to park. the other sides of the park are blue zone, so you have to pay. it felt safe. quiet at night, during the day a lot of people and movement. you can buy the stuff you need arond the place. it seems there was free wifi at the park, but we didn't try. toilets 0,15. and you can fill your water tanks with drinking water, we asked it to a worker who was watering the grass. grassy zone for dogs and children stuff and swings in the park. Riobamba is not the very big thing, but this park is OK if you have to go there for some reason. 10min to the center.

name: Macuchi
description: We parked at left side of the church, close to a futbol/basketball field and a former school. The place is super quiet, and peaceful. We arrived at night and couldn't see too much around, but in the morning was a amazing surprise, the landscape is beautiful, plenty of flowers. there is a flat area enough for 2-3 vehicles, ok for big rigs. a lot of grasy area, perfect for dogs ands kids. it is 100m far from the main road. we were almost alone, in the morning came two super friendly locals, we spoke with them and they gave some tips about Quilotoa and other places. higly recomended. no services. free.

name: Quinta Horse
description: Quinta Horse is a terraced property on a hillside overlooking Ibarra. We are the first overlanders to stay here. Carlos, the owner, wants to welcome more overlanders to stay here. I’ll add that he and his family are very hospitable and kind. They are a great resource for anything you may need in the city as well. The property is gated and secure. The entrance gate is wide and tall (3.5+ meters). Just about any rig will fit. Once inside the gate the driveway is very steep but is maintained and has plenty of traction. As of right now there is a toilet, sink, and small bar area (with electrical outlets, sink, fridge) at the bottom of the property. No shower. But there is a water tap with potable water. WiFi is available near the house at the top of the property. There are 3 friendly little dogs. Don’t leave anything laying around or it will become their toy. There is bus service that goes by the property or there are plenty of taxis at the bottom of the hill. It’s about a 20 minute walk down. The view here is great! Contact Carlos at +593939350544

name: botanical garden
description: well executed and pretty botanical garden. get given a card with a map and explanations of the diverse systems at the entrance, in Spanish or English. $3.50 entrance for adults. good place to learn more about the diverse ecosystems in Ecuador and to relax in the city.

name: Cheap AND Delicious Traditional Food
description: Full of locals and for good reason! Absolutely yummy. $4 for meal of the day - soup, meal, drink and a dessert (it was just a peach slice lol) but you can choose between two options for soup and meal! We tried both chicken and ceviche and they were great. Also the coconut juice was AMAZING.

name: Tour De Café
description: Attached to this cafe is an exhibition plantation of coffee from tree to cup. Lots of interesting information as you prepare, roast and grind beans for your own cup of coffee.

name: La Casita De La Isla
description:
Calm and chillin hostel in San Cristobal. Outside a bit old but everything is spotless inside. 8 min walk from downtown. Considering here is Galapagos, fast wifi and hot shower, big kitchen. Family owned hostel, all staff s are friendly and helpful.

40$(1night)for Double room. We stayed 6nights and get discounted. Strongly recommended

name: Petroecuador
description: Nice gas station on the road to Pedernales. You can fill your water tank too. Free.

name: Fruits and Coffee - Great breakfast!
description: $4 for coffee, toast, scrambled eggs (with option for ham or salami), fresh fruit juice, and a bowl of fruits. Our favorite spot for breakfast! Everything is yummy and fresh (See pic)

name: Hosteria Ñungañan
description:
Stay over close to the street with multiple options to spent some extra time. Part of this estate is a laguna, multiple fruit trees, a swimming pool close to the river. Currently they are building (additional) rooms to stay in and they have a restaurant.

Although they didn’t expect any campers, the toilets were very clean and equipped with soap and toilet paper. Showers a little sand, but otherwise also clean.

Big rig friendly, options to park in the level parking lot, nice common area.
USD 3 pppn.

name: Nice Restaurant el fordon ardiente
description: On our way to the cost we had lunch here. Lentils soup with tuna pasta (served quickly). Very nice women and extremely clean bathroom. USD 3 per dish incl. juice

name: El Tio - Reception
description: This is the reception for El Tio hostal/cabañas listed on iOverlander, a little bit south from here. Go here first.

name: Cruce Fronterizo Lalamor
description: We arrived late in the afternoon so we asked if we could sleep here, and they said yes. They said it is safer here than in the other side. Very quiet. --- Llegamos casi en la noche por lo que preguntamos si podíamos dormir aquí, y nos dijeron que sí, y que es más seguro que en el  otro lado. Muy tranquilo.

name: Old Town / mawka llakta / Cemetery
description: from oyacachi is a good dirt road here to. you have to get your car registered and you have to pay 1$pp leaving oyacachi. here are two restored old houses of the old village, baños and on the other side of the road the cemetery and ruin of the church. you can walk along the river aswell.

name: Aeropuerto Quito
description: parking zone E and F are for staying over night. 24h cost 7$,  1h is 2$, 15min are free. but do not (!) enter at the busline- than it is expensive. there a security cameras and the guards said it is safe to stay overnight. baños, wifi at the airport.

name: Mitad del Mundo: East Parking  Lot
description: as the spot nearby is directly at the street we parked here overnight (friday). they lock the gate at night. we had talked to the guard in advance. we were alone here and the noise of the street died down at night. it was free.  we visited mitad del mundo next day (5$ adults //2,50$ seniors).

name: sportsarea with roof
description: it is a small village. we asked the locals were to stay overnight and they told us to park under the roof directly on the sportsarea. there is light at night and not so much sand when windy. potable water tap is at the churchplace and long time not used toilets. no claro reception.

name: Mercado Supermaxi y Todohogar
description:
Great clean supermarket , you find all you need
Free WIFI. It is entered by filling out a form. --- WiFi gratis. Se ingresa llenando un formulario.

name: Parque de Caranqui
description: It is a park with a wide, beautiful, pleasant road and has many trees but none gives enough shade to cover the car. It is quiet, safe, quite bright at night and the people around are friendly. The WiFi network does not work. --- Es un parque con una vía amplia, bonito, agradable y tiene muchos árboles pero ninguno da sombra suficiente para cubrir el carro. Es tranquilo, seguro, bastante iluminado en la noche y la gente alrededor es amable. La red WiFi no funciona.

name: Parque Francisco Calderón
description: A large park, with good space to park. Quiet and safe. WiFi network is not working. One street is public baths at a cost and a health center with free public baths. It is a sector with a lot of art, the parks are beautiful and you have sculptures carved in wood. There are many art shops around.

name: Barrio 11 de noviembre
description: probably the best spot in Los Andes, beautiful volcanos. view, safe place nice people, you can spend several nights in this place.

name: Old gas station
description: After crossing the border from Colombia to Ecaudor late in the day, we found ourselves searching for a place to sleep in the dark. The 2 operating gas stations before this stop wouldn't let us park overnight. We drove 10 minutes up the road and found an old abandoned gas station with a huge lot to park. Directly past the El Gran Pionero Restaurante. Level ground and plenty of room for big rigs. We were surprised at the view when we woke up. The restaurant next door has wifi and was open until 9pm. We didn't eat or use wifi because we were exhausted. Only disadvantage was the 2 baking dogs that live on the roof of the restaurant.

name: Primax petrol station
description:
24 hr petrol station. Has shower and toilets. Free. Alright to spend one night. 
Restaurant in front street.

name: Tonsupa
description:
Free spot beach front, we ask with the local people and said is very safe here. Police comes and said the same. Food tents good and cheap. The beach is good.

Estacionamiento gratis frente al mar, hablamos con la gente y es bien tranquilo y seguro. La playa está buena.

name: AudioPro
description: Great music shop, mainly guitars. But if one chord brakes, this is the place to go! The guy plays the guitar like a pro and gave out kids a lesson of electric guitar! Highly recommended.

name: Sea Lion
description:
Good food, friendly family. Away from the Malecon = quiet and not that busy. 
Almuerzo (5$ pp) and desayuno.

name: Free showers and toilets at the beach
description: Good place to have a shower after swimming/snorkelling. Right at the "Malecon“ Cuna del Sol.

name: Tour agency Eco Fishing
description:
We did the 360 degree tour with those guys: motivated guides, nice staff and good equipment. Well organised they take care of you during your trip. Plenty of snacks and a proper almuerzo. 
The tour is defiantly worth the 150$ we payed.

name: Williams Multicervicios
description: William is a great guy who helped us fix our problem with a temperature sensor. It was a fair deal (40$ for 1,5day of work!)

name: Lago en "La vuelta de la paloma"
description: This place is not safe. People of Ibarra tell us that it is a dangerous place where serious crimes are committed. Do not sleep here.

name: Complejo Arqueológico Florida "Mayo Chinchipe"
description:
This place is 10 km to Palanda. The guide, Jorge, is very kind, he invited us to stay the night here. The place is near to the river. There are bathrooms, without showers, open 24 hrs and energy. All free.

A 10 km de Palanda se encuentran estás ruinas denominadas "Santa Ana" de la cultura Mayo Chinchipe. El guía del lugar, Jorge, nos atendió muy amablemente y nos dijo que podíamos quedarnos a la noche si lo deseabamos. El lugar se encuentra a la orilla de un rio. Hay baños, sin duchas, que estan abiertos las 24 hrs. Energía, a la cual nos conectamos. Todo gratis!!

name: Agapantos Termas Parking
description: here is the parking (not for real big rigs, fine for our sprinter camper van) for termas agapantos- which are the cheaper ones for 3.50$pp/2$seniors. across the street are the termas: two swimming pools about 33 degrees water temperature. hosteria durian termas cost 8$pp (no reduction for foreign seniors).

name: Casitas de colores
description: Beautiful little town with graffitis and different colors. Worth the stop and you can park in this spot, in front of the school. Definitely worth the stop!

name: Centro Recreativo Santa Rosa
description:
It is a communal park with a soccer field 5, a children's park and an exercise room for adults. It has running water to recharge the tanks and a large parking lot. We didn't sleep, but we filled our water tank and the children enjoyed the square. We asked and they told us that the town was quiet and you could park here.

Es un parque comunal con cancha de fútbol 5, parque de niños y plaza de ejercicios para adultos. 
Tiene agua corriente para recargar los tanques y un gran estacionamiento. 
No nos quedamos a dormir, pero rellenamos nuestro tanque de agua y los niños disfrutaron la plaza. Preguntamos y nos dijeron que el pueblo era tranquilo y se podía parquear aquí.

name: Tonny mechanic
description: really nice owner Tony. we arrived late and he let us sleep inside, there are toilet, shower, wifi. next day he fixed our problem with wheel. he had a lot of workers and good equipment. it was really cheap. recommended.

name: Little waterfall near the road
description: A basic pull out approx 15m away from the road on a corner with a small waterfall and pretty knee deep pool for washing. Not completely hidden from the road, but not a lot of traffic and safe.

name: Police Checkpoint
description:
Police checkpoint at entrance to town near gas station. Police looking for a reason to issue a citation, wanting a quick settlement instead of the complicated and expensive official route. Asked about tyres, but settled on polarised windows being an offence. It isn't, at least not for foreign-plated vehicles, so hold your ground and after the usual intimidation techniques, they will back off. Do check all is in order before passing through here, don't give them an actual reason! 
Police # mae-1113

name: Villamil Playas, Beach campsite
description:
Campsite, 200 meters from the beach, shower, toilet, washbasin, water connection, electricity 110 V, possibility of horse riding, public transport in the city, 1,5 km from the supermarket, outings in the area (also by public transport too to reach)
for campers and tents
pleas, reservacion: manuel.amarillo@hotmail.com
WhatsApp +593 989902291

name: Kustom Pro
description: Professional 4x4 Mechanic in Manta. We needed to repair our rear steel bumper. And they repaired perfectly. Wifi is available.

name: Hostal Alcalá
description:
This will be soon the next “Casa de Ciclistas” in Lumbaqui.

Darwin (the owner) lets you camp inside the hostel. His family is so nice and kind.

name: Master shaper / Surf board repair
description:
We got here recommended by a friend who built his own surf board with Victor. He repair our board for an excellent price and make and awesome work!!

I would really really recommend him! 
He also makes custom made boards and really know what he's doing.

You can call ahead or just show up, he is ussually there. 

VICTOR GARCIA
Master Shaper 
0994842426
vicgarmanglar@hotmail.com
*he also has a facebook page where you can look his work.

name: nice, clean and very good food
description: Really nice place to have Ecuadorian food. Nice view of the beautiful landscape. Very clean and neat! There are clean toilets with water and paper. The dishes are between $2 and $2,75. Recommendable!

name: Infocentro - free internet
description:
Infocentro - it's a place that belongs to the government with computers and other free services. No WiFi, just internet on computers but it's free! Almost every town has its own infocentro. I've seen many along the roads. Find or ask for one in the town/city you visit.
Not sure the coordinates are exact.

name: very good and cheap food!
description:
Soup + main + juice + banana + avocado + sweets = $2,50 . delicious!

Excellent attention, really nice people. also clean.

name: Estação de Combustível e Café
description:
Fuel and Coffee Station open until 22:30. 24 hour security to sleep and rest ... Clean place, Mini Market, Ambient Music and Bathrooms ...

Estação de Combustível e Café com funcionamento até às 22:30. Segurança 24h para dormir e descansar... Local limpo, Mini Mercado, Música Ambiente e Banheiros...

name: Informes turísticos
description: This is a good place next to informes turísticos de Baños, there is a toilet next and water! Is necessary to talk with people the informes.We talked with Stela, and she was very lovely!

name: Bus stop for casa del árbol
description: This is the bus stop for going up to la casa del árbol. We were told the road was quite steep and didn’t want to take chances. The ride is 1$ per person. The departure times are 5:45, 11:00, 13:00, 14:15, 16:00.

name: Next to El Faro Bar Restaurant
description: We parked here due to the height clearance of the mall. It got late so we decided to sleep over, we asked the guard of the restaurant if it was fine and he said not to worry since there’s always security 24/7. It’s a flat street and the next morning we went to the free museum down on the main road (signaled in iOverlander)

name: Hostal Mochiliers
description: Great Hostel in a lovely old building with friendly staff. Room with 2 single beds is $15. Shared bathrooms. They let us park our motorcycles inside (big bikes may not fit). Showers are the electric type, and they're hot. Big kitchen and great chill areas. Close to everything. Highly recommended.

name: Pet's Health clinica veterinaria
description: Great veterinary, took our dog here because she was losing weight. He was very friendly and cheap. Our dog had a respiratory infection so he gave her a shot and antibiotics. $10 in and out in 30 minutes. He didn't speak English but was very patient with us.

name: Casa Las Mantas
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.  

Beautiful houses for rent. Complete small kitchen, hot water and almost private beach. Maximum 4 people in each house. More info +593984633918

It is a very quiet place ideal for those looking to disconnect from the city. You can hear the sea... The birds, the sound of the wind. 

The houses that we rent are in this case for travelers looking for a quiet place surrounded by a lot of nature who want to make a stop on their trip and be comfortable for some time in a small house. 

The beaches are almost private and the nice thing is that we are next to a town, so you can walk to the other side where the beaches are free of construction and you only find the sea, stones and sand. Here in these beaches you can practice kitesurfing in season from April to December. And the rest of the year 10 minutes away there are beaches where you can surf.

At 20 minutes there is a nice path in the humid forest where you can see howler monkeys.

To get here we would like to be notified before. Prices vary according to the season, the number of people and the nights they stay. But they go approximately between 15/22 per person.

name: Estación de bomberos
description:
We grabbed the night of the road to El Coca, and we asked in this bomber station if we could pass the night and watched us say so.
Quiet area al costado de la ruta. --- Nos agarró la noche de camino a El Coca, y preguntamos en esta estación de bomberos si podríamos pasar la noche y enseguida nos dijeron que si.
Zona tranquila al costado de la ruta.

name: Ride - moto and bike accessories shop
description: ok selection of stuff here but it's expensive.

name: Mechanico
description: Taller Tiwinza. Super professional and helpful mechanic, who figured out the problem and helped us right away. He was also honest about one thing he couldn't fix because of the lack of spare parts for our rare old VW. Great general check up + work for a super fair price.

name: old road
description: Quiet place in a curve. It's the old road near a river. Seems closed but access possible.

name: Matambre - very (!) good barbecue
description: We met an incredible friendly local who took us to this place. We had two plates with awesome meat (local farming) vegetables and platanos. Sooo good. Highly recommend.

name: Free showers! Masgas Gasstation.
description: Simple, good, free. Cold showers. Ladies/gents separated.

name: Corrupted police
description: We were stopped by police and they asked us USD 900 because of our small windshield crack. They negotiated the fine USD 900-500-300-180. We paid nothing at last but spent almost 1hr on the road. Bad ending in Ecuador.

name: Riverside
description:
Not far off the main highway as you are going south to Cuenca. Small piece of public land right after a bridge next to a river. Stayed one peaceful night here. Bring a garbage bag to collect what garbage the locals leave here and set a good example. 
The entrance has two trees which you must drive under with about a 4-meter height clearance.

name: Gasolineira Rocoil
description: We stayed here for one night , the staff is very friendly! The night was quiet, only noisy of the road!

name: Gustavo Tours
description: Gustavo Tours (no sign). We payed 100 US$ for snorkling (diving was 150 US$) at the Kickers Rock/Léon Dormido. One guide for the four divers, one for us two snorklers. The equipment looked almost new. Everything just perfect, unfortunately they did not send the videos/fotos as promised.

name: Cochasquí Camping
description:
i was sure there was an ioverlander spot in february2019 when we came first time. but it has disapoeared: this is the official camping to the arqueological site. if your camper is bigger than our sprinter van you can stay at the parking area which is uneven. 
free, sometime claro reception, not clean baños, the better ones are just above at the entrance to the pyramids. great view (not in february).

name: el resbajon
description: typical traditional  food for the region ,one meal very tasty  pork, corn, potatoes. the 3$ plate was already plenty

name: Vegetarian & Vegan El Funky Sauce
description:
Looks like a great restaurant, we passed by and it smelled really good but we already ate... would’ve loved to try it, looks really nice! 
And Friday to Sunday they at noon as well

name: Hotel bajo del sol
description:
Really nice hotel, pool, parking for one medium rig or plenty of bikes. But I would say parking outside would be safe anyway. Really nice rooms, comfy beds, such a change from Peru! I paid $12 and got a free beer. That was for one person in a triple room. It's off season though so I expect the rate to be higher later in the year.

Lady down the road serves food or take away, had a nice prawn curry for 2.50.

name: Safe, any size rig, parking
description:
Gated, secure parking lot for the Hilton, central to many fun areas of town.   They permitted me to sleep in my van overnight when I asked them respectfully.  Was a nice easy night to enjoy the city, where it can be difficult to find accommodation to stay in your rig. 

For a full day $15, less for just a night.

name: Fuel Station 24h PetroEcuador
description: We asked to spend the night and they said "ok!" So we are here. toilets not the best, friendly people 24h gas station, good for sleep nothing more. Flat area, fits everyone.

name: MundoCross
description: Very friendly and helpful shop and mechanic. Has many parts for many Motos. Found 15W fork oil here.

name: Reserva Chimbarazo
description: Gate opening hours only until 2pm. This is the start of the road to the refugio. Motos can park here, but aren't allowed further up. Any other vehicle can drive up.

name: Cascadas Del Milagro
description:
Perfect place to stay!
The owner is a overlander friendly.
We stayed here one week.
The place has beautiful waterfalls, picnic area, bathrooms and restaurant on weekend.
The owner provide to us energy, water (clean from the waterfalls) and internet.
We stayed here for free, but the entrance is only 1,5 dolar per day.

Local perfecto!
El dueño le gusta mucho a los viajeros.
Nos quedamos una semana.
El local tiene cascadas, área de picnic, Baños y restaurante (final de semana).
No pagamos para se quedar pero el precio es solo 1,5 dólar por día.

Lugar perfeito para viajantes.
O dono gosta de viajantes e é uma incrível pessoa.
Ficamos uma semana.
É um local com cachoeiras, área para lazer, banheiros, vestiários e restaurante.
Energia, água mineral (diretamente da cachoeira) e internet disponível.
Nós não pagamos para ficar porém a entrada custa apenas 1,5 dólar.

name: Reparando suenos
description: Rafael's a phenomenal guy. Very predisposed to help travelers. He knows a lot about mechanics. Plus he allows you to stay there.

name: Lá Cabana Carmita
description: This little place has the best food I have ever ate in Ecuador so far. We had a garlic shrimp, Corvina fish and Rice and Shrimp. All very tasteful at a great price. By Sao Mateo Beach.

name: La Cabaña del Corviche
description:
A lovely restaurant serving a variety of meals, but most importantly, corviche.
Corviche is unique to Ecuador and it’s delicious! It’s pretty much cooked and raw plantain made into a type of dough, stuffed with seafood (generally tuna or shrimp and peanut paste), rolled into a ball and deep-fried until nice and golden brown

name: El Otavaleño market
description: Great fruit and veggies market, super fresh and great little store/market. Highly recommended!

name: Pizzeria Siciliana
description:
Best pizza in Ecuador! 
If you miss a good italian pizza, this is the place to go. The size in relation with the prize and the taste is very good. The restaurant is very cozy! 
The staff is great and they have wifi.

name: Moto Coffee & Il Buscone pizzeria
description: A really nice cafe and pizzeria owned by moto and overland enthusiasts, Eric and Massimiliano. We just came in for coffee and cake but the pizzas looked sooooo good!

name: radiator and exhaust shop
description: Fixed our snapped exhaust by welding it together for $10 USD, very helpful, attended to us straight away and did a good job.

name: free parking Infront of Nice park
description: Stayed here for 1 night, security said it was fine! We parked at the end of the parking lot and didn't get disturbed. There's people walking through the park during the day but quiet at night. Potable water available in the park and clean toilets available for free open 6am to 6pm. Probably the nicest street parking we've done in a city for a long time. Would reccomend. Normal sized car parks so maybe not suitable for big rigs.

name: Good hairdresser
description:
If you're looking for a hairdresser while your car is getting fixed than this is the place! Got my hair dyed darker and cut for $40USD the owner takes pride in her work and took her time to make sure it was exactly what I wanted. Very lovely owner and would reccomend.

Cel: 0998462572

name: Best spot to camp
description:
This spot is used as a parking lot on weekends  but still enough room to park if not there is a similar spot again if you go up the drive way. It is about 100m from the lake. We had a small fire and no one bothered us for the 3 days we were here. Trees block out the wind so probably one of the least windy spots in the town. Also spots to put tents and any size rig can fit
 Please bring some food for the dogs if you can, they are all friendly and hungry.

name: Corrupt Police
description: Stopped by corrupt police for not having reflective triangles posted on our van. Seemed to be asking for $115 but told us that we would have to pay to exit the country. Asked us “what we wanted to do” and when we said we’d pay at the border to exit, as they said, things seemed to end. Ended up not paying anything but they initially took our license and they started to write us a ticket. Then asked to see our title again, brought out a copy and by then they had gotten in the truck and we got in our van and left. They followed us for a bit and that was it.  Nothing paid but heads up

name: Entrance to Cascade El Palto
description:
Entrance to a beautiful waterfall. The farmer charges 1 dollar per person because it is his property. They started to build a little place by the entrance where they want to sell coffee and other stuff. Super friendly people.
Walk to here from Vilcabamba takes 2-3 hours.

name: Casa Comunal Nuevo Susudel
description:
Just an empty room with electricity but without water. 
It's next to the roofed basketball field so it's easy to spot. 
We asked for water and bathroom in the house nearby.

name: Integral-Vet
description: A very nice vet in Quito near a good garage shop! The guy is very friendly and speaks clear Spanish as well as some English. $83 for a flea collar, allergy treatment, and a pack of pills. Not a bad deal for the level and quality of service.

name: Check & Clean
description: Super friendly mechanic shop that does everything. They speak Spanish primarily, English may be tough for communication. However the shop is super clean, and they have a lot of loyal clients so the work is very good. We had our brakes done here.

name: Gringos Cafe
description: Cute little breakfast place ran by a couple from the US; Donna and Sterling. If you're missing a few favorites from the states, this is the place to go. They have REAL bagels, loaded hashbrowns and biscuits and gravy to name a few of our favorites. We spent 2 weeks in Banos and ate there at least 7 times. Oh and the cookies are a must! They are open 9-3 closed on Monday's and the wifi is crazy fast.

name: La Casa de Matilda
description: Very very nice hostel. Like the best I ever stayed. The owner is so friendly. He like to party in the evening. His place has a little bar for the guests. He offered us a bunch of shots for free and was really happy to see us again for a second night. We felt like home and like his friends. He owns a few dogs and two cats. Even with my allergies to cats I felt fine. The toilets and showers are brand new. Ping-Pong table available. I know it is a street parking but the area is very safe. It was the first time we left the car alone in the street in South America and everything was fine. 6$ for a bed in a 3 beds dorm. 8$ for a small private single room. I think the private double room was 10$ pp. It was such a great experience, I really recommend this place. It was a blast!

name: UNIFRENOS
description: Brakes mechanic. Excellent service and price. Very efficient. Changed front brake pads for a good price 30 USD

name: Night Parking at the Ecuador-Peru border
description: Parking inside Ecuador- peruvian border. Arrived late at the border to cross from ecuador to peru hence asked police officer where would be safe to park overnight. Parked in the back of mini-market.

name: Café Lif - Restaurante
description: a newly opened little place. with very friendly owner and staff. we had menu del dia for 3.75 with a vegetarian/vegan option. they also have platos a la carta. good wifi and very clean place. recommended.

name: Pizzeria Venezuela
description: Best pizzeria in town! VERY CHEAP and so tasty. The stuff is so friendly and the pizza is one of the best I had on my travel! If you‘re in Pifo or passing by it's a must! Other pizzerias in Ecuador all mostly much more expensive and not really good. Because of the price in relation with the taste and the stuff is this one my favorite in Ecuador!

name: Cascada el Manantial
description:
Nice little creek with a small waterfall. We stopped here to go swimming. 
Guy at the gate asked for one dollar. We said that all national parks in Ecuador are free. He let us through. 
Go behind the natural swimming pool with the slide. There is the river.

name: Riverside
description: Nice quiet spot next to the river. On the way to the Cascada Silencio. 1$.  away from main road. Easy access.

name: Hotel Changra Ramos
description:
About 30 cabanas overlooking the sea. We arrived in low season and negotiated the price from $26 to $20 for a big room with three beds overlooking the sea with on suite bathroom.

Shower was cold, but it's so hot here that it didn't bother me. 

We loved our night here.

name: Cuenca Sightseeing Tours
description:
Here starts the hop-on hop-off bus for the sightseeing tour.
They have two tours. One south and one north. Tour is 8 dollars and booth tours are 12 dollars. The tour takes 1h45 and is in spanish and english. Ticket is valid 24 hours.

name: Bebedero de agua gratuito
description:
Free drinking water on the Amazon River Av

Bebedero gratuito sobre la Av Río Amazonas

name: Fibra de vidrio Ray and plastic welder
description: A place to fix your bumper with fiber glass or plástico

name: Shower
description: There are free showers, toilet, drinking water. perfect place for camping before and after tour to the jungles!

name: Gas
description: Diesel and eco pais. normal prices. This road is incredible.

name: Mike‘s Meat
description: Awesome meat store. They have salami different cuts of beef and other delicacies as bread, sauces and chutneys. Mike is a super friendly italian guy and he lets you try everything.

name: Police control
description: Stopped us to check and claimed that our darkened windows are prohibited. We told him that this doesn’t apply to foreign cars. However he said that we are wrong and he will write us a ticket. We said: „okay go ahead!“ and checked his name. Suddenly we were free to go... don’t let them trick you!

name: CHEZ OSCAR
description: Very tasty food, beautiful dish and very good price! Menu 2,5 USD!!! The place is very cool and also open as lounge in the night. They are also Hostel, we only came for the menu. They don't have parking, but they said that you can park in front and they have guard all night.

name: Santa Clara
description: Petroecuador Gas Station next to the main road.

name: turismo hostel
description:
Quiet hostel with private rooms.
Shared bathroom.
Nice staff.
I paid 7$.
Recommend it

name: Dique de fatima
description: nice stop for refresh  hot day. you can swim here in the river. there are huge parking and some restaurants, toilets. FREE.

name: VW Germán
description:
Recommended mechanic. Quiet area not very pretty. You have to always haggle


Mecanico recomendable. Zona tranquila no muy linda. Hay q regatear siempre

name: great electric!!
description:
Very professional and fast electric! He changed all cables in our Kombi in one day! And it was Saturday!!! The place is not belonged to him. So we had to ask the owner of the house to stay in the car during the reparation. and he allowed.
±593997538501 Eddy

name: León Dormido Hostal
description:
Very nice hostel that looks like more a hotel. All rooms with private bathroom, hot shower with "pressure", very clean rooms and linens and has the always welcoming Roberto (the owner, manager and whatever you need) to welcome you.
Stayed 5 days for 17 dollars a pay per person. Recommended!

name: Minka Hostel
description:
A friendly vibrant hostel conveniently located on the outskirts on Centro Historico. They have a fairly well equipped kitchen (blender, microwave) and multiple chill out areas. The wifi is good. 
They have secure parking for 1 medium sized vehicle.
Prices: Dorms $6-$10; Private $30

name: Hotel Cacao
description: Clean with AC, but no hot water. On site parking. Friendly owner. We paid $15 for a room. Wifi is average.

name: TechnoCom
description: Claro SIM cards are available here for $5. They activate it and you can purchase packets for data, sms and talking.

name: Los Cedros
description:
this is a private nature reserve in the cloud forest in a UNESCO biosphere. it's remote and very beautiful, plenty of wildlife (birds, monkeys, reptiles, amphibians etc) and plants. A fair few trails to explore with a few stunning views of the cloud forest. If you want some peace and quiet and explore the nature here, this is the best place.
Get in touch with José to make arrangements in advance. I think it's 65$ a night, including all food, accommodation, guides and mules to get the reserve. It might seem a little much but this is the only revenue of the reserve and allows to employ some locals. José is working hard to protect this important forest and to fight against large mining projects. All support is welcome!

To get there you need to make your way to the nearest town Chontal. Either leave you vehicle there and get a mototaxi or collectivo to the trailhead, or to a small house at the trailhead (small vehicles only, ask the family here if it's possible to park and pay them something for the duration. I left my motorcycle there for a week for $5). 
it's then 1h30min hike uphill to the reserve.

accommodation is basic but comfortable in wooden house, hot shower, dry toilets, good local food, potable water, electricity and WiFi mornings and evenings when the generator is running.

plenty of trails to explore and a river to go for a dip in.

website is http://reservaloscedros.org/
José contact: jose@reservaloscedros.org

name: trail head for los cedros and possibility to park at small house
description: this is where you may be able to park, secure in the yard of the little house. Ask the owners and pay them. I left my moto here for a week for $5. some friends left their pick-up for a week for $10

name: Free Spirit Hostel
description: Very nice hostel in front of the sea in Puerto Engabao. The place is a surf spot and the hostel offers boards to rent. The parking place is in front of the beach. The price we paid included vegetarian breakfast and dinner (ask directly for the price to one of the hostel's associate). Access to hot shower and toilets (very clean). They have a bar and a swimming pool. Animal friendly (well educated), they have two dogs. The owners are very welcoming and helpful if you need advice to visit around. Laundry service 5$. Highly recommended place to stay in Puerto Engabao.

name: Aventura y pesca Galápagos Adpesgal SA
description:
we booked with this agency two things : 
1. A tour to Los Túneles in Isabela
2. A straight boat from Isabela until San Cristóbal.
About 1, we wanted a tour with the agency Pahoe Hoe (good reviews) and the seller (Kevin) sold us the tour in another agency without telling us. we discovered it the day before while on Isabela Island. The other agency that was supposed to do the tour with us almost canceled our reservation because this Kevin did not paid them.
about 2, The agency sellt (Kevin again) lied to us about the straight boat to Isabela as we had to take it absolutely on Tuesday. the boat did not exist that day. we had to take another boat on Wednesday at 4 am to be able to catch our plane. the day before the dude still did not paid the boat driver and again they almost canceled our reservation. we had to spend hours on the phone to fixe the issues. 
this agency take your money and leave you alone. I do not recommend it. I recommend you to book your tours directly on the island.

name: Reina del Cisne
description: Reina del Cisne. Bathrooms, tienda, gasoline.

name: El Cangrejo Loco
description: Very good and tasteful food where they serve all different kinds of fish, shrimp, burgers (with patacon instead of bread) and salads.  Juices and deserts are also delicious.

name: Infinity Cars - car wash and grease protection
description: Very nice place, good and fast service. We paid 4 USD to protect the underbody of the car with oil after we came from Peru. They also offer other service, see the pictures.

name: Gustasos
description:
We stopped for lunch here during the week and the owner was very receptive to vegetarian options for lunch. They also serve a variety of options for lunch including fish, chicken and pork as main dishes. Served with juice and soup. $2.50 each person. 

The food was fresh  and tasty.  Nice spot for lunch.

name: Empanadas Factory
description: Nice stop for lunch outside of Quito close to the highway.  Very sweet owner and tasty fresh empanadas made to order.

name: Parque Principal Nanegalito
description:
Es una zona poblada y segura de acuerdo con personas del pueblo. No hay WiFi pero está el infocentro donde ofrecen acceso gratuito a computadores con Internet.
Junto a la cancha de volei del Parque principal hay un orinal. En la Junta parroquial Nanegalito hay baños y ducha públicos hasta las 5 pm y también junto a la cancha sintética de fútbol.
Los niños del pueblo son muy curiosos y van a querer entrar al carro, pero es mejor evitar problemas y no permitirles que entren.

name: Artisanal Beer
description: El Bosque Restaurante and artisanal beer factory, open Tuesday through Sunday

name: Cascada Llana
description: Nice waterfall, there are signs to reach here from town.  If you’re deciding whether it’s with the trip, it’s a 1km uphill walk.  Very difficult to reach the pools or the falls themselves because the trail at the end is washed out.  You can view the falls from a distance though.

name: Iglesia Palmitopamba
description:
We spent a night at this spot. It's a very quiet and small town. Apparently there is not much to do around, but it's ok for a night.

Nos quedamos una noche en este lugar. Es un pueblo pequeño muyyy silencioso y tranquilo. Al parecer no hay mucho para hacer pero está bien para parar a dormir.

name: Mecanico Patiño
description:
The best mechanic for VW Kombi and Escarabajo in ecuadorian coast.
He prepared my T2 and i’ve made a 22000 km without a single problem!

name: Campestre Restautant
description: Very nice place and very good quality restaurant on the road. We ordered the Asado al Campestre (a parrilla with seafood) for 4 people/ 20 dollars. Very good!

name: Park
description:
Right in the town, two blocks from the plaza Central, there is a nice park with a communal open kitchen next to a small river.
There is a toilett and some sinks.
You can camp in the park or under the roof.
We ( cyclist) asked people and they said there was no problem. Very 'tranquilo'.

name: La Casa del Oso Pachanguero
description: There are 2 houses, for 6 persons Rachella house, full furnished. Also beautifull space for camping, Vegan Persian food and orgánic veggies also.

name: Cablecar to Cascadas Reina 5
description: Here is the cablecar to the waterfalls Reinas 5. It costs 5$ per person to enter. Come here by taxi or walk about 1.5h from Mindo. In the park are three paths where you can see several waterfalls.

name: Elevated ground
description:
There is a flat area above the road. A few meters away from the road, too. Additionally there was an earth wall between the road. Not entirely hidden but good enough. The low amount of traffic is probably too busy going up or down the road anyway. It is a good spot to spend the night. 

Unfortunately the spot is for bicycles only. Maybe it is possible to get up there with a motorbike, too. 

There was a village a bit lower than this spot, in the curve where the bridge was. Most likely you can get water there if you're coming from the west. Maybe also camp there, it looked pretty good for camping there. 

Another flat spot was around 6.6 km uphill. There was a house and I tried to ask the kids I found there but we didn't understand each other.

name: Refugio on the mountain
description: A fairdinkum refugio (little house for resting) with a rubbish bin outside and a clothes line under the awning of the new roof!! There’s a break in the edge of the road if you have a car you want to park off the road, and it’s pretty clean too.

name: Open WiFi (Public)
description: Wifi by the town. The name of the network was La Troncal Renace Contigo. At the Plaza San Gerado

name: Montanita Spanish School
description:
The best Spanish school we have been to in the 2 years we have been in Latin America.
Very friendly staff and our teacher was excellent and very patient.
$10.00 an hour.

name: Free Camp near the church
description: there is a side road. Near the church you will see a nice place for camping. Also A family living near the church . Kind people and they said it is a secure place. For one it is ok

name: Family run Hostel
description: Family run hostel. One small room with 3 bunk beds. We paid 5 dollars per person. Shared bathroom with hot electric shower and possible use of kitchen. Small garden were we parked our bicycles. Car parking on the street, the village is super quiet so it shouldn't be a problem.

name: Duchas en complejo deportivo
description:
Showers, bathrooms and easy-to-use exercise devices. All for free. Cold water
--
Duchas, baños y aparatos sencillos para nacer ejercicio. Todo gratis. Agua fría

name: El Rincón Manabita
description: Delicious cevicheria that serves a traditional dish called ENCEBOLLADO. They even won a competition of this dish in Ecuador and got the third place. Service was very good and fast, toilet very clean, full of locals when we came. ENCEBOLLADO cost 3 USD without shrimps and with it costs 5 USD.

name: Cascadas de Chupiankas
description: A beautiful waterfall located 700 meters from the main road, has trails through a natural jungle, at the entrance you can see medicinal plants, and if you are lucky animals of the area in their natural state, in the waterfall you can swim, also It is a sanctuary of petrified shells on the rock walls

name: Hostal Ñaui
description: Lovely hostel on the hillside above Tena. Great for some R&R. Bike allowed in room. Prices $10-16 and breakfast $3.

name: Muelle Tijeretas
description:
We've been robbed here. Just the money (still about a 200$), but at least not the camera and mobile. Out of the wallet, which was in our backpack.
One of us was snorkling while the other stayed outside with our child. Felt really safe with lots of people, but we sure were careless. Could have been anyone, tourist or locals. Stupid to take that amount with us.

name: Roadside
description: Little pull out off a side road where a cyclist could tuck in with not too much visibility.  Smaller rigs could pull in too.

name: Peaje Station
description: We spent 1 night here because it was getting late to cross the border. Friendly staff, safe, very clean bathrooms, water and free. A little noisy at night. Perfect for 1 night.

name: San Tadeo Birds Watching
description: Nice place to watch birds : 2 spots, 1 for colibries (they are literally humming around you !) and the other for various beautiful species (we even saw 2 toucans !). We are not at all bird specialists but spend 2 hours watching. 5$ per person (free for our kids under 10). The sign is not visible from the road but stop at the group of house at the right side coming from Mindo.

name: Administration for Parking Permission
description: This is the office to get permission for parking overnight in the park (camp icon in iOverlander).  Directions were not clear on how to get here, so here it is!

name: Small pizzeria
description:
Small pizzeria, more recent than the others on the plaza.
The owner is really nice and can tell you all the story of the town (if he's not too busy). He owned a bar in the village before.
Great pizzas around 8$ (personal, but there are bigger ones), made with only local products. On the table, you have parmesan and great pizza sauce "aji"-like available.
I prefered this restaurant to the others. Better pizzas and more affordable.
Closed on monday. Maybe sunday too...

name: Las Orquídeas
description: Small rooms, very basic but clean and comfortable. Water just barely warm. Road noise may be a problem if you don’t bring earplugs. Bike allowed in room. $10. OK for overnight stop.

name: Mills Brewing Co.
description: Local craft beer bar. I only tried the IPA and it was seriously tasty! 6 other styles available. Highly recommended.

name: Hotel Merceditas
description: Simple guesthouse with small, clean rooms. Bike allowed in room. $10. Terrible WiFi but amazingly hot water!

name: Helados Rosalia Suarez
description:
his is the original place, where You can try original Helados de Paula! Where they still prepare it traditionally in ollas de copper. 

$1,20 for two sabores and they are so delicious! The owner is attending herself and she gave us two other portions for free!

name: El Manglar
description:
Cabaña restaurant El Manglar. A wonderful place, very quiet, very safe, and very economical.  available cabins and camping area! price per person in camping 2usd, price per cabin, 6usd per person

Update May 2024-They no longer operate the restaurant. it's just cabins or camping

name: Hostal Sibambe
description: It's the only hostel in Sibambe, a small quiet town along the panamericana. Carmen, the owner, is a very enthusiastic host. Rooms have private bathroom with electric shower and they also provide food (dinner and lunch). We paid 5 dollars per person for the room and 2.5 dollars for dinner (single plate with rice, fries, salad, meat plus bread and juice). She also let us use the kitche to prepare our own breakfast. We took our bicycles in the room but any other vehicle can be park on the street that is super quiet.

name: Bomberos El Angel
description:
They are very nice.  You can sleep in a secure storage room. They give you access to kitchen and bathroom with hot! electrical shower. Wifi too. 

They said a lot venezolanos sleep there, but at the moment we were there there were none.

name: The city of the cuy
description: In this small town you will find many restaurants specialized in cuy (guinea pig). They call themselves as the world capital of cuy. Looks like in the weekends is full of ecuadorians. We came during the week, many of the restaurants were closed. We choose the El Palacio del cuy, we had a cuy and chicken, the worst chicken I had in my life. The price of half cuy is 9 USD and 16 USD a full one. Chicken was 5 USD. The cuy seems to be this price in all the others restaurants. I hope you will choose a better restaurant than us. Come in the weekend!

name: Free hot shower - Ecuador Aduana
description: Waiting in the line entering Ecuador, we discovered a simple but pretty clean hot shower. We took a fast hot shower and continued our trip to Ecuador ;)

name: Viewpoint over lake
description: Absolutely fabulous drive to Quilotoa Lake. 4x4 necessary, especially when wet. Wonderful scenery and worth the out and back drive. Could possibly camp here too as there is a large flat area - cold though. On a clear day the lake view would be amazing and there is a tiny cafe here although closed when we arrived.   There are other lovely driveable routes to the lake on easier trails too if you prefer and suitable for two wheel drive.

name: Yacuri House
description: This place allows us to rest in a comfortable accommodation or to your tourists who care for the equipment they need to provide a safe place to camp. --- Este sitio nos permite descansar en una confortable habitación o a su ves a los turistas que cuenten con el equipo necesario les brinda una zona segura donde acampar

name: Parque Bolivar
description: Parque Bolivar parkings are free from 5pm to 8 am (otherwise you pay a ticket 0,50 $ hour). We stayed one night with our van and we talked with the Police man who was around all the night. He let us stay no problem but our van is not really big, so maybe ask before. Quiet and safe night in Otavalo. Free wifi working.

name: Del Buen Cafe
description: Greatest place at Baños to ask for tortillas, empanadas, hot chocolate and, if available, the famous “cola morada”.  Cheap, clean and very friendly. Dont miss!!!

name: Comida vegetariana „El Huerto“
description:
Situated in the centro comercial „La Manzana“. Almuerzos with jugo and tea, soup and main for 2,75$, semi-veg with non-veg main dish for 3,25$.
Possible to take your dog into the food court.

name: Concierto de ranas
description: Frog concert. You can book in town for 6$ pp (mindo cafe or tour agencies), or directly at the Mindo Lago when going to the tour for 5$ pp. The tour starts every day at 18:30, be there at 18:15. They first give you an shooter of wine while you listen to an audio tape in english and Spanish explaining what they do here, then you go in the hotel's garden looking for frogs and insects for about an hour. It's nice but we were there on an Saturday night and there were about 30 persons so come in the week days if you can

name: Hostal El Faraón
description: Sparkling clean guesthouse with good WiFi and really hot water. Asked for $20 but came down to $15. Bike allowed in room after promising to pay for any damage it may cause.

name: Viewpoint Tower
description: Viewpoint Tower that you can see all Cuenca center city. Beautiful at night. It is open until 8pm.

name: Economuseo Casa del Sombrero
description: This is a small museo about handmade Panama hats. Very nice and free.

name: Parque Santa Elena
description:
There is nothing to do around, but it's ok and it is safe for a night.

No hay nada para hacer en este lugar, pero está bien y es seguro para pasar la noche.

name: Estacion de Servicios de Choferes Professionales
description: Brand new gas station with showers, bathroom, water and shop targeted at professional drivers. We did not spend the night here (we were here at noon), but did accept the spontaneous invitation for a shower. And we filled our water tank. All for free with a full tank of cheap diesel.

name: Subs Sandwich Bar
description: This is the correct location for this restaurant, featuring sandwiches, etc. German. Fish and Chips on Fridays only and only (?) with pre-order/reservation by phone/WhatsApp: +593 990 987 784

name: Roadside camping next to river
description: Quiet spot next to a dirt road and above the river. Just a few cars and people passed by in the evening and morning. The river is just 50 m away. With a powerfull motor or 4x4 you can also camp right next to the river. We had a refreshing bath.

name: forno del porto
description: Very nice restaurant, very cosy, nice garden. Good pizzas (around 10 dollars). Very nice attention.

name: riverside hotel
description:
So nice people. Very comfortable room. Very clean. 20usd with excellent breakfast. Secure Parking.

You can also sleep in your van for 10usd per night using toilets and shower! Really recommend!

name: san Augustin ferretería
description: Very good place with a lot of things. Very nice and professional

name: autoservicio nissan Renault
description:
Very professional, very nice and very good job. He really knows his job. Can work on every brand of car. He has the computer/scanner.
Very helpful. Cheap. 
He also has "grúas".

Muy profesional, muy bueno mecánico, conoce muy bien su trabajo. Seguro
Barato. 
Tambien tiene el scanner computador. 
Por cualquiera marqua de vehículo. 
Tiene grúas. 

Francisco +593984475296

name: ferretería domsur-domej
description:
Muy amables profesionales, muy ayudantes.
Nos hizieron una pieza que fuimos buscando desde 2 semanas en todas las ferreterías de Ecuador!!! Y hizieron todo para que sea lo mas barato para nosotros. Recomiendo

Very nice people who helped us a lot. Trying to make it as cheaper as they can for us. They made the piece and Now we have the piece we were searching for for 2 weeks in all the ferreterías de Ecuador!!
Really recommend!

name: chillogallo hostal
description:
Nice place to stay.
Cheap private room. 12 usd the room for a double with private bathroom.
Also they have a big secured parking included in the price. They also have a restaurant.
Very very nice people.
Good wifi. Hot shower. Tv. Very clean.
You can also sleep in the car for 7usd and use the toilets. 

Muy buen lugar. Habitacion privada con su propio baño por 12usd. Buen wifi, agua caliente, muy muy limpio. Largo Estacionamiento privado incluido en el precio.
Sino pueden dormir en su carrito, utilizando los baños por 7usd.
Muy amables son ellos.

name: chillogallo hostal
description:
Nice place to stay.
You can sleep in your van and use the toilets/shower for 7 usd. Big flat and secured area to park. 
Very very nice ecuatorians couple. 

If you want they also have cheap private room. 12 usd the room for a double with private bathroom.
A big secured parking included in the price. They also have a restaurant.
Very very nice people.
Good wifi. Hot shower. Tv. Very clean.


Muy buen lugar. Habitacion privada con su propio baño por 12usd. Buen wifi, agua caliente, muy muy limpio. Largo Estacionamiento privado incluido en el precio.
Sino pueden dormir en su carrito, utilizando los baños por 7usd.
Muy amables son ellos.

name: Barbershop
description: Great place for a shave/haircut/trim. Stumbled upon it... the old guy there knows his stuff. $3 for a men’s cut. Just around the corner from some great ceviche too.

name: Cevicheria Pepe 3
description: The traditional Jipijapa ceviche is topped with avocado and peanut paste, with chifles (plantain chips) on the side... it sounds bizarre but it’s delicious. Goes well with a beer. This place is original and a perfect brekky, lunch, or snack. They only stay open until they sell out, usually around 1-2pm, so stop in early. You can get some for takeaway too. Owners, Pepe y Loli, are super sweet.

name: Selina Hostel
description:
great staff, great location. swimming pool, pool table, bar, coworking space and restaurant

$10pp.

name: Balneario rio Eno
description: We arrived in a hot afternoon and we took a fresh bath in the balneario (100 meters of Rio where people come for a bath). Nice and pretty clean place between trees and nature. There are bathrooms and showers for 10/25 cents. We stayed for one night and we felt safe. A man who lives close assures it’s safe, and he also offered a bathroom for the night at the end of the street. We didn’t pay anything for the balneario and parking. There’s a free WiFi that works  just one hour, then you have to wait long time before using it again.

name: Balneario Eno
description: Nice and free balneario to have a nice fresh bath in the clean river, we really needed it in this hot afternoon!!! Maybe in the week end it’s full of people, but during the week we were almost alone and in the late afternoon some kids came to play and bath nice place to stay and refresh. There are bathrooms and showers (10/25 cents) and a free WiFi that works only sometimes

name: Restaurant Don Guevara
description: Restaurant parking lot, roadside 6km before Cajas Nacional Park. We asked the friendly owner for permission and spent two nights here while visited the park. This is a good option to avoid the fee to camping on the visitor center's national park. Safety, good view and night traffic did not bother us.

name: Hostel Rincon del Nomada
description:
What an amazing find in the overpriced area of Machachi. The owner Franklin and his family are so warm and friendly. And so are his two dogs. We stayed in a two double bed room for just 16.8 USD including taxes a night for both of us. We booked it on booking.com. 

The toilet and showers were very clean and it was hot with good pressure! Towels, soap and toilet paper were included.

Parking is safe as it is gated. No height restriction, but max width is around 2.2m. 

It’s peaceful, spacious - we have two sofas, and a dining table in our room.

name: Casa Zamora hospedaje
description:
Very nice and clean hotel. The owner is very friendly. There is safe parking. 
Owner Wildon Ortega 0987181149

name: Engeneria Alarcon
description: Very good workshop for mechanisch repairs like breaks, Motor, alignment etc, very friendly and not expensive.

name: Hacienda Releche
description: This is the hacienda at the beginning of the hike up to Laguna Amarilla / El Altar Volcano. Call ahead if you want to stay here or hire equipment from them (such as rubber boots). Don't make the mistake we made and show up unannounced. The employees we met were dishonest and straight up lied to us. Would recommend bypassing them entirely if you want to do the hike. Also they charge $5 for parking. If you need to overnight somewhere there's a grassy patch next to some stables just off the paved road (a bit further from the turn off to the hacienda) where the locals will let you camp free, no hassle.

name: Agua Purificada
description:
We found this place while we were having our vehicle checked over in the Multimarcas R.B.R mechanics next door.

We paid $2 for 20 litres.

name: Cascadas Peguche
description: We've all seen a lot of waterfalls, I'm sure, but this is a really nice little detour around Otavalo. There is a big parking lot ($1) and a short but very peaceful hike through the woods to la cascada. 20m tall and with a lot of refreshing spray. Quite a few other things to see along the trail and you can tell the local indigenous community has put a lot of effort into making this a nice place to visit. Entry was free but we left a donation of a dollar apiece which was appreciated.

name: Truchas Arco Iris
description: popped into this place during a MTB-Tour - the grow their own Truchas using a intelligent pool method for cleaning the water to get the best fish. it is absolutely delicious and one Plate with freshly grilled Trucha just costs 5$. Definitely recommend if you like fish. They have other plates as well all for 5USD.

name: Tecfaroni
description: We went there to do the tire alignment on our truck. We still had a problem after the alignment and he looks for it. We paid 22 dollars. The boss speaks English and is really nice. Knows what he does. The name of the business is not marked on the entrance, see the pictures.

name: auto electrician.
description: After a few weeks of dual battery problems on our Land Rover we finally found an auto electrician who took the time to understand our system and found the fault! $30 for an hour or so and some new connections made and some spare fuses. He wouldn’t take money until the next day after we made sure all was working.

name: El abismo del diablo SWING
description: This swing is amazing! Single and double seats! We did the double and loved it. Great views and so much fun! 10usd pp . He also recorded videos and took some pictures while we were swinging. Close to the entrance to the Pailon del Diablo waterfall. Follow the signs and enjoy. Also Ivan, the owner, lives right there with his family and offered us to park there and stay overnight and even use the toilets that are outside (clean and new). Very secure

name: Su delicia
description: Delicious quality homemade food. Excellent attention. They are also the owners of the swing across the street. Very friendly people and love to meet overlanders. You could probably park at their house next to the swing if you get to talk to them for a while.

name: Talleres Jaramillo
description: Very good and honest mechanics! They speak English and are very friendly and helpful. Friends from Cuenca recommended this place and we are very happy, that we finally have a mechanic to trust. They did just the things that were necessary and nothing more. They do all brands and did a very good job on our Toyota Hiace. Highly recommended!

name: Police checkpoint
description: They stoped us and told us that legaly we are not allowed to have polarized rear windows. He said that he will need to give us a fine unless we remove the film on the spot. When I jumped out of the car to remove the film, he let us go.

name: Home stay with Raul and Nancy
description:
I stayed with a really nice family in a small warm private room with attached toilet. They only have one double bed. So it’s best for a single or couple though I’m sure they’d work something out for everyone. 
I said I didn’t need food included but they fed me (and especially my dog) a lot anyway, I had full access to their kitchen and we shared many stories over coffee and pancakes. 
Their family also have cabins on a farm in the mountains near by if your looking for something really off the grid yet with amenities to wind down for a few days. 
I’m still learning Spanish but they speak slowly and make you feel welcome and part of the family. I highly recommend. $5 p night. 
They run a little “local” shop next to the plaza so if they’re not home, you can whatsapp Jonathan, their son: +593984038485 
Or head up the hill to the plaza. Their shop is the last one on the right hand side on the street leading into the plaza.

name: Petrol station
description: Petrol station. Cheap fuel before higher prices in Peru! Will fill up jerry cans! Only cash and only 20usd bills accepted

name: At the beach @ el pajonal
description:
Parking spot next to the beach, nothing spectacular but away from anything (for now). It takes about 20 minutes on unpaved (but hard) road suitable for non-4x4's. There's a big park a bit further, but gringo's are apparently not allowed past the gate, the guard was very friendly though, and so was his cute little dog . Some locals passed by and were interested in the van, and it all felt very safe.

Maybe it would be nice for a 4x4 to check it out, since you have an easy access to the beach and can drive along it for miles - locals with bikes and jeeps did so. So camping right on the beach a bit furter away instead of on the parking should be possible. There's zero amenities here, but you're parked right at the beach so who needs those anyway. We had a beautiful sunset.

name: Bario la Cascada
description:
Fantastic place to stay, not because of the views but because of the people! We were apparently the first tourists ever visiting this pueblito, and were received with open arms. We asked the lady of the small tienda if we could park out here, and that was no issue at all. There's space for multiple cars past and on the volleybal and football fields. Big rigs may have difficulties in turning around. There's no amenities but you're allowed to use the toilet and bucket shower of the tienda for free (very basic). We watched the children playing volleyball in the evening while the others were bbqing, great atmosphere and nice talks (despite our very very basic spanish). The people of the town would love to welcome more overlanders... so if you're looking for a nice place to spend a night on your way from Quito to the coast or vice versa, this is a good option and you'd make a lot of people happy. 
There's a waterfall in 10 min walking distance. We could stay for free but gave some toys to the kids.

name: Road to El Angel from Tulcan
description:
It is almost not possible to drive this road during the wet season, even with our Ford F-350 4x4 truckcamper.  Very muddy and slippery, deep tracks.  Beautiful views on this road.

10/22 - There is a landslide, so only motorcycles and bikes can go through the road. The landslide seems to be older because the gras is growing there already. Please don't go there with a car or a truck. There is not much space to turn back. But the views are wonderful and there are some nice spots to stay overnight on the road. Don't go there if you don't have a 4x4 campervan because of the big holes all over. High ground clearance is required.

3 June 23. Still impassable by 4x4.

name: Recreation field
description: Small parking lot, of a recreation field. Very quiet, except some music between 7 PM and 10 PM, when activities are going on. Not completely level.

name: Mambo Eco Hostel
description:
Very nice new eco hostel set close to the beach in San Lorenzo. 

SURF: the owner rents surfboards.

It was opened a year ago. The owner, Yoan, is french and he is really friendly. He is working on upgrading the hostel.
There is place for tents, but not sure what the price is. It also has space for bikes and motorbikes. Doesn't have much space for cars or vans but I think that one can fit, so just stop by and ask. I don't know if he accepts pets but I would think so. He has a cat himself and a nice garden. I am also sure he accepts family with children.
Matrimonial rooms are $12.5 each.
Dorms are $10, although the dorm only has a bunk bed with a matrimonial bed at the bottom and a single bed on top. He has 1 dorm and 3 matrimonial, but he also has extra space at the neighbour's house. The rooms and facilities are really good, comfortable and clean.
A nice breakfast with fresh juice, bread, jam, egg, fruit and avena is included in the price.
There is no warm water, but if the weather is warm you can have quite warm water from the shower outside.
There is a nice terrace made of bamboo with hammocks to relax upstairs.
He does have a kitchen but he currently doesn't let hosts using it as he had previous bad experiences with other hosts (Yoan lives in the house, so this is his main kitchen). However, when we were there, there we were the only guests, therefore we eat together.

IMPORTANT INFO: The village is not really touristic. There is no bakery. A guy passes at 6.30 am and in the evening to deliver bread. There is one place open at night for food, just by the church. It only does papi Pollo, batidos, tostadas and empanadas.

We went in low season, but Yoan says that in high season the village is much more lively :)

As we were alone, Yoan took us out with his friends and their family to do a small hike to try and see the monos!

name: Terraza Suites
description: Basic Hotel in North Quito, close to the road to Otovalo. $21 for a large room with private bathroom and warm shower (sometimes hot). Slow WiFi. Space for car/motorbike parking only. Bicycle allowed in room after some pleading.

name: Claro Service Center
description: This was the only Claro shop in Loja, where we could buy a SIM card as non-Ecuadorians. Passport needed.

name: Mirador del Oso Andino
description:
There is already a spot for camping, but it is possible to come here for bear watching only.
The chances to see the andean bear is really high - just bring a good camera and /or binoculars.
We have seen 5 bears within an evening and morning. Great experience, highly recommend. Prices see camp spot.

name: Empanadita Stand by Gas Station
description: Stopped for gas and decided to try the empanadas at the little stand to the right of the station as facing it. These are fantastic! They only had Pollo (chicken) while we were here but, man! Really good! We got three empanadas, a Coke, and a hot chocolate for less than $5. A great treat on a long drive day.

name: VW Van Mechanic Expert - Cupido Motorizado (Ivan)
description:
Ivan is VW Van mechanical expert with more than 25 years of experience in VW and also well recommend by travellers and locals. Also has plenty space (with bathroom and hot shower) to receive overlanders while repairing our vans. We did some maintenance: breaks, injection, filters and suspensions, also he fixed a leaking of our gas tank. Very good mechanical, good team, reasonable price and lovely family to share. 

WhatsApp contact: +593 985167010

name: El cisne - sofacamas / matresses
description: We buyed new foam for our bed here. They cut it as you need it and you can choose different types of foams. It was more expensive then in a supermarket, but much better quality.

name: Salinas Parking
description: The best place to stay in Salinas. A big parking lot in front of the beach. We stayed one night (Sunday) and it was very calm and silent. We paid USD5,00  per night. From 8AM to 22PM, there are baths (USD 0,50) and shower (USD1,00), wifi and electricity 110v. We didn't use the bath, so I don't know if it's clean. I don't know if it's a good option in high season because is of the Discotheque nearby.

name: Beach Parking/camping
description: Nice sandy area by the river to sleep and rest. Quiet (with rapid river noises) and clean. Wild camping, no facilities or cell access. It’s by the main road so we felt very safe. Turn off right after the bridge onto dirt road and then turn right immediately after to come down a bit of a rocky road to the beach access.

name: Camping under El Mercado Roof
description:
With reference to my check-in at Estadio just to the south of here on 19/11/2019, we moved here from Estadio based on the recommendation of some locals.

They guided us to park under the market roof in the corner under the floodlights. No toilets or amenities but it was fine for one night arriving late and leaving early the next morning.

name: Llullu Llama Mountain Lodge
description:
Llullu Llama Mountain lodge offers a variety of accommodation including camping.
$12 pp for your accommodation which includes a delicious breakfast and dinner.
Facilities include: bathrooms, free yoga twice daily, jacuzzi, sauna, communal areas with fireplaces, laundry.
This is one place you MUST visit.

name: Napolitano Apart Hotel
description: Private, gated parking for smaller vehicles or motorcycles. We booked a double room with private bath for $42/night and were upgraded to a room with a kitchenette at no extra charge. Good WiFi, very hot showers, clean rooms and a delicious breakfast was included. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from downtown. There were a lot of dogs barking at night but that seems typical for the town. They have a pool which is open year round and a hot tub which is only open on weekends in the slower months and daily during the busy season. The owner/host Ivan was extremely friendly and gave us many great recommendations on things to see/do (though he doesn’t speak English). The most comfortable bed we have slept in during our entire trip through Latin America so far!

name: Biocanic - Paintbull "Expertos"
description:
If you are in rush (like all of you travellers) don't go to this place!! We had a problem with our Sprinter (automatic transmission) and after visiting already 10 mechanics in Peru and Ecuador we finally got a recommendation to this place. 
As we planned to stay in Quito for about 3 weeks we decided to give the car a more thorough check here. 
It took them 2 weeks (!!) to find the problem inside the transmission. One week more we waited for the prices of the spare parts which were totally insane. So we bought the parts on Ebay in the US and imported them by ourselves to the place. We actually wanted to go to another mechanic but as the transmission was already dismantled this was no option. 
The communication was awful, for every information we had to call and write several times. The answer was most of the time: TOMORROW 😤😤.
Long Story short: we spent 8 weeks, lot of nerves, 1000$ just for the working time and at least we have a working transmission. Thank God.

name: Sim Card
description:
The best chip and plan in Ecuador, to speak unlimited, whatsapp, video call. U$ 10,00. to 30 days.
Carlos: +593 96 339 8019.
Very friendly and trustworthy.

name: Great Hostels Amazon
description: Hostels and Camping Area, Motorhomes, parking, motorbikes, Tends, Restaurant, Alojamiento, Tourist Information, Informacion Turistica,

name: Reserva Intillacta Tucanopy
description: An excellent place to have fun and to enjoy nature. Either If you're looking for a peaceful time or a rather extreme experience, this is the place. Family-run enterprise with high quality equipment and standards.
