Don't stop asking! the owners' knowledge about botany, and the biological an ecological processes makes it not only a great tourist attraction, but also a fascinating learning and authentic experience.

name: Hostal Alcala del Rio Dorado
description: Perfect place to stay, friendly staf, very clean rooms with airco and private bathroom.

name: Sol del Venado Brewery
description: Curtis Hofmann is the owner and brew master of this brewery. Apart from delicious beer... they also have a bbq restaurant that is open on weekends. They have space for rv parking and camping along the hillside. I suggest coming on the weekend when the restaurant is open to enjoy some bbq and beers. CALL Curtis: 098-224-5678

name: Parking lot
description:
This is a parking lot for cars that students from the university of Azuay leave their cars during class hours

the ground is not soft so dont set your tent there, its better to sleep in the car 
they have restrooms and  a hose for water 
for more information 0995112390 Contact the owner Juan

name: Rafael
description:
His name is Rafael and he fixes all kind of vehicles (vans, cars, motocycles), all brands but he is especialized in Volkswagen.
He and his family welcome with open arms all travelers. He provided WiFi, bathroom, clothes wash machine, and all kinds of amenities that are in his hands while he fixes our van.
We were there three days and we feel like a family member.

name: Andino Mecánico
description: We were travelling in two Volkswagen kombis. The mechanic  identified the two faults in both vehicles in just 5 minutes. We were charged  just $5 for each "fix." The mechanic told us that all kinds of cars can be repaired.

name: Comunidad Río Blanco
description:
In the community there was an experiential tourism project managed by the community itself. There is also a space where there is also the communal house and another house where people with a football field were housed where you can park if you ask permission. In principle it's free. We weren't charged.
Three houses away is Don Gaston and his mother Elvira who can give you permission.

name: Cerro Hojas Jaboncillo
description:
Museum and Archaeological Site of the Manteña Culture. Free guided tour. Very good facilities with bathroom.
We spoke to the site director and he told us we could park and spend the night. There's a vigilante and they let us build a fire in a place he's already prepared.

name: Justice building (wonderful and free library wifi)
description:
This is the justice court. But it was a law university before. This is French architecture inspired mostly. With mostly local marble !
Probably the most beautiful building of Cuenca.
You can use free WiFi and computers and law books of the library ! You have to enter here ;)

name: Café & Hostal Andes Alpes
description: Nice little restaurant with some rooms to sleep in. Even a mountaineering company that offers tours to nearby mountains. You can rent equipment here, too. The owner let us stay in our campervan before the spot. There are bathrooms with toilets, showers and wifi. 👍 $5 per person. You can add dinner and breakfest for $18 per person. Taxi to „La Virgen“ is $25.

name: Urgiles
description: Absolutely the best shop in the world. I had a fairly serious engine problem. Four mechanics worked 14-hour days including the weekend. The owner went with me to Guayaquil twice to buy spares, always finding the cheapest shop possible. All of it in a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere. It took a few days to get everything done right, but the car left the shop in a better state than it was when I bought it. I wish all mechanics were at least half as good as them.

name: Parque Carigan FREE Camping
description: Free clean secure campsite/park near Loja with bathrooms open all night. We stayed on a Wednesday night and no one else was here and was very quiet and there were Personnel on site all night in the administration building. There are established tent sites with fire pit within 500m from the entrance. Covered picnic tables near the gravel parking lot in case it rains. Entrance gate is maybe 3.5m, so should be ok for big rigs.

name: Termas Catalina
description: Very nice thermal pools, outside, 4 USD pp., open 6 AM - 6 PM. They have 6 pools, with different temperatures from cold to hot, some of them really big. Hydro massage in the one but warmest pool. Nice warm showers. Very clean! We were here at a Tuesday afternoon, with about 10 people only. Friendly staff, they allowed us to stay overnight for free at the parking lot, after we went to the pools. Very quiet at night.

name: Canela y miel
description:
Nice hostel, a bit expensive but these are the prices around here. We paid 20 dollars for a private room with bathroom.
Good spot to visit the cascada San Rafael and the Cueva de los Tayos!

name: Coco’s Green Cafe
description:
We had veggie and capresa pizza! Waaaaaw! From 2$ to 3,50$ for a personal (25cm)! With homemade spices, herbs, sauces... 
Pizza paste is made from green bananas (gluten free)!
Burgers too ;)
Vegan cheese too if you need it! Amazing for everything.
(Also very very good natural juice!!).

name: Bosque do Laguna Yambo
description: A short dirt road is leading to the top of a hill where we could hide behind the eucalyptus trees to be not visible from the street. Might be narrow for big rigs to turn arround.

name: Cascata Yantsa
description:
Incredible waterfall with about 70 mts, its possible to go behind the waterfall. 
A good experience with local indians. Jugle experience, local food, medical plants, dance, rituals..
It's possible sleep near waterfall. 
very friendely. 
Recomended..
.
The best experience in the amazonia. 
.

U$ 10,00 pp al (food 3 meals, dance, waterfall, snacks, natural medicine, gifts...)
Sr. Antonio e Sra. Rosa. 
098 9256719

name: Musap
description:
Great place to stay near Cascata Yantsa
 We parking near house to Antonio e Rosa. 
very Friendly, they prepared dinner and invited us.

name: Musap, Dona Rosa cascata Yantsa
description:
It's possible eat jungle food from Local Indians. 
Dona Rosa prepared delicius jungle  foods. Maitos, Chifles, teas.... 
.
Organic foods, jungle condiments.
.
She can prepared near the waterfall. 
the best experience 
.
Recomended
.
Husband 098 9256 719

name: Don Juan Pueblo de pescadores
description:
We was parking right at the beach, next to a roof. In front there is a house that offers bathroom and shower ( I don't know price). It's a small fisherman Town, safe and relax. The people is so Nice, we was really good welcoming, they offer us water, shower, bathroom and even food! There are some palapas, some grocery stores, every day comes the fruit and vegetables' s truck  and there' s a couple of beach restaurant. There are a lot of little boats, You can Buy fresh fish every morning.. That's the reason because You can Heard noises at 3 am ir You park near boats. We went to help to the " biblioteca" , and was one le the most beautiful experiences during our Travel.
••••••••••••
Nos estacionamos en la playa, junto a un quincho. Al frente hay una tienda que ofrece baño y ducha (no se el precio). Es un pequeño pueblo de pescadores, seguro y  tranquilo. La gente es muy amable, fuimos muy muy bien recibidos, nos ofrecieron agua, ducha y hasta comida! Hay algunas palapas, algunas tiendas, todos los días viene el carro de frutas y verduras y hay un par de restaurantes de playa. Hay muchos botes, y podés comprar pescado fresco cada mañana. Por la noche, a eso de las 3 de la mañana salen a pescar, por eso puede haber algo de ruido si estacionas cerca de los botes. Fuimos a ayudar a la biblioteca, y fue una de las experiencias más lindas que tuvimos durante nuestro viaje.

name: Biblioteca y Fundación "A Mano Manaba"
description:
Beautiful children and adult's development space. Rut and Esteban the directors are very professional, Literature proffesors, after earthquake on 2016 they found this way to helping. They receive volunteers from all around the world that stay for 2 months helping in the activities. It's a really useful space, each morning there are english and computer clases for adults; they make English activities, schollar and reading support with the local school. In the afternoon there are reading and diferent children activities.
All kind of helping is welcome.
The volunteers have their own space in the house.
We came every day with our kid for sharing activities and helping.
Good wifi for working.
You can just come or find them in Workaway: Children's Library by the beach and the webpage is http://www.amanomanaba.org/
Rut's phone  +5930985929886

••••••••••••
Hermoso espacio de desarrollo infantil y de adultos. Rut y Esteban los directores son muy profesionales, Profesores de Literatura, luego del terremoto en 2016 encontraron esta forma de ayudar. Reciben voluntarios de todo el mundo que se quedan por 2 meses ayudando en las actividades. Es un espacio muy aprovechado, cada mañana hay clases de inglés y computación para adultos; hacen actividades de inglés, apoyo escolar y de lectura en conjunto con la escuela local.  Por la tarde lectura y actividades para los niños.
Todos los tipos de ayuda son bienvenidos. Los voluntarios tienen su propio espacio en la casa.
Nosotros nos estacionamos en la playa y vinimos cada día con nuestro niño y a ayudar.
Buen wifi para trabajar.
Pueden venir directamente o encontrarlos en Workaway: Children's Library by the beach y la página es http://www.amanomanaba.org/
El teléfono de Rut es +5930985929886

name: Siete Cascadas / Cabañas Victoria
description: Right at the entrance to the beautiful "siete cascadas" (seven tropical waterfalls with pools you can bath in) you find this family run campground. You camp right next to the river, where you can have a refreshing bath (this is actually also the "shower"). The owners are very lovely and welcoming which makes this place an even more beautiful spot to spend a couple of nights.

name: Hotel Colonial San Martin
description:
Very nice and clean hotel a few blocks from the center. 
Friendly staff
The best hotel in San Gabriel, not the cheapest but we wanted a good and clean one !!
36 dollars for 2 persons with breakfast

name: Hostal El Huasipungo
description: Basic hostal, not very clean. We paid 20 dolars for a double room with private bath and warm shower. Inside bicycle storage. The lady was friendly and on our demand she prepared a tasty vegetarian dinner.

name: Viewpoint - Mirador
description:
Very cool hike that brings you to a viewpoint where you have an amazing view on both Cotopaxi and Ruminahui volcano, plus view on 3 others snowcaped volcano peaks in a distance. Start as early as you can to get the views without cloud. We started at 6:30 and were at the top at 9am (average pace) and we got lucky with 5 minutes of clear view.

So starting on the trail around the Laguna Limpiopungo, going anticlockwise, after the second hut, you will pass a wooden brigde. This bridge crosses a small creak, and this creak flows following a valley. 10 Meters after the bridge on the right start a trail going up the valley. The first part of the trail is not well defined but you should keep going. This trail goes up in the valley staying always on the left side of the creek. Follow this trail until you reach almost the base of the volcano Ruminahui. From there the trail is less obvious but if you try to find a path going up the ridge on your left, you will finally reach a well defined (rutted) trail. After one switch back this brings you straight up the ridge to the viewpoint. Enjoy!!!

PS: in December the creek was flowing well and water was available almost all along the trail. You should treat it there are cows and horses up.

name: Cruce de Vicuñas
description: Good place to stay overnight, better than the other places for the morning view. Also closer to the volcano.

name: Mirador de Otavalo
description: Perfect hotel, great view on the city and 1km from the city center. Hector the owner is very friendly and can help you to discover the region (Lakes, moutains, markets...). We have paid 10$ for private double room with bathroom!

name: Alto Caribe (venezolana increíble cocina)
description: Waouw ! We came here for diner and we didn’t expect so much. So tasty, very nice service and gentle people ! 3-4$ for arepas and 6-10 for a really tasty meal with an amazing tasty soup ! We got all vegetarian and enjoyed it a lot !

name: Fra Fre
description: Urban gastronomy restaurant - awesome place to eat in the Galápagos! Prices are similar or cheaper than other restaurants. New restaurant founded by brothers Franklin and Freddy, who both graduated from culinary school in Argentina. Delicious food with huge portions: nachos, seafood, pasta, fried rice, etc. Patio seating as well as inside seating.

name: Hospedaje Carigan
description: Nice accommodation for two next to E35 road.  Room has a kitchen attached.  Quiet, clean and secure.  Parking for a car and motorbikes.  Ines and her family are very lovely.  Her young son, Jeremy, knows English and helped with the communication.  Entrance is on a little steep dirt road (20 metres) from E35,  across Tracto Tuning shop.  $15 a night.  Call Ines at +593 97 985 1978.

name: Cotaló Village
description: Very friendly and quiet village. A lot of large parking spaces around an old factory in the center, perfect for long vehicles. People told us it can be used by everyone. No facilities, please keep it clean!

name: El Tambo
description: It is a square next to a ‘centro de informacion turistica’, with some parking spots. We stayed on the corner where it is possible to park our 7.5 meter long truckcamper. Very quiet, between 9 PM and 7 AM. We asked permissies at the tourist office, it was no problem at all. Toilets in the tourist office between office hours.

name: Re Parabrisas Freire Glass
description: Windshield repair after rock chip. Very professional with American resin. Repaired one huge chip and a crack for $40.

name: Camino del Inca Tierraventura
description:
Restaurant with space for one tent . We were there with our tent and bicycles. At the moment it's free to stay here. Amazing view. Very friendly owner, the food is cheap and good. 
Hot shower and toilets open all night for us. A great stop before Sigchos.

name: P&S Sambembe
description: We filled our tank at this petrol station and asked to stay for a night. We were allowed to park beside the trees. Toilets open 24h. Bright light from the petrol station the whole night - safe. There is a little shop selling some snacks.

name: Floresta Nativa Ayampe - Rooms & Pool
description:
Moderator Note: The information is provided by the owner/manager and has not been verified by an overlander.

Hi travellers,  I'm Javier and with Catalina we are travelling from Ushuaia to who knows where, and now we stop moving a bit to make a pit stop at this amazing place. We are glad to receive adventurers like us going south or north if you are by come and share with us. The place is beautiful, 10 min walking to the beach. 

Good vibes, birds, nature and a beautiful pool you can use are here waiting! Sadly it's not allowed to park by the beach in Ayampe but it's still a beautiful place to spend some days and relax. You can go surfing, shopping, everything by walking!

Ps: Our parking area is not that big so make contact before so to save a place WhatsApp: +5493512580143
Cel: +593999494297
Travel safe - buenas rutas...

name: Bomberos
description: You can stay there for free. There's a huge room where you can sleep. Cold showers and WiFi. You can also use the kitchen.

name: Bomberos
description:
They invited us to stay in their meeting room... really friendly. They offered this opportunity to travelers. 
.....
Cherchant un lieu pour camper nous avons demandé aux pompiers leurs conseils, ils nous ont gentiment invité à rester en nous prêtant une pièce qui sert normalement de salle de réunion et leur cours pour laisser nos vélos. Ils ont l’habitude d’accueillir les voyageurs de passage.

name: Arenacafe y vino
description:
We slept in a tent in front. The next morning, the manager offered us to take a shower :) Super nice welcome and the coffee is delicious = D she kindly prepared a breakfast for us to set off on a bike with strength! I recommend this place to all those who wish to spend a quiet moment, with a warm atmosphere.



Nous avons dormi en tente devant. Le lendemain matin, la gérante nous a offert de prendre une douche :) 
Accueil super sympa et le café est délicieux =D elle nous a gentiment préparer un petit dej pour repartir en vélo avec des forces ! 
Je recommande ce lieu à tous ceux qui souhaitent passer un moment tranquille, avec une ambiance chaleureuse.

name: In front of the Arenacafe y vino
description:
Petite place avant le centre du village, il y a des jeux pour enfants et une salle en hauteur construite en bambou qui sert visiblement à des cours particuliers de langue et d’art. Nous nous sommes installées en tente avec nos vélos vers les jeux. 
Nous avons passé une nuit très tranquille. Il y a un  point électricité et eau vers la salle de cours. 
Je recommande le resto d’en face CafeArena&vino tenu par Patricia qui nous on offert l’accès au sanitaire et douches.
En plus, le café colombien est délicieux :) 
L’accueil est top ! Je recommande.

EN : we stay one night with tent next to the children area, in front of the restaurant called CafeArena&vino. 
You can find electricity and water next to the toilets. 
If the door is closed I advice to ask at the restaurant. The owner, Patricia, is really friendly and helpful ! She offer us the shower and toilets. Then her Colombian coffee was delicious !!! Let’s try !

name: Hôtel Plaza La Merced
description:
super place to stay with clean huge rooms
in town

name: Residencia al Mira
description: Basic hostel, 10 usd per person (price a bit high for what you get), heated shower but was cold when we were here, towels provided, bicycle storage in the patio, friendly owner, wifi.

name: Hotel Marquez de Rio
description: Nice hotel on a main road. Secure inner gated yard for all kind of vehicles. Paid $25 with breakfast for single person. Fast WIFI. Couple hundred meters down the road you can find all kind of eateries.

name: empanadas boloñes tamales
description: Cheap local restaurant "El pollo pachanguero". They have typical Ecuadorian almuerzo and merienda, but also good tamales, bolones de verde, empanadas con queso, carne, pollo. We tried also that things in other places and we think that here they make it better. You have to be prepared for hundreds calories - most of their specialties are fried in deep oil, but fresh and tasty.

name: Mashpi Chocolates y Maship Shungo Reserve
description: Very nice natural reserve with a organic cacoa plantation and artesanal chocolate production. They offer a amazing chocolate tour with a nature conservation speech, also you can enjoy a birdwatching walking. Agostina and Alejandro are lovely guests and as ecologist and ornithologist they can offer you a great information about the local nature. In front of the reserve you swimming in the lovely Mashipriver. At the end, the Maship Organic Chocolates is very very delicious!

name: Silvio & Léia House (Brazilian Friends)
description: Silvio and Léia are Brazilian missionaries living in Ecuador.  They are wonderful people, friendly and helpful, they love to receive overlanders.  They live in a closed and safe neighborhood, you can park in front of the house, use the facilities (water, electricity, wifi, bathroom and shower) and enjoy their lovely company.  They don't charge, but they do accept donations.  (New WhatsApp contact +593963120207)

name: Carrizo
description:
It is a beautiful free place to spend the day and night in front of the river. You can bathe in the temperate river. There is shade(?!?). Very calm. The road to get there is a gravel road but it is a few kilometers and is in good condition. Highly recommended place
--- 
Es un hermoso lugar libre para pasar el día y la noche frente al río. Te podes bañar en el río templado. Hay sombra. Muy tranquilo. El camino para llegar es de ripio pero son pocos kilómetros y está en buen estado. Lugar muy recomendado

name: Asiacar Hyundai
description: Changed our brakes (we had the brake pads) since Ford could not lift our Ford Transit with 2.8m heights. Very friendly and very helpful service staff. Highly recommended. Cost was $40.

name: Mirador San José
description: Nice panoramic view of the city and the valley. Can get here by walking from the city, just aim to the long stairs that go to the top of the mount. Along the walk there are big christian signs that display Jesus important facts.

name: Malecón
description: We spent two nights here. It was quiet and looks safe. No one came to take us out. This is the best free spot we found in Machalilla and it is a long street with trees, so you can choose where to park and have some shade.

name: Hot water spring
description: Hot water spring, free for anyone. It has a small pool where hot water can be enjoyed. It's also right next to the river where you can also refresh. It can be resched by walking from Portovelo, it's a 40min walk.

name: great ice-cream
description: Farmer's family who sell delicious homemade fruit ice cream. 0,40dollar. Have one while you enjoy the amazing view of the volcano.

name: Agroturismo Rancho Mila
description:
Moderator Note: The information for this place is apparently provided by the owner/manager. It has not been verified by an overlander.

Rancho Mila is located in one of the most traditional regions of Ecuador. It is surrounded by breath-taking beaches and spectacular mountains. Based on the respect for the environment they created an atmosphere of comfort and balance.

Rancho Mila is based on agrotourism experimentation. It offers rooms and suits close to the nature. You can enjoy farm's life during few days and discuss with local people by few activities (milking cows, garden's visit...)

This really relax place will give you the chance to discover Ecuador by its nature and environmental's practices.

If you want more information you can ask the administrators at: +593 96 942 7448
+593 98 251 7573

name: Finca albenca
description:
Moderator Note: The description for this place is apparently provided by the owner/manager. It has not been verified by an overlander.

In this beautiful finca you can have a chilling rest for few days.
Close to the nature and a really cool river you can enjoy of the Ecuadorian's countryside.

The bambou's house can offer some beds and a bathroom. You can also sleep in your own car on the little parking.

You can help out in the garden or in the farm. The administrators are open to volunteering.

For more information you can send a message at: 
+593 96 942 7448
+593 98 251 7573

name: Guitarras JR Julio Ramirez
description:
Really nice handmade Guitars - the old guy is hard to find but it makes so much sense to look for him !!
I found my new baby here ;-)
Here is his Ecuadorian Phone Number: +593 987773306 or +593 2757805

name: Football soccer place
description:
We stayed there with our bikes and tent for free.
At the end of the street, so it's pretty quiet.
There are 2 groceries .

name: Quinta Los Duendes
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.

Informal campsite, secure parking, can accommodate various rigs, great views of the Cotopaxi volcano. In a private house. Costs 2 USD per rig/tent per night. They also rent out a fully self contained cabin.

name: Guardada city
description:
"Gonzalez" service station (gas station).

Estación de Servicio "González" (gasolinera).

name: Primax
description:
Primax gas station.

Estación de servicio "Primax" gasolinera.

name: "Gladisita" Gas Station
description: Estación de servicio "Gladisita" gas station.

name: "Los Arrayanes"
description: Estación de servicio "Los Arrayanes" gas station.

name: Parque Acuático Balsapamba
description:
Water park. There are pools and slides. Very beautiful place.

Parque Acuático. Hay piscinas y toboganes. Muy bonito lugar.

name: "Balsapamba"
description: Estación de servicio "Balsapamba" gas station.

name: Camping with roof
description:
Foot Soccer with roof.  We stayed there with our tent and bicycles.
Just behind the church .
There is a roof in case of rain.

name: El Tornio de Ruiz
description:
Patricio is the man who will find « the solution » to fix any metallic issue you might have on your cc!. We had troubles with the metal support of the aluminium front storage box, Patricio designed brands new parts strengthening the whole structure within a day.
Great place with friendly staff, highly recommended place.

name: Pierogis y cerveza artesanal
description: Polish pierogi (3$), sausages, craft beer (3,8$) and coffee. very tasty, great view for main plaza.

name: Sol del Venado Fabrica de Cerveza
description: here are a cervecería called sol de venado Whit 6 type of artesanal beer..I'm from Belgium and really happy to find a great beer..I really recommend this place...you can also eat a BBQ meal..or others..for now it's just open on the weekends on that saison..but if you want ..you can maybe ask direct to the owner next house..soon will be a bar direct on the brewery

name: la baguette boulangerie
description:
here are a French bakery running by a French/Belgium couple Romain and his wife...really good bread . baguettes and many others things..all are always fresh..
I really recommend this place ..and have chocolatine .. éclair aux chocolats...humm delicious

name: hostal Sol Inn
description:
The Hostal can take Campers as well on their gated parking lot next door! All other secured places were unavailable in town... so I asked the Owner here! 
the Parking lot is under construction and not really nice... but you have power wifi and water and kitchen showers and banos of the hostal can be used! payed 5$/p/n! Gate locked day and night with a small door to the hostal! Recomended!

name: Hostal Munaylla
description: It's a cheap hostal near to the principal park, we spend a night for 15 dollars.

name: just spot next to the road on the mountain
description: spot next to the road good place for small van or small rigs up to 7 meters. safe and good.

name: Tuna Bistrot
description: Very good vegetarian/vegan restaurant. Almuerzo is $4 and includes entrada/plato/postre/bebida.

name: Laundry service
description: laundry service,  1$/1kg. wash and dry in 3 hours

name: Frente a la casa de Franklin
description:
Spectacular spot by the sea. In front lives Franklin who offers toilet and shower

Lugar espectacular, de cara al mar. En frente vive Franklin y su flia que ofrecen baño y duchas.

name: Estacionamiento frente al mar
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

A very large place to park, free, facing the sea. There are some quinchos of straw to use, and to hang hammocks. It can make fire.
---
Un lugar muy amplio para estacionar, gratis, frente al mar. Hay unos quinchos de paja para usar, y para colgar hamacas. Se puede hacer fuego.

name: Megaclean lavanderia
description:
Very nice laundromat where you can do your own laundry, washing and drying or they can do your laundry with same day delivery when you bring the laundry early morning.
They have machines with 5 different load capacities, from 3 to 7 USD for a machine.
Also soap available for a normal price.
Possibility to park before the laundromat with a van, maximum 6 meter long.

name: Quiet Beach-Place
description: Quiet place far from The street with a lot of crabs during THE Night. Wat To THE Beach is Sand but no problem Even for a Big van. Lovely Stau !!

name: DR.CELL   Cellphon repair
description:
Mi Cellphon didn't start due Saltwater.
Wilson couldn't repair it. To much oxidation.
But he could copy my Files and Pictures on a micro SD card. Took 3 Days. Cost 40$.
good Job.
Recommended...

name: Best Restaurant in the North
description: Simple restaurant  with fresh fish and love - highly recommended- I will come back.

name: Champisti Restaurant
description: Nice place behind fuel station. Daily menu and other options. Clean. Fast service. Wifi. Big parking

name: Ecoparque Carchi
description: Huge free eco park, river, lakes, playgrounds, carp area, grills, shower-free baths, large parking lot, and plenty of green walking.

name: Playa Africa
description: Far from the street (approximately 15-20 minutes drive on sandy road) is a black/grey sanded beach in a beautiful bay. The museo/hostal “villa paz” is up on a cliff - so no direct contact - you can camp in peace.

name: Hostal Tierra de Fuego
description: Is a great Hostel, it has a big terrace, and public zones, the staff is very friendly. You can use the kichen, a lot of supermarkets and stores near to it. A paid $5,6 Usd per night in a shared room. The internet is good. The hostel has only 2 bathrooms. Is a relax Hostal, the travelers usually sleeps and wake up to early to climb mountains. No party Hostel. It has parking for car or motorcycle.

name: Hosteria La Estelita
description: Close to the clowns, beautiful place and amazing view to the city and lake.2.700hi. Warm swimming pool, sauna and big comfortable rooms. Breakfast included. Very nice family place. 6km up to the Panamerican. Unpaved road. Good food. They have trekking to the lake.

name: Zona militar
description: Here is a permanent military control point - the soldiers recommend not to continue the last 2 km until the border because it’s dangerous.

name: Centro Intercultural Comunitario de pueblos y nacionalidades
description: Place founded by the local people but financed by the government - they build marimbas, make music and a lot of other interesting things - you have to visit

name: Torbellino music and dance
description:
Asociacion Folklorica Cultural TORBELLINO - music and dance school with roots from Ecuador and Colombia.
From Monday to Friday at 7pm you can spend a nice time with really good musicians and happy dancers. 
I recommend a lot.

name: El Picatodo en la chocita de Doña Vero
description: Very good local food (fresh fish from the river, etc.) in a lovely place.

name: Servicios Tecnico de refrigeración
description:
The unique place in Riobamba that repairs fridge in the city. Oscar does a professional job by checking any leaks prior to refill the air-conditioning circuit.
I would recommend it for cc and 4x4 like our

name: Mirador on cañon ! Really Nice view. To rest/ camp
description: Nice mirador just 4min walks from the trail ! Worth it ! Roof and bench to rest. Roof to camp. Really nice !

name: Sangay Volcano View (Lava at night)
description: Lovely couple are constructing a restaurant here. There is lots of space next to the road for parking (free). Amazing views of the valley and sangay volcano. You can hike down through the jungle to the river (very steep and muddy, apparently lots of wild animals). A little bit of traffic during the night but we were able to see the sangay volcano in the distance and even the lava flow at night! A good camera or binoculars definitely would have helped. We felt very safe here. Small creek with drinking water according the the restaurant owner just across the road. We drank it, no issues whatsoever.

name: Hostal Manta Tropical
description: The hostel is 200 m above the beach in walking distance to the Pacific Shopping Mall. A quiet Place to rest. Small Swimming pool. Rooms are available from 45 to 50$ for two Persons

name: Taller Pizzaro
description:
Juan Vasquez is an excellent professional for any metallic repairs.
WhatsApp contact. +593 990497721.

name: Laguna Curiquingue
description:
Nice and quiet place to spend a night away from the Panamericana. Reachable trough a very well preserved (as of Jan 2020) dirt road. 

I arrived on a Monday evening and there was no one around. There is a small store and toilets, but they were locked during my stay. I assume it is only open during weekends. Several people saw me going to the campsite but nobody bothered me during my stay. Good place to set up a tent plus a campfire, and there is also parking space for decently sized rigs, but it's not even. There is a small dock by the lake as well. 
 
Free for me, but I can't say if they charge for camping during weekends.

name: Cascada El Tingo
description:
This is where you have to take the dirt road to the "Waterfalls/Thermals El Tingo" spot nearby. 
Quite narrow most of the the way just by the cliff, but we drove both ways with our front wheel. There is a nice flat space at the end where you park and can turn around comfortably.  you can park before the old police truck of jou are not to big (sprinter size fit). By the way, watch your GPS as you will be crossing the Equator in this dirt road as well!

name: Sports center
description:
At the end of the town , covered soccer field . 
We stayed there with our bikes and hammocks.
400 meters from the center.

name: Soccer field with roof
description:
We stayed there with our bikes and hammocks. There is a roof in case of rain , water available , but bathrooms are out of order ! 
Be aware : there is a HUGE downhill to come here . 
Only for bikes , motorbikes , walkers or 4 WD.
The view is amazing and it's very quiet.

name: hostal conejito
description: run by nice local Familly ..paid 15 use for the bed Whit dinner and breakfast  I...wifi..etc it's ok room are clean

name: La Chilca church plaza
description:
a small town on the way to Loja.
In front of the church is the main square. We stood between the square and the small football field ( 7 meter motorhome). We ask the neighbours an they told us that it's quiet and save.

name: Old road behind mound
description: This spot is behind a small mound on the old road. A little bit hidden from the main road, traffic noise reduced. Great views and big rig friendly. We had only a coffee here, but this would also make a good overnight stop, if you are heading over the mountain range. Claro 3G reception.

name: Parking lot behind the beach
description:
We spent a night here for free, but there are several signs with $2 USD for parking leyend. It was a quiet nigth and no one bothered us at all. People around seems pretty kind. In the town you can find 50cts shower and 25 cts bathrooms. Nice little beach! But no sunset.

Pasamos una noche gratis aquí, aunque en algún momento pueden cobrar porque hay letreros que dicen que cuesta $2 USD. El lugar estuvo tranquilo y nadie nos molestó por estar ahí. La gente es amable.
La playa es chiquita y linda, pero no hay atardecer porque el sol se esconde detrás de la montaña.
En el pueblo hay alquiler de ducha por 50cts y baño por 25 cts.

name: Nice view next to the road
description: A flat piece of land with a very nice view next to a church and a very friendly couple that owns a little shop and a farm.They where very interested in our van and came to talk with us. Good stop when you are driving to the Coast. A neighbor brought us frech cheese. And in the morning frech milk,  So friendly!

name: flat grasfield quit place
description: One dollar parking place, very quit on a grassfield behind a house. Friendly owner. close to the national park.

name: Tecnitranstar- Cajas manuales y automaticas
description: Don Carlos is THE gear box specialist in Riobamba (actually couldn't find any other). He gets the contacts for spare parts and knows how to handle these complex systems. Very nice and honest, he practices fair prices. He provided me with electricity and bathroom during the 3 days necessary for the job to be completed. Cellular: +593 998 474 676

name: Casa campesina
description: Perfect for cyclist. it's 2,50 usd per adult and 0,50 usd for kids, for one night in dormitory, but it's possible to have family room.

name: Hostal Solar del Puerto
description: we were looking for a place with private parking and got to this hostal. it's a bit expensive, 30$ for a private room with private bathroom and hot shower, breakfast included. private parking in closed lot on the property

name: Hotel Alpachaca
description: Perfect place for you (and your car) to rest really close to the airport. Clean, safe, cheap, warm welcome, flexible, everything better than expected. I will come next time it’s sure !!!!

name: Hot Showers!!!
description: This hostel: Chaski Ñan offers showers for wild campers and overlanders for US$5. May be a bit expensive but this was the only option I could find in town (although it is low season at the moment and not a lot of places are open). In my opinion though it was money well spent after a day hiking around the crater before settling into my tent for a cold night!! The shower was very hot and the guy was nice and friendly. He even offered me soap and shampoo but I had my own. In case your wondering I pitched my tent in the grass car park (also marked on iOverlander) (on your right when you first come into town - opposite turn off to main car park, at first not visible from the road as it is behind some buildings) and camped there two nights for free.

name: Puerto Banana Hotel
description: Place is fantastic. New, huge locked parking attached, faces park, elevators, hot water, ac, wifi, super clean and very friendly staff. emailed ahead and got a room for 1 with breakfast for $30. Area seemed sketchy but park across the street, few shops and restaurants its kinda nice. Map shows it around the corner, not accurate. You will see the new 5 story building facing park.

name: La Casetta Pizzeria Italiana (Vegetarian/Vegan)
description:
Nice little restaurant with Pizza made out of Sourdough. This is an Vegetarian/Vegan Restaurant. They also offer Pasta, Lasanga and Craftbeer. The dishes are hugh! Pizzas from 7,5-11 USD. Canneloni and Lasagna for 3,5-4 and Pasta for 6. It was really delicios!!
Tel. 072640339

name: sabores lojanos
description: This place is located at Loja' central market and it has an amazing food. I payed 2.5$ and I ate an amazing local food.

name: El Idolo Restaurant (with showers!!)
description:
Friendly family-run restaurant serving traditional grilled plates. We had the grilled pork and beef, served with boiled potatoes and Ecuadorian style fava(?) beans. Super tasty! Big plates, we took a Tupperware container of leftovers with ya. Nice vibe inside despite the appearance outside. 

Also they have showers! And nice bathrooms! And a playground in the parking lot for kids! Pretty sure they’d let us camp too. Nice spot coming or heading to the border.

name: Agrocalidad De Ecuador
description:
Veterinary Services to get the documents to exit Ecuador. Located in Tumbaco, Quito.
At the beginning of the street is a vet who provides the Certificado de Salud.

name: Asociacion Hermano Miguel
description: Not allowed to do anything here - but very safe and calm.

name: Yamor chicha Otavaleña de 7 maíz
description:
Nice place to taste the famous chicha Yamor. Really tasty, sweet enough, weak in alcohol ! (0,50$ glass to 3$ for big big jar)
9 pequeñas empanadas de banano para 1$ ! 
Vale la pena ! Worth a visit and a taste !

name: Rough road for travel bicycles
description: 'camino de piedras' as described by locals. nice path to get/exit from national park Cotopaxi - hard road for travel bikes. but plenty of "camionetas" can lift you.

name: beginning/end of bad road for bicycles
description: 'camino de piedras' as described by locals. hard to do this portion with travel bicycles but lots of camionetas (4 wheels drives) would kindly lift you .

name: almuerzo cusubamba
description:
good almuerzo
the time we went was quinua soup, jugo de Maizena (our first time in Ecuador, very good to taste!), chicken/rice/pasta with mayonese/salad.
owner nice
$2 pp cheaper you can't find :-D

name: football stadium
description:
safe place to stay, Tienda just next to it where if you are nice to the lady and buy some small stuff there she will let you use the water tap. just need to open the blue gate (open all the time). better to inform the lady of the Tienda you are staying here.
place to park with vans in front.
ok for cyclists

name: paradero "tres huesitos"
description:
bueno restaurant serving famous cuy.
$3 almuerzo con pollo 
$5 almuerzo con cuy
$6.50 almuerzo con conejo
nice people
good mora Juice

name: hostería Pakari
description:
hotel on panamericana with swimming pool
negotiated $25 with breakfast per night for two people
room average, bathroom bit oldish but ok.

name: Close to Road
description: Safe place to camp wild close to the road but far enough not to be seen or bothered. locals working in the fields might say hello :-) Waterfall and river close to get water (to filter). Local people say this place is safe.

name: panadería
description:
great panadería on the way to Macas.
owner super nice

name: Laguna de Llaviuco
description:
You can either climb a bit and get to the terrasse or stay above the terrasse.
Quite cold at night (humidity).
running water but needs to be filtered.
had to pay $4 pp even though there is no facility... discussed with the entry guard but they insisted.

name: Guayuza Runa
description:
The Community Jacinto.
There are a few indigenous families living here. 
The Place is called 'Guayuza Runa'! 
I met a girl of the Tripe in Puyo. She invited me to stay in their community. You can camp here and get the full experience of the indigenous tribe 'Kichwa'. 
They take you on rainforest tours, they have cabanas, they have a lot of knowledge about the medicinal plants of the Amazonas. You can get the Ayahuasca experience together with the familia! 
You find them on FB under  'Guayuza Runa'.
whatsapp of the daughter Rosa 0969853522.

name: Bar de Leslie
description:
Fantastic place to stop. Barbara, its owner, is very kind and friendly. Drinks are served (micheladas, cocktails, beers, water, juices, ice cream). Good place to enjoy the beach with music and refreshments

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Es un parador fabuloso, Barbara su dueña es muy amable y amigable. Se sirven bebidas (micheladas, cócteles, cervezas, agua, jugos, helados). Buen lugar para disfrutar de la playa con música y refrescos

name: Hostal Montañita
description: Very good accomodation in El Carmelo. 15 USD for one night for matrimonial. Hot shower and parking inside for two cars. I'm not sure how much exactly but entrance has a limit around 2,4 m. Good place to stop by. Owner said there is WiFi but we couldn't connect to any network. :)

name: Gas station
description: Big gas station with a little store. WiFi, water, toilets 24h

name: Free Wi-Fi at the public library
description:
Public library with free Wi-Fi (and good average speed). Just ask at the reception for the password.
The place has chairs, tables and plugs for your computer/phone.

name: El Sabor Costeno
description: Restaurant with wide variety an lovely staff, prices are middle of the road, good lunch stop from Loja heading North! Also this town is the antipode of Kuala Lumpur - very important for RTW!

name: Baños Doña Gloria
description: Really nice family that owns the natural showers where drivers stop to have a bath. They let us set up our tent beside a small hut near the river for free, and they also have a swimming pool you can use for 1USD. Very recommended!

name: Restaurante Vegeteriano GENESIS 1:29
description:
Maria Antonia has open recently this vegeterian restaurant. It's really nice place with deliciuos food. 
We really recommend to eat here. It' s all home made and cheap: 3 dolars for a menu :)

Photo gallery: Maria Antonia infront of the restaurant

name: Margarita's Restaurant
description: Good cheap restaurant have just breakfast and lunch a this moment. they have attention until 16:00. have bathrooms and shower very clean. if you ask maybe they let you put a tent to spend the night. Margarita lives in the building next to the bamboos.

name: Rico Pan
description: Biggest bakery in town

name: Intikilla Hostel
description: $1.00. Shower service in the hostel! Monica was super friendly! with hot water and good pressure! highly recommended

name: Free place for vaccinations Centro de salud
description: Get your free yellow fever vaccine here! Other vaccinations also available. Only on Wednesdays and try and come early

name: Hot Springs
description: Nice hot springs to chill when you come down from cold Chimborazo. Entry is 1$ and if you talk with the owner she might let you stay for a night to camp. We could clean clothes, sleep and have a nice bath alone at night. You can also buy some supplies and in entry eat something with mamitas doing some meals. El salado is 5kms away and there are more supplies if needed(Tuesday marketplace)

name: Max International Bar
description: Do not miss Max’s rest, bar, place of talking and resolving the world! Max is a nice person that will make you have a great moment. Great local food, some beverages before climbing to Simiatug or going down to El salado

name: Pizzeria Aliani
description: Pizzeria with super delicious crunchy thin crust pizzas, the best one we've had in 5 months travelling in South America! :)

name: Cafe del grillo
description: Awesome coffee & cakes, lovely owners. A couple that offers a lot of hospitality. (open Wednesday-Saturday)

name: Mercado Central (aka Palace of Fried Pigs)
description: We know you’ve been eyeing those whole pigs hanging on the side of the road. Here’s your chance to finally try one! This is your standard local eatery crowded with stalls all selling variations of traditional Ecuadorian fare. Including those marvelous pigs! The best fried pig you’ve ever had! So good. Most plates run around $4 and they come loaded.

name: Parking garage
description: Good spot to park right near the town center! Very secure, restrooms onsite, super friendly older gent working there. Charges $1/hour but only charged us $2 for 3 hours.

name: Taller de William
description: We changed our brakes for a Mitsubishi L300 here, as the place was recommended by a local in Canoa. They charged us $10 USD for the labour and they did a great job. The guy really knew what he was doing and also lubricated the parts and did a few extra bits for the price. Excellent job. You do have to get the parts from the town but it's a 5min drive and the guys at the workshop can tell you exactly where to go to get the parts you need, also for $1.5 dollars they can take you in a scooter to get the parts.William's number is +593959457735

name: Banco Internacional Cash Machine
description: After having our cards rejected in many cash points on the small towns of Ecuador we found this Cashpoint which worked with our Mastercards and didn't charge us any transaction fee.

name: Balcón Cuencano
description: Nice hostel. Cheepest we could find. Private rooms with private bathrooms was 7.5 usd or 12usd per person. Has a nice kitchen with few supplies available. Wifi was good and hot shower was very nice.

name: Swiss Corner - Swiss Backery
description: Delicious bread, cakes and coffee. Not expansive. ☺

name: Pub, snacks&cofee Gordon blues
description:
It is a place to listen to music, entertain and relax. A very good service is provided, its owner Juan is a very kind person and always willing to help. The bar has wave rock, jazz and blues


Es un lugar para escuchar música, entretenerse y relajarse. Se brinda un muy buen servicio, su dueño Juan es una persona muy amable y siempre dispuesto a ayudar. El bar tiene onda rock, jazz y blues

name: Cafe San Sebas
description: Really nice diner style spot with North American influence. Wooden tables, great service. On the plaza. We had a big breakfast for about $6pp. Cafe con leche for $1.5. Cozy. Outdoor seating as well. Recommended!

name: Salinas drinkable water
description: We ask the locals the water is drinkable they told. right side of the market hall. you can drive there with any vehicle.

name: Lubricadora Andy Splash
description:
good and clean place to change oil
this place have full synthetic oil which is way better than mineral oil as many place in South America
the also have filter 
30$ for oil change for a 4 runner
the owner is very friendly

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Standard check in, just asked for TIP and sent us on our way.

name: Bombero
description: Woahhh! Such nice bomberos. They love to chat and eat together. They shared a lot of fruit with us. There’s no kitchen but WiFi and nice people!

name: Immigration office
description: This is where you go to get your passport stamped if you are leaving to Peru vía Rio Napo. They no longer stamp it in Nuevo Rocafuerte. You’ll get your entry stamp into Peru in Pantoja

name: Parque La Madre
description: People from el Guabo is really kind. We slept here for 7 nights. Richard from Las Acacias restaurant gave us water and Wi-Fi, is such a nice person, we had good chats with him. Toilets on the opposite side of the car for 25 cts. We took a shower in the fireman building and we sold our handcrafts. There is a plug to charge the phone in the scenario in the park.

name: Refugio Lagunas Ozogoche
description: We put our tent under a small cover area in an old open shelter a few meters after the bridge. Natural water from the river, althought not clean because there are many animals nearby. Friendly locals and nice trekking around the lagoons.

name: in front of the chimborazo
description: Just a wild camping spot, flat and windy but an excellent veiw. could possibly drive down into the valley more to break some of the wind.

name: Restaurants Fátima
description: Lovely restaurant with cheap and good food.  They also have good wifi.

name: Intihuatana
description:
Excellent site in the Busa lagoon, there are rooms for $80 US, but you can also stay in the motorhome for $10 US
It has a swimming pool, hydromassage, restaurant, and many gardens, even with an organic garden.
In addition, the people of the place are super super friendly They also sold us vegetables from their organic garden. Highly recommended !!

name: Pet Hotel - Villa Canina GYE
description:
Hotel for pets/dogs. They charged us 15$/day; for 20$ you can get a kennel with AC.
Open from 9.00 am to 5.00 pm.
We used the pet hotel during our stay on Galapagos Islands.
We comunicate for a reservation by Instagram:  villacaninagye !

Tel.: 098 084 5450 ( the speak less English )

name: senor Bolivar "taller America"
description:
It's a place with 2 differents mechanic the one is "Senor Bolivar". We had a serious problem with our van since 1 month and nobody helped us really. After few hours he helped us and fix the problem quickly. The  work is great and the price fair. It's better to call him before it's a really nice guy! +593 99 946 6833.

Super garagiste indépendant qui a très bien réparé notre van et pour un prix vraiment correcte. Il vaut mieux l'appeler avant d'arriver.

name: Vista al Mar
description: Hostel is located on main Avenida Baltra. entrance is a bit hidden, you need to go down in something looking like an open garage. This hostel has variation of dormitory, single room and doubles. Prices vary depends on low or high season. Free drinkable water, kitchen and owner Roberto is super friendly! he can give you a lot of recommendations and help with trips / transportation. He also has kayaks and bikes that you can negotiate and rent for 1/3 price than in the town / on the beach. The only bad thing is slow internet. But after visiting couple of different places I found it normal on Galapagos. Highly recommend!

name: Casa China
description: some serious chicken curry, crunchy peppers the whole 9 yards.. reminds me of the chinese back home in Ireland some job lads

name: parking lot Climbing área
description:
small parking lot in Cojitambo Climbing área. there are just one or two flat places to park and overnight. The other spots in the other aire of the Hill are much better.
To reach this point you Drive left from the main square down Road and just on a curve there is a dirt Road and you take this and Drive Up año the way until you reach a church. The parking lot is on the left side. The dirt road is not really good but doable with any Kind of car. no Big rigs.

name: Electromecánica Pardo
description:
If you have any electric problem with your car, Iván Pardo can repair anything and he has also lots of parts to change and sell. 
Come here, one of the best on Cuenca and super good price for travellers

name: sangay volcano overlook
description:
An amazing stop  with views of the Sangay volcano and the mountain range. Nancy and her husband are currently building a tourist stop ( in process) their land cover 108 hectares of forest and you can take a lovely hike to the river. if lucky you'll see the volcano erupting at night as well!! 
Support their protect and come visit them! it really worth it.

name: Pension Valladolid
description:
Pension Valladolid is a small pension / hotel. 
Basic but clean room. Very cheap, 5$ per person per night. We could park our motorbikes within the courtyard for the night at no extra cost. 
No breakfast provided but you can find breakfast / lunch and diner next door on the main plaza. 
Nice little city for a night break, not far from the frontier Ecuador / Peru. 
The road from Vilcabamba that leads to Valladolid is a bit sketchy sometimes because of landslides in some parts, but the landscapes around it are absolutely stunning, especially at sunset

name: Public bathrooms-potable water
description: Behind covered basketball court is a pink building.  Bathroom was free to use and water in sink just outside is potable.  Can fill bottles and jugs but not directly to vehicle tank (too far).

name: Main plaza
description: We got into town after 6 p.m. Asked at the petrol station they advised us to stay at the square as it is safe. We could use the bathroom from the petrol station. Added bonuses:free WiFi at the square (slow) and a gym next to the gas station for 2 USD you can do your workout and have a shower after.

name: Museo Otavalango
description: On the site of the historic San Pedro textile factory the local community has a project museum...they purchased the factory (now empty) and now give tours where you can learn the history of blanket and textile weaving, but even more interesting about the life and customs of the indigenous people.  $5 per person. With a group of ten or more and advance notice, Rene, the head of the project, can arrange demonstrations of tradition weaving (they have both blackstrap as well as wooden mechanical looms), as well as with the curandero or “sabio ” who explains the medicinal herbs and healing ceremonies.  Contact Rene at 062903879. English speaking guides usually available. Also can consult on other nearby places to visit as it is convenient to the local sites around Otavalo

name: Como Hecho en Casa - hipster asado eestaurant
description:
A modern take on a homemade Ecuadorian meal. Grilled meats that come out on a grill platter, plus a side of veg. See the photo. Delicious! The $5 chicken is great value. A ton of food. The mixed meat dish was a bit fatty, but still a lot of meat for $13!

Hours are Friday to Sunday, 11:00-22:00

name: Museo Vivente Otavalango (Antigua Fabrica San Pedro)
description:
It is possible to camp at the museum.  The director of the museum and his wife and extended family are warm, welcoming people.  There is plenty of room for big rigs. Bathroom and one shower available.  
There is also a small cabin where backpackers without their own gear can spend the night.  $5 per night.

name: River People Rafting
description:
We booked a great one day rafting trip on the fantastic Jatunyacu (class III) River. We felt super safe with a professional company! And had a lot of fun with our 3! guides. Highly recommended (Irish) family run  enterprise (therefore English speaking).
There are also very cozy cabañas with a really nice pool and bar!

name: Alimaki
description: Handicraft workshops. A place to interact with artisans and try your handicraft skills. Pets are very welcome to run in 1ha or stay with their humans while in the workshops

name: wifi
description:
Good wifi in the civil registry office and free
-------
Buen wifi en la oficina de registro civil y gratis

name: Abandoned House
description: Abandoned house along the Panamericana. Perfect for cyclists touring in Ecuador in rainy season. Asked a local whether it’s possible to camp in the abandoned house. She said it’s fine.

name: Feria ganadera
description:
Very good place to camp, it has spaces to grill, a few meters from the Miriumi river
---
Muy buen lugar para acampar, cuenta con espacios para hacer asados techados, a pocos metros del río miriumi

name: Muelle Flotante de Cachiviro
description: Small port with restaurants and artisan shops. Large parking area with lights. Locals invited us to park in the gated area, closer to the shops, but the parking lot was more than enough for us.  Well-lit but not overpowering.  Very safe.  Another local recommended here instead of the other spot East of here as it’s safer. Local ladies were fun to talk to. Follow the stone road to get here.

name: Agrocalidad Ibarra
description: Here you get the certificate to cross the border to Colombia with your pet after getting the health certificate from a veterinaria.

name: Incanto Gelato Artesanal
description: Great sandwiches and ice cream, wonderful house made bread.  Excellent service too !

name: El Panecillo view point
description: Awesome view over the city, at some steps or 5 min by car from the old city. Possibility to park even with a big rig for 1$.

name: Camping Pequeno Paraíso
description: A small paradise, surrounded by trees, close to Pailon Del Diablo and Cascada Machai. There is parking for campers, buses, and trucks. It provides space for tents, with roof and outdoors. And also private rooms. Access to wifi, games room, kitchen, hot shower, barbecue and swimming pool.

name: Near cabañas Carihuairazo
description:
Beatiful spot  front the Chimborazo and Carihuairazo volcanoes. Free. The Road is Bad and bumpy but doable with any vh. From the Main route are only 4 km. 
 Awesome views, many hiking posibilities, super quiet, many vicuñas and cold of course. 
  In this place we met Darío and Ernesto, who lives nearby and manage the cabins that are in front. They were super friendly with us and offered water (You can bring from the cabins). Ernesto's daughter is weaving caps and wool gloves, you can help them by buying something.

name: Nice hidden place by the road
description: Quiet and nice place hidden from the road. There is a bridge, two small buildings and toilets (I thing open 24/7). A lot of trees and a creek. We asked in the shop by the road and it wasn't problem to stay overnight.

name: Automundo
description: Very helpful staff. Rene is the owner and speaks a little german. His daughter-in-law Anna is austrian and helped us a lot, too. Highly recommended - especially for german speaking people! +593 99 767 4437

name: Kimbi House
description:
A very relaxed retreat with a large room that has space for 5 people and a lot of floor room. There is a private shower with water hot enough to turn your skin pink. 
They have a lock up space for vehicles down the street. 
$17 p night inc breakfast. Pets welcome. 
There is a listing on AirBnB for photos. 
If you’re looking for a place to wind down. This is it with hot thermal springs, walks etc very near by.

name: Servicio automotriz Molina
description:
267/5000
Super conscientious and professional garage owner
José took care of us as soon as we arrived and solved our brake problem very quickly
Has a bridge
Very clean workshop
Any mechanical intervention possible
Please note: entrance is a bit narrow

name: Chocolaterie Dikati (prévenir de sa venue +593 99 184 5112)
description: Small chocolate factory with tasting, visit to the production laboratory, and purchase of products possible

name: Free Wifi
description: Free Wi-Fi in Parque Sucre and other places in the city

name: Ojos del volcán, Las Antenas
description: The place is very comfortable. the family Bastidas Lierena live here, good people. Have a restaurant with very delicious food . Maybe 14 cars for parking. Have 3 rooms  for 12 people.

name: Alonzo Mechanic
description: Juan is a friendly guy who helped us to find the part we needed to fix a small leak from our transmission quickly. He is an automatic transmission specialist but it seems he works on other things too. big workshop, should be fine even for big rigs.

name: Hôtel Iguanazu bnb
description: Very nice hotel in a quiet area of ​​Guayaquil.  Nice view of the city, center quickly accessible.  The whole establishment is perfectly clean.  Swimming pool, enclosed garden with trees, TV room, wifi.  Excellent breakfast.  You can also eat for lunch and dinner.  The owner speaks very good French.  If you want to have a good time, don't hesitate !!!  In a few weeks, there will also be a site for travelers with backpacks or vehicles, with a shared kitchen, girls 'and boys' dormitories, showers, wifi.  Whastapp +593 99 986 7968

name: Petro Comercial
description:
We’ve been told they WILL NOT sell gas to license plates from other countries. From this town till the border it is “contrabanda”. 

Be INFORMED!! Fill your tanks before coming this far to the border

name: Hostel Crossman
description:
Small hostel in a calm street. Just 6 minutes walking to supermarket and water taxis.
They have family rooms, double bed rooms and 4-bed dorms. Rooms with wifi and showers. Kitchen is outside.

We stayed 4 nights.

name: Bosque de Quishuar
description: Place to put your tent up before going to Laguna Amarilla. Not perfectly flat but ok. Natural water nearby on the rivers and some protection of the wind and rain by the trees. From here it's a 1h uphill climb to the viewpoint of the lagoon. This is property of the Sangay National Park and free to camp.

name: Hotel Charvic
description: Cheap hotel with rooms from 12usd for a couple. Good shared bathrooms with hot shower and equiped kitchen. Barbacue place on the rooftop and washing area. Best economic option we could find in Baños. Camping is posible for 4usd per person on the rooftop with covered area.

name: Hotel San Luis
description: Great hotel in front of the bus station. Private room with private bathroom from 10usd per person but negotiable. Kitchen is available to use and rooftop with laundry area. Super friendly staff.

name: Las Cuevas restaurant
description: Good trout but very, very long service (maybe because we were on sunday ? ). Medium prices (around 7 $ the dish).

name: ALULEMA
description: Mechanic and parts. Helpful. Fast. Suitable for big rig. Maybe expensive.

name: Don Jacinto's “Sala de Eventos”, Cumbe
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I did not notice any accommodation en route. In Cumbe I asked around and was told there was no formal accommodation. Luckily, I met a kind lady called Norma in her tienda (S3.08533 W79.01410)and she said I could camp in her dad’s large enclosed “Sala de Eventos” (Events Hall). We crossed the road to her Dad's house (S3.08526 W79.01433) and he said OK, I could camp in the Sala. I followed him there. It was about 500 m N. It was a good place to camp.  

Pros: tent protected from rain. Bathrooms with water. 110V outlet and lights in bathroom. Tables & chairs. Water. Secure (I locked myself inside). I donated $5 for camping. Worth the money. Cons: No shower. My Claro SIM card had no data service, hence no internet.

Note that iOverlander had listed rooms in a private home belonging to a man called “Don Juan”. No-one I spoke to had heard of him.

name: Sports Stadium, Yangana
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, there was one hotel at 0.5 km, then nothing, not even in Yangana. There I was told by several folk that the covered “Cancha” (sports stadium) was free for tent camping. This had open sides, bathrooms, water and 110V inside the bathrooms. There was no internet service in town. My Claro SIM card did not have any service, but I learned later that certain spots had a usable Claro connection, for phone calls/SMS only. (No internet).

I camped for 1 night under cover in the Cancha (sports stadium) in Yangana. This was a worthwhile camp. Pros: Free camp. Bathrooms had sinks, lighting, water,110V, and were open 06h00-23h00. I camped on a smooth clean covered surface above the Cancha. See photo. It had a convenient bench and trashcan nearby. Folk in town were friendly and welcoming. I enjoyed dinner at local restaurant (07h00-19h00). Stores had adequate supplies and were open 06h00-21h00. Cons: Noise and bright lights in the Cancha until about 23h00. Thereafter there was loud music until about 01h30. After that it was peaceful. No barking dogs. Traffic was a bit noisy until about 21h00, and from 06h00 on.

name: Rancho Gypsyland
description: Quiet campsite at small organic farm only two kilometers from the beach and town. Place is still under constructions, but there is a toilet and you can use water for showering.  One official shower will be ready soon. Roman, the German owner, also bakes amazing bread. There is also a lot of cute animals around which includes dogs, cats, geese, chickens, goats etc.., so a lot of fun

name: Tellus Mater House
description:
Moderator Note: The information for this place appears to have been submitted by an owner/manager. It has not been verified by an Overlander.

It’s a cozy country house with big space  for camping, we have a little orchard. Behind us you can find the PASOCHOA ecological reserve, and the bike tour of the 9 volcanoes! You will enjoy so much staying here and touring new and exciting Places

name: Full Inyection Service
description: We made the adjustment of injectors and valves as well as the turbo cleaning. Very good job, fast, serious and cheap.

name: Hostería Playa Nuestra
description: Lodging in a farmer house, front  the sea and to 5 km from Cojimies. Surrounded by palm trees. Restaurant service and camping

name: Sewing& Couture Prata Kabir
description: Very nice ladies did a great job constructing thermal curtains for my camper. They were quick to provide an awesome result and for a really decent cost. highly recommended.

name: Pyramids de Cochasqui
description: The park is open, it is just the parking area that is closed.  This is a great little wild camp just a few km away.  Can take any size vehicle.

name: auto flash mecanica
description: great people

name: saquisili
description:
Motoresport
we had problem with automatic steering gear and they were of very good advice. They tested vehicle for half hour and no charge.

name: Camping By the River
description: Beautiful wild campground by the river. 10 mts. from an unpaved road to San Jose de Mashpi.

name: Clínica del freno
description:
In this place, they can fix damage to the entire brake system in any type of vehicles.

En este lugar pueden solucionar daños en todo el sistema de frenos en cualquier tipo de vehículos

name: Macanas tailler  José Jimenez
description: Nice place to see how they make macanas. artisanal shop. they explain us all the processus.

name: mercado central
description: you can eat here for 1 dollars in the differents shop. you can buy fruits and vegetebals too. Wc.

name: Sol de Piedra
description:
Nice hôtel with differents type of rooms. 15 dollars /person with breakfast  and 22 with thermas ( balneario) and breakfast .
good breakfast. 
possible to eat at restaurant.

name: Hosteria Pacific Stone
description: This site is a hosteria for vacations. It Has cabanas as well. Very convenient for overnight parking on the way from Esmaraldas to San Lorenzo or Camarones. Has clean banos and open shower (cold). Has a restaurant on site. you can use the eating area (free) and the pool for a small fee. But, there is music all day. We enjoyed.

name: Cayapas Mataje
description: Reserve of Manglares. Good place for camping. Clean and safe. Gratis. Two cabanas available with matres.  5 dolars per person.

name: Estero de Platano (pueblo)
description: Wild camping by the ocean. Little fishermen village. Can hire boats for fishing and whale watch. Very friendly. We used the toilet in restaurants. No cellular signal!

name: Flor De Mompiche -Hotel
description:
A green area in the hotel courtyard. There are running water toilet, cold water shower  excelent service, restaurant, wifi.
5 dolars pp. On the main road. 
3 min walking from the beach. 
 Also recomend the hotel. All new! Very good value for money.

name: DANNY MOTORS
description:
Mechanical shop on ruta 35, near Chunchi. Very professional. Unusual clean and organized place. Danny, the owner, is a very kind person. Not just basic mechanic. Highly recommended!  We had some problems with the exhaust which he solved quickly and perfectly.
tl. 0985805348, 0993422467

name: Quinta Dorada cafeteria
description: In Riobamba. Address:Garcia Moreno between 10 Agosto y Primera Constituyente. Located in the oldest colegio Riobamba.  Great organic coffee from Loja. Excellent food for breakfast. Very nice environment. Maria and the family are very nice people. Highly recommended

name: Casa de peregrini Santo Thomas
description: Very nice hotel. Good and safe parking place. Autobuses can enter the parking. Warm shower, good internet. We paid 10 usd pp. Nice staff. At weekends nice breakfast is available at extra cost.

name: Llankay
description: A small but very noce hostel, in the village La Josefina in the mountains of north Ecuador. There is wifi. Good food. Very nice family. Can contact snr. Alicia tl. cell. 0988204334

name: Hostal Pakay
description: Very nice hostel, ecological near Tena. Beautiful view on mountains. Nice breakfast. You can do kayaking, jungle excursions. bird watching during breakfast. Nice staff.

name: sharksky Aline Louvet
description:
Agency that offers tours, rental of snorkeling equipment. We went through her to organize the trip to the Galapagos because she speaks French as well as her colleague on Isabela. super nice full of good advice. We recommend it to you.---
Agence qui propose des tours, location de matériel de snorkeling. Nous sommes passé par elle pour organiser le voyage pour les Galapagos car elle parle français ainsi que sa collègue sur Isabela. super sympa pleins de bons conseils. On vous la recommande. 

agence who make tours and snorkeling rental. very nice staff a lot of informations. they can organise all your trip in Galápagos. really good.

name: Iguana Point
description: very nice restaurant with good almuerzo nice view on the beach. children can play next to the restaurant

name: Asado de Anibal Garcias
description: very nice place to eat pescado lobster and meat at grill.

name: lagunas trekking parking
description:
from there you can have many nice walks :
- one small around the first lake
- one long that start on the other side of the lake. it goes on the right of the mountain, through a beautiful forest, some caves, and then you make a large loop on the right with many lakes before going back on the parking. better go in the morning to have a nice weather.
it took us 3h with 2 kids. sometimes hard to know which is the right way. follow the red dots on the rocks.

name: peaceful spot near river
description:
Perfect hideaway in nature close from the city, and free.
there's room for only 1 one or 2 vehicles on a small community land.
can fit a big rig like ours (7.20m long)
safe, peaceful, with a nice green land and a river nearby (with fire pits). 
surprisingly no noise at night... nothing!
just be aware not to park right in front of the tree trunk that block the access to the green land, as some tractors use this path.

name: terraza de santa Ana
description:
on the right hand of the cathedral, in a small path you can access to the roof of the cathedral with a very nice view on the town.
2 dollars per adult 
1 dollar for kids

name: valley balcony
description:
free leveled asphalted area with a gorgeous view on the valley.
no lights, little traffic, safe, peaceful night.
good spot for a fire pit.

name: Chukírawa Restaurant
description:
A very nice restaurant right next to Quilotoa - very friendly people, great service, and very good food. 
You can get an Almuerzo for $4. 
They also let you use their free WiFi and bathrooms.

name: 40$ PCR Covid test UDLA
description:
Cheapest PCR COVID test we found in Quito
Only 40$
Fast and efficient 
They provide results via email a max of 48hrs later. It’s a bit of a process to sign up, they need a bank deposit and a completed online form. 

Here’s their contact:


Laboratorio de Investigación
Universidad de las Américas - Ecuador
Calle Queri, entre Av. De los Granados y Av. Eloy Alfaro
Teléf.: +593 (2) 3981000 Ext.: 964
Email: citas.laboratorio@udla.edu.ec

name: Pawkar Camping
description: Great place to camp. Very comfortable and safe place. Hot water, bbq place and excellent attention. Weather 57° F-71° F.

name: Hostal Ebenezer
description: good Hostal in Pedernales. quiet, nice, good location and AC service. Some rooms have kitchen.

name: Parking at Malecon
description: A very safe and nice spot to spend the night. It’s at the end of the newly built Malecon, right next to a skate park, across from the beach. Lots of food stalls at the Malecon, sports facilities, a bike track and the parking lot is next to a police station. People were superfriendly and welcoming.

name: Jonn lemon
description: good place to rest, large spaces, excellent service. $ 3 for camping and $ 8 for room. --- buen lugar para descansar, grandes espacios , excelente servicio. a 3 dólares para acampar y 8 para habitación.

name: Slow Brew Coffee
description: Amazing coffee, lovely owner. Large choice with some interesting pastries.

name: El Mandarino
description: Super good restaurant! the owner is super friendly and food is extraordinary  and really big portions! recomended!!!

name: Garceta Sol Hosteria
description: Secure place where you can park your Car/Truck and camp in front of the river. Bathrooms available.

name: Primax
description:
Primax Service station, excellent bathrooms, wifi, water, air and large parking lot. 
.....
Primax Estación de servicio, excelentes baños, wifi, agua, aire y gran playa de estacionamiento.

name: Pambiliño
description: Pambiliño is a rain forest reserve and forest garden devoted to education for conservation and sustainability. At this site you could sleep in the guests’ house as well as in your camper at the parking area. Pambiliño is located next to Mashpi river, which is perfect for bathing and swimming.

name: Aventour Ecuador
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   

Aventour Ecuador is a Tourism Operator of the Province of Tungurahua founded by professionals in Tourism and Hospitality, we have more than 10 years of experience guiding through the Ecuadorian Andes, we innovate new routes to exceed the expectations of our clients and at the same time the satisfaction of Tell us what activity you want to do at aventourecuador@gmail.com and we will organize your trip. 

Aventour Ecuador es una Operadora de Turismo de la Provincia de Tungurahua fundada por profesionales en Turismo y Hotelería, contamos con más de 10 años de experiencia guiando por los Andes Ecuatorianos, innovamos nuevas rutas para superar las expectativas de nuestros clientes y a la vez la satisfacción de los mismos, coméntanos que actividad deseas realizar a aventourecuador@gmail.com y nosotros organizamos tu viaje.

name: Antonio Spanish Lessons + Hospedaje
description:
I took 1 week of Spanish lessons from Antonio, and stayed on site in his Airbnb which was a private room/bathroom + kitchen and living area. 

WhatsApp # for Antonio: +593 99 272 5027

One of the best Spanish instructors I have ever had. Both he and his wife are instructors at Montañita Spanish school. He speaks very clearly, he is very natural at working the lesson into easy conversation. Incredible organization to his lessons, within the first 10min he organized the language into a chart that immediately cleared up so many confusions I had regarding the verb tenses. He is friendly and his family is beautiful, with 2 young talkative children and his wife is also very nice. Highly highly recommend.

$15 for 2 hours of lessons. 

$12.50/night with better deals for longer stay in his accommodation. Could also just stay in Montanita and taxi to him, the taxis are $1.5 each way.

name: Casa Del Río
description:
Live unique experiences and connect with nature and adventure in one place.

We have areas for camping, campfires, hikes, restaurant, garage and guaranteed security in our fafting tours and horseback riding. 

Vive experiencias únicas y conéctate con La Naturaleza y la Aventura en un solo lugar.

Contamos con zonas para Camping, Fogatas, Caminatas, Restaurant, Garaje y Seguridad garantizada en nuestros Tours de Rafting y Cabalgatas a Caballos. Ver menos

CASA DEL RIO 
Baeza-Quijos_Napo
150204

CONTACTOS: 0997159241 / 0997189618

name: Adjuana de Tulcan
description: Here you get the permission to leave Ecuador with your vehicle. They wanted my passport and the TIP. I had almost two hours to wait.

name: Miskay (in Quito)
description: Ecuadorian Food at it's finest! Food from each region, guinea pig, seafood, Ceviche, pork, chicken, empanadas! The best service, and English is spoken!  Prices are moderate.

name: Viajando con el Tarot (Mari)
description:
By owner: Viajando con el tarot is a small villa located in Tumbabiro, a charming little town known it's people kindness, nature and warm dry weather.
The villa is a peaceful and safe place to rest.
Johana Posso, the person in charge of checking people in, also a young traveler herself. Her contact number at WhatsApp I +593 99 703 0417.

We're 10 kilometers away from Chachimbiro termal pools, 8.5 kilometers from Urcuqui town, 12 kilometers from the Salinas - San Lorenzo road which leads to Esmeraldas beach and 117 kilometers from the Colombian frontier.
The price is of 5 USD per person per night, includes electrical energy, potable water, shared kitchen, shower, toilet and WiFi.
I'm the villa owner but mostly I'm a traveler and I know our needs.

name: Jimbura Ecuadorian immigration office
description:
Migration office for entering and exiting Ecuador 
ONLY FOR PEOPLE, NOT VEHICLES 
THERE IS NO CUSTOMS OFFICE HERE

name: Hacienda CreeSer
description: The Hacienda is located just 10 minutes from the heart of Olon up into the mountains ~ a space to relax and reconnect to the essential. We have spaces for accommodation, learning, adventure, eating, and natural exploration. We are surrounded by natural forests, and practice organic farming and sustainable living practices. Occasionally we have yoga, art classes, professional trainings, self-growth seminars, and more. Come hang out with us and find your peace!

name: Alma Liebre
description:
A great place to stay enormous space to park, camp, walk and practice activities… fernando is the host and proprietary of Alma Liebre is a very kind person, he also have farm activities here and near to his place an sport automotive business where you can be a racing driver for one day. 

Near to markets and shops, they have a mechanic, and  staff to help whenever you need…


Is a clean space, they have very good prices (5.00USD x person x night)
