You have water, electricity, wifi, bathrooms with shower, Landry (cost 3.00USD x charge), sewage discharge (dump station). 

They have a promo: one weak (7days) on your trailer you have 1 day for free.

name: Místic Tacos - really nice Mexican food!
description:
Very nice Mexican food located in a beautiful colonial building decorated with lots of fun “Mexican art” / they have 4-5 veggie option. They serve chips and 3 salsas as free entrees for you to enjoy while you wait for your order, just like in Mexico :)

I had the veggie chimichanga and it was delish. They also have “nacho personal” and I asked if they could make it vegetarian and it was so so so good. Recommended!

The guy who owns the place lived in Charlotte and California, super nice !

name: Restaurante Vegetariano Zen Wei
description:
Very nice vegetarian restaurant full of locals eating their lunch. Lunch included soup, juice, and a big plate with 4 options of your choice! Lunch is $2.50, it gets pretty busy between 11:30-12:30. 

Very yummy and probably the very few veggie options for lunch in Ibarra.

name: Museo Textil Atuntaqui
description:
This is an awesome museum. Free. It was one of the first textile factories in Ecuador. The original machines are here and there is a gigantic statue right outside. It’s a very cute town as well with many murals. The museum is located right in front of the former Ecuador train station. 

The guard told us to bring our bikes inside the museum lobby while we walked around it. Recommended!

name: Petroecuador
description:
Gas station with 24h service! 
A bit noisy untill midnight...
Wifi from the Jungle Restaurant!

name: Comedor El Soledad
description: This abuela can cook!  All Memelas (large open faced corn tacos) are made with hand made tortillas.  Order the one with quesillo, potatoes, avocado and mushrooms with red salsa.  Her picante salsa is flavorful with a slight after burn on the lips.  All sauces and salsas are made in house.  This is a hole in the wall family business. We've eaten here twice!

name: Marisquería Huaquillitas
description: Absolutely delicious restaurant on the side of the road. There should be a pig roasting out front and Luis (with the fedora) is probably cooking it. $5 for a platter of pork + soda. One of the best pork meals I’ve had in my life.

name: Hostal los Andes
description: Hostal with hot showers, Wifi, 15 dollars room, we used the secured parking lot, no height restriction, max length 6,50m

name: Hostal Kolibri B&B
description: Great hostel on the outskirts of Cuence. Safe secure parking for low roof camper van. Private room $25 per person per night. Hot showers, strong wifi, direct tv (didn't try it), complementary breakfast (eggs, toast, fruit, coffee), and use of the kitchen. Host is really friendly!

name: Hostal Guayunga
description: Adding this as a campsite since it was hard to find a good place to park our camper near the old city and off the street. This hostel has space for 1 maybe 2 campers. The entrance to the parking lot is 2.8 meters high and about 2.3 meters wide. So it’s tight but we were able to make it in and really enjoyed our stay here. It’s family run and they take very good care of you. We had access to two different bathrooms and showers and they offer laundry service for $1 per kilo. $15 a night for the camper van. One thing to be aware of is that they have some other buses park here as well so getting in and out is not that easy. Better to walk around the city or take public transport. Contact Jefferson via WhatsApp before you arrive to confirm availability and so they are ready for you. His number is 984619552

name: Zaroa Beer Garden - craft/artisanal
description:
Zaroa is produced and bottled locally. The family began the business during the pandemic. They offer several special flavors of beer including IPA, maracuya, lemongrass, banana, guava, coco, etc. 
Location offers beers on tap, seating areas, sand volleyball and friendly service.  If the gate is closed, knock or ring the bell. Proprietor speaks English, waitress tries ; )

name: Farmer’s (Gringo) Market
description: Thursday mornings if you’re in the area swing by here for tasty foods, pastries and lots of fresh organic veggies and products. Best to get here before 11.

name: El Trapiche Ecológico
description: A delightful old timer with a beautiful farm. Producing pure alcohol, sugar cane sugar, coffee and chocolate.  We paid five bucks each to learn about the processes and sample each (except chocolate).  Well worth the time to meet the guy and see his life work. So can buy his coffee, liquor and chocolate. Parking. Walking.

name: Restaurante El Tocte
description: Cheap lunches ($2) that include soup, main dish, and a small drink. Super close to Tu Parada En Cuenca and nice ambiance. Highly recommended

name: Gasolinera
description: Gasstation open 24 hours! Has free wifi guards and a mini market! Talked to the cops... all good!

name: Manantiales
description:
Exit spot for an underground stream. Super pure water in what feels like a secret place. Beautiful rolling hills surround it. Very peaceful and you can probably bet you’ll have the place to yourself. Drive in is also excellent. 

Looks like there is a hiking trail that goes up into the hills and surely results in an excellent view of Cotopaxi. Didn’t take it however.

name: Paraiso Toledos
description:
Nice place whit Cabins, has safe parking, i got a doubble room with TV and shared bathroom for $10 USB no breakfast…. 

The place is clear but the smell inside the cabins was unpleasant because the birds nest on the roof and this generates an unbearable smell

The price is not negotiable. 

The location is perfect, is near to the touristic pleases and the different restaurants and the sea.

name: Wonton Soup
description: This is a hole in the wall joint (not sure it has a name), but a nice Chinese man named Pan is making up some good house-made wonton soup for $3.50 a bowl. Wouldn’t travel for it but if you’re staying in the area and looking for something healthy in the evening I’d recommend it.

name: Balneareo Quintana Thalia
description: Flat and concreted parking lot at the Balneareo. No facilities. Toilets and shower at the pool. We paid 2 USD pp entrance and were allowed to stay overnight. The entrance gate is round about 3,40m.

name: Access to Refugio de Vida Silvestre Pasochoa
description: IMPORTANT. Drive to this point (100m from the E20/E35) and take the road on the right from the church. It's bumpy but no problem for any car.

name: La Semilla Café
description:
If you’re looking for seriously good coffee this is the place. From planting to harvest to roasting this operation is a family affair and the quality is exceptional. 

Also, it happens to be cheaper or equal to the other places in town.

name: Ibarra: Dentist Dr. Bolaños
description:
Dentist: Dr. B. Bolaños
crossing the street Oviedo and Bolivar
Edificio Way
Tel (+593) 062 956585
Cal 0999 165 205

modern, very good, to recommend

name: Rondador Cotopaxi
description:
This place is listed as a hotel but they are a perfect spot for iOverlanders. Some of the best hospitality I have received in my travels so far. It’s run by a family that offer a variety of tours to Cotopaxi as well. $3 pp and $1 for the use of the hot showers. The dinner I had at the restaurant was excellent as well, albeit a little more expensive than normal ($7.50). I can’t recommend this place enough! 

Fernando's phone: +593 99 144 7294

name: La Combi de Canoa
description: The only place in town you can get shawarma (also burgers and fries). All made in casa, really tasty and good price for Canoa. $4 shawarma. Bonus it’s all serves from a cute yellow Kombi.

name: Biking Dutchman mountain bike tours
description:
Jan and Anna have been taking MTB tours for decades.
Tours range from easy for a competent cyclist, to intermediate and advanced.
On day tours all the way through to five plus day tours. They supply bikes, safety gear, excellent picnic lunches, guides all speak English, really good guys. Adapted Land Cruisers for transport, support and uplifts.
I went on three one day tours. 
Best way to explore the Quito region by far.
WhatsApp: +593 99420 5340

name: migration office in Manta (at Districto de policia Manta)
description: Facing the building  of UPC Manta, this is the entry door on your right. oprn 8.00am-4.00pm

name: Dr Pet clinic
description: Clinic where you ca get your dog's health certificate (necessary document for your pet exportation to another country). 35$ for certificate.

name: Agrocalidad ( ecuadorian administration for pet exportation)
description:
Go to Guayaquil airport
Go to landing/arrivals zone
on ground floor entrance, take right
on the side of "El Español", is Agrocalidad office.
come with:
- bank payment proof for this exportation process (26,50$)
- recent veterinarian health check-up for your dog
- filled-up documentation for them to process your enquiry (see agrocalidad website)

name: Mirador Condor Purina, Nariz del Diablo
description:
Start of the track to the Mirador Condor Pununa In the village of Nariz.
This track takes you to the top of the Devils Nose. A reasonably easy dirt track until you get to the gate where it cost $2 to go to the end . The track then becomes very steep and narrow.  You are allowed to ride it at your own risk .

name: El Pedron
description:
Lovely quaint hotel , right in the middle of town. very nice owner. we paid $35usd for a twin room including a good breakfast.
Good wifi. Good off street parking .

name: Hotel Huasi Continental
description: Pleasant hotel , very nice owner, great parking for motorcycles or a car. Close to the historic centre.$36 usd for a twin room including a good breakfast.

name: Hostal Alexander
description: Hostal Alexander is a very comfortable hotel. The owner and his family are very friendly and kind. They offer a parking place for vans, campers, etc. with all the services. We stayed there three nights and everything was perfect. Our car is 7, 60 m large and there is no height limit.

name: Hostal Alexander
description: This is a hotel and they also offer a parking place to vans and campers with all the facilites. We stayed there three nights and everything was perfect. Our car is 7, 60 m large and there is not high limit. The owner and his family are very friendly and kind.

name: Coffee Shop
description: The best cappuccino in Mindo (I’ve done my research)! They also start to open around 8/8:30am, which is earlier than most of the other cafes, and their coffee is far superior. Friendly staff and lots of birds around. Also they sell kombucha for a better price than seen elsewhere.

name: Chivos Pizzeria
description: restaurant and pizzeria, delicious local food, home made food. Seaview

name: Cascada De Peguche Area De Camping
description:
For tent campers only!!
A semi formal campsite a couple of hundred meters from the Peguche waterfall. No facilities -the toilets close at 6pm and despite being told that they open at 6am no-one showed up. You can camp on grass, on stone pyramids, one with a roof. Cost $1,50 pp. Once everyone had left the park I had it all to myself. Lots of stalls and some food places at gate. Cheap, basic but very pleasant

name: Patate
description: Parking lot, very safe, government building, open day and night, police patrol park here during the night. Very quite, we spend one night here.

name: Bendito's - great empanadas place
description: Right across from the market/sports area is a small empanada restaurant with great food and drinks. Very friendly staff. The empanadas are freshly made and BIG for 1,25$. You can eat in or do a take-away. We post the menu in the pictures.

name: Bonkers Cafe - English pub/cafe with great food
description: Bonkers Cafe is part of the Sangay Spa Hotel. The setting is really nice under the theme of Alice in Wonderland and very British. The food is excellent. Very good fish & chips for 7$ and other great dishes. Also a great cafe with wonderful cakes and desserts. Nicely presented and very friendly staff.

name: Carpe Diem - Great Italian Restaurant with super pizza
description: This is a wonderful restaurant with a really nice setting. We sat outside next to the koi carp pond under a roof. We could watch our pizza being made and put into the stone oven. Super yummy. Also the pasta is homemade with great sauces. A bit more pricey around 7 - 12$ per dish but absolutely worth it. Really nice staff!

name: Cabañas Tres Ríos
description:
Wonderful cabañas on the Quijos river, which has world class rafting and kayaking (and the owner, Alfredo is the best, most knowledgable and experienced guide— and speaks perfect English ). The cook here makes wonderful local food, the cabanas are simple and cute, and you sleep to the sound of the river. Also there are perfect hot tubs down in the common area where there is also a kitchen for use, rocking chairs, and space for yoga. Plenty of birds to see as well. 
Pet friendly. Camping available. 
There is a gate but it has no limits for heights.

name: mirador de los volcanes
description:
nice place. bathroom near to camp.  beautifull park. theare are "llama" . owner marco bando 0995271690. very helpfull.
in front of volcan cotopaxi.

name: Kamala Surf & Backpacker Hostel
description:
June2023: Under new management and trying to be less of a our party hostel. Great pool and access to the beach.

This is a Party  hostel, but it’s quiet after midnight and there’s no loud music everyday/every night. It’s perfect for overlanders who want to socialize, have some beers and good food in the hostel restaraunt!
We payed 5$ for 2 persons, 1 van and 1 dog (has to be on the leash all the time but the beach is pretty close, so we find it ok) 
The wifi is really good and reaches the place where 2-3 vans and some tents can park, showers are coldish but ok, toilets are there as well . It's cleaned everyday (we stayed for 1 week in the hostel itself and a couple of weeks later 4 days with our Van)

The hostel manager is always eager to help, you can rent surfboards at the hostel or do some tours.

name: Muyu cafe and chocolate shop
description: Amazing coffee, big space to hangout and enjoy, and free Wi-Fi.

name: River Beach
description: Easy road down from the main road. Lovely place with grass, trees and white 'beach' sand. Place is subject to change as the river changes course over time and this spot is used by locals to fill bags of river sand. No Claro reception, some CNT reception. Garbage bin present.

name: Tosta Bakery
description:
Awesome artisan bakery with an extensive offering of delicious breads and pastries (including gluten free coconut sourdough!) Exactly what you’ve been missing on the road. 

Nice walking distance from Tu Posada.

name: Full Criollo
description:
Really excellent well-balanced almuerzos that rotate and of high-quality (which I feel you don’t normally get in these price ranges). $3. Includes an actual portion of salad and not just a big plate of rice. Also rare!

It’s a buck more than the almuerzo closer to Tu Parada but you get a notably superior product for it. Highly recommend! Was eating there until I discovered this place.

name: Hostal Fara
description: New hostel, waterfront. Green space for large RVs

name: Notaría Publica Cuarta
description: This is an English speaking notary ( Paulo) that made a poder for us in 2 days. We used the template provided by Alex Smith, found in the files of the Pan American Facebook group. The cost is $95. Double check the documents because once it is stamped no changes are possible. Parking is easy.

name: Estacion de servicio
description:
Stayed one night. clean shower and bathroom. very safe 
.....
baños y ducha limpio. el seguridad nos dio la contraseña de wifi

name: Parqueadero La Gasolinera Misahualli
description:
Ideal place for campers, camperistas, travelers and tourists, it has all the services on the banks of the Napo River, a very quiet and safe place, where you can sleep with the murmur of the Napo River and wake up with the chirping of the birds, for more information contact Sandra by Whatsapp at +5930987751501
.....
Lugar ideal para campistas, camperistas, viajeros y turistas, cuenta con todos los sevicios a orillas del rio Napo, un lugar muy tranquilo y seguro, donde se puede dormir con el murmullo del rio Napo y despertar con el trinar de las aves, para mayor información contactar por Whatsapp a Sandra al +5930987751501

name: Villa La Casa de La Abuela
description:
Wooden cabin, located on the banks of the Napo and Misahualli Rivers, in the heart of the Ecuadorian Amazon, family atmosphere, with all the necessary amenities to make your experience in the jungle more comfortable, safe and unique, they rent it for days, weeks or months, more information with Sandra. Whatsapp +5930987751501
.....
Cabaña de madera, ubicada a orillas del río Napo y Misahualli, en  el corazon de la Amazonia Ecuatoriana, ambiente familiar, con todas las comodidades necesarias para que tu experiencia en la selva sea mas confortable, segura y única, la rentan por dias, samanas o meses, mayor informacion con Sandra exelente anfotriona. Whatsapp +5930987751501

name: Arasari Hosteri
description: No people there and two closed fences. It looks loke a nice grassy area, but we turn around

name: gasolinera Petroecuador
description: parking space with very clean bathrooms and free hot shower, it is next to the highway so the noise of cars is constant but we had a good night --- espacio para parquear con baños muy limpios y ducha caliente gratis, está al lado de la autopista por lo que el ruido de los carros es constante pero pasamos buena noche

name: Hostal Runa Wasi
description: As campers say, friendly and helpful owners. We arrived early, not intending to stay but ended up staying a night and enjoying the fireplace/internet all day while weather was bad. $20pp including dinner and breakfast. Good food by local standards. Private baño, very warm bed. Safe parking for motos, so glad we didn’t try to camp as it froze overnight…

name: Las Brisas de la Cascada
description: A nice place to stay. you can set your tent, or stay in your truck as they have a big parking area. they have showers, kitchen, toilettes. people very kind there

name: Cascada, Encanto del Rocio - Machay
description:
Beautiful waterfalls with 2 impressive jumps, the first with more than 80 meters high and the second 20 meters high with natural spa, ecological and safe trails, where you can see bird watching, has restaurant service, drinks, bathrooms, camping area, large parking area and excellent service, is a community and ecological project,  For more information contact Monica +593 961923170, community entrance, in front of the court with covered space.
.....
Hermosas cascadas con 2 impresionantes saltos, el primero con más de 80 metros de altura y el segundo de 20 metros de altura con balneario natural, senderos ecológicos y seguros, donde se puede apreciar avistamiento de aves, cuenta con servicio de restaurante, bebidas, baños, zona de camping, amplia zona de parqueo y excelente atención, es un proyecto comunitario y ecologico, para más información contactar a Monica +593 961923170, entrada comunitaria, frente a la cancha con espacio cubierto.

name: Cascada Encanto del Rocio - Machay
description:
Excellent place to rest and enjoy with 2 spectacular waterfalls, one of 80 meters and the other of 20 meters, with natural balneareo of crystal clear water, ecological trails, a beautiful, quiet and safe place to spend a few days of relaxation next to nature, Monica and Don Hector, very friendly hosts, for more information, at +593 961923170.
.....
Excelente lugar para descansar y disfrutar con 2 espectaculares cascadas, una de 80 metros y la otra de 20 metros , con balneareo natural de agua cristalina, senderos ecologicos, un lugar bello, tranquilo y seguro para pasar unos dias de relax junto a la naturaleza, Monica y Don Hector, anfitriones muy amables, para mayor información, al +593 961923170.

name: Isla del Amor
description:
Nice camping spot on grassy area. It’s a 3min bike ride (all downhill) from the Parque Central de Pintag. This is a eco park with a nice tiny waterfall, fishing, camping area and lots of green spaces. We arrived and camping was $3 pp. We had access to a hot shower and went to bed pretty early. It felt safe and we slept really well. 

The camping area is not covered. There is a covered platform that seems to be used for concerts or as a stage; in case of rain I think the folks might be open to let you set your tent there. 

We did not need to use sockets/to charge our devices but I am sure you could ask. We also did not ask for wifi or using the kitchen since we had eaten dinner before we arrived.

name: Space near tiendas
description: Small town with 2-3 tiendas (no veggies mostly dry produce!). Lots of space for wild camping; some abandoned building and kind neighbors

name: Gym
description: Covered gym. We asked the locals and they let us stay. Water available, covered !

name: Shuyo Chico - camping at the casa comunal
description:
This location is for both the communal house and a big flat grassy patch.

We are following the TransEcuador bike route. We had resupplied up in Angamarca then came down to this nice little town (very tiny!) with very kind people. 

We asked if we could camp somewhere and we were directed to the church. The folks at the corner store by the church chatted with us for some time and kindly offered to open the communal house for us - there we had access to water, flush toilets, and electricity (+ outlets that worked!). 

The communal house is right in front of a green flat patch “potrero” where we were initially going to camp.

The folks kindly offered to open the communal house; we did not ask, so just keep that in mind.

name: Ciudad Canela
description: Great place for the money, in a quiet neighbourhood, just 10’ walk from downtown huge car park, no height restrictions, nice rooms… all other decent options seem to have closed down due to you know what… I was the only guest here paid $25 inc. breakfast. It’s a good option if you want to be away from the noise, have secure parking and be within walking distance from town.

name: Water Home
description: Here you can exchange your bottle or fill up.

name: Casa de Don Antonio
description:
a quiet and safe place to spend the night in voluntary contribution, they offer laundry service per kilo.  with drying, dressmaking, they give you water.
 a very kind family.
-----
un lugar Tranquilo y seguro para pasar la noche en aporte voluntario, ofrecen servicio de lavandería por kilo. con secado, modisteria, te regalan agua.
una familia muy amable.

name: Pan de Vida
description:
Small panadería with brick ovens. They have a few traditional breads like empanadas with cheese and mermelada. Very simple but nice. 

It’s a family who runs it. Nice stop for coffee and “colada morada” (hot drink made out of black/purple corn and blackberries).

name: Taller de Mecanica Automotriz Multiservicios López
description:
Translation:Preventive and corrective maintenance workshop for vehicles, engine, box, transmission, suspension, brakes and brasswork, Cristian its owner is a very kind and hospitable person with travelers, a lover of classic and antique irons, 100% recommended

Taller de mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo de vehiculos, motor, caja, transmisión, suspensión, frenos y latonería, Cristian su propietario es una persona muy amable y hospitalario con los viajeros, amante de los fierros clasicos y antiguos, recomendado 100%

name: La Rinconada
description:
Wide flat areas, partly under trees,  inside the Cotopaxi National Park.
The coordinates are just the gate of the park. You have to register at the entry and drive into for free. Camping is 4 km up the road (no need of 4x4), at 3500 m heigth. Restaurant, shared kitchen, toilettes. 3$ pppn, wifi near the houses (did not work).

name: Servioil Gas+ restaurante
description:
Gas station with restaurant and mini market; sign says restaurant is open 24hrs. It was raining pretty hard and we decided to stop here and find cover from the rain.

NO CAMPING ALLOWED 

Side note: there are a lot of green areas around/behind the gas station and kinda hidden from the panamericana; if you are in an emergency trying to find where to set your tent/spend the night this could be a place to ask. Staff seemed very kind.

name: Big covered football field
description:
For the fellow cyclists following the TransEcuador; this is a big covered field (domo) to shelter from the rain or to camp. Inside the field there is an elevated room (stairs) where there are sockets (that work!) to charge stuff. The whole are has free wifi so if you need to stop here either for lunch, shelter from the rain or to camp; this is a good stop. enjoy! 

There are bathrooms and a water spigot just behind one of the buildings. The folks around great super kind and said people have camped here before.

name: Grass area by the lake
description: Nice empty and clean grass land by the lake with access to water, at the end of road. Some homes around but not many people. Great view all around. No utility/bathroom. Very good phone reception.

name: Restaurante Villa María
description:
It is an ideal place to make a stop, taste typical regional and modern dishes and drinks. Fernando and his family, who are going to be future travelers, welcome all campers and campers very well.  We spent two very quiet and safe nights, a perfect place to rest if you go to Quito or to the coast.  Contact.  0992191306
-----
Es un lugar ideal para hacer una parada, degustar platos y bebidas tipicas de la región y modernos, Fernando y su familia, que van hacer futuros viajeros acogen muy bien a todos los camperistas y campistas. pasamos dos noches muy tranquilas y seguras, lugar perfecto para descanzar si vas hacia quito o a la costa. contacto. 0992191306.

name: Restaurante Villa María
description:
Ideal place to spend the night, with a restaurant and all services, safe and quiet, Fernando and his family are future travelers, and they welcome campers and travelers in general. contact. 0992191306
.....
Lugar ideal para pasar la noche, cuenta con restaurante y todos los servicios, seguro y tranquilo, Fernando y su familia futuros viajeros, acogen muy bien a los campistas y camperistas y viajeros en general. contacto. 0992191306

name: Quinta San Felipe
description:
Ideal place to spend several days, it has a large parking lot, camping area, swimming pools, restaurant, bathrooms, showers, courts for different sports, river and waterfalls.  Jeferson and Josselyn are excellent hosts, very friendly to travelers, 100% recommended, ideal for resting when you go to Quito or for the coast. Contact. +593986233840 or +593963455115
.....
Lugar ideal para pasar varios dias, cuenta con amplio parqueadero, zona de camping, piscinas, restaurante, baños, duchas, canchas de diferentes deportes, rio y cascada, Jeferson y Josselyn son exelentes anfitriones, muy amigables con los viajeros, 100% recomendado, ideal para descanzar cuando se va hacia Quito o para la costa. Contacto. +593986233840 o +593963455115

name: SRAM bike distribution center + shop
description:
This is the casa distribuidora de SRAM in Ecuador. We needed a bottom bracket for our Surly and we could not find the right on in Quito; so the shop in Quito called this place, they save the part for us and we picked it up (we were biking to Cuenca). If you are in Quito they can ship the piece there too (extra fee). 

The shop in Cuenca is pretty decent; they have high end and standard SRAM stuff. Good mechanic service too. Kind staff. You can pay with card or cash

name: Agua Essenza
description: $2 garrafones fill (20L). She filled our Jerry can for the same after cleaning it for free. Just happened upon it by stopping at the pharmacy across the street.

name: Soccer field (not covered)
description:
For folks following the TEMBR, there are plenty of camping spots around the area; this soccer field (concrete floor) is one of them. It is right next to a small tienda it has some green grassy areas as well.

The folks around were super friendly, we stopped here for some shade and for a snack only but they said travelers have camped here in the past. There is a water spigot and plugs to charge stuff

There was a mini restaurant with salchipapas and beer; not sure about their hours. We stayed to watch a bit of the soccer game that was taking place.

name: Ayaloma- tiendas and soccer field
description:
For folks following the TEMBR, or any cyclist friend - this town is a place to resupply and/or pitch your tent if you need to. We stopped here for a snack but folks told us camping here is allowed. The soccer field has covered areas and there is water around. 

We saw a bakery across the street as well.

name: Tienda
description: Small town with tiendas and a church w a covered area; asked and they say camping is allowed - just make sure you ask or talk to someone before

name: Another covered soccer field :)
description:
Miraslomas (the town before this one) and here, Baijón, have covered soccer fields that are open for camping. 

We were on our way to Oña but the heavy rain stopped us here around 5pm. We asked folks who we should talk to about camping and they told us to check in with the towns president, she was happy to see us and kindly offered the soccer field to us (she open a room where we had access to water, a bathroom and a cold shower :) The plugs worked too! 

— you could camp here without asking (it’s open) but we suggest to ask, for politeness. 

We had a great night of sleep. We are again so so thankful to the people of Ecuador and their hospitality.

name: Camping (under a roof)
description: Small settlement with a soccer field and two more buildings; buildings have big covered areas - it’s open. Nobody around but one lady with her cows; said cyclists have camped here. Bathrooms and water available.

name: La Casa De Cecilia
description:
Super nice hostel in Mindo. Located along the river just a few steps from the city center. They have a perfect little grassy spot where you can fit a camper. Good and clean kitchen, nice areas to relax and from what we understood they also arrange all kinds of tours. We payed $7 pppn. Good WiFi that reaches the camping spot and warm showers. 

The staff only spoke Spanish and as our Spanish is very limited they were not really nice about it. I think if you speak Spanish the staff will be very nice. 

Turn left just when you get up the little hill. Unfortunately the road is pretty narrow and there’s an overhanging roof that you have to pass under. Our defender is 2.6m with the tent and we made it without any issues. I would guess it’s around 3.0-3.3m.

name: Runa wasi café
description: Nice place w fast wifi and coffee, very nice stop

name: Grupo Ingenial
description: Great glass and aluminum shop. They fixed my camper back stairs. He called his workers off another job to help me right away. Very friendly and cheap…

name: Starlight Inn
description: Hostal with lovely hosts! Clean bathroom and very fast Internet. Perfect stay for the three-day hike to the Quilotoa Laguna.

name: Quilotoa Loop
description: From Sigchos (Starlight Inn) you can start the three-day hike to the Quilotoa Laguna. First day you hike until Isinliví (LluLlu Llama Mountain Lodge), second day until Chugchilán (Black Sheep Inn) and on the third day to the Quilotoa Laguna. From there you can take a Bus or Taxi to different destinations. Overall they are 36 km and 2'200 altitude to overcome. A beautiful and impressive hike through the Andes.

name: Hostal Albatross
description: Decent low priced Hostal/Hotel in a great location close to beach/shopping mall. It’s kind of expensive in this city. For $25 cash a night it’s not bad. Best thing is they have room for a couple of big and tall vehicles and very secure parking.

name: Vilca Garden
description:
Nice restaurant/beer garden (actually a pretty nice grassy garden inside!) with craft beer (the porter beer is really nice) pizza, sandwiches (vegan/veggie options too), coffee and juices. 

We were there on a Saturday and they had live music; a wonderful pianist, I forgot his name but we were looking for something chill and this was just perfect

name: Casona Pesillo
description:
A beautiful hacienda that has a large space to park cars, we spend a quiet and safe night.
----------------------------
Una hacienda hermosa que tiene un espacio grande para estacionar los carros, pasamos una noche tranquila y segura.

name: Wild Camping Beside Misahualli River
description:
At the right side of E45 Highway.
Nice flat places beside de river. Some locals use the place to refresh themselves.
Locality called Santa Elena.
Enjoy and keep clean

name: Quite free camp on sandy road
description: Spent a quite night here, only a few cars, cows and sheeps passed by. You can stay more or less weherever you want on this road. Lots of space also for big rigs and some grassy areas for tents. Felt very safe, locals waved when passing by. Simple but good and not so high in altitude as the spot in laguna Quilotoa. Recommendable

name: Teleferico Camping
description: Camping on the parking of the teleferico. Toillets clean shower not working properly. They were just building cabanas so maybe more infrastructure in the futur. Payed for two ppl 10USD pn. The first teleferico was 8USD pp and the second  5USD pp. Nice hike to the cascadas during rainy season.

name: Dr. Ruben Barona Dentist
description:
Ruben is a great dentist for anyone visiting Quito that needs any type of dentistry work done. (From a cleaning to a root canal, he does them, and for anything he doesn't, he has recommendations for someone that does.) 
He studied in Brazil, and completely speaks English so there's no worry about any language barrier. 
He says he's worked on many travelers/overlanders through the years. 
Prices are good (at least, compared to the states) and he does a real good job. 
We went in for a root canal/tooth infection and ended up getting a whole lot of other work done too. We plan on coming back to Ruben to get implants done as well. 
He understands that travelers are on a tighter schedule than most, so he'll do his best to get you in and out as quickly as he can/you have time for. 
He has his own office, on street level, with street parking out front. One day (out of like 4) there was a parking lady that was taking payments (40c an hour) and Ruben even paid it for us before starting. Don't know if he always does this, but it was a nice gesture. 
Overall, highly recommended for anyone needing any kind of dental work done.
Hours are from 9am-6pm, but just email him beforehand and if you mention you're traveling he'll find the best time to fit you in. Email is barona.viteri@gmail.com

name: taller de Mecánica
description:
Mechanical and electromechanical workshop. Mauricio a very kind gentleman.
0963702309 --- Taller de mecánica y electro mecánica. Mauricio un señor muy amable.
0963702309

name: FrutiVida (bakery/organic store)
description:
This place receives fresh pastries from Le Baguette on a daily basis: croissants, pain au chocolate, baguettes, etc. 

Lots of fresh produce, nuts, chocolate bars, and other natural products like nutritional yeast, hummus, soaps and organic lotions, cheese, kombucha, etc. Their bread is delicious too (from le baguette!).

name: Parque Palanda
description:
Very nice parque with a cute colorful church. There is a covered stage at the park and we were told camping for a night is allowed here. 

Plugs, water from a spigot and very nice park.  Tienda across the street. People were kind and the park was quiet when we were there

name: Sabores del Oriente
description:
Restaurante/comedor with sea food plates also and normal almuerzos. 

We don’t eat meat and got big plates with menestra (lentils), rice, fried cassava (yuca!), and salad + a juice for $1.50.

Normal menu includes a soup. Staff is super kind, There is wifi but we did not ask for it.

name: El Chorro
description:
We spent our last night in Ecuador here.

This point is refering to two possible camping spots. One: the covered cancha by the church. It’s big and there is a tienda right across the street. 
Second option: under the church. Space for 2-3 tents. It’s covered and folks told us that cyclists have camped here before.
When we were there the whole town did not have water. Bathrooms by the park were open but they were filthy. Still, it is a short ride to the border the next day.

name: Metsankin
description:
we ask if it is possible to sleeping here with our tent for the night. The chief of the Shuar community give us thé house of reunion community for sleeping. there is toillets, show ers, potabled water ans electricity for the house.
we put bicycle in the house of reunion community
they are very friendly

name: Consultirio Veterinario Cuatro Patas
description: Issued a health certificate for my cat before crossing into Peru. Costs 25usd. The veterinaria doctor handled my cat very well, great service!

name: Ta’Lico (Best Chinese Food North Of Peru)
description:
Grew up in China and this place is legitimately the best Chinese food we’ve had so far. Specializes in Sichuan food.

The picture menu is for locals. But there is a Chinese only menu (just a piece of paper) where the real food is.

Woman speaks well enough English. Get the “twice cooked pork”!

name: Parque del sombrero Saraguro
description: Safe and quite. We spend one night here. Very friendly people.

name: Atacames
description: A quiet place on the Atacames boardwalk for Motorhome --- Un lugar tranquilo en el malecón de Atacames para Motorhome

name: Armony Camp
description:
In our space, you can park your mobile home, we have two bathrooms and two electric hot water showers, electricity 110 volts, water, grill.  Near the airport, Tumbaco, Cumbaya and 20 minutes from the city of Quito.

Eve Salazar +593 995468125 (Spanish)
Fernando Quintero + 593999830795 (English & Spanish)

name: End of road
description: End of road: Due to land slide by volcanic eruption (2021) the river has everything washed away (bridge, road, village, …). Now they try to build a new access to the NP Sangay.

name: Crooked Banco Pichincha ATM
description: Don’t use this ATM from Banco Pichincha. It took $400 from our account and gave us no $$$. Others were at the bank complaining about the same thing. The manager went hiding from everyone..

name: Ukshapungo
description: A nice place close to Laguna Cuicocha. After the climb from the lake, it would be nice to sleep here or have lunch (local indigenous food). After lunch I crossed the mountains but the weather changed really quickly into thunder. I wish I would have stayed here;) Owner is incredibly friendly.

name: Finca Verde
description: This is a farm and the owners are creating an ecohostel (they have a lot of amazing projects with the farm and the community) We slept there for a week doing voluntary work, they offered us a private bedroom with bathroom (but if you want you can sleep in your car/tent) we could used their kitchen and eat fruits from the farm, in return we worked picking coffee around 3 hours a day (only weekdays) that was the job of the moment but it's always something different. The owners are really kind, we had a great week learning from them and just talking, also people in Rio Canoa are very kind. You can find the farm on Facebook or Instagram and here's the WhatsApp number of Alfredo, one of the owners +593 99 340 3410

name: wooden house skeleton
description: Two walls will hide you from the road, nice flat spot, nice views of the valley

name: Sinfonía Café
description: Cuenca has a cafe on almost every corner, but Sinfonia is a step above—they roast great coffees on-site, offer everything from V60 pourovers to delicately tempered cappuccinos to rich iced mochas, and they serve incredible food to boot. Their prices are fair, the service is friendly, and the internet is fast. We grabbed a 250g bag of light-roasted coffee grown in Loja for $6.75. The banana bread is a standout, as well as the cheesecake and spring rolls. Don’t miss this cafe when in town!

name: Grafi Stick (sticker shop)
description: Amazing sticker shop. They are able to print CMYK on a variety of sticker substrates as well as vinyl transfers. I printed 50 10x15cm stickers on reflective substrate for about $20. Sharpest printing I’ve seen at a shop yet. A few other print shops nearby if you want to compare quality/price.

name: Hostel Dream House
description: Says hostel in the name but I think it only had private accommodation, mine had 2 single beds. It was 7 dollars a night and the owners are super friendly, they let me use their kitchen and put my bike in their restaurant for the night. Good WiFi, beds not the most comfortable but not bad, everything is clean and no hot water in the shower. Not sure about parking.

name: Area De Conservation Municipal Tinajillas Rio Gualacena
description: Not a formal hostel, but this house is where the park rangers live while working and they have rooms for people visiting the park and doing tours etc. so they have space to host people so long as they aren't full. I met two park rangers on the road and they invited me to stay the night there, they said it was good for them if people come and stay because it proves they are doing their job. obviously it's nothing formal so not 100% reliable but I'm sure they would host people who need it. They have a kitchen and hot showers and it was secure enough just to leave my bicycle outside.

name: Estacionamiento Iglesia papallacta
description:
large space, quiet, environment with lots of greenery.
espacio grande, tranquilo, entorno con  mucha vegetación.

name: Marisquería La Cascada
description: Nice little restaurant with great prices. Got stuck here due to road block for a night. There’s a small river across the street for bathing. Road was quiet except for a few motos, but probably due to road block. Just buy dinner and park for the night on a nice rocky parking lot. Used their bathroom until they closed. Great signal with Claro.

name: Roadside flat kind of out of view for cyclists
description: The view is nice and flats are not too hard to find. Lush grass all around

name: Finca Orgánica Chamano
description:
We can receive camping cars and tents. You have access to drinking water and internet. $10 a night. We offer activities with additional costs : visit and explication of the project, milking the goat by hand, learning how to do the cheese, how to do the french bread and more.

Organic farm. We grow vegetables, grains and raise animals (chickens, goats, pigs, horses, ducks). Every week we sell our production in Quito. What we produce allows us to be almost autonomous in food.
---
Finca orgánica, cultivamos verduras, granos y criamos a animales (gallinas, cabras, puercos, caballos, patos). Cada semana vendemos nuestra producción en Quito.   Lo que producimos nos permite estar casi autónomos en alimentos.
Podemos recibir casas rodantes y carpas. Tienes acceso al agua potable y Internet. $10 la noche. Proponemos actividades con costos adicionales: visita y explicación de nuestro proyecto, ordeñar la cabra a mano, aprender a hacer el queso, aprender a hacer el pan de masa madre, y mas.

name: Finca orgánica Chamano
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Place has not been verified by an overlander

Organic farm. We grow vegetables, grains and raise animals (chickens, goats, pigs, horses, ducks). Every week we sell our products in Quito. Our production allows us to be autonomous in food.
We rent private rooms, country house and cabin, with food from the farm and activities (milk the goat by hand, see how the cheese is made, make bread if the days coincide, ride bareback if the horses are willing ).
---
Finca orgánica. Cultivamos verduras, granos y criamos animales (gallinas, cabras, puercos, caballos, patos). Cada semana vendemos nuestros productos en Quito. Nuestra producción nos permite ser autónomos en comida.
Alquilamos habitaciones privadas, casa de campo y cabaña, con alimentos de la finca y actividades (ordeñar la cabra a la mano, ver como se hace el queso, hacer el pan si los días coinciden, subir a caballo a pelo si los caballos están dispuestos).

name: P&S Petrol Station
description:
A gas station which is good to stay, shops, toilets, and ATM. Clean and ok for one night
.
Estación de servicio buena para pasar una noche. Hay tiendas (farmacia y restaurante), baños limpios y cajeros.

name: House ruins
description: Good spot for cyclist, hidden from the road.

name: PS gas station
description: After enjoying Santa Elena, we didn't want to cross Guayaquil on a Saturday evening. We stayed at this Brand New gas station. Electricity and a bathroom. The gas station is larger than the others, there is only little noise

name: Hosteria San Geronimo
description: Restaurant and hotel in an otherwise somewhat blank spot in the map. Rooms are clean, hot suicide shower, wifi on and off, nice host, safe parking. Allowed me to keep my bicycle in my room. 10USD for me as a solo traveler.

name: Quingue
description: Informal campsite, small fishing village. Full of children, they are likely to be kidnapped by some. It has a high viewpoint where humpback whales can be seen between June and August. Get cheap accommodation and fish at a good price. You can get a good price for a fisherman to take you whale watching or fishing with you. Try the "Corviche", a typical dish from here and the "Sleeping Milk". Women play soccer in the coliseum, good panorama. If you need a tour guide, locate "Mister" his name is Hausen or something like that, for a few dollars he shows you the whole town and gets you whatever you need. The parking lot is at the end of the town and you will not have a problem of insecurity, the children will wake you up to talk or play with you.

name: Chester's B&B
description: First went to the other Hostal here in town but even though I would have been the only guest they asked for 30USD for me being a single traveller. Found this place here on Booking.com for $20 including a great breakfast! Very lovely, clean and nice hotel. Spacious room that I was allowed to roll my bike in. Close to airport but windows were fairly soundproof. No issues with noise. Fast wifi. Super clean and modern shared bathroom with boiling hot water. Great kitchen with water filter. Very friendly and chatty host. Fantastic pizzeria on the property, bit pricey for Ecuador but one Pizza easily feeds two [or one hungry cyclist]. Highly recommended to stay here!

name: Petrolrios gas station
description: Nice and clean gas station with showers,   toilets and a little tienda. Guarded 24h. We gave the guy 3 dollars to stay there and take a shower. A bit noisy but safe. There is water.

name: Corrupt Police
description: On the  highway from Guayaquil to Santa Elena you will find police on big motorcycle and they stop you to get money!! If you have a little crack  in windshield or a burned bulb or little run down tire they will charge money! Stay calm ! If you have time you can discuss but if not there is no way they openly say what amount they want very corrupt !!! We must give 50 us but they started with 900 us incredible!! So if you see them be averse

name: Locks and small works
description:
Behind the tree
Local, cheap good service for changing locks and small works
Really helpfull and honest

name: Repair Shop
description:
Family-owned business, I spent a week with them, Price is really fair.  Repaired and painted the outside part of my . They also do small jobs. 
Phone number of Alberto +593 98 882 2903

name: Puerto Engabao
description:
large quiet and safe parking lot

amplio estacionamiento tranquilo y seguro

name: P&S station
description: Little  gas station, friendly staff. parking space on both aides. we're ok to park our big rig for the night. on the road from Puerto Lopez to Mindo. slightly noisy (next to the road).

name: Salinas
description:
large quiet and safe parking lot
-----
amplio estacionamiento tranquilo y seguro

name: Burbujitas
description:
Translation:Very cheap laundry $0.50 per pound of clothes.  we wash five jeans, shirts, and coats for just 4 dollars.  cool!


Lavanderia muy económica 0,50 dólar por libra de ropa. lavamos cinco jeans, camisas, y abrigos por tan solo 4 dólares. ¡genial!

name: Mercado municipal, municipal market
description:
Translation:Lunches (lunch) 2.25 dollars, bathrooms (toilet), and vegetables.

Almuerzos (lunch) 2,25 dollars, baños (toilet), and vegetables.

name: Balneario San Jose
description: Pool (1 dollar pp), restaurant, parking(1 dollar car) kitchen in motorhome. piscina,, parqueadero.

name: Frente del hotel cumbres andinas
description:
Translation:We have slept in front of the hotel, on public roads, super quiet, safe, 20 meters from the beach, we have used the hotel shower for 0.50 dollar p.p.  Fresh water is scarce, they sell 20 liters for a dollar of fresh water.

Hemos dormido frente del hotel, sobre la via pública, súper tranquilo, seguro, a 20 metros de la playa, hemos usado la ducha del hotel por 0,50 dollar p.p. El agua dulce es escasa, venden 20 litros por un dólar de agua dulce.

name: cabana de franklin
description: Parking free, shower, beach, restaurant lunch 3 dollar.

name: frente al hotel Puerto Manglar.
description:
Translation:There is a bay for free parking, very safe Police patrol often, in addition to fishing in this place if it is allowed.
Existe una bahía para parking free,  muy seguro Police patrulla seguido, además de puede pescar en este lugar pues si está permitido.

name: Cascadas de Chindul
description:
Translation:Cachoeira, Waterfall free, parking for motorhome 1 dollar, parking per motorhome 1 dollar in high season in low season 0 dollar.

Cachoeira, Cascada gratis, parking pela motorhome 1dollar, parqueadero por motorhome 1 dollar en temporada alta en temporada baja 0 dollar.

name: playa pedernales
description:
Translation:It is a public road, with no parking fee, next to the beach, close to the lifeguards and with the possibility of a shower for 0.50 and a bath for 0.30

Es una via pública, sin cobro de parqueo, junto a la playa, cerca a los salvavidas y con posibilidad de ducha por 0,50 y baño por 0,30

name: Chapas Gerardo Para Puerta de Vehiculos
description:
Translation:Place where you fix damage to the door locks of the van or mobile home

Lugar donde arreglas daños en chapas de puertas de la van o casa rodante

name: Plaza Nuevo Comercial
description:
Translation:Free parking, showers - shower 0.50, Sanitary Bathrooms - Toilet 0.25, market wide variety of vegetables and food (lunch 2.50).  Variety of vegetables and food (lunch 2.50) dollars.


Parking free, duchas - shower 0,50, Baños Sanitario - Toilet 0,25, mercado gran variedad de verdura y comida (almuerzo 2,50). Variety of vegetables and food (lunch 2,50) dollars.

name: Los Sartenes
description: Health and tasty local food! Daily menu for $3,75 includes soup, main dish and desert. if you are hungry but the have a la carta menu for $10 max.

name: Patucocha / Pucará viewpoint
description:
Safe camping spot. 

can get in to the viewpoint by walking from the entrance or with tall cars (with short cars by ur own risk to get stuck). 

In winter (from december to may) the road  is always in good conditions but very foggy and the spot gets muddy and wet to camp but its also a good experience because if you have a lucky the sky gets clear and the sunrise /sunset are beautifull.

Day max temperature:  20°C 
Night min temperature:  3/4°C

name: casa killary
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description appears to be provided by owner or manager.   

place full of nature and culture where you can camp near a viewpoint towards the pastaza river
------
lugar lleno de naturaleza y cultural donde se puede acampar cerca de un mirador hacia el río pastaza

name: Ayangue
description:
Free water ask in front of the town.
Agua gratis pedir en frente a comuna Ayangue measure 412ppm the 7.4.2024

name: CR motos
description: Specialised repair shop for motorbikes. Cristian is a real professional and very competent. Great welcome and service. Fast and efficient work.  If you are in Guayaquil and you have a problem with your motorbike, this is the place to go. 100% recommended

name: Hotel Corona
description: Adding this place as it seems to be a bit of an blank spot in the map. Good place to rest before or after the border crossing, especially for cyclist in need to split up the distance. Cheap hotel at 8USD/person for a room with fan, 10USD for air con. Just arround the corner from the main Plaza. Walking around there are plenty of hotels in the center. Bit of a rugged town like the random ones in Colombia but good to spend the night/stock up on food. Low key hotel, nothing fancy, decently clean, so so wifi, cold shower, was allowed to take my bicycle in but be prepared to carry it some steep stairs. Had a room in the back which was quiet at night. Out front could be more noisy.

name: Spondylus Tours
description: Whale Watching tours (20) and Isla de la Plata (45). German and English speaking Katy very friendly.

name: Cabañas del Lago hotel
description:
Hermosas cabañas a la orilla del lago San Pablo, prestan estacionamiento y baño a viajeros, con consumición mínima en el restaurante del lugar. 

Beautiful cabin at the lake San Pablo. They give us place to park and bathroom only with a minimum consumption in the restaurant of the place.

name: Mr. Jeff- laundry service
description: Clean, organized counter for laundry drop off service. They don’t seem to offer same day option.  1-2 days typically. $10 for 7 kg bag. We received all of our laundry back and it was fresh and clean. They have a website and the phone number listed on Google maps is on WhatsApp. They were responsive and helpful in messaging. Great option if you are staying nearby to kite and/or surf for a while.

name: Quilotoa Lagoon Mirador Parking
description:
If you are traveler you must see this. Is a beautiful lagoon in the center of a crater, crazy and amazing. SO COLD. Bring all the cozy clothes you can find because the wind is frozen. 

We parked just down the stairs of the mirador, and slept here. No problem. No services but just a few steps from the lagoon. Totally worth it!

name: Hostal Travellers Inn
description: A vintage hostal, with comfortable rooms and hot showers. Price range from 14 US$ (shared bathroom) to 20+ . Secure parking space for motorcycles and 3 cars. Close to restaurants and grocery stores. Only 3km away from Ecuador Freedom Motorcycle Rental (they service your bike, besides renting). Breakfast available. Very friendly staff. Laundry available.

name: IVECO service & parts - AUSTRAL CIA.
description:
This is the new IVECO dealer (and other truck brands also, mainly International). Their core is trucks, not vans, so they don't have that many parts for the smaller vehicles such as the IVECO Daily.
I came here needing some maintenance on my Daily and although they didn't have the parts, they were able to repair the main things. They are all great guys, super willing to help, and the price was fair.

They also offered to bring parts from Europe if I was willing to wait (1 month aprox). Seems crazy to wait but that could be an option if you are travelling around Ecuador, since they've got workshops in Quito and Cuenca, so you could send the parts to another city if you are going there later.

IVECO dealerships are non-existent in Bolivia and very bad in Peru and Chile, so this is your last real chance to do anything until Argentina or Brazil.

Better contact them beforehand for them to make space on the agenda.
I leave the contact info on the picture.

Safe travels!

They can cook for you. Half a block from the main square. If it's fiesta season, be prepared to listen to music till midnight! Safe parking for a few bikes and one or two cars.

name: AVC Car Service
description:
We found ourselves in need of work on our gearbox as we approached Quito. We found a review for Daniel, “The best mechanic on the PanAm” on Ioverlander under "Autoexperts & 4x4 Specialists". Unfortunately, he closed his shop and his partner, Alexei opened another one just down the road.  We are extremely grateful for that connection. It’s always stressful to find a good mechanic and uneasy knowing if you can trust them. We had a great first impression of Alexei. He put us at ease assuring us he’d get our truck running well and was very honest and up front about potential costs (high) and time (long). He graciously let us stay in our camper in his secure parking lot while the work was being completed. We realized when he left us keys to his place that he was trusting us, and we trusted him. It was a great mutual relationship, and we only wish we had him work on our truck earlier on our trip! Alexei and Sebastian fixed things that should have been addressed early on (bad spark plugs, dirty fuel injectors, fixed a coolant leak, for example).  They also took apart our gear box and found that the problem was not as serious as suspected and were able to solve it much quicker than expected. Sebastian even came in on a Saturday to finish our truck so that we could get out exploring for the weekend. They trusted us to take off with our truck without paying, to return on Monday and settle up. We can’t say enough about how great this meeting was, and how thankful we are to have found Alexei and Sebastian. We recommend them very highly. You could tell from the amount of business they were getting throughout our stay that although a new shop, they are very popular, so the only problem for future overlanders is that they will be busy!!!
Alexei phone: +59398955850
Sebastian phone: +593968595178

name: Hotel Cumbres
description:
We found this hotel after finding out Casa 1887 was full. We have a tall pickup camper so finding parking was hard in this city. Their parking is secure and ok for rigs up to about 3.5 meters tall. The hotel clerk quoted my wife $20 pp then after we got parked the manager wanted $25 pp. He also tried to charge extra for parking in his parking lot across the street even though his website says free parking. Then he charged us 12 percent extra for using the credit card to pay. The breakfast is very cheaply made. The room was two queen beds with a small balcony overlooking the street. Suicide shower that trickled out hot water. A bit noisy until 10 pm then again at 6 am. If you put the bed sheets over the curtains you can darken the room more. It was clean and adequate for a few days to explore the city. 
Update: The next morning when leaving the parking lot an old man that lives there tried to block our exit saying we had to pay him for parking. We refused and told him to talk to the hotel. There’s a reason why this hotel was empty and the other good ones at the same price were full.

Outside the workshop there is a bus stop and 400 meters away there is the "Trole" line or Quito's integrated public system that connects you with the entire city. During the day you have to take the car out, outside the workshop is an alternate street, with little traffic.
