description: Beautiful site with a huge tropical garden. Offers very nice rooms, cabañas and camping in tent. No campers. Clean hot shower, nice swimming pool, very quiet. Friendly owner speaks English. Good WiFi. Nice veranda. Humming Birds in the garden. Asks 10$ pP per night  but we could talk him down to 6$. Not cheap but worth the money. Highly recommended. Bring bug repellent, quite a few mosquitoes here... :o)

name: Restaurant La Negra Mala
description: Nice traditional restaurant in Calle Ronda. Very tasty Ecuadorian dishes. Also many vegetarian and vegan dishes. Tasty juices. The lady who runs this place is a real sweetheart. Historic building and a really nice ambiente. Main courses between 8 and 15 $. Grilled cuy is 24$. Highly recommended. Open daily 1 pm through 10 pm.

name: Checkpoint Transmission specialist
description:
Very professional workshop specialized in everything connected with transmission, esp. 4x4 and Toyota, but working on all kinds of vehicles  - no really big rigs though. Have all necessary tools, very competent and friendly staff, Juan Pablo and Diego, the heads, extremely friendly and helpful.
Address: De Los Colimes 43-187 y, Quito 170503
 Can recommend full-heartedly

name: free whales Mirador
description: Stayed here 2 nights. Yesterday the transit police came by just ask'what was I doing". Anyway, super nice spot. Not many people around. 3G signal. I found it with sat images . It isn't on Google Maps. On the road to the Mirador shortly turn left then right, up and down the hill. Get to a parking spot 20 m higher from the beach. Perfect whale watching spot

name: Lago San Pablo lakeshore
description: Beautiful quiet place right on the lake shore, grass and gravel, friendly neighbours (we asked if it was OK to stay here, had a nice chat), great views, clean - please keep it that way! (good 4g Claro )

name: overlooking the playa
description:
Nice solitary spot at the end of a bumpy, not much used road. It's not on Google, to get here use OSMAND.
Note: You arrive to a steep clearing, and you will need stones to level. View is super and looks not many come this way

name: Refugio Urcu Huasi
description: Amazing mountaineering refuge right next to Chimborazo. Private rooms w/shared baths. U$35.00 per night for a single w/breakfast & dinner included. Secure parking @ Urbina with owner-provided  transport to refuge or drive up in your capable 4WD.

name: Campo Colibri
description: Ecxellent nature experience! Omar and Walter gave us an extensive tour around, explaining the different kinds of trees, other plants and especially dozens of different kinds of orchids.

name: Angochagua
description: Quiet and safe place on church plaza, beautiful scenery, great views from the mirador above the village, very friendly people - worth the detour from the main highway. Toilets clean and open during daytime. Water tap behind the green-white building to the right of the church.

name: Primax
description:
It's a gas station that has a large parking lot at the back.  We asked the staff if we could spend the night there, and they said yes.  Shortly after, a guard from the station arrived saying that he would charge 2 dollars.  We ended up deciding not to go out the next morning, and spent another night there.  We filled up on our way out and asked who we should pay for parking, and they said no need to pay.  It is possible to fill the water tank and has a convenience store.  When the weather is clear, the view of the Cotopaxi volcano in the background is beautiful. 

É um posto de gasolina que possui um grande estacionamento ao fundo. Perguntamos aos funcionários se poderiamos passar a noite lá, e eles disseram que sim. Pouco depois chegou um vigia do posto dizendo que cobraria 2 dólares. Acabamos decidindo não sair na manhã do dia seguinte, e passamos mais uma noite no local. Abastecemos ao sair e perguntamos para quem deveríamos pagar pelo estacionamento, e eles disseram que não era necessário pagar. É possível encher o tanque de água e possui uma loja de conveniência. Quando o tempo está aberto, é linda a vista do vulcão Cotopaxi ao fundo.

name: Overnight parking near Plaza Bolivar
description: You can park overnight and sleep in your vehicle here for $5 US. No height restriction but probably won’t make the turn or fit if over 24 feet or so in length. They only open from 8-6. Closed all day Sunday. If you ask the guy he’ll give you a key so you can come back after 6. Just tell him it’s for in case of an emergency. I wouldn’t park here and leave vehicle unattended overnight since there’s not much security other than a locked gate. Dogs bark until 10 then quiet until 6 or so. No services at all.

name: hostal maxima
description: rooms were $12 and he let me park the camper inside.nice garden

name: Houz Rouz Campground
description:
This campground just recently opened and we were their 3rd visitors. The owner, Andres, is a young artist, entrepreneur and nature lover with big dreams, who left the busy city of Quito for a quieter life, to open this place to travelers, in hope of making it something bigger in the near future. He offers two very different, but both amazing options to stay the night: one is close to his house, where bathrooms, snacks and coffee are available. The second is behind the property, deep in nature, in an almost surreal location where you can't even hear a truck go by. We stayed only one night near the house so we could chat with him a bit, he is a very attentive and caring person, who will definitely stay more of a friend than simply the "owner" after our visit.

He wishes to eventually convert his place into some kind of bar and is in the midst of renovation, but who knows, maybe you'll have the chance to experience that dream of his soon!

Check out his instagram pages: @Houz Rouz & @jr_andresfalcon

name: Hiker/Biker camp spot
description: Perfect place to set up camp for hikers/bikers. Free and flat. Beautiful view on the lake. Quiet and just a few dogs around.

name: La Libertad Plaza
description: Right at the plaza of the small village, level, quiet. Had a quiet and undisturbed night, felt really safe. Two bakeries one block away, small shops around, copy-shop if you need copies before crossing the border.

name: Cevicheria Iris del Mar
description: Very good and fresh cheviche. We had "mixto" with mussels that were opende just in front of us.

name: Public Parking
description: Public Parking next to cemetery. 24h parking, entrance height about 4.5 m, we passed the night here - closed and locked from 11.30 pm to 8.00 am, paid 3$ for the night.

name: P&S Gas Station
description:
The town people of Machachi refered us to the P&S gas station when looking for a safe place to spend one night in our tents with our motorcycles.
When asked nicely, the gas station employees let us stay under a roof in the empty service rooms (see picture) with access to the bathrooms all night and potable water. There are even working electrical outlets in those two little garages.

Only con is that you're straight facing the highway so very noisy and you're not quite hidden from passer-bys.

There's always the option to go behind the gas station and stay on the grass section for peace.

name: Yacunana warm springs
description: challenging hike up-down the springs but nice .just warm water .can park overnight up to the village or drive a SMALL truck down here.last 2 kms to get to the town is narrow!NO BIG RIGS.I overnight in the football field easier

name: outstanding view.lone camp
description: this is the exact spot where to sleep. the view is amazing  and better at very end of road but is extremely windy!!had 1 of the worst nights ever with truck  shaking!! here is only 60m away but sheltered! feel pretty bad to be honest, could have moved earlier if I knew. park down from a couple of shacks selling drinks. if the woman asks $3 show her your ticket that u already paid on the other side.

name: Aluchan hot springs
description: It a very rough descent of the mountain to get here.about 2 kms of absolutely and ONLY 4wd high clearance.I actually have to get out now but that keeps people away altough u may expect it more crowded in weekends .spent 2 nights here.no phone sig. nice temperature water.tents can stay next to the pool.use OSM MAPS to reach from Cusubamba

name: Parking near the centro historico
description:
Secured Parking near the city center 5 min walk. A good option if you want to visit the city. You can sleep in your van for 15 $ per night. (Closed at night) 
The owner Dalia is very kind and helpful you can ask her if you need anything. 
We were happy to meet them 

Dalia Toledo 
+593 99.289.34.02

name: Lavandería Surfista
description: Really nice, fast & friendly laundry service. They charge per kilo, 1,50$/kilo and finished the same day. We had two big bags and paid ~$10 and could pick it up in the evening, all clean and nicely folded. Super convenient if you park on the free spot, it's in walking distance.

name: Rafting - RiverPeople
description: Alex has been living here and guiding rafting trips for over 20 years - we took a family day trip and we VERY pleased with the whole experience. Super responsive via WhatsApp +593992349333

name: punta blanca
description:
very friendly fishermen's village, on the beach. good food with Mrs Maria Quiroz wifi, toilets, showers. suitable for camping in a tent or motorhome. Excellent place.

Español
caserio de pescadores muy amigable, en la playa. buena comida con la Sra Maria Quiroz  wifi, baños, duchas. apto para camping en carpa o auto caravana. excelente lugar.

name: Riverside
description: 100 m from the road but completely invisible,  did not see anybody from yesterday, although the fishermen must know we are here. On the river bank. Flat gravel clearing. 3g signal. May stay one more night. Seems no-one bothers or know I am here.

name: lots of electronics shops
description: Lots of shops that sell all kinds of electronics, from computer equipment to electronic engineering, motors, sensors & Arduino stuff. Found stuff here that we haven't seen since Mexiko.

name: In front of Mariposas de Mindo on river side
description: Nice quite place at the river side. Allmost flat. We asked at the butterfly farm if we could spend the night here. They told us, nobody has concers. You can walk to the cablecar, which you can not reach with big rig. You get meals at the butterfly farm until 4 pm

name: Estacionamiento La Carolina 5
description:
Parking with guard 24/24, around the parc. Free from 22h-6h. Then 0,5 $/ hours 
Not quiet, but good place for Botanic garden and visit the Town.

name: next to bridge.river pool
description: spent the night .nice pool at river .although a bit of noise from the bridge by very low traffic

name: Estación de servicio TERPEL
description:
We arrived at 11pm, we talked to the guy to be able to park and he charged us $1.50 to park and sleep. We parked in a corner and took advantage and took a shower with our portable shower. It has security all night. Sometimes there is a bit of noise but it's fine for one night.
----
Llegamos a las 11pm, hablamos con el chico para poder estación y nos cobro $1.50 para estacionarnos y dormir. Nos estacionamos en un rincón y Aprovechamos y tomamos una ducha con nuestra ducha portátil. Tiene seguridad toda la noche. A veces hay un poco de ruido pero esta bien para una noche.

name: Yakuruna turistico.balneario
description: nice grassy area ,parking lot.is a water park type of biz

name: Parking space in a mansion
description: We parked our van to go to Galapagos for two weeks here. No problems. Very big green space in Quito in a backyard of a house used for events. The guy who takes care of this place (Pepe) is very nice and kind! No sure if you could sleep in a car, but if you are looking for parking lot in Quito it’s a nice place. He charged us USD3 per day. Pepe’s cel number is +593 99 524 4581.

name: Primax
description: Here you can fill your tank before entering Peru ....!! Coming from the border this is the first gas station

name: La Quinta Colorada
description: This is a fancy nice Hotel that offers also tent sites in their garden for 10$ per person. Showers and nice bathroom offered in one of the hotel rooms included in the price. Fence around the whole area, picnic tables, fireplace, grass area with some llamas, cats & dogs. Wifi included and some electric plugs available.

name: Rio Rircay
description:
*Bridge completely washed out.
.....
Potentially deep or impassable river crossing if you are taller than 2.5m/8ft. We drove here from Saraguro towards Santa Isabel and this was the fastest route that both Google Maps and Maps.me suggested. The drive is slow, but very scenic, but after almost and hour of mountain dirt roads we reached the river crossing of Rio Rircay in Sulupali where the bridge has a height limit of ~2.5m (it's only marked coming from the other side). The only options are crossing the river or doing a 2h+ detour (maybe even more) to cross somewhere else.

It did rain the day before but was dry when we crossed, but the river was still almost 90cm/3ft deep at the crossing, bringing our 4x4 truck very close to it's technical limit. Anything that's not a serious 4x4 pickup or off-road truck with good clearance would certainly not make it. Might be different depending on weather conditions, I suppose it could be both much easier or impassable.

One nasty thing is also that the river looks much shallower than it is, probably because heavy construction trucks use the river crossing as well, so best to walk it before driving (don't get washed away if you try, use sticks or a rope for security!).

Regarding the pictures and water marks on our truck: our wheels are 95cm/37inch and we're almost covered, so the deepest point was somewhere around that.

name: potrero de la tienda
description:
We stayed one night. You have a view of the Chimborazo volcano and it is next to the road. We talked to the person at the store who was very nice and let us park here. Very quiet place to spend a night.

Español
Nos quedamos una noche. Tienes vista del volcán Chimborazo y esta al lado de la carretera. Hablamos con la persona de la tienda quien fue muy amable y nos dejó estacionar aquí. Fuera del poste ya que es de otra propiedad. Muy tranquilo el sitio para pasar una noche.

name: Nice place behind lost train station
description: It's  a nice flat gravel place. Beautiful views on the vulcanos. Quiet at night. Plenty of space. Close to panamericana south but in the middle of nowhere.

name: Balneario Indillamas
description:
Brandnew Balneario with resto, toilets and showers. Leveld parking lot with lots of space. Very friendly owners. On weekends a lot of locals come here.
Dayprice 1 Dollar per person. To stay over night we paid 3 Dollars.
You can park here and go to Lisan Wasi community. 20min walk. In Lisan Wasi there are Cabañas for rent.

name: Air Suites Boutique Hotel
description: Perfect place to stay if you don't want to be in the middle of town. It is clean, the breakfast is perfect, the area is safe (right across the Olympic stadium) and the hosts are friendly. Nearby is a shopping mall, there are good restaurants and a bus will take you anywhere. The hotel has a garage.

name: Mindo, Restaurante 'Serenity'
description: excellent kitchen, fresh camarones, dishes with vegetables. Nice presentation. Clean and it looks new. Good price. Recommend.

name: Bamboo ecolodge
description:
Great lodge for 27 person maximum. 
Made of bamboo in the middle of the forest and along the lagoon. 
10 rooms from std to luxury suits. 
Food is excellent from breakfast to diner. 
Most activities are done by motor boat or paddling. 
Guide know everything in the forest about animals, trees, plant,... 
We were looking for a 4 days tour more orienter nature than community visit and we found exactly what we needed. Spent only 3h cooking in a community. 
There is several lodge along the lagoon and river but than one looks really special with the bamboo structure (the owner is specialised in that type of construction)

name: Balneario El Encanto
description: It is a private property and the owner is happy to host travelers. We camped next to the river for one night for free. The Balneario is a nice spot where the locals swim and relax. There is a small shop for drinks and patatas fritas (homemade) and a nice fresh river. It is a beautiful place and the owner's family is super nice.

name: René and Anna’s place
description: We stayed two nights at René and Anna’s place while our car was in the garage of René his dad. They just finished a guest house and it is really beautiful. For 25$ a night you get a hot shower, a GREAT breakfast (with real bread!), a good night's sleep, a safe parking spot, free laundry and a beautiful garden. They are very lovely and speak German, English and Spanish. You can also park your van safely behind their gate. It is best to contact them before arrival. Anna’s number is: +593 981930528

name: behind Lago Agrio
description: There are a few spots between the main entrance of the lake and the back side, where you could park or even camp with a tent under a shelter. Just drive along that gravel road which turns off to the left after about 1,5 km (BE CAREFUL, SOME QUIET BIG ROCKS) and you will find a peaceful spot next to the lake and some local fincas. You may have 3G signal in that area with "Claro".

name: Parque de la Familia
description:
It is a beautiful park with an athletics track, children's games and courts. Ample parking, a large camper had to be parked with all comfort. There are shops around and inside the park there are bathrooms (take into account that they are locked at night).
Es un hermoso parque con pista de atletismo juegos infantiles y canchas. Parqueo amplio, poseía estacionarse un camper grande con toda comodidad. Hay tiendas al rededor y dentro del parque hay baños (Tomar en cuenta que por la noche los cierran con llave).

name: Achupalla Hacienda
description:
Family run hacienda with horses, llamas, a few cows and lots of space. Very pretty and quiet with space for large vehicles. There’s some fun 4x4 access camping and areas accessible by 2wd. Nice bathrooms with hot water. Diego’s family is usually here but if not, the hacienda manager lives in the lower house. Diego speaks english and runs a mechanic’s shop about a half hour away in case you need any vehicle work done. It’s called Rastech Mechanica Automotriz.

Highly recommended. I spent two months here during COVID 19 quarantine.

name: petroechador
description: A gas station along the valley road. Didn't have any signal, was relieved to find this one. Has a mini market also.

name: Grutas de La Paz
description:
It is a beautiful place with caves and hot springs. A charming place with a lot of history and culture. Keep in mind that there is a small stretch of dirt to get there.

Es un hermoso lugar con grutas y aguas Termales. Un sitio encantador con mu ha historia y cultura. Tener en cuenta que hay un pequeño tramo de terraceria para llegar, pero una combo entra perfectamente.

name: Summit 4000m. Ruta E30
description: this is the real location of the highest point on this road

name: Doctor of Machines
description: Very profesional and friendly mechanic and workshop. I needed them to fix water problems in the electrical circuit of my motorcycle (KLR650) and they handled it right away and with proper care of the machine. I saw them handle cars as well with profesional equipment. Lots of tires around too!

name: Primax with Water
description: Here we were able to fill it up our 140l tank ! Also you fill it up with the best view!! (see pic)

name: Casa de Edwin
description:
You can call Edwin Quiros at the number: +593 998352254, suddenly he could solve your problems as he did with us.

We had been without gas from Salento, Colombia and none of the ambassadors wanted to support us with this until we found him. He changed us the cylinder, the nozzle, and gave us the hose to recharge the cylinder later.
.
Pueden llamar a Edwin Quiros al numero: +593 998352254, de pronto él podría solucionarsus inconvenientes como lo hizo con nosotros. 

Llevábamos desde Salento, Colombia sin gas y ninguna de las embasadora nos quiso apoyar con esto hasta encontrarlo a él. Nos cambió el cilindro, la boquilla, y nos dio la manguera para recargar el cilindro más adelante.

name: start gravel road
description: from here on until the border to peru gravel road - ca. 50km! good drivable during dry days, could be a nightmare after or during rain. don't expect to be faster than 25 km/h.

name: LAVANDERIA D1
description:
self-service laundry. has 3 washing machines (10kg) and 2 dryers. Internet, bathroom, desk to work and parking. It costs $3 USD to wash and $1.40 USD to dry. good option in Quito

lavanderia de auto serviço. tem 3 máquinas de lavar (10kg) e 2 de secar. Internet, banheiro, mesa para trabalhar e estacionamento. custa $3 USD lavar e $1,40 USD secar. boa opção em Quito

name: Nice place beside the restaurant la Mazorca Dorada
description: Beside the restaurant you can stay over night if you eat at the restaurant. Almost flat, with beautiful view to the valley. Very friendly owner of the restaurant speaks some English and gave us a interesting tour to his biological farm, where he grows all the vegetables and herbs he uses for his cooking. Delishes traditional food for nice price.

name: Parqueo del 911
description:
Secure place. We slept here for two nights. We were told by neighbours that it was ok to stay here. 
......
Es un lugar seguro, amplio y gratuito. Nosotros dormimos aquí dos noches y no tuvimos inconvenientes, vino varias veces la policía a preguntar si vendíamos algo porque nos vieron cocinando y al ver que éramos viajeros nos dijeron que no había problema con que quedáramos aquí. Lo único es que del otro lado hay un campamento de migrantes indocumentados, pero no tuvimos problemas con ellos.
Nos tomamos un café en "Nuestra Tradición Coffee" y pedimos la clave del Wifi, además cruzando la calle hay un parque donde hay baños y agua potable.

name: Banco International
description: ATM with no commissions to get cash right on the main road.

name: Hotel Ebenezer
description:
Very kind and talkative local family running a simple hotel. Rooms start from 10 US$, depending on the size and if you choose a room with air conditioning or fan. I camped up at the rooftop for 5 US$. They gave me permanent access to a maintained bathroom with shower, toilet, mirror and sink downstairs. 
It is possible to use the kitchen.

name: Hotel La Cabana
description:
Simple, well-priced hotel at 10 US$ for a single room with fan. Cold shower absolutely comfortable in this climate (I normally prefer hot showers). 
My room was at the rooftop, so I appreciated feeling a bit more secluded. The guy in charge let me use the fridge too. 
The road noise can be a bit annoying though.

name: Gamacsa Mangueras
description: Shop for all kinds of (hydraulic and others) hoses and couplings

name: La División Playa
description:
Public parking lot in front of the beach of La Diversión and next to the restaurant Brisas del Mar Nelycita. great place to relax and enjoy tranquility and harmony. We got electricity from Mr. Ramon, the restaurant owner. when we arrived we were welcomed to the place.
.....
É um estacionamento público na frente da praia de La Diversión e ao lado do restaurante Brisas del Mar Nelycita. ótimo lugar para relaxar e desfrutar de tranquilidade e harmonia. conseguimos energia elétrica com o Sr. Ramon, dono do restaurante. quando chegamos nos deram as boas vindas ao lugar.

name: Empanadas Colonial
description: You're probably like 'ok, empanadas..' but these are unlike any empanadas I've ever had. A simple window with a limited menu, and some benches outside for seating. The pollo option actually has a bit of veggie and the cheese is unreal... Don't pass on the morocho either. We came here every other day for the weeks we were stuck in Cuenca due to protests. Cheap, filling and right on the river next a beautiful park.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento Primax
description:
Gigantic parking inside a Primax Gas Station. Calm, safe, convenience store, ATMs, bathroom and water. 

Estacionamento gigantesco dentro de um Posto de Gasolina Primax. Calmo, com segurança, loja de conveniência, caixas eletrônicos, banheiro e água.

name: Auto Motriz
description: A good workshop. Ask for Fabian, he knows a lot. When we came for a problem with overheating on the steep ascent of the road to the mountains he offered to come with us and see the problem. He spent one hour with us in the mountains too figure out the problem and in the end charged us only 8 USD for the part, that had to be replaced. We gave him a good tip

name: Gas station Virgen de Fatima
description: Very new gas station. Gasoline, diesel, diesel extra. That's what they have.

name: Lago San Pablo Boat Service
description: Large, flat grassy and part concrete area. Asked friendly local, if we could stay the night - sure, no problem. Quiet night, some dogs, waterfowl, and geese in the morning. No amenities. Had a good nights sleep, safe place . Good 4g claro

name: Next to the river
description: Nice place next to the river. we stayed 2 night, Wednesday night it was very quiet Thursday night not so much. You can here in the background the disco music (400m north from here). So we assume that the others spot north can be worse. During day very beautiful spot, water is perfect for swimming. And clean almost not Trash around. Some drafted wood to start a fire. Good 4g Claro. South from here there are others spots (not marked) along the river nice so .... plenty of options.

name: Mamallacta Paramo Lodge
description: Small, unique hotel at base of surrounding mountains immediately next door to the Papallacta hot spring park entrance. Enter down dirt road to the right of park entrance. Full bar and restaurant with high quality food. Indoor common areas for relaxation and entertainment and outdoor as well, including a playground area for children. Owner open to Overlanders parking vehicles on site, with access to public bathroom inside building. Unfortunately, no shower available for campers without booking a room, but with hot springs next door, showers are available there if needed. Family run business. Unique artistic flair to the facility (see website).

name: CoatiSacha NaturalCamping
description:
It is a small natural paradise in the jungle. On our land there is clean water but not filtered and approved. There is no bathroom yet but you can bathe in a small estuary. There is the possibility of making a bonfire or enjoying nature. We are 10 minutes from Puerto Misahualli there are a few small shops closer and 2 restaurants.
---
Es un pequeño paraíso natural en la Selva. En nuestro terreno hay agua limpia pero no filtrado y aprobado. Aún no hay baño pero se puede bañarse en un pequeño Estero. Hay la posibilidad de hacer una fogata u disfrutar de la naturaleza. Estamos a 10 min de Puerto Misahualli hay unas pequeños tiendas más cerca y 2 restaurantes.

name: Parking lot Mitad del Mundo
description: Visited the Park and the near-by Museo Inti-Ñan (where the real equator is located, by the way), asked if we could stay overnight- sure, no problem. US$ 3 all day. Amenities inside the Park. Super fast WiFi on the parking lot.

name: Punto ornitológico
description:
Beautiful place surrounded by nature.
Small van accepted ( combi size friendly )
15min walking to the center.
5 $ p.p
Don't hesitate to have a walk through the forest next to the river !

No ATM !

Give a WhatsApp message before your arrival !
+593 99 3672262

name: alcohol 96%
description:
shop name:Comisariato de quimicos
  Here you can buy alcohol for cooking. supermarkets and farmacias only have 70% alcohol

name: Cafeteria Witoca.Lab
description:
Open from Tuesday to Sunday (Monday Close) . They produced local coffee and cacao. Here you can also have a nice cup a coffee! They are supported for UE. Instagram: @witoca_coffee 
pH: 0992356124 for tour let they know in advance (a few days) $10pp

name: 4000m balcony
description: End of the unpaved road. Nice spot which overlooks on the valley. View of Cotopaxi when clear. Orange waterfall and not so warm hot springs near by. Half way to here there is a chain which is apparently open from 8 to 14, we arrived later and the guy in the house next to the chain opened it for us after a little discussion. A path goes up to the Illinizas from here, nice but not always easy to follow. Road to here is in pretty bad conditions, no need for 4wd but for clearance yes. Wouldn’t come with a van or something bigger.

name: A cool place
description: Nice big flat area among hills and pine trees. Nice view. Not too far from the paved road.

name: Iglesia vieja
description: 2 very big flat areas near an old church and some antennas. The view is very nice from up here and there is no noise from the road. After you pass the bus stop, at the intersection continue on the road to Guangora for a few hundreds meters and then turn right on a small dirt road that goes uphill, when it splits keep right and you’ll see the yellow church. The road is a bit narrow, not ideal for big RVs (maybe check it on foot before taking it). Tent campers could have a roof on their head.

name: camping Gopal
description:
Moderator Note: place added by owner.

Small warm and charming camping located at 10 minutes walking  from Puerto Misahualli ( cable car for 25 cents) or canoa for 50 cents. surrounded by a beautiful garden where you can observe monkeys , birds,colibris... Kitchen open to our customers . shared bathroom.  Tours organized in the jungle and around the town . Price from USD 3.  See you soon...
WhatsApp : +593984775790

name: Taller Especializado FORD/GM
description: Next to Hundai. Seems far better than FORD QUITO MOTORS just up the road. He and his main mechanic worked in the states and speak some english. Did a clean job on differential and transfercase oil change. Actually use a electronic torque wrench. WOW!!

name: Flat area for construction
description: Large flat area for future construction. Suitable for big rigs. We didn't ask, but nobody came on the morning. It is visible from the road. View of the valley is nice.

name: The Secret Garden (veg/vegan)
description: This is a great experience. We went to this vegan/vegetarian (some fish available too) restaurant where the owner, Ronnie, will cook you most things by request or anything off her menu. Caters to any dietary requirements. Lovely food, very reasonably priced and we had a nice relaxed evening chatting away with her and eating a lot! Mains $6, desert $2.5. Menu on Google. It’s in her house and cooked to order, so reservations only by WhatsApp +593 964058132. Don’t be out off by the fact you can’t just turn up, it’s worth it. She is Australian too, so you don’t need Spanish for this one!

name: Las Lajas waterfall
description: Las Lajas cascada. Nice 2 levels waterfall with possibility of swimming. Entrance 2$/pp. Maybe more turistic than other possibilities around here. There is decent gravel/concrete road from the main one. From car park (marked position on overlander) it is around 5 min walk down. There is a house with changing rooms and toilet close to the waterfall.

name: Petro Ecuador
description: nice place to fill it up our fresh water tank. they have a hose so no need to use ours ...

name: gasstation ruta 132
description: new gas station just out of Pichincha. clean showers & toilets. Free Wifi at the shop.

name: Mirador Del chasque
description:
A restaurant with a viewpoint overlooking the Cotopaxi Volcan, we were very well received by Diovane, owner of the restaurant, we had lunch at the restaurant, good food and a fair price, playground for children, infinity swing overlooking the Cotopaxie, several animals, sheep, Ilhama, ducks, pigs, horse, cow and not to mention the view, which is incredible! They charged us 5 dollars per car and couple with child, to enjoy all this!
---
Um restaurante com mirador com vista pra volcan cotopaxi,fomos muito bem recebidos por diovane proprietário do restaurante , almoçamos no restaurante boa comida e preço justo , playgroud pra crianças ,balanço infinito com vista pra cotopaxie vários animais , ovelhas , ilhama,patos ,porcos ,cavalo , vaca e sem fala da vista que é incrível !Nos cobraram 5 dólares por carro e casal com criança , pra disfruta de tudo isso !

name: Mirador Del chasque
description:
An excellent place, restaurant with good food, has energy, water, bathroom and Wi-Fi .. they charged us 5 dollars a day , has a playgraud , swing with a view of the volcano and several animals Very receptive owner Geovane …
---
Um excelente lugar ,restaurante com boa comida, tem energia , água,banheiro e Wi-Fi..nos cobraram 5 dólares por dia , tem playgraud , balanço com vista pra vulcão e vários animais ilhama,ovelha ,cavalo,pato muito bonito e o Geovane proprietário muito receptivo …

name: Finca San Andres
description: Arrived here late (6pm) with our campervan without a reservation. The family hosted us amazing, brought us wood for a campfire, gave us electricity etc. Place has clean toilets, a volleybal net, bbq place, firespot and even a playfield for kids. We were the only ones staying here on nice green grass with a gorgeous view. Rene and his family are super welcoming! Make sure you dont skip this little gem!

name: Máster clean express
description: Automatic washing machine at different prices. From 2 to 4 dollars the huge one. New machines, clean and gentle owner. Also drying machines.

name: Planta Procesadora & Futebol Field
description: In front of Planta Procesadora de Frutas, behind football field. Great spot for overnight, easy parking, bathroom, water and a open wifi. We just asked to the friendly neighbor in front of.

name: Rustic
description:
They sell homemade pasta, lasagne, pizza, nachos, burritos, shawarma and ice-cream.
In general the quality is alright. For my taste the dough of the pizza was too sweet, but others may like it.
Pizza grande / familiar 9 $ (enough for one person).
The staff is very kind!

name: Hotel Sol de Oriente
description:
The staff is very kind. Most rooms have been renovated. The whole hotel is kept cleaned by the attentive staff. Wifi works well. There are areas where one can work, rest or eat. It is possible to store small things in the fridge. Kitchen facilities are not available.
The shower is hot! During my stay there was a problem with the cold water pipe. Therefore the shower was way too hot. So I recommend to check if they have fixed it!
The most basic rooms are 10 $, others quite spacious rooms can be 13 $ per person. 
To me it is the best choice out of the only three hotels in town!

name: Hotel Regina
description:
It is a well maintained, local style hotel.  Rooms start from 10 $ per person in low season. Some rooms are more cozy than others and some have hot showers. The walls are thin as usual in this part of the world, so you can hear everything at any desired time. The Wifi works very well at some spots, especially at the sheltered terrace, where they also have a bunch of tables. The owners are kind and I personally got along well with them! But at times it can be difficult to communicate with them. They seem to like a bit of tension. ;-/
On the whole I absolutely recommend to stay at Hotel Regina if you are looking for a budget and non touristic location closed enough to everything.

name: wild camping next to the river
description:
next to the bridge Big area to put your tent.
Wet met some people fishing and doing laundry during the week-end. possible to stay in the abandoned building if it's raining a lot but the Access was pretty muddy for us .
water from the river

name: Boats to Nuevo Rocafuerte
description:
Here you can find a boat to ship your motorcycle to nuevo rocafuerte (beginning of the long journey to Iquitos). I attached the time table.

No more ATM until Iquitos so take enough cash with you, you'll can change it in iquitos at the official rate.

We paid 60$ for each motorcycle until Nuevo Rocafuerte (didn't negotiate as I found it fair and they helped us embarking / disbarking the bikes which wasn't too easy).

No one ever asked anything regarding the TIP (there is no aduana here so you can't really exit "legally" the bike from the country...if you chose to do it anyway its possible but you'll risk a 450$ /day fee if you return to Ecuador.)

We asked the 2 agencies working there and they told us we can't travel on the same boat as the bikes. We put the bikes at 6:00 AM on a canoa de carga (60$/moto) and took the speedboat of 1 PM (38$ pp). There is also a slow boat leaving in the morning for 20$ but we had to go the migration at this time.

The canoa de carga took 10 hours and the speedboat took 4. we arrived before our bikes at 5 pm.

Here is Joaquin's number (the captain of the canoa de carga we used) : 0989111328

name: Fernando Sifuente
description:
Fernando took the two of us and our two motorcycles to Pantoja for 60$ all included (not sure its always that cheap as he had to go there anyway, but expect to pay between 60$ and 80$).

I leave you his number in case of need : 0980519789

name: Taj Mahal Indian Restaurant
description:
delicious indian/pakistani food with apetizers and various vegetarian options. They also sell Falafel and Shawarma.
recommended if you are looking for south asian dishes!

name: "Resort Tigrillo"
description:
Beautiful place to spend time, green areas, in the middle of the nature, it has a swimming pool, artificial lagoon, kayak, hammocks, price per person $5, children $2.50. Very nice people, monkeys and parrots 
.....
lugar hermoso para pasar, áreas verdes, en medio de la naturaleza de Macas, cuenta con piscina, laguna artificial, kayak, hamacas, precio por persona $2, niños $1

name: Petro Ecuador
description: this fuel station is important to get gas in this area becuase is big and good quality, its arround the comercial area, markets, banks, mechanics, storage, camping ground, etc

name: AUTOTRÓNICA TALLER & OFICIOS
description:
Mechanic specialized in VW with parts 

Mécanicien spécialisé en VW avec repuestos de pièces

name: Cabañas "Joy"
description:
A very nice place to camp, it is next to the crystalline Inchillaqui river, very safe and quiet, 10 minutes away from the city of Tena, perfect to spend a few days with the family. It is a very welcoming family. It is important to contact Joy León beforehand at 0996662041 for directions on how to get there.
---
un lugar muy bonito para acampar, está junto al rio inchillaqui cristalino, muy seguro y tranquilo, retirado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Tena, perfecto para pasar en familia unos días. Es una familia muy acogedora.
Es importante contactarse antes con Joy León 0996662041 para las indicaciones de cómo llegar.

name: Hostal la Tortuga
description:
Hostal with dwellings and a huge patio for motorhome. We pay $5 a night. Quiet, safe and close to the beach. The couple of landowners are very kind and helpful. 
---
Hostal com habitações e um pátio enorme para motorhome. Pagamos US$5 a noite. Silencioso, seguro e próximo da praia. O casal de senhores proprietários são muito amáveis e solícitos.

name: Lavandería Lady Diana
description:
Family lavandería, we pay $1 a kilo of clothing.
We put it to wash in the morning and search in the late afternoon. 
---
Lavandería familiar, pagamos US$1 por quilo de roupa.
Colocamos para lavar pela manhã e buscamos no final da tarde.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Gasolonera Santa Rosa
description:
Parking at the gas station near the highway.
Safe and relatively quiet at night. 
---
Estacionamento do Posto de combustível próximo da rodovia.
Seguro e relativamente silencioso durante a noite.

name: Sonhando Acordado: Estacionamento para Pernoitar
description:
Small family parking (Mr. Henrique) well located in the Neighborhood Lá Mariscal, we pay US$15 for overnight stay from Friday until Monday morning.
We recommend only for weekends, because there are monthly and the space is small (at most Van). 
Nearby we saw that there are other larger parking lots that are not business, maybe allow overnight too. 
---
Pequeno estacionamento familiar (Sr. Henrique) bem localizado no bairro Lá Mariscal, pagamos US$15 para pernoitarmos de sexta até segunda pela manhã.
Recomendamos apenas para finais de semana, porque há mensalistas e o espaço é pequeno (no máximo Van). 
Nas proximidades vimos que há outros estacionamento maiores que não são de empresas, talvez permitam pernoitar também.

name: Estación de servicio Shell Pifo
description:
Small and quiet service station, with very friendly staff. The parking lot is free and with a small green area. Water available but not drinkable, bathrooms open 24 hours. It has a small mini market.
---
Pequeña y tranquila estación de servicio, con personal muy amable.
El parqueadero es gratuíto y con una pequeña área verde.
Agua disponible pero no potable, baños abiertos la 24 horas.
Dispone de un pequeño mini market.

name: La Casa del Rio
description:
The number of the owner Maria is below, so you can contact her directly. Beautiful and modern shared house, well-priced at around 12 $ per Person. It offered a good, hot shower, suitable working space, a washing machine and a kitchen with basic cooking utensils. It would need more equipment for the number of people that are hosted at that place. 
It has been mostly quiet and therefore highly suitable to work remote (digital nomading). 
The communication lacked a bit, as Maria has not been around herself and the responsible people were unaware of certain arrangements that had been made (such as extending the stay).
Overall I definitely recommend staying at "La Casa del Rio". Given the location and facilities, it must be one of the best options in Cuenca.

Maria (owner):  +593 99 816 3356
+593 96 290 1545. She uses Whats App as well!

name: Small gasstation
description: This is a small gas station with diesel and gasoline. Openings hours: mon-fri (8:00-12:00 and 13:00-17:00, sat 8:00-13:00). Phone number 0982717743). If they are closed you can go to this house (-4.552234, -79.133181) or ask around. All people know each other there. We paid $3,10 per gallon

name: Hotel Central
description: 30$ a night for 2 persons with private bathroom. The hotel looks brand new. Very clean, comfortable bed, good Wi-Fi and amazing hot shower (which worked in the evening and morning). The nice owner offered us a breakfast (hot drink, bread with cheese and bananas). We could put our bikes inside in the restaurant room (which is not used).

name: Casa Blue Tortuga
description: We stayed here at a room $35 per night and fixed our van in their private parking lot where they have a lot of space! The elderly woman is so nice!! And told me that not many people come around this time and she was so thankful. She speaks Spanish but I think if you ask her if you could spend the night at the parking lot for some money she would agree to it. She has nice facilities table tennis, football table, pool, basketball area, pool, nice bar, toilets etc. Fast wifi. Her whatsapp number: 099-441-3614

name: Hotel Rosamia
description: Nice clean hotel with small parking in premises nice for bikes. Close to downtown. 25 USD one person

name: Km 50 Ansu Yaku  Balneario el Tulcan
description: It is a place where you can spend a very quiet night. near the river. You can eat at the restaurant (fish) and Fernando and his family, who are very nice, authorize us to sleep here. It's a good place. Santiago.... from France

name: Parque de Baeza
description:
We slept in this park, it is quite neglected but it is a good option to spend the night, because it is safe, very quiet and our dog also enjoyed the grass. It is free but has no facilities.

Dormimos en este parque, está bastante descuidado pero es una buena opción para pasar la noche, pues es seguro, muy tranquilo y además nuestra Perrita disfrutó del pasto. Es gratuito pero no tiene facilidades.

name: PetroEcuador

name: parqueadero 2

MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Crimes reported in this location. Please use caution.
tried sleeping here but cops came at 1am and recommended to move as it's not safe. specially when only ones at the lot

name: JP Decor Autos Tecnicentro
description: We found this automotive technical center in Naranjal. It has saved our lives because we found the 4 tires we needed, after looking for them all over South America practically (lol). They sell all kinds of tires, wheels, accessories and do balancing and general mechanics. They receive all credit cards and handle very reasonable prices. They also have a headquarters in Cuenca. The owner Juan Pablo is very kind and attentive.

name: Taller de Chapa y Pintura « flower »
description:
Good job for repair of glass fiber and welding. We negotiated the price! 
Anyway, the work is excellent ! We filled up the water tank for free. You can camp in the street too.

name: Estacion de servicio San Juan
description:
Small service station with free parking, bathrooms open 24 hours. Water available but not drinkable.
Minimarket next door.
--
Pequeña estación de servicio con parqueadero gratis, baños abiertos las 24 horas. Agua disponible pero no potable.
Minimarket al costado.

name: hotel Santa Rosa
description: Clean and comfortable, with blazingly fast internet. There is a secure parking area, not sure if it fits cars since the two days (Tuesday and Wednesday) I was here there was a market blocking the entrance for cars. 15 dollars for a single room

name: gas station maría beatriz
description: toilets, shower (cold). safe and nice night

name: St Emilia Hostel
description: Beautiful little hostel near the shopping mall. Great clean rooms. Good shower and bathroom. $45 per room per night excluding tax. Secure parking on the premises. Recommended!

name: Casa Blanca Hortencia
description: Hostel on the outside of town. Nice rooms, clean. Swimming pool! Secure parking Different prices for rooms, with or without airconditioning etc. We paid $45 for bigger room with air

description:
An amazing spot right on the beach to have a drink, camp or park with a stunning view and a few meters from the ocean.

Edison is a local very chill surfer
He also rents surf boards.

3$ per person with tent 
Parking available.

+593979543053 Edison

name: Roadside spot
description: If you don't like to sleep in town at the river side, you can drive this road to this spot. It is not a fancy place and next to the road, but it was flat enough and we had a quiet night here.

name: Hostal Las Palmas
description: Beautiful little hostel situated around an abundant garden. Rooms from $26 and up (ex taxes). Private bathroom.

name: Quilotoa
description: Parking lot close to a restaurant some blocks away from the center. The owner is very friendly. we asked if we could spend the night there. No services. very close to the laguna.

name: Finca las Divinas
description:
[ONLY WITH RESERVATION] A charming family farm that accepts people to camp or in a motorhome. We spent two weeks here with lots of delicious fruits that fall from the trees around the campsite. The property has a direct exit to a practically deserted beach. They charge $5 per person, but rates may vary based on vehicle type and resource usage. Water also has limitation depending on the season. They only accept reservations (Johana - Whats +593 99 164 3958)

----------------------------
[SOLO CON RESERVA] Una encantadora finca familiar que acepta gente para acampar o en autocaravana. Pasamos dos semanas aquí con muchas frutas deliciosas que caen de los árboles alrededor del campamento. La propiedad tiene salida directa a una playa prácticamente desierta. Cobran $5 por persona, pero las tarifas pueden variar según el tipo de vehículo y el uso de recursos. El agua también tiene limitación dependiendo de la temporada. Solo aceptan reservas (Johana - Whats +593 99 164 3958)

some locals working for the city invited us to stay here, explaining that there were a lot of bikers staying there for the night. 
it's a sport hall next to what's called the mercado (but we never saw it open). it has a cover so you're protected from the rain
people around and children played different kind of sport. very friendly people. 
we stayed here 2 nights, it felt safe
wc and water available 
a lot of stores in the village

name: Brisa del mar
description:
All right it has wifi, hot shower. Safe
Garage as well
15$ per night per person

name: Open space
description: A narrow entry from the road. It has an open area. You are not totally hidden, but in the dark cars probably will not notice you. Enough space for a tent as well.

name: Gas Station.
description:
Good place for to stay one night. 
Safe and 24h. 1h from the border.

name: Hostal Bernys Estrellita Inn
description:
Basic hotel, not too expensive. 
$16 for a double room, private bathroom. Hot shower. There’s also a restaurant. 
Safe private parking available in a garage downstairs.

name: Mitsucar
description: Mitsucar is a small parts shop that specialises in mitsubishi and hyundai parts. They supplied me with airfilter, ball joints, bumpstop, steering rod ends and a special reverse switch on the gearbox. Needed for a mitsubishi L300 4wd.

name: Hotel Uriel
description: 15 dollars for one night (one person). Thought this was a pretty good price and when I searched on bookings I couldn’t find anything cheaper. Don’t know how it is for people in vans but for a cyclist it was great. Clean big room. The ac didn’t work but the fan worked fine. There’s also a store just next to it where I think you can get a sim card.

name: Finca don Gary
description: Manuel from Cascadas de Manuel (1km away at the waterfalls) organised us a little tour to see the process of growing until packing the Bananas in this finca. Gary, the owner is really friendly and explained us (in spanish)  everything we wanted to know. Its a 9 ha, fair trade, Bio, not monoculture finca who exports to NL, FR and other countries. He didn’t want money at all. So we tipped him with 4 dollars. If you want to go too, contact him trough Manuel, try to show up or write him in advance by mail: gary_mendieta@hotmail.com.

name: Posto Shell
description: Great place to stay for a night. Nice employees, good bathrooms with shower. Very clean and safe. They have a good small store and free wifi too.

name: mercado Lago Agrio
description: nice fresh product market (fruits, vegg, meat, fish). Friendly people good products, ok price, easy to Park,beven Big rig

name: Restaurante Oásis Marisqueria
description: Nice restaurant. Good meals. Cheap prices. WiFi too.

name: Pára-brisas
description: Nice and reliable windshield store in Loja. All sorts of windshields for cars, trucks and buses.

name: The car sport
description: Nice shop with all kinds of accessories for cars. 4 floors with many, many parts. Family owned place.

name: Custom Window Install
description: The guys at MetalBus installed custom windows for us on our van and did a fantastic job. They do custom windows on the massive busses. Place isn't on Google, but the location is correct. You can also park at the end of this road overnight, super quiet.

name: El Tío Hostal & camping
description:
Amazing place close to Otavalo.
El Tío is a great person, great service. 
rooms are available as well as a camping ground. 
shared kitchen, and bathroom with warm water.
great internet ! +593984491625

name: Hostal Curiñan
description:
A beautiful hotel overlooking the town of Otavalo with views of Imbabura and Cotacachi volcanoes. 

A hotel done in traditional architecture with private rooms with beautiful views. The hotel has services of a restaurant and tours of Otavalo and the surrounding area. 

Contact Inty : 0959116605

name: Hotel Toledo, Santa Rosa
description:
Basic hotel. $20 for a double room.
Private bathroom, warm water. 
Garage available. 

The two ladies at the desk were not really friendly though. Not really interested.

name: Ohlala French Bakery
description: Excellent french Baguette & Croissants from 8:30 am. Mondays closed.

name: Primax Gas Station
description: Easy water fill up in the back corner. Good pressure. Said it was potable but we always filter no matter what.

name: El Escondite
description:
We came here looking for the local coffee, instead we found the most welcoming Ecuadorian-Swiss couple. He has travelled the world for 18 years and invited us in his home to celebrate the Chinese new year with another couple. They have a beautiful place. We had the best time. 

A combi sized van fits inside, but there's place right outside too, very safe, very quiet town.

Shower and toilet available, also wifi and 110v electricity.

If you want fresh pizza from the oven or other food, it's best to send them a message beforehand, otherwise you can just show up. It's the last house in the top left corner if you come from the main road. 

Daniele y Gabriela; +593 99 407 2133

Please send them love from Benjamin and Annie from Belgium!

name: Hosteria Los Chorreras
description: Hostel with shop and restaurant attached. Not actually staying but was missing and the food here is good, cafe, English breakfasts. Plenty of cakes and bits to buy. Worth a stop after you come off the roads above here.

name: Plaza Abdon Calderon
description: We slept at the square of this city, it was super quiet on a Tuesday night. There are bathrooms you can use, it costs USD 0.25. The lady that cleans the bathrooms is usually around the plaza and leaves the  bathrooms doors closed, so you need to find her to open it. There is free wifi from the city, but it doens't work.

name: D’Lirios
description: Real nice restaurant. Awesome food. Not expensive. 5-11 USD for shareable plates. Desayuno, lunch and dinner. I had the most wonderful costijas de cerdo and shared it with my son for lunch.

name: PARQUE DE LA JUVENTUD
description: Best place to alero in Nueva Loja, next to a huge park and the fire station. Firefighters would give you water and electricity. Right next is a small forest where you can see monkeys in the afternoon. Theres a grocery store (supermercado galindo) in front of the park. Safe and no noice.

name: Enjoy - Heladería y Waffles
description: Cute little place where you can buy and eat excellent homemade icecream and waffles. They also serve good coffee.

name: Roxy cafe
description: Very nice Italian restaurant, good food and very friendly staff. Also sells local liquor and chocolate.

name: MK servicio técnico
description: Fine mechanic shop. Fixed my breaks here. Very fast, good service, gentle people.

name: Riverside
description: we parked for one night next to the river in front of the yellow house. quiet and safe

name: Jardin Pacifico
description:
Beach side rooms and bungalow. Secure parking, will also accept small camper van.
Lovely rooms with en-suite (hot water) and good fan. Terrace with table and chairs and hammocks. Well equipped kitchen.
Fire possible on beach.
Very friendly owners, English and Spanish spoken.
$27.50 per night for double room - excellent, will return.

name: Lavandería Lava Clean
description:
We ask how much it cost. They said that the price depends of the size of the laundry machine. The price starts in 6USD. 

Preguntamos los precios y nos dijeron que el precio es por máquina (y por la ropa que entre). Los precios son a partir de 6USD

name: Hacienda cacao y mango
description:
This is a really nice place where you can make a cacao tour trough the cacao Plantage and get explained the whole process. At the end you will make your own cacao and chocolate bar. The tour costs $20,- p.p. and takes 2 till 3 hours. If you want a 3 course lunch it will costs $35,- p.p. 
Its good to make a reservation one day in advance. +593 98-798-1377. Ninfa will help you with everything you need and she speaks good english. Its also possible to stay for the night. They have toilets, no shower. You can also rent a little bungalow for $30,- a night.

name: casa coral
description: Hostal that has room for about 3 vehicles out back, one tree supplying shade, the last cabana has an outside outlet. --nice patio, hammocks, swing chair, open shared kitchen, secured gate, wifi that reaches outback. nice view of the crashing waves, beer next door. $7-$8 per person, warm afternoon showers after the tank heats up.  2 cats on site.

name: Hosteria PapaGayo
description: It is a very beautiful place, surrounded by nature and animals, you can enjoy the wet area as a sauna and jacuzzi, at night there is a campfire, the camping area has its own shower with hot water and amenities, you can also enjoy the restaurant with delicious meals, we have a large parking lot for the safety of your vehicle

name: Mirador Tres Cruces
description:
We wanted to sleep in the PN CAJAS but the parking lot was closed because they were doing maintenance. So, they said to us we could sleep in this view point. 
It was safe but not really quiet, it’s next to the road and there is a lot of traffic. 
There is 3G with Claro but doesn’t work. 
-----------------
Quisimos dormir en el estacionamiento del PN CAJAS pero le estaban haciendo mantenimiento; así que ellos mismos nos indicaron que durmiéramos en este mirador. 
Es seguro pero no es muy tranquilo. Esta al lado de la ruta y pasan muchos autos, incluso muchos paran de noche en el mirador. 
Hay 3G con Claro pero no funciona.

name: Abandoned Building
description:
An abandoned building on top of a hill with an incredible view of Chimborazo and when it really clears up, you can even see Carihuairazo in the distance.
The building only has one door opening and no windows so it does a great job of blocking the wind and cold. There's a colibri nest inside with two colibris flying around all day, didn't seem like my presence bothered them.
Some signs of people hanging out here, maybe on the weekends. But I had a very peaceful and quiet night.
Easy access for motos and bicycles, I'm sure cars can get up here too if they really want.

name: Hosteria El Surillia
description: Hotel with swimming pools that offers camping on it’s property.  Bathrooms, with hot water showers in pool area (not private so wear your swimsuit), big grassy field and kitchen area with grill and  sink for washing dishes.  $5 per adult to camp and $4 for child age 3 and over.  Swimming is extra fee.  $10 per adult and $5 for child over age 3.

name: Hacienda Santa Ana lodging
description: not possible to spend the night in our car on this very nice hacienda/ hotel.

name: Orilla del Río
description:
A pretty place with natural surroundings. Good for the night.
.....
Es un lindo río con naturaleza alrededor, precioso para pasar la noche.

name: Car wash
description: Car wash , also grafite spray to help against salt water

name: ADVmoto
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   

Guesthouse for travelers.
We offer lodging to adventurous travelers, we have garage for motorcycles. We can help you plan your route in the country, we can help you with whatever you need.

Hosteria Rincon del Pacifico

name: El rey de las fritadas
description:
Yes yes.  The king of fritadas.  But really I’ve been in Ecuador more then a year and a half and I’ve eaten a lot of fritadas.   This simple road side stop is the best.  

I first stopped here because I saw how many trucks were stopped. That means 2 things. It either cheap or really good. So here I am for the 8th and finial time as I drive north I’m here. 

Happy fritadas!!

name: Al Paso
description:
Great lunch restaurant. Large parking lot good to keep an eye on vehicle.
Great value

name: La rica mordida
description: Really nice spot to have a drink, superbe coctails and the best owner!

name: Along the road
description: As there were too many mosquitoes along the river we found this place to spend the night on the way to Mindo. Road is flat, wide and quiet until the first buses rush by in the morning.

name: Finca de la Vaca - Swiss Bistro Cumandá
description:
a Swiss gentleman owned restaurant which has been turned into a campground/glamping resort. 
This place is absolutely beautiful for camping.
a sheltered campground. bring your own tent is 18$

this is a gem of a place.
the restaurant is Swiss and has one of the most incredible Swiss menus.

Wifi, secure parking, hot showers, a river, firepit with firewood provided, and swimming pool.

name: Euro Frenó Sur
description:
Auto mechanic workshop. Specialists in diesel engines, injection, oil change and mechanics in general. Mr. David was very attentive and diligent in helping us with the repair of the injectors. We were also able to stay overnight in our motorhome. Very reasonable prices.
---
Taller de mecánica automotriz. Especialistas en motores diesel, Inyección, cambio de aceite y mecánica en general. El señor David fue muy atento y diligente al ayudarnos con la reparación de los inyectores. Además pudimos quedarnos a pasar la noche en nuestro motorhome. Precios muy razonables.

name: Victor Hugo hotel & restaurant
description: Fairly priced meals .. most around 8 usd; good music and relaxing atmosphere; the offer rooms and have inside parking, but only if you get a room

name: Shelmar  Lavanderia
description: On the main street, near where David sells water and ice.  $1.00 per lb..  minimum  $2.

name: Mora Motor Sport
description:
Multi-brand automotive mechanic, suspension repair, clutch, engine repair

￼

name: Market
description: Fresh fruit and vegetables. Als almuerzos and handcrafted goods

name: Pacoche Lodge & Reserve
description: Small hotel with a few Cabañas and a restaurant. Beautiful located in the selva but still close to main road. They have 2 trails where you can experience some wildlife incl. a family of howler monkeys. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good local food in the restaurant. Average wifi only in the restaurant. Found the place in booking. Prices for the restaurant are ok, the food delicious. Prices for the Cabañas are definitely too high. 80 USD for 2p incl. breakfast. The Cabañas need urgent renovations. We expected definitely more in this category.

name: Cumilinche Club
description: Beautifully situated with “private” beach. We stayed in Bungalow no. 7 high above the interesting beach with a fantastic view over the ocean. Our motos were parked close by under shady trees all secure. The  good restaurant serves all meals upon request. Various breakfast from under 4$. En the evening we made a campfire on the beach. We had the place literally to ourselves. 61$ per night for 2, after negotiating we payed 50. Pricey but worth the stay. At low tide you can walk left until Punta Galera or to the right with interesting beach formation.

name: Hotel Rio Napu
description: In front of the hotel you have a secured parking lot where you can park or store your camper for 3$ a day. We stored our camper here while visiting the amazone for one week.  No electricity, only a water tap you can use.

name: Amici Cannis Veterinaria
description: Very nice vets, took good care of our cat. They are non profit organisation so not too expensive. We paid less than $50 for three vaccines and a blood test. They speak English too if you need.

name: Vandanam Indian Restaurant
description: Reasonably priced and very good curry! Lots of veggies options. Let us in with our pet too. Mains around $5-7, good portions.

name: hostal Jora Continental
description:
very nice hostal, very friendly owner who takes care of her host
the beds are very good, wifi very good. 
hot shower
good breakfast included (fruits, fresh juice, eggs, advocate, ham, bread and coffee).
25 dollar for a 2 people bethroom, shared bathroom (we negociated 23). 30 for matrimonial

name: Toroleo
description: This guy repaired our 2 flat tires very professional!!

name: Primax Palmetto Plaza Manta
description: Palmetto service station.  New place with security at night.  It has a shopping center with a bar, market, ice cream shop, etc.  We slept one night and it was very peaceful.

name: Gas Station el Altar
description: Free parking ; Big gas Station; bathrooms; mini market and big parking on a level gravel area; little noise for a gas station ; ask the person in the mini market for permission

name: Crucita
description: A quiet place on Crucita boulevard, we spent a quiet night without noise, we asked the neighbors and they said it was a safe place to spend the night next to the waves

name: Tayta Wasi
description: Excellent coffee and lightning fast wifi. I registered 180mbs!

name: nice Road with orchids
description: Very nice driving through Mountains, lots of orchids and other flowers beside the unpaved Road. Should be possible with 4x2, when rainy better 4x4. Few places to sleep, Sometimes one lane with bus coming

name: Espeletia Lodge
description: Brand new hostería right before you enter to the Polylepis lodge. Cabañas, restaurant, hiking, bird watching and plants. Very friendly people. We stayed one night and had a nice hike recommended by Arturo, the GM who is quite an inspiration with his 82 years. The facility just opened, we were the 1st guests by chance. Internet still needs to be installed. This place is a great option if you won’t afford the Polylepis Lodge. Parking for big rig is possible. Checkout “Espeletia Lodge” in Insta & FB. The restaurant provides excellent food. We had the best chicken breast with salsa de champignons and vegetables in all Ecuador. The young chef knows his business well.

name: Las menestras del negro
description: If you are in the center of Quito, it is the best clean and cheap alternative, food from 3.75 US dollars, in the surroundings the dishes in a restaurant were from 10 dollars or more, clean and fast food type service, meat, chicken, pork

name: yumbo impérial hostel
description:
really nice hostal, with kitchen
good wifi, nice staff
cons: you hear everything from your neighbors and the beds are really little and not confy. 
nice location in the city center, next to the main square
hot shower :)
14 dollar for a double room with shared bathroom (we easily negociated 10), 5 for a single
we could let our bikes in some room (bodega)

name: Parking behind police station
description: Very safe spot to park behind the police station. We asked and it was fine. We were here for carnaval, which is probably the only time this place is worth visiting. Or if you're on your way to or out of Quito, it's a good resting spot with several restaurants nearby and also a playground right next to the lot.

name: Paraíso Persa
description: Iranian spot with really delicious falafel and chicken shawarma! And their house sauces are delicious. The place is a bit shabby, but definitely worth a stop. They're also open really late if you're in a pinch.

name: La Molienda
description:
Recreation area with cabins and swimming pool. Don Manolo the owner is very kind, he offered us a space for the camper next to the swimming pool
---------------
Área de recreación con cabañas y piscina. Don Manolo el propietario es muy amable, nos ofreció un espacio para el camper al lado de la piscina

name: Mirador Nuevos Horizontes
description: Very nice Place, directly on the Road Puyo - Macas. With increíble view about de Amazon Dschungel. Entry 1.$

name: Novospszio building tap next to the drive way
description: There is a tap next to the garage door we filled water, it’s not potable but works for cleaning. We asked the security guard before filling.

name: Chorrera
description:
Parking in a small, safe and quiet fishing village
Estacionar en un pueblo de pescadores pequeño, seguro y tranquilo

name: Uga uga junk food
description: This is a wonderfull place to eat  hamburgers, hot dogs, french fríes, drinks, Travel friendly, made for a traveler

name: Primax gas station
description: Clean bathrooms and showers , Cold showers

name: Alfredo- la clinica de la moto
description: This garage has been recommended to us by other motorists. Alfredo has experience over more than 24 años as mechanic and has a lot of clients with big bikes. We had several problems, like a leaking radiator, damaged threads, tire changes, etc and he solved everything and serviced our 2 bikes excellent. Highly recommended for all bike travelers for small and big bikes like KTM Adventure, KLR, Tenere, BMW, Transalp, etc. Here is his cellphone and whatspp +593(0)994936096.

name: Glas repair
description: Here we let repair three broken spots in our windshield. Very very rare to find. they seem to be professional. We paid US$45 for all of it which seems to be fair regarding the Taxidriver who recommended us this spot himself. He paid ones $40 for one crack.

name: Lucia cafe - Best Pie
description: Amazing light, fresh pie. Strawberry shortcake and banoffee pie are our favourite. Open till late, pet friendly and clean washrooms. And you can draw on the table

name: Auto clinic motor
description: We got a big dent down for one third the price in one day. He lets you use his tools. Quick fix and very cheap Russian mechanic. It’s fancy but you get the job done

name: Hostal Pillango Rest en Baños
description:
in this place runs by a very nice family, you can use the kitchen area, they have hot water and privated bathroom, they have a big parking free for the guests. they have a fire area, tv in each room.
it is a great hostel and it is so calm and there are not noisy.
they have secured parking for a motorcycle, highly recommend

name: Taller Gustavo Suarez
description: nice little shop without height restriction, they repared a cooling hose, which we could not buy in this country. seems, they can repair a lot!

name: Isidro Ayora
description:
good location very quiet and safe

buena ubicación muy tranquilo y seguro

name: Beautiful Road from/to Laguna Quilotoa
description: all paved road in georgous landscape, no potholes, scenic drive, low traffic. Recommendation!

name: Ayampe Camping Park
description: Cool place close to Ayampe and Las Tunas. great beach. big rigs can enter

name: Salinerito - cheese/charcuterie
description: Great little shop with lots of cheeses (mix packs!), salamis, nuts, honey, chocolate and other charcuterie type things! Yum!

name: Estancia de la Campiña
description:
Before Nono's main street, turn left and you'll find Estancia de la Campiña.
With bathrooms, wifi, a wide field to set an RV or a tent, Andrés -the host- will share his space and also options to eat, his grill and hang-out around.
This place is close to the detour to Tandayapa and has very close options  for bird-watching and trails.

name: Riobamba - Church
description:
Ample parking in front of a beautiful Church (free), quiet place except for the the church bell. Internet free but weak.
.....
Amplo estacionamento em frente a uma linda igreja (free) local tranquilo, exceto pelas badaladas do sino da igreja. internet free mas fraca.

name: Full Diesel Valencia
description: Diesel experts. We lost turbo pressure and they were able to find and change the valve in one day for our European VW Crafter. Also asked them if they could do a oil and filter change and done quickly and professionally. Highly recommended for your diesel truck/van. Very friendly staff (Spanish only).

name: Cloud Forest Hostel
description: Awesome hostel! Flat space for 2 vehicles in a really big, social hostel. It’s the mid-point for the hike, so lots of people, tons of hammocks and picnic tables, pool tables, fooseball, ping pong, free tea/coffee all day. Family-style dinner/breakfast for $3. Access to a room for toilets/hot showers (so pretty much private for you). $3pp to stay in your car. Great deal, we loved it here! Only downsides are their big, loud dog barks a lot in the night, very slow wifi, and there is some road noise starting early. Worth it for the atmosphere!

name: 1835 coffee lab
description: Very nice little restaurant. Healthy dishes with nice vegetables, juices, coffees, breakfasts/lunches/diners.

name: Victoria
description:
parking on the village square very quiet and safe
parking en la plaza del pueblo muy tranquilo y seguro

name: Petrorios station
description: Here you can fill in your water tanks with potable water when you charge gas in the station. They say it's drinking water.

name: Rayu Pakcha, Gran Cañon
description: camping and cabins inside the jungle, quiet place, small parking lot for large motorhomes.  the entrance from the main road is narrow but in good condition for large motors.

name: Cascadas del Gran Cañon
description: sendero from the road to the river where it is has dug an impressive canyon and several waterfalls, one of them inside a cave, a small lagoon for bathing.

name: Parque Pujili
description:
Parking in the Municipal Park, with water and surveillance cameras.
-------
Estacionamento no Parque municipal, com água e câmeras de vigilância.

name: Parque municipal Pujili
description:
Quiet and safe parking, with security camera and tap water.
--
Estacionamento tranquilo e seguro, com câmera de segurança e água de torneira.

name: Seke Sonachun
description:
Indigenous interpretive center that has 2 cabanas (4 bunk beds,  double), tenting and room for 6 vehicles under shade and larger ones along the forest edge.  3 large palapas, one with kitchen, the other 2 with hammocks.  You need minimum 7m cord to access power (middle of the palapa). W/C and cold (gravity tank that warms up during the day) rustic shower.
$5 for camping,  $12/person for the cabana (breakfast incl.).  Bude (Boo-dy) also offers medicinal plant nature walk and has medicinal tea always in the kitchen area (just tell him what hurts, time to pick the leaves and soon after,  hot tea on the table).
Just 5 minutes from the edge of town, a good stop between  the beach and the interior.

name: Fuel Station Primax
description: This is a fuel station Primax. They are very gentle, we ask to put some water and they say yes very fast :) And the convenience have very good things to eat

name: Quinta Margarita
description:
This is a perfect space for travelers because of the nice people who live here, it is a bar on the outskirts of the city but it has two apartments for rent, a large one a bit expensive, the other small but very nice, it has space for a vehicle, be it a van, etc.
---
Este es un espacio perfecto para viajeros por las lindas personas que conviven aqui, en si es un bar a la afueras de la ciudad pero que cuenta con dos departamento en alquiler, uno grande un poco costoso, el otro pequeño pero muy bonito, tiene espacio para vehiculo, ya sea furgoneta, etc.

name: Whater inside the gas station
description: Water whit a good pressure! It is inside the gas station, shell very big i thinking it is allowed to sleep

name: Playa Cabuyal
description: A long stretch of beautiful beach with some families and two small restaurants open on weekends. We stayed at the restaurant overlooking the ocean and one of the locals opened the bathrooms for us and let us use the electricity and wifi. Free, safe, super nice people and gorgeous beach. The road in is pretty smooth, there's one small section that is a bit steep right before you arrive at the beach that may be tricky for underpowered vehicles.

name: Bravo Grand Hotel
description: Nice hostel, super super sweet family who runs it. The whole family helped us to cary our stuff to the room. It’s clean and quiet. Hot showers. Breakfast is included. 45 dollar for one night (two persons, matrimonial). Was also parking, for us it was not high enough and then the owner found us a different place (for free) nearby.

name: mirador San lorenzo
description:
Flat área with super Nice view of the ocean, locals say is safe to stay here overnight.
no facilites, there si claro signal. You can walk  to the beach (10min) good option if You don't have 4x4.

área plana con una hermosa vista, los locales dicen que es seguro quedarse aqui. se puede bajar caminando a la playa en una caminata de 10min aprox. es una buena opción si no tienen 4x4. no hay servicios pero si hay señal claro.

name: Bottle deposits
description: FYI the price of your glass bottles (coke, beers, etc) includes a deposit. Small is $0.25 and big are $0.50. Return your bottles to the same shop and they’ll refund you. On Isabella, it’s $1.00! It adds up!

name: Lubricentro
description:
Lubricenter for vehicle oil change.

Lubricentro para troca de óleo do veículo.

name: SAN piedra
description: Camping place with pool, have to drive straight to the end of the route, it has restrooms and a beutiful landscape

name: duchas primax
description:
Nice clean bathrooms with showers (free)

baños limpios con duchas y mucho espacio para estacionar

name: Jungle Lodge El Jardín Alemán
description: Beautiful cottages near a central Building with Restaurant, bar and Pool. Services for Jungle Tours available. Big parking in Front of the hotel entrance. Wifi working. Clean and Save área. To reach this only 2 km of a ripio Road to be used. Ok for non 4x4.

name: Santa Rosa de Moras
description: Hostería $5pp, very nice place, quite. Wifi, clean bathrooms, hot showers. Good clothes shopping at town stores and a lot of places to go walking or cycling.

name: Distribuidora de Gas y Agua Montedeoca
description:
Recharged my 3 kg Argentine cylinder, but you need to have the adapter. Open from Monday to Saturday, from 6:30 am to 6:30 pm and Sunday from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. It cost 9 dollars. Marcia is the owner's name, she is not the one who fills it, but she took it to fill it for us.
--
Recarregou meu botijão Argentino de 3 kg, mas você precisa ter o adaptador. Funcionamento de Segunda-feira à sábado, de  6:30 às 18:30 horas e domingo de 7:00 às 14 horas. CUSTOU 9 dólares.  Marcia é o nome da Propietaria não é ela que enche, mas levou pra encher pra gente.

name: CoDa Vista
description:
CoDa Vista camping and overlanding oasis! Amazing views over the city and the surrounding volcanoes. Grassy area, one simple toilet and shower, fridge can be used (beer available). Andy (Canadian) is very helpful with everything and the perfect host. 

Uber to the historic city center costs less than 5 dollars. Camping 8 dollars/pers./night. Safe storage of the car if you are planning a Galapagos or Amazon trip (5 dollars/day).

Andy is still working on this place to improve facilities.
Call or Whatsapp Andy @ +593 98 604 5854 

https://www.instagram.com/coda_vista?igshid=YzAwZjE1ZTI0Zg%3D%3D&utm_source=qr

name: Laundromat New-York Wash-Up
description:
Laundry Wash-Up.  $6 for the big machine, it fit all our clothes.  $4 a small.  There are promotions on different days of the week.  Dryer 0,25$/12 mins. Good service.

Lavanderia Wash-Up. $6 a máquina grande, coube toda a nossa roupa. $4 a pequena. Ha promoções em variados dias da semana. secadora 0,25$/12 mins. Bom atendimento.

name: Casa Grande
description:
For community tourism, walks, camping, lodging. 15 minutes from the city of Cayambe, Paquiestancia sector. 
.....
Para turismo comunitario, caminatas, camping, hospedaje. A 15 minutos de la ciudad de Cayambe, sector Paquiestancia.

name: la quinta primavera
