description: i don't know why anyone stays anywhere else in nueva loja.  15 minutes outside of nueva loja, place has super cute rooms and little cabanas. pool,  hot water in the shower,  no ac, super nice owners, lots of parking,  kitchen.  great atmosphere,  super chill, pet friendly. i paid $21. there are slightly cheaper rooms with shared bathrooms I believe.

name: Bakery - Kachi Tanta
description: Amazing bakery with awesome bread (!!!), rolls, sweets, and baked empanadas! We ate a pizza empanada every day, delicious. They also sell Swiss cheeses and tofu. Highly recommend!

name: police check point 40km South of Cuenca
description: We encountered corrupt police officers close to this place. It was a normal check point but two officers tried to convince me that it was not allowed to carry Bicycles on the back of the car. After about 20 minutes they gave up. Later I got confirmation that it was indeed corrupt police.

name: Tour to Laguna Limoncocha
description:
Rene is a tour guide and offers boat and hiking trips into the reserva Laguna Limoncocha and the rainforest. Night walks and night boat tours are also possible.
You can stay in one of his cabanas in the forest ‘Supaycocha’ (see pictures, accessible by boat). He only offers Spanish tours.
We very much enjoyed our stay here and the different tours!
His number: +593985654958

name: Torno (no idea really,  that's the biggest sign)
description: 2 mechanics,  side by side,  lots of bays and guys.  they got me in right away for a suspension issue but could not resolve,  guy really didn't know what he was doing. putting this here just so it's on the map if you're in a real pinch,  but the mechanic i posted just down the road in san gabriel is 100x better.

name: Tecnicentro Naveda
description:
Mechanics in general, balancing and alignment. Entrance is high, its alignment elevator supports up to 4 tons. We did the job without having to take our camper off the truck, see photos. Javier is very attentive and even presented us with a bag of perfume for the car.

Mecânica em geral, balanceamento e alinhamento. A entrada é alta, seu elevador de alinhamento suporta até 4 toneladas . Fizemos o trabalho sem ter que tirar nossa Camper da caminhonete , ver fotos. Javier é muito atencioso e até nos presenteou com um sachê de perfume para o carro.

name: Cafe Montuna (& Óptica)
description: Wildly adorable spot right on the road, perfect for a cold coffee stop. Aesthetics and design of this space are beautiful and a good selection of quality eyewear for sale too.

name: mechanic
description: little mechanic shop.  guy really knows what he's doing,  super friendly.  identified 2 problems in minutes that another mechanic couldn't.  parts availability low,  but they can order.  he jerryrigged a hydraulic engine mount with some piece of tire, and while it likely won't last more than a few months,  it got me on my way.  he wanted $5 for his trouble.  super nice people.  i gave him 10.

name: San Francisco Hotel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User reports business is to avoid related to poor service. 
----------
not the best,  not the worst. $16.50 per person. hot water, basic room,  but at least it's not plain white like most of them.  nice lobby.  desk in room,  so nice to do a bit of work.  secure parking across the street.  town is nice.  wifi.  they accepted my dog, but didn't seem very happy about it.  sour staff. not a terrible option if it's late and you just need a bed.

name: Montano Camping and Hostel
description: Great place just at the entrance of Baños. 10 min walk to town. Secured parking for moto, cars or smaller RV. Shared kitchen. Covered spaces to relax. Shared bathroom with hot water. Great wifi. You can camp and they also have a few rooms. (Which are on booking.com). Owner Fabricio is absolutely great and welcoming. They gave us juice and banana bread when we arrived. Very relax vibes here for a few days in Baños

name: saguamby
description: super nice place.  cabins and rooms by the river,  restaurant, games room.  rooms are gorgeous.  expensive.  quoted 80 bucks,  got it for 60. totally worth it as a splurge,  as everything is a little overpriced in this town.  pet friendly. super friendly staff, secure parking.

name: Paspanchu Lodge
description: Pashpanchu Lodge is a tourist complex managed and created by the Kichwa community of Pompeii, nice place for tents or good and clean cabins.  They can organize any visit, boat trip, river crossing.  They also manage a private and free secure parking in front of the lodge.  Consult these procedures on WhatsApp +593 99 217 1067 Doña Balvina.

name: Chuta Madre
description: The place to get good sourdough bread and great coffee. You can go here for lunch or just buy a bread for ~$2

name: Shayari Community Amazon Activities
description:
This is an absolute MUST! You can camp here for free or rent a cabaña in their beautiful lodge in the jungle. We came unannounced on a Friday night and they had tours and activities planned for the following day:
-2 hour guided hike in the jungle where you can learn about the medicinal plants and how their tribe use the natural resources.
- most delicious typical Ecuadorian lunch (we ate cream of papaya soup and fish with yucca and salad)
- fishing tour for piranha in the laguna paztasa and beautiful warm lake to swim in
- dance show in the evening performed by local kids in the community 
- tribal cleansing for their visitors

We thoroughly enjoyed our time here. One of our top highlights on our trip driving south through the Americas so far. 

All activities including 3 adults and a child, plus 2 nights camping cost $86 - absolute bargain. Such a lovely community, come support them! 

We do recommend calling ahead, letting them know you are coming and booking your personalised trip with them. Walter is a wonderful guide:
+593 99 256 7808

name: El Gigante
description:
It is a peaceful and quiet place, the welcome is warm! Billiards, restaurant, a superb swimming pool! Ideal to rest before passing the border with the children!  You can fill up with water and charge your batteries.
---
C’est un lieu paisible et calme, l’accueil y est chaleureux ! Billard, restaurant, une superbe piscine ! Idéal pour faire un spot de repos avant de passer la frontière avec les enfants ! 
On peut y faire le plein d’eau et y charger les batteries.

name: Ortega y Gasset, Loja
description: Quiet and level place at the end of the street. Next to a forest. Good claro and CNT reception. Neighbourhood with appartements, streetlights. Local people were friendly and police came to check but all was OK. Nice view over the city.

name: sport field Loja
description: Public watertap with potable water. Usually we get our water at a fuel station,  but we came across this one by accident. It is in OSM too.

name: Vivet Clínica Veterinaria
description: Veterinar where you can get a health certificate. There is another place close by that does the same. Here it was 25 USD, the other 26. We thought it could be done for a lower price (just a piece of paper, didn't even have to show up with the pet). So we tried 5 other veterinars. But these two were the only ones offering this service.

name: Casa de mármol
description: Great place 10 min walk from centre of Riobamba. Good secured parking across the street. They have rooms with private or shared bathroom. Wifi is excellent. Irma the owner is very welcoming and attentive, providing many suggestions for things to see or eat in town. The breakfast is included and is copious and delicious

name: Monodedo Outdoor equipment
description:
Small outdoor shop selling HIGH QUALITY travel /outdoor / camping equipment! The owner / salesperson is very kind and helpful!
If you have got a high limit on how much money to spend I certainly recommend to stop my!
Otherwise if you are on a budget save your time and check the other stores in the historical center: Accion Sport + "forgot the name" ;-(

name: Robbery near River Mall
description:
If you are without a vehicle be aware that your way home at night/dark can be dangerous here. 
Those are roads with only little traffic or people  around. I got robbed by 3 people + a knife. It seemed that they are "searching" for victims during the evening in the surrounding of "The River Mall". 
Cameras and police are useless!

name: Maquipucuna Ecolodge
description: This place is magical, so happy we found it! It’s a massive reserve with plenty of forest hikes (20 minutes-5 hours), waterfalls, riversides. It has a fancy lodge area with more hummingbirds zinging around than I’ve ever seen, lots of hammocks and swinging chairs, beautiful and boujee. The camping area has plenty of flat space, a bbq and covered fire pit. Super hot showers (or a cold shower with a jungle view!). There’s a sad looking fridge and stove, I think they were unplugged, not sure if they work. Fast wifi in the lodge area. Somehow we were the only 2 people in the whole place for several days, feeling like millionaires. It’s low season, can’t speak for high season. This is the best place to spot Andean bears (Oct/Nov). Unfortunately, no big rigs, height limit around 2.4 metres (see bridge photo), no pets allowed as it’s a reserve. We really enjoyed it here!  Best to call ahead so the caretaker knows you’re coming. $4pppn, plus one time $15 reserve fee (worth it, I promise!).

name: Primax
description:
Alluriquin Primax Post, Female and Men's Baths, Coffee/Market

Post de Primax Alluriquin, Banhos femininos e masculinos, Café/Market

name: Ki Wa Korean restaurant
description: Really amazing food. Try their kimchi stew on a rainy day and the side Korean grocery store they sell good range of noodles, tofu and fresh homemade kimchi.

name: Recycling station
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: unclear if this independently available and just happens to next to a grocery store. Please report if recycling station belongs to AKI.

Great little organized recycling station next to the AKI grocery store.

name: Campamento Canino
description:
This is a great dog hotel. They took excellent care of our dog when we went to the Galapagos. It's $15 a night and you need to bring your own food.

Find them on Google, you can visit or WhatsApp them to discuss the details.

name: Hostal Alejandra
description: Decent hotel for $10/room (1 person). Rooms are a good size, plenty of room for bicycles. Limited parking under the hotel. The shower is VERY hot. Priceless on a cold, wet day. Staff is super friendly. Seems to be a quieter location than others...

name: Church. Alausí
description:
Was told by the bomberos about this place. 
Just knock or enter the small door to the right of the main church and ask for the priest. He let me stay in one of the classrooms they have there.
Toilet and freezing cold (but refreshing) shower available.
Watch out for the giant beetle invasion when the sun goes down!

Free wifi in the park in front of the church.

name: parking dans impasse
description:
parking in dead end at the edge of a football field, calm and quiet
---
parking dans impasse au bord d'un terrain de foot, calme et tranquille

name: Austral - IVECO
description:
A great place in the city center of Quito, they do IVECO DAILY so do not hesitate if you have things to do on your Daily. In addition they can keep the vehicle during a trip to Galapagos!

Une super place en plein centre ville de Quito, ils font IVECO DAILY donc n’hésitez pas si vous avez des choses à faire sur votre daily en plus ils peuvent garder le véhicule pendant un voyage au Galapagos !

name: Parc Entrance
description: We arrived late and found no place to stay in the dark. We asked the officers there for a place to stay. They said here. The place is save but noisy.

name: Casa Victoria
description: Small property, restaurant is open only weekends. Very friendly owners, $5pp/pn, flat parking on well maintained grass, water, hot shower, clean bathrooms, very quiet. We went down to the river, help the owner to cut some grass and feed their cuyes, walk around and spend a placid night.

name: Farm Field across from Gas Station
description:
across from the gas station is a big farm field.  the owners live directly next to the gas station and have a little tienda/pig carving set up.  they let us set up our hammocks in the trees in their field.   buy some food from them as a thank you! 

this spot is only available as a walk-in. cannot drive to it.

name: Servi Oil
description: If Luis is working, he will let you camp around the gas station. There is a yard behind it and you will have a pig as a neighbor, if you tent.  Might be able to sleep in your vehicle there too.  Quiet, bathrooms, water.

name: Emergency Vet
description: English speaking, wonderful vet. Took care of our dogs infection with love and compassion.

name: Local Restaurant (Normal prices)
description:
After walking around 30 minutes for tge very busy but nice local restaurant locals eating and local prices not them ripp off gringo restaurants. 
Plates from $2.5 to $5.0. 
Many options

name: Animal Doc
description:
Very experienced and caring vet.  Andrea examined our Vincent very conscientiously, issued the health certificate and applied for the export license for us.  She has many international customers, speaks English and is very experienced in compiling the necessary documents.  We also had her rabies titer determined (she sends the samples to the USA).  We can warmly recommend Andrea and Animal DOC.  Our Vincent was very happy because she was super sweet with him.  5 paws

Update: text them in Advance so they can Check everything - +593 98 203 7813 (Not necessary, but can be helpful.)

name: hotel Selva verde
description: standard town hotel, great hot water, clean, secure parking, solid wifi, decent size room. only downside is no outside window. $15pp.

name: 1959 Hôtel
description:
small, comfortable and clean hotel.  $35 for a double room, with air conditioning and TV, hot water in the shower.  they allowed us to park our van in their closed and secure car park, and sleep in it for the rest of our family.  very friendly and helpful.

Hotel pequeño, cómodo y limpio.  $35 por una habitación doble, con aire acondicionado y TV, agua caliente en la ducha.  nos permitieron estacionar nuestra camioneta en su estacionamiento cerrado y seguro, y dormir en ella para el resto de nuestra familia.  muy amable y servicial.

petit hôtel confortable et propre. 35$ la chambre double , avec climatisation et TV, eau chaude à la douche. ils nous ont autorisé à stationner notre fourgon dans leur parking fermé et sécurisé, et dormir dedans pour le reste de notre famille. très sympas et serviables.

name: CAFE NEUS
description:
Stopped here for a lovely cafe on the way to Quito. 

Nice coffee from a machine not that filter crap. 
Reasonable prices. 
Easy parking. 
Nice lady from Quito

name: EP Petroecuador
description:
We were able to fill up with drinking water here.  The staff is very pleasant.  They didn't ask us for anything but we still left a tip for the lady was very friendly!
--
Nous avons pu remplir en eau potable ici. Le personnel est très agréable. Ils ne nous ont rien demandé mais nous avons quand même laissé un pourboire à la dame était très sympathique!

Pudimos llenar de agua potable aquí.  El personal es muy agradable.  No nos pidieron nada, pero aún así dejamos una propina para que la señora fuera muy amable.

name: Parador
description: Free hot showers, very new and clean facilities. Also a restaurant, small tienda offering everything from 20L agua pura to brake fluid to aplanchados. Looks like there’s also a spigot for water if you need a refill of non-potable water, but ask first. Probably fine to camp, though we haven’t asked yet. Enjoy!

name: Viewpoint & free toilets
description: Mirador del shiriculapo. You get to this viewpoint passing through the hospital (no fee). Is a viewpoint on a giant rock, nice view of mountains! free toilets at the entrance.

name: FREE WIFI AT LITTLE PARK
description: there is place to park for free and the wifi reaches to the vehicle. Not very fast but it works. There is a church in front, quiet place.

name: MAYA CAFE
description:
Come here to try really tastys ecuadorians breakfasts!! ($3- $3.8 each) with coffee from Amazonia.

The "costeñizate" breakfast (coffee or chocolate with juice and a "bolon" made with green platano and cheese, 2 eggs, meat broth, mayonnaise and cilantro sauce and aji sauce) Really tasty and well served!! 
They also have "nata" to spread on the bread, it's like a tipycal cream cheese from Ecuador, try it!
 Really nice atmosphere, fast wifi. 
 The owners, Luis and Lore loves to meet travelers, super kind people.

name: PARKING OF NATURAL HOTSPRINGS
description: Big place to park and start your trek to go to a nice and natural hot springs, 2.5km walking, nice waterfalls surrounding the place. The path is marked and well signed. This place is known as "Ojo del fantasma". We didn't sleep here but it looks like a cool place to stay.

name: Panaderia for "dulce de leche"
description:
We miss the "dulce de leche" so we bought the "rollos de manjar", so yummy! it's like a little sweet bread with manjar (jam) inside, same flavor than dulce de leche! 20cent each. The little bread of cheese is also tasty.  Auto service bakery, good prices.

Extrañamos el dulce de leche asi que compramos los rollos de manjar, riquisimos! es como un pancito dulce con bastante manjar adentro, igual al dulce de leche. 20cent. cada uno. Los pancitos de queso tambien muy ricos. Panaderia autoservicio, todo a buen precio.

name: Cascada La Chorrera
description:
The path start behind the hostel (brick house beside the road), parking lot, easy access. 
Beautiful landscapes, nice waterfall, and perfect spot to do climbing. We didn't spend the night here but we saw a lot of grassy places to pitch a tent near the waterfall and the river. 
FREE. Enjoy!

name: QUIET SQUARE
description: We slept here with our van, nice houses around, friendly neightbours, quiet little square, almost no traffic at night. We even left the van alone at this location because we were hiking. 5 block away from the road and a mall nearby with toilets and hardware store.

name: VW BEETLE & KOMBI SPARE PARTS
description: Owners very friendly, they are VW lovers, they have 7 beetles and love to meet travelers. The shop is called Mi vocho. They also have a restaurant at the corner, very tasty ecuadorian food.

name: Ulba Waterfall
description: Don't pay to visit "7 cascadas", come here!! A short walk to Cascada Ulba along the river, really nice! There are little natural pools to get into the water. Apparently, it is possible to camp on the grass and make a little fire near the river. The entrance is before the bridge to baños, beside "Los Lupetrus" house, you will see stairs going down.

name: CASA DEL ARBOL viewpoint
description:
Wooden viewing deck in scenic valley. Opening hours from 8:30am to 18.30 on weekdays. And 7:30am to 19:00 on weekends. $1 parking. $1 pp for all day in the park (zipline, swing, etc). Toilets and plugs. 
Cafe where you  can buy empanadas, corn with cheese, hot dog, etc. cheap! 
We arrived at 9am. on tuesday and there was few people. We got there by foot through the trail (i put it on ioverlander). 
Bring jacket!! The weather could be cold or rainy up there. 
---
abre de 8 a 18.30
$1 el estacionamiento 
$1 por persona la entrada para estar todo el dia en el parque (tirolesa, hamaca, etc.)
baños y enchufes. 
Cafeteria donde podes comprar empanadas, choclo con queso, salchicha, etc. barato!
llegamos a las 9am de un martes y habia pocas personas. Llegamos a pie por el sendero (lo puse en ioverlander).
LLeva campera!! puede llover o ponerse frio alla arriba.

name: SENDERO A CASA DEL ARBOL
description:
Here starts the trail to get to the famous "casa del arbol" by foot, is very steep, it took us 2 hours of walk, nice views (5km where you raise 1000m. of altitude). i recommend start walking at 6am to arrive at 8am when casa del arbol opens and there is no tourists. There is a map with the paths at the tourist information. 
~
aca empieza el sendero para ir a la famosa casa del arbol a pie, es empinado, tardamos 2 hs. en llegar, lindas vistas (5km donde subis 1.000m. de altitud). recomiendo empezar a caminar tipo 6am para llegar a la casa del arbol  tipo 8, cuando abre y no hay turistas. Hay un mapa con los senderos en la oficina de turismo.

name: DELICIOS & CHEAP RESTAURANT
description:
TIO TITO RESTAURANT
Delicious ecuadorian food, and cheap ($3 menu)
we tried the menestra with meat and rice, another day we tried shrimps with a delicious sauce, rice, tomato and avocado. 
every plate includes soup, spicy sauce, juice and little dessert. They invited us cheese with fig, a tipycal ecuadorian dessert.They also have burguers and fried potatoes. 
The family running this place is very kind, loves to meet travelers and they are VW lovers. 
~
Riquisima comida ecuatoriana, y barato($3 menu) 
probamos menestra con carne y arroz, otro dia comimos langostinos con una salsa riquisima, con arroz, tomate y palta. Cada plato incluye sopa, salsa picante, jugo y pequeño postre. Nos convidaron higo con queso, un postre tipico de Ecuador. Tambien tienen hamburguesas y papas fritas. 
La familia que maneja este lugar es muy amable, aman conocer viajeros y son fan de vw.

name: CHEAP GREENGROCERY/DIETETICA BARATA
description:
Oat, dried fruits, peanut, chocolate chips, etc, everything very very cheap!! ideal to get stocked. 
~
Avena, frutos secos, mani, gotas de chocolate, etc.. todo mu barato!! Ideal para stockearse.

name: Machay Waterfall (Community Access)
description: We went to the beautiful waterfall and natural pools through the "community entrance", it costs 1,5$ /p (children under 10 are free). We parked for free in front of this place, beside the road.

name: QUIET PARK FREE
description:
Little park in front of a church, clean, good place to park, very quiet. We slept here one night in our van, even we left the van alone and walked to the center. FREE. 
~
Pequeño parque frente a una iglesia, limpio, buen lugar para estacionar, muy tranquilo. Dormimos acá una noche en nuestra van, también la dejamos sola para ir al centro. GRATIS.

name: Private Refill
description:
A man who refills bottles of cooking gas, your bottle is ready from one day to another. His name is Efrain Escudero, not very easy to find his house. You can call him before you arrive. He refilled our 2kg Argentinian bottle for 3 usd. +593 99 3690987. Also Chilean bottles.
~ 
Este hombre recarga garrafas de gas para cocinar, tu garrafa esta lista de un dia para el otro. No es muy facil encontrar la casa, podes llamarlo antes de llegar. Recargó nuestra garrafa argentina de 2kg por 3 dolares. +593 99 3690987

name: Saucotambo Lodge
description: Small B&B style bird watching lodge. Jorge and Olympia are passionate about birds and enjoy sharing this passion with their guests. $25 a night with breakfast. Motmots in the early morning, toucans later, a billion hummingbirds all day long. Really pleasant place. Jorge is in the process of making a trail network, he has finished about 1km of them so far. If the gate is closed (and for a reservation) call Olympia at 0979212268. They live about 5 minutes away.

name: little parking / parqueadero
description:
parking on the sand at the edge of the beach, there are umbrella rental companies $5 and barnums $10.  quiet at night, they close the parking access chain.  they reopen it in the morning around 8:30.  possibility of showering for $1.  with a hotel opposite (Brisas del Pacifico) at $35 per night.  close to the shopping center with supermarket, small shops and cinema.

estacionamiento en la arena al borde de la playa, hay empresas de alquiler de sombrillas $ 5 y barnums $ 10.  tranquilo por la noche, cierran la cadena de acceso al estacionamiento.  lo reabren por la mañana alrededor de las 8:30.  posibilidad de ducharse por $1.  con un hotel de enfrente (Brisas del Pacifico) a $35 la noche.  cerca del centro comercial con supermercado, pequeñas tiendas y cine.

parking sur le sable en bord de plage, il y a des loueurs de parasol 5$ et barnums 10 $. calme la nuit, ils ferment la chaîne d'accès au parking. ils la rouvrent le matin vers 8h30. possibilité de se doucher pour 1$. avec un hôtel en face (Brisas del Pacifico) à 35$ la nuit. proche du centre commercial avec supermarché, petits commerces et cinéma.

name: futbol field Umbuni
description: came to see the small but cute waterfall 300m away but kept driving up by instinct.. nice flat spot on the hill u can see the river far away.it s the school field but I havent seen anyone since yesterday!quiet.with a view.there s some bathrooms diwn there but i didnt check.low claro signal

name: Gabcha Choubid
description: Next to the river and in front of playground. Little bit noisy cause near the road but ok. After 1h driving in Cuenca to find spot for big rigs (more than 8m), we found this one on up to 8,5m.

name: ItalDeli - meats & deli
description: This place is an excellent, massive butcher/deli. They have tons of cuts of meats, sausages, lots of cheeses and other artisanal bbq stuff. Not cheap, but high quality. Bonus, there’s a restaurant upstairs for cheap and delicious wraps and sandwiches.

name: Hotel Jimmy
description: Great hotel with excellent hot showers, $12 a night for a single, parking that should be tall enough for a van (10-12 feet 2.5m). Near bus terminal

name: Runa Wasy
description: Hidden gem. Take the trail along monkey beach and you arrive at the restaurant. Delicious fresh iced guayusa drinks and local cuisine.

name: Scala shopping mall
description: Location pin for street to park in if you have a tall. Vehicle. Big mall with big Groceries store and many different shops.

name: Spot next to the restaurant
description: Spot next to the restaurant ! They are very friendly buy some drinks !!!

name: Hostel Rincón Turista
description:
We didn't stay the night here but we could leave our bikes in a safe place to be able to visit the Mercado. The owner was very friendly. 
There are rooms for 6/8/10$ p.pers. (but didn't check them).

name: Hostal La Suite
description:
A small but clean hostel/hotel in the historic center.  Safe, clean and nice staff.  Let us bring our bikes to our room.  There are a ton of restaurants, services etc in very close walking distance and the historic square is actually pretty cool.

we paid $20 total for 2 people.

name: Mercado Central
description: Best and cheapest place in town to try local food and drinks. Especialy on the lower floor there are many restaurants. Plus the people are very friendly and helpfull.

name: Parqueadero Bordemar
description:
It's a parking lot for a Chilean Mr. Francis. Ample space for vehicles of any size. Francisco is a kind person and likes to talk. They have water, energy and Wi-Fi. We were charged $10 for a 7.34m Sprinter motorhome. We stayed one night. Location with closed gates. You have to call, as he is often in your workshop. Puerto Lopez.
----------------------
É um estacionamento de um Chileno Sr. Francisco. Amplo Espaço para equipamentos de qualquer tamanho. Francisco é uma pessoa amável e gosta de conversar.  Têm água, energia e Wi-Fi. Temos um motorhome Sprinter 7,34m e nos cobrou 10 dólares. Ficamos uma noite.  Local com portões fechado. Tem que ligar, pois muitas vezes está em sua oficina. Puerto López.

name: 3D Printer
description:
We were able to get a few custom pieces made by this super high quality but budget-friendly 3D printer. He printed our Starlink Mount for us and is also printing one for another traveler. He can replicate any part you need or he can work with your designs to quickly create what you need. 

Email is project3.0dis@gmail.com

name: hot springs parking
description: arrived at 5pm it was closing but they told me I could camp in the flat ample parking.wait for tomorrow open at 4am! 1 large a bit rundown lukewarm outdoor pool.+2 smaller warm and 1 hotter under a roof.must be crowded in weekends. quiet night( I never write a naive 'safe' in SA!! if u are not gated+guardian !!).rare claro 2g.no WIFI inside!

name: hosteria mitad del mundo
description:
simple, clean and cheap hotel on the panamericana.  has a clean looking pool and a small kitchen. HOT showers.  rooms towards the back are really quiet

we paid 18 for 2 people

name: Finca Capamaco
description: Beautiful campground (also a fish farm) with cabins, playground  and a  restaurant surrounded by mountains with a small river just meters away. I highly recommend you visit this place if you are in the area, Patricio the owner was very welcoming and helpful.  The wooden bridge right before the campground limits the size of vehicles to about a high roof  Mercedes Sprinter lwb and the like

name: L&S Artisan Meats
description: Go check out this farm in Cotacatchi to purchase all those meats you miss from home. They produce their own pork products, raising their own pigs on acres of happy pasture but work closely with another farm that do the same but with cows and chicken. We did not walk away empty handed, but instead with two huge bags full of MSG free sausages, BACON, ribeyes, ribs, snack sticks, smoked meats, bbq sauce and sauerkraut. Definitely the highest quality out there. Lindsay and Shaun are super hospitable, as are their three lovely kids and will take the time out to show you around their farm and factory. They also run the local farmer market in town which is held on a Thursday.

name: Samay Restaurante
description: A very nice new place with clean bathrooms and an ample parking lot—ask the owners for permission to camp. Two bars of Claro 3G

name: SQUARE WITH FAST WIFI
description:
The road to get to this town is in bad condition, but we wanted to go to the N.P., arrived late and parked beside the stairs of the church. Nice and quiet square. There was an open and fast wifi called pichincha. There is also a cheap supermarket called TUTI few blocks away. 
~
La ruta para llegar a este pueblo esta en malas condiciones pero queriamos ir al parque nacional, llegamos tarde y estacionamos al lado de las escaleras de la iglesia. Plaza linda y tranquila. Habia un wifi "pichincha"abierto y rapido. Tambien hay un supermercado barato TUTI a unas cuadras.

name: IN FRONT OF CHURCH
description:
we parked in front of the church that is in refaction. We were waiting for the weather to be sunny to go to the Limpiopungo lagoon. There is nice grassy areas around. Very quiet to sleep in a Friday night. Lot of room for big rigs. Free.
~ 
estacionamos frente a la iglesia, que esta en refaccion. Estabamos esperando que se ponga soleado para ir a la laguna Limpiopungo. Hay pastito alrededor. Muy tranquilo para dormir un vienes a la noche. Un monton de lugar para motorhomes grandes. Gratis.

name: Aldea Vet and day care
description: Left our two dogs here for Galapagos and for once weren’t stressed 24x7 about their safety. The own is a vet so took care of our puppies upset stomach. Sent us tons of photos and videos of dogs and play time. They looked so happy.

name: La Tradicion de Mama Terre Bizcochos
description: Famous recipe bizcochos, hot out of the oven with queso de ojo,manjar and (real) coffee.  check this place out if you want the real-deal bizcochos!

name: Delicias Cotopaxi - Restaurant Cafeteria
description:
Family restaurant at the entrance of the Cotopaxi national park. Great place to stop on your way in or out of the park. 
We had a very good breakfast here. Afordable prices and the nicest staff.
Delicious hot chocolate!

name: Vitech Mechanic- Best mechanic in Quito
description: We came here recommended by friends and so glad we did. David the mechanic and his family are the nicest humans. They fixed multiple issues with our 1977 Dodge. From suspension, to brakes to oil change. The family offered us laundry and the wife who is a dog groomer gave our dogs a bath. The shop is very clean and we stayed here for two nights while waiting for parts. Very genuine, helpful and efficient mechanics for a change.

name: Santa Rita - Kichwa - Cacao
description: we met Bolivar the manager of the Kichwa community at Santa Rita (call locals for the road ok for our 29ft RV, buses come here) ! an admirable person who made us discover the secrets of cocoa, from the planting of the seed to its manufacturing process! an unforgettable moment spent with the family! Bolivar is an exceptional person! Do not hesitate to call him in whattsapp! He will welcome you with open arms! in addition (for 1$) it will take you to a quite incredible landscaped natural swimming pool!! Bolívar +593 98 353 5430

name: East of Tayuza on E45
description:
Military checkpoint. All vehicles are pulled over and searched very thoroughly. Including trunks. All people, including kids, are required to vacate the vehicle and be frisked by military personnel. 
We were warned by the military commander that Ecuador is not safe and the inspections are for guns, grubs, etc for our safety.

name: Restaurante el complejo
description: A great restaurant right on the beach! Good food, cheap prices and parking for any kind of vehicle. I would be willing to bet you could stay the night next to the restaurant, they have showers and bathrooms

name: Edu Bike
description:
local bike shop that helps bikw travellers.  they got us bike boxes and packed them for free! we tipped but it was super kind

phone number in picture

name: Bomberos
description: This place does not accept to host biketravelers.

name: Parque central de Mindo
description: We stayed here 2 nights, very nice and safe ! We were with another van. Restaurants, bars, coffee place and supermarket around. You can find water tap around the place. Quiet at night, no problem. We got the wifi from the restaurant “Manabita” (very good and cheap by the way)

name: Green Bike park
description:
Camping area for cyclists
Bathroom
Kitchen
Wash area
________________

zona camping para ciclistas (camping Bike)
baños (bathroom)
cocina (kitchen)
lavadero (wash zone)

name: Mr Wash - big dryers here
description: Great affordable laundry here. The lady washed our comforters, bedsheets, all clothes and gave it back to us dried and folded in 5 hours.

name: Movistar and Claro
description: Tienda to buy a new SIM card and plan when entering Ecuador. They set up the SIM and put a plan on our phone with no issues.

name: Street parking Salinas
description: Quiet place to spend the night, a few blocks from the central park, very illuminated, silent until early in the morning. Very friendly townspeople.

name: Best croissants and sourdough bread
description: Finally found great croissants, we tried the almond and pain au chocolat and both were amazing. Sorry for half eaten pictures

name: Dog hotel - Wolf pet spa
description: We left our two dogs here for a week when we went to Galapagos. Jenifer a vet on site and a pet salon. The house has a huge scenic backyard, it’s not a daycare so not crowded with 100 dogs and the dogs have the option to stay in the bedroom next to her is they have separation anxiety like our puppy. Really nice place and very kind lady: highly recommend but the road to get to her place needs a 4x4 for last 200 meters. Or she can come pick you up.

name: Museo Municipal de Arte Moderno
description:
Very interesting art galery. Several rooms with different expositions from local artists.
FREE

name: Robbery
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.
Look I was unlucky on Playa Tinosa... took my phone, crédit card, money, laptop etc. luckily they didn't find the keys...

name: Hostal Santa Maria
description: Cheap hotel in the middle of town. I paid $10 for a single room. My bike could fit in a locked area in the back. Decent WiFi and fan.

name: Hard River Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant with nice view on mountains and river. The price is correct. There is a parking (I think for big rig)

name: Life's water Aqua de vida
description: Good place to buy drinking water in bulk. Not cheap. We paid 1.75 USD for the big 20l containers

name: Road to Cotopaxi (4560)
description: it is now possible to get into the car park of the Cotopaxi. Go up!!  it’s very beautiful ! Enjoy.

name: Hotel Rio Tena
description: Looked around because the other hotel markers on iOverlander for Tena didn’t have the price listed which isn’t very helpful. Paid $10 for a single person with fan. Good wifi and a hot shower for once! Kept my bike in a locked area in the back. Very close to the main supermarket in Tena.

name: On the road at Mirador Yanarumi
description: Wild camp on the road at Yanarumi Mirador. it's a small gravel road up a hill. Only for narrow vehicles not big rigs. We had a few Shepherds pass by in the late afternoon. Very cold and misty through the night and morning. Safe and quiet. The signs to the Mirador are small wooden signs and quite faded so look carefully.

name: Carapaz’s house
description: It is the house of Richard Carapaz parents Giro d'Italia and other competitions winner. Front entrance is steep, use the back one. The parents are very kind, his mother tells the story of her son in a very friendly way. parking lot is flat. They have a restaurant with bathrooms and wifi. very quiet to spend the night, many places for trekking in the surroundings.

name: Cascada de Paluz - Main entrance
description: Can park here and walk to the falls. This seems to be the main entrance, but see our other spot for more info on other parking, a trail, and a pool.

name: Cascada de Paluz - Swimming Pools
description: There is a spring fed small public swimming pool with showers (cold) and bathrooms. There is a trail to the waterfall to the right of the bathrooms up the hill. Nice short walk (10 min) to a beautiful park and waterfall. Bathrooms, grills, picnic tables, trash cans. Seems to be free. Way to go Ecuador! If you are lucky, you will see elves and find a pot of gold....

name: Jardin de Teresita
description: Beautiful Hotel with garden and animals. It is super quite, they have hot showers and fast! Internet. Owners very nice and they are pet friendly, have 4 super cute dogs, rabbits, guinea pigs, birds, chicken and gees. You can have breakfast for 3 Dollars per person and it is all from the garden and chickens. We paid 29 Dollars for two persons with breakfast per night. There is a hight restriction for the gate at about 3,5m.

name: Cabañas ETZA
description:
We really enjoyed our tour organized by a Shuar family, proud to show us their culture. 
This place offers different services : you can do a tour of the Amazonian forest, the Cascadas and caves. You can also sleep in a typical Shuar house for the night to listen to the monkeys at night. You can chose the duration of your stay (one day, two and more days). 
Cheaper price if you contact the Shuar guide directly (avoiding expensive agencies). 
contacts : 
Nantu : +593 96 165 2230 (Whatsapp) 
Daniel : +593 98 614 4264
Be aware that they don't have a lot of signal. Contact them a few days before.

name: From El Tambo to Cuenca
description: Attention the trap is well installed! a person on the side of the road waves to you, showing your bumper…. you don't pay attention to it then two to three hundred meters further on a second person waves to you, showing you your bumper! You stop on the low side to watch! And there, a third person disguised as a mechanic comes towards you! he looks at your wheel, and tells you that it's the rim that's coming off! he invites you to his garage in the city center! the streets are narrow so you park a little further, the mechanic takes his tools and tells you to order a part in Cuenca… for us the scam ended there! the mechanic had hands that were too clean, an immaculate mechanic's coat and tools that were shiny as new! !!!

name: Paquiza
description:
Paquiza is a hat maker, he has a space where he does soldering and bodywork for vehicles. Our van door handle broke and he fixed it by charging us $5.

Paquiza é chapeiro tem um espaço onde faz pequenas soldas e lataria de veículos. A maçaneta da nossa porta da kombi estragou e ele arrumou nos cobrando $5.

name: Hacienda El Rejo
description:
We were so surprised that this beautiful Hacienda (ranch) was not listed in iOverlander yet. This place is so beautifully build and mainainted, the view over the Cotopaxi is fantastic and they have a truly fantastic restaurant (with 24-hours slow-cooked ribs!). They have won many prices with their cows, the offer horse riding tours and there are a lot of other animals.

We were traveling with our Overlander vehicle as a group of 4 for a week, so we booked a room and for an additional 10 USD we were able to camp in our car. They mentioned that they are definitely open for more overlanders to visit, since it of course also generation different revenue for dining etc. The parking areas do have a few horizontal areas, although that might look different at first.

After 4,5 months of travel this, this places was one of our top-5 camping and dining locations.

name: Vethouse Veterinary For Export Papers
description:
A team of vets with a clinic, groomer and pet shop. Super thourough and organised. The vet issued the health certificate with photos for leaving the country to Colombia on a Saturday evening for $30.
All the team members were really friendly to our Giant Schnauzer who is mortally afraid of veterinaries.

name: Hostal San Raphael
description: Nice hotel, definitely one of the better budget ones I’ve stayed at. WiFi, modern TV, fan, private bathroom, hot shower. $10 for one person. Large parking area behind the hotel for vehicles/bikes. Loads of hotels in this area and they all seem quite similar.

name: Hacienda El Rejo
description:
Creating this location as an hotel as well, sinc this of course is their core business. Our family members stayed here in one of their rooms, whist we slept in our car. They absolutely loved their room!

Make sure to read our informal campste comments here for more insight on the property.

name: Hotel Colonial
description: $15 a night for double room with bathroom. Plenty of parking in front and secure parking at rear for motorcycles and cars/trucks. Owner super friendly and helpful.

name: GOOD WIFI ICECREAM SHOP
description: Cheap ice cream and good Wi-Fi. There is a free parking lot beside the shop.

name: Finca de Moma
description: This is a really nice place to stay right before the border with Colombia. It’s a campground on the river with hot showers, clean bathrooms, Wi-Fi, a bar and a lovely family that runs the place. They moved to live here during the pandemic and have now started developing it into a campground. Price at the moment is $5 per vehicle.

name: Estación de servicios San Pedro de Vilcabamba
description:
A new gas station with new showers and bathrooms, very clean

Una estación nueva de Gasolina con baños nuevos sin ducha, muy limpios

name: at the beach
description: small parking lot ,6-8 cars.very quiet and non touristy! a few palapas on the beach.asked a local he said no problem to park.is noy private .will stay prob 2 night!

name: Amazing Vegan food - YūA
description: Oh my god. I am not a salad bowl personal but this might have changed my life. Healthy food never tasted so good for my Indian taste buds. Definitely a must try if you vegan

name: Vibe de Dois: Puma Gás Station
description:
We spent the night at this Puma gas station. It is big and spacious and many hikers also stay overnight here. There are clean restrooms with free cold showers. The workers are kind and we felt very safe. We haven't tried to use other facilities, but they probably have them.
—

Passamos a noite nesse posto de combustíveis Puma. É grande e espaçoso e muitos caminheiros também pernoitam aqui. Há banheiros limpos com ducha fria gratuita. Os trabalhadores são gentis e nos sentimos muito seguros. Não tentamos usar outras facilidades, mas provavelmente eles tem.

name: Plaza of the city
description:
Além do mirante, também dormimos na frente da praça da cidade (porque o senhor do mercadinho em frente gentilmente nos emprestou sua internet para trabalharmos). É uma pequena rua, mas cabem muitos veículos. Nos sentimos seguros, sem facilidades por perto.

In addition to the mirador, we also slept in front of the city square (because the man in the small market across the street kindly lent us his internet so we could work). It's a small street, but many vehicles can fit. We felt safe, with no facilities nearby.

name: Lamian China - most authentic hand stretched lamian noodles
description: The food here is not Chifa china. This is as authentic as it gets. lamian noodles are hand stretched here and the tofu is freshly made here. The flavours are absolutely incredible. One of the few restaurants with parking and pet friendly. Must try.

name: Hostal Sunshine
description: Right on the main road, $20 for 2 people with 2 beds. Pretty sure you could get it for cheaper. Hot water, average WiFi, flat screen TV unlike most other cheap hotels. Loads of space in the room for bikes, but no parking options.

name: La Kntera
description:
An incredible place to camp, both in a tent and in a motor home. The facilities are in excellent condition. There are bathrooms with hot water, kitchen, stove, and living room.
The family that cares for you is loving. Jorge and Margarita and Kevin. All three are great.
Within the same property there are some beautiful cabins and walls for climbing. You can go down to the river, there are some very nice but cold natural pools.
To get there, you can also search for it on Google as "La Kntera". AT THE PRINCIPAL DOOR THERE IS A SIGN "Area minera el arenal" go in and after 100 meters there is a little house at the right where they will explain to you all about the site. Camping costs 5 usd per person.
......
Un lugar increíble para acampar, tanto en carpa como en motorhome. Las instalaciones están en excelente estado. Hay baños con agua caliente, cocina, fogón y lugar de estar.
La familia que lo atiende es amorosa. Tanto Jorge, como Margarita, como Kevin. Los tres son geniales.
Dentro del mismo predio hay unas cabañas hermosas y paredes para hacer escalada. Se puede bajar al río, hay algunas pileta naturales muy lindas pero frías. 
Para llegar también lo pueden buscar en Google como "La Kntera". En la puerta principal hay un letrero "área minera el arenal" entra y avanza 100 metros, te encontrarás con un casa blanca a la derecha donde te darán las instrucciones del camping. 

Sale 5 usd por persona el acampe.

Principal gate normally is open everyday from 7am to 7pm otherwise you can send a whatsapp to the number +593984255708 for more lnfo.

name: Villa del Rey - La Joya - Guayaquil
description:
If you want to spend a couple of days in Guayaquil, we offer you a very safe place to park your van under shade. Wi-Fi and a quiet place to work and edit your videos. Less than 10 minutes from Parque Samanes.
...
Si deseas pernoctar un par de días en Guayaquil, te ofrecemos un lugar muy seguro para parquear tu furgo bajo sombra. WiFi y un lugar tranquilo para trabajar y editar tus videos. A menos de 10 minutos de Parque Samanes.

name: Vibe de Dois: Parking REEC
description:
Parking next to the square and well located in the historic center. Spacious, flat and with a good height limit. There is a relatively clean restroom and the employees are very kind. Good for spending the day, but not allowed to spend the night. During the day we couldn't find a parking space on the street because it's very busy, but at nightfall it was easy to find a parking space and we stayed 2 more days on the street, very safe. Noisy during the day, but quiet at night.
....
Estacionamento proximo à praça e bem localizado no centro histórico. Espaçoso, plano e com um bom limite de altura. Há um banheiro relativamente limpo e os empregados são muito gentis. Bom para passar o dia, mas não é permitido passar a noite. Durante o dia não encontramos vaga na rua porque é muito movimentado, mas no cair da noite foi fácil encontrar vaga para estacionar e ficamos mais 2 dias na rua, muito seguro. Barulhento durante o dia, mas a noite silencioso.

name: Kayak Hostel Ecuador
description: Kayak Hostel Ecuador do personalized tourism and offer lodging, tours in the Amazon rivers, food services and everything you need to enjoy your days in the jungle. We are located in the best strategic place next to the river, close to the best section for paddling in the region, surrounded by nature and close to the main city. Join this experience! We welcome all visitors who wish to camp, sleep in their motorhome, or rent a beautiful cabin in nature.

name: Public Swimming Pool
description: Hot shower for 1 $ at this swimming pool

name: Villa Bonita Hostel
description:
Located in Riobamba, Villa Bonita provides accommodation with free WiFi and access to a garden for $10 dorms, shared.
All units come with a patio, a kitchenette with a dishwasher and a toaster, and a shared bathroom with a shower.
The bed and breakfast offers an American breakfast.
-------------
La Villa Bonita se encuentra en Riobamba , ofrece alojamiento con WiFi gratuita y acceso a un jardín.
Todos los alojamientos cuentan con patio, zona de cocina con lavavajillas y tostadora y baño compartido con ducha.

Este bed and breakfast sirve un desayuno buffet o americano.

name: Border information - May 2023
description:
Ecuador to Colombia, I recommend you to pass at 6.30 am. They asked for passports only!! VEHICLE: take picture of plate, chassis number, drive license, passport's first page and Colombia entry stamp, make a PDF with those photos and upload it to the Colombia webpage. They open at 7am, there are computers and wifi to do the paperwork and the ladys working here helped us with everything!! ALL FOR FREE and nobody checked inside of our van.
~ 
Ecuador a Colombia. Te recomiendo cruzar 6.30am. Pidieron solo pasaportes!! VEHICULO: Sacá fotos de patente, nro de chasis, licencia de conducir, primer hoja de pasaporte y sello de entrada a Colombia, hacé un PDF con esas fotos y subilo a la pagina web de Colombia. Abren a las 7am, hay compus y wifi para hacer el tramite y las chicas que trabajan acá nos ayudaron con todo!! TODO GRATIS y nadie revisó nuestra van.

name: Land Rover mechanic
description: Ernesto Flores serviced my Defender with a 300Tdi engine. He also did a cambelt change for me. I was very happy with the workmanship, he clearly knows these vehicles. He works alone so best to phone beforehand. Cel no 0987932070.

name: Productos Lacteos el Alisar
description: If you like to buy some cheese or yoghurt, this could be the place for you. They also sell marmalade and coffee beans. You can also stop for a coffee (simple automat) and piece of homemade cake. We enjoyed our break there.

name: Lavandería internacional
description: Huge lavenderia, always washed our stuff in a day but could probably do quicker if you asked. They have the biggest machines I have ever seen, good if you need to wash something large. $1 per kilo.

name: Mitad del Mundo El Eno / Equator
description: Here you cross the Equator. There is a small flag next to the road.

name: Plaza central Macara
description: We rolled in late at night and decided to park here. It was pretty empty by 8pm. We parked in front of the panderia across the Cruz Azul farmacy. The bakery owner said it’s safe to park over night. Had a good quote night. There are clean paid washrooms that open at 7am to 8pm for 25 cents.

name: Hotel Valle Segrado
description: $7 for a dorm room, $8 for a private room with shared bathroom. Easy choice. They asked for $10 but I showed them it was cheaper on booking.com. Decent WiFi, basic but clean room.

name: Flat Plateau above the road with nice view
description: We were on our way to another spot and found this one by accident. It’s a relatively big gravel plateau above the road. Depending of your size of vehicle and the area you choose to park, you might be invisible from the street. We really liked the view and parked closer to the edge. Until 9pm cars where regularly passing by, after that it slowed down. And as soon as E35 is repaired, there will be probably less traffic on E487. And not sure if it’s always like this, but it was only a bit windy, nothing bad. Cellular signal (claro) isn’t strong (mainly E, sometimes 3G).

name: AMANCAY hotsprings
description: nice natural looking pools.relatively new place .I was the 'first foreign' here.owner speaks good english and will let u park in the front .share power if u need.not so busy in the week and pool is not extremely hot unbearable!there s also a cold water one and the river.definetly better than Shuar down the road

name: Hostal Flor de los Angeles
description: This is the cheapest place in town. $20 for 2 and it's very nice. Spacious room, queen bed, nice bathroom, a locked (at night, in the back) parking area for our bikes. It's a little far from the centro area, but town is not that big.

name: Kofi time
description:
Great cafe to work with good Wifi, and great attention from the staff.
_________

Ótimo café para trabalhar com bom Wi-Fi, é ótima atenção dos funcionários.

name: Panaderia y pasteleria Scarleth
description:
Small bakery with fresh and cheap bread all day long.  The owner is super nice and always offers free coffee (for us it was more like tea, but of course we accepted!).
__________

Pequena padaria com pão fresco e barato a toda hora. O dono é super atencioso e oferece sempre café grátis (para nós era mais um chá doce, mas claro que aceitamos!).

name: mecanico
description:
a family lives here, the man is a mechanic. We stayed in his yard for 2 days while he fixed our cloche disc. He had to go to Machala for the spare parts. He charged $120, which we thought was a bit expensive but he did a good job.
--------------
aquí vive una familia, el señor es mecánico. nos quedamos en su patio 2 días mientras nos arreglaba el disco del cloche. Nos tocó ir hasta Machala por los repuestos. Cobró 120 dólares, nos pareció un poco caro pero hizo un buen trabajo.

name: Solar Panels - Ilios Energias Renovables
description:
We went to Ilios for a problem in the solar installation of our mobile home. After a check they quickly detected that the problem was in our solar controller. The customer service is impeccable and from the first moment we were sure that we were dealing with good professionals. Having visited other solar businesses in Cuenca, I would definitely recommend this one.

Acudimos a Ilios por un problema en la instalación solar de nuestra casa rodante. Después de un chequeo detectaron rápido que el problema estaba en nuestro controlador solar. El trato de cara al cliente es impecable y desde el primer momento tuvimos la seguridad de estar tratando con buenos profesionales. Después de haber visitado otros negocios de energía solar en Cuenca, sin duda recomendaría este.

name: Villa Kite
description: This is a Hotel where we asked if we could Park in front of the building. The owner is really nice and we paid 6 Dollars a day for electricity, one open public shower, bathrooms, wifi and using their pool. They also serve food from morning until evening. All in all, a nice stay, in case you need electricity. Otherwise,  I guess you could also just camp on the road and be fine.

name: Cafe-Pizzeria Imperios
description: Tired of chicken and rice but haven't warmed up to cuy asado yet. If you have a hankering for some pizza Imperios is pretty good. My expectations are always very low outside of the 5 boroughs but the toppings were pretty tasty and the crust thin a little crisp and not bad. Don't expect mind blowing za but pretty good for Equador.

name: Grassy Field
description: We spend two quiet and safe nights here. Grassy field. Shade available. Friendly locals. No trash or stray dogs. Good internet both with Claro and cnt. To get to this place, you have to drive across a narrow bridge under a gate which is about 2.8m high. The river is easily accessible here. About 1.2 km from main square.

name: Playa Varadero
description: Huge parking lot of dark sand, not a particularly attractive beach in my opinion, lined with some Gaudi-inspired structures with little restaurants. Mandatory pushy waiters. Bathrooms showers. I asked the night guard to park, said ok. I believe with a tip, the guard will give you power. 3g signal.

name: Sr. Coffee
description: Coffee place with great Bolón. The coffee is made with coffee beans. Tastes good. It’s not espresso but it’s nice after encountering so much instant coffee.

name: Entrance to Reservation Arenillas
description: Marking this point, so that it is easy to find the actual start of the entrance road to the reserve, instead of getting confused by Google. Camping is a further 4km along this road

name: Proyecto Buela
description:
This small campground in Otavalo is under reconstruction right now, but open for travellers. The gate to enter is just 3m high and the campground is not leveled. The owner is really nice and friendly.
We have been the first guests and paid 5$ for the night. At the moment there are just cold showesr and no WiFi but in time this might change. 
It's a good place to spend some nights.

name: Beach
description: A bit out of town, at the end of #17. Spent a quiet night but I never mark anything as "safe"!

name: Agrocalidad
description:
Here you can get the official document to bring an animal into Colombia, after the veterinary check. You will have to pay 27,72$.
After that, you also have to stop at the Agrocalidad office at the Rumicacha frontier to get the official stamp on this document.

name: Origen Coffee House
description:
Step into our café and be greeted by the enticing aroma of freshly brewed coffee. We take pride in sourcing the finest beans from around the world, meticulously roasted

Indulge in our delectable menu offerings

Our café provides a cozy and inviting atmosphere, perfect for catching up with friends.

name: Vibe de Dois: in the street
description:
Narrow street but good for parking. We stayed 3 nights on this street and it was very quiet. ATTENTION: we are a few meters above this point, in a recess in the street itself, in front of the store “Moda Mistic Ecuador”. The street is noisy during the day, but at night it is silent. The police pass by frequently. There are no facilities close by. We are in a kombi and it was the perfect size, for a van or larger vehicle, I believe that the street - as well as the entire historic center - may be too narrow.

_____________

Rua estreita mas boa para estacionar. Ficamos 3 noites nessa rua e foi muito tranquilo. ATENÇÃO: ficamos alguns metros acima desse ponto, em um recuo na própria rua, na frente do estabelecimento “Moda Mistic Ecuador”. A rua é barulhenta durante o dia, mas a noite é silenciosa. A polícia passa com frequência. Não há facilidades por perto. Estamos de kombi e era o tamanho perfeito, para uma van ou veículo maior, acredito que a rua - assim como todo o centro histórico - possa ser estreito demais.
___

name: Accion Sport - -Outdoor Gear
description: We found this small shop with a good variety of different (lower quality) outdoor gear. They sell the standard bottle of propane for European cooker (see picture). They are expensive with 16$ each (440g), but we finally found them :-).

name: Anchwy Hwan Chae (La Casa de la Alegria)
description:
We had the greatest time here! it is hard to describe... cyclists ussually stay for a night or two. This is not a hotel, just a family house, Richard, Anita and their sons are great hosts and better people. Fridays and Saturdays, there is live music and you can drink homemade "yage" among other things. Richard is a certified master in alternative natural therapies and if you contact him in advance you can book for a ceremonial ancestral session, energizer therapies and so on... great atmosphere to interact with locals, keep in mind that they don't speak english.
Clean separate bathroom for men and women
Wifi available
Richard +593982050966

name: San Vincente hotsprings
description:
A small complex in a beautiful location! bit cold because of the altitude but nice.I arrived here after 6 pm when they were closed and the owner let me park overnight.it is $5 entrance.wifi reach but better neat reception. I did not see a Claro signal. Bathrooms-shower inside, 
open when they are open.

name: Taller VW “El Rápido”
description: If you have a Kombi or anything Volkswagen for that matter, Reinaldo is THE person, not just in Ambato, but in all of Ecuador for you. I had been to 7 different mechanics throughout Ecuador before Reinaldo and he put EVERYTHING in not just working order, but in as close to perfect condition as could be. Reinaldo is a Cuban CHARACTER, but one of the nicest people you’ll ever meet. I was able to stay inside of the garage for the entire 2 weeks he was fixing my engine, brake and steering systems. His shop is on a tiny little alley/backroad and he may have a few projects going on at once but he’s the best, hands down. Tell him Adam sent you! +5930962892987

name: Cotopaxi Entrance - NO MOTOS ALLOWED
description: We arrived on our Moto and were denied entrance because motorcycles are not allowed in the park. Cars are allowed but motos are not?!? We had to turn around. Very sad and a weird rule considering cars are allowed.

name: Pumamaqui hotsprings
description: small compkex but reallt nice ,next to river only on reservation u can have the place for $29 pp

name: Casa Primavera Baños de Agua Santa
description: Great apartment near the center of Baños, close to everything (shops, bars, restaurants, parks, thermal baths). Very helpful and responsive owner (Sonya +593989757423). Spacious place with a fully equipped kitchen. Fast wifi. We felt right at home. Unbeatable price ($12 per night, for 2 people). The apartment can accomodate 6+ people. There was plenty of space to store our bicycles inside. Highly recommended.

name: Hostal Napoles Emperador II
description: Simple hotel with friendly and helpful owners. The location is great, close to shops, produce markets, parks and restaurants. They let us take our bicycles up to our room. No questions asked. Very secure. Recommended as an affordable option in the center of Ambato.

name: P&S Petrol Eosy Station
description:
Petrol station, with water, toilets (no shower). No WiFi. Partly at a fairly busy roundabout. $2.

Stazione di benzina, con acqua, bagni (no doccia). No Wi-Fi. In parte a una rotonda abbastanza trafficata. 2$.

name: San Miguel hotsprings
description: Cute village in the middle of a fantastic jungle! Not even on Google Maps! but on OSM. It is 6 kms off a dirt rd. Follow the sign on main rd. 4 large pools of different temperature. Hot showers ,baños open I guess til 7-8pm(?)ask. They let me connect the power and in the second night they let me park in front of the church/plaza free!. $2 entry to the pools.there's some Wi-Fi around but no Claro signal. If you're a hot spring lover, this is super! On a Wednesday, only a couple of local folks showed up

name: Casa Campo
description: It’s about 1km west of this point along the road (couldn’t get a proper read due to connection issues). Beautiful guesthouse with a great restaurant. We stopped for the food. It’s a little more expensive for Ecuador typical price but the quality is good. Toni and his mom and aunt were incredibly kind and hospitable. A great meal if you’ve found yourself a bit hungry after cycling from town.

name: Mi Sub
description: New clean restaurant offering Almuerzos. The meal of the day for us was mora (blackberry juice), chicken soup (delicious) and pasta Al La pesto. Good WiFi and very accessible!

name: End of the road
description: You cannot continue the road from here. There is a gate and it is private property.

name: Hostal Familia FLORES
description:
Nice Hostel in Angamarca downtown. 
8$ per person.
Rooms are clean, staff is very friendly !!!
Wifi, hot shower, very comfortable bed!
If you are looking for more privacy they have a lovely cabin just outside the town!
For more information, you can call the owner "Doña Ester" at  0998284555.

name: Ramos Urku
description:
nice place to stay, 10 dollars per person, you can put your bicycle in the room, hot water, wifi, restaurant. 
.....
Buen lugar para quedarse en la naturaleza , limpio, wifi,  agua caliente y restaurante. 
Hôtel très bien tenu, 10 dollars pour une personne,  cadre agréable  plus restaurant

name: Puichig Llacta
description:
We stayed in Puichig for a couple of days to relax after passing through Quito. We were very well received by Carmen and her family, they really made us feel at home. It's a very quiet place, with a beautiful view of the surrounding volcanos. 
We stayed in the private room with bathroom. We parked our Van in the backyard, it's a very safe area. 
We initially planned to stay 2 nights but ended up leaving only after 5 days. 

They also provide guided tours to Cotopaxi, so feel free to contact them for information regarding tours.

Owners description: 
This is a tourist hostel where people feel at home.
A mountain refuge for those who are passing through Cotopaxi.
We have a private room and two rooms with a shared bathroom, a shared kitchen, wifi, and hot water. Four people can stay in the shared room.
We also have a camping and parking area.
.....
Es un hostel de turismo donde la gente se sienta en casa.
Un refugio de montaña de los q van de paso al Cotopaxi.
Tenemos una habitación privada y dos habitaciones con baño compartido, tiene cocina, cuenta con wifi, y agua caliente
Se pueden quedar en la habitación compartidas 4 personas.
Tiene área de camping y Parqueadero.

name: Misahuali Camping
description:
This is a campsite under construction. It currently has no services.

The owner Luis makes tours to the different places of interest in the Ecutorian Amazon.

--------------------------------------------------

Este es un camping en construcción. Actualmente no tiene  servicios. 
El propietario Luis hace tours a los distintos lugares de interés en la amazonia  ecutoriana.

name: PS GAS STATION
description:
Free water 
__
Abastecemos e nos deixaram pegar água.

name: restaurante "El Pasajero"
description:
very good restaurant!
breakfast, lunch, dinner are ok
cyclist are welcome!!!

name: Armed Robbery Attack
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Serious crime reported in this area! 
Do not, under any circumstances stay at this place.
3 guys wearing masks, weapons in hand attacked us at night. 

We managed to escape. Scariest experience in our lives.

name: Petroecuador water
description: Gas station where you can also fill your tank with potable water

name: Fateh Bread and Coffee
description: Amazing BRUNCH, one of the best in Ecuador. They have a Selection of breads. We had an excellent Spanish tortilla (like a thick omelette with onion and potatoes) and chocolate pancake. Comes with a huge side of fruits, eggs, hot and cold drink and so much food and out total bill was $10 for an excellent brunch.

name: Parque Maldonado
description: We stayed parked on the 5 de junio street. The park was extremely clean and surrounded by beautiful churches, architecture and super quiet at night. Our dogs loved it too. Highly recommend. Very safe, next to a police station.

name: Cascadas las Lajas
description: The family who runs the waterfall will let you stay in the parking lot that is next to their restaurant with bathrooms, showers and wifi available 24/7. Overnight stay is $5 including entrance to the waterfall and they have good food at the restaurant from 8am-5pm. William and his family are doing a great job and want to start having overlanders stop by as well. The road off of the main road isn’t the greatest but if I can handle it in my Kombi there are very few cars which would have problems.

name: Cascada la Eterna Juventud
description: One of the most beautiful places I’ve ever seen! 20-30 minutes down a relatively good dirt/rock road and then another 30 minutes with a beautiful walk through the rain forest to get to a massive gorgeous waterfall. There was no one there, the trail is super well marked and the pool at the bottom of the waterfall is the clearest water I’ve ever seen. A perfect place for a stop off on a hot day. I think you could easily camp/park overnight at the parking lot at the entrance.

name: Entrance of NP
description: Right after the gate, the ranger at the entrance allowed us to stay here. There is a large pull out that could fit 2 vans. Just ask the guy if it’s ok. Not very quiet as there is traffic on the road but ok for a night. Free

name: Charla Wasi Camping and Cabins
description:
We came here on our bikes at the recommendation of the tourism office in town. This is the camping option for this town. It’s $5 per person per night. Great views of the mountains, flat dry spot, can make a fire. The outside bathrooms (for people camping) are luxurious! My wife says these are 5-star hotel bathrooms. Clean, well-designed, hot shower. Not gonna lie, most impressive camp-bathrooms we’ve experienced in 9 months of cycling South America. They are a little far from the tent area though. 

As of now they are still building the restaurant, but do offer food services on weekends. They rent luxury beautiful cabins as well for $30 per night with breakfast included. Great stop if the hills have made you tired on the way out of Quito.

name: camping masada
description: Nice campsite run by a friendly family, $5pp

name: taller de bicicletas
description:
Good place to repair your bicycle, Alex the owner travel also . Good prices and shimano repairs. 

Un lugar para reparat su bicicleta, Alex el dueño practica tzmbien , es muy amable y tiene muchos repuestos shimano. muy profesional y barato.

Atelier de réparation,  Alex le propriétaire est très sympa, prix très intéressant, beaucoup de pièces shimano .

name: Quiet place at side of town
description: Quiet place to camp just out of San Isidro at the back of a disused building , we asked the lady living close by and she said it was ok to do so. No facilities but water and toilets 5 minute walk at the children’s playground

name: Parque Parana
description:
It is a safe place to spend only the night, it is very quiet at night, it is a residential area that takes great care of the park, you can walk your dog, there are some shops nearby. It has no cost.
At night, it is quite cold.

Es un lugar seguro para pasar solo la noche, es muy tranquilo en las noches, es una zona residencial que cuidan mucho el parque, puedes pasear a tu perro, hay algunas tiendas cerca. No tiene costo. 
En las noches hace bastante frío.

name: Gas station warning
description: For those going to Peru, the gas stations after this toll don’t accept credit card. And some won’t accept to fill your van at all. So be sure to fill up before this point or have cash.

name: P&S gas station
description: Big gas station where you can also spend the night. The employees are very nice, toilets and showers clean. They can give you the wifi password if you ask.

name: Parque Podocarpus Trails
description:
Thought I should add the trails to this entrance to the Parque Podocarpus as a separate attraction as they make for some nice hiking and we would have missed them if the nearby overnight spot weren't so conveniently located for our night.
You get three circuit trails: 400m/20min - 700m/30min - 5km/3hours. Finally there is a 14.5km in and out trail to the lagunas (supposedly 8hours) but unfortunately this one was closed due to weather conditions.
I've set this marker to point to the park entrance where you provide your passport details. The trails start at the refugio/overnight spot which is an 8 km drive up the mountain and makes for a perfect campsite. The trails are easy to follow but beware, the big circuit takes you right across a ridgeline with strong winds who think that you ain't got no business up there.
Park rangers are supposedly there from 8 to 5. We arrived at 4pm to spend the night and were told that last admission would be at 3. They still let us in without much begging, but if you can manage, try to stick to their schedule, they are otherwise friendly people and provide everything free of charge.

name: Emergency stop: construction site
description:
Because the Oasis hostel nearby was closed for the season, we checked a path we saw on the map that extended after a dirt road one “block” from the Oasis spot if going North (it’s the next road). It looks like an area that’s still being built up, but there isn’t anything here. Grass is growing in the areas that have been dug up, suggesting that construction is halted for now. The dug-out walls keep noise from the highway from getting in. There are some of those small flies around, but otherwise a very empty, quiet, and kind of nice spot. The ground very flat, clear of stones, but too hard to stake in a tent, so we roped the tent to some rocks (there are plenty heavy but moveable rocks here). 

Not a bad option if you are in a pinch!
Full Claro 4G signal here too! Bring your own water.

name: Vulcanizadora Amazonas
description:
We had a flat tire from a nail, so it was repaired with a sturdy patch for $5. Very friendly people, the son took care of us and is very professional, 100% recommended.
.....
Tuvimos un neumático pinchado por un clavo, entonces nos lo repararon con un parche bien resistente por 5$. Gente muy amable, el hijo se ocupó de nosotros y es muy profesional, 100% recomendable.

name: Cabanas Fratello & Camping
description:
Cabanas Fratello & Camping is located perfectly between San Lorenzo and Playa de Los Frailes (Parque Nacional Machalilla). A perfect spot to visit if you are passing through. 

The property is nestled on top of a bluff overlooking the beautiful beach of San Jose. Famous for the world-class waves found here during the summer. The location is a perfect spot to find peace and solitude. Make sure to bring everything you need as there are no stores or restaurants nearby. 

The property is quite big. Plenty of room for big rigs and tents. There is also a private room and private cabana available for rent. Wifi is strong. Some even work remotely from this location. Outdoor shower and bathroom are available for campers. Also, there is a large communal space on the first floor of the main cabana. Perfect for cooking or hanging out. Nice access trail to the beach as well. Mangrove forest nearby!

The owner, Franklin, is a local surfer from Manta. He has been working on creating a special surf camp vibe for surfers and travelers alike. Very helpful and eager to assist you with anything you need. It is recommended that you contact him before arriving as he is regularly traveling to Manta to visit family. Also, reservations for the Cabana and private room are available through Airbnb. 

Don't follow Google maps! Follow red arrow on photo for correct directions. 

WhatsApp/Phone: +593 98 487 9634

Email: f.evy@hotmail.com

Cost: 

Campers - $5/pp/pn

Espanol: 

Cabañas Fratello & Camping está perfectamente ubicado entre San Lorenzo y Playa de Los Frailes (Parque Nacional Machalilla). Un lugar perfecto para visitar si estás de paso.

La propiedad se encuentra en lo alto de un acantilado con vista a la hermosa playa de San José. Famoso por las olas de clase mundial que se encuentran aquí durante el verano. La ubicación es un lugar perfecto para encontrar paz y soledad. Asegúrate de llevar todo lo necesario ya que no hay tiendas ni restaurantes cerca.

La propiedad es bastante grande. Mucho espacio para camiones grandes y tiendas de campaña. También hay una habitación privada y una cabaña privada disponibles para alquilar. Wifi es fuerte. Algunos incluso trabajan de forma remota desde esta ubicación. La ducha y el baño al aire libre están disponibles para los campistas. Además, hay un gran espacio común en el primer piso de la cabina principal. Perfecto para cocinar o pasar el rato. Bonito sendero de acceso a la playa también.

El propietario, Franklin, es un surfista local de Manta. Ha estado trabajando para crear un ambiente de campamento de surf especial para surfistas y viajeros por igual. Muy servicial y dispuesto a ayudarte en todo lo que necesites. Se recomienda contactarlo antes de llegar ya que viaja regularmente a Manta para visitar a la familia. Además, las reservas para la cabaña y la habitación privada están disponibles a través de Airbnb.

WhatsApp/Teléfono: +593 98 487 9634

Correo electrónico: f.evy@hotmail.com

Costo:

Campers - $5/noche/persona

name: hotel Castillo Real
description:
Nice play to stay, very big room quiet and clean. The owners are very friendly.  Good value, 15 dollars for a person, you put your bicycle in your room.  Fast wifi and hot water.

______________________

Un bel hôtel tranquille,  le propriétaire est très sympathique  , chambre spacieuse , pas cher pour les commodités offertes en comparaison avec les autres hôtels visites. Possibilité de mettre le velo dans la chambre. 
Un  buen lugar para descansar. Habitacion grande y limpia, buena cama, agua caliente, fast wifi.  Los dueños son muy simpaticos.

name: Hotel Su Dulce Sueño
description:
Basic hotel on the main square. Friendly owners, hot electric showers, okay wifi. Space for bikes out back though a little squeeze getting through (ask them to open up the shop to go through!). 
Paid $5pppn with 3 cyclists.

name: Cuenca
description: Autolider Mercedes-Benz  garage. They have the filters we needed (oil, etc) and did a big check up for ( Sprinter 4x4). We parked in the street before the garage entrance and spent the night (safe en quiet and the guard looked on us as well).  so they can start immediatly in the morning. Good service, friendly and reasonable prices.

name: Makakos
description:
This is a family house with a wonderful patio were Darwin offers parrillada... actually a high quality super nice parrillada. He lived 10 years in Argentina were, among other things, he learned the art of cooking with fire, now he offers this service but only with advanced reservations.
Angelica, her mother, lives with him. She picked us up from the main square or plaza (we are a couple cycling around SouthAmerica) and she gave us a place to stay for the night, super nice people... and by far the best asado we had in Ecuador.

Darwin +593990033935
Angelica +593990904935

name: LA PEDREGOZA
description:
LA PEDEGROZA is located in a large volcanic crater. 
suitable for all types of transportation. cabanas are also available. 
a large open house invites you to chill and get together. a restaurant, a bar and a small shop complete the whole thing. 
everything is tasteful, lovingly and very clean and well maintained. the owners and staff are incredibly helpful and attentive without being intrusive. 
the area offers a lot of nature and opportunities for hiking, horseback riding, cycling and much more. I could go on forever..... look at it. 

Price for Landrover Defender 2 people: 
U$ 20.00/night.

name: hostel El Imperador
description:
not really nice hostel, but the only one open when i arrived in town under the rain.
10$ per person, slow Wifi, cable TV, very little rooms with private bath and and not so clean ..... no hot water.

name: Trepel - Estacion de servicio
