description: We spent a nice and quiet night here. It's a big gas station that has a large gravel area next to it for sleeping trucks and cars. We asked an employee for permission and she said it was perfectly fine. Free. There are bathrooms, restaurants etc.

name: Carr. Panamericana
description: Flat asphalt area. it is next to the road but there are some bushes. You won't be hidden enough but the best we could find for a snack. We think this is the best you will find for sleeping.

name: Oasis Hotel
description: Only hotel in Biblian. $20 a night for two people with private bath. Gym on the first floor with loud music and weights banging till late at night. Rooms are rundown and a bit dirty. Can’t open bathroom door all the way and toilet seat is is broken. Warm water only. Good WIFI on 3rd floor. Bike storage downstairs.

name: P&S
description:
We could fill with Canadian plates and get air. There's water here as well next to the air but we didn't ask if potable.
Cash Only, has an ATM in place.

name: Apart Hotel Casa Blanca
description:
Clean, modern hotel. Kitchenette with a refrigerator! $24.50 for two people. Close to stores and restaurants. We were able to keep our bikes in the room though we had to carry them up 2 flights of stairs. 

Heads-up: When we asked about the price the lady said $40 dollars. I showed her the price on bookings.com and she said I had to reserve thru them if I wanted that price. So I booked the room at the hotel’s front desk. Weird way of doing business but I got the lower price!

name: LUIS
description:
ENGLISH / SPANISH 
If you want to visit the Yasuni, without a doubt LUIS is the best option. He charged us $60 for 4 people and we spent 1 day and a half in the jungle. Travel the boat, look at birds and dolphins, we stopped at the camp, ate, walked through the jungle for 2 hours, we went to look for boa snakes, see the sunset at night, we went to look for alligators. The next day we went for a spin with the boat again and then we came back. It was very little what we paid for everything we did, it is true that Luis does not show you much animals either but for $60 friends it was VERY GOOD. You will not find that price anywhere. 
He doesn't get much money from this, it's not mandatory but after a little tip wouldn't be bad to help him

TELEPHONE LUIS +593 98 007 2658
--
Si quereis visitar el Yasuni, sin duda Luis es la mejor opción.  Nos cobró 60$ por ser 4 personas y fuimos 1 dia y medio a la selva.  Viaje el lancha, mirar aves y delfines, paramos en el campamento, comimos, caminar por la selva 2 horas, fuimos a buscar serpientes boa,ver el atradecer en la noche fuimos a buscar caimanes. Al dia siguiente fuimos de nuevo a dar una vuelta con la lancha y luego volvimos. Fue muy poco lo aue pagamos para todo lo que hicimos, es cierto que Luis tampoco te muestra mucho animales pero por 60 $ amigos estuvo MUY BIEN. Ese precio no lo vais a encontrar en ningun lado. 
El no saca mucho beneficio de esto como los otros. No es obligatorio pero después un pequeño tip entre todos no estaría mal para ayudarle 
TELEFONO LUIS +593 98 007 2658

name: Taller del Sambo
description: Sambo and his team are incredible with Kombi he helped me with issues with my steering, brakes, and suspension. They are great mechanics and they do not charge travelers. Just whatever the parts they need cost. Very recommended!

name: Santo cielo pizza
description: $1 slices of pizza! Right in front of the parque Calderon. Maybe not the greatest pizza on Earth but it’s hard to beat $1 oversized slices

name: Gran terreno / Big field
description:
It's a very big field next to a roasted chicken shop. There are many tents that probably sell food during the day, right now (sunday night) they are closed.

We asked in the chicken store and they said it's safe to sleep here. To enter the field there is a small ramp where only fits one wheel, but it's doable anyway.

There are some not-very-clean bathrooms available and even some cold showers you can use for free.

-----

Es un terreno muy grande al lado de un negocio que vende pollo asado. Hay también algunas carpas que probablemente venden comida durante el día, pero hoy domingo a la noche están cerradas. 

Preguntamos en la tienda de pollos y nos dijeron que es tranquilo y seguro. Para entrar hay una pequeña rampa en la que solo entra una rueda, pero se puede subir sin problemas.

Hay también unos baños no muy limpios y varias duchas de agua fría que se pueden usar gratis.

name: Parque Nautica
description:
We were here for one night. Quiet place.


Estivemos aqui por uma noite. Lugar tranquilo.

name: Mecânica Automotriz Multimarcas
description:
an accessible workshop, no height restrictions, diesel and gasoline mechanics, Fabian its owner is very kind and works very well. He attended to us promptly and even let us stay overnight in the workshop, we filled our water tank we didn't use it but as he lives in the place where he needs a bathroom, he can ask. Tel/WhatsApp:+593996692245 Fabian

un taller accesible, sin restricciones de altura, mecánica diesel y gasolina, Fabián su dueño es muy amable y trabaja muy bien. Nos atendió puntualmente e incluso nos dejó pasar la noche en el taller, llenamos nuestro tanque de agua no lo usamos pero como vive en el lugar donde necesita un baño, puede pedirlo. Tel/WhatsApp:+593996692245 Fabián

uma oficina acessível, sem restrições de altura, mecânica diesel e gasolina, Fabian seu proprietário é muito amável e trabalha muito bem. Nos atendeu prontamente e ainda nos deixou pernoitar na oficina, enchemos nossa caixa d água  não usamos mas como ele mora no local de precisar de banheiro pode pedir. Tel/WhatsApp:+593996692245 Fabian

name: Hostería y Cabañas La Estancia
description: Marco came to us as he was seeing us looking for a spot for the night. He's the owner of a nice garden full of cabañas and let you stay for free in the garden. There are toilets, outside shower and swimming pool (with huge slide!). We saw a kitchen too but didn't use it so not sure if it is available. Marco is lovely and made sure everything was ok for us. He lives in Quito so is not always there. The best is to send him a message beforehand to make sure he can open you. There is place for 2/3 campervans. There might be a height restriction to enter the garden as there is a sign above the gate (we're 2,10m high, no problem). Very nice place! +539 99 878 3272

name: Pan de Masa Madre
description: A tiny little bread shop with the most Devine bread and pastries.  And very reasonably priced.

name: SUPAY
description: A restaurant I was surely not expecting. From outside it just seems like a normal almuerzo type place but the food is incredible! It’s gourmet prepared food for very cheap. Got a delicious chicken, mashed potato, cuzcuz and mixed veggie plate for $5

name: ferromaderal
description: it is a fully serviced for motorhomes. they repair all mechanical and non mechanical damages to motorhomes. nice service

name: Repair Glass
description:
Great service, fast and quality service. we paid $35 usd to have our windshield repaired, which was cracked by a rock the day before arriving in Guayaquil.
Ótimo atendimento, rápido e servido de qualidade. pagamos $35 usd para fazer o reparo do nosso parabrisa que foi trincado por uma pedra no dia anterior antes de chegar a Guayaquil.

name: Rincón de los viajeros
description:
The good man receives travelers of all kinds and from all sides. There is wifi, there are bathrooms and several other things... In addition, he is a specialist in VOLKSWAGEN. He helped us with our Kombi T2
-----------------
El buen hombre recibe viajeros de todo tipo y de todos lados. Hay wifi, hay baños y varias cosas más… Además, es especialista en VOLKSWAGEN. Nos ayudo con nuestra Kombi T2

name: crêpe suzette
description:
Super good French crepes. The sauces are homemade.  Personal favorite was the orange one.  My daughter loved her chocolate strawberry crepe. Small establishment run by the very friendly Yann.
-------------------
Super bonne crepes françaises, un goût de la maison ça fait tellement plaisir. Bonus pour les sauces qui sont faites maison. Craquage personnel sur celle a l'orange. Ma fille a adoré sa crepe fraise chocolat. Petit établissement par le très sympa Yann.

name: El Castillo del Lobo
description:
El Castillo del Lobo Steakhouse - Camping - Grill Very good, safe place. People are very friendly and polite. $5.00 per person, including firewood for wild fireplace.
.....
Lugar muito bom, seguro. 
As pessoas são muito amigáveis e educadas.
U$5,00 por pessoa, incluído madeira para fogueira.

name: Nothing fancy
description:
Nothing fancy, not hidden from the road, but we slept here one night because of the altitude we didn't want to go higher. At night it was quite enough. You need a high clearance to enter from the road, but it is big enough for every car. Claro signal.

Enjoy!

name: Amazing, next to the river
description: Very nice place to spend one or two nights. You can park very close to the river. At 500m there is a very comfortable campsite. I think it's free to spend the night in the campsite, it's municipal.

name: Posto Primax
description:
It's a gas station, we asked and they let us fill our tank, very clear water, we were told it was drinkable.

É um posto de combustível, pedimos e nos deixaram encher nossa caixa, água bem clara, nos disseram ser potável.

name: BATERIAS MAC
description:
+593 0960851830
Batteries of all kinds.
Excellent service.

Baterias de todo tipo.
Excelente atendimento.

Baterías de todo tipo.
Excelente servicio.

name: Overnight spot for birders
description:
If you are searching for the Red-faced Parrots, we stayed one night here in the corner of the road. It was really quiet at night and we saw in the late afternoon 4 parrots :) 

Enjoy!

name: El Gaubo Bar restaurant
description: The best restaurant in Quito! Nice staff, beautiful surroundings full of flowers and hummingbirds. Absolutely amazing dishes. You won't expect this at this place. It is definitely a must stop

name: Dog highway
description: A note about this stretch of road. This road to Quilotoa is known as 'dog highway'. There are hundreds of dogs that have been dropped off in this area. They now rely on the kindness of people passing by and providing food. They lay along the side of the road and watch every car that drives by hoping for some food. It's a bit surreal. Apparently many people do provide food so it's not all bad, but certainly not great, and a bit dangerous for the dogs. Might want to bring some food for them if you are a dog lover and taking this route.

name: Flat area by beach
description: Easily accessible, large flat spot by the beach. Beach is a bit dirty, friendly fishermen around. We camped in a group.

name: PWR Performance
description: We spent almost 4 weeks here while doing some painting jobs on our van, and some maintainance and repairs to our MB180. Cris, the mechanic, is an awesome person and made us feel at home all the time. He has a spare room and shower, and drinkable water to refill tanks. Most of all he's an excelent mechanic with fair prices, cheap comparing with other mechanics in Ecuador. All travelers welcome!

name: Balneario Mi Refugio
description:
We found this place on the recommendation of a local.
The price must be negotiated, we pay usd5 for 2 people. Place with roof to set up the tent, bathrooms, without shower, wifi, access to the River. And best of all, the kindness of Vicente and Carmen, and their entire family. We feel at home. If you are in the area, be sure to visit them and send greetings from Lucas and Aldana, the Argentines.
----------
Encontramos este lugar por recomendación de un lugareño.
El precio hay que negociarlo  nosotros pagamos usd5 por 2 personas. Lugar con techo para armar la carpa, baños, sin ducha, wifi, acceso al Río. Y lo mejor de todo la amabilidad de Vicente y Carmen, y toda su familia. Nos sentimos como en casa. Si andan por la zona no dejen de visitarlos y mandenle saludos de parte de Lucas y Aldana, los argentinos.

name: Food stalls
description: This place has multiple food stalls with amazing selection. We had some amazing tasty hornado  con tortilla for $3 a plate and also had fantastic chicha.

name: Truck Taller Euroman
description: This is a recommended place for trucks. They work on other brands as well. Well equipped, good organised and trustful.

name: Tomas Hacienda Adventure
description: Pool with restaurant, showers, soccer field, etc. We paid the entrance price of 5$ per person and were allowed to sleep in the level and green parking lot.

name: Black House Hostal
description: Excellent newer hotel in San Gabriel. Clean spacious rooms, secure bike storage. Hot water but short lived. Paid $15 as single traveler, includes breakfast.

name: Lavandería la Química
description:
good laundry, fair prices 0.65 USD per pound.  They give you dry and folded clothes.  good option in the area
--------------------
buena lavanderia, precios justos 0.65 USD la libra. te entregan la ropa seca y doblada. buena opción en la zona

name: Panea Bakery
description: Great sourdough bakery, croissants, cinamon rolls bread etc, friendly and helpful

name: Laguna de Cuicocha Restaurant
description: In the garden of the restaurant you can camp. Paid 7 dollars for one night. Shower and toilet included. Wifi also available.

name: Estación de servicio primax
description:
service station, with security at night.  people were friendly.  There are very nice bathrooms in the cafeteria, it closes at 10 pm and opens at 6 am, they sell everything.  there is a flat place  We didn't see many options in machachi.  you feel some traffic on the road, it's ok to spend a night.
-------
estación de servicio, con seguridad en la noche. las personas fueron amables. hay baños muy lindos en la cafetería, cierra a las 10pm y abre a las 6 am, venden de todo. hay lugar plano. no vimos muchas opciones en machachi. se siente algo de tráfico en la vía, está bien para pasar una noche.

name: Panificadora Tumbaco Desde 1976
description: Incredible bakery. Plenty of lovely affordable pan but also some really special ‘gourmet’ options too. The cinnamon bun is worth every cent of its $1.60. It’s kind of like a cinnamon roll/croissant hybrid, it is to die for. Enjoy!

name: Mirador Laguna Quilotoa
description: Nice mirador with amazing views of Laguna Quilotoa. It's located along the hiking circuit around the laguna. Parking is 5 min walk away at the Shalalá Lodge (where you can camp - see iOverlander entry). 2$ p.p. to visit the laguna. The dirt road to get here was in good condition when we drove it with our MB Sprinter.

name: Jaguar rescate Centro
description: Refuge for wildlife victims of trafficking or domestication. They have two jaguars, 1 puma, Coatis, monkeys, agoutis, parrots, turtles... possibility to visit or volunteer. It's not a zoo. For volunteering it's $17/day including accommodation and 3 hearty meals (same price for children and motorhome travellers). Normally it's at least 1 week but we were able to do 4 days. We fed the animals, cleaned the cages and did some small DIY work (about 4 hours of quiet "work" during the day). Our two 8 and 11-year-old daughters loved it and so did we

name: Volontariat Comunidad Wayta
description: Volunteering on a cocoa farm. It is a young association of cocoa producers that seeks to produce and gradually transform cocoa into chocolate to better value their work, make quality chocolate accessible to Ecuadoreans and also develop new crops, in particular vanilla, to offer better valued work to women. Entirely organic and agro-forestry-inspired crops. We spent a week with Victor's family. We worked about 3 hours a day to do weeding, cocoa picking, frame cleaning... in exchange we had lunch (of course the accommodation for backpackers). Possibility to park your camper. Shower, toilet, sanitary and drinking water, wifi available but rudimentary installation. Very authentic experience and guaranteed immersion. Puerto misahualli at 3km for a walk and possibly excursion on the napo river.

name: Petrolrios
description:
Translation : Public 24 hours, safe, clean baths, a little noise for being close to the highway.

Publico 24 horas, baños seguros, limpios, un poco de ruido por estar cerca de la autopista.

name: El Palacio de los Lujos
description: Tire shop. I got good AT tires here for my van. With time they can probably get what ever you need. Their son also has a repair shop nearby where I had an axle and hub replaced. I highly recommend both of these shops. Number 0998493220. Add the +593.

name: No through road
description: We tried to get into the park this way but road ends at some point.

name: Lavanderia Aromas
description:
laundry and steam ironing at $1.50 per kilo.  Pick up after two hours

lavanderia y planchado a vapor a $1.50 por kilo. Se recoje despues de dos horas

name: Selina Hotel
description: We looked for shower options in the area and it is very central, it is next to the main church. They very kindly charged us 1 dollar for each person's shower (you must bring your towel) neat and beautiful place. buscamos por opciones de duchas en la zona y está es muy central, está al lado de la iglesia principal. muy amables nos cobraron 1 dólar por la ducha de cada persona(debes traer tu toalla) sitio aseado y lindo.

name: Banco Pichincha
description: Bank with ATMs outside on the left side of the building when facing uphill. Not sure if there was a limit, was able to withdraw $250. $4.48 withdrawal fee.

name: Old Dirt Pulloff
description: Small overgrown dirt road on the right of the road when heading uphill. Very narrow and overgrown with cactuses so probably not accessible by car. We were on bicycles and was perfect for us, well hidden from the road and flat for camping. road noise wasn't too bad.

name: Juan Montalvo Park
description: a nice, free, safe site.  next to Juan Montalvo park.  There are bathrooms for $0.25

name: Hacienda Cacao y Mango
description: You could visit this finca, do the "chocolate tour" (2-3h) but you could also stay there for the night. Owners are very friendly and are projecting to optimize the facilities for campers. actually there are toilets and restaurant. good experience for us, for our first day in Ecuador coming from Perù...

name: disused land
description: disused patch of land with a few good spots for tents. couldn't find other wild camping near here. spoke to several locals who said it was fine and that no one owns this land currently.

name: DISMAD -Wood made to messure
description:
DISMAD - wood made to measure
We needed a plywood board made to measure for a small expansion of the interior.
You won't find it in hardware stores or carpenters.
But at DISMAD you will find what you are looking for.
You will also find hinges, screws, angles, silicone, paint and much more.

name: Yura_Yaku_Wasi
description:
The place is about 5 km from Tena. It is located in the wild on the Inchillaqui River.
There are pitches for motorhomes, tents and cabanas available for rent. These are located in the middle of the forest with a view of the river. You can swim there. It has fire pits and a communal kitchen.
Pre-registration with Joy on +593 99 666 2041 is required.

name: El mejor mecanico ! Roberto Di Domenico
description:
Translation: We needed to change our rear brakes urgently. After seeing another nearby garage, we arrived at Roberto's at the end of the day who, after taking a quick look, told us to come back the next day at the first hour, indicating a place to sleep for the night safe. The next day they spent the day looking at each part affected by our overheated brakes. Precision work and with a lot of kindness. We recommend them 200%!! Trustworthy people!

WhatsApp: +593 98-462-7207

Nous avions besoin de changer nos freins arrières de toute urgence. Après avoir vu un autre garage proche, nous sommes arrivés chez Roberto en fin de journée qui après avoir jeter un coup d'œil rapide nous a dit de repasser le lendemain à la 1ere heure en nous indiquant un endroit où dormir pour la nuit safe. Le lendemain ils ont passé la journée à regarder chaque pièces impactées par notre surchauffe des freins. Travail de précision et avec bcp de gentillesse. Nous les recommandons à 200% !! Des personnes de confiance !

WhatsApp : +593 98-462-7207

name: School field under roof
description: We were told we could camp in the school field just off the parque, under a roof with a tiled floor. The toilets were locked and no running water but a garage 80 m away had toilets and water.

name: Gravel pit aside from road
description: Slept here, no problem, quiet at night. You can go 50m further and you will be well hidden from road. Any size of vehicle fit. It can be very windy here. Second place is a bit protected.

name: ATM en PyS Estacion de Gasolina
description: Banco Pichincha Visa MasterCard ATM is inside the PyS Gasoline Station

name: Hostal La Española
description: A reasonably priced and clean hostel. I paid 12  usd for single person, they have plenty of space for bike. Wifi is okay, hot shower available and a small breakfast is included..they charge per person

name: PyS Gasoline Station
description:
Inside the gas station there is a large space to park.  We asked the guard and he told us to stay at no cost.  free There are restrooms small shop.

dentro la estacion de gasolina hay gran espacio para parquear. Al guardia le preguntamos y nos dijo que nos quedaramos sin ningun costo. free Hay baños pequeña tienda.

name: Lavandería Yaku
description:
Laundry service, it is not the cheapest but it gave us more confidence than others.  They deliver dried and folded.  1.30 usd a kilo.  compliments and easily accessible

servicio de lavandería, no es el más económico pero nos dio más confianza que otras. te entregan secado y doblado. 1.30 dólares el kilo. cumplidos y de fácil acceso

name: Balneario La Lajilla
description: Nice place which locals visit for a natural balneario in the river but nobody in there in the evening. Few really nice spots to park a van. For super brave people there are toilets and also some electricity plugs (didn't checked if it works). Road in here is sandy but decent.

name: Embarcadero Río San Miguel
description:
this place is perfect to spend the afternoon and night after the border, it is spacious, near the river and the people are very friendly.

____________________________________

este lugar es perfecto para estar la tarde y la noche después de la frontera, es amplio, cerca del río y la gente es muy amable.

name: deserted beach
description: Large space by the sea, safe and quiet. we stayed 3 nights. No facilities.

name: Restaurante Paradero Dona Susy2
description:
Restaurant with large parking lot.  Clean bathrooms and cold shower with water from the waterfall in front.  I asked to sleep and they didn't charge me.  Breakfast and dinner... Fast and efficient staff.  E20 road.
------------
Restaurante com grande estacionamento. Banheiros limpos e ducha fria com a água da cachoeira em frente. Pedi para dormir e não cobraram. Café da manhã e jantar... Funcionários rápidos e eficientes. Estrada E20

name: Hostal Valle Andina
description: Really nice new hotel, about $24 USD for a double room, we used booking.com for discount. amazing shower heat and pressure and super nice owners. away from main road so reasonably quiet. safe storage for bikes

name: Birdwatching place
description: I've found this place as very rich for bird watching. Many hummingbirds and others. There are even track of Tapir. You can park here, rest of track is very steep for our Sprinter 2WD. If you will be fulfilled with this place go on the top of the hill, there is possibly hike trough cloud forest and see more.

name: La Casa de la Luz
description: It’s a super good place to eat, all fresh, also Vegetarien food. Coffee and handmade bread de Masa Madre, all delicious. Open 7 days a week from 8 a.m until 5 p.m. . Secure parking in front, a very cozy place

name: Paradero Gaby
description:
We were tired and we spent the night here, we negotiated to purchase from their store, we bought drinks and they let us use their bathrooms

Estábamos cansados y pasamos la noche aquí, negociamos consumirles de su tienda, compramos bebidas y nos dejaron usar sus baños

name: Casa Guardaparques Antisana
description:
beautiful place to be, chat with the rangers, they let you stay inside and do a little hiking
---
hermoso lugar para estar, platicar con los guardabosques, te dejan estar adentro y hacer un poco de senderismo

name: Sports hall next to church El Tambo
description:
Heading from Zamora, go through town and turn left up a steep hill for 40m past the church and the covered hall sports hall is on the right. We asked grounds man if we could camp inside and he said yes. Has toilet and sink with running water. 

He did say if kids are playing inside we might have to wait for them to finish before putting the tent up but no one arrived. No parking available and dead end road so not suitable for campers, tents only.

name: Corupt police!!
description:
corrupt traffic police If there is a policeman and he asks you for money, the policeman is corrupt, but when there is a checkpoint with 15-20 policemen and they ask you for a tip, the Ecuadorian police are corrupt. At 11 in the morning I went there and they told me that I was going very fast even though I stopped at a toll just 500m behind, which means that it couldn't be true. They told me that the fine is 200 euros, yes euro€. and then they made me give everything I had loose ($35). they are very good scammers. (What you don't know is that I was filming with a hidden camera and I'm going to publish it. Surprise!)
Espanol

policía de trafico corrupta. si hay un policía y te pide dinero, el policía est corrupto, pero cuando hay un control con 15-20 policías y te piden propina, la policía de ecuador es curupta. A las 11 de la mañana pase por allí e me dicieron que iba muy rápido aunque solo 500m atrás pare en un peaje lo que significa que no pudo ser verdad. me dicieron que la multa es de 200 euros, si euro€. e luego me hicieron dar todo lo que tenía suelto(35$). son muy buenos timadores. (lo que no sabes es que estaba gravando con camera oculta y lo voy a publicar. sorpresa!)

name: Green Bamboo Lodge
description: Nice place, wonderful views, very quite, very safe, a lot of nature, flat parking, Octavio and Yoly are a retired couple who lives there, they are very kindly, they make a great pizza too. You could take breakfast if you want. Very clean bathroom and hot shower, fast wifi. $10 pppn.

name: Playa desierta en Puerto Rico
description:
Beautiful sunny beach next to the stone wall. quiet and safe place, several locals came to talk to us. We stayed here 3 night. no facilities. 

Bela praia ensolarada ao lado da parede de pedra. lugar tranquilo e seguro, vários moradores vieram conversar conosco. Bom Sinal 4G Claro. Ficamos aqui 3 noites. sem facilidades. @Bustrada

name: Little stream
description: Pull out next to a little stream. Very quiet night. The cows came by in the morning to drink. Could fit any size vehicle, but there’s not much space for tent camping (we made it work though). Really enjoyed our night here. Clearly visible from the road.

name: hôtel Bau Bau for pets
description: Here you can leave your dog or cat during your trip to Galapagos.  Your pet has one room with air conditioning, TV with pat patrol, walks and a personalized nanny who takes care of him all the time.  It is a large house with drinking filtered water.  Cedt a 4 star hotel for animals that are very well pampered.  We had videos and shots by WhatsApp for 15 days.  You can write here +59399 413 1400 to book.  They are adorable.  The price is 25 US dollar per night but with exceptional service and in a real dog hotel. You can see their instagram page "baubau_2015"https://instagram.com/baubau_2015?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==

name: Flat area by the River
description: Beautiful and quiet spot beside the River. Huge flat area suitable for all types of vehicles. Possible to put a tent. Feels safe. No 4G.

name: Park next to Puerto Hualtaco
description: Free working Wi-Fi in nice little park near the port. Good signal, speed average

name: Espigón Manta Centenaria
description:
It is a good place to camp. There is free cold water (dispenser). Permanent security, free Wi-Fi. Paid bathrooms (USD 0.25) without shower, very close. But you can use the one at the service station. Friendly workers and can supply drinking water for motorhomes. You have to know that the police often come at night, and it only bothers a little that they leave the trucks with the engine running, perhaps for a couple of hours. Today July 28, 2023, free gym classes started at 6 in the morning with music, I heard they will be from Monday to Friday.

Es buen lugar para acampar. Hay agua fría (dispenser) gratis. Seguridad permanente, Wifi gratis. Baños pagos (USD 0,25)sin ducha, muy cerca. pero se puede usar el de la estación de servicio, que está  Se puede estacionar en la playa. Los trabajadores amables y pueden abastecer de agua potable para los motorhomes. Hay que saber que durante la noche viene seguido la policía y solo molesta un poco que dejan las camionetas con el motor en marcha, quizás un par de horas. Hoy 28 de julio de 2023, comenzaron las clases de gimnacia gratis a las 6 de lamañana con música, escuché que serán de lunes a viernes.

name: Charlitos
description: Great value priced American food. Big portions, and by far the best deal in Vilca. Very big burgers for $3.50. Great pesto pasta, and large pizzas for $10-12. Charlie is an American who has been in Vilca for 15+ years, so is a good resource for info also. Restaurant is a bit sterile without much ambiance, but the food and prices more than make up.

name: Gas station
description: We only stopped here briefly with our campervan during the day. Relatively new gas station with shop, clean bathrooms, showers outside and a small restaurant. Considering there are not many options for an overnight stop along this route, I add it here.

name: La Ruta de Chavo
description: This is a beautiful place to stop, eat and also sleep in Cabañas. In the middle of nowhere but directly on the main street. Waterfall beside and surrounded by lush green. The Contact you find in FB & Insta, super nice hosts and a great service.

name: cerro corazón
description: this is the starting point for the cerro corazón trail. it's about 3 hours up, but we only went until the last step. it was very windy and foggy. so we saw no sens in climbing up the last 400 meters. we had to pay 2$ pp and 2$ for the car to enter the park. if you want to climb the peak you need a helmet. you can also sleep here but have to pay for another day.

name: Riverside spot for cyclists
description: Gorgeous little spot for cyclists. Across a small wooden bridge over the river, space for a few tents. Cows about. A number of locals saw us, we were prepared to introduce ourselves but they didn’t even approach, just a wave and went on. Quiet and stunning.

name: Comunidad Llullimunllo
description: Tiny community, very friendly people. You can camp at the school, but they can also open the old schoolbuilding where you can sleep inside (light, electric plugs, toilett). Watertap outside. Its a poor village, they might ask for a donation for the community or school.

name: Bomberos (cyclists only)
description: Kind bomberos who will let cyclists sleep in their little office/bodega. We were offered kitchen access and a hot shower upstairs but we tried to keep ourselves out of their way where we could. Locked the bikes up outside the room, sadly in full view of passers-by but we were assured they were safe on the inside of the gate. Thank you firefighters!

name: shower at the petrol station
description: petrol station where we found diesel cause no more in Catacocha. nice and clean cold shower.

name: Hotel Samuria
description: 45$ spacious tripple incl breakfast. Big secure garage where we could service our motorbikes. Close to main square and to food places down by the river.

name: Bosque Aventura
description: This is an adventure place where you also can camp or stay with your truck. It is a super beautiful place, very quiet, well maintained and a friendly host called Luis. Shower is cold. Good Claro 4g Signal. paid 5$pp

name: sabría que vendrías restaurant
description:
the restaurant sells several dishes, we tried the chivo al hueco, with cassava, sweet potato and horchata. All natural food and at a good price for the exotic. 8 USD costs the goat. there are more prices. clean place and friendly people.
--
el restaurante vende varios platos, nosotros probamos el chivo al hueco, con yuca, camote y horchata. comida toda natural y a buen precio por lo exótico. 8 USD cuesta el chivo. hay más precios. sitio limpio y personas amables.

name: Flat space for 2 campers next to the road
description: There is possibility of wild camping at this place, it's flat next to the not very much used gravel road. It's just 500m before La Montana, where you can do some birdwatching trails. I've seen hummingbirds and other birds on this place, also toucans but you have to be patient. Be careful that bridge from Mindo is I think maximum for Mercedes Sprinter but not wider rigs. Claro H+ so so.

name: Estucheton for SIM card
description: Had to try several stores before we finally found one that would sell us a Claro SIM without local ID. Looked like they had a good repair service for damaged phones too.

name: Mamma mia pizza
description: The pizza is delicious! You have 3 sizes. And lots of options. They make it fresh and you can see them do it. The couple is from italy. Imagine the pizza. Hmmmmm do not miss it. Look the menu:

name: Corrupt Police Checkpoint
description: We were stopped at a big checkpoint. The officer tried to find something wrong. He said we stopped the car a couple of meters past the stop and were driving to fast. He proceeded to tell us, that he will have to write a fine for our „mistake“. This fine we would have to pay as we leave the country. Cherry on top- apparently this fine is 400$.  He was clearly waiting for us to make an offer. The discussion ended quickly as we said we would give our ambassy a call and pointed out that we have a dash camera (not true we pointed to the mirror).

name: Waterfall
description: Beautiful. 2h hike to this waterfall. Gorgeous

name: Estación de servicio masgas
description:
a good place to spend the night during the week, it has the cleanest and most organized bathrooms we have seen in Ecuador, they can offer you a free shower if you are lucky and have the right person.  worth it in vilcabamba

un buen sitio donde pasar la noche entre semana, tiene los baños más limpios y organizados que hayamos visto en Ecuador, te pueden ofrecer una ducha gratis si cuentas con suerte y la persona indicada. vale la pena en vilcabamba

name: Cotacachi Street Parking
description:
Wide street that has no exit and is quite quiet. Cotacachi is a very beautiful town worth visiting. We spent a night here and then went to the Cuicocha Lagoon. 
--
Es una amplia calle que no tiene salida y es bastante tranquila. Cotacachi es un pueblo muy bello que vale la pena visitar. Nosotros pasamos una noche acá para luego ir a la laguna de cuicocha.

name: Tecnicentro Gallegos
description:
Excellent service and fair price.  We changed the oil and filters of our Kombi, everyone was very attentive and helpful.  highly recommend.
---
Excelente atendimento e preço justo. Fizemos a troca de óleo e de filtros da nossa Kombi, todos muito atenciosos e prestativos. super recomendo.

name: Avalon hostel
description:
Can’t believe this place isn’t listed already - absolutely SPOTLESS hostel run by a German lady. Big cabins look beautiful but we took a dorm bed for £9pp per night (full price list in pics). No one else in our three-bed dorm so we had it to ourselves. Bathroom is sparkling, shower HOT. Kitchen has plenty of utensils, and is, again, spotless. Maybe the cleanest place we’ve stayed in South America so far. Yoga classes here too. A beautiful, peaceful spot. Bikes went in the garden outside our room window, happy they’re not visible from the road. 

Wish we could have stayed longer!

name: Spot for cyclists off the Panam
description: Ideal wild camping spot for cyclists on the Tembr. Too narrow for a car, it’s likely a track used to move cows around. A bit boggy at first but soon enough you’ll find a lovely flat piece of dry ground, not visible from the road and even with a nice view. You could turn to the right and push up to the top of the hill if you like, to be sure no one (i imagine a farmer) would see you, but there aren’t lots of flat spots up there and we didn’t see anyone all night anyway. Bit of traffic noise but aside from that all quiet.

name: Big primax. Wash car for free
description: Big primax, toilets. Buttt nice thing! They have high pressure hose where you can also fill up your tires. We washed our car with it. It was perfect! So nice.

name: Professional Mechanic
description: Very professional mechanics, did work fast and communicated well.

name: VW Especialist Henry Mora New Adress
description:
Here is new Adress of Henry Mechanical VW

Aqui é o novo endereço do Henry, mecânico especialista em VW.

name: Aromi caffee and chocolat
description:
Cozy coffee place where u can have nice cakes (tiramisu) and chocolat milk. The cups are huge!!!!! 

Annoying point: they will not give you the wifi so we wanted to do some work that is why we went here but was not possible.

name: El Sambo restaurant
description:
Great local food place where you can taste yummy Amazon dishes. Mainly fish served for lunch (at least when we stopped by): smoked in a large leaf or grilled, served with mashed fried plátano. No full almuerzo but the $5 include a main and refresco. Tasty and rich, one of our best local lunches in Ecuador. 
Large car park outside suitable for any rigs.

name: Hostal Alexandra
description: Nice hotel. Rooms aren't big but clean, comfy and look good. Good wifi but shower is lukewarm rather than hot. Double room $20 a night. No breakfast served but large court yard they use as car park suitable for big rigs.

name: Casa Elf
description: This is a indigenous family that host traveleres (bikes, motorbikes, vans, cars...). They are so nice. They are Luis and Victoria. They have a room for guests and plenty of open space outdoors.

name: Valley Overlook
description: Beautiful grassy area next to the highway. Fairly hidden and only accessible by bike or motorcycle. Super beautiful view. There’s a stream coming out of a concrete thing across the street where we got water. Lots of space for tents, although the ground is a little lumpy. There is highway noise.

name: Galápagos Frontier Tortoise Reserve
description:
Galápagos Tortoise natural with free-roaming giant tortoises and a lava tunnel. Principally a national park guided tour area with fresh fruit juice ($15 guided tour) but camping + breakfast available for $20 with your own tent. Only $10 taxi ride from Puerto Ayora, or $1 (Guayabillos) blue bus - much closer to town than the other tortoise ranches.

Owners are Julio & Cesar
+593 98 234 4180 
@galapagosfrontier

Commercial kitchen used for tour groups. Message for facilities available.

name: THE SHACK BBQ AND BEER
description:
Exceptional place that you can not miss if you go on a weekend and holidays, here without a doubt you will find the best BBQ and the best beer in all of Ecuador.  people are very friendly and like to help travelers.  we have been in vilcabamba for 16 days just enjoying its people and food.  very fair prices.  You can even sleep here in the camper.

lugar excepcional que no puedes pasar de largo si vas un fin de semana y días festivos, acá sin duda alguna encontrarás el mejor BBQ y la mejor cerveza en todo ecuador. las personas son muy amables y les gusta ayudar a los viajeros. hemos estado por 16 días en vilcabamba solo disfrutando de su gente y comida. precios muy justos. hasta puedes dormir acá en el camper.

name: 4wd specalist
description: Good mechanics here who really know about 4x4! They can do any kind of work, mechanic, external fixing, painting... Camillo is a really nice guy, he himself has a cool Toyota he used for off-road races!

name: View - Vulcano River
description: Beautiful spot to sleep. There is wifi. A roof. View over a volcano and potable water if you follow the path on the right. Natural water source.

name: Cemacol RV water pump - bomba de água
description:
We found a place to buy a water pump for the RV.
Great service! We highly recommend Sebastian 0999015314

Encontramos um local para comprar bomba de agua para o RV. 
Otimo atendimento! Recomendamos muito o Sebastian 0999015314

@luaudasmontanhas @luaulife

name: Hostal California Inn
description: This hotel in Guayaquil is a safe place for whatever you are up to in town. We traveled to Islas Galapagos and we're able to park our motorcycles for free during this time (2 weeks safe parking). I think it only works for motorcycles but you can ask if it is possible for cars as well. Overall very nice rooms, fast internet, super friendly staff. Restaurant at the hotel, free drinking water. In booking it was cheaper for us 25$ for a couple.

name: Freshlite water fill up
description: Great place to refill water. The lady cleaned our bottles before refilling. it's right next to the Aki  grocery store.

name: La Casa de Hacienda Otavalo
description:
Hotel and cafeteria with a big gate and large interior courtyard where you can spend the night. Perfect if you want to be close to the new Animal Market in Otavalo (20-min walk). 

Bathrooms available at the cafeteria. Super fast WiFi. They can also open a shower for you if you want. Continental breakfast available for 3$. Pets allowed. 

Many hikes available in the region. Close to the Pan-American Highway, 5-min drive to downtown Otavalo and the handicrafts market. Very quiet at night. Super nice owners.

name: Petreolrios Flota Bolivar petrol station south of Buena Fe
description: Clean and safe petrol station with small shop. No restaurant. Security guard on duty. Showers and toilets. Some traffic noise during the night as you are close to the road. Good for a night driving the E25.

name: Centro Médico SNE-MED
description:
Specialized medical center for any eventuality in Ecuador.
.....
Centro médico especializado para cualquier eventualidad en Ecuador. 
Centre médical spécialisé pour toute éventualité en Equateur.
.....
Whatsapp: +593 984154938
Teléfono: +593 961883238

name: Claro store
description:
Claro store at La Plaża shopping mall. Here you can buy, recharge, register your SIM card. We had problems at doing this at a random pharmacy so here it is much easier. Open 7 days a week

It has open wifi, but didn’t work when we were here

name: Wild life camping
description: It is a place that plans to start receiving travelers in motorhomes. a perfect place to disconnect from the city, with a view of the cayambe volcano. Oswaldo, its owner, is a super attentive person. with him you can agree the price to stay. The road to get here is paved and in perfect condition. To get to the campsite, keep in mind that there is a small slope. Oswaldo's telephone number for you to contact him is 593 999290068

name: Hotel Betania
description: Nice hotel in town, feels like a normal hotel in a Spanish city. warm-feeling room with carpeted floor. no parking but bicycles can be stored in a function room (up one flight of steps). booked via booking.com, $18 for one person. smart TV and good wifi. couldn't get any hot water out of the shower though!

name: Parking of Tarabita Mindo
description: Big and mostly flat parking space of Tarabita Mindo. Was free of charge.

name: Parqueadero Asunta Te y Cafe
description:
This is the parking space of Asunta Te y Cafe.
Price per hour was 1 USD and per 24 hours would have been 5 USD.

name: MaMi Nomads
description:
Short,medium & long term parking (we're the owners).
Overnight stays possible with water & hydro hook up.
Parking/staying in a secure private property.
2 miles from Manta airport for those wishing to fly out to Quito, Galapagos, Panama city etc...
Hablamos Español, we speak English & nous parlons Français.
Room for 3 pickup or 4 cars or 1 overlander van or 1 overland  truck (max height 3,20m, max lenght 7,05m, 2 or nights only )
Rates: 5$/night, 30$/week or 120$/month (key stays with the vehicle for parking moves).
Rate for overnight stay with hookup to be discussed.
Thanks for considering. The owners: metalca1965@gmail.com or Whatsapp +593 98 750 3556 (message only)

name: Corrupt Police
description: Wanted 250$ because of our bikerack. Offered 125$ unofficially. Gave them 50$ and told them it wasn’t okay.

name: Conectando sueños
description:
Translation: Traveling family that has already traveled through South America in a Camper and has a lot of experience to share, great people, super friendly, they lend you laundry, kitchen and bathrooms.

Familia viajera que ya recorrió Suramérica en Camper y tienen mucha experiencia para compartir, grandes personas, súper amables, te prestan para lavar, cocina y baños.

name: Wildcamp on E35 old tar road. Just before town of Ona
description: Great wildcamp for Vehicles. This is difficult to see as the access is on a sharp corner. Once you turn off you are on an old tarmac road. With lots of space. Some rubbish will be good even in the rain. Not sure about tents as surface is hard. it's quiet at night not much traffic noise and you can park out of sight.

name: El Jalapeño Taco
description:
If you're in the mood for Mexican food, this is the place.

This is the best place I've found for Mexican food since Mexico.

Very close to Mexican street tacos. Excellent guacamole and legitimately hot salsa!

Good service and clean bathrooms seal the deal.

It's very popular with locals, so you may have to wait a bit for a place to sit, but I think it's worth it.

name: Carvernas Laberintos de Guami
description: A super nice hike trough the labyrinth caves which are 25 meters deep in the ground of the jungle. You can see fossilizations in your headlamp spot. Feel the adventure for about 300 meters (depend of the rain) without daylight. We enjoyed the well known experience of Bryon Carrillo, a super nice guide. The tour takes you about 1.5 hour, we paid USD 7/pers. You can park your car just in front of the house. The family takes care. Dont miss this adventure in this incredible nature. Highly recommended!

name: Hotel GH
description:
Good hotel for travelers, we rented a room for two adults, a child and a baby for 14USD per night, it has all the services.

Buen hotel para viajeros, alquilamos una habitación para dos adultos, un niño y un bebé por 14USD la noche, cuenta con todos lo servicios.

name: Technolavado
description: Fast, clean and cheap self-wash Saloon where you can wash and dry.

name: Distribuidoras Andino - Water
description: Here you can buy a 20L garrafon for 2.50 USD

name: Hosteria Lindo Pilahuin
description: Last hotel before Chimborazo. Simple hotel. 10$ pp. Private toilet, warm shower, swimming pool, you can use the kitchen. The toilet was not super clean so we asked to clean it properly.

name: Parque El Angel
description:
Safe place to spend the night, please take care of the park so as not to disturb the super friendly neighborhood. It is close to Shopping Batan, food court and supermarket.
 
Local seguro para passar a noite, por favor cuide do parque para não incomodar a vizinhança que é super amigável. Fica próximo ao Shopping Batan, praça de alimentação e supermercado.

name: AGUA LUNA
description: Water refill place just off the main road (massive sign can’t miss it), nice guy gave us two garrafons to fill up our tank, 2 dollars for 40L.

name: las tortillas de mamita otilia
description:
This restaurant has been in existence for 69 years and is perhaps the most traditional in Tumbaco. Mrs. Otilia continues to cook a delicious typical meal over charcoal. If you pass by here do not stop coming. Only served Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

Este restaurante tiene 69 años de existencia y es tal vez lo más tradicional de Tumbaco. La señora Otilia sigue cocinando una rica comida típica al carbón. Si pasas por acá no dejes de venir. Solo se atiende viernes, sábado y domingo.

name: Chimborazo Rey Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant with hosting. But they let you put the tent at the school for free, super close to the restaurant. It has a roof so it is protected from the rain and the wind. It is quiet. You can stay in the common areas of the restaurant while it is open. Super warm inside. Friendly staff and perfect to recover from the cold. The restaurant/hosting has toilets and potable water. The school doesn't have toilets.

name: Scanner Cuenca Imagen Diagnóstica
description:
Medical Center open to Mon at Sat fron 7am to 7 pm. We paid $30 usd to realize ecography. We didn't do checking hour. Cell number +593 96 789 4687

Clínica de exames de imagem (ecografia/ultrassonografia, tomografia, mamografia). Excelente atendimento, para ecografia não é necessário agendar, atendem de segunda a sábado. Paguei $30 dólares para fazer uma ecografia mamária. Whatsapp +593 96 789 4687

name: Tiayta Beer Cerveza Artesanal
description:
Food and brewery.  I didn't try the food, but it smells great. 

They currently have five beers, and I like them.

Prices for beer, $3-$5.

name: Yellow Fever Vaccine (Centro de Salud No.1)
description:
Tuesdays and Thursdays starting at 8:00 am you can get your yellow fever vaccine. Limit of 20 vaccines per day.


Must provide Identification, a printed ticket proving you are travelling to a place with yellow fever, and your vaccine card if you have one.

name: Tyre scam
description: Lots of men waving down the van pointing at our tyres. We knew of this scam so of course didn't stop. Don't get caught out. Just keep driving and check your tyres regularly,  just somewhere else.

name: Visitor Center with WIFI
description: Visitor Center with free wifi. Toilets are 25 Cents. To get here, you dont need a guide, even if they say it at the entrance.

name: You dont need a guide
description: they try to sell you a guided tour for 40$ because of volcanic activity, but when you say you dont want to pay that, you can enter the park after registration with passport without a guide.

name: 5000m hike
description: you have to hike to this location to 5000m.

name: Bakery with Sour Dough Bread
description: artesanal bakery with amazing sour dough bread unter 4$. cinnamon rolls, banana bread and cookies also. sometimes banana bread without sugar.

name: Plazoleta Guayaquil
description:
Small parking next to the square with the Alausí sign, in front of the train station.  We spoke to the people who work at the Tourist Information and they were very kind, indicating that we could park here and spend the night.  It's very quiet here, we feel super safe. Its free and have wi-fi.
--------
Estacionamento pequeno ao lado da praça onde tem o letreiro de Alausí, em frente à estação de trem. Conversamos com o pessoal que atende nas Informações Turísticas e eles foram super gentis, indicando que podíamos estacionar aqui e passar a noite. Aqui é muito tranquilo, nós sentimos super seguros. É de graça e tem wi-fi.

name: Mundo Loma, Cascada 7 almas
description: A beutiful and pacefull place, You can walk and see birds everywhere, For the waterfall we paid 5 dollars, but we didn't pay For the night

name: Vulcanizadora
description:
we paid 2 usd to fix our tire, fast and excellent service.
-------
Pagamos 2 usd para consertar nosso pneu, serviço rápido e excelente.

name: Hostería Kumbha Mela
description:
Cabin hotel with a good country atmosphere, it has a swimming pool, lagoon, bathrooms, energy, wifi, water, restaurant, a very large parking lot and 30 meters from the river, very safe and with very friendly people, they charged us 10USD for the night of parking, they can buy additional tourist service in the Tarabitas which is an elevated basket and takes you to a path of 7 waterfalls.

-----------------------------------------------------------

Hotel de cabañas con un buen ambiente campestre, cuenta con piscina, laguna, Baños, energía, wifi, agua, restaurante, un parqueadero muy amplio y a 30 metros el río, muy seguro y con gente muy amable, nos cobraron 10USD por la noche de parqueo, pueden adquirir adicional el servicio turístico en la Tarabitas que es un canasto elevado y te lleva a un sendero de 7 cascadas.

name: Mirador Nariz del Diablo
description:
Right next to the Panamerican Highway, a two-story tower you can climb for a view of the canyon below. Free. At the time of writing, it isn't finished. Looks like there will be snacks or a gift shop available in the future. 

Note: there is a second "Mirador Nariz del Diablo" located in the community of Tolte down below. That mirador is a restaurant located on the rim of the canyon, and is also worth the side trip, in my view.

name: Mercado de animales
description: It is on Friday morning. They sell many animals. Also others days but less activity

name: Nukanchik
description: Very good coffe and cakes, cookies. They sell some coffe, chocolate and others goods. Very friendly

name: at the equator
description: stayed at the plaza, where there is an unofficial monument midad del mundo. We ask police for permission to park here overnight. there is a free public toilet and free WiFi.

name: Verde Machay
description: This is a beautiful family that used to have a restaurant in this location, one of their sons is responsible of the camp site!! They have power, water if you need and one bathroom inside the house. They currently charge $5 per van/Rv. The place is very safe near the Main Street but we had a very good night. They also have a place for tent camping under the roof of the old restaurant.

name: Santa Ines - Hospital
description:
Consultorios Médicos Santa Ines
Great spot, we arrived on Saturday, admitted right away with emergency (strong stomach pain). Professional, clean, new equipments. Nurses very nice speaking easy to understand Spanish. The doctor spoke English and was awesome. Glad we found this place

name: Machete money extortion at campsite
description: This is a big green grassy field. I think that this is the parking lot for the local market. We wanted to stay here for the night, but in the evening four or five men with machetes came and knocked at our windows and asked for money. Because we didnt feel safe anymore, we wanted to leave. They try to block our van with their cars, but we managed to drive away.

name: Very good pizza (also vegan)
description: Very nice neapolitan pizzeria and an amazing stylish interior. Pizzs starts at 4,99$ for marinara or margherita. they only have one size which is about 28cm. they also have vegan dishes.

name: Quiet spot at end of the road
description: This is a quiet spot at the end of the road, so the other cars dont pass you directly at your van, like at the other camp spots near the park or university. Thats why we chose this spot over the park spots in town. There is a sign „no heavy cars“, so chose by yourself, if you are one.

name: La Tradicion restaurante
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Does not meet criteria for Restaurants (must be exceptional (good or bad), have a detailed description, OR be very remote).

Good food. Menu of thé day. Very cheap and many local people. Delicious food and friendly people. 2,5 us for the menu including soup and limonade

name: Corrupt police
description: Police checkpoint. They checked our documents and then checked our tread depth on our tyres. Firstly tried to ask for 450$ for a "fine" for having low tread depth. Got him down to 40$ otherwise he said he would confiscate the vehicle. Even though we had a spare wheel he didn't allow us to change it.

name: Hostal Carolina
description:
We looked for many places to take a shower near the center where we were parked and the owner here was very helpful, the bathroom is great and the shower water is hot and plentiful! A little expensive but is a good shower, $5 for a couple.
---
Procuramos muitos lugares para tomar banho perto do centro onde estávamos estacionados e a proprietária aqui foi muito amável ,o banheiro é ótimo e a água do chuveiro é quente e abundante! Um pouco caro, mas é um bom banho, US$ 5 para um casal.

name: Baking Partners Panaderia Artesanal
description:
the best bakery in the city 100% artisanal natural fermentation breads and delicious sweets
---
a melhor padaria da cidade 100% artesanal pães de fermentação natural e doces deliciosos

name: Manta pets vet
description: Very good vet clinic. Several of the Vets speak English. They did a blood analysis in the clinic. Results in 5 minutes. They also have ultrasound equipment.

name: hacienda Zuleta
description: Gourmet Cheese shop and restaurant on hacienda where cheese is made. Must have reservation to tour the hacienda. Delicious gourmet international cheese in their tienda.

name: Fuel. Diesel and gasoline
description: Diesel and gasoline. Open every day 8am till 5 pm. But close for lunch time 12-13h

name: Casa del Rey Hospedaje/Camping
description:
Hospedaje/Campground
You are standing at the parking area, but can use all services like kitchen to share, pool, secured parking, showers...

2min walk to the sea.
One night for camping is: 10$pp/pn with all services

Contact - please contact before you come (especially actually because of saftey reasons. The owners are really happy to know who is coming.)
+593 98 474 7910
+593 99 914 0946

name: Honey Coffee & Tea
description:
The best coffee in town, internet, spectacular for those who need to work while traveling, as well as wonderful coffee and delicious food

O melhor café da cidade, internet, espetacular para quem necessita trabalhar durante a viagem além de um café maravilhoso e comida deliciosa

name: PARADISE PROJECT HOSTEL
description:
Amazing place close to the
Beach with quite comfortable and cheap rooms, large parking and different areas such as kitchen for guests to use.

____________________________

Lugar increíble cerca a la
Playa con habitaciones bastante cómodas y baratas , parqueo grande y diferentes áreas cómo cocina para uso de huespdes

name: Hostal Cattlya
description:
We stayed here 5 nights and can recommend this Hostal. Trudy (speaks german and spanish ) and her husband Ivan are very very nice and so friendly. We have a room with 1 bed and a doublebed with private bathroom and hot shower. Also a Air Condition. 
They have also rooms with shared bathroom. Everything is really clean. The breakfast is really delicious with a beautiful view over the bay from San Cristobal and changed everyday with fresh fruits. Coffee and Tea available. Also portable water to refill your bottles for free. WiFi is with Starlink but a little bit slow. They have a kitchen with all equipment and a fridge, microwave but i dont see a oven. Maybe you have to ask. 
Come here and support this nice couples 👍🏻

name: Casa LaSofia
description:
Casa Sofia is located 25 minutes from Vilcabamba between Quinara and Yangana.  It is a lodging and retreat farm, where they have a space to locate campers and travelers, a very pleasant place to rest for one or several days.  Its location allows you to go to several places of interest in the area and the best thing is that you are away from the hustle and bustle and are surrounded by nature.  Mrs. Raquel is a very kind hostess.  BEFORE GOING, YOU MUST CALL +593 99 361 7049 (watsapp)to confirm availability.  cost $5 per night with all the necessary services.
.....

Casa Sofia esta ubicado a 25 minutos de Vilcabamba entre Quinara y Yangana. Es una finca de hospedaje y retiros, donde tienen un espacio para ubicar camper y viajeros, un lugar muy agradable para descansar uno o varios dias. Su ubicación permite ir varios lugares de interes de la zona y lo mejor estas alejado del bullicio y estas rodeado de naturaleza. La señora Raquel es una anfitriona muy amable. Por favor ANTES DE IR HAY QUE LLAMAR +593 99 361 7049 (Watsapp) para confirmar disponibilidad. costo $5 dolares por noche con todos los servicios necesarios.

name: MIPA Artesenal Fireworks Museum
description:
Fireworks museum at the end of a steep but doable road. For $2.50 you get an interesting tour of the museum (sometimes in English, if the owner is there) and a small fireworks show.
There's even a campground, and they would prepare meals, but prices for vans are yet to be negotiated.

name: the travelers hostel
description:
absolutely amazing place!!! 
we paid 12 usd per night per person in a private room incl. breakfast. 
our motorcycles are parked very safe in the garage.
the showers are amazing the beds are amazing, the staff is great!  it all feels like I'm in a 5* hotel! love it!!! 
definitely recommend!!!

name: Cerro Alegre
description:
spanish lady living in a gorgeous spot, she shares the bathroom and the kitchen, you can sleep in your movility or you can camp. it costs $5 each person the night, you can also clean your clothes for $3; if you ask for, she sells (homemade) bread, Jam, fresh chesse, she gives meals and also repair your clothes and bags! and the view is espectacular! she has 3 cats, dogs are not allowed...

you can contact her vía some app, look for cerroalegrecojitambo!

name: Puente de la Saquea
description:
If you like quirky bridges, this is a fun quick stop. 

I won't post any pictures to leave the surprise when you arrive.

name: Beautiful spot above the clouds
description:
Kind of ended up here by accident, looking for the nariz del diablo, really happy that we did, the view is amazing, we didn't think it could get better than this so we stopped here for the night. It's just by the side of the gravel road (which is in good condition, no potholes), but we didn't see a soul. Just one farmer who we waved at, he seemed happy to see us. Very chill and decent Claro reception. 

Wanted to add that the Nariz Del Diablo pins aren't accessible via the northern part of the loop, all the dirt roads leading up there are blocked. But this spot is free and better ;)

name: Parque Central Celica
description:
Parque Central Celica a place to spend the night, very quiet during the week.  There is a Cafe and Mini market, here they also lend you the bathroom.  Around the park there are ATMs.  The Wi-Fi is free public You do not need a username or password

Parque Central Celica un lugar donde pasar la noche, muy tranquilo en semana. Hay un Cafe y Mini market, aqui tambien te prestan el baño. Alrededor del parque hay ATM. El Wi-Fi es público gratis No necesita usuario ni clave

name: Castillo en Zapotillo
description:
We spent the night in the parking lot at the castle viewpoint.  Quiet and safe place to rest. In front there is a house with friendly people,  there is no commerce nearby or bathrooms but you can walk and find where to buy food and bathrooms.  We spent one night and then continued towards the border of Peru.
.....
Pasamos la noche en el parqueadero del mirador del castillo. Lugar tranquilo y seguro para descansar al frente hay una vivienda con personas amables, al rededor no hay nada de comercio ni bañosmpero puedes caminar y encontrar donde comprar alimentos y baños. Nostros pasamos una noche para luego seguir hacia la frontera de Perú.

name: Magic Paradise
description:
Great property with private rooms and cabanas. Clean, well kept and affordable. Lady who runs a restaurant downstairs can make anything the way you like it, steamed or deep fried, choice is yours.
Washington, the owner of this place can organise a tour to the jungle nearby and owns a bus that can take you back to/from Quito

name: Hostal Kucha Wasi
description: Great hostel with good WiFi. The staff is super helpful. They let us park our bikes inside the hostel, but only room for 1 or 2 and the. 2 or 3 vehicles fit in the garage next door. Food in nearby Colta or host will have taxi deliver it to hast for you. We paid $30 usd for room with 2 beds and private bathroom

name: Mirador El Gavilan
description: Amaizing sunset view! Boondocking. Quite and safe place, $1 pp admission, Flat parking, no facilities, 15 min from Salinas. A little bit windy and cold, 5 centigrades at night but it really worths, friendly people they lit a bonfire for us.

name: estación de servicio el proyecto
description:
service station with bathrooms, showers and security, perfect on the way between Nueva Loja and Coca
----------
estación de servicio con servicio de baños , duchas y seguridad, perfecto en el camino entre Nueva Loja y el coca

name: Clínica Veterinária Los Sauces
description:
Dr Galo Valverde was recommended by Agrolocalidad de Quito to complete the zoological health certificate procedures.
galo_vet@hotmail.com
---
Dr Galo Valverde foi indicação da Agrolocalidad de Quito para fazer os trâmites de certificado de saúde zoo sanitário. 
galo_vet@hotmail.com

name: Police Checkpoint
description:
Tried to ,get us‘ because of a scratch in our window-shield. After showing our TIP and a photo which proved, that we already had this scratch, when we crossed the boarder to Ecuador and explained, that the police was ok with the scratch there … and a bit more and more of discussion, they let us go after 15 Minutes or something. 

So just keep friendly, but stay confident :)

name: Las Cochas
description: Very quite and safe place, flat Parking. By a little pond, nice if you want to relax, spend a nigth and take a walk in the surroundings.

name: Peter's Deli
description: If you miss fantastic sausages and cheese - here you go. Peter is Polish and his cheesemaker is the third generation from Switzerland. Not cheap, but the prices are really worth it. Fantastic products (meat, sausages, cheese, bakery...) and very personable.

name: Spring Clean next to supermarket Gran Aki
description: Very good laundry service. 9$ for a really really big bag (all our laundry of 5weeks or something) Ready the same day. Good parking without hight districtions because it is the parking of the supermarket. Highly recommended!

name: chimborazo high camp
description: geodesic domes situated at ~ 5200m. beautiful viewpoint and magical sunset but super cold.

name: Yagui Urco
description: Amaizing sunset view! Nice, quite and safe place. Flat grassy parking. A lot of sites you can see sunset. Clean bathrooms, hot shower, wifi. A great place. Rolando and his wife, the owners are very friendly. Strongly recomended.

name: Oficina Agrolocalidad
description:
Pichincha District in the city center to collect the Zoosanitary Certificate documents after filling out the online forms. It is on the 18th floor. 
Requirements: https://www.gob.ec/arcfz/tramites/solicitud-certificado-zoosanitario-exportacion-animales-compania 
Form: https://www.agrocalidad.gob.ec/?page_id=41585
Contact: certificacion.zoosanitaria@agrocalidad.gob.ec
---
Distrito Pichincha no centro da cidade para retirar os documentos de Certificado Zoosanitario após o preenchimento dos formulários online. Fica no 18° andar. 
Requisitos:
https://www.gob.ec/arcfz/tramites/solicitud-certificado-zoosanitario-exportacion-animales-compania

Formulário:
https://www.agrocalidad.gob.ec/?page_id=41585

Contato:
certificacion.zoosanitaria@agrocalidad.gob.ec

name: Fabiano’s pizza
description: Great Big pizza or small/medium/familiar. One xl is ok for 4 people! Very good taste and quality.

name: Finca Saquifrancia
description:
Family farm dedicated mainly to the cultivation of cocoa and the production of products from it. They provide tours to learn about the cultivation and process, tasting and sale of products. Additionally, they have nice cabins to rent to tourists and they allowed us to park with our motorhome. Its owners are very friendly, 100% recommended place

Finca familiar dedicada principalmente al cultivo de cacao y elaboración de productos a partir del mismo. Brindan tours para conocer el cultivo y el proceso, degustacion y venta de productos. Adicionalmente cuentan con lindas cabañas para alquilar a turistas y nos permitieron estacionar con nuestro motorhome. Sus dueños son muy amables, lugar 100 % recomendable

name: hostal San fransisco
description: Nice hotel with restaurant and kitchen to use. Rooms at 15 $. Clean and profesional. Also parking available where you can put your rig. You can also wash your clothes.

name: Entrada gratis cascada y parqueo
description:
Desde este punto hay un camino que va a la cascada, no cobran parqueo ni entrada. Pero cuando llegas a la cascada te piden 50ctvs para acercarte debajo a la cascada. ridiculo :') ....

From here you can walk to the waterfall, parking for free. When you arrive up they ask you 50ctvs just to go near the waterfall (5meters) .. ridiculous for us :')...

name: Open space with nice view
description: Nice green area behind the monastery. Dog friendly, very quiet, nice view. We find-it better than the parking to overnight. We slept one night and felt very safe :)

name: Lubricadora Al Paso
description: Changed our oil and oil filter. Did not have to wait drove straight in. No size limit on car/truck/camper.

name: Hostal Romanza
description:
basic hotel with secured parking for cars and motorcycles. 
I paid 12 usd for a private room. 
rooms are clean and a nice bed.

name: Boulevard del Rio
description: Many restaurants sushi pizza hamburger and other. Order ehat you want and seat to eat. Super! Might Be Good food

name: Punanti Hostel
description:
Very good place to spend a few days relaxing/ or hiking. The parking place in front of the hostel is free for a night, and you can have access to hot a shower and toilets. There is also wifi and electricity. In exchange, it's nice to have breakfast/ dinner with them, Antoine, the owner, was a chef so it's excellent and generous (5$ breakfast, 5$ lunch, 8$ dinner).
Pets are allowed if they're nice (because Antoine already has 3 nice dogs). 
Antoine proposes some trekking or climbing activities if you want. It's a super nice place to acclimate to the altitude. 
He also proposed a shared bedroom (35$pp) and lodge. 
The access road is a bit steep and it's recommended to drive a 4*4

name: Galápagos frontier
description: Giant tortoise reserve and lava tunnels Galápagos frontier

name: Galapagos frontier
description:
Giant tortoise reserve and lava tunnels with an endemic forest and local birds.
reserva de tortugas gigantes y túneles de lava con un bosque endémico y aves de la zona .

name: El Zorrillo Hostel
description: Under construction Sept 23. We slept there in our tent. It has big windows looking out to the forest.  It is run by a lovely family. They may also let people camp on grass once finished, if you do I'd suggest buying a meal in the restaurant.

name: Zona de Estacionamientos
description:
In this area there are many parking lots that are perfect for leaving the vehicle and touring the historic center. This is an underground one with a maximum height of 3.2 m so tall vehicles can enter. But in the area, there are many others outside for taller vehicles.
.....
en esta zona hay muchos estacionamientos perfectos para dejar el vehículo y recorrer el centro histórico. este es uno subterráneo con 3,2 m de altura máxima así que vehículos altos entran. pero en la zona hay muchos al aire para más altura.

name: Between Cubilche and Imbabura
description:
We stayed here one night after we hiked Cubilche.
It‘s a flat spot next to the dirt road. Room for 2 vans with fine views into the valley and Cubilche.
Indigenous women taking their cattle up and down the road. Three/four cars passed by in the evening otherwise very quiet.
No cell reception.

name: Tours at hostel Pakay
description: If you are interested in doing any tours like Rafting, Kayaking, Hiking, Jungle-Adventures here you“ll find one of the best guides of the area, it’s Tony the owner of Hostal Pakay. He speaks spanish, english and german and he‘s one of the nicest guys we have met on our 2 year‘s journey. As we booked a tour with him, he offered us to stay overnight with our truck in front of his hostel free of charge and we could use the wifi and the bathrooms. You can reach him on WhatsApp: +1 970 9482667 (Tony and Erin). Also if you are looking for a nice place for the night where you feel like you already are in the jungle this hostel is really great! Everything highly recommended!

name: Gracie's Naturals
description: A store with affordable biodegradable items.  Washing-up liquid, toothpaste, detergent, etc. It's been a long time since there was a place where you could find something like that.  The owners are very friendly and helpful :) (big bottle of washing-up liquid 4.60$, big toothpaste 5$)

name: Chakra Andina
description:
Jaime and his family have 3 cabins on their property close to Chimborazo. Quiet and beautiful place
Breakfast is included 
Kind and sweet people, highly recommend

name: Beautiful Sidetrip through Amboto-River-Canyon
description:
Very beautiful road through a canyon to/from Chimbay Volcano. 

Sometimes a bit tight, but doable with any vehicle. Good asphalt. Really worth the views in this beautiful landscape! 

Enjoy :)

name: Ugly gravelpit with nice views
description: Gravelpit next to road with nice 180 degrees view over the valley. Asked neighbors if it was ok. Workers could arrive around 8:00… we left at 9:30 though and saw nobody. Take care driving up and off this spot. We hit our back side of our motorhome.

name: cascadas del aventurero
description: here is a nice place with a waterfall ..the owner are nice and a safety place where you can camp as well..really recommended

name: cascadas del aventurero
description:
here you can camp with any vehicle..all commodity as water ..WiFi bathroom..you can cook your own meals..even if you don't 
..they can make it for you the cost for a tent by day is 10 $ by tent even if you are 2 person's ..secure place and nice.. recommended

name: Hosteria Ojo de Agua, Loreto
description: Nice hotel where you can stay with your camper near a pond and a swimming pool. 7$/p.p.

name: Complejo deportivo Galo Miño
description: Flat spot between coliseo and soccer field. The complex is open to public, has voleibol,básquet, racquetball fields for free and toilet olso. Nice please and safe

name: Pelicanos Tours
description: We had an awesome tour today 2-2.5 hours whalewatching and a bit snorkeling at the island. The owner Fernando is very nice and easy guy, we enjoyed a lot! we were in a group of 8 people and paid 15pp (smaller group a bit more).

name: Mecanico Neris Yugsi
description:
Translation: I had to stop here due to a noise coming from the gearbox and took advantage of a general check. Luckily I did because I had a broken shock absorber, the rear wheel was out of alignment and the driveshaft was soft. Thanks to him I fixed everything and checked brakes and fluids for a total of $45 including spare parts. job done very well.

Tuve que detenerme aquí debido a un ruido proveniente de la caja de cambios y aproveché un cheque general. Afortunadamente lo hice porque tenía un amortiguador roto, la rueda trasera no estaba alineada y el cardan suave. Gracias a él arreglé todo y revisé frenos y líquidos por un total de $45 incluyendo repuestos. trabajo hecho muy bien. 

Naris Yugxi 0968537447

name: playa escondida
description: here are a new balneario.. with places for camping...even they are selling drinks and even meals..all commodity to pass the day .. possible to camp ..any vehicle can come here..the roads are easy gravel road from the main road...just following the path going down ..the entrance for now is 50 cents per person to pass the day..small cost to pass the night if wanted..nice place still orki'g slowly acomodating the place..

name: grifo de agua en primax
description:
Translation: This primax has a water tap to fill the tank. First we refueled and then we asked for water and they let us have no problem

esta primax tiene un grifo de agua para poder cargar el tanque. primero repostamos y luego pedimos cargar agua y nos dejaron sin problema

name: Acampar Glamping
description:
The signal coverage is 60% but they have WIFI access. Only for small vehicles, and the parking is free and very safe.
Información - 0983982350

name: Würstchen/ Butcher
description: Here you will find a very good sausage and meat display. Super clean

name: Campo de Naomi
description: Lovely place. River, swimming pool, traditional food and a tree house.

name: Ayawaska Atractivo Sacha Wasi
description: This is a beautiful jungle lodge, with affordable rooms and lots of space to camp. The owner, Camillo, takes great pride in hosting and will help you with whatever you need. They make great meals, and also offer ayahuasca ceremonies for an unbelievable $20, should you wish to try. The little lagoon on their property is frequented by anacondas and caimans, truly amazing!

name: Motriz Luis Romero
description:
Good and very cheap mechanic for many many things like breaks, standard stuff, AND electric!They also do air conditions. Very nice guy!

Ask for Luis Romero. If you want, you can also contact him in advance +593963746223

He also says, when something doesn‘t need to be done, which we found very sympathic.

name: agua en estación de servicio P&S
description:
water tap (drinking) at the service station, we were able to fill the tank without problem
----
grifo de agua (potable) en la estación de servicio, pudimos cargar el tanque sin problema

name: Las Palmas hostel
description: Possibly our favourite hostel in 10 months South America. Very nice outside areas with a pool, bar, couches and hammocks. Fully equipped kitchen. Space to store and work on bikes and motorbikes outside. Bigger rigs can probably just park in front on the street. The super friendly host Yeleni has 2 double rooms and a family room/dorm. The place invites to interact with other travelers and has a very chill vibe. We paid 22$ for 2. Super fast wifi and a washing machine too.

name: Down by the river
description: Nice spot, like many others in this area. Green grass, flat, river access. Reasonably out of view from the road. Only accessible by bike or motorbike.

name: Armed robberies
description: Armed robberies of tourists and locals reported during summer 2023. More details on the bikepacking.com route page for the Tembr and in the comments. Take care.

name: La Quiteñita
description: Really nice restaurant, very welcoming owners and great food. Especially truchas a la plancha y con salsa de maracuya. They also have a hostal and a minimarket. Recommended!

name: multiple cafe and restaurant
description: cafe and restaurants , tiendas. almurezos, desuyanos

name: Fiore Gelato
description: Amazing icecream. 2 kinds of sorbet. Good coffee too. Very nice surprise to find this outside of a tourist zone.

name: cafetería haycha
description:
The wifi in this cafeteria is really fast (I think the fastest we have found on our trip through South America) both up and down, if you need to work with the internet I think this is the best place to do it. bathrooms, there are many tables and some have a plug.
-----------
