el wifi de esta cafetería es realmente rápido (creo que el más rápido que hemos encontrado en nuestro viaje por Sudamérica) tanto de subida como de bajada , si necesitas trabajar con internet creo que este es el mejor lugar para hacerlo en baños, hay muchas mesas y algunas tienen enchufe.

name: P&S Porto Viejo
description: Could get potable water here with hose. Most gasstations have water.

name: El Rincon de George
description:
Great hotel, very welcoming, good advice, very clean, very well located. With a kitchen and fridge available. Unlimited fresh and hot water. Air-conditioned rooms. A roof terrace. Recommended
---------
Super hôtel, très accueillant, bons conseils, très propre, très bien placé. Avec une cuisine et frigo à disposition. De l’eau fraîche et chaude à volonté. Des chambres climatisées. Un toit terrasse. Recommanded

name: Vilcaroma coffee
description:
Superb visit to a coffee and fruit finca… the ruta del café. Superb welcome, tasting of lots of fruit, explanations about coffee, coffee tasting… great time: RECOMMENDED
-------
Superbe visite d’une finca café et fruits… la ruta del café. Superbe accueil, dégustation de beaucoup de fruits, explications sur le café, dégustation de café… super moment : RECOMMANDED

name: agua en la estación de servicio
description: pudimos cargar el tanque del agua en la estación de servicio sin necesidad de repostar. personal amable y muy buena presión de agua

name: 24hr Terpel
description: Just another gas station but alright for a stopover. Has bathrooms and a 24 hour convenience store

name: Ambato
description: This is the best location we could find in Ambato to sleep, we looked at the other park and it was not ok for us, too much exposed and in the street. This parking area is quieter and safe, and the park is nice to walk.

name: Bridge Washout
description: Been washed away for 4 months. Cannot cross. Had to go back to main road to get around.

name: EP3 Chip Tuning
description:
This is a place where you can get your DPF removed and your system reprogrammed. 

Fernando Gerente is the owner, a race driver and he knows all about tuning. Very friendly and helpful, speaks good English.

We arrived with our 2007 Sprinter, we had our DPF removed at another garage, but it was hard to find the right person for the computer stuff! First Fernando had problems as well, as his tools and software could not read our car. After contacting PRO Chips in Salta (he knows the guy there) he received the necessary information to successfully treat our Sprinter. 

The place is pretty packed with cars, but they will move them around if necessary. Any car should get in, it’s uphill and tight up there so maybe walk up before you drive in.

We paid USD 150, we could have let it tuned with more power and less full consumption for USD 400, but we didn’t. We can totally recommend this place.

Contact Fernando phone / WhatsApp 

+593 99 904 0363

name: Hagale Pues Adventure
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Place has not been verified by an overlander
We are a vacation home specialized in lodging.
We have:
6 rooms with capacity for 20 people.
Garage
2 mini-apartments with kitchen
2 Master bedrooms with private bathrooms
Community/Social Areas

Contamos con:
6 habitaciones con capacidad para 20 personas.
Garage
2 mini-departamentos con cocina
2 Dormitorios master con baños privados 
Areas comunitarias / Sociales
Estamos ubicados a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Baños en la parroquia Ulba.

name: Casa de Cambio
description: Money exchange. Today 17/03/2023 €1 = usd 1.03

name: Via Bombuscaro
description: Passing the bridge on the right, there is a large area to park. The river is next door and there are several businesses at the entrance to the parking lot.

name: Electrocardenas
description: Good electric mechanic for cars. Could get new lights and accessories, organized space

name: Clinica del Automovil / Check Engine
description:
I came here after asking in an other garage in Riobamba, where they told me they knew a very good mechanic. Daniel and Wilson did an amazing job, were very honest and professional! They had to get some parts from Guayaquil and Cuenca and everything arrived there in one day, included the direction which had been remanufactured in this time! Daniel invited us to eat with them, then even sleep in there house. I stayed one whole more day and went on a half-day tour with them to test the car and see nice places!
Very kind human beings, very professional, quick and fair prices. He can manage all kind of cars included the electronics. He knows everyone around town and can get you anything you need immediately.
If I had any other issue with my car in this region, I would come to his taller!

name: Estación de Servicio PS
description:
Water tap at PS service station. We were able to fill the water tank without any problem.
.....
grifo de agua en estación de servicio pys. pudimos cargar sin problema el tanque de agua

name: Balneario Las Orugas Yantzaza
description:
Las Orugas Spa. Free, with parking for up to 5 cars. Free Wifi.
---
Balneario las Orugas. Gratuito, con parking para umos 5 coches. Free Wifi.

name: Embarcadero Puerto Lopez
description:
A very good place for wild camping. The sea here is very calm, lots of fish. No facilities. We stayed here for 5 very peaceful days. 
---
Lugar muito bom para fazer um wild camping. O Mar aqui é bem calmo, muitos peixes. Sem facilidades. Ficamos aqui 5 dias bem tranquilos .

name: Colibri Tailor
description: If you need to sew something, the tailors here are magicans! We brought backpack, goretex clothes and some other more than used stuff, for 3 hours of work they only charged us 8$ and we had problems to find where the holes used to be!

name: Balneario de Pachicutza
description:
Balneario de Pachicutza. 
🇬🇧 Free clean swimming pool, two bar-restaurants across the street and 400 meters from the main square of the village.
Barbecue grills are available.
🇪🇸 Piscina limpia gratuita, hay dos bar- restaurante enfrente y a 400 metros de la plaza principal del pueblo. Hay parrillas para hacer barbacoas.

name: Waki waterfall
description: Waking waterfall. Beautiful place to rest, make a barbecue, etc.

name: Carolina and Gilda House
description:
Carolina and her daughter Gilda welcome travelers, you can sleep at their place if you have a motorhome and you can even ask if you can pitch a tent in their garden. You can also help them as a volunteer on their farm.

🇪🇸Carolina y su hija Gilda reciben viajeros, puedes dormir en la puerta de su casa si tienes motorhome e incluso puedes preguntar si puedes poner una tienda en su jardín. También puedes ayudarlas a modo de voluntariado en su finca.

name: Super cheap local supermarket/Tienda
description:
There is a small tienda which is well stocked.
It's cheaper than the big supermarket Coral which is in the near. 
The stuff super friendly and the prices are cheap. We like to buy our stuff here.

name: water tap in the border
description: we slept here and use the water in the tap it the side of the personal building white and blue

name: Finca Flor Anita
description:
We are the first overlanders so we had the privilege to camp for free .. Bathrooms and natural showers/pools are available! Its quiet at night even on Weekends but you will get woken up by a army of bitchy-dogs at 6 in the morning 

We didnt asked the people if they want to receive other overlanders but i think if you want to keep the place open for overlanders, you should provide some money before you leave ..

Beautiful place and nice people!

name: Hostal Inca Real
description: Pleasant and quiet hostel. Managed by caring people Maria and Victor. Clean room and comfortable mattress. Shared shower and WC. Cooking facilities available. Bike stored outside (can be covered with a tarp).

name: Pacheco Farmhouse
description:
Lovely place run by a Britishman. Wonderful nature site with 2 nice cabañas and some rooms in the main house. Everything is tasteful decorated. To relax you can find hammocks, swinging chairs or a sofa in the lounge. We were served an excellent dinner, different from the average Ecuadorian food. 
Safe parking in the gated yard for e.g. motorcycles.

name: La Esperanza
description:
Lovely place, on the way to Laguna Quinoloa. In the central square there are bathrooms, taps and sinks for community use. Simple but very welcoming village. They treated us super well. We recommend
------------
Lugar adorável, no caminho para a Laguna Quinoloa. Na Praça central há banheiros, torneiras e pias para uso comunitário. Povoado simples mas muito receptivo. Nos trataram super bem. Recomendamos

name: Scenic route to Santo Domingo/Coast
description: This is where a 81 km nicely paved offroad starts and takes you to the highway around 30km from Santo Domingo. It reminds the route Trampolin de la Muerte, steep terrain, beautoful mountains, many indigeous communities. I did the route in around 3h with stops on my motorcycle. This is the ancient route that indigeous people used to cross the mountain. Use maps.me for it! Refference pueblo for the midroute is Chiriboga. Several pullouts to camp, drove by 5 vehicles in this stretch of 81km.

name: hotel san andres
description:
Hotel on the Pan-American route. in the town of San Andres. We stayed 1 night in the parking lot. with access to wifi and bathroom. for the price of 5 usd per car. The central park is 1 block away and I was able to walk quietly with my dogs. The parking gate closes at 11:00pm. It is a good place to spend the night and get to know a little about this beautiful town.
---------
Hotel en la ruta panamericana. en el pueblo de san andres. estuvimos 1 noche en el parking. con acceso a wifi y baño. por el precio de 5 usd por carro. el parque central queda a 1 cuadra y pude caminar tranquilamente con mis perros. la reja del parking cierra a las 11:00pm. es un buen lugar para pasar la noche y conocer un poco de este bello pueblo.

name: Ministerio Salud parking
description:
🇬🇧 Large free parking in front of the Ministry of Public Health. At 300 meters from the famous stairs of Cuenca. Free, large and clean restrooms are located 100 meters away in the park.
🇪🇸 Gran parking gratuito frente al Ministerio Salud Publica. A 300 metros famosas escalinatas de Cuenca. A 100 metros en el parque hay baños gratuitos, grandes y limpios.

name: Expressoil Servicios Automotrices Cumbaya
description: It's a little but completely mechanic, it's located in Lumbisi. Camilo Yepez, the owner has a lot of experience with overlander vehicles like Toyota Land Cruiser, Land Rover. Another kind of services are Expressoil sell camping and overland accessories, off road accessories.

name: Estrada inclinada  - Road very slanted
description:
We couldn't get past this point with our motorhome (Sprinter 515). Road very slanted and with holes. There is a small parking lot on the curve a few feet above. Light cars and tourist vans passed.

Não conseguimos passar deste ponto com o nosso motorhome (sprinter 515). Estrada muito inclinada e com buracos. Há um pequeno estacionamento na curva poucos metros acima. Carros leves e vans de turismo passaram.

name: gas station Terpel
description: we slept here one night, we asked before and they let us stay, very nice gas station, lots of green in the back, clean toilets, cold shower available.

name: EXPORTADORA K.DORFZAUN Panama Hat Shop
description: At the recommendation of another traveller, we stopped here for an affordable Panama Hat.  The fine weave hat was around 50 USD and the less fine were around 25 USD, but still pretty good for a very nice hat.  The young lady was very helpful and spoke English.  It was a fun experience!

name: Free camping area of the natural park
description: Free camping area authorized of the natural park with space of bbq, toilet and water. Table under open shelters. Possible to go by bicycle

name: Dumplings & Noodles
description: Taiwanese oriented vegetarian restaurant that serves, Dumpling, stirfried noodles, noodle soup,  and wok dishes.   prices are around 8 dollar per dish

name: parqueadero de las ruinas Ingapirca
description: parking in front of the entrance of the ruins. you can also camp with a tent. facilities available (toilets) and security guards.

name: Andes Alpes Café - Cotopaxi Travel
description:
Very nice café/restaurant/hostal/travel agency for mountain tours in El Chaupi. 
I could stay on the parking lot using all facilities (shower, toilet, common room) for 5$. I had dinner for 4.50$ as well as coffee in the morning for 1$.
He gave me a lot of good advice for the Iliniza Norte without a guide and offers a lot of mountain tours in Ecuador with high quality guides and material! 100% recommended!

name: MECANICAKASA
description:
Multi-brand workshop. He checked us for an oil leak from our transfer. Content price.
Taller multimarca. Nos revisó una fuga de aceite de nuestra transfer. Precio contenido.

name: Laundry autoservicio
description:
self-service laundry (you can also leave your clothes and they will take care of it). It has many machines for both washing and drying and of many sizes, there is one that is huge!!! It's really great, all industrial machines that leave clothes clean. you can stay there waiting, there are chairs and wifi
lavandería autoservicio (también puedes dejar la ropa y ellos se encargan). tiene muchas máquinas tanto para lavar como para secar y de muchos tamaños, hay una que es enooooorme!!! la verdad que genial, todo máquinas industriales que dejan la ropa limpia. puedes quedarte allí esperando, hay sillas y wifi

name: Biker Zone
description: Great small shop with decent selection of accessories. Capable of manufacturing and repair (crash bars, pannier racks, light protectors, etc.)

name: Royal Enfield Dealer
description: Small RE dealer and small service shop. If you want tires/tubes, you will need to go to a tire shop (there are literally dozens of them around the city.

name: TEMBR Gate Cyclists
description:
On the end of this road is a gate for TEMBR cyclist, just climb it and ask at the house next. They have the key.

Alternative: difficult road to Camping next to river

name: Hospedería comunitaria Doña Evita
description:
Located along Panamericana a decent hotel owned by wonderful and peaceful Doña Evita. I spent night here and since it seems there is no shops around she gave me water and prepared a big dinner (bandeja). I paid 18 USD for a room which is spacious (easily can keep bike inside), shower with cold water, but there is no Internet (having Claro sim card, I had no Internet neither).

I recommend this place and Doña Evita as a host is very nice person.

name: Hostal Casa Campesina
description:
This is a Nice house of the community where you can stay to sleep in dorm bed or private room. The beds are good and with enough blankets ! there is also a Hot shower. The amenities are simple but there is everything you could need.
They can also cook the meals (maybe better         if you ask before).
We went there while we were backpacking but we asked if it would be okay to come with a car or camper and park on front of the house and there is no problem !

Luz is the woman who take care of the house, she is very kind and she answers all the questions you could have, it would worth it staying a few days to know and understand better their way of life. 

We highly recommend even if it's only for one night. 

Arriving in the pueblo you can ask for "La casa campesina".

we don't remember the prices but it was very low. 

Here are the number of Roberto (luz's son who is in charge of the reservations) +593980650560
and Luz's number : +593994983609

name: Rio Hospital
description: Private hospital with general doctors but also specialists. First consultation is 20$. Emergency are 24/24 open. You don't need an appointment, but in case you need to contact them - +593 99 539 3648

name: Beach
description: Nice place and quiet, we buy some fish and cook it right here. we did not slept here ,but seems safe :)

name: masgas aguarico
description:
We stayed one night while we bought insurance to enter Colombia. The girls are very friendly.
_______________________

Nos quedamos una noche mientras comprábamos el seguro para entrar a Colombia. Las chicas son muy amables.

name: Dulces y helados (with crazy flavours)
description: This shop has some of the craziest helados in south America. made out of juice and always comes with a small pot of juice to dip the ice cream in. Most of them are very acidic and the dip can be quite salty if you don't ask for the contrary. I love them! if you've been enjoying micheladas and the salty and acidic food found elsewhere between Pasto and Quenca give this a try

name: La quinta Luna
description: cheap and nice hotel. they have a big parking lot and the cost of a room with a/c is just 6$.

name: Sweet Place - Cafe
description:
Nice little cafe shop with very good pastry and cakes and salty pies (empanada). They also have a coffee machine and good Expresso and Cappuccino.
They have open 7 days a week.

Try the chocolate croissant. Lot of „Nutella“ inside.

name: Potable water at Masgas gas station
description: Potable water at a tap at this gas station

name: ASED Laboratorio Diesel
description: Very professional guys. The owner David is very kind. We checked all injectors and compression, changed oil. I am sure they can help with a lot of things. We could stay over night! Totally recommended! They have clean floor, fits trucks and even use torque wrench :-) 👍🚒💨

name: Street parking
description: Parking on the street 100 meters from the sea, in front of a house under construction.

name: Biker Zone
description: Small motorcycle parts and service shop. They have a good selection of panniers, both new and used, as well as auxiliary lights and communication devices. I've had mixed results when I asked them to do custom work and they really botched a tube to tubeless conversion of my rims.

name: Wi-Fi and free use of computer and printer
description: a place with many computers which you can use for free, they also have printers and wifi!! the computers are good enough!!!

name: Placita Principal
description:
If you get off from Quilotoa and going to Cotopaxi, this is a good alternate route. I had to wait in this place and ended up spending one night. Very quiet. Nice view of Cotopaxi
....
Si bajas de Quilotoa y vas para Cotopaxi, esta es una buena ruta alterna. Me tocó esperar en este lugar y terminé pasando una noche. Muy tranquila. Es un lugar de paso unicamente. Bonita vista del Cotopaxi

name: Lavandería sol y espuma
description:
Lavandería, te cobran $0.45USD por libra de ropa, se entrega seca y tarda aproximadamente 3 horas en entregar. Horario de atención 9:00am a 5:00pm 
También tienen servicio a domicilio, este es el número +593 98 089 7488 


Laundry, they charge you $0.45USD per pound of clothes, it is delivered dry and takes approximately 3 hours to deliver. hours 9:00am to 5:00pm
They also have home delivery, this is the number +593 98 089 7488

name: RESIDENCIAL PARAISO
description:
Translation: Residencial Paraíso located in the town of Macará Ecuador right on the border with Peru, $6 pp per night in a single room, single bed, shared bathroom, warm water shower, Wi-Fi, excellent for bicycle travelers, right in front of the ATM, Bank from Loja.

Residencial Paraíso ubicado en el pueblo de Macará Ecuador justo en la frontera con Perú, $6 pp por noche en habitación simple, cama 1 plaza, baño compartido, ducha agua tibia, wiffi, excelente para viajeros de bicicleta, justo frente al cajero automático, Banco de Loja.

name: Quinta Elsa del Carmen
description:
Rural property with cabins and swimming pool that allows the arrival of motorhomes and space for camping. There is also a restaurant
Quinta rural con cabañas y piscina qué permiten llegada de motorhomes y espacio para acampar. Hay además un restaurante

name: Parque a la Madre de Santa Ana
description:
Parque a la Madre de Santa Ana, better and quieter than sleeping in Torrevieja on the way to the mountains from Manta. Park has free wifi 

Parque a la Madre de Santa Ana, mejor y más tranquilo que dormir en Torrevieja de camino a la sierra desde Manta. Wifi gratuito en el parque.

name: BIKECENTER
description: Bikecenter, technical service for your bike in Loja, attended by cyclist, Jorge Ramón +593 98 022 2312

name: BIKECENTER
description: if you need stay in Loja in your bicycle trip, in bikecenter you can find a place for camp or find information, also you can repair your bicycle or find a good food in the restorant.

name: Chifa Guaranda Chinese Restaurant
description:
Fantastic Chinese Restaurant, actually served by Asian speaking Spanish....kinda fun.

Good food and not expensive.
Enjoy

name: Main square
description: we spend one night in front of church. there's was a noisy night because a two places near to square with loud music until 2 or 3 am. was Saturday night. late of that was calm. the wifi of square not working. used from Bazar just for 30 min.

name: Hostal Ñukanchik Sara Allpa
description: Private room with bathroom. $9 pp per night, tv cable, wifi. 16 USD for 2 beds room.

name: Shelter for cyclists
description:
Shelter for cyclists in La Paz, ask for availability to Don Osvaldo Godoy in the Vulcanizadora, +59391296180
--
Refugio para ciclistas en La Paz, preguntar por disponibilidad a Don Osvaldo Godoy en la Vulcanizadora, +59391296180

name: CENTRO AUTOMOTRIZ SAN VICENTE
description: Very friendly and helpful mechanics.  They tried very hard and were successful.  We had to change the fuel filter on a Toyota Diesel and some other stuff. I can highly recommend this auto repair shop.

name: El Malecón
description:
🇪🇸Parking en la calle, frente a la entrada de la posada El Pigual junto al río.
🇬🇧 Parking on the street, in front of the entrance to the El Pigual inn next to the river.

name: Luis Tipan Travel... updated
description:
This is a more up-to-date on this travel agent. Agent is called Louis Tipan Travel.

I purchase a 4 day cruise for $1,000.00. I need to pay extra for the airfare.

Steve

name: estación de servicio
description:
dormimos aquí tres noches (solo veníamos a dormir) . es una estación de servicio mediana , mucho ruido de camiones y de la carretera pero por lo menos es seguro. 
..
We slept here three nights (we only came to sleep).  It is a medium-sized service station, a lot of noise from trucks and the road but at least it is safe.

name: agua en estación de servicio
description:
We were able to load water without problem at this service station

pudimos cargar agua sin problema en esta estación de servicio

name: Willka
description: Nice hostería , flat parking, big rigs, you can park by the river, fishing, very clean bathrooms, Belén is very friendly. You have a water fall 30 min walking, very paceful and relaxing. WhatsApp +593988164788

name: Valle Verde
description: Nice place, wonderful views, flat parking, big rigs. Clean bathrooms, hot shower. Service is outstanding, they recieve you with a jug of hot naranjilla juice wich you can add sugar cane alcohol. They bring tortillas too. $5ppn jug of juice and tortillas included. Did not like that they ask $5pp to go to a 100m path !

name: Ivagatours
description:
Classic Baños tour operator, offering rafting, canyoning, ziplining, jungle tours, hiking etc
We went canyoning with them and I tell you, it was great! They have 3 canyoning options, varying in difficulty and price and we went for the toughest one (all beginner friendly!). It was just us two and two guides - so no waiting in line for the rest of the group to take their turn. They make pics and videos for you with the GoPro. All pro equipment, thick wetsuits and a lot of fun! We alternated between waterfall rappels, jumps (the highest is from a 8m cliff), slides and waterfall swimming. Recommended 
Btw viator price is 90$, on their website it says 80$ and we got 75$ without haggling. The cheaper options are 35/45$ I think and are shorter ofc, in different places

name: hermanos Galarza pesca deportiva
description: beutiful place to camping and camper. White riber, restaurant, wifi. in the midre ofrece the Rain forest. a place bery beutiful restaurant wifi

name: Estacion de servicio
description:
Translation: We asked the beachgoers if we could spend the night and with the purchase of a meal at the Chinese restaurant, we obtained the wifi password. It is located in a good place and close to a mall and businesses nearby.

Consultamos a los playeros si podiamos pasar la noche y con la compra de una comida en el resto Chino, obtuvimos la clave del wifi. Esta ubicado en un buen lugar y cerca de un mall y negocios cerca.

name: Transport Police Checkpoint
description: There is a police checkpoint around 500m north of this gps location. They stopped us to see TIP, drivers licence and ownership documents. All very civil and fast.

name: Hostal El Náufrago.
description:
Good place with comfortable beds. The owner is friendly and shows you places of interest in Manta. It has parking for motorcycles inside the hostel. Nearby there are stores, restaurants. It cost me $18 dollars for a single room. 

Buen lugar con camas cómodas. El dueño es amable y te enseña lugsres de interes en Manta. Tiene parqueadero para motos dentro del hostel. Cerca hay tiendas, restaurantes. Me costó $18 dólares una habitación individual.

name: Cojitambo CECAMP
description:
Beautiful small place right under the rocks, made with love! Clean bathroom, no shower. Slept in my car for 5 US. Two rooms with doble beds and showers and two rooms to eat inside. Cafe-bar, laundry and restaurant. Last 40 meters small rough road, but no 4/4 necessary. Not accesible for big rigs, because of the entrance turn. 
Nice look over the valley/town.

name: Bivouac
description: Good wild camping. Protected from the wind. Beautiful seen on the mountains

name: Masgas
description:
Gas station allowed us to spend the night for free.
---
Estación de servicio nos permitieron pasar la noche gratis.

name: Veronica House
description: This is a private property informal camp site in a security area on the road that leads to the airport and will soon have a restaurant and other services. $5 night per vehicle. Recommended place, quiet area.

name: Balneario público
description:
🇪🇸 Gran área plana para aparcar junto al río. El río limpio está muy bien para tomarse unos buenos baños.
🇬🇧 Large flat area to park next to the river. The clean river is very good for taking a good bath.

name: Tatuy
description: Super nice restaurant!! Nice vibes, good food, the cake of chocolate is amazing!! Worth the price:) They cook very good and they are good artists! Don't miss it :) Good wifi

name: Sani Lodge Office
description: At this location is the office of the Sani Lodge. If you have a tour with them (which we booked online through the agent greengotravel.com) then you can store your vehicle on their ground which is fenced and gated. There is a toilet, water tap and electricity available. You can also stay overnight in your campervan here.

name: Adriana Check Point
description: Friendly officer asked for import papers for our van and motorcycle.

name: DPF fix and computer diagnosis for all kind of vehicles
description:
We had a problem with our DPF and were referred to this place by another local. 
The owner offered to remove the dpf and reprogram the motor management. 
The shop looks very professional and the mechanics were caring a lot. We are very happy with the result. WhatsApp: +593 99 023 6045

name: PLAYA OLON
description: A very quiet and family-friendly beach (they had told us that other travelers were removed by the community itself, we spent 2 nights and they didn't tell us anything, they were very kind to us

name: Motel (tu y yo)
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Use with caution, most likely love motel

We're travelling by bicycle. Surprise location. We thought we were in a love hotel because of the many mirrors on the side and above the bed. Clean place. Hot shower. The room is directly linked to a private garage for cars.

name: Street parking
description:
Parking on the street in a quiet neighborhood a few meters from a police station. A taxi to the old town from here costs approximately $3 and arrives in 5 minutes.
--
Parking en la calle en un barrio tranquilo a pocos metros de una central de policía. Un taxi al casco antiguo desde aquí cuesta aproximadamente 3 dólares y llegas en 5 minutos.

name: Autolider Mercedes
description: Official Mercedes dealer and service garage. Have specialists for Sprinter.

name: Gilosmar
description: Restaurants, cafeteria and small supermarket. Very good and copious.

name: Panaderia y Pasteleria Santa Teresita
description: Bakery, bread and pastry. Bottle of water and soda.

name: Camping Rio Blanco
description: Wonderful camping and cabañas at the waterfall. A few kilometers from the main road. Toilets, showers. Kitchen and tables under a large roof. Everything clean and well maintained. And then the rainforest....incredible! US 10.--.

name: 4 small brick rooms
description: ideal wildcamp for cyclists. of the 4 small rooms 1 was filthy but rest at a pinch ok. just need it to be breezy to keep the flesh eating flies at bay or have a small fire!

name: Studio flat
description: paid $30 a night, super sized studio flat. kitchen. washing machine and place to dry on roof. HOT water. very comfortable bed. Desk to work at and superfast wifi. supermarket etc 2 mins away. just off komoot route into Ibarra. Garage below building and stunning nighttime views.  very quiet.

name: Vulcanizadora y Lubricadora Los Ángeles
description:
He helped us repair our wheel and checked the rest! Help travellers!

Nos ayudo a reparar nuestra rueda y chequeo el resto ! Ayuda viajeros !

name: Zumba Bus Terminal
description: You can sleep in the bus terminal. Lots of cyclists to stay here. Upstairs it's quiet. There is a very friendly security the whole night. Very quiet night. Electricity, toilets, water. If somebody is there, you can ask at the closeby soccer stadium to use the cold shower. Lots of space to park outside.

name: On the street in front of the central square
description:
🇬🇧 On the street in front of the central square of San José de Minas. Quiet at night.
🇪🇸 En la calle frente a la plaza central de San José de Minas. Tranquilo por la noche.

name: Hotel cabañas arcoiris 🌈 +590991154466
description:
good place to spend the night
parking lot and 30 meters from the beach,
the owner is very friendly Ivan Giler,
from 12$us per person
They make cooking easier for food preparation.
---
buen lugar para pasar la noche 
parqueadero y a 30 metros de la playa,
el dueño es muy amable Ivan Giler,
desde 12$us por persona
facilitan la cocina para la preparación de los alimentos.

name: Finca San Alejandro
description: we treated ourselves tonight. $30 bed and breakfast.  super hot showers, cabin type rooms so super easy access with our cycles. massive grassed courtyard.  restaurant and bar.  Simple menu, hamburgers, but im not a big meat eater so they made me a fantastic salad. As its approaching Christmas the owners family came to see all the decorations and have a few celebrations.  we were welcomed. The word tranquillo describes here perfectly. Its on a quiet street on the edge of this small town. Great WiFi.  100% recommended.

name: Casa de Diego
description:
🇪🇸Diego, pintor y escultor recibe viajeros , mejor llamar y coordinar x whatsapp +593 99-489-4936
🇬🇧 Diego, painter and sculptor receives travelers, it is better to call and coordinate by whatsapp +593 99-489-4936

name: Mercado El Angel
description: Here is a nice market every monday, farmers from surrounding villages come here to sell fruits and vegetables.

name: Movistar SIM Card
description:
Got a Movistar SIM Card here, its in the Mall. 

6$ for 2 GB 
16$ for 6 GB.

name: Club de Clases y Policia
description: We are on a bike trip. The police club provides rooms in their provincial houses. $24 for the double room. Possible to put the bikes in the living room. Perfect for families. Large common area. Large kitchen with the bare minimum for cooking (with a fridge). The person who manages the place is Mirian Valdiviez +593 (0) 997176476

name: Hotel Sol y Luna
description:
Couple of minutes from Equator museum. security here with locked  entrance to courtyard.  paid $31 for 2 of us. very comfortable bed.
 cold shower but I think that was because we couldn't work it! secure room for cycles too. Great pizza place opposite! very quiet at night too.

name: Parking in playground and skatepark Salcedo
description:
It is a free parking lot in front of a family park, we stayed one night, very quiet, in front of a school and there is a security camera.

Es un estacionamiento gratis frente a un parque familiar, estuvimos una noche, muy tranquilo, frente a una escuela y hay cámara de seguridad.

name: P&S fuel station
description:
Free shower, cold water, they keep them closed because they say there are people who have done damage, you just have to ask the guys who deliver gasoline and they will open it for you without a problem.

Ducha gratis, agua fría, las mantienen cerradas porque cuentan que hay personas que han hecho daños, solo hay que preguntar a los chicos que despachan gasolina y ellos te abrirán sin problema.

name: transtar - parts
description:
parts shop - I found here Breaks and cylinder for my Chevrolet express.
you may find here parts for your American car

name: Hostal Chimenea
description: A really nice family run hostal in Baños. Very friendly & helpful people who run this place. $8.50 for a 4 beds dorm with its own bathroom. $17 for private  single room. $20 for private double. You can book via Booking.com. Super clean room & smell nice. Room & beds are clean everyday. Fresh towel changed daily. The hostal has a swimming pool & really cool roof top kitchen + dining room where u can see a beautiful waterfall. Breakfast provided for a fee. Location is great, close to center but quiet. Next to La Virgen thermal bath. Parking is ample for 4 cars. No problem for motorcycles. The road to the hostal is flat if you enter from Thomas Halflants Street. Don't enter from Ambato Street (if coming from Quito). Its super steep.

name: Camping Bellavista, Santo Domingo
description:
It is a magical place, full of nature, close to the road and the city, it welcomes campers, motorcyclists, motorcycles, bicycles and backpackers. It has private and shared rooms, a tree house and a pool. It has internet on the property, but not on the sites.
Bathroom, shower, water and electricity
--
Es un lugar mágico, lleno de naturaleza, cercano a la carretera y a la ciudad, recibe campistas, rodanteros, motos, bicicletas y mochileros. Tiene habitaciones privadas y compartidas, casa en el árbol y piscina Tiene iternet en la propiedad, pero no en los sitios. 
Baño, ducha, agua y electricidad

name: Parque lineal
description:
If you are passing through Paute, be sure to come. this park that has enough space to park. There is a lot of greenery and although at night some places play music, it is usually a quiet and safe place. There is a tap further ahead where you can drink water, it is located next to the bay where the cars park. There are bathrooms but when we were there they were closed.
--------
Si estás de paso por Paute no dejes de venir. este parque que tiene espacio suficiente para parquear. Hay mucho verde y aunque en la noche algunos locales ponen música suele ser un lugar tranquilo y seguro. Hay una llave más adelante de la que puedes tomar agua, está ubicada al lado de la bahía donde parquean los carros. Hay baños pero cuando estuvimos estaban cerrados.

name: in front of universidad de Otavalo
description:
We spent 3 nights here in front of the University of Otavalo. The first night we spoke to the security guard and he told us ok. There is a boulevard with beautiful grass and palm trees, it is very quiet at night and it is very close to the center. A few blocks away is a P&S gas station with restrooms and free WiFi.
----
Pasamos 3 noches aquí frente a la universidad de Otavalo. La primera noche hablamos con el guardia de seguridad y nos dijo que ok. Hay un boulevard con hermoso pasto y palmeras, es muy tranquilo por la noche y es muy cerca del centro. A pocas cuadras hay una gasolinera P&S con baños y WiFi gratis.

name: Las empanadas de Majavé
description:
best empanadas we had on our journey. 50 cents each. The tortillas de platano (with cheese) are delicious too.

the couple selling the empanadas is lovely and very kind :)

we'll be back!

Open Wednesday - Sunday 5pm-9pm

name: Shelter (for bicyclists)
description: We are bicycle travelers. Shelter on one side of a field of sport. The shelter is a building under construction. The walls and the roof are finished. Clean. Without wind and rain. Next to a busy road. We asked the neighborhood if the place was quiet and the permission. Rest: no problem

name: Bomberos Nabon  (bicyclists)
description: We are on a bicycle trip. Super nice. They have a tent space on their vowel field, protected from the street. WC and shower available

name: Chaperón Lodging
description: Nice new hotel that has rooms on both sides of the street.  Free parking, hot water, good wi-fi, generally quiet and close to everything in town.  I paid $20 for a single room and I bought breakfast at their restaurant for $4.

name: Hostal Guayllabamba
description:
Hotel with big rooms, okay but nothing special. They have a big parking lot and decent WiFi.

It took me a bit of convincing that I wanted to pay the Booking.com price of 15 dollars instead of the normal price of 20 dollars. Both prices are way higher then I usually pay for accommodation.

I could park my bicycle in the room.

They pointed out they had an inside restaurant for breakfast and diner. I didn’t use it in the evening and in the morning it was closed although it supposed to be open at that time.

name: Parking Coliseo Atuntaqui
description:
We stayed here to do the pet paperwork at Agrocalidad and it turned out to be a good place to spend the night, it is a parking lot for the sports coliseum, in the afternoon families go to play sports and they are not extremely noisy, very quiet at night.  Close to all types of commerce, market, plaza and veterinary (20 dollars for a health certificate).

Nos quedamos aqui para hacer el trámite de mascotas en Agrocalidad y resultó ser buen lugar para pernoctar, es estacionamiento para el coliseo deportivo, por la tarde familias van a hacer deporte y no son extremadamente ruidosos, muy tranquilo durante la noche. Cercano a todo tipo de comercio, mercado, plaza y veterinaria (20 dólares el certificado de salud).

name: Small river beach (no vehicular access)
description:
We're in a bicycle. Relatively flat terrain for the tent. Hidden from the road. The elevated location of the river, but with access by a small beach.

The place is accessible by bike, motorbike and on foot from the road nearby.

name: Café Austria
description: Austrian/European coffee house culture. Good coffee, traditional austrian cakes and dishes. Nice atmosphere, friendly stuff, some newspaper (also german). You can play chess.

name: Botica Central
description: The only farmacy in town that sells 96% industrial alcohol.

name: Municipalidad Zhud (hot shower!)
description:
Cyclists: You can sleep in the Salon de uso Multiple in the municipality building behind the police station. It's a big room with light, electric plugs, water, toilets and an electric shower (you have to switch on the main light in the main room to have electricity for the light and shower in the bathroom!). The door is always open. If somebody is in the offices upstairs next door, you can ask to stay, but it seems totaly ok, to stay even if nobody is here.
Around eight p.m. a few workers who stay in a house nearby came to brush their teeth, use the toilet or take a shower. They were very friendly and just sayed hello. They also came pretty early in the morning and had to switch on the light to use the bathroom, but they were silent, I kept sleeping.
Save and quiet spot, you even have the police station in front. Lot's of big shops and restaurants. No Claro signal but down at the big roadcrossing and also behind the building you have free wifi.

name: Chifa Chinese Restaurant
description: Great value food. super hot, generous portions, we're cycle touring so we can eat, but a medium portion was plenty. mains $5 to $6 . fab jugo natural $1. Quiet when we arrived but locals collecting takeaways, always a good sign. Friendly staff, a great little restaurant!

name: SILANCHE QUINTAS VACACIONALES
description: We stay here for one week, is a amazing place for rest, work and connection with nature, pay $14per night and booking in AirBnB, have a big space for relaxing and share, one doble bed room with bathroom and hot shower, a big living to be connected wiffi and enjoy the view, the second floor have four simple bed with bathroom and nice view. absolutely recommended if you travel many months on a bicycle, motorbike, truck or campervan.

name: Landrover José-Luis
description:
Very competent and honest Landrover mechanic. He drives a Landrover himself.  
+593 99 583 7520
We highly recommend!

name: centro comunitario dos mangas
description: here are the starting place with a information touristic place and guide to go to the waterfall and pozos..cost 5$ to go by yourself..12.5$ if you take a guide...the path from here are almost 4.30hour walk to the waterfall dos mangas..are other paths almost same time go and back ..here are restaurant to by also what you need for the trek

name: cascadas dos mangas
description: small river arounded by nature birds..nice to si a walk..you can come also by horses if you want ..no really a big waterfall just only maybe 2 meters high..but nice to have a bath..clean water

name: Don Cosme Hospedaje
description:
Very nice place for enjoy nature and panoramic view in San Vicente de Pusir, $10usd pppn, 6 matrimonial bed in a private room with private bathroom and hot shower and clean water. 2 private room with 2 separate bed, private bathroom, hot electrical shower, electricity, available kitchen, fire place and grill, frutal trees with aguacate, mango and citrus. 
You can enjoy Angel River and Chota River.
Cosme owner very kind +593989463153

name: Parking Estacionamiento
description:
This parking lot is on the right before the bridge(from Puyo to Baños).  It has big space.  We felt safe and the host Javier welcomed us very well.
  We arrived during the day, took a trail to the waterfall and at night we took another trail, just after the bridge and came back and slept in the same place. We paid $3 for the camper.

  Tip: try the Mercedes empanadas (leave the parking lot, turn left and it's on the same street on the left).

name: Access road to Bosque Polylepis
description: This is the access road to the Bosque. Right now the first 10 meters are severely washed out, only 4x4 can make it in and out. There are plenty of places where you can stay overnight along this road.

name: TecniOcaña
description:
We changed the oil and filters on our Ford Transit. We had the fried ones so we only needed the oil and labor. Everyone was very friendly and maintenance was super fast. We recommend it.
.
Hicimos el cambio de aceite y filtros en nuestra Ford Transit. Nosotros teníamos los fritos así que solo necesitábamos el aceite y mano de obra.

Todos fueron muy amables y el mantenimiento fue super rápido. Lo recomendamos.
.

name: A bus shelter
description: Bus shelter. Public water tap available. They're big enough for a dozen people.

name: TerreMotos
description:
Best Motercycle shop we have found in South America.  We showed up with a KLR650 that was not charging the battery.  After diagnosing the problem, Jose Drove 4 hours round trip to get the part and returned well after dark. The next day, he and his employee fixed the bike on a holiday weekend. Super nice, super knowledgeable, fantastic service.  
Whatsapp  999859999

name: Panaderia y arte “El Hortelano”
description:
The cutest art cafe/panaderia. Pretty art, books and the most delicious bread we have had in South America in the last year travelling. We are Dutch so we know when to appreciate good bread. The owners are very nice people and make their bread in their so called micro panaderia where you can see the bread bake in the oven. 

They also have coffee that you can enjoy in the lovely corner with tables and books. 

They just got started and are sold out quickly. They do make bread all day but you have the most chance to find something of your choice if you come at opening at 9AM. Or text (0967473609) them to have something made and collect. 

Coffee $1 for two people
Croissant $.75 each
Roll de Canela $1 each 
The larger full breads are a little more expensive but very much worth it. They have all kinds; pumpkin, integral, coconut, avena, etc. 
They expect to make pizzas too soon. 

@elhortelanopan

name: Blue house hostel
description:
Nice place to stay for a couple of days. Nice outside covered comunal area. Comunal kitchen. Nice vibes with the other guests.

Dorm from 8 dollars, if you book through booking it might be cheaper. The 4 person dorm, with big beds is very comfortable.

Very bicycle and motorcycle friendly. You can place them safely under the roof, enough space to do some maintenance or dry out your tent.

The downside is that there are only 3 bathrooms including only 2 showers. Which is not sufficient if there are a lot of guests. But if you plan your shower outside rush hour it is doable.

Street parking is available, although I would not park a loaded car for a long time over here.

name: Parking hospital
description:
(Español abajo)
Parking at the rear of the hospital. You enter from the back, suitable for large vehicles (ours is 7 x 2 meters). It is advisable to arrive after 8 pm, before it is usually busy with hospital staff, but there is no problem with parking as it is not closed. There are cameras. We have been there for a week and no problems, even during the holidays. In the area all streets have metered parking, not here. Very close to the historic center (3 blocks from the steps).
---
Estacionamiento en la parte trasera del hospital. Se ingresa por la parte de atrás, apto para vehículos grandes (el nuestro tiene 7 x 2 metros). Es recomendable llegar después de las 20 hs, antes suele estar ocupado con el personal del hospital, pero no hay problema con estacionar ya q no es cerrado. Hay camaras. Hemos estado una semana y ningun problema, incluso en fiestas. En la zona todas las calles tienen estacionamiento medido, aquí no. Muy cerca del centro historico (3 cuadras de las escalinatas).

name: Puerto de Montaña
description: Is a place to be camping o rent a room, nice views, have a pool and BBQ grill. Please contact before you're arrive

name: Moto Mike
description: Miguel runs a small moto repair shop just outside Loja.  I was referred to him and he has done a great job diagnosing some intermittent issues with my motorcycle.   He also works on big bikes like BMWs, KTMs, etc. I had to leave my moto overnight and I left all my gear and extra things here and everything was safe. I would highly recommend him.

name: 2nd Valley Overlook
description: we planned to stop at the 1st Valley overlook, which was fantastic,  and very private but it was raining and thick mist. 10 mins later the sun came out and spotted this place. Not as private, but there is a lower level. cows clearly graze here but none at the mo. slept fine, some road noise, no dogs tho! also just nearby is a sports field with a building, local may let you sleep there. we got wifi reception.

name: Hostel vista Linda (aka vista Hermosa)
description:
The hotel has the name Vista Linda on google and Vista Hermosa on the signs, but it is the same hotel.

Price is 10 dollars a person. Simple rooms with warm shower. 

I could put my bicycle inside, but there was a place upstairs with a roof as well where you can park it.

Private parking on the premises.

name: Camping ‘camping spot’
description:
I didn’t stay here, but I passed it. I didn’t ask about the price.

There is a Gazebo within picnic tables, you could ask to tent camp there te be out of the rain.

name: Ruins, nice views, close to water
description:
Nice place te camp, under a big tree, in the ruin without roof, the grass nearby or more hidden in the woods. 2 small rivers close to filter water or to take a bath. Beautiful views of a mountain. Lot’s of firewood laying around.

Only reachable for cyclists and hikers. The Trans Ecuador Mtb Route passes this location.

name: Las tongas / Sendero de las aves
description:
Camping ground in the parking lot of Las Tongas restaurant and hospedaje Sendero de las Aves.

 It’s quiet and peaceful, the people responsible are very friendly and helpful. The access to showers is conditioned of whether there are guests staying in the cabin above the restaurant which I would guess it doesn’t happen that often. Internet is available at Sendero de las aves, 2 minutes from the camping ground.

You can see over 10 species of colibris at their feeders, the cabins above have a wonderful view, which they let you access. The place is right next to the trail that leads to reserva las tangaras which is beautiful, and very close to the Tarabita, the Mindo teleférico, and other attractions. 

Perfect place for those who want to stay a bit out of town, relax and enjoy the forest. The price is $5 per person per day. We had a wonderful time staying here. The bathroom was clean, the hot showers were good and available for the whole time we were there. The food at the last tongas restaurant was also very nice. We plugged our car in the bathroom power outlets. Go seat at the balcony of the hotel above, watch the colibris and enjoy the view.

name: Parking lot Park and terminal
description: We spent a night in front of the park and bus terminal. It was quiet. No traffic at night. Almost leveled. Free internet inside the park. Police was just passing.

name: Balcon Al Cotopaxi Hosteria
description: A place to treat yourself with a view that is worth every penny. Approx $50 for a room. A wall of glass windows with an unobstructed view of Cotopaxi. Ran by Carlos and his family. An incredible stay that is worth every penny. Picture attached is view from own 2X bed room at 6am! Perfect parking for bikes also.

name: Terminal parking lot
description:
after spend two nights in front of terminal, the guard (who lives inside the terminal) invite us to park inside because at night (Saturday) a couple cars put loud music and yell until 3am. plus, many cars with alcoholic people is passing for avenue. including a little accident in the corner. so, Happy to park inside. 
the guard tell us than the inside parking lot is municipal and everyone can park here and spend the night. 
there's a water tap and you can use it.

name: Las Montañas
description:
Parking lot of Las Montañas attraction. Very safe open area parking lot with a gorgeous view facing the mountains. 

This was the most beautiful and peaceful spot we could find in Mindo. There is a beautiful hang out area with hammocks, tables, etc… where you can watch colibris, tangaras and toucans. You have access to the trails that lead to the river, view points and waterfalls, and you can cross the valley in the “Colibri Tarabita” which is just as funny as it is awesome. The shower is outdoors, in the garden. A few tourists come by during the weekend but overall pretty chill.

This place is amazing and cheap compared to the others, $5 per person/day. It’s the perfect spot for whose who just want to relax and stay in nature. It’s a 20-30 min drive up the hill but the road is good. One of the few spots in Mindo open enough to properly set starlink. We haven’t tried their internet but the owner said it is not very good, the same as all other places in Mindo.

This is a family business and you can contact Ramiro or Janet, two very friendly people on these numbers: 0991114190 / 0988177626.

name: Maria’s house - Estación Carchi
description: You can stay in Maria’s house here. Maria fixed us a spare bedroom. Nothing luxurious (floor mattress) but great place to stay. Ask the locals for her house. It’s next to the train station. This is perfect if you’re on the TEMBR. She is super kind and loves getting to know you. She will even make you dinner and breakfast. She won’t charge you but we offered to pay. Great view of the river and simple store to restock a bit. She offered to keep our bikes in her storage room but the town felt very safe. One of the more memorable places we stayed on the TEMBR.

name: Rental Hosted by John Thomas
description: Very pleasant large property with multiple rooms and prices to match. Short riverside walk from the main town and a very peaceful spot. Rooms range from shared bath upwards and start at 20 dollars per night. Very reasonable for the area. Compared to the average hostel this is a fabulous building with lots of space, privacy and excellent security. Ideal for those travelling by motorcycle. Space for small overland rigs too but best to check first. You may find rooms slightly cheaper on AirB+B but if planning a few nights maybe reach out to John directly (speaks English/ Spanish fluently). Notice required as property is sometimes booked out in full. Hot tub / sauna available at additional cost, pool, washing machine included. If searching AirB+B look for 'room in rental unit hosted by John Thomas' if wishing to contact direct; +593 99 883 2123 or lrcvilcabamba@gmail.com

name: Communidad Teodasín
description:
Cyclist: I could sleep in the building of the community. Electric plugs, light, toilet inside (!), huge room. One of the most luxary community buildings I've seen so far. Very friendly people, the children helped me to search for somebody with the key.
If the water is off, you have to open up the tap outside in front of the building.

name: Estación de Servicio P&S
description:
New, very spacious station, with Wi-Fi throughout the parking lot, clean bathrooms and free showers. The shop was stocked but for lunch there was only hot dog. We spent a very quiet and safe night.

Estación nueva, muy amplia, con wifi en todo el estacionamiento, baños limpios y duchas gratis. El shop surtido pero para comer solo habia hot dog. Pasamos una noche muy tranquila y segura.

name: Leon’s Coffee
description:
Leon’s coffee is a really nice little family owned coffee farm (exporting their coffee to Europe as well). Don’t miss to stop for a tour, to buy some excellent coffee or for both! Everyone is really welcoming and friendly and what we liked the most about it: it’s not at all a tourist kind of tour! 

Coming from the north, turn left after the Petrol Station.

name: Parking lot El Peral park
description: excellent place to spend the day and night. very flat and quiet. there's a bathroom (closed at night) next to the Casa de la música (house of music). also the place have cameras and security personal all night. plus, the guard invite us to spend the night in front of bathrooms, under he's sight and cameras. the bathroom have plug to connect what you need to charge, like computer or similar.

name: Eco Challanger Galapagos
description:
Our best tour in the Galapagos and certainly not only because of what you see. The first operator (after Santa Cruz and Isabela flops) who didn’t lie or make things up just to get you in their boat. And everything, every little detail, that Fabrizio mentioned or previewed was there.
1/ organization: they are super organized. Before your tour, you get a numbered bag where you put your fins, mask and wetsuit. You always get the things that fit and don’t have to worry that you get was is left for you on the boat. It doesn’t get mixed up on board. They leave on time. Like one minute early, unbelievable in SA. 
2/ boat: the 360 tour boat is important because you spend a lot of time on it, like 4-5hours maybe. The Hammerhead boat is bigger, which means different options where to sit. Two cushioned benches inside ofc but also plenty of space in the back outside, if you are seasick as I am or if everyone gets out to watch the wildlife(birds, dolphins). Also at the top near the Capitan or in the front. Every time you get out of water there is something tasty waiting for you (water makes everyone hungry) - bananas, watermelon, pineapple, nachos with the best guacamole ever, sweets,…the lunch is also really good and enough. 
3/ staff: in the agency you meet Fabrizio, who will be you guide, in person. You can see that he is super friendly, not making awkward forced jokes (we don’t like the comedian-type guides), knowledgeable and he speaks very good English. Btw the sailor on board also spoke English, which was surprising and helpful. 
4/ details: Fab really cares about them to make the most of your trip. He is a freediver and carries his GoPro. So, 1/ his videos are amazing as he dives really close to the all wildlife and 2/ you don’t have to worry about spending half of your snorkeling time trying to get the right shot and staring the your screen-you can just enjoy the moment, he shares all his videos/pics in HQ. He brings Vaseline for the guys with moustache, it really works in the mask! He has seasickness pills. There is morning coffee. He previews everything enough in advance so you know what to bring or what you will do at the stop and no one is confused (silly, but apparently not an obvious thing). He studied biology so he knows so much about the wildlife and explains it all. 
We can’t recommend enough. Worth every dollar. Btw, 170$. And, adding all the amazing wildlife you see, our 360 was the best
Check their online reviews if you want! They also arrange stuff for you (ferries, other islands tours etc), but we didn’t do/need that.

name: Primax
description:
Tienen 2 canillas y pudimos cargar agua en el tanque de nuestro motorhome, aunque no es potable.
.
They have 2 faucets and we were able to fill the tank of our motorhome, although it is not drinkable.

name: Turnout behind rock
description: Turnout is a loop accessible by bicycle from either side. Accessible by motor vehicle only from the uphill side. Pretty quiet at night, out of view of the road, some trash but not too bad if you're further towards the downhill side. Fantastic view. Good flat spots for tents. Strong Claro signal. The stream looks very dirty.

name: Up abandoned road
description:
Accessible by bicycle. Possibly accessible by moto. Not accessible by 4 wheeled vehicle. 

Entrance is an overgrown stone road right at the high point of the pass: -3.3074817, -79.1296918. NO CURB CUT. 

No fence, no property signs, infrequent human use. Beautiful nature. Soft ground for tents. 

Weak Claro signal.

name: community sports pitch
description:
[Bicycle touring]

on the edge of the sports field with permission from locals. nice quiet area

water spigot to the left of the church.

locals gave us permission to use the unlocked bathrooms in the community building next to the road. 

weak Claro signal

name: Pull out dirt road
description:
Pull out a long of a large dirt road. 
No problem of access, very quite and nice view. 
Suitable for a van or 4x4 with camper, not for a truck camper. 
Great for the night and ideal for morning footing 😊

name: Casa Hospedaje Puyo
description: cheapest place on booking and it's a great deal.  $8 per person for your own apartment.  2 of us have a whole 2 bed apartment with private full kitchen and bathroom for $16.  gated secure parking as well.  basic apartment but has everything you need and a decently comfy bed.  no sign from street so turn into alley where there is a sign for Dunky Donas.

name: Lodge France Amazonia
description: amazing place owned by a french guy and his wife and children who has been here for 15 years.  amazing swimming pool, outdoor shared kitchen and private gated parking suitable for just about any size rig.  he has no place to set up a tent but I assume if you asked he'd probably let you sleep in your vehicle.  originally asked $20pp but we talked him down to $25 a night for 2.  nicest place we've stayed in the last 8 months.  we had the best room, a 2 floor cabana with trap door to private terrace with hammocks and view of the river.  2 min walk to beaches on the river.  we stayed 5 nights and are thinking of coming back in a couple weeks.  we were the only guests here the whole time and had the whole enormous place to ourselves.  seems like he has stopped trying to attract guests and is focusing more on local projects to help the community and his children.  highly highly reccomend

name: Hotel California Bucay
description: nice basic hotel, matrimonial rooms for $20 or $25 depending if you want a room.woth a river view or not.  smart tv, wifi and hot water.  has gated garage next door and gated alley on side of hotel where I parked my moto.  on busy road but the rooms are way in the back on the river so it's nice and quiet even though the road is busy.

name: Turnout at top of pass
description:
[bicycles]

Turned out looking for the lake. didn't find the lake. Possibly it's further up. would require bike carrying if it is. 

flat, soft, but lumpy tent areas. 

out of view of the road, clean, looks like very infrequent human traffic. 

weak Claro signal. 

bicycles or possibly motorcycles only.

name: Wifi Municipio de Guaranda
description:
In the park there are 2 public networks of the MUNICIPALITY OF GUARANDA 2G/5G. It works at the parking area.
.
En el parque hay 2 redes públicas del municipio MUNICIPIO DE GUARANDA 2G/5G
Llega a la zona de estacionamiento.

name: German Bakery
description: One of the best German bakeries in South America. It's calles Bruning Deli. He has various breads, pretzels, various sweets and super cheap pizza. Can only recommend this place.

name: Shimano Service Center. Ecco Bike
description: Good bicycle shop and mechanic. With lots of Shimano parts in all quality ranges. Such as shifters, bottom brackets, cranks, cassettes, derailleurs, deore, slx, xt. Their mountainbike tire selection is less impressive though.

name: Candurumy Lodge
description:
It's in a beautiful, peaceful location near to nice walking country with lots of river swimming.
The family is a very kind and helpful local Kichwa family who made us and our kids feel very welcome. 

There is a big, flat, grassy parking space inside the grounds - inside a huge, 3m+ high gate - and they said they are happy to accept overlanders. The last few kms are ripio but in good condition when we drove it.

name: Goza - Delicious Egg Benedict
description: Cuenca has lots of great restaurant options, but we thought to add this one because of its excellent brunch menu and good parking options for Overlanders.  We really enjoyed the eggs benedict and pancakes.  Also the brunch menu is served until 1:00 p.m., and then after that they have a good selection of burgers, sandwiches, pastas, and a large dessert menu.  There are two other locations of this chain in the city, but we prefer this one as it has a large parking lot that could accommodate any Overland vehicle.  The parking lot does get very crowded on the weekends, but during the week it was quiet during the times we visited which were mid morning.  We ended up going a few times and every time the quality of the food was excellent and the service was very prompt.  Also it is right next to a brand new Supermaxi if you need to stock up on good quality cheeses and meats. Enjoy!

name: Dra. Maite Depreeuw
description: Dra. Maite is absolutely amazing.  I had struggled with a health issue for over a year.  I visited many doctors in Colombia but it remained unresolved. Dra. Maite found a solution in under a week!  She speaks English, Spanish, Dutch, and French.  The initial consult fee was $40.  Contact by WhatsApp. +593 98 212 3992

name: Vamos Spanish School
description: This Spanish school offers a drop in class on Saturdays from 11 a.m. to 12:30.  I attended several times while we were in Cuenca, and it was so much fun.  We played all sorts of learning games and it was a really good way to improve my Spanish.  It is donation based, but the suggested donation is $2 per person. As I understand they only have this drop in class three Saturdays out of the month, so be sure to send a WhatsApp message in advance to confirm that it is on for that Saturday.  +593 98 299 9083

name: Sofy Glocal Cuisine
description:
Sofy Glocal Cuisine - Fancy but Relaxed!
This is a really nice restaurant just off of the main plaza that offers delicious curries, lamb, filet mignon, and fresh pasta.  They have really nice appetizers, as well as vegan options. The atmosphere is classy but relaxed, and the dishes are served with so much care.  They are adorned with fresh edible flowers and they look so beautiful!  We visited a few times, so we added lots of food pics!

name: LOTUS WASI
description:
Chris and Emilio run this very lovely campground. They offer glamping tents and cabañas. But there is also enough lawn, where you can easily put up tents, parking space for all kind of vehicles. 
In Oña you go right, up the mountain. It turns into a gravel road which is quite narrow and steep, but it is totally worth it. We managed to go up there with a 2wd motorhome. Once at LOTUS WASI the couple made us feel at home right away. They offered to make a pizza (which was incredibly tasty!) while we could sit by the fireplace. Kids could use sandbox or swings. It might be best to get in contact with them upfront so they are prepared (+593 99 262 8060)  We paid 12 USD per adult, 6 per child including breakfast (super good and home made as well!). Toilets and showers are brand new (Dec 23). Everything is made with love for details and in an ecological way. We recommend you go up there and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere, the beautiful starry nights and the fresh air. Perfect place to relax!

name: Bomberos Guayllabamba
description: Came cycling (5 ppl + dog). Very nice bomberos used to receive cyclers. We camped in their huge garden. Hot shower (if you go one by one) and WC. The guard offered us tea. You can cook in their kitchen. I don't know for the WiFi. Very quiet at night. They ask for passport and give it back in the morning. All nice and free.

name: backpackers balcones
description:
Es un lugar muy amigable. Parqueadero 10 dólares por día por carro con baño, cocina y wi-fi. Servicio de lavandería adicional. Muy seguro. También se puede rentar habitaciones a partir de 6 dólares por persona.

tel del dueño: +593 988128527

safe place to stay. we pased 3 weeks in this place was amazing. incredible view to the River AND volcano. Manuel the owner Is a great person 10 usd per car. whit bathromm and kitchen. laundry service apart. you can rent a Room for 6 per. person. With privated bathroom It Is an amazing place to stay.  💯 recomended.

name: DogKdemy
description: Dog kennel services. Daycare and over night services. Very friendly family and very affordable. Andre his wife Josefina and daughter Andreina care so lovingly for your dogs! %100 recommended!

name: Pishku WASI
description:
3 available rooms in the countryside, 1 glamping tent and camping space near Quito and airport !
If you're looking for a peaceful place to stay in nature, to enjoy calm and fruits, rest and adventures in the mountains.. 
Welcome at Pishku WASI (the house of the bird, in Kichwa) !

name: Pishku WASI
description:
3 available rooms in the countryhouse, 1 spacious glamping tent and camping space near airport and Quito, on the road to Otavalo. 
If you're looking for a peaceful place to rest, or to go for adventures in the mountains.. 
Welcome at Pishku WASI !

name: Posto Primax
description: Parking with water and bathrooms. We spent a night and didn't use the bathroom, but it's not clean. We pay $2.00

name: Parking lot hotel Miramelindo
description: the hotel's owner let us overnight for free in the parking lot without problems. very quiet at night on Friday.

name: Gas Station P&S
description: Large parking lot next to the P&S station, with bathroom, shower, water and energy. We were only one night, but the place is quiet and pleasant.

name: Hacienda Santa Ana de las Piedras
description: Campsites available on a private Hacienda with great views of the Mountains.  Just of the major highway, so easy access with all size vehicles.  Shower and toilet available at the main house for campers use. Clean drinking water and reliable Wi-Fi signal. Download 94.97 mbps Upload 77.79 mbps

name: Hacienda Santa Ana de Las Piedras
description: Hacienda accommodation in a beautiful mountain setting.  Close to the main road for easy access to the property.  The hacienda has large rooms available some with on suites and some with shared bathrooms.  The location is beautiful and in nature with plenty of birdlife and hiking trails to enjoy.  Just 45 min from the provincial airport and 10 km drive from the city of Cariamanga, Loja.  The hacienda has all the modern comforts of home.   The property is available to explore and enjoy.    This is an off-the-beaten track location with safe and secure accommodation.  Enjoy activities and food in the local community.  Hacienda Santa Ana de las Piedras is awaiting your visit.

name: Hostal Belen
description:
Simple but decent size accommodation. Good tv, showers are hot. The WiFi works well on certain moments, other moments it is not usable at all, during problems just tell them to reset the router…I paid 10 dollars for one person. Just a couple of minutes to walk to the city center. I could park my bicycle in my room upstairs.

I used this hotel to get some rest after the though day ride by bicycle, between Limon Indanza and Gualaceo.

name: Masgas
description:
Very good service station, we spent 1 night with the motorhome, and we were able to fill the water tanks. It has a restaurant and a market.

Muy buena estación de servicio, pasamos 1 noche con el motorhome, pudimos cargar los tanques de agua. Tiene restaurante y mercado

name: Kitu Chocolate
description:
A family run business and the best chocolate we tasted in Ecuador, maybe even the best we've ever tasted! They do a short explanation of how they make the chocolate and then give you tasters of all the different flavours they make. There is no pressure to buy anything, although we went back many times because the flavours are so amazing! 

The bars cost a little more than others made in Ecuador, but it truly is a family business and the taste is worth it!

name: Parque de la Familia
description:
The park is very large, there is a little parking in front, but there is a good place on the side. There is a place to make a fire and games for children

El parque es muy grande, tiene poco estacionamiento al frente , pero al costado hay buen lugar. Hay lugar para hacer fuego y juegos para niños

name: Gabriel
description: Call or send him a WhatsApp and ask if he can sleep here, he has two rooms with double beds and everything else you need.  Since it is opposite the "Mirador des Cristal" and there is always Securit here, the place is very safe.

name: parking lot
description:
we stayed few nights here and the parking lot without problems. the police just passing and chat and tell us than the place is ok for overnight. 
----
pasamos el día y lagunas noches en el estacionamiento y pasando la esquina en una calle sin salida. hay enchufes bajo los bancos que funcionan perfecto. también hay una canilla con agua a disposición más adelante en el malecón. también pudimos vender artesanías en el estacionamiento sin problemas.
sumado a que estamos en momentos de toque de queda, nos da tranquilidad ya que todo cierra a las 23.
también hay baños públicos a 0.25 $

name: Open space near to 7 cascadas
description:
there's a big space near to 7 cascadas entrance. super quiet at night and free.
-----
Hay un espacio muy grande cerca de la entrada de las 7 cascadas muy tranquilo de noche y gratuito. pasamos la noche una kombi y un MB608 sin problemas.
el camino a las 7 cascadas es hermoso.

name: Hotel Lindon Garcia
description: Friendly owner and secure indoor parking. $20usd for 2 people, $30 with aircon. Would recommend.

name: Aguas Negras River Lodge
description:
We were so lucky to find this place. We wanted to visit the Cuyabeno but wanted to avoid the big places with quick turnover of guests doing the 'Amazon Tour' from Quito.  This lodge is much further down the river and for us got the balance absolutely right between being comfortable and wild.

We were the only people at the lodge during our 4 night/5 day stay (seems to be the case for most guests - it only sleeps max. 10) and were very lucky to have Fabian (the owner) as our guide - he speaks excellent English, has been guiding in the area for around 20 years and really knows his stuff. He really felt like a companion as much as a guide and went above and beyond in many ways.

The lodge and boats are run by a local Kichwa family - and we also camped for one night with a Secoya family on the Aguarica river. The schedule was flexible and could be tailored to our needs. Our kids loved the experience especially some of the cultural activities, playing with the Secoya family's kids.

It's a bit more expensive than some - but cheaper than others - but for us was absolutely worth it to get away into primary forest and into the quieter backwaters of the area. There's also the option of spending more nights camping - and longer paddling trips too.

We did the easy canoeing trip and saw so much (57 species of birds, lots of night critters, monkeys, otters, pink river dolphins, caiman, piranha). Great food, loads of activities and all in a beautiful location with nice river swimming.

name: Cascada Hollin
description:
A lovely family run this simple restaurant with cabanas right by the thundering waterfall of Cascada Hollin. We stayed one night between Tena and Lago Agrio. There's excellent birding nearby and some trails to walk in the Jocotoco reserve.

There's plenty of space to pull up rigs of any size and the family said anyone would be welcome to stay and even make use of the kitchen they use to prepare very tasty meals and breakfast on demand. They seemed very keen to have people come by and enjoy the place for a (very?) minimal fee.

It's by the road and some road noise although for us it was quiet overnight due to the curfew in place. 

You can whatsapp Flor on +593 9845 60657

name: Bomberos
description:
Came cycling (2 ppl). Very friendly staff. They let us pitch our tent at 5pm and take a shower at 7pm (hot for M, cold for W). Camped on their parking space and cooked there also.
There's a mini market up the street at 200m. There's a kitchen but we didn't ask for it. Good WiFi "invitado". [passwords are not allowed]

name: AGIP Gas
description: Shop that sells gas bottles. As we have an integrated tank, we first went to Jacome to buy the appliances (see our iO entry there) and then came here to refill our tank from a domestic gas bottle. The lady was very friendly and helpful. We paid 2$ for the gas and 60$ deposit for a 15kg bottle. As it is not legal to refill a tank in this way, we had to drive a little away to an open area where we did the refilling. Thereafter we brought the bottle back and got 60$ deposit back.

name: NP Cayambe
description: The road from Olmedo up to Lago San Marcos is a well maintained gravel road. The final 400m access to the lake is closed at the moment with a locked gate. Nice views of volcan Cayambe along the road. Various places to camp overnight. No cell reception. The road ends at a water collection site of the Rio Clavaderos.

name: VW/Audi - for my T6.1
description:
One of the most efficient dealers I've been to... Knowledgeable and friendly problem solvers.  We tried independent workshops who even brought in techs from other dealers, but couldn't solve the problem on our 2023 T6.1

Our ECU locked up after a DPF Regen issue and while at first their computer couldn't complete the task, their support in Ecuador and Germany got it sorted in less than 24 hours.  Regen, oil/filter change was $330 - Priceless!

Victor our service liaison, Mario the service manager, and Chris the owner seemed to go out of their way to help get us back on the road

Victor's WhatsApp
+593 98 315 6754

name: Teckelvet
description:
Our dog was vomitting white/yellow foam every day or 2.

There's a vet on almost every corner, and when we wanted a blood test we were referred to Monica @ Teckelvet for further evaluation.  After the blood test and evaluation she told us he was dehydrated, she found inflammation on his spine, and recommended elimination diet as he was scratching his hind quarters.

She told us he likely had an ulcer or gastritis.  Her focus was protecting the stomach liner. 3-hours later, she completed an IV with several medications, blood test, bio scan, etc. $12 for the consult, and $190 in tests and medications. 

Next day we returned for s follow-up. He was drooling excessively and a bit slower. Back on the IV and meds.  She said we could continue the oral meds for a month, or do an ultrasound. 

Next morning the tech arrived and we did an Ultrasound - it confirmed Gastritis and not an Ulcer.  The stomach lining was inflamed, nearly twice its maximum size. The ultrasound revealed possible arrythmia. Vet said we could wait 3 month until we got home, but decided to go forward with that test as well. She returned later with an EKG. $60 for those 2 tests.

We're now comfortable proceeding with our trip - Monica is available via WhatsApp and the vomitting has subsided.

Monica is an awesome and trustworthy vet

name: Hotel Coracol
description: Nice & clean. $20 for two people no aircon or fan.Secure parking in a lot a block away is included in the price.

name: Bomberos
description:
Came cycling (2 ppl). Probably best bomberos we stayed at. Super friendly staff used to receive cycle travelers. They offered us bed, hot shower, WC, kitchen. All free and nice. Nice conversation at night with them. They took a copy of our passports when we entered. Water from tap not potable so we filtered it.
Shops down the village.

name: Lubricantes Bedon
description: Change of aceites (oil). Mecanic for Body works / carrocería. Fast Service. Also Saturdays.

name: Pizza Colibrí
description: Super good pizza some of the best we’ve had on this trip. One of the owners is English. Great vegetarian option.

name: Bomberos Penipe
description: Came cycling. Like always: super friendly bomberos. We could use kitchen, hot shower, WC, place for handwashing clothes and hang them, we camped under roof. Water is potable. There's a free WiFi of the village but slow. They also have a WiFi, a little better. All free, quiet and safe. Shops nearby.

name: Bomberos Riobamba (cyclists)
description: Came cycling (2 ppl). Bomberos let us sleep behind in their small bodega/garage (not big enough to put the tent because of their stuff). They proposed us hot shower in the morning. There's a slow WiFi you can ask for, WC open all night, water tap and facility to wash your clothes. The bomberos started to train at 6:30am in the court.

description:

name: San Carlos School
description:
