At the school you have a lot of options to park or pitch a tent or use your hammock. Also options under the roof. Ask at the restaurant at the entrance of the village if you can camp there.
There is a toilet, but may be closed during the night. The restaurants have toilets. Two little shops. Wifi at the restaurants.
 Watertap in front of the school. You can switch of the spotlights with the fuse at one of the masts. Very friendly people, after we hsd s talk they brought us fried bananas, chees and fruit juice.

name: Sports ground
description:
Asking in the village where to camp, everybody sent us to this sports ground with a big roof. But the night was very very noisy, lot's of truck and bus traffic. Probably the other sports ground in the village is quieter. The toilets were closed. Somebody also said that you can stay in the Casa Comunal, but we did not ask for it.
From the bridge south of the village, you can have a view of Vulcano Reventador in the distance and its clouds of smoke. The guard of the bridge said, in clear nights sometimes you can see lava. At the bridge, you can also have a refreshing swim in the river!

name: Pine forest
description: Open public land. On the edge are some pine trees and it is extremely quiet. You can tuck yourself away very easily with some shelter from wind

name: La Giralda Hotel
description: Nice, friendly hotel. Can keep bikes in foyer. Officially $18/pp but room for negotiation

name: Stream-side camping
description: Great wild camping spot at the bend in road. Keep following the steam up (small path) and there is a clearing between the plants. Stream water was murky when I was here - would need a water filter

name: Laguna de Maylas wild camping
description: Steps up to the laguna are opposite the car park. Very quiet. There is a very wide bridge at the top next to the lake - perfect for pitching a tent, otherwise there are flat spots as you come up and a few around the laguna. I took my loaded bike up the path (I don’t recommend this!) - maybe find a spot to hide it at the bottom and just bring what you have to. Otherwise there looked to be camping as you descend from the car park

name: Kitu Chocolate
description: Family owned chocolate shop, it only opened two months ago. The young owner, Julio, explained the production and let us taste all the flavours!! Very nice owner and the chocolate is delicious! the bars price is between 5.5 and 7 dollars, they have different products

name: La Mariscal artisan market
description: The market itself is nothing special (all the shops sell the usual souvenirs) but there is a shop which is different from all the others (artee makers - in the small building), is owned by a young designer who designed very nice and different t-shirts, magnets, stickers and notebooks. The t-shirts are 15$, good quality and with interesting drawings! All related to Ecuador culture

name: Casa De Huespedes (US$12 pp per night)
description:
Friendly owner, good location
 - USD$12 - Double room with en-suite (hot/ cold water), no a/c, but two decent fans
 - USD$20 - Double room with en-suite (hot/ cold water) with a/c. 
Clean rooms, soap, shampoo, towels etc

name: Juanita’s Grill-US$5 meals
description:
Lunch or dinner cooked on Juanita’s patio. Plus open until late in the evening. 
 - US$5 - rice, white bean sauce, plantain and beef/ chicken/ half red rock fish
 - USD$6 - rice, white bean sauce, plantain and prawns

name: Bomberos Biblian (cyclists only)
description: We came cycling (3 ppl). The bomberos of Biblian are used to receive cyclists (only). We had access to hot shower, kitchen, room inside for sleeping (pitch the tent if you want to do so), didn't ask for WiFi but I think they have, electricity plugs. No restaurant but shops close by, pets are welcome, but they have 2 dogs so you know, water is potable.

name: Hostal la Rosa
description:
Good hotel with great secure parking for vehicles 3m or higher.
$20usd for a room with 2 beds private bath and hot hot water, for 2 people.
Parking is right across the street and height is limited by the wires, see photo.
laundry is $0.90 per KG.
clean and comfy, 3 blocks from the artisan/poncho market.. Free wifi

name: Parrilladas de Nancy
description: Soy Ford Lady on the Road, It is a place where I arrived only for lunch and they have allowed me to park the vehicle in the parking lot, a very quiet and beautiful area. You can use the bathroom but there is no shower and it is mainly a safe place

name: Hostal Micronia
description:
Cheap and cheerful. We paid USD$22 per night for the two of us.
 - air conditioning
 - en-suite
 - central location
 - charged per room!
 - decent wifi

name: El Junco Lagoon
description:
We hired bicycles ($10 each) and caught a taxi ($15) to the lagoon and cycle down to Chino and Galapaguera de Cerro Colorado before returning to the lagoon for an afternoon walk and the cycling back down into Puerto Baquerizo Moreno.
Also, squeezed in a visit to Playa Loberia.

name: Galapaguera de Cerro Colorado/ Tortoise Breeding Centre
description:
Free!
Amazing to see so many giant tortoises plus heaps of younger ones at the top of the sanctuary too.
Open from 8am - 6pm.

name: Tambo Pak Samai
description:
We paid 15$ each for a matrimonial with private bathroom, breakfast included. We definitely got better deals in Ecuador but the room was clean and the owner is a nice lady. There is a secure gated parking on the back of the building. Warm showers.
The village is quite dead but there is a lady that makes a very good pizza in town, ask around and locals will point where it is!

name: Cafeteria el Descanso
description:
small parking lot next to a "Cafeteria" with pick nick tables and a baño with water outside. It was all closed as we arrived at 6 pm and as left at 10 am. You of course hear the cars and trucks passing. 
There is a flat and grassy place behind the cafeteria (for those sleeping in tents, but I don't know if welcome or not). 
No network signal.
We felt very safe and no-one bothered us.

name: Hostal Sandrita
description:
Cheapest room we could find on the island.
$25 for a nice double room for two people including air conditioning & ensuite.
Includes use of a hostal style kitchen and dinning room.
Good location, although nothing is far from the ferry terminal. 
Manager (owners daughter) is a beautiful lady who is happy to share any information you need. 
Wifi is decent when it works.

name: For all bikers: Ivan runs a Casa Di Cyclista
description:
Ivan approached me to say that he opens his home to cyclists for free. I did not stay with Ivan as already had accomodation and so can not share many details other than he seemed very kind and has a young daughter. His number is and he said you can see monkeys from his home <3
Ivan : 09 6319 0377
Maybe the first person to verify can add some more details about the address etc

name: Next to the river under the bamboo trees
description: parking spot near the river right in front of Khumba Mela hostería. Quite dark space at night but lot of space. No facilities at all but you may ask for toilets and bathroom at the hostel if needed.

name: Hamadryade Lodge
description: Absolutely beautiful and peaceful. They offer a discount on booking.com when you book for the same day or the next day. Glamping works out as $50/night and I think $60 if you are two. Breakfast included. Recommended if you want day by the pool and to treat yourself. Food and drinks are expensive - eg a coffee is $4 and glass of wine is $10, but food is delicious. In the glamping you can get away with bringing your own

name: Duchas gratis CEBAF
description:
The showers are not very clean but the water is very good, there are also hydration points with drinking water.

Las duchas no estan muy limpias pero el agua es muy buena, tambien hay puntos de dhidratacion con agua potable.

name: PS Avelino(fuel station)
description:
Friendly staff and owner, very safe, quiet, super clean bathrooms, showers, hose to wash the car, key to refill the water tank, wifi... and everything for free. It also has a minimarket right there and restaurants in front.

Personal y dueño amables, muy seguro, tranquilo, baños super limpios, duchas, manguera para lavar auto, llave para rellenar tanque de agua, wifi.. y todo gratis. Además cuenta con minimarket ahi mismo y restaurantes al frente.

name: Bomberos Pasaje (cyclists only)
description:
Ecuadorian tour of bomberos, I'm thinking about adding it on bikepacking.com. Anywaaaayy, suuupperrrr friendly bomberos (probably one of the best we stayed at). Kitchen, WC, shower, no WiFi, they offered us food. We camped in the central hallway. Super safe, no light or noise at night.
They are super keen to help, talk and very interested in other cultures and about the trips of the cycloviajeros. A must !

name: EDS Terpel Pifo
description:
Free parking, clean bathrooms and a store.  Within 100 meters there are many shops and restaurants.

Estacionamiento gratis, baños limpios y una tienda. A 100 metros hay muchas tiendas y restaurantes.

name: Stickers of All Kind and size
description:
we needed new stickers to give away and to decorate our car.
Santiago made it super fast and in good quality.

name: Hostal el Colibri
description: The price is 25$ for a matrimonial with private bathroom (check on booking.com for offers), there is secure parking (not a lot of space for cars so contact them before). The room was clean, hot shower. There is a nice kitchen guests can use and portable water with free coffee and tea. Hammocks where you can relax outside.

name: Inti Mindo Hostel
description:
Newly opened hostel in 2024. About 10 minutes walk from downtown and much quieter. Birds in the morning.

There is one flat space for a rig of at most 6m. And a few not very flat spots for tents or small rigs.

Large gate. rigs above 2.5m will have trouble getting in.

Basic toilet, lukewarm suicidal shower, and a kitchen.

8$/van

name: Hotel Angeles
description: We paid 34$ for a matrimonial with a simple breakfast included. Hot shower, clean, WiFi was good enough. It has a secure parking half a block away.

name: Hospedaje Rosario Ochoa
description:
Small hospedaje with 3 rooms with two comfortable beds. Fast internet and good tv. The owners have the shop downstairs. I paid 12 dollars for one person. 

I could park my bicycle temporarily in their storage and at 1900h in their store. The bicycle didn’t fit in the hostal.

There are two other hospedajes in this center. One in the same street up the square. And another one (15 dollar) if you cross te square in the middle and follow that street, next to the pharmacy.

name: Possible tent camping
description: Possible tent camping spot, next to the water in the grass. Close to the dirt road but possible out of sight, because it is lower.

name: Hotel Semana Wasi
description:
Hotel with big rooms and fast WiFi. It’s a bit noisy in the mornings with other guests. They asked 15 dollars for one person, but they brought the price down to 13,5 dollars.

I could fit my bicycle inside the room, they have private parking.

name: Cool (vehicle) river camp
description: Nice spot to tent camp or with a vehicle next to the river.

name: Fast and free Wi-Fi
description: Here is a fast and free Wi-Fi access without password. This is a service of the National Park.

name: SIM card
description: You will find here a shop to buy a SIM card. Claro SIM card cost 5$US and you have a large choise to recharge it. In our case we took 15Go + 2Go (Facebook and Instagram) + 3Go (YouTube+TikTok) + 5Go (WhatsApp) for 30 days for 15$US.

name: Mercado food court (cheap place!)
description: You will find here a food court inside the market place. We had lunch for 2.25$US a full meal (starter, main course, dessert). I recommend stand 11.

name: Estacionamento em frente o Parque El Paraíso
description:
We slept here for a week. It's very safe and has a friendly neighborhood. Nearby there is a shopping center, a laundromat, and a pharmacy. There is drinking water in the park. It's also a great place for travelers with pets.

Dormimos uma semana neste local. É muito seguro e tem uma vizinhança amável. Nas próximidades tem o shopping, lavanderia e farmácia. No parque tem água potável. E além disso é ótimo local para quem viaja com pet.

name: Dique Fátima
description:
Dique de Fatima is a very nice place to spend a few nights. The river is very clean, it is a popular place in the lively town. There are bathrooms and wifi food stores. Very quiet and safe at night.

Dique de Fátima.
Lugar muy lindo para pasar unas noches. El río es muy limpio, es un lugar popular en el pueblo animado. Hay baños y wifi
Tiendas de comida.
Muy tranquilo y seguro en la noche

name: CIVICAR - Land Rover parts
description:
Store well stocked with parts for Land Rover. We found a handbrake cable and a sensor for the differential there.
Here are the contacts: +5930999472697, civicar56@hotmail.com.

name: Balneario Chuya Yaku
description:
A place with ample parking and two places where food is sold. Entrance to the spa 1usd pp. The river is beautiful and crystal clear with puddles up to 2.5 m deep. The people are friendly. There are decent bathrooms. We arrived on a Sunday and there were a certain number of people, however the river is so large that there was room for everyone.
Un lugar con parqueadero amplio y dos lugares de venta de comida. La entrada al balneario 1usd pp. El río es hermoso y cristalino con charcos de hasta 2.5 m de profundidad. La gente es amable. Hay baños decentes. Llegamos un domingo y había cierta cantidad de gente sin embargo el río es tan grande que había espacio para todos.

name: Off Ruta E35
description: Works in progress on the main road. People put a rope across the road and tried to ask us for 1 USD to pass on the detour road, saying that it's a private road. It's totally wrong. We just told them that we didn't have cash 3 times. Then they let us go. They ask everyone...

name: Wifi Plaza principal
description: Free Wifi, without password and with good speed: GAD_ONA

name: Water fountains in a park
description:
water fountain, perfect for refilling with jerrycans or bottles.  The tap is in the park in 2 places.  It is not possible to connect a hose.

fontaine à eau, parfaite pour refaire le plein avec des jerricans ou des bouteilles. Le robinet est dans le parc à 2 endroits. Il n'est pas possible de brancher un tuyau.

name: Bomberos (cyclists only)
description:
Aaaannddd ecuadorian bombers number one million I add on iO before crossing to Peru.

Came cycling (2 ppl). No overwhelming welcoming but still nice: we could use kitchen, shower, WC, WiFi, they even gave us some of their food and drinks.
There's a garafon you can use for drinking water.
The place is overall not very clean. I've seen cleaner bomberos.
We camped next to the cars after cleaning the place a little bit.

name: Bici Polos
description:
Manuel is a very pro and nice bicycle mechanic. He welded an aluminum extension to my fork which was a difficult work. He really did a good job, he's very reactive and he's cheap.
He cleaned some stuff of my bicycle and added some new stuff I didn't even ask. He loves cycloviajeros!!
His phone number: +593997866835
Recommend 100% !!!

name: Good spot for a night
description:
Parking on the street, around a park with games for children, sports field and several small restaurants which sell empenadas for example.  For toilets, ask at these restaurants which close around 9:30 p.m.  Otherwise, go to the children's health center which is less than 2 minutes away on foot.  There are also water fountains, perfect for refilling with jerry cans or bottles.  The taps are in the park in 2 locations.  It is not possible to connect a hose.  Wifi is free and works well.  You should preferably park at the bottom of the park, where it is best.  The night was quite calm.  so we recommend because the neighborhood is safe.
---
Stationnement dans la rue, autour d'un parc avec jeux pour enfants, terrain de sport et plusieurs petits restaurants qui vendent des empenadas par exemple. Pour les toilettes, demander à ces restaurants qui ferment vers 21h30. Sinon, aller au centre de sante pour enfant qui est à moins de 2mn à pied. Il y a aussi des fontaines à eau, parfaites pour refaire le plein avec des jerricans ou des bouteilles. Les robinets sont dans le parc à 2 endroits. Il n'est pas possible de brancher un tuyau. Le wifi est gratuit et fonctionne bien. Il faut se garer de préférence en bas du parc, là où ça passe le mieux. La nuit a été assez calme. donc on recommande car le quartier est sûr.

name: Hospedaje Reina de el Cisne
description:
Hospedaje with several rooms. I paid 10 dollars for one person. Good bed and reasonable WiFi.

I parked my bicycle in the garage. Where there is place to park high cars.

It’s located at the main square, above the yellow pharmacy Cucibaba.

There is another hospedaje with garage next to it, with a road in between. I didn’t check that one out.

name: Via al cedro (dead end dirt road)
description:
I took this dirt road detour off the highway, since it was a going through road on OSM (and simular) maps. After 4 or 5 kilometers climbing the road ended. Then in becomes a  steep single track hiking trial.

I was there by bicycle. It might be possible to go through and push your bicycle. It was too muddy and rainy when I was there, so I decided to turn around.

name: Hotel los tres reyes
description:
Simple hotel on the main road. There was a bit of road noise in the evening and morning. WiFi wast fast. I paid 10 dollars for a room with private bathroom. With shared bathroom is was 7 dollars. 

It was not super clean but acceptable.

I could park my bicycle in the room on the ground floor.

They don’t have parking, but street parking in front. Motorcycles can park next to the hotel (no fence). 

I went to two other hotels in town. Hotel vale del oro (5 dollars shared bathroom) and Suite hotel Curipamba (15 dollars). But this one worked the best for me, since they gad the best option to park my bicycle.

name: Bizcochos San Pedro Restaurante
description: The other location for Bizcochos San Pedro is the factory, this is the restaurant. You can buy bizcochos at the factory but here you can have the traditional breakfast with cheese and coffee and also see the ovens where they make bizcochos. During busy hours they have live traditional music. Loads of parking in the front.

name: GR Autorepuestos - VW, Audi, Skoda, Porsche
description: We had problems with steering geometry parts on our VW T5.  I searched for Febi Bilstein in Quito on the Internet in the hope of finding affordable apare parts.  So I found GT spare parts that also sell other brands and also have a great workshop with good mechanics.  They discovered that our noise problems had another cause and repaired it straight away rather than simply installing new parts.  The mechanic "Ricardo" also checked our engine electronics and programmed off the EGR valve at our request.  Very competent, friendly service for VW, Audi, Porsche, Skoda.

name: Caféteria Ecuatorial
description:
Cafeteria with traditional Bizcochos. You can also Buy local chocolate (2,50 Dollars), agave products and coffee. 
They will offer you a 5 minute tour about the agave plants and its products. 

Prices for breakfast between 3 and 4 Dollars. 
The Little Restaurant belongs to the Mitad del Mundo Campground, Family-run.

name: Hostal Imperial
description:
Simple hotel. I had a room with shared bathroom for 20 dollars. The room had a ventilator, the WiFi was quite good. They have rooms with private bathrooms as well.

I could park my bicycle in the room at the first floor, so I had to carry it upstairs.

Street parking.

name: La Delicia Bakery
description: Great little bakery for rolls, fresh loaves of bread, empenadas as well a fridge with cheese, flans and jellies.

name: The Tree House / Felipe Andrade T.
description: The Tree House facility offers parking space for short or long terms.  Located 40 min from Quito and easy access to bus or  Uber transportation. Large garden for kids or pets.  Nice place to settle down and organize other trips.  The entrance has 3 mt height and  3 mt wide. We also have The Tree  House and Rock House which are described on Airb&b.  Shared facility for cooking, barbecue and hammocks. We do not have a shop established yet but can give mechanical advice and help with guidance and solutions. (I have experience in automotive and Diesel, used to work for GM and Ford)  . Soon will have a shop for larger works.

name: Casa de Javier - FOR CYCLISTS
description:
I was just biking up the hill and Javier’s dad (who’s name I cannot remember) asked me if I needed a place to stay. This is a really lovely spot with a bathroom, shower, and WiFi. Javier is also an amazing cook and made me dinner and breakfast the next morning. 

Covered spot to put your tent if it’s raining and nice grassy area if not. They have hosted other cyclists before and said they are always open to helping people out. They only speak Spanish FYI.

name: Cafetería Bistró Pukamuro
description: Nice breakfast spot. The mote sucio is great (I think $2.50) and they have $1 tamales, humitas, cafe ($0.50) and chocolate. They were open at 9am on Wednesday after camping at the ruins. Not sure what regular hours are. (Friendly staff, free WiFi, and electrical outlets)

name: Parking lot /Estacionamiento Muelle Lago San Pablo
description:
We spent a couple of nights in this large parking lot. It was quiet, with a lot of people movement on the weekends and no visitors during the week. Right next door there is a typical food fair and the dock for boat rides. There is a signal with Movistar.
.
Pasamos un par de noches en este estacionamiento grande. Fue tranquilo, con mucho movimiento de gente los fines de semana y sin visitantes durante la semana.

Justo al lado hay una feria de comidas tipicas y el muelle para hacer paseos en lancha.
Hay señal con movistar.

name: Hostería Las Cucardas
description: Super cute hotel at the side of the highway. It’s much more beautiful inside than you would expect and the family that runs it is incredibly sweet. My room was $12 for a single, and there are also lots of common areas, a pool, and it’s by the river which drowns out the sound of the road. WiFi seems good. Secure parking, and a covered parking area for motos. Definitely recommend stopping here

name: Road washed
description: The track is unfortunately inaccessible from this point, 2 portions have been washed away. The 3 points indicated above at the viewpoint are therefore no longer accessible by 4x4. Motorcycles and bicycles can pass through. Just before this point it is possible to park in the bend (grassy area) and spend the night there.

name: viewpoint over Loja
description: nice viewpoint with a bench and kid playground. we had breakfast there to enjoy the view.

name: TinGo TilinGo Restaurant
description: Delicious, healthy and economical breakfasts, lunches, super special prices for iOverlander travelers.

name: Eni gas glp
description:
Efrain is the guy to fill your bottle. Call him before +593 99 369 0987.
He filled our Brazilian gas bottle, but he is able to fill any type of bottle. Usd 5 for 10kg.

Efrain encheu nosso botijão brasileiro p13. Ligue para ele antes de ir +593 99 369 0987.
Ele pode encher qualquer tipo de botijão.

name: Uko Bread Puembo
description:
Small bakery with German quality bread. Prices also like in Germany (3,70$ -4,70$) per load but absolutely worth it. We are Germans and know how bread has to be like ;-)
Also good croissants.

name: Bosque de Polylepis
description: Nice walk and really nice hidden small forest at the top mountain. With a foggy weather it is really mistical! I recommend to start this walk from the bivouac point nearby (-1.530464, -78.882671). from here it 3km round trip and around 130m elevation.

name: Pretty meadow by the river
description: Pretty meadow by the river (fresh and transparent water). You will be surrounded by cows and sheep. The spot is by the roadside and you are clearly visible but at night it is quiet. A few houses around, an old man came to greet us and wish us a good night. No Claro signal.

name: Hostal Quito
description: Clean Hostal with spacious common areas. Cold shower, windows to the court. We liked it better than Hostal Junín. WIFI and TV. Paid 12 Dollars per person. Friendly staff. Place to store bycicles.

name: Posto de Combustível Petro Ecuador
description:
We spoke to the gas station employee and he let us fill the Motorhome's water tank.  The tap has good pressure.

Conversamos com o funcionário do posto e ele deixou abastecer a caixa d'água do Motorhome. A torneira tem boa pressão.

name: Hostería Campo alegre
description: Campground with Pool, cold shower, toilets and nice flat grassy area. 3 nice dogs and super friendly owners. Not suitable for big rigs, maybe a small campervan could fit. It's more a place for cyclists or motorcyclists if you need a place to stay on the way to Mirador de los osos andinos. We paid 7 Dollar pp. Got a coffee and some sweet bread and some real interesting talks with the owner.

name: Next to Río Puyo
description: Next to the Río Puyo, it is a quiet place to spend the night. Here is a foot bridge to access the Wayuri community. The locals greeted us kindly. Do not hesitate to cross the bridge and have a look to the "village". No Claro signal.

name: E25 between pajonal and babahoyo
description:
March 7, 2024, it has been especially rainy, and the roads are flooded here, and it is calling for more rain.
.6 meters or 2 feet of water on the hiway currently.  
I expect it is like this whenever there are heavy rains.

name: Engine Truck's
description:
Specialists in the field of engines for cars and trucks.  We were able to have our engine problems with our truck fixed here today.  
They replaced 2 defective seals and 2 hoses.  The mechanics worked very quickly and in a planned manner.  They got all the parts that they didn't have in stock in one go.  We were able to continue driving 5 hours after our arrival.  We paid $150.  WhatsApp +593 98 595 7142 https://www.aiyellow.com/enginetrucks

Spezialisten im bereich Motoren für Autos und LKWs. wir haben heute hier unsere Motorprobleme con unserem LKW beheben lassen können. Sie haben 2 defekte Dichtungen und 2 Schläuche ausgetauscht. Die Mechaniker haben sehr schnell und geplant gearbeitet. Alle Teile die sie nicht vorrätig hatten besorgten sie in einem Schwung.  5 Stunden nach unserer Ankunft konnten wir weiterfahren. Wir haben 150$ bezahlt. WhatsApp +593 98 595 7142 https://www.aiyellow.com/enginetrucks

name: Dique Fatima
description: Quiet place, parking área, has shower and bathroom

name: Hacienda Napoles
description:
It is a natural pool spa on the Miriumi River, it has bathrooms, showers, payment 1usd per person, wifi. The owner, Mr. Oscar, is an excellent host.
Es un valneario piscina natural del  rio Miriumi, tiene baños, duchas pago 1usd por persona, wifi. El dueño el señor Oscar excelente anfitrion

name: At the edge of the Río Blanco
description: The point referenced just before did not suit us so we continued the track until we found this location next to the Río Blanco. This location is quiet and far from the madness of Baños, we had the visit of 2 women who welcomed us and who gave us fruits that they picked up in the forest. The location is not level but with a few stones it does the trick. Access is either by a small wooden bridge, but we did not dare to test, there is another access by crossing the river which does not pose any difficulty but the slope after is significant and requires power (I recommend 4WD). It is possible to take a bath in the river a little bit below, but it is really cold! On the road there are beautiful orchids. No Claro signal.

name: Nice loop to cross communities villages
description: Pretty little paved road that cross many communities. This is an opportunity to observe the houses on stilts and the villagers. The road maps are not all up to date but a bridge has just been built on the Río Puyo, this allows you to make a nice loop south of Puyo, from Shell to this coordinate -1.557927, -77.890969.

name: Parts for European cars ....
description:
GTA repuestos 
Very serious people that can import parts for abroad cars (European...) at good price.
Phone number : +593 99 813 6674

name: Hidden field from the road
description: Small space in a field just before a sign prohibiting going any further. Here you will be hidden from the road and there is little traffic noise. You may be surrounded by horses, donkeys and llamas. It's not completely flat but with shims it's perfect. A man on horseback passed by and greeted us, I deduced that our presence was not disturbing. Please note that this location is reserved for small vehicles because the U-turn is complicated. Perfect with a tent. Good 4G with Claro.

name: Páramo de Tinajillas
description: The previous point was not accessible (woodcutting in progress) so we continued the track (which is quite good for a 4wd) and found this place. It is an old path parallel to the track. It's flat and very quiet. Campers with tent will be able to continue on a small perpendicular path and arrive on a meadow, our 2.5m high camper could not go there because of the trees. In the evening a man came by to greet us and confirmed that we could sleep here. Some lumberjacks passed on the trail. Weak Claro signal.

name: Free Spirit Hostel
description: It’s an Hostel and cabanas. A place cosmopolite for surfers. The owner Anna is swiss from Lausanne. We have parked our big rig in front of the hostel and pay 12 dollars to stay include the dinner for 2 persons. The village of fishermen is authentic with just a few tourist facilities. No mass tourism here. We love it even if we dont surf.

name: Next to the soccer field
description: None of the points around suited us, too much mud or too exposed. We ended up finding this football field. There is a small place to park and it's quiet. We asked the villagers next door if it was possible to sleep here, they told us that there was no problem. In the morning you will be gently awakened by the roosters. No Claro signal.

name: Quinta Sierra de Fuego
description:
You're in for an **incredible experience**! We have everything you need to make your stay **unforgettable**:

Comfortable rooms with **hot water**.
**Wi-Fi** to keep you connected. **Television** for your entertainment.
Our cozy **café**.
**Multipurpose court** for sports enthusiasts.
**Billiard table** for endless fun.
**Green spaces** to relax in the midst of nature.
**Bonfire area** for magical nights.
**BBQ zone** to enjoy a delicious grill.
And even **karaoke** to unleash your artistic side!

**Phone**: +593992187924  
**Email**: sebasjd8@gmail.com

We're eager to welcome you and make your stay at **Quinta Sierra de Fuego** unforgettable. Don't hesitate to **contact us** and create special moments in our beautiful place!

name: Trailhead to Tatala waterfall
description: Here there's a shelter and bathrooms and some space to park. There's a parking area before you get here but I rode my motorbike to this point and parked in the shelter. If there's nobody around you could drive a car here. The waterfall is about a 30 minute walk. Bring good shoes as it's slippy. Don't use Google maps to get here, I'll add another post with the location where you turn off the main road onto a gravel road. Towards the end the gravel road gets very rough and may require 4x4. The waterfall is spectacular, well worth it.

name: Road to Tatala Waterfall
description: Turn off onto the gravel road here to get to Tatala Waterfall. It's about 14km from here on gravel.

name: Museo Punto Cero
description: The real equator line. It's a museum full of history and data about the real equator line. Patricio is the owner, call him before going. +593 979 163566

name: Public park in Rumipamba for cyclists
description: In Rumibamba, we asked to the lady of the tienda/restaurant where to camp and she said we could camp in the public park. Later I also asked to the owners of the cows next to us if that was alright and he said no problem.

name: Restaurant La Guarida del Coyota - Free room for cyclists
description: Delicious restaurant. When we arrived, we were offered to put the bikes in the backstore so we could enjoy the lunch without having to watch them. We were immediately offered to stay for the night and in a room that they have and don’t use in the back of the restaurant (which is also the owner’s house, Jorge). The room feels like it was the grandmother bedroom back in the days and is not used anymore. Very cozy, with 2 beds, a hot shower and internet. The owner and waiters are very kind and friendly, and specifically asked us to promote the free room among the bicycle travellers community.

name: Auto frenos express
description: Brake Shop Specialist for all Kind of Cars.

name: Banco Guayaquil parking lot
description: Large parking lot with a small park adjacent . Garbage cans , tienda across the street. Busy in the morning, quiet at night. Stayed two nights never talked with anyone ( no vigilantes).

name: Dead end street
description: I was traveling between Banos and San Lorenzo and it got late. There is a state of emergency in place and the curfew seems to vary so rather than deal with that I decided to find a place. I parked on the side of a street that dead ends at a small park with a playground. Tienda on the corner and several restaurants nearby. Very quiet and safe.

name: Servicio Eléctrico Automotriz CJ
description:
Great electrical mechanic.  Rebuilt our starter  with parts available locally. 
Very organized shop, meticulous work, and only charged around 10 usd an hour for labour! 
Small (super cute and kind family) business.
One of our best experiences with having to get things fixed so far. 
Only Spanish language, but we got by with Google translate.  
whatsapp +593 99 462 2794

name: Electro Mecanica Perez
description:
Electric Mechanic. Great service, we fixed our 12v charger and fixed a small issue with our battery. Very fair prices, only 5usd.
They sell batteries and small electric items for cars.

name: Hotel Cotopaxi & Pollo Sabroso
description:
Very local & nice option in El Corazon. The hotel is called Cotopaxi and is right at the main square. But at the chicken shop just across from it, the family is lovely and supportive of motorcyclists. Sergio the owner let me park my bike inside the restaurant overnight, made me dinner and breakfast for $8. The room at Cotopaxi was $10 (private bathroom, a little noisy.) If you want to contact them ahead of time, you can reach Ximena (the wife at pollo Sabroso) at +593 99 056 7746
They also own several fincas, and can arrange tours of that especially for bigger groups of travelers

name: Ingapirca Archaeological Complex
description:
Very well maintained Archaeological Complex. We arrived at 2pm and the official ticket desk informed us they had sold out of tickets for the day/ week. We needed to purchase one from one of the tour guides outside for $5 each.
It appeared buying a ticket from the guide behind a car was the only way we would could see the site. Also, discovered that we needed a guide to explore the site anyway.
Our guide spoke English and was very informative.
Also, the museum is worth a brief tour too.

name: Hacienda los Mortiños
description:
A gorgeous hacienda with well-appointed rooms with and a lovely dining room, all with large windows.

The rooms are not cheap - dorms start at $29-35 and go up from there.

More attractive for budget travellers would be the camping option, a couple of hundred metres away with views of Cotopaxi. Camping is $12.20

There is a restaurant with good (but again, above budget prices) meals. Mains are $12-14, and full dinner is $20

name: Chimborazo Basecamp lodge
description:
Wlady is a lovely host and has a beautiful lodge that you can park in, use the bathrooms, shower and entertaining area with a stunning view of Mount Chimborazo.
Wlady has professional guides for local hikes as well as climbing Mount Chimborazo. 
There is also the option to volunteer here. 
Contact Wlady before arriving on: +593 99-831-1282

name: Football court with roof
description: In the village of Piquer, there is a football court with a roof where you can camp for free and out of the rain. It's a small community with just 40 families living here, they are all very friendly. There is water, a bathroom, and even public wifi. There are a few stores in this village as well.

name: Playa Azul
description: Public parking area right on the beach. Stayed four days no problem.Ten minute walk to the happening spots on the Malecon. It was quiet. About 15 minutes walk is a TIA supermarket. Lots of restaurants close by. At the other end of the Malecon there is an open air fish market. It is a good spot!

name: Alao village
description:
Such a welcoming village. We were given a huge bag of potatoes and the gentleman refused any money.
Great walks up the local hills.

name: Vía a a la Cascada Escondida
description:
On the road to the hidden waterfall there is a space next to the river where we were able to park the truck. The very friendly people there came to say hello and told us that it was safe and quiet. The cold water river was very pleasant, we were able to cook and spend a quiet night

Sobre la vía a la cascada escondida hay un espacio al lado del rio donde pudimos parquear la camioneta. La gente del lugar muy amable se acercaban a saludar y nos dijeron que era seguro y tranquilo. El río de agua fría muy agradable, pudimos cocinar y pasar un noche tranquila

name: Tecnicentro Macas
description:
It is a general mechanic shop, we changed brake pads and brake shoes of our motorhome. Excellent service
----
Es un Taller de mecánica general.
Nosotros cambiamos pastillas y zapatas de freno de nuestra motorhome. Excelente atención

name: Bosque Petrificado Puyango
description:
The (supposedly) biggest petrified forest of South America. Open from 8am until 5pm. There is a small museum and you can walk two trails (~35 min & ~1 hr 20 mins). Since it was already 4pm we only did the short trail. The walk was nice and easy but the petrified forest in Argentina (Jaramillo) was much more impressive. 
When we came back, there was a lady and one of the artisans who set up their camp at the entrance. They told us, that we have to pay an entrance fee. 
Although the board says that people with a disability certificate are free of charge (see picture) they insisted that this is only valid for locals and my husband (who has a certificate) had to pay the full amount as well. We ended up paying USD 6 per person. Although the walk was nice, I think it was not worth the price.

name: Bio market
description:
Small store with all kind of ecologic products. Liquid detergents, solid shampoo, eco cosmetics, bambu toothbrush, food...
Good prices.

Tienda eco con todo tipo de productos: detergentes liquidos a granel, jabones solidos, champú sólido, cepillos de dientes de bambú, productos de cosmética, de alimentación, granos, especias...

name: La Carishina
description: My favorite pizza in Ecuador, a very nice place with very friendly people. They are VW lovers, if they are travelers and need help they will do it.

name: Free swings overlooking a beautiful valley
description: Two sets of swings that are not manned, so free to use.

name: Soma Beer Garden - brewery/ hostel
description:
Awesome selection of craft beers. Great venue to enjoy them in. Free wifi
Pinta - $5
Litre - $9

name: Parking Basilika Nuestra Senora de Elevacion
description:
El Cisne has only 1.532 (2010) inhabitants but a huge basilica. Every year on August 17 it is the destination for thousands of pilgrims. 
There is a huge levelled parking lot above the city. It is for free but doesn’t have any other amenities. We saw a free WiFi signal but couldn’t connect.
We spent a quiet night (except my husband said he heard the church bells around 5:30h - I was still fast asleep and didn’t hear anything). 

Police station is at the end if the parking lot.

Update: There is a grassy area but I don’t know if they would allow tents.

name: Basilica de Nuestra Señora de Elevación
description:
In the small town of El Cisne (in 2010 it had 1.532 inhabitants) there is a huge basilica. 
Each year on August 17 it is the destination for thousands of pilgrims. A (supposedly) nearly 2m high statue (tom me it seemed more like 1.5m) will then be brought to Loja in a 3-day procession. The statue will be part of a big event on September 8 in Loja and then be returned to El Cisne on November 3 (but this seems to be not in a procession). 
There are lots e souvenir and sweet shops in the streets around the basilica. 

Taking photos inside the basilica is prohibited.

!!! I just read about the pilgrimage in lonely planet. They provide a different timing. 
August 15: Procession in El Cisne
August 20: Arrival of statue in Loja 
November 1: Returning statue to El Cisne
Mai 30: smaller Ceremony in El Cisne

name: Ayawaska Urku Mirador
description:
We offer camping and traditional food of amazon maito with palmito, plantain, papachina and other food too.
We have medium speed wifi.
If you want a complete service in this place you can reserve just for 25 dollars per person, including the breakfast, and you can share ancestral knowledge with the Quichwa and Shuar  people, their food and drink.
You can have treatments with medicinal plants. There are two rivers around the community. the house is in front of the river.
If you want to collaborate or donate something that helps the community, you can do so voluntarily. You can also help with some work in field activities such as cultivation, sowing, harvesting and maintenance. If you want to come to this wonderful place the contact is: 0986437884- 0982835129. Mail, moya78486@gmail.com

name: Landslide
description: Passable on a small motorbike, decided against attempting to pass on an Africa Twin.

name: Fausto's Panela Production
description: Fausto welcomed us in his small Finca and showed us how to make Panela. He brought us to his organic field to cut the sugar cane and he made the juice in front of us. He is cooking one day per week so if you are lucky you can also witness the panela cooking production. Amazing experience!

name: Hostal Las Gardenias
description: We had a great stay here (the nicest of the 3 islands we stayed at). Run by a lovely family recently moved here from the mainland. They were happy for us to use the kitchen to cook for ourselves. The rooms are decent and good value for Galapagos. Helped us organise some of the trips and helpful with other info.  Worth contacting to book direct in our experience.

name: Lavandería Speed Wash
description: Lavandería with new clean American style washing mashines for self service. Small load 2$, Big load 4$, Drying 1$, so wax cheaper than many places we used before. Nice helpful guy, who changes to quarters. Was open even on Good Friday, also on Sundays.

name: Climax Vinos Espumantes & Cervezas Artesanales
description:
As always, such beautiful people. Alex makes a delicious variety of craft beers and wines out of Amazon fruits.
Well worth reaching out to him to visit his brewery/ house for tasting and buying/ supporting local drinks.
Message Alex on WhatsApp: +593 95-874-9411

name: in front of school
description: A few km from "El hondo los enamorados" there Is a spot in front of the school "nueva generación ", next to a clean river. Quiet and peaceful place to sleep, just the sound of the river. It's a free wide parking.

name: Grassy quiet spot next to river Ambato
description:
Relatively secluded, charming, grassy area next to river Ambato. Co-ordinates are the access from the Via Flores road from Ambato to Chimborazo.
There is a fair amount of garbage around which is a pity. Still a beautiful place, though.
Fire pits, some firewood.
Seems like a very safe place.
Fair cell reception (claro).
A few gnats in the evening.
Picture 1 is the entrance next to a little bridge.

name: APARCAMIENTO AL LADO DE BOMBEROS
description: We arrived at night at the lagoon type 7 pm, and we realized that in the day they charge the entrance to the entire complex of 0.50, but as we arrived at night there was no one taking care and we continued straight, we arrived next to the firefighters and spent a very quiet night, without noise, the next day early many vehicles arrive to park to play sports around the lagoon, but it does not affect in the slightest. We only stayed one night the next day we left normal through the main exit but there was no charge, although we realized that they were charging the entrance.

name: Quite lane off the main road
description:
Quite country lane between fields. No one drove or walked passed that we were aware.
Flat ground for cooking and and sleeping. 
 - No facilities.
 - Decent Claro signal.

name: Big landslide
description: I tried to ride this route from sigchos to pucuyacu but the road here is blocked by a huge landslide. I thought I could get my bike through by taking off the panniers but a local rider passing through told me is gets worse further down and not even small bikes can pass.

name: Touristic gas
description: After searching in some places we finally got a touristic gas in the shop Bordado. Was 22$ for a large bottle :/

name: Las Flores Park
description: Las Flores Park have a big parking with bathrooms at day, water. The place Is Quiet and safe. Close to a shopping center. In the morning people come to exercise. This Is a good option to spend the night

name: Mexican Food MIL AMORES
description: The restaurant, run by a lovely Mexican, has only recently opened. It serves typical, authentic Mexican food such as quesadillas, tacos, burritos and more. Very tasty! But bring a little time with you. It's a bit more pricey, but perfect if you're looking for a bit of variety in your meal.

name: Centro de tecnologías FUNHABIT
description:
Translation: Training center offering Overlander accommodation and arrival possibilities. Very safe place in a natural environment, you can learn a lot about organic agriculture and local development.

Centro de capacitación que ofrece posibilidades de alojamiento y llegada de Overlander. Lugar muy seguro en un entorno natural, se puede aprender mucho sobre agricultura orgánica y desarrollo local.

name: La Guardia del Coyote
description: It's an Asian oriented restaurant with a very kind owner that loves to host cyclists and travellers. He provides a private room with shower and toilet. He doesn't charge anything.

name: Beware of dogs!
description: For those doing Quilotoa Loop: there are some unfriendly dogs on this route: village Guayma-San Pedro. Better bring your walking sticks with you!

name: Vulcanizadora 24 horas
description:
opened 24h call at 0967039739 if not open. 
very good, recommended
opening hours during the day 9h-22h

name: Hacienda La Vega
description:
Hacienda La Vega is located in the beautiful Intag valley, close to García Morena. It’s an excellent place to rest and relax, surrounded by nature. Forests , rivers , waterfalls and walks nearby. Perfect for taking a break or to split the trip from Mindo to Laguna cuicocho o Otavalo.
Part of the road is unpaved, but not in bad condition.
On their farm they have cattle, horses and many other animals. The 3 dogs are very friendly.
Juancarlos’ family is incredibly friendly, helpful and attentive. 
They also rent cabaños with  bathrooms  and serve food. 
I can highly recommend

name: Wild camping in front of Podocarpus National Park entrance
description: Nice and calm spot for vehicles of all sizes on the way to the Refugio of the Podocarpus National Park. Really nice, green and with a good view over the valley. You could also set up a tent here (though I don’t know if national park authorities would appreciate that). It can be reached on a gravel road that (under normal conditions) isn’t a problem for a 2WD (as ours). The park itself opens between 8am and 5pm, so it’s a good option in case you arrive later during the day. Further up the road (within 2 km) there are two or three more spots to park a vehicle of all sizes before you finally arrive at the entrance gate that is closed during the night. There might be a metal chain at the National Park archway down at the main road in later hours during the day. This one can easily be put aside for vehicle entrance. There are locals living further up the hill that use the road 24/7 to get to their homes anyway. We asked the locals if it’s okay to stay with the car up in the hills for a night and they were very welcoming and said that it’s absolutely no problem, safe and quiet.

name: Leforet craft Brewery/ pub
description:
Great little micro brewery, serving and selling a delicious selection of beers brewed on site.
We were welcomed with a free tasting. Prices are reasonable for the beers and food. Easy parking on the road outside. Cosy entertaining areas. Free fast wifi and power sockets all over.

name: Mi Refugio
description:
Hostal with paintball field, easily accessible by van. Ask for Don Rafa, $10/night

Hostal avec terrain de paint ball accessible en van sans problème. Demander Don Rafa, 10$/nuit

name: Bomberos El Tambo
description: Really friendly bomberos host cyclists (only). Stayed here 2019 and again 2024. Huge area in the first floor to put your mattress and sleeping bag. Could also fit self standing tents (but what for?). Cold shower was offered downstairs. Upstairs next to where you sleep are toilets. They let us use the kitchen. Bikes securely stored inside.

name: Cristal auto - Windscreens, windows etc
description:
Super efficient. Pulled up, given a fair price and installed super quick.
No fuss service. 
cristalautos.com

name: Iglesia de Ichubamba
description: You can camp at the church in the village of Santo Domingo. Ask for permission at the store across the street. You can also camp at the football field nearby. Very quiet area and super friendly locals. Free.

name: Family park
description:
Great spot to take a break, have lunch. Really nice park looks relatively new. Close to a really nice campground where we stayed! The town of Sucua itself was also super clean and really nice!

Some of the playground items are in disrepair, but overall it looks like a nice place to stretch your legs. There’s also a large paved walkiing / running path around the perimeter and a small bike track for kids.

name: Buen Lugar para acampar en la montaña
description: A good place to camp, we spent one night, it was quiet. It is a mine, dump trucks pass by but until 7 in the afternoon from then on it is quiet until the next day, around 7 in the morning, when they go back to work.

name: Dreamkapture Hostel
description:
A little bit run down but a nice backpacker hostel with a small courtyard, free breakfast buffet and a small courtyard to park a couple of motorbikes.
Prices for one person:
$22 private room with shared bathroom
$25 private ensuite
$29 private ensuite with AC
$3 to park a motorbike inside
Dorms are around $15 but I'm not sure exactly.

name: Solar Specialist (RENOVAENERGÍA)
description:
First solar technician that were able to clearly resolve our electrical issues.
They didn’t try and sell us anything. 
Peter clearly explained our electrical set up and options on how to improve.
Highly recommend.
Peter: +593 98 4989 688
Or +593 98-700-0710

name: Next to Police-Station
description: Next to the police station is a large area for all types of camping. Covered playing field and playground/fitness area. Very safe and quiet. Claro4G.

name: Copedesa gas station
description: Super nice gas station with security cameras, free Wi-Fi, free coffee, brand new showers, air conditioned lobby, and a fast food chicken restaurant. It also has an ATM and you can buy 20L bottles of water.

name: Along the river
description:
Nous avons passé 1 nuit, le long de la rivière, plat, grand espace herbeux, au bord d’un chemin caillouteux, facile d’accès, pas de services, plusieurs restaurants à 300 m.
Très bruyant le samedi soir: des jeunes avec leur voiture musique à fond….
Pas de problèmes d’insécurité selon les riverains.

We spent 1 night, along the river, flat, large grassy area, at the edge of a stony path, easy to access, no services, several restaurants 300 m away.
Very noisy on Saturday evening: young people with their cars playing loudly….
No insecurity problems according to local residents.

name: Camping Playa Cañaveral
description:
Really nice camping spot right at the beach among the palm trees. You can park 5 meters from the sand on a nice flat grassy area. Very quiet and peaceful. Basically no other visitors at the beach during the time we were there. The ocean is quite beautiful and has nice water temperature. Infra structure is basic but more than enough: good cold showers, running water, hammocks under the shade, and electricity. We didn’t use the internet so I’m not sure about the quality. Water is not potable just like other places nearby. 

There are a couple of restaurants and tiendas nearby if you want to buy basic stuff.

The owner Thiago is a super nice and friendly guy who will give you plenty of help and space for you to enjoy. You can contact him (Spanish only) at +5930989990161. Paid $5pp.

name: Parking Lot Next to the Church
description:
Flat area Parking next to the church. 
We spend one night. Quite and safe. Close to the restaurants, supermarket and kid playground. 
Free wifi

name: Museo de Los Amantes de Sumpa
description:
Nice museum where you can learn about the ecuatorian culture and you can see Loa Amantes de Sumpa where the arqueologist founded. Nice and free. The people súper nice and friendly. 

Time: 8:30 to 16:30 Every day, Sunday to Sunday

name: Street camping: G. Alvarez
description:
We sleep here 1 night whit our RV 7'3m.
The neighbourds super fine and welcoming.
We take the lunch in the restaurant La Brissa, good foid and nice price. They sharing the wifi with us. 
10 m to Super Maxi grocery. 

The street was quiet and safe.

name: Special American car's, José Mechanic
description:
Jose have a workshop in Quito Ecuador, he is a specialist in american cars, he helped us to fix our motorhome, he did a great job!

Call José before ±593 984024892

name: Water
description:
Very good water pressure at the P&S station, with high pressure cleaner if necessary.

Très bonne pression d’eau à la station P&S, avec nettoyeur haute pression au besoin.

name: middle of a field
description:
We slept here for 1 night, for lack of anything better…flat land, very very quiet.
In the middle of an earthy field.
Be careful there are holes in the ground, but it passes easily.
Nous avons dormi 1 nuit ici, à défaut de mieux…terrain plat, très très calme.
Au milieu d’un champ terreux.
Attention il y a des trous dans le sol, mais ça passe facilement.

name: Parking lot
description:
we spend the night on street besides of Outlet. super quiet and nobody around include houses. the security guard tell us than the street is public, so, you can park without problems. on day you can left your van here and walk 100 meters to the cumbaya center... BUT...
If you need to left early, don't park in the end of the street because the employees let theirs cars all over the street in three lines covering every exit. so, you can park right in the corner or next to the gate. 

se puede estacionar en esta calle sin salida y pasar la noche sin problemas. el seguridad nos dijo que la calle es pública así que no es problema. durante el día podes estacionar y recorrer cumbaya a pie. pero si querés pasar la noche y salir temprano, no estaciones en el fondo del callejón porque a la mañana siguiente ocupan los 3 carriles de la calle y no podes salir. es preferible estacionar pegado al portón o en la esquina así no quedas bloqueado.

name: Parking in Bajo Alto
description:
In Bajo Alto there is nowhere to park but established park places. 
This one is a family house and they provide their space in front the house for parking. 
They let us spend the night, use electricity, wifi, shower, toilet, wash our clothes by hand. Very lovely people, we shared breakfast together.
5 dollars per night.
Ask for Sonnia Gomez.

The beach is not worth it. It's quite dirty. But it's the only one between Quayaquil and Perú borders we know of.

name: La Casita del Bosque
description:
Great spot for tent or motorhome. There are dorms and a little (and basic) cabin too.
Electricity and drinkable water, two WC and a (cold) shower are available 24/7. 
There are five adorable dogs, but is not advisable to bring your pet.
Javier is a great host! 099 581 8801 is his mobile number

name: La hueca del chivo - restaurant and camp site
description: This nice restaurant on the side of the road has a big parking space behind (OK for big rigs) where you can stay overnight for free. Access to clean toilets and to water to refill the camper's tank. Very friendly and welcoming people. Great food!

name: Terpel gas station
description: A big gas station with lots of place to park. Bathroom  24 hours open. safe. non potable water. no wifi. electricity plugs available to be used. Claro and Movistar work perfect

name: Terpel
description:
Translation: Gas station with large parking for trucks, cars and buses to spend the night. Cold water shower (excellent), with convenience and restaurant. There is security at night.

Posto de combustível com estacionamento grande para caminhões, carros e ônibus para passar a noite. Ducha de água fria (excelente), com conveniência e restaurante. Durante a noite tem segurança.

name: Paradero Reina del Cisne
description: Restaurant for long distance buses. Lots of food rapidly ready. Averagely clean. But big parking space (OK for big rigs) and access to toilets (OK cleanliness). A bit noisy (road close by and buses stopping)... but not too many places to stop on this road...

name: Pucará de Rumicucho
description:
Parking of the place where you can stay overnight.
Very safe place, there is a bathroom and water.
Pets are allowed. There are trails. They charge 2 dollars and with that payment you enter the Ruins, museum and the Oasis

Estacionamiento del lugar donde te puedes quedar a pernoctar.
Lugar muy seguro hay Baño y agua.
Se aceptan mascotas. Hay senderos. Cobran 2 dlls y con ese pago se ingresa a las Ruinas, museo y al Oasis

name: School in Laihua Chiquizungo
description:
I am a cyclist and I was able to camp inside this school. There is an empty room on the second floor of the main building where you can hide from the wind and rain. I asked at the tienda in this community if I could camp somewhere in this village and the man actually suggested I sleep inside the empty room. No one lives on the school property so it's easy to just go in. Make sure to leave early in the morning. Free.
Also, the tienda has basic supplies.

name: Primax gas station
description:
we park in front of market close to the bathroom. some noise because the trucks at night and route but always is the same in this kind of road station.
fine for spend the night. free wifi.

name: Mechanic Dr Auto
description:
the owner Javier help us with little problems with our direction of our VW kombi. we enjoy this place chatting with his family and workers. receive travellers for help with theirs vehicles. highly 
recommend.

gran taller donde el dueño Javier y familia nos recibió con mucho cariño y nos dieron una mano con algunas cosas de la kombi. súper amigables y les encanta recibir viajeros. 
muy recomendables.

name: tapiceria/upholstery
description: Small shop. Miguel (0969679610) did a good and fast job to recover an armchair for us. He does all kind of tapestry works for cars, sofas, etc.

name: Escuela of Chocar (cyclists only)
description:
I camped inside the school property. Asked at the tienda nearby and they said no problem. There is an iglesia right next to the school which is also an option, but is completely visible. The best spot to camp is probably by the cocina building inside the school which is right behind the iglesia. This spot is completely hidden from the road and has a bit of a roof to hide from the rain, enough for a single person tent. 
The gas station near Joyagshi does not allow camping so this place would be an alternative if you are looking for a place to sleep in the area.

name: Hostal Casa Blanca
description:
Nice little hotel. Safe parking space for motorcycles. They have space for about 6 big motorcycles.
Cars can park across the street in the neighbours secure parking lot. No height restriction to enter.

Our matrimonial room was 20 USD. Very clean, good got showers. Wifi was ok. 
They have a 24h-reception and stuff was friendly.
In this area there are a lot of local restaurants. It's about 2 km walk to the port. Safe area.

name: Centro Cultural camping
description:
you can park in the parking lot for free (neighbors give you water and toilet) or you can park at the Centro Cultural, under the roof with shade. They give you electricity, water, toilet access. It is safe. Ask for Manuel.
They had temporary WiFi, but we got wifi from the restaurant next door.

name: Hosteria Santval
description:
Very nice hotel next to the Road. Very quiet, safe, and peaceful, very friendly owner. Double room for 40 (usually it’s 50 but we asked for a discount) without breakfast. Probably also parking for big rigs is possible.
Includes a restaurant, which isn’t budget but good food.

name: La Palmira
description: Very nice hostel 50 Meters away from the PanAm. Rooms 11,20 per Person for a cabin-like matrimonial with a private bathroom. Good Wifi, The showers were cold but we were the only guests and didn’t reclaim it, as it was a warm enough day. The place is surrounded by lovely gardens and fruit trees. There is also a swimming pool with slides, but it was under construction when we were there. Very friendly administration. Safe for parking cars, motorcycles and bikes. There is a height limit at the entrance so don’t know if big rigs can enter. At weekends also restaurant service. Place is run by volunteers “club de voluntarios de la fuerza terrestre”. Best recommendations!

name: Del Castillo Cafe
description: Great breakfast spot if you're staying at one of the hotels/hostels in this area. $4.50-5.75 for a really nice breafast. The coffee is great too.

name: Plaza Lourdes
description:
we sleep here one night, calm and secure. Near the center.

Dormimos al costado de la iglesia una noche aqui, muy tranquilo y seguro.
Un poco complicado subir hasta aqui pero hay que buscar la calle con menos pendiente.

name: El Lechero
description:
A popular local tourist attraction that features a couple of “lechero” trees (named for its milky sap) purported to be the result of a forbidden romance between a princess and a commoner. Their tears filled the nearby Lago San Pablo, according to legend. Touching the lechero trees is supposed to be restorative, but that is probably due to the fact that it places you between the volcanoes Imbabura and Cotacachi with a panoramic view of the lake and the Otavalo Valley. We walked here as part of a self-guided walking tour from Hostal Curińan that also took in Parque del Condor raptor rescue centre and Peguche Waterfall. Google maps states the circuit takes about 2 1/2 hours on foot. The route is also possible by car.
It’s a peaceful and beautiful place.

name: Galapagos Deli
description:
Galapagos Deli is a liitle gem downtown. 
Great menu of fresh sandwiches, pizza’s, salads, cakes and helados artesanales. Every thing is homemade in a very transparent open kitchen.
I have enjoyed the smallest sized pizza quatro stagione, their fresh salad di la casa and a sandwich integral bread, with ham, cheese and tomatoes.
The man (owner?) is part of the furniture.
The rest of staff are Ecuadorean ladies who all speak reasonably English.
The restaurant including bathroom facilities are hygienic and tables and floor are directly cleaned after your visit.
Locals appreciate this place as well for celebrating birthdays with family and friends in style.

name: Migration Office
description:
Inside the airport and upstairs is the migration office. Here you can apply for a visa extension. You need a photocopy of the main page and entry stamp and show your physical passport. There's a photocopy service in the architects office in the food court. They give you a piece of paper which you need to take to a specific bank to pay the fee. It's two stops on the tram to the bank. You need to be in Ecuador between 80-90 days to apply for the extension. If you have a vehicle, bring the extension to the aduana nearby to get your TIP extended.
Edit: for the TIP extension you will need a "record migratorio". This needs to be requested from the same migration office and costs $5 which had to be paid at the same bank. Save yourself a lot of time by asking for this when you ask for the visa extension.

name: Food court
description: The food court upstairs in the airport has free WiFi. The password is written on the walls.

name: Cabanas Oyacachi
description:
Adorable Cabanas near the hot springs town of Oyacachi. It was $15/night for 1 person including breakfast, and $5 for a fresh trout dinner. The cabanas are also a trout farm so you can’t get fresher than that. Cabin came with firewood and a wood stove, hot water shower, but no cell signal and no WiFi. 

The setting is gorgeous, the hot springs in town are nice and less touristy than Papallacta, and it’s an area not many foreigners explore. The family that runs this place is Kichwa so that’s a fun experience too. Highly recommended coming here. 

You can contact them at ‪+593 99 370 0529‬ but they require a deposit to confirm reservations, which I never got to work so I just showed up.

name: Aduana - vehicle TIP extension
description:
After getting a visa extension here is where you get the TIP extension. There's no sign outside, it's just an old looking building on the corner.
You'll need colour copies of the following: 
1. Original TIP
2. Récord Migratorio (obtainable from migration office)
3. Vehicle title/registration 
4. Passport

name: Tres Colinas Pululahua
description:
Fantastic spot at the base of the volcano crater! Amazing 360 degree views and an easy walk to three trailheads. ( the mirador, el chivo and pondona.
There were several hot showers and banos, a pool ( extra cost) and a restaurant for $12/night for two adults in a van. There are several very cute cabanas to rent as well. 
We spent one night camped  here and the previous night at Castillo de Lobo steakhouse down the road which had great tomahawk steaks for $15 and camping was $10/ night but they didn’t have showers of any kind. 
Friendly owners at both places and a super unique experience to sleep in one of only 2 inhabited volcanic craters in the world. 
We highly recommend.

name: Nazca restaurant in Puerto Ayero
description:
Nazca restaurant is a pleasant restaurant with good value for money lunches, almuerzo. 6,5 US $ for a starter, main with juice and postre. 
The waiter is sincerely kind and speaks some adorable English.
Many locals is always a good sign !

name: calle hampton
description:
quiet street with a good neighborhood, spectacular central to stay a couple of nights, better if it is fds because it has almost no cars, and they don't charge parking, it only has a family that takes care of the street and they accept any collaboration. safe neighborhood.
------------
calle apacible con buen vecindario, central espectacular para quedarse un par de noches, mejor si es fds por qué no tiene casi autos, y no cobran estacionamiento solo tiene una familia que cuida la calle y aceptan cualquier colaboración. barrio seguro.

name: TJ Galapagos food experience
description:
A very pleasant place with great staff. 
I enjoyed their happy hour cocktails which actually are available all day.
10 US$ for 2 is a good deal on the mian street with views on the Plaza Central and Ferries terminal.
High quality seats and good Wifi

name: Motostop Tecnicentro
description: Good selection of tyres for big bikes. Pirelli, Kenda, Metzler. Also a workshop and motorbike clothing for sale.

name: Flat Pull Out Beside Street
description:
It’s just a huge levelled pullout above Rio Intag besides the street shortly after a small settlement coming from the south. No infrastructure, a nice view towards the river and no traffic during the night. Cows in the morning.

On our way from Mindo to Otavalo we turned left at Nanegalito and took the smaller roads. Until Nanegalo the road is narrow but paved and in good condition. Then follows a ~ 55 km long stretch of unpaved road with potholes but often beautiful views. After crossing Rio Pamplona we turned left and immediately crossed Rio Intag. The whole stretch of unpaved road took us nearly 3 hours. There aren’t many options to spend the night along that narrow road. We were glad to find this spot.

name: Parqueadero Santa Rosa
description:
A great spot to spend a few days while you visit historic Quito as it’s a short Trolly ride (.35c ) away. 
The parking lot managers name is Angel and he speaks very good English. He lives on the property with his wife and is very helpful. He held a package for us which was very much appreciated and he offered some tips on things to see and do. 
There is a bathroom on the property but no shower. There is also a guard dog who is quiet and curious but we are unsure how she would be with other dogs. 
The property is very secure with high walls and the entrance has zero height restrictions which makes it good for larger vehicles. This would also be a good place to store your rig while you visit Galápagos Islands or fly somewhere from the international airport. 
We were allowed to sleep in our van and could use electricity if required. 
$5/ night for 2 people in a van. 
Great place! Very clean.

name: Mare&Vento
description: Very nice place by the beach, with a lot of palm trees, a little hot and mosquitoes here, very quiet , there are not many houses and people here, 4 km far from the town where you can have a great sea food lunch. Owners are very kindly, very clean warm shower and toilete. $5pppn. We stayed five days.

name: Road closed to large vehicles
description:
bridge is closed. there is another bridge with a hight restriction of approx. 2m.
Locals told us, the bridge has been closed for two years already. no way from here to Tena  for any vehicle higher than 2m.

name: Petro Ecuador gas station and showers!
description:
Free showers that are clean and have hot water!
There’s even a shampoo dispenser for $1. The gardens and bathrooms at this gas station are top notch as well. 
We will make sure to buy gas at more Petro Ecuador stations in the future.

name: Francisco & Verito
description:
Hot springs, parking space and overnight stay.
--------------
Termas rio caldo, aguas termales, espacio para estacionar y pasar la noche

name: Hotel Caribbean Real
description: It is possible to park at the hotel.  offers a heated water park for U$$5.00 where you can take a shower and use the bathroom.  from 8 am to 5 pm.  breakfast for U$$3.00.not recommended for big rigs

name: Pachay - Montecristi hat
description:
Since three generations they are producing hats in an artisanal way. 
Freddy is super nice and took the time to explain all the details related to processing steps and available qualities from standard (30$) to fino-fino (500$). 
Possibility to purchase here your hat. Staff friendly and welcoming. 
We recommend highly ! 
Tel : 0997591155 / pachayhats1986@hotmail.com

name: Closed to a river
description:
Track ending on a riverside. At the entrance of the track there is a gym center and they confirmed us the place is safe.  Dey quiet night. Small flies in the evening that did not allow us to have diner outside… 
Very quiet night. 
No info about signal coverage as we are using Starlink. Possibility to by street food closed by.

name: Parcadero Santa Rosa
description: We left our van in this lot for two weeks. Angel works here. He speaks perfect English and will send photos of your vehicle every few days for reassurance. You can also sleep here although we didn’t. I believe the toilets are open 24 hours but ask Angel. +593 99 743 2909. Very safe. Space for all kinds of vehicles. We paid $5 a day but think you could get it for less.

name: hostal
description: great hotel, very cheap, room is good, Big and clean, 10 dollars two persons

name: Estacion de bomberos Ascazubi
description:
Came here cycling, two persons.
After leaving Otavalo we wanted to rest a little bit. We came to this fire station. We were welcoming. They all are kind people. The invited us without any hesitation. They gave us a room only for us.

Hot shower, slow wifi, there is a kitchen that you can use. 

Highly recommended.

name: Hacienda La Laurita
description: A beautiful farm, where we have space to park campers, and where they will have access to bathrooms, water, electricity and internet.

name: Aparcamiento al lado de la UPC bahia amplia.
description:
Good place next to the park next to the river, we walked to the Biblical basilica, quiet night next to the UPC, we had no problems spending the night.
Buen lugar al lado del parque junto al rió, fuimos caminando hasta la basilica de biblian, noche tranquila al lado de la UPC no nos colocaron problemas para pasar la noche.

name: La Hacienda
description:
Very good and friendly restaurant.
Best Juca papas fritos
Worth to go

name: Aduana Checkpoint
description: Aduana check point, asked to see my TIP. No issues.

name: La Hacienda
description:
It is a very nice family with two children. 
If you eat at the restaurant, you can sleep at the parking from the restautant. Otto an the family are si helpful wirh everything. 
Highly recommended!

name: Casa ciclista
description:
This is a casa ciclista owns by Leo. He is a really nice guy. He is a taller for the bici and can help you to fix them. 
He proposes you to pitch your tent under the rooftop or in a little cabane behind the house. We could use his kitchen.

Hot shower, toilets, we didn’t ask for the wifi.

You give him a tip as you want .

This is really simple and basic, you can rest a little bit before the Chimborazo.

name: Albita Grill Bar Restaurant
description:
Lovely restaurant in town, close to the Mercado Municipal. Good value for money menu del dia for 8 $. 
I enjoyed the entrada of a fresh salad, and a spaghetti pomodore. Free juice and postre. Free Wifi and nice outdoor terrace. Also a destiny for bigger tourist groups who are accompanied by a local guide. Still worth visiting and recommendable

name: No idea
description:
Great lovely street of restaurants on both sides. 
The 5 $ deals are a thrill for both locals with their families, tourist groups and solo travelers like me.
Awesome ambience and vibes.

name: village
description: nice village. arrived here early didnt camp. asked the owner of the tienda if its possible to camp in this village she told me yes. I guess its better to stay here than in a dirty hospedaje in Buenos Aires. around 2h30 to ride there from Buenos Aires.

name: Hosteria Capillapamba
description: Restaurant and cabañas on the border of the road but in the middle of the nature, next to a river, perfect to rest. The food is good and prices are ok, the accommodation was really comfy. We had a private cabin for 35$ with double bed, breakfast included and all commodities. The staff is friendly. The speciality is trout !

name: La Bonita
description: Little town with a parking place next to the police station. I asked and it was ok and this was the best spot in town. It’s big enough for big rigs. Level. Restaurant at the corner for food and a toilet. No signal.

name: Military checkpoint
description: Military checkpoint. Friendly personal. Probably because you travel parallel to the border for so long.

name: Hornidos Rosita Restaurante
description:
Hornados ( roasted pork)is a big deal here in Ecuador and Riobamba is the epicentre for it!
We were directed here by Juan, the delightful owner of Finca Castillo del Altura which is also listed as an awesome place to stay on Ioverlander. 

Hornados Rosita is located on a street with many Hornado restaurants but this one is the most popular and was really delicious. We shared the El Mas Querido plate between us for $6 which was more than enough and allowed us to try a little bit of everything! 
They offer cervesa, jugos natural, soft drinks and water to drink and for dessert they have ice cream novelties or try the grilled plantain filled with fresh cheese for $1.
There’s not many tourist attractions here in Riobamba but this is worth stopping in for especially before or after your visit to Chimborazo.
The bathrooms are clean!

name: Pizza Italia
description:
Gabrielo the excellent cook is from Italy. 
Is on the island for since 2008 with this great pizzeria to eat at and also for take aways.
One of my favorites is a pizza with anchovies and capers : found anchovies hard to find in Galapagos. 
A few calls between locals confirmed my order.
Together with a great cold red wine, Fantini Montepulciano d’Abruzzo and aqua con gass, I experienced a great last dinner in Puerto Ayero.

name: Mecánico y Camping - Estrella
description:
Translation: Jorge is a good mechanic, patient and tidy and his family is lovely. He can help with inspections and repairs, as well as offering a place to rest in tranquil Pujilí before climbing or after visiting the impressive Quilotoa lagoon.
In its space you can park for a few days and it offers an electricity point, a water point, a clean bathroom with a hot shower, Wi-Fi, the possibility of help with the management of other services... 3pp
+593 99 835 8785 Jorge Estrella

Jorge es un buen mecánico, paciente y ordenado y su familia es encantadora. Él puede ayudar con revisiones y reparaciones, además de ofrecer un lugar donde descansar en el tranquilo Pujilí antes de subir o después de visitar la impresionante laguna Quilotoa.
En su espacio puedes parquear unos días y ofrece punto de electricidad, de agua, baño limpio con ducha caliente, wifi, posibilidad ayuda con la gestión de otros servicios… 3pp
+593 99 835 8785 Jorge Estrella

name: Dos Reservas
description: Large parking lot for vehicles of all sizes. On the main road. Light traffic during the day. Quiet at night. Nice cafe. Toilets. Rooms available. Food on request. Beautiful nature (river). Short hike to a fantastic waterfall (5,-$ approximately. Also possible without guide). Guided hikes. Horseback riding on well-groomed and healthy horses. Double room $20. We didn't stay overnight, but can recommend the place.

name: Jorge Estrella
description: Jorge Estrella, good mechanic and better person. It also offers a place and services (see the description in the other point marked on the map)

name: Estacionamento na Rua
description:
Street parking next to the skate park. There are paid bathrooms in the square. 300m from the center, quiet place.
--
Estacionamento na rua ao lado da pista de skate. Possui banheiros pagos na praça. 300m do centro, lugar tranquilo.

name: Biking Spirit bike and hiking tours
description:
