If you are interested in booking a mountain biking trip DOWN Chimborazo then this is the company to go with. They are not located at this spot but the guide, Edison, is very good friends with this family so you can stay here AND start your trip from here. 
Edison will meet you here at Finca Castillo del Altura with a support truck, bikes, helmets etc and will drop you off here after your epic ride. 
The price is $85USD pp and includes a delicious lunch ( veg and vegan options) all transport, snacks and hot tea at the halfway point and total support along the way. 
It was about a 6 hr day and despite the cold, fog and bit of snow at the top we had an amazing time. This will likely be our most favourite and memorable experience in Ecuador. 
If you don’t stay here at the finca then Edison will pick you up wherever you are. 

The $85 trip is for more experienced riders and is primarily off road. He also offers a $70 trip which is primarily on the highway from Chimborazo to San Juan. 

Contact him via whatapp 
593 99415 6348

http://www.bikingspirit.com

Edison offers hiking trips as well. We highly recommend him.

name: Hacienda Gonzabal
description:
Bike-friendly Hacienda Gonzabal can be reached in less than an hour from Loja. This touristic corridor has interesting options, If your plans are not to stay in the city, this is a very friendly place. Easy to find the road (carretera E35 to Catamayo), sign, and then unpaved and good shape and you get to the Hacienda. Local food and good options of bird-watching, try the Gonzabal produce and Rosa will offer you a marvellous breakfast! If you'd need to hit the Panamericana again, there is a detour that in less than 30min you can be facing north without going back to Loja.
On those days where you'd rather sleep on a bed and have a good rest, this can be the place. Rather call MCarmen in advance: +593 99 945 0545

name: Restaurante cueva de los tayos (cyclist)
description:
Came here cycling 2 persons.
This is a restaurante. The owner couple have the habits to host the bicycle travelers. There is a building next to the restaurante where you can pitch the tent for FREE. 

They proposed us a shower, wc, wifi. 

They are really kind people. There are shops nearby. You can eat at the restaurante.

name: Restaurante 3 dolares Almoço
description:
Very good food and cheaper than the restaurant next to the tree house. Tea, starter soup, main course and juice.

comida muito boa e mais barato que o restaurante prox a casa de árvore. Chá, sopa de entrada, prato principal e suco.

name: Bomberos Sucua (cyclist
description:
Came here cycling , two persons.
We asked if we can stay one night. They accepted and took our passports.
We slept with our tent in a big room
wc, hot shower, wifi? 
Friendly staff.

name: Lavanderia
description:
Lavenderia very cheap.
0,40 per lb : clean and dry.

2 hours and that’s it !

name: Bridges impassable
description: Both bridges are not passable at the moment! You can drive a detour via Misahualli to go south. There you should ask the locals (exactly!) which gravel road is the good one to Ahuano! There a boat can bring any size of vehicle to the other side.

name: Restaurante La Choza
description:
We were allowed to camp here.  We slept under one of several shelters and had electricity, fast WiFi, drinking water and toilets. The place is very clean. The very friendly and knowledgeable Armando (the owner of the restaurant) told us that he would like to accommodate more travelers.

We had a meal in his restaurant;  the food was good but I am more concerned with helping other travelers find a good place to sleep.

name: Coral Tree Lodge
description:
You will find a paved parking space on the property of our lodge. The square is concrete and measures 2.70m wide and 6m long. The access is suitable for campers up to 4 tonnes. 

We offer a covered terrace for your tables and chairs. The square is illuminated at night - if you want. From the pitch you have a panoramic view of the Andes, about 35 km away. There is also a place for a campfire. Power connection 110V and 220V is available. Your water tanks can be refilled. Water connection is available. Gray water and composting toilets can be disposed of with us. But not black water! For an additional charge you can take warm showers and do your laundry. We also bake rolls or German bread for an additional charge.

We are a married couple from Germany and speak German, English and Spanish. We have three dogs on the property. If you have a dog, decide for yourself whether it gets along with other dogs. Bikers are also welcome. We also have a holiday apartment with a kitchen, bathroom and large bed.
WIFI is free and available at the pitch. We look forward to seeing you, because we were enthusiastic campers ourselves in Germany.
Have a good trip!

You can find contact information for inquiries or bookings on our website.
On our website you can see in our booking calendar whether the "Plaza de chuko" space is free or not.

name: in front of Cabañas Miramar
description: Cabañas Miramar have some tables and benches under the roof cross the street in front of their house right on the beach. we spent one night with our motorhome parked next to the tables and then one night in a tent. there are two plugs and the family gives you internet and lets you use the toilet they have for public but since it's so quiet village we were the only one using it. very kind family. quiet and safe village. beautiful beach

name: Yacu Reserve Camping
description: Tiny paradise-like camping close to the road, basic ammenities. There is a sign advertising the camping and a little shop. The house on the other side of the road is where the owners live. They brought us to a beautiful little stream where we camped under a big tarp. Natural shower in the river and dry toilet, only place for one or two small tents. She asked 10 USD for a night (we were two) and we negotiated 8 USD. Also offer meals in their house.

name: Limon Indanza Park
description:
We stopped one night in the square, on the sidewalk of the tourist office. In the square there is free wifi and water. Very nice place.

Dormimos aqui frente a la plaza de Limon, en la oficina de turismo y la iglesia. Hay wifi libre y agua. Hay bastante movimiento hasta las 22 y a partir de las 6, pero se duerme tranquilo.

name: Kawsana Family Owned Farms
description: If you want to taste and buy very good coffee, it’s the good place. The production is organic and all the process is made by themself. With 3 différents Arabica and 3 différents type of toast and lavadoes. A lot of choice and you can taste and see the arte of the préparation.

name: Nex to River Piatua
description:
beautiful place to rest next to the river piatua, super crystal clear. Nearby there are some spa facilities, they are free, but there was music and we stayed a little earlier, next to the river. 
---------
hermoso lugar para descansar al lado del rio piatua, super cristalino. Cerca hay unas instalaciones del balneario, son gratuitas, pero habia musica y nos quedamos un poco antes, al lado del rio.

name: Zayapa Ice cream & coffee
description:
Lovely place just off the pier, next to Hotel La Zayapa with a modest 5 table terrace at the boulevard, and some seats inside.
Small but very well thought about menu.
I had several breakfast moments here and they were good value for money. 8 $ for 2 fried eggs, toast, butter and jam, cafe con leche, fresh fruit juice, yoghurt with granola and some fresh fruits.
Bonus is probably one of the best Wifi’s in town.
Staff (have to) change Wifi password daily to prevent mis usage.

name: Kavsana coffee
description: If you want to taste and buy very good coffee, it's the good place. The production is organic and all the process is made by themself. With 3 differents Arabica and 3 differents type of toast and lavados. A lot of choice and you can taste and see the arte of the preparation. 340gr packages cost between 5 and 8 dollars. Production is manual and organic. The owner explained his ethical approach to us. On request, he organizes a visit to the hacienda and explanations of the process between cultivation and the finished product.

name: Cristales
description: Side of a small lake with some tourist facilities such as viewpoints, swings and boats for rent. During the week almost no one. Just music loud when we arrived and late at the evening . Finally at night no noise. Barbecue under cover. Free site. Only activities are chargeable. The 1.4km access track is dirt and passable for all vehicles.

name: Casa de Papita
description: Parking at a country house on the outskirts of Cevallos, with electricity, internet, and water.

name: Cafe Finca La Cascada
description:
It is a small coffee farm exploited by american expats, along the TEMBR bikepacking route.
They rather search people staying a few days 
helping to pick and process coffee from March to September. They provide a wooden house with kitchen, bath and food if you help out.
Very easy-going familly and incredible experience if you have a bit of time.
Write to cafefincalacascada on instagram in advance to organize a stay!
If you just pass, they have space for one or two tents and maybe a van in case. River is close. All is steep, no more space.

name: Tedasa Truck Loja
description: Alignment for big rigs. They do brakes, oil change, etc. very profesional fair price. Highly recommended from Pato Mecanico (also in iOverlander)

name: Soat
description: There is a SOAT office in the migration/customs building, where you can buy the SOAT for Peru. We paid 22$ for a campervan for 3 months. Please note: this office is open 07:00-17:00 on weekdays and 07:00-13:00 on weekends.

name: Next to Misahualli River
description:
large area to park next to the river. We came to this point because the other one had a very steep descent. beautiful and peaceful

gran zona para estacionar al lado del rio. vinimos a este punto porque el otro tenia una bajada muy en pendiente. hermoso y tranquilo

name: IS LAUNDRY
description:
good LAUNDRY for a good Price.
0,35 per lb and minimum 2$ to wash.
recomended.

name: Hospedaje
description: Nice hostel, right on the square. Clean and the double room is big. We could keep our bicycles in the room. $15 for 2 persons, $10 for 1 Person. we had a quiet night.

name: Family owned restaurant at the end of La Chorrera
description: Very kind family that allows you to camp under the roof in their big restaurant. They also have a space next to the restaurant which has hammocks, you can camp there too. They have a beautiful decoration that stands out. Toilet, electricity, wifi. In the village there are public showers but I use them. There are many dogs around, but harmless. Be more aware of the kids! haha. When they come back from school they will be all over you asking you million questions and not leaving you in peace. They are not shy to ask you for sweets. So bring some stuff with you for them, they'll be super happy (one mother asked me for remedies for her 2 year old son who had cold). Safe village with kind people.

name: Parque EPMAPS
description: Street parking beside a small park with free municipal wifi (slow). You have to pay from 8am-4pm (I think it's $0.40/hour) but free after 6pm and on weekends. There's a water fountain in the middle if you need a bit of water to clean up but didn't see a faucet to connect a hose.

name: Bomberos Limon
description:
Came here cycling two persons.
We were welcomed to sleep here. We had a big room upstairs with private kitchen. 
They asked us our passports.
Really friendly staff.

Hot showers, wifi.

name: Habla Camarón
description: A family owned restaurant in Quito, excellent! They do cook directly and they have very good daily menus and very tasty fish soup. The best restaurant I had in town here and it’s cheap and fair with prices. People are very kind. I usually do post any restaurants, but this one I had to. I’ve been here four times. The daily menu is three dollars actually.

name: Football Pitch Free Access
description:
Grava football pitch spot recommend by police. Good enough spot for bikers. I camp here for a night in my way to Loja. Tap water available to drink.

The village has some restaurants in the main road and supermarket in the square. 

Desde Tierra de Fuego a Alaska en bicicleta

name: Yantzaza Bomberos (cyclist)
description:
Came here cycling two persons.
They host every travelers. Really friendly. There is a room upstairs to pitch the tent (dusty place). There is also a kitchen that you can use.
Perfect for one night.

name: Refugio Taita Imbabura
description:
It's a hostel with enough space for some motorhomes (even big rigs) and although space for tents. 
The place is perfect to stay for some nights and to climb the Imbabura. To the Imbabura trail Aurora, the host, organized a taxi for us in the morning for 6 Dollars. Even she cooked a good dinner for us for 3 Dollar per person. 
The night was 5 Dollar for two persons in a Motorhome. 

Aurora, the host is very nice and even

name: ESTADIO
description:
Estadio (football pitch) is opened for cyclists and motorbikes. Talk to the people to talk to the watcher who take care this place at night. He belongs to a traveler family and they live in front of the entrance.

I sleep here for a night and I woke up with ecuatorial military songs.

name: Oceano de sabores
description: Very simple but good restaurant beside the road. We had lunch here and payed 3 USD for a soup and a plate with rice, pasta and camarones the food was really good. Recommend this if you are in the region and want to eat something

name: Oso Ruso Cerveceria
description: If you’re tired of the same food, here is taaasty russian/georgian idk restaurant, serves the best pelmene. He also makes his own beer which is really good. Pricey but good.

name: Abandoned spot hidden from the road
description:
Perfect spot next to abandoned building. Lots of place, gravel road and you can hide from the wind and the road here. 
Amazing view on the volcano.

name: Dos Chorreras
description:
A beautiful chocolate paradise!

There’s loads of room to park any size rig. 
There’s lots of options here

Restaurant 
Cafe
Panadería 
Hospedaje 
Ice cream
Sweet shop
Chapel

Stop in for a chocolate treat and wander the property admiring the waterfalls and trout farms and fantastic views of the mountains all around.  
It’s worth the stop

name: LavaExpress
description:
This is both a self-service laundromat and a place to drop off your clothes and have them washed or dry cleaned. 

New, modern machines. This is the third laundry we’ve used in Quito and recommend it the most if you are camping at Parque La Carolina.

Prices of machines:
Small - $3.50
Medium - $4.60
Large $5.70
Dryer (huge): $2.60 for 48 minutes.

Promotion everyday: Wash with two machines or more, get the dryer free. 

The area is a chill residential area with some shops. There’s a bakery and a fruit shop/market 1 minute down the road. The parking is easy and fits up to 6.5m long vehicles. Super friendly woman working when we stopped by.

name: Laeticia french walking Tour
description:
Visite guidée avec Laetitia, une jeune française qui vit depuis quelques mois ici et lance son tour qui aborde l'histoire de la ville, l'art, l'artisanat et la gastronomie.
N'hésitez pas à la contacter, à lui poser des questions et à l'aider à progresser.
Le tour est très intéressant et fait découvrir des endroits auxquels nous n'aurions pas pensé.
Elle a aussi pleins de bons tips pour le reste de notre séjour ici.

Actuellement : 10$/pp pour 2h.

A venir : tour en anglais & en español 

Whats'app : +33 7 71 93 46 09

name: Escuela - Policia
description:
The school was restructured for the use of the local San Pedro police. 

Inside, they let me sleep in my tent and take a shower. 

I simply asked them for a place to pitch the tent and they allowed me to stay here. 

It seems other travelers have been.

WiFi - Comercial Jaramillo // Password - [passwords are not allowed]

name: Lavanderia LavaSpeed
description: Modern self serve laundry where  the smallest machines take 26 pounds (12kilos) at $3:50 and the largest take 50 pounds (22 kilos) at $5:00. Dryers are $1:50. Clean modern and with street parking out front in a residential  neighborhood.

name: Hotel para Perros Quito Familia Perruna
description:
Gaby is THE person to leave your dog with if you need to leave Quito for a while or are going to climb Cotopaxi. She is absolutely amazing. Best dog hotel we have ever been too. Her WhatsApp is +593990339086. Tell her Alex with Paquito sent you. Find her reviews on Google Maps by searching the title above. $12/day. She can pick up and deliver. You’ll find only 5-star reviews on Google. She even gave our dog eye drops multiple times daily without charging extra. I definitely recommend her!

*Note: this address is the address she has on Google but is NOT her real address for security purposes. Please message her for the exact coordinates.

name: VillaVet Clinica Veterinaria
description:
This place is amazing. Very professional. After a botched urine test at MediPet Clinica Veterinaria (AVOID THIS AWFUL PLACE) that left our dog in physical pain and traumatized, Doctor Patricio and his team took care of him. They did various ultrasounds to see what was wrong with our dog and determined it was a blood clot that eventually went away. He was very patient and explained everything to us and answered all of our questions. The prices were reasonable. You can get detailed urine and blood tests done here. We did a basic blood test and a parasite blood test to determine that our dog had Ehrlichia and anemia. Fast, professional, and with various specialists like eye doctors that were great too. 

WhatsApp: +593939775432

name: Azul Vital
description: Refill your water bottle with clean, filtered, ozonated water for just $1.75! They will even scrub your bottle (both inside and outside) before filling it. Owner is super friendly!

name: Sunrise Café
description: Great American Breakfast. It’s like a diner back home. Hasbrowns, Eggs Benedict, and pancakes were all delicious! Everyone speaks great English. Prices are from $4-$6. A great restaurant if your missing tastes from home.

name: Bomberos Zumba (cyclists)
description:
Came here cycling two persons.
They offered us a roof to pitch the tent.
Cold shower, electricity, wifi ? 
Close to the town.
Perfect for one night before crossing the border.

name: Football Pitch - Church
description: Small football pitch near to the road - no visible from there - spot for cyclists. The night catch me and I found this place. Good enough. Electricity and tap water available. Bit noisy because of cars but there aren’t many in the night. There are WiFi but I don’t know the password.

name: Safe Point Quito
description: A safe street for free parking with a water tap, close to 2 hotels with 24-hour security, near La Carolina Park

name: KAO sport - snorcheling gear for Galapagos
description:
Great sport shop. They have everything here, we bought snorcheling gear and swimwear for better price then we saw anywhere else (snorchel and mask for 15.60$) 
Open daily 10:30-18:30
On sunday 10-14:00

name: Best empanadas - Dianita
description:
Best empanadas we’ve had in South America. They are here since 1995 and they are delicious. Ladies are located near city market, there are few stands with emapanadas but these are the best - according to locals also. 
We were eating emapanadas with banana and chocolate everyday
They are also cheap - 1.5-2.5$ which is very nice.

name: Bad Fuel
description:
Depuis le Pérou, nous avons mis 100$ de diesel, et en suivant nous avons commencé à avoir des problèmes de carburation, des ratés aléatoires. Après avoir discuté avec des locaux, ces derniers nous ont confirmé qu’il était connu qu’à la frontière le diesel était de contrebande et coupé à l’eau. Attention à ne pas faire le plein avant de quitter le pays sous prétexte que le diesel est moins cher en Équateur. 

From Peru, we put $100 of diesel, and by following we began to have carburisation problems, random failures. After talking with locals, they confirmed to us that it was known that at the border diesel was smuggled and water-cut. Be careful not to fill up before leaving the country on the pretext that diesel is cheaper in Ecuador.

name: small village on the tembr
description:
tiny village on the tembr. big flat grassy space for several tents. friendly locals, we asked at the house behind the small church for permission and they told us many cyclists camp there.

tap water available, not sure if potable. there seem to be some toilets but they were locked when we were there.

name: Aquandina
description: They filled and cleaned our containers. Very friendly. $1.80 for 5 gallons. I included prices in pictures.

name: Comer, sanar,vivir
description:
A very good vegetatarian restaurant. Menu of the day at 4,5$. Good wifi and the owner are very friendly! 
You can come Even if you’re not a veggie addict

name: CarpeDM Adventures
description: Friendly Free Travel Information regarding Ecuador, you can use our Wifi for Free.  We are open Monday to Friday 9.30am to 2pm.

name: Soccer Field Shelter
description: Fenced in soccer field with a large structure and flat place for a tent. Cyclists/Walkers only. Beautiful view of Ruminahui mountains. Nice place to rest before heading to Cotopaxi north entrance.

name: Laboratorio Clinica Ibarra
description:
If you need to run any tests (blood, urine etc) this is the place. 

Just walk in get sampled and 30mins later you get your results. 

You don't need to visit a doctor in the first place.

name: School Football Pitch - Open
description:
School Football Pitch near the road with free access. Wind and Rain protection. 

Electricity available and pretty close to the restaurants in the main road. Enough far from road to sleep good.

name: farmer's market Angamarca
description: farmer's market on Friday morning. lots of fresh fruits and vegetables and other things

name: Hotel Ambassador
description:
Nice Hotel in Quito with a huge and safe parking for any kind of vehicle.

Paid 50$ per night. Breakfast included, fast Wifi, hot showers etc.

A lot of things in walking distance.

name: MegaMaxi, MegaKywi, and more
description: Big MegaMaxi supermarket and other big stores next to the park. Kywi, Tatoo… Underground parking with a giant ceiling as trucks come down here to load and unload. Big rig friendly.

name: Hostería El Chozon
description:
Found this place closer to the border. It has swimmingpools, a restaurant, and some rooms to stay. It has a private parking lot, which they closed at night. 
You can sleep here with your camper and you have restrooms and good WiFi.
At the beginning they said 10usd p.p. We asked them if they could adjust the price because we weren’t using the pools or any other services, so they eventually said 5usd p.p.

name: Mirador Guaycapi
description: A pullout alongside the highway next to a restaurant and mirador over the jungle valley. We asked about dinner but the restaurant was closed and the manager said no problem it’s safe to sleep here. There are also bathrooms open all night. Traffic noise of course but it dies down late at night.

name: Hostal Paraiso de los Andes
description:
Brand new accomodations and friendly staff. Paid 17 USD for a matrimonial room via booking.com. Clean, new rooms with very hot showers. Smart TV and good WiFi. The rooms have thin walls but the other guests were not too loud.
Some of the locals use this hotel as a love hotel.
Secure parking lot for few cars and many motos.

name: El Paraíso Cacao Farm
description:
If you are looking for cocoa preparation experience, come to visit the farm, people are friendly and welcoming

You can pass the night at the place, some facilities available.
.....

Esp: si buscas una experiencia de preparación del cacao, visita la finca, las personas son amables y amistosas.

Se puede dormir en el lugar y algunas facilidades están disponibles

name: Hostal Rosita
description:
Simple hostel next to the two natural swimming pools of the river. Super quiet at night. 
The two owners are not really talkative, but you will realize they are super friendly. They offered me various fruits (as a present) .
I got a single bedroom downstairs for 10 USD, with shower, but no toilet and tap. The common bathrooms are clean. The rooms upstairs are supposed to be more luxury (with toilet, TV, view on the river) so you should pay 15-20 USD. 
Good WiFi.
There is like a big garage-terrace they close at night where I guess you could ask for parking your vehicle. It would actually be a chill place to spend the night since there is the view on the river, tables and chairs, the bathroom just next to it, etc.

name: Very Big, nice place for spend a night. Little bit dirtily, but haha a good view in a morning.
description: Good turn from the road from any direction. Very big place. Silence in the night. When you wake up in the morning, you will see a beautiful landscape.

name: Petroecuador
description: Gas station. Good, clean toilets. Possible to tank water

name: Bernardo: Vehicle Body Work
description: Bernardo was recommended by Xavier at Performance Mecánica Integral to do some body repair for our van. He told us, “it will be perfect,” and he wasn’t kidding. He repaired the side of our van in 1 day after I ran our ladder into a gate and it hit and scraped the side of our van. See the pics for before and after. $220 cash for this job. WhatsApp: +593963821348.

name: Balneario de cochero
description: Nice place with pool and bathroom cold shower 5$ for a family for a night. Fresh egg  is possible. Nice owner. Very good before or after Bosque petrificado de puyango.

name: Chorro Viringo
description: Nice place for a night. A little noisy with the trafic road but good for a night. There is a shower with the river water very cool. Bathroom very clean and frère.

name: Hostal Mirador
description:
First of all, you gotta know that to get to Santa Isabel you will have to climb almost 300m D+, whichever is your direction on the main road. But the stop is, to me, worth. That is a lovely little city, where you will find everything. 

Hostal Mirador is a very good address : clean, quiet, hot shower with good pression, good wifi. They have a big garage where I put my bicycle (I guess you could put a car or van). I paid 13 USD for a single bedroom with private bathroom. It also had a smart TV. Owners not very friendly but that really is the only negative comment I can do.

name: Welding: Taller de Escapes Wiki
description:
I broke our van’s aluminum ladder after running into a gate. It was beyond repair. This place doesn’t work with aluminum, but they made a great, heavy-duty ladder. Looks even better than the original one I had. 

Contact Wiki on WhatsApp at +593 99 880 9217 if you need something welded. They do a lot of roll cages and roof racks here. Really professional.

name: hotel jj
description: nos hospedamos 2 personas por 15 dólares, con ventilador,baño privado en habitación y sin costo adicional por párking. muy buena atención, habitaciones cómodas y muy limpias, son pet friendly.

name: Autoservicios Reyes
description:
Change oil , oil filters , air filter etc

Can refill the grease or other things

name: RADIADORES
description: This company can do everything  with you radiator. They can fix any problem. Really perfect guys. For me they do a new one custom radiator. No chip, but they are professional.

name: Mirador Nariz Diablo
description: Wind and rain protection. Room in the second floor. I asked the locals.

name: Alberto mechanic
description: Nice guy. Hi can fix small trouble in you car ore moto.

name: Adeco Cia Ltd
description: This was a recommendation by Andy from CodaVista campground. We were here for an oil change and some  minor maintenance work and were very happy with their work. The have space for big rigs and mainly work on diesel engines.

name: Self Serve Lavandería
description: Great place to wash and dry your clothes. We had 17kils of clothes and it was 53soles.  To Wash s2.20/kil. To dry s1.8/kilo. This price also includes soap and softener. Rhaoul was extremely nice. He even said we could go eat some where and he would put our clothes in to dry for us and text us when they were ready at no extra cost! 3 washers and 2 dryers onsite.

name: Capitan (sea food restaurant)
description: The restaurant is very good service and the food is excellent, the chef can come if you need some explanation

name: Aeropuerto Jumandy
description:
Big parking area in front of the Airport.
Security 24h

name: Repsol Car wash
description: All Repsol gas stations was your car for free if you fill up with gas! Not a bad wash either. We tipped him 5 sol and he definitely gave us more attention to detail and a great wash compared to the other people in line. It has a high powered pressure washer as well.

name: taxoloma saloon
description: a small and new restaurant on the hill. The owners is Italian and cooks very good! very recommendable. on saturdays and wednesdays they have wood oven pizza's.

name: P&S Gas Station (only diesel and extra)
description: Nice gas station for a quick stop. The guy offered us showers and bathrooms. Very welcoming. Clean with TP. No Super gas here (95 octane), just Extra (85) and diesel.

name: Repairs car seats -spare wheel covers
description: This shop is perfect to repair car seats or to make spare wheel covers

name: Taxoloma saloon
description:
It's a nice coffee bar with Italian dishes and pizza! Italian and Ecuadorian family owners! Cozy place and wonderful view! 
It has two private bedrooms with hot water. Also, you can camp in the garden! absolutely amazing!

name: P&S gas station. Free clean showers
description:
We came here for a shower after filling up with propane at Lojagas. There’s 4 stalls. All clean, all free and refreshingly cool water. No need to buy gas to use shower but we did! We love P&S stations!
The views all around the station are amazing too so if you have to spend the night here it’s not so bad.

name: LT Diesel
description:
Excellent repair shop for diesel engines. We had an intermittent problem with the turbo of our sprinter. Mario, the owner, took care of the problem and was able to fix it. very systematic search for failure. Mario is an excellent mechanic, he really knows his job.
Friendly team. 30 USD for 3 hours work.
